description:
Pretty good tea spot if you're in the area! I've gotten the blended milk and brown sugar drink and it's suuuppperrrr good! I recently got their Thai tea as I was craving it all day and I was actually pretty disappointed. They have it pre-made and you can definitely taste that it is.

Knocking 1 star because I do wish their menu was a little bigger, more options.
author: Karina R.

description:
Love this place. I got their nutella tea and added boba and chia seeds. I also tried out an order of their takoyaki on special. 

They have a nice atmosphere and serve the tea in nice glass jars. The nutella tea was delicious and sweet. The takoyaki took a sec to come out but they made them fresh and they were tasty and a good size order for the price. Hot crisp and soft in the middle. 

I work nearby and will be back to try all the other teas in the near future.
author: Sean G.

description:
I've been to Plentea a few times already, even when it first opened. This place was pretty cool and cute in the Financial district. What got me were the glass bottles. I think it has been over a year or two since I came back, and recently this place has changed a bit. They still have the glass bottles, and same menu but I think the food menu has changed a bit and maybe owner? But anyways all in all this place is great, their teas are fresh and I like the glass bottle that goes with it. I also like their tapioca, its made pretty good, as some places tend to leave it out long and its very hard and chewy. Unfortunately its in downtown area, so I cannot make my way here as often. This place does get busy, and parking can be a pain depending on time of day. It is on the pricyer side for teas so I cant say I would come back here everyday. Service is great and quick would def recommend everyone to come here and try it out if they have not already. 

My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea. Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Love the bottles! The drinks were okay, nothing special, I'm really picky with milk teas and I'm not sure if I have mentioned this before but whenever I go to a boba place, I always try their milk teas and usually that makes or breaks my opinion or the boba shop. It's a bit critical, but yes, I do take into account other things like set up of store and their quality of boba. I liked their boba and their drinks, nothing bad! Would say it was over hyped when it first opened though
author: Shaeli Z.

description: Don't forget to check in to get 15% off if you order 2 drinks like I did. Came here because I thought the glasses were cute. We ordered a classic milk tea, sea salt cream oolong milk tea, mango green tea, and a honey lime green tea from the suggestion of the worker. All of the drinks were ok. Nothing I would go out of my way for. A con with these glasses is the straw gets in the way if you want to close it. It's basically an open container otherwise unlike the boba cups with a sealed top. Of all the drinks we got I'd stick with the classic milk tea.
author: Lanha T.

description:
I was sold on plentea when i heard the glass bottles were free with purchase. Very environmentally friendly though I don't know who actually brings their bottle back whenever they come to get a new drink. The drink prices are VERY fair and actually kind of cheap if you factor in getting a free glass jar. I was in San Fran for vacation and do not live here so I couldn't take the glass jar back with me. Also, if you check in, you get 15% off 2 drinks which makes it even cheaper.
My boyfriend and I got the regular fruit teas and they were both pretty good and standard. I wish I could come back. If I lived in SF, this would be my go to bubble tea spot!
author: Flora L.

description:
There are a lot of boba places in SF and this one is definitely one of the better ones! 

My boyfriend got the avocado smoothie with aloe ($5.95) with jelly (the only boba place I've seen in SF with avocado as an option, which is his favorite!), and it was AMAZING (I wanted to trade mine for his). It was creamy, but not overly sweet. 

I got the Matcha Latte with almond milk, boba, and less sweetness ($4.95), which was presented beautifully with the layers and I saw them make it with fresh matcha.

Yes, it's a bit on the pricier side but that's because they use fresh ingredients and put it in a glass bottle that if you bring back to refill you get a 10% discount! Love love coming here and am craving this place as a I write this review!
author: April L.

description:
I had heard a lot about Plentea for awhile but as I don't live in the city, there's not a ton of chances to get it unless I'm there. Well, when the wedding reception you're going to in a block or two away, why not?? To say the other wedding guests were excited then upset that boba wasnt actually being served is a bit of an understatement. Everyone loves their boba lol...

But anyway, about Plentea. I thought the quality of the tea was pretty apparent in the taste. The jasmine tea scent was sooo fragrant and obvious in taste. I'd say it's one of my favorite jasmine milk teas I've had. The boba was also chewy and fresh and tasted like it was sitting in honey too. I ordered the matcha tea latte and that was also delicious! They use all organic teas and milks which I can really taste. And the cute glass bottles are of course another great marketing point (reduce plastic!!) and was actually quite convenient to cap off when I needed to store my boba away for a second. 

Drinks run about $5 or more if you add boba but if you buy two drinks and check in on yelp, you can get 15% off! I'd come back if I could!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
First off - glass bottles. As someone who has really aesthetic friends, Plentea really helped me flex on them - "yeah your nicely edited photo of your latte and laptop at a coffee shop is aesthetic but have you ever had Thai milk tea in a glass bottle?" I'd like to think that when they saw my photos of my bubble tea in a glass bottle they whispered to themselves "damn I need me one of those".

Anyways.

Generally, bubble tea makes me feel bloated afterwards. I realize this is because they probably use powder, or because their tapioca comes from some questionable source, who knows. With Plentea's drink offerings, it tasted clean and like real tea and milk, which is something I appreciate a lot and I'm willing to pay the premium if I know what I'm drinking is not powder. I can even see the staff make my drink in front of me, which is more reassuring than the places that have someone take my order, disappear into the back, and come back with my drink. 

I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea. I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and my friend who didn't wanna take risks didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet, it just tasted like a nice milk tea with hints of Nutella. My goal is to try everything on the menu before I leave SF.

And again... glass bottles. You don't even pay more than you would at other popular bubble tea shops... maybe a bit less actually. Maybe I'm a sucker for these novelties, but it's what drew me in and the quality of the milk tea is what kept me coming back.
author: Calvin Z.

description:
~$4.50 for a drink, which includes the glass bottle you can take home - not bad! 

The tea here you can tell is higher quality, and they use real dairy products for their milk drinks. I usually get drinks at 50% sweetness, and here the sweetness reduction is serious - 50% here is probably equivalent to 25% elsewhere. 

Matcha latte was delicious - they mix up matcha the traditional way, then pour it on top of chilled milk. Great matcha flavor.
author: Tasha H.

description:
I got the mango green tea and was a huge fan. I'm vegan so I was looking for an option with milk. It was green tea with chunks of real mango in it. I think sugar was added but I didn't get around to asking. I love mango and I like green tea so it was a good combination. You also get to keep the glass containers they give you with a lid.

My friend who got the CoffMilk Tea said it reminded her of Vietnamese coffee.

My friend who got the Strawberry Green Tea liked hers as well and said she also tasted the real strawberry in it.

I think if you get the right drink then this place could be a great option for you.

I know I'll be back for more mango green tea and I may add red bean as a topping the next time around.
author: Karishma M.

description:
I love this place enough that my desk at work has a collection of at least 5 bottles- oops! 

Pros: 
Quality tea used to make drinks 

Interesting selection (not sure why the fruit teas are cold-pressed instead of made hot then chilled, but it tastes good) 

Real milk instead of the non-dairy creamer used at places like I-Tea. They also have several milk options. 

Stylish glass containers with a lid that you can reuse. I'm going to try to make my own milk tea in it ;)

Cons: 
They should get a loyalty program!
author: Leeyen R.

description: The drinks here are pricey but hey, you cant blame them since they use glass bottles, which are pretty sturdy and comes with a bottle cap so you can take your drink 100 percent to go. The oolong milk tea with sea salt crema and grass jelly was pretty good. I liked how it wasnt super sweet and had full of tea flavor.
author: Tina R.

description:
Pretty alright. Honestly This place was pretty solid in our time of need because it opens later than other places. The glass bottles are nice, very eco friendly which I can always support. They just need reusable straws next lol. 
The milk tea was pretty good but the waits can be long bc there's not too many people on staff. I got the milk tea with boba 50% sweet and it was a solid experience. The upstairs area is pretty quiet so it's a good study or chill place. The decor is also pretty nice with lots of wood and plants. 
Overall a wholesome experience
author: Lawrence H.

description:
As others have already mentioned, they give out these cool glass jars with each drink order. They even come with lids! 

Aside from that, the bubble tea is actually just ok. Not bad, but not amazing. I admit, I really only came for the glass container..

So a 3-star boba shop, but an extra star for eco-friendly glasses you get to keep and use at home!
author: Alexa L.

description:
We walked by Plentea plenty of times on our multiple lunch trips to R&G Lounge from our hotel. I'll be honest (and tacky): the only reason we decided to go here instead of the billion other boba tea places in SF was because of the milk jars these guys sell their tea in. Usually shops make you pay extra for glass jars, at least here in LA. 

I had the original black tea blend with boba and my husband had the strawberry banana smoothie with boba. We also went back to grab tea before departing SF and he tried their pineapple infused jasmine tea. 

The wait is a little long considering how many employees they have working, but all of the staff were very friendly and we didn't receive any funky, messed up orders. 

The black tea was really delicious with a deep, rich flavor that was perfect with half sugar. Like their signs say, it does come with a noticeable hint of chocolate which I loved. The boba was chewy and not soggy at all; ya just can't do soggy boba unless you're crazy.

The smoothie was just okay, it wasn't anything special, but the pineapple green tea was amazing. It came with little chunks of fresh pineapple and somehow both the tea flavor as well as the pineapp flavor were very much there. Usually these "infused" teas from other shops are kind of watered down or tastes like fruit syrup so the one from Plentea was a pleasant surprise. I wound up taking so many sips of this one that my husband ended up asking if I'd like to switch...

The $5 a tea price tag is fair for what you get even if other places might sell for slightly cheaper. Don't forget to check in for 15% off your order of 2 drinks or more!
author: Belinda J.

description:
Somewhat long line at popular times. Prices are around average for a tea place.

There's a second floor area with tables if you want to sit down for a while. The matcha latte was great. They seem to make their teas with authentic ingredients. My friends got boba or lychee jelly milk teas and they tasted about the same as similar drinks from other places, so if you don't want to wait in the long line at boba guys just go here.
author: John L.

description:
Listen up, you are paying for the aesthetic.

The aesthetic of the marble counter top, the aesthetic of the milk bottles and the aesthetic of the decorations. 

I drink a lot of boba but do I consider myself an expert? Absolutely not/kind of. That's besides the point. 

While I enjoy a good instagram aesthetic as much as the next person, the prices for a drink here are too high. I understand I'm paying for overhead, cute decorations and milk bottles but I would seriously rather pay for a plastic cup if it dropped down the cost here. The boba is average.

Looks like they've added some additional flavors (LIKE THAT BOMB ASS MATCHA LATTE) but the verdict is still esspensive. You can walk over two blocks to iTea for a bigger serving of boba and a wider variation of flavors.

If you are wanting a cute pic for your instagram story or your yelp review (HI!) then head over to Plentea. If you care about how much money you spend if you drink boba on the daily then this place is a hard pass for me.
author: Adrianna L.

description:
I've always been a fan of Plentea - so much so that I have a full set of plentea glasses that I use for water at home that fill 2 shelves. 

Now that there are other bubble tea options in the area, the line is no longer as crazy.

beware! they no longer allow guest access to the restrooms and I'm not sure if there's another convenient one near by. There are plenty of seating for small/medium size (2-8) parties upstairs. so if you don't have bladder problems and want a place to hang out until 10pm-ish, plentea's a great option.
author: Annie Z.

description: Finally tried this place! Was greeted at the register and I think the cashier might've been new, but not a big deal. The bobarista was really friendly as well. Ordered 2 House Blend Black, which came out to be a total of $10, but I love me some check in discounts even if it just knocks it down a few bucks. I think the price is comparable to other boba places, plus given in a glass bottle. You can pick up lids for the bottle at the little station, along with the straws and napkins. Overall, the drink was pretty good! I would probabaly be back if I'm nearby.
author: Maggie W.

description:
We stumbled upon this place while on a day trip to San Francisco. We had been walking for a bit and needed refreshments. The line was to the door, but that gave us time to look at the menu. 

We had the strawberry banana smoothie and an iced coffee with boba.

So, to be fair I really should not have ordered a strawberry banana smoothie at a tea place. And I got exactly what I deserved, which was a watery strawberry banana smoothie. It tasted like one of those premade mixes you can buy in the frozen area of a grocery store and all you need to do is add water.

The coffee was fairly good. We had to ask for more milk because it was too strong the first time.

The only redeeming factor is the cute glass you can get and keep forever. 

I'd suggest trying any of the other hundred tea places in Chinatown.
author: Monika L.

description: There is evidence that I checked into here and somehow the screen for the coupon disappeared. When I asked for the discount, I showed the cashier the check in and he still refused to give it to me. Why be so difficult? Regardless of the quality of the tea, the service is so terrible that this will be a one star rating...
author: Louis Suo L.

description:
Cool boba spot in SF!! Every time we visit the bay, we stop by plentea to get boba!! This place is pretty popular and when you order your drinks, you get to keep the class it comes in! They even have lids for you to take home! 

They are known for boba and desserts! They have seating downstairs and a lounge upstairs which is pretty cool. 

Their menu isn't the largest.... ranges from teas, to milk teas, to smoothies, to coffee, to ice milks! 

My favorite is the brown sugar iced milk! Delicious milky drink with brown sugar!! My lady loves the avocado smoothie but it could have been sweeter! 

Highly recommend stopping by here to get your boba on!!!
author: Yao C.

description:
This was the first bubble tea joint I visited when I first moved to the Bay Area... First thing that went through my head was "Seattle has better bubble tea" lol. Since then I've been back another 4 times, and can say nothing really changed x)

The GOOD:
- Good looking bottles and milk tea design for pictures
- There is seating downstairs and private seating upstairs -- so if you ever want to meet someone or play some board games upstairs, there's space for that here @ plentea.
- If you bring back your bottle, you can get 10% off your next purchase... nice.. but I haven't managed to do this yet lol.

The MEH:

- More americanized milk tea... if you like that TEA flavor of other bubble tea places, you won't find it here... it's more like a milkshakey flavor here.
- Drinks are all on the sweet side and can be inconsistent most days
- Boba is on the harder side, never perfectly chewy
author: Vy T.

description:
I was really excited to try this place because the pictures were so cute but I was pretty underwhelmed :/ 

I went on a nice day and surprisingly there weren't that many people in front of us. The interior was decorated in that cute, minimalist Insta-friendly style that's really popular lately. I'm definitely a fan of  the design because I'm a sucker for wood accents and plants! The guy who made our drinks was pretty friendly and recommended a drink for my friend who was undecided on what to get so that was pretty sweet. 

Drinks came out relatively quickly and I can't deny the aesthetic appeal of the bottles. Unfortunately my milk tea tasted kinda watered down and not that memorable. My friend and I ordered bubble milk teas with less sugar and ice. Maybe the milk tea would've been better with full sugar but it was just okay. Our other friend's drink was better. Unfortunately I can't remember what it was called but it was some type of fruity green tea. 

If I come back I'll probably get a green tea or a full-sugar milk tea. I'm open to trying their Nutella milk tea as well. Come if you're in the area and try for yourself!
author: Staci W.

description:
The place is cute and nice that they have seating upstairs but it wasnt very clean. Hair, dust, and trash everywhere. Maybe because i went late at night, but it was still not very pleasant. 

The drink was ok! They have nutella milk tea which was interesting. For cold drinks, they give you a glass bottle that you can take home if you want. It's environment friendly so i was super happy to see this.
author: Yeonhwa S.

description:
Pretty good oolong milk tea.  I would come back if in the area.  I like that they didn't add a lot of ice so the tea flavor stays strong.  Boba had a nice chew to it.  The oolong milk tea didn't taste like what I normally think oolong tastes like.  Maybe it's the sweetner they used, but it was still good.

The drink comes in a cool glass jar.  The only thing I don't like about the jar is that it's a square.  How am I suppose to fit it in my cup holder?!  But it's cute I guess.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
So I don't know what happened to this place but it's AWFUL.
I haven't been in a year or so, so when I was passing by it - I thought I have to go in!
I got their peach oolong tea, as highly praised by one of their employees - so I said I would try it.
It tasted like muddled peaches & water.
I had my friend try it too & she also didn't like it.
She got the oolong sea salt creama which USED to be great but she only drank half, saying how different it tasted.
Like MOST drink places on this planet if you don't like something you can exchange it for a different drink.
Apparently that doesn't apply here - so if spend almost $6 on a drink and don't like it - don't expect to try something else!
I asked very nicely if I could get a different drink because I really didn't like what I had gotten.

I was told I couldn't exchange it. And that if I dropped the bottle I could get another drink for 50% off. Why the heck would I do that. Is it not easier to just remake the drink to something else??

Don't tell me you're sorry when you can even remake my drink or act like you cared I overplayed for a crap drink.

I don't know what the hell happened to this place but I am never coming back, and definitely telling anyone else I know not to return.

Peace out Plentea I used to love your drinks & your stance with glass bottles but this policy is ridiculous.
author: Callan B.

description:
I don't know how Plentea doesn't have five stars. This place is hands down my FAVORITE. They have the best quality and taste of tea, plus many milk and toppings options. Their House Black Tea Milk Tea has a slight natural chocolatey taste that I'm addicted to. The Matcha Latte is excellent, made fresh in front of you. Everything tastes natural and is not watery like other chain places.

I live in Oakland Chinatown and work in Downtown San Francisco so I've been to a LOT of bubble tea places....this is the BEST.
author: Mariam A.

description:
Sweetness warning...
If you normally get 50% sweet anywhere else.. you probably want to go less sweet here.

Other than the sweetness, I can't complain about the Brown Sugar Ice Milk with pudding & boba.

If they can find a way to have a lid where the straw fits through it, it would be great!

I put the bottle in the freezer because my ice milk wasn't so icey when I got home. I found that boba freezes very quickly! But even frozen, the boba wasn't hard and old tasting. It had a nice chew and they soaked up some milk flavor, it was quite nice.
author: Soy Y.

description:
TL;DR - The Instagram pictures look better than they actually taste.

Plentea has quite a bit of competition for the best boba tea - as expected in San Francisco as my fellow yelpers have noted. They do have a competitive edge by offering their glass boba bottles to keep with purchase. Its decor incorporates a lot of woodsy and metallic design in its modern interior. For some, this spot still resonates and finds its loyal fan base.

Although the taste and creaminess of my beverage were mediocre, I was impressed by the barista's care to make sure that my order was to my satisfaction. He went beyond and even remade my drink another time at no charge without me asking or complaining to him. I would still come back to give this place another chance thanks to the great service I saw that day.
author: Adam C.

description: I went here a while ago so this is coming in late, but the tea was alright. The cost was kind of high--maybe $6. Came with a reusable glass I still use, though. Overall, not life changing or necessarily up to the hype. There are Plentea (get it) of other milk tea places that are cheaper/better in my opinion.
author: Anne S.

description:
Really impressed by this bubble tea find! Will caveat by saying it's definitely a more modern spot (along the lines of Boba Guys), meaning that the flavor isn't necessarily extremely traditional. The decor is really clean, a lot of wood paneling, and they have seats upstairs. 

The fun part is that they serve all the drinks in a cool glass milk bottle that can be used for a 10% discount if brought back to the store. Love that it's environmentally friendly. 

The boba drink itself was tasty. You could really taste the black tea and the drink wasn't overly sweet like some other places. Love that they use Clover milk! The toppings were great.

There were no customizations here relating to ice, sweetness, etc.
author: Amanda C.

description:
On my first visit, I ordered a sea salt creama oolong tea. When it came out, I was like "oooo layered and cloud wispy looking!" in my head. The baristas there recommended to shake it up. I hesitated and glanced to the customer next to me who ordered a similar drink-- he was shaking his up. By his I mean his drink. 

"Am I doing this right" I commented, as I screwed on the lid and began agitating the bottle's contents. 

The other customer just smiled and did not really give me a clear response. Maybe he was shy or something! 

Overall the tea was quite light and gentle in flavor-- the oolong could've come out more. The sea salt was interestingly detectable. I do wish I thought of tasting the oolong tea and sea salt separately before mating them together like that. That's what group think and peer influence will do to you. Next time! The tapioca balls were underwhelming but decent-- I like them sweeter. 

In conclusion, I look forward to putting cute flowers in the empty glass bottle.
author: Bonnie T.

description:
Average milk tea, over-the-top cuteness.

Get your Instagram fix and you can also keep the glass jar.
author: Querida Q.

description: First time having, really good. Quality ingredients!  Nice interior and vibe. Nice flare on classics and good flavors.
author: Shawn L.

description:
P.E.A.R.L. Standard Rating = 4.5/5
P-Perfect Chew
E-Extras  (variety of toppings and tea options)
A-Accommodations/Ability to customize
R-Real Ingredients 
L-Liquid Gold (Quality of Tea)

P  (.5) Not consistently stellar, as I've occasionally had the disappointing hard center, but when it's fresh, it's smooth and chewy all the way through! 
E  (1.0) Add-ons include chia seeds, pudding, honey boba, and grass jelly. I also like the many tea options that are available.
A  (1.0)  You can change ice, sweetness, and milk options. The team (both cafes are pretty reasonable for other requests) Additionally, the fact that Plentea uses glass bottles allows for accommodations to be made post-production, which is helpful for any sweetness level changes. 
R  (1.0) Housemade syrups and seasonal fruits here (i.e., avocado, papaya, taro). You won't see powders or conventional packaged syrup flavors! 
L  (1.0)  Super sippable hot, cold, black or sweetened! Plentea uses organic loose leaf teas. Their matcha (hand-whisked) is also pretty delicious! 

FAVES: 

Matcha latte with egg pudding half sweet 

Jasmine MT with honey boba, half sweet 

Strawberry black tea with chia seeds

House Black MT with boba and grass jelly, half sweet

Pineapple Oolong tea with chia seeds and grass jelly 



#thePEARLstandard
#mrsbeansbobablog
author: Leah H.

description:
Pros:  

- Free glass jar
- Decent milk tea

Cons

- i tea is close by, which in my opinion tastes better
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Nice spot conveniently located by my work office! Despite it being so crowded, our drinks came out quickly. Lots of options here from milk tea to fruit teas and smoothies. I like that the drinks come in glass jars!
author: Lillian B.

description: Such good service! Cashier was so friendly and kind. My fave kinda person  I usually get the green tea with fruit flavasss and boba
author: Connie C.

description:
This place is nice and hip! It looks really nice from the outside and inside.

At first I thought it was going to be pricey since they offer the glass bottles but it is very comparable to the other boba places around the area that give you the normal plastic cups. I ordered the peach oolong green tea with boba. I like that they add real peach bits in there and surprisingly unlike some of the other reviews I saw, it wasn't too sweet at all. Actually a little on the 30% sweetness level which is how I like it. The boba could have been a little softer but when I am craving it, it's not a big deal.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but if I were walking around and close by I would definitely visit again. Satisfied customer!
author: Allison S.

description:
Great creative tea + boba drinks. I love how modern this place is decorated. The place is very open and well lit, as well as clean. Their tables are small so not ideal for large groups but there is a large table upstairs. 

I come mostly for the reusable glass bottles no extra charge! They care about the environment and it shows!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I am in love with their iced milk with caramel and boba. It's so smooth and delicious and not too sweet. 

Note:
The afternoon lines are long but it moves fast. 
Bring your bottle back with you.
author: Sandy C.

description: If you need a tea fix and don't want to trash the plant with more plastic and like reusable bottles to take to work/school, this place is for you. I purchased the sea salt cream oolong tea and a matcha latte. I must say, this was one of the best matcha drinks I've ever gotten from a tea shop. I watched the matcha being made with the traditional Japanese tools, and how she layered the drink- it's so pretty and smells so good freshly made! I highly recommended this place! Their boba is really soft and thankfully not overly sweet, perfect to leave more emphasis on the tea. The combo of the refreshingly well done tea and overall aesthetic won me over. The glass bottles are definitely following me to work. Also the 15% off two drinks with a check in is nice; just like the employees even at twenty minutes until closing.
author: Misa C.

description:
Came around 7 pm and there was almost no line, which I appreciated. My friend ordered the boba with black tea and I got the Thai milk tea. The order came out within minutes in glass bottles. 

Upon tasting the boba, we both agreed that the milk tea had robust tea flavor, a sign of superior boba. Other places use powder and heavy syrup to supply flavor, but I am tell this boba used real tea.
author: Nathan C.

description:
Pros: Glass bottles! No cute images printed on them but basic rectangular bottles that looks like old school milk bottles. The lids are like the metal caps from Snapple so I'm impress how they're trying to move away from plastic. Menu is pretty minimal and not overwhelming. They also work with Ritual now! Prices are fair too, about $4.50

Cons: Not giving them 5 stars only because their drinks are inconsistent from time to time. Hit or miss because their drinks can be bland sometimes.

Ordered: Ice milk tea and  nutella milk tea are my go to here.

Would I recommend: Yes! One of my favorite milk tea shops downtown.
author: Terry N.

description:
Four stars for the milk tea

Pros: fresh tea, fresh milk and various choice for snacks or small dishes.
Cons: (it would be very picky to say that) not traditional enough.

One star for its glass bottle. Come on, we just need to be more environmental friendly!!!!

Attached is the Strawberry Green Tea
author: Paul C.

description:
WARNING: do not order the Mango Green Tea. It is almost as if the tea used in this drink is the same exact tap water that was used to wash the mango itself. 

Overall, I loved the glass cups and the decorations. The place looked very aesthetic.
author: Danielle A.

description:
You're basically paying for the bottle here.

The boba is hard and the tea is not very special. 

I would rather go to a boba place that doesn't charge me for the bottle and actually makes soft chewy boba. 

Sorry to the loyal Plentea lovers out there, but this place just is not to my taste. It does make for a good picture.
author: Allyson L.

description:
I love vegan milk teas, especially when I can get them with vegan tapioca (the boba is honey-free).

What makes Plentea stand out from the rest (aside from their high prices)? They seem to put a lot of thought into their recipes and seem to use quality ingredients...I can taste the difference with their soy milk, which is super tasty.

My favorite drink to get is the matcha milk tea with boba and soy milk, unsweetened. The drink comes in a cute glass bottle and is beautiful overall. They first place the boba inside the bottle and fill it 2/3 up with soy milk then mix up the matcha on the side and pour it on top. This drink looks super pretty when they hand it to me...and I'm always afraid to shake it up, haha! The jasmine milk tea is also delicious but the matcha is my go-to. Plentea is my favorite milk tea place in SF.
author: Christina M.

description: came for the pictures, stayed for the tasty drinks , left with a nice glass souvenir. If you bring back the bottle you get a 10% discount next time!
author: Soojeong H.

description:
Lavender Lemonade here I come!

The drinks only come in glass bottles now (seen before they had plastic cups too for a lesser price) 24oz to 26oz glass bottle just by eyeballing it.

Lavender Lemonade was $4.95. There's lavebder, there's lime. there's sparkling water/club soda/carbonated water. - it's ok. not too much my cup of tea.

It can get busy on weekdays after work, 3p to 330p, there was about a line out the door after 5 minutes I ordered, sat, and hung out. 

Unsure I'd be back because I have my Chinatown favorites so MT I'm all set. I'd come here if a friend wanted to try but I wouldn't recommend.
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Plentea is another popular Boba Milk Tea place in FiDi. Unlike the other places, it is open late, which has got me here a couple of times. The menu here is simple consisting of Classic Milk Teas, Special Milk Teas, Cold Brewed Teas, Ice Blended Drinks and Hot Teas. For milk you have options for both dairy (Clover whole and half-and-half) and non-dairy (Silk Soy and Califia Almond). For toppings you have boba, aloe, grass jelly, lychee jelly, chia seeds and egg pudding (50c each). Sweetness can be customized to your liking (100%, 50%, 25% or 0%). It seems to cross all boxes as far as options are concerned.

Over a period of time I've tried most of their Classic and Special Milk teas. One thing that distinguishes Plentea from other boba tea places is their insistence on using glass bottles instead of plastic cups, supposedly to help the environment. In today age when you can get fully compostable cups and straws, insisting on using glass bottles for protecting the environment is just wrong. Let's call it what it is, a marketing ploy that positions Plentea differently from their competitors. Goes without saying I am not a fan of these glass bottles as they feel heavy and makes holding the drink painful. I would prefer if they give you a choice of getting a glass bottle rather than palming them off on everyone. Anyway let's move on to the drinks.

The short and simple review would be that their drinks are good not great. It took a little trial and error to get to my customization right here. I started by getting my drinks 50% sweet, but found that for my taste I needed their regular sweetness (but that would be a little sweet for most people). Then I replaced whole milk with half-and-half as whole milk tended to undermine the tea taste and lastly getting less ice prevented the teas from becoming diluted with time.

From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea. The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness. What I didn't like was the Matcha Latte. It was pretty weak and needed a lot more Matcha powder to give it the bitter sweet finish.
 
Most of the teas are just under the $5 mark which with toppings will put you about $6 a cup give or take, which is in line with what you would pay at the fancy Boba Guys but 10% more than what you would pay at i-Tea just a block down. In my pecking order for Boba tree places in FiDi (or at-least the ones that I've been to) Plentea lies in the middle of i-Tea and Boba Guys, with i-Tea on top and Boba Guys at the bottom. During normal hours I prefer to go to i-Tea and end up coming to Plentea only for a late night boba fix.
author: Ahmad J.

description: I had high expectations for Plentea because all of my friends like it...but it's not great. I got a jasmine milk tea with boba and it tasted so bland, almost like I was just drinking 2% milk (I don't remember what type of milk they used for my drink). The boba was okay and it's cool how you can keep your bottle, but I probably wouldn't go back.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Was my regular stop for many years when I worked around the corner. They were always busy but rightfully so. Very good Boba and snacks. My favorites are the sea salt crema oolong and Nutella milk tea.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Full disclosure: I came for the glass bottle. It's exactly as expected and a perfect new work water bottle, as well as a reminder to go back for some delicious tea. I'm unsure if they have a discounted return situation, but there were people in line bringing back bottles for use.

I got the iced oolong tea. It was very smooth and without sugar as requested. It's hard to give much a review other than for tea and a bottle I want/want to keep, $5 is a way better deal than the $4 for tea in a paper cup nonsense. 

Docked one star for the line that took way too long at lunch. It was only about 10 people and took about 20 minutes. I realize many of the teas take a bit to make, but one person making at lunch is as stressful on the person doing the job as the people standing in line for way-to-long for pricey tea. 

I'd still go back.
author: Mari H.

description:
Love that they use glass bottles and changes out their plastic tops. Really simple menu, but delicious. My go to is a black tea with boba and I love getting it here because it's not too sweet at all. They also have new drinks since I've last visited. They have a new lime honey boba black tea that is surprisingly amazing! 
The space itself is small and skinny with the line usually right when you enter but there is an upstairs space that not many ppl use. I'm not sure if it's still available or ppl just don't know about it, but it's there if you need to sit a sip your tea!
author: Laura B.

description:
This is my favorite milk tea place in SanFran, so far. Lots of specialty drinks, being able to customize the sweetness and type of milk, and in a glass bottle, very unique!

Discount can be applied if you purchase a second bottle or bring your old bottle back - I really liked the concept here of being environmentally friendly.

I tried the Oolong milk tea, very silky. Their tapioca was chewy and not overly sweet.
author: Elaine H.

description: The tea was decent and the service was quick but I think they were wrong when they told me oolong had the least amount of caffeine. Assuming they put the same amount of tea in each drink. From what I could find it seems Jasmine tea can have 3X less caffeine than Oolong (which they serve). The reason this mattered is I gave it to my friend whose highly sensitive to caffeine and she ended up not being able to sleep that night. If I'm wrong about my assumption please reply and I'll revise.
author: Ben S.

description: My office was not that far from this place, so I stopped by here after lunch almost everyday. I love their milk tea with extra bubbles! Especially, I like the fact that they provide the cute reusable glass bottles.  How wonderful it is to not only enjoy the great bubble tea but also care about the environment!
author: Jen P.

description: Very cute overall aesthetic, but it is a little small in terms of space. Especially around noon when it gets crowded. However, the drinks were very made in my opinion. The cashier was very nice and allowed us to customize the drinks as we wished. He was very patient in explaining the non-dairy substitutes they had, which made it a lot more convenient when ordering. Not to mention, the cute glass bottles were an added bonus. :)
author: Sharon H.

description:
Came here because of the cool looking milk jars they serve their drinks in, the drinks here were around $5 each and toppings (like boba) were an extra $.50. There is additional room upstairs with some chairs and tables and I have seen this place get rather busy but it wasn't too bad when I went.

I got the iced milk with brown sugar and it was okay. It was blended into what I would describe as a milky slushy texture, and the actual taste is just a sweetened milk taste.

Outside of the novelty of the milk jars, everything else was just average and nothing too special. The drink wasn't bad, but it didn't really stand out among the various boba places all around the city.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Great boba tea, their options are very very tasty. 

Today I decided to try the traditional milk tea with black tea blend, but since I'm vegan I asked with Almond milk but the cashier suggested doing with their regular dairy-free milk option, Coffee Mate, which is how they do it traditionally, I accepted.

Later on I was researching the ingredients and I confirmed that this product "Coffe Mate", although dairy-free, it's not vegan since it contain "Milk Solids".

This means that if you are not vegan and simply lactose-intolerant, or you would like to avoid dairy, then this milk option will do fine to you, however if you are concerned with animal abuse, then you can be sure cows have been harmed just the same way, since this is a cow milk's byproduct.

I'm sure the cashier didn't know that, hence I'm not complaining - as a matter of fact I'm quite satisfied with them, since I came back 30min after I left (once I did my research back on my office) and since I haven't had open the bottle yet I returned to the store, explained what happened and I asked them to redo it with Almond milk, and they redid it immediately (although they were not much apologetic as they might not have believed much on what I said). 

Thus - I would like to leave a call out for vegans to not go for the "Coffee Mate" milk option since it's not vegan.

Lastly, I would strongly suggest the owners to mark their vegan options on the menu. You can simply put a (v) mark in front of your 2 vegan-friendly milk options: Soy milk and Almond milk. If you do that I will raise this review to 5 stars.
author: Tiago G.

description:
Great concept and milk tea comes in cool glass milk bottles but I've had better tea and thought they didn't give much tapioca for the additional charge. 

Today was the first time I passed by this place without a line out the door so I decided to finally try it. Super disappointed--guess you could say I had very high expectations based on the popularity and it was just average. 

Tea didn't taste very strong. Not sure if they don't steep it long enough or if there's too much milk but it lacked more tea punch. Tapioca wasn't bad but there didn't seem to be much given the big glass bottle of milk tea. I got the regular black milk tea and got my husband the matcha latte. Both could be customized for sweetness level which is always a plus to me because I don't like my milk tea to be too sweet. Each topping is an additional $1 and you just don't get enough of the add ons.

Their fruit teas looked pretty good. I saw a lot of people walking out with them after I ordered but I probably won't be back again after this time so won't get to try it. Sorry but first impressions really do count with me when it comes to drinks or food. If you want a cool glass milk bottle then you should give this place a shot but it's probably not worth waiting in a long line for.
author: Betty R.

description: Came here with some friend and got the 2 for 15% off deal with the yelp checkin. We ordered Nutella milk tea and a regular milk tea. I really like how it's all made with real tea so it's slightly on the bitter side. Much better than the powder milks tea. Super cute how they put it in a glass bottle that's reusable. I do wish hey had more flavor options though... it is pretty limited. Overall would definitely go back when I get a chance
author: Nina Y.

description: The tea's aroma attracts me to the store. Ordered sea salt creama. Tastes good, definitely above average. Clean decoration and interior design. They have glass cup. Looks cute, won't be able to remember bring back for more teas tho. Nice try. Would come back to try more.
author: Alexis

description:
Drinks 3/5. Service 4/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 3/5.

Rebranding alert! This place use to be a little more busy looking with more clutter in the shop. It had more food options and more  decor on the walls. Today, it's a little bit more streamlined with simpler decor, with a main theme of white. The drink list got smaller and even the signature drink bottles changed a little with the caps being a hard cap that you can screw on versus a flimsy plastic cap. 

However, the drinks are just as mediocre. The tea flavor from the drinks aren't that prominent and the flavor itself like they advertise like mango aren't that prominent either. The fruit teas are all premade so the fruit can't subbed out for a different tea. This time I got the sea salt creama oolong and it wasn't that memorable. The tea flavor was missing and the creama felt flat. And for the price, I expect so much more. Overall, there is far better boba places to get drinks like boba guys a few blocks away. It's worth trying just for the bottle, but it's nothing special. 

Tips - The fruit tea is better tasting than the normal milk teas. The Thai tea is also premade but you can't really go wrong with thai tea.

Pros - you get to keep the bottle and the bottle now comes with a cap that seals the bottle better. 

Cons - lacks in tea quality and a lot of their tea is premade beforehand.
author: Brian N.

description: While visiting SanFran, my bf and I wanted to try milk tea here. I'm not familiar with the area so I just yelped it and it had the most reviews. When I arrived there was a really long line outside the door. I don't know if it's always like this but I'm not use to waiting that long for my milk tea fix! Lol I liked the aesthetic, the drinks came in cute reusable glass jars. I think it was also a good size. My bf got a classic jasmine milk tea with boba. He really liked the boba. You can really taste the tea and that's what I think determines a good milk tea. I got the sea salt oolong and I think the sea salt was decent. The tea itself was good though. If I was in the area I would probably visit again to try their more unique drinks. Also their costumer service was friendly!
author: Anna S.

description:
Excellent. Best Boba Milk Tea with $5 I have in SF so far.
Very nice environment. Definitely will come back!
author: Jasmine MengTing W.

description:
How good is this place? Well we live about an hour from this branch, and we will drive up on a weeknight just to satisfy our cravings. 

I've only had the matcha milk tea and Jasmine milk tea so far, but boy am I impressed. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. Its cool how they mix the matcha in front of you. Definitely Instagram worthy! Their tapioca pearls are hit and miss. Sometimes they're  too sweet, sometimes lacking sweetness. But overall still very good. 

I recommend this to anyone who's in the city and in need of some milk tea fix!
author: Kathleen Y.

description: I was pleasantly surprised here.  A salted oolong tea with cream in a glass jar.  It was simple, yet good.  The tea was brewed from leaves and was quite tasty.  I would have it without toppings if I went again
author: William R.

description: I'm a huge fan of matcha but i'm also very picky with the quality of the tea and toppings. So this just made it to my recommended list for boba!!
author: Kelly S.

description:
I like to think that I'm a boba-aficionado, granted that most of my check-in's are boba-related. Plentea tops my list, as they use hand-whisked matcha, brown sugar, high quality boba, and fruit you can see in the fridge to make a short but effective list of drinks and smoothies. 
I've heard the line is insane but divine intervention has brought me to the front of the line twice.
author: Sean H.

description:
I adore Plentea, and I'm fairly picky about my boba. My favorite drink here is the Oolong Peach. The boba was nice and chewy, but not overly so. The drink also wasn't too sweet even at normal sugar level. I did tone it down once and ask for no sugar, and the drink was still super delicious. 

I also appreciate Plentea's lovely glass bottles. I always bring mine back to get the 10% discount which pays for the addition of boba. 

One nit: I've gotten used to the honey soaked boba from a boba joint in NY, and I think Plentea would benefit from have that as an option on their menu. The honey flavor just adds a whole new dimension to the flavor profile of the drink.

Items I've tried (ranked in order of preference):
Oolong peach (delicious with no sugar)
House blend black (half sugar)
Green mango
CoffMilk Tea
Salt Crema Oolong (too sweet for me and they don't let you make adjustment to specialty drinks)
author: Cynthia T.

description: Free glass bottle and great tea...wtf of course you get 5 stars!
author: David C.

description:
I am not a big fan of glass drinks and additionally forcing to pay for the glass jar when they don't have the plastic cups as an alternative for drinks. The drinks here are over-priced and recently I came back and they changed their menu. I remembered they used to have food with the drinks, but the layout changes and its only glass drinks. I am not complaining about the quality because I really like the drinks here, but I feel it's overpriced. I am not sure if they still offer discounts if you bring their glass jars. 

Besides the change of layout and only glass jar drinks, I really am a big fan of their lavender lemonade. The sweetness level is perfect. They add lime to give the drink a zesty kick, even though its lemonade Lolol. Did I forget to mention that they add sparkling water? I am currently in the carbonated water phase and this lavender lemonade is just perfect. The best toppings that go well with it is chia seeds. I always get lavender lemonade whenever I go to Plentea or around the area, I just wish they have plastic cups for alternatives. 

Also, this place is cool to take hipster pictures for the Instagram photos.
author: Judy M.

description:
Loved this place for a couple of reasons, 
1. They have boba in everything which is fantastic and it's every tasty too bit slightly heavy( not sure why) You will be really full as the serving size is big. 
2. They give you the glass containers to take home which is awesome ! 
3. The tea is great and very flavourful. I tried the Thai milk tea and loved it because it wasn't sweet like other places but was just right !
4. They are open late so it's the perfect after dinner treat ! 

I will certainly go back for sure because along with delicious teas the staff is super friendly and the place has a hip vibe :)
author: Shivani B.

description:
When I'm craving boba in San Francisco, you bet there are a ton of options to choose from. Generally, Plentea isn't my number one option, but I needed another one of their cute jars after mine had broken so that took me and my friend here!

I think San Francisco has at least 2 different Plentea locations, and the one on Kearny was the closest one to us. Unfortunately, the parking here is especially horrendous since it's between Chinatown and the financial district, so you may have to loop around a few times or double park.

But after you find parking, you'll walk into a different world, a more beautiful world without walls separating people~ Plentea is known for its aesthetics and you see it right when you pass through the door. There's beautiful lights all around the ceiling and walls, there's cute plants on shelves, and the atmosphere is overall cute and welcoming.

So how do the drinks stack up? Plentea has your average assortment of boba drinks; they stick with what's popular like jasmine milk tea, oolong, and black milk tea as well as matcha. When we came here, my friend got the original milk tea and I got the oolong. Pro tip: do not swap out the milk base when you order; I've heard it doesn't taste was good. 

Drinks came out a few minutes later in their cute jars, and after taking our instagram pictures, we dug in. My friend loved her milk tea and thought the boba was amazing. I'm a huge fan of oolong and thought that my drink was good, but watered down and a bit too sugary. However, I finished that thing quick cause it was still good! 

Overall, I enjoyed this Plentea. The tea was okay even though mine was way too sweet because the taste was decent and the price was not bad for the fact that you get to KEEP THE JAR!!!, but I wouldn't come here above other places in the Bay. The presentation and atmosphere here do give you a reason to come. I'd give this place a "nice-su, I'd take my parents here" rating because the experience was good and passable!

Drink well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
Squished in between Onigilly and some other restaurant on Kearny is Plentea, home of deliciously milky drinks and chewy boba balls. I've come a long way from a childhood spent drinking powdery 99 Ranch smoothies and mushy tapioca. While I still enjoy my super cheap Banh Mi Che Cali BOGO milk teas with the flavorless balls, I'd like to think I'm finally at a point in my life where I know what good boba tastes like.

At nearly 3 p.m. on a Friday, the line for Plentea stretched past Onigilly. The poor guys managing the counter at Onigilly must get excited when someone approaches the entrance just to lean against their shop windows, waiting for a shot at Plentea.

It's 15% off of 2 drinks if you check in on Yelp, and in an attempt to be environmentally conscious, 10% off if you bring your glass bottle back. We got a sea salt creama oolong and strawberry tea, both with tapioca, and were pretty pleased. While waiting in the cramped shop (hey folks, there's lofted seating upstairs!), I watched them make the strawberry tea and leave it sitting on the prep counter for five minutes while my oolong was ready. With four people making drinks at the same station, it gets busy back there. It would likely be more efficient if they had someone also calling out order numbers, as some people are reeeeeally slow at picking up orders.

It's weird that they used bottled waters to make their teas that didn't look like they were glass, but I invite them to prove me wrong on that. We can at least taste the difference in quality, so er...taste buds 1, recycling bins 0? I didn't see a place to recycle the bottles either, so I think it'd be more in line with their mission and other glass-enthusiasts like T.epiphany if there was an option to give the bottles back.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Plentea definitely has the aesthetic vibes going on with the cute shop and the glass bottles.  However, it's definitely not my favorite boba place in the area.  I suppose I'm turned off by the slightly higher prices and less variety.  It doesn't taste horrible or anything... I'm just not amazed.  I literally only came here recently because it was the only place open later at night (besides Boba Guys, everything closes before 9 pm).  

Bottom line: go ahead and try it out if you've never been.  Get your glass bottle and instagram pics.  But if you want variety and better tasting boba, I'd go to i-Tea, which is just down the street.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Finally got around to this place with no line, normally when I happen to pass by it's too crowded.

Not cheap by any means but really enjoyed the black milk tea with grass jelly, half sweet. The papaya milk was perfect for the kids and somewhat healthy. 

Pretty glass bottles, clean interior. Great that everything is organic, would be even better if they could offer a Taiwanese oolong tea as well.
author: Philip L.

description: Best milk tea is financial district! Mango smoothie and papaya smoothie are the best! Also they have special glass bottles, which make the tea look very nice!
author: Henry L.

description:
Wow I love the clean look inside this spot. It also helps that my drinks came in cute glass bottles and didn't cost an arm and a leg like other places. We had the sea salt crema coffee and jasmine green tea with tapioca balls. 

(Slurping with the straw) ahhhh.... enjoying the moment here! I will be back to try other drinks!

Discount if you bring/reuse their bottle for another drink :)
author: Holly A.

description: Tried this place a couple times and I'm not impressed. I've tried the strawberry tea and the honey citrus tea.  The tea flavor is lacking. The boba is just ok - not really chewy. Also I feel like the amount of drink they give you is a lot less than other places. The drinks did have fruit in them - bits of strawberry and orange peel, which is a plus. I like that they have the glass bottles, even if we have to pay a little extra for them. But I don't live close by so I never remember to bring the bottles back. They're open pretty late, which is good when you're in the area, craving boba late at night and other tea places are closed. There's counters and stools in front. But they also have some seating upstairs, which is away from the cold of the outside and quiet/secluded.
author: Alison W.

description:
Came here on Sunday afternoon around 5 pm with a couple of friends to see that Plentea no longer had its giant tv screens on the wall, and a new updated menu! It looked good and I hadn't been in about a year so was excited to try it after it had been a while! 

I got the roast oolong tea ($4.50 + boba, 50 % sugar, less ice )while my friends got the Nutella milk tea ($4.95 + boba) and oolong salt cream ($4.95 + boba)! You get 15% off 2 drinks (doesn't apply to roe than 2 drinks) if you check in. 

Honestly the texture of the boba was excellent (think better than some of the boba guys places I've been before, much improved since the last time I had been) and I could tell how fresh the milk tea was! Roast oolong had the perfect creaminess to it with the whole milk, so 5/5 would recommend! Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!

We also got free cups of water when we asked so don't be shy if you need some too after drinking all that boba! Price point is pretty good especially since you get to keep the bottle and can bring it back for a discount- and they have new metal lids instead of plastic! 

Overall, great and will be back again soon! 

PS they redid their counter set up so that you pick up the boba on the side instead of the front like before!
author: Kristie M.

description:
This place is so expensive for mediocre boba (and simply boba in general!!). People come here for the cute bottle but I hardly think it justifies the outrageous price. It's overhyped. Also note it's in downtown so your best bet to get here is public transportation. (Leave your car at home because you'll never find parking)

If you were to get something, get the fresh fruit tea. There's real fruit in it. Unless you want to splurge on boba, try somewhere else.
author: Melinda L.

description:
I got boba one day and brought back a few bottles to return. They didn't thoroughly clean them before filling one with tea and giving it back to me. I asked about it and they assured me they had washed it. I felt skeptical, but rolled with it. I proceeded to get really sick afterwards :(

TL;DR - make sure they're using a clean bottle for your tea.
author: Ti Z.

description: The best tea place ever!!!  Yummy!!!  Honey Line Tea with Jasmine Tea Add Lychee Jelly!!! SS
author: Sam S.

description:
Overall an a-ok experience.  Pretty cool concept and great for the environment.  When you order your drink it comes in a glass bottle stamped with their shop name.  Remember to bring this bottle back on your on your next visit to get a discount towards your purchase. 

It was crowded when I visted. There was a long line that went out the door, but it moved fairly quick.  I ordered a mango fruit tea with boba to go.  When I finally got to my destination to drink my tea, I was quite disappointed that I didn't taste any mango flavor in it.  The boas were chewy, but with a slight grade in firmness.

I've had better boba teas in SF so I'm probably not going to return. The only cool thing from this experience was getting the glass bottle.
author: Peter C.

description:
Come for the brown sugar ice milk. Its really good. 

They remodeled this place and its much cleaner and brighter inside. They are still eco friendly and revamped their food menu. 

Biggest complaint about this place is that it's not consistent. You'd think they'd have their formulas down to a science, but it can vary depending on how busy they are and who is making your drink. I've complained before and sometimes they fix it, and some times they just say thats how it is.

Overall 2 stars. Brown sugar ice milk 5 stars when its done right.

btw, if you are super eco friendly, you can bring back the glass bottle for 50 cents off your next purchase.
author: James S.

description: I love how you can keep the glass bottle! And it's cozy enough to hangout and catch up with friends!
author: Angela C.

description:
Was not a huge fan of Plentea since it was too milky for me and the whole glass set-up was not something that appealed to me . They fall  at #20 of 22 in my rankings below. 

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #22  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale. 

Ratings as of Late November 2017. 
1--Itea - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 9/9 - RM Yelp Rating - : 5 stars    Price: Around $5   Location: 253 Kearny & 2150 Irving
2-- Puppy Bobar - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 8/8   RM Yelp Rating - : 5 stars Price: $4.90   Location: 1142 Grant
3--Asha Tea House - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 7/9 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price $ 4.25 Location: 17 Kearney
4-- Caffe Central - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 7/8 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price $4.29 133 O'Farrel $4.29
5--Cool Tea Rating - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 7/8 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price $4.82 Location: 103 Waverly 
6--Good Earth Café - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 7/7 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price $4.07 Location:  835 Kearny  
7--Hanlin Tea -  Rod Boba SF Rating - : 6/7 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price $4.76 Location 801 Kearny 
8--Keep it - Rod Boba SF Rating - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 6/6 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price $2.53   776 Broadway
9--The Ramen Bar -  Rod Boba SF Rating - 6/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 4 stars Price: approx $5 Location 101 California  
10-- Sharetea -Rod Boba SF Rating - :5/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 3 stars Price approx. $5 Location:  135 4th Street & Union Sq 
11--Tanca - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 5/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 3 stars Price $3.53 776 Broadway 
12--Boba Guys - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 5/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 3 stars Price: Around $5 Location: 429 Stockton, 8 Octavia St #308, 3491 19th Street
13--Steep (not Steap) - Rod Boba SF Rating - 5/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 3 stars Price Around $5 Location 240 Ritch & 270 Brannan
14--T&T Café - Rod Boba SF Rating - 5/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 3 stars Price $3.00 Location 601 Broadway 
15-- E Tea - Rod Boba SF Rating - 4/7 Price RM Yelp Rating - : 2 stars Price: $5 Location 839 Kearny
16-- Steap (not be be confused with Steep) - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 4/5 RM Yelp Rating - : 2 stars Location: 827 Sacramento 
 17--   Maggie's Café  - Rod Boba SF Rating - 4/4 RM Yelp Rating - : 2 stars    Price $3.50 848 Grant St.  
18-- Sweet Heart Café - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 4/4 RM Yelp Rating - : 2 stars Price $3.00 Location 909 Grant St
19--Quickly - Rod Boba SF Rating - 4/4 RM Yelp rating - : 2 stars Price $1.99 Location 901 Kearny, 709 Larkin and Fisherman Wharf Ste A11
20-- Plentea -Rod Boba SF Rating - 4/5 RM Yelp rating - : 2 stars Price $5 Location 341 Kearny.
21-- Ten Ren Tea -  Rod Boba SF Rating - :  3/3 RM Yelp Rating - : 2 stars Location:  Price: $2.75 949 Grant Street 
 22-I Café  - Rod Boba SF Rating - : 3/3 RM Yelp Rating - : 2 stars Price $3.50 Location: 57 Walter Lum Pl
author: Rod M.

description:
Quick and decent boba establishment. A little light on the volumne, but they have some quality drinks. And you can keep the glass.

My favorite here is the:
Almond milk tea
Taro milk
author: Sean W.

description:
This is the best boba place I have tried so far in SF! I got the icy caramel milk drink with boba and it was the best icy milk drink I've ever had. It was the perfect amount of sweetness and had the aftertaste of ICE CREAM! I don't know what kind of milk they use but it really made the drink perfect. The boba was also the perfect consistency and I liked how sweet it was!!

The only thing I dislike is that they only offer glass bottles ): it's definitely reflected in the price too; the drinks are more expensive than other boba places. I dislike getting glass bottles because they're heavier and I never end up reusing them anyways because they're hard to clean. I know they only offer glass bottles to prevent waste but I think a lot of people like myself end up throwing them away anyways or end up never reusing them.
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description: Fresh fruit, not too sweet, and no syrups = great! Tired of other places that load boba drinks up with artificial flavors and sugar.
author: J D.

description:
I came here around 5:30 on a Wednesday. 

Tea: I got a strawberry green milk tea with boba and it was one of my faves I've ever had. I could taste the green tea and the strawberry wasn't too sweet. The boba is smaller than other places, which I loved!! I also love the glass cups they give with the tea, will be good to re use. 

Service: When I arrived there was not many people in line and I ordered and got my drink within 10 minutes. 

Ambiance: It was small when you walk in, but I didn't have the time to check out the upstairs. I liked all the plants inside their glasses. 

I will definitely be back!! :)
author: Hayley D.

description:
Love this place. 
My husband and I are milk tea/boba enthusiasts & have even driven & flown to LA to get our milk tea fix, many times. lol 
Plentea is our new favorite though. If you don't like your drink, they will adjust to your liking or make you a new/different drink all together. The price is great, as it's not much more than you would normally pay for a milk tea drink but you get a beautiful glass bottle with the lid to reuse at home or to bring back to get 10% off. 
My husband and I highly recommend the Ice Milk drink with brown sugar & tapioca. It reminds us of the popular ice milk drink at Half & Half tea in Los Angeles. 
I do prefer the taste of the iced milk drink with brown sugar at this location in SF more than the Berkeley location, because it's the perfect blend for me. Not too sweet. 

Hoping that Plentea opens a location in Cupertino near where we live soon so that we don't have to make the 1.5 hr drive each way. :)
author: Eunjoo P.

description:
Plentea: home of the famous  (environmental-friendly) tea jars and moderately priced drinks ($4-5)

It's not often when I'm back in the SF area, so I decided to come back here after exploring more boba places around the bay.  I came around 5-6pm on a Saturday evening. I was very surprised to see that it wasn't packed but there was a few customers ordering. The last time (and first time) I came, it was quite crowded with music pumping. It's nice to a peaceful and calm vibe sometimes at boba places but I'd rather it be more alive...ESPECIALLY on a Saturday. 

There isn't PLENTEA enough of drinks to choose from their menu but still enough choices to pick out a drink. They offer milk teas such as Jasmine, Roasted Oolong, and Earl grey. Plentea also has hot drinks such as Hot Oolong milk tea and cold brewed teas (Peach oolong, Premium mountain oolong, etc). They're are mostly known (in terms of drinks) for their Sea Salt Creama which I recommend to those who haven't tried it yet. I'm not a huge fan of Taro Milk tea but for all those Taro lovers out there, Plentea doesn't offer Taro Milk tea.

The guy who took our order was very quick and attentive. He was really informative by letting us know that the sweetness of their Thai tea cannot be adjusted. Kindly, he offered us a sample to see if it was too sweet for my mom's liking. Once we got our drinks, the person who made my drink even asked me to tell him if I needed more sugar in my Jasmine Milk tea! After that, I was highly appreciative of their amazeballs customer service. Rarely any places I try out, gives us a sample when we ask if one of their drinks are too sweet before we order. That's mostly why I was really impressed with their customer service. Y'all are doing that portion right for sure. 

I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba (surprise surprise), my sister got the Matcha Milk Tea with egg pudding, and my mom got the Thai tea also with egg pudding. Can I just say, Thank you Plentea very MATCHA for that Jasmine Milk Tea. It was definitely one of the best Jasmine Milk Tea I've ever tasted in my mouth. The tea was just as strong as the amount of half and half they put in. The creaminess of the half & half and the brewed taste of the Jasmine was just BOOOOOM. They also put in the matcha in front of you if you order the Matcha milk tea which creates a cool ombré mixed effect. That adds on even more to this Tea place that just shouts aesthetic. 

The guy who took my order was even considerate enough to ask me if I wanted whole milk or half and half with my Jasmine Milk Tea. I didn't catch his name or the one who made my drink but I thank them for making my second experience here more enjoyable.

I'd give this place 4.5 stars due to the fact they can't adjust the sugar for some of their drinks like the Thai Tea since it's pre-made.
author: Danielle A.

description: 4 years after coming back here and not much has changed! I tried the Mango Green Tea this time around and it was the perfect blend of sweetness and very refreshing with the boba it was great. Would recommend and the pricing is good for the beautiful bottle you can keep as a souvenir.
author: Jenny T.

description: Every time I visit SF, this is my go to boba spot. The staff has always been friendly and I like how there's extra seating upstairs. I've gotten the sea salt crema and the matcha and they both tasted pretty standard. The decor is cute and honestly I love how they use reusable glass bottles
author: Kimberly T.

description: Awesome drinks flavor and a cute glass bottle for your boba! The quality of the tea is there for sure. I never had a matcha milk tea this strong in flavor before in my life. I wasn't complaining though. It was refreshing and aesthetically pleasing. My friend ordered the ice milk and it was creamy, smooth, and perfect for a hot day. The way I would describe it would be milky with a sweetness of caramel. The price here is about $5 but you get the keep the bottle so it is worth it in my opinion. The tea quality is there as well.
author: Ellen V.

description:
Friendly barista at 7:30PM on a Thursday advised me that the nondairy milk would taste way better than soy in my black milk tea + egg pudding, and she was right. 

Great tasting tea and perfectly cooked boba/pudding here. I love the reusable glass bottles, which are included in the price of the drink. The upstairs seating area is my favorite place to hide when I get tired of walking around downtown.
author: Angel V.

description: I was really looking forward to this place because of the jars and the fresh concept of organic teas. Despite the medium reviews, I persevered and gave it a try. The tea flavor is very mediocre and the selection isn't the largest. I'm not the biggest fan of milky teas so I guess it was slightly hard to find a drink I'd like since the majority of what they are known for are milky drinks. The pineapple green tea is pretty good but the strawberry black tea tasted slightly off, like bagged black tea from diners, not organic high quality Asian teas. The jars are cute and would make a neat flower vase but the drinks did not impress me too much.
author: Ellen G.

description:
Not a lot of boba places open late at night anymore, so I am glad Plentea opens somewhat late! Came here right before closing and most of the good food desserts were sold out, but the drinks were definitely worth it.

I came with several friends so we all ordered different things, and none disappointed! And you can also keep these cute jars that I now use at home for my other drinks.

I will come back again for their desserts!
author: Chloe S.

description: Awww sad day. Today the boba was hard and inedible. The coffee milk tea taste more like coffee and lack creaminess. I'm glade two of the drinks had no boba. Well the upside at lease they kept the change in the new twist lid than the easy cheap plastic cap that falls off. The bottle is beautiful for lots of artsy crafty things plus it's reusable.
author: Christy V.

description:
What do you do when i-Tea 1 block over is packed silly? Come to Plentea where it's...empty. In all honesty, this place is just aight. I really like Plentea's aesthetic, but you can only go so far on style points. Price wise, they're pretty fair. You get a whole glass bottle for around $4 and with a fair amount of tea. 

Drink wise, they never sat well with me. I find that their teas usually have a bitter aftertaste to it - a sign that it's not brewed fresh...or they're doing something wrong. And if they don't have a bitter aftertaste, then they have no taste at all (bland tea isn't what I'm going for). Their milk teas don't have a nice consistency either; I can see the cream, milk and tea separating in my bottle. In a pinch, these guys will do. But I try and stay clear of them unless I'm really dying for a boba drink.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Place - small place but there is secod floor. At lunch, there is often long line. It worthy to wait.

Taste - great - nutalle mike tea was awsome! Really recommend! Glass bottle is sweet! Love that.
author: Da Won L.

description:
I was craving for some Asian desserts at 10 pm and I thought about taking Uber to Richmond for some hot Asian desserts.
But I changed my mind because it was raining and windy. so I grabbed my umbrella and walked 5 minutes instead, problem solved.
I had Nutella Milk Tea with Tapioca, and ..
It was good.
author: Rudy H.

description:
Decided to check this place out while walking around the Chinatown area. I was drawn to the place because of the unique mason jars that they use for their drinks. It is a very cool concept and different from a lot of the other boba places I have visited. Honestly though, the only good thing about this place was the mason jar concept. I ordered the oolong milk tea with tapioca, but I could barely taste the tea, and it seemed like it was pre-made because I didn't feel like the tea had been freshly brewed and mixed with the milk tea. The tapioca was also very small in size relative to other boba I have tried. I wish the tapioca was a bit bigger and had a sweeter taste.

I also think that the volume of the drinks are not that much, and the jar deceptively presents the drink to seem like it is a large quantity for the same price, if not more relative to other boba places. I was not that impressed, but it was very cool that they didn't charge extra for the jar and let you keep it as well. The atmosphere of this place is nice, and there is a cozy upstairs area as well.

Probably will not be back, but it was a neat experience having my boba served in a mason jar.
author: Julie Y.

description: hands down the best milk tea i've ever had!! the House Blend Black was brewed so strongly that i even watered it down after. the Jasmine Green was perfect! boba was cooked flawlessly but they didn't give much of it. love the fact that they are reducing waste by giving glass bottles free of charge! i'm from the LA area and i will miss this SF tea.
author: Hana K.

description:
Loved the tea and the glass containers initiative!! So environmental friendly 
The matcha milk tea that I had was very nice, freshly made.
I totally recommend this place.
author: Nora A.

description:
The good: 
- the actual boba was cooked well 
- it's the only boba shop in its vicinity open later than 8 or 9 pm... 

The ugly:
- Watery, chalky tea that is priced way more than it's worth.
author: Anna C.

description: Got the black tea with soymilk, which not only tasted great but also made the rest of the night easier on my lactose intolerant tummy. It's nice that i didn't have to pay extra for soy or almond bc usually it's extra at most places. The glass jar was also a perk!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
The tea drinks and smoothies taste pretty fresh. I love that their drinks come in a recyclable glass bottle that you can keep or bring back for a discount on a future visit.  

The tea drinks are a bit watered down, so I would recommend getting light ice. The fresh fruit smoothies are great, but a bit on the pricey side.
author: Claire W.

description:
We ordered the caramel ice milk w/ boba, which was good and had the consistency and flavor of a vanilla shake. the caramel flavor was there but it was bit overwhelmed by the milk. boba was a bit on the hard side but it didnt get in the way whatsoever. the reusable glass bottles were a nice touch



rankings
flavor/freshness/boba texture/total (out of 5) and ranking next to the 8 chinatown boba shops we tried that day
person a: 4/5/5/14 #6
person b: 3.5/5/1.5/10 #7
person c: 4/5/4/13 #4
person d: 4/5/4/13 #5
person e: 6/6/6/18 #1
me: 4/5/3/12 #3
average: 4/5/4/13 #4.3
author: Boba R.

description:
Visited this place many times!

First off this place has a very hipster vibe with their decor and seating. There are cute plants hanging on the side of the store as well. Menu was straight forward and easy to follow.

Pricewise for a boba milk drink it is pricey because of the glass jar/bottle. Be prepared to spend at least 5.25 for a drink with one topping.

My go to drinks here that kept me coming back is the Taro Ice milk tea. It taste very good and not that artificial flavoring, it contains real taro chunks. I've also tried their honeydew milk tea which was ok. Overall what I enjoy about their drinks is that they don't use artificial flavoring. I would say go with their Ice Milk drinks because they are very GOOD. Boba balls are average, not too soft but not chewy enough to my standard.

Customer service is ok, no connection whatsoever, just order and then get your drink.
author: Michele G.

description:
Henry the manager made a statement saying "It is not my fault that we don't have any boba" after waiting for 30 minutes for their shop to open because they had an accident.

Henry then proceeds to blame doordash for the fact that they listed them as being open even though they were closed.

I wanted to be specific because his defensiveness and complete disregard for taking any responsibility caught me off guard.
