First time trying this spot, never again.
author: David C.

description:
I got the honey lemon green tea ($4.50) and it was pretty good! Finding parking in SF is definitely a pain and if you're interested in trying something different that's not boba guys around Union Square, then this is the place to go. For every drink you order, you get a nice heavy jar that comes with your drink. 

For the price you pay for, you are essentially paying for the jar since you are not getting much tea out of it. I felt that it wasn't worth paying an extra $0.50 for boba when you are just going to get less tea. What also comes with the drink is a ton of ice!! :( 

I came to Plentea around night time and there was one a few people waiting in line. The person making the drinks was just the cashier himself, so it does take awhile to order as well as picking up your drinks. Plentea does look like a great place to study and hang out at. They have additional seating upstairs. 

NOTE, Plentea does not have a public restroom!!
author: Diana N.

description:
Plentea isn't my all time favorite boba shop, but they're a solid go-to in my book.

I've tried their boba milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and their thai tea. All of their drinks could use more of a tea flavor, as they're a bit diluted. Their boba is always nice and chewy and the bottle is a definite plus. Their drinks are also on the less-sweetened side, so keep that in mind if you prefer sweeter drinks. They'll happily remake your drink if you're not happy with it.

They also have twist on caps for their bottles now, so no more spills!
author: Shirley H.

description:
This place is convenient to my office. It's the closest boba shop around, but I'm not a huge fan. It was just okay for me especially considering how pricey it is. My coworkers and I went around 3pm on a random Thursday and waited close to 30 minutes for our drinks. It was pretty ridiculous. They also didn't have any boba left! 

I got strawberry oolong with aloe and it was a bit on the sweeter end. It was still refreshing though!

Note: Bring the jar back for a 10% off discount.  If you're ordering 2+ drinks, there's a Yelp check-in discount too.
author: Annie N.

description:
I rarely get milk tea in SF, my only spot would be Little Sweet. We wanted to get Boba Guys, but the line was out of the door and we didn't feel like waiting. So, we went to Plentea. 

It wasn't crowded, and the interior is amazing. It's a really pretty and aesthetically pleasing place to hang out at. I felt like the drinks were limited, but the Matcha Latte was amazing. I also adjusted the sweetness to half, and sweetness exceeded my expectations. Service was really great too. I also really love the concept (what makes this place different from most) about how there's glass bottles that you can keep, but I think it's fair enough to have an alternative for customers who do not want to keep it. Other than that, I will definitely come back.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
When I need to grab a drink, I usually find a bar and order something with alcohol.

Not this time.  Running between meetings, I just needed something cold, and I wanted something other than a soda or water.  Plentea's teas are brewed well, I mean you can actually taste the tea over the sweetener.  The real gimmick is the milk bottle that you can take with you.

It's adequate, and if I'm in the area, I know were I could go to get a quick thirst quencher.
author: Ron L.

description: I tried many bubble tea places and you guys totally nailed it. Love the bottle concept. Hats off to you and your team!
author: Raymond Y.

description:
I remember the first time I walked by this spot, right after I'd met with the big boss at my current job-- it was the middle of August, the sun was shining, the weather was perfect, and I had just been freed from weeks on weeks of being at the office until midnight (for real though). The glass bottles looked so hip, the drinks so perfect for summer.

I've been here at this job for a year now. The bottles no longer seem as hip (perhaps the 30-strong bottle collection at work has something to do with it), but some of the drinks here can still be good. In direct comparison to my first time at Plentea, today was cold, rainy, and windy. The bf was in town after a business meeting so we stopped here for a quick drink. He got a strawberry black tea with boba. The strawberry flavor was reminiscent of Smucker's strawberry jam, but less sweet, with a strange, unnatural aftertaste. Boba isn't as chewy as I'd like it to be.

What I'd recommend getting here are the ice milks (yum!). Pro tip: If you're trying to watch your calories, drink half of it (and all the bobas) and put it in the freezer for another day! What I also like about this place compared to iTea and Boba Guys is that there's actually a place to sit (a cute little alcove upstairs!). 

I've also had some of the foods-- the smoked salmon salad and tiramisu. Given that they're a boba shop, I'd pass on these. They're kinda like stuff you'd get out of a box.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I love Plentea - hands down my favorite black milk tea boba around. I like the remodel (maybe to compete with boba guys?) and my drink tastes the same. My only gripe is that the plastic cups are no long an option. The glass bottles are gimmicky and drives me crazy. But, I guess, the environment. Yes. 

Oh - and the caffeine will keep you up.
author: Erika C.

description:
I definitely had hits and misses with Plentea. Sure, the jar will suck you in as a first timer, but then you start to reevaluate why you are coming to Plentea when there are so many other boba options on Kearny. I actually stopped visiting Plentea for the past year because of a bad experience, but I decided to give it another shot last week. I ordered the Mango Black Tea and it was surprisingly very good. It didn't have that nasty, overly sugar taste that other boba shops have. I also appreciated the fact that there were some actual mango pieces in my drink. I wouldn't go out of my way for Plentea, but I would be down to try out the other drinks on their menu if my friends decided to come here.

Btw, their decor got super cute. They use their own bottles as terraniums!
author: Eva L.

description:
so goodddd 
I like the green milktea but I got the sea salt cream oolong also good to me, also love the shop inside
author: Sally W.

description:
Coming with a friend, or just enjoying 2 drinks by yourself? Don't forget to check in to receive 15% off!

You get a glass bottle if you're ordering a cold drink. Bring it back to get 10% off. Grab a lid at the counter, if you don't already have one and you can reuse your bottle whenever you like.

There's a decent selection of drink choices, and not just teas. I enjoyed my tea and the boba was good. They also have some small bites you could order as a snack.

They're open relatively late. They have additional seating upstairs. You can do some work here since they have wifi and outlets.
author: Vivian T.

description: Their Jasmine green tea is awesome!!! However, honey lime tea is super sweet I'd not have it for the second time...
author: Zeynep D.

description:
DOV: 11/12/16
7th stop | 4:35 PM-4:45 PM

TBH, if I had to pay $4 for every drink just to get a glass bottle...I would totally do it again. 

Friend and I wanted something to quench our thirst, so we ordered something light.

Pro tip 1: check in on Yelp to get 15% off when you buy 2 drinks! 
Pro tip 2: You won't be able to stack "rewards"...so no Yelp check-in + 5stars reward. 
Pro tip 3: Wifi password: Iloveplentea 
Pro tip 4: $10 minimum to use credit card 
Pro tip 5: If you order a hot drink, you won't get a glass bottle.
Pro tip 6: Grab extra lids in case you lose yours...
Pro tip 7: If you bring your bottle back...10% off. But you probably can't stack this either?

THERE. I spelled it all out. 

Drinks wise, we got:
2 Premium Mountain Tea: choose between black, green, oolong //
+You can adjust sugar level for this!
+Get no ice! It's already chilled. 
+Strong tea flavor! It's legit Oolong. 

FYIs:
1. Service was great, super efficient staff and clean space. 
2. Upstairs is closed for renovation, and probably won't open until the new year. 
3. Lots of outlets along the walls, so great spot to sit and chill. 

Oh, and if you don't LOVE your drink...ask them to redo!
author: Hurjane V.

description:
This place gives drinks in a glass jar. No paper cups!!
I tried red bean smoothie with boba, it's not too sweet and so delicious!!
author: Tina K.

description:
My favourite bubble tea shop in sf so far! I've ordered the thai ice tea and the matcha latte and both were great. The default sweetness level is perfect for me (I usually get 25% sugar). There's also something really satisfying about watching them whisk the matcha and pour it in. 

The service is amazing as well. The guy that took my order was so polite and cheerful. The first time I went the tearista even let me sample the tea because I was having trouble deciding on what to order. 

There's also an upper level with seating and outlets !

Love this place so much
author: Vianna V.

description: The tea is good, not the best though, but the customer service is terrible. Just a word of advise, if you work with people be nice to them.
author: Natalia Q.

description:
The customer service at Plentea is above and beyond. The female cashier working that day made sure I was satisfied with my drink and took all measures to accomplish this. This alone makes plentea a five star in my book. 

Plus my strawberry oolong with 30% sweetness, was perfect! 

I also tried the house blend black milk tea and it had a nice strong tea taste, another plus!!

I will be back for more drinks!
author: Sophia G.

description:
I was craving boba on a recent trip to San Francisco and fortunately we were just down the street from Plentea. 

Very small location but super hip with the fairy lights and succulents that line the ceiling and walls. 
They serve all their drinks in glass bottles which add a nice touch. They provide bottle caps if you are taking the drinks to-go and also give a 10% discount if you bring your bottle back on your next visit. 

The Strawberry Black Tea was my favorite and I could see why it's one of their best sellers.
Sweetness on most of their drinks is adjustable to your preference which is a plus! Will be back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Tiffany P.

description: I'm a fan of the glass cups they use (more like tap glass bottles).  Environment friendly for sure!  I opted for the coffmilk tea which is Hong Kong style "ying yang" aka coffee and milk tea mixed together.  Great drink with enough caffeine but not too much so you can sleep at night.
author: Ronald L.

description: I've been here a few times and each time has been different. They started to redecorate the place. At first, they started with just serving drinks, then they added food, and now its back to just drinks. Their drinks are like any typical boba spot, except they serve it in a milk glass jar. I love it and it makes it super cute. You can keep the bottle and reuse it for the next time you come. The place is a little tiny so you're lucky if you find a spot to drink and chill with friends. There is also a small upstairs layer for you to sit as well, more ideal for groups since there are bigger tables there. I typically order the fruit smoothie with no toppings. I like it since it has the right amount of sweet. I will be back here again soon. I highly recommend people to try this place. Super delicious. I should note that sometimes they run out of the glass bottles so call ahead to make sure. Prices here are reasonable.
author: Danika P.

description: Love the bottle! I got an avocado smoothie with boba, the smoothie was delicious and the boba was the right level of chewiness and sweetness
author: Rene C.

description: I got the jasmine milk tea from here~ the drink is by far the best I have had in SF~ before I used to have to drive all the way to San Mateo just to get a decent cup of milktea, but now I have a better access to good quality drink now. The sweetness is perfect, which I have adjusted to 80%, which is less sweet. And I can definitely taste the tea and the milk~ and the glass bottle is definitely a plus ++++++ which you should get your drinks here. Losing one point due to its location, which I hate going to downtown with all the traffic and people~ but it is a overall very good place to get your boba!!
author: Man Chun K.

description:
I came here with my roommate the other night and ordered a honeydew oolong milk tea. The service was alright, but the drink itself was lacking. I was kind of disappointed with the drink because it tasted really water down. The boba itself was OK though. Rather than getting it in a glass bottle, I opt for the plastic cup.

In terms of pricing it was kind of expensive for what it was. I think I paid around $5.50 for a 16 ounce drink. I think the standard everywhere else is around ~$5 for a 24 ounce drink. 

The seating upstairs was spacious and I could imagine it as a cool hangout spot.
author: Victor L.

description: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!! They were both very delicious. Sadly live to far or I'd be there every day! Customer service was good!
author: Karina R.

description:
Solid 3.5 stars

You know I love my boba. I have been to a number of boba places and though I wanted to love this place there were a number of things I wasn't a fan of. I have been here on a few occasions trying out their drinks to see if there was something I was missing, but each time I ended up with the same conclusion. Slightly better than average boba with cute gimmicky glass bottles for a higher than average price point. 

Their boba balls itself are chewy and sweet which is a good thing. They have a limited drink menu which is no big deal because it has all the drinks I normally order like the iced milk and the milk teas. What is a big deal is that I can't really customize all my drinks in terms of sweetness as I am able to in other places. HUGE con for me as most drinks, to me, are way too sweet. Sadly, that is why I am giving them a 3.5 stars. 

I wouldn't say that I would never come back because I find myself coming here whenever itea's line is too long and I'm in a rush for boba.
author: Melissa N.

description:
I dropped by Plentea when I came to visit my friends in SF. They recommended this shop, and I trust their opinion because they grew up in the SGV too. I got the ice milk with pudding and boba, something I normally get in SoCal. Plentea's version was just as good; the boba was chewy and sweet. 

I thought it was a cute touch (also environmentally friendly) that the drinks came in glass jars. These glass jars are not very sturdy though. I tried making tea and poured boiling hot water into the jar, and the bottom cracked--not the shop's fault; I was just dumb haha. So just in case you want to reuse the jar, use it only for cold drinks LOL
author: Vivian Y.

description: Wonderful place to get boba in the city! Very modern and cool environment. My favorite part about here is the bottles you get from the drinks. You can save them and get a discount if you come back. There are a variety of yummy drinks including milk and non-milk teas. Definitely recommend this place for a little snack and to hang out with friends.
author: Joanmarie S.

description: Loved their Thai ice tea and mango milk shake. Best thing...they use glass bottles instead of plastic.
author: Sravya J.

description:
Boba boba, I love boba! 

Plentea is actually one of my favorite spots in SF to get milk tea -- particularly their oolong milk tea. I've tried a ton of other places in the city but you can clearly taste the powder. Womp. At plentea, you can taste the quality in the tea leaves and flavor. Only downside: it takes them forever to make drinks. Sure, they have the cute glass bottles but that hinders efficiency and speed. Boba for life!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Ordered the Thai ice tea today and it tasted too sweet and watered down. I spent almost $5 (no toppings) for my drink and its really not the price. I have tried the original milk tea before which I thought was okay but I can't say whether or not the quality has gone down since I haven't tried it recently. 
They also used to have a rewards system which unfortunately they do not have anymore. The menu now is also very plain and boring, I liked it when they had the pictures of the different kinds of tea. may come back to give this place another shot and try their matcha or milk tea again, as for Thai tea, I'll stick to other places.
author: Cheryn L.

description:
There's many boba places in SF near FiDi and Plentea isn't the most inspiring of them. It can get really crowded and I don't think there's anything too inspiring about Plentea.

I got the Nutella drink and I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't just a nutella tasting chocolate milk. There was a hint of nutella but it was mostly a stronger tea taste. I could see myself coming back to Plentea just for this drink but their other drinks are pretty generic. You can get those drinks with a better taste at other stores. But I will say, Plentea does have a really cute glass bottle.
author: Cassie Z.

description: Got the matcha smoothie. It was pretty good. Facility is decent, fancier than quickly. Nice that you get to keep the glass bottle.
author: ChiefFinancial O.

description: The matcha latte at Plentea had the right amount of sweetness and a strong fresh milk taste. Often times bubble tea places will use milk powder or other artificial powdered flavors, leaving you with a very bloated feeling after a few sips. This was definitely not the case at Plentea! Their drinks even come in a super cute reusable glass bottle, at a very reasonable price compared to other stores that serve drinks in plastic cups. What's not to love about Plentea!
author: Annabelle S.

description:
Like the other reviews have mentioned, I think people like to come here for the cute little glass jars. #diditforthegram #diditforthesnap 

With the recommendation of others, I ordered my milk tea with half sugar. The milk tea itself it just okay. It tasted like watered down milk, with no tea flavor. I wouldn't come back. There are "plentea" of other boba places in the city.
author: Marilyn T.

description: I got the iced milk with brown sugar and egg pudding, and it was fantastic! Definitely would recommend. It wasn't too sweet at all.
author: Emily Z.

description: The redeeming factor that this place has for me is their interesting idea of giving glass bottles to customers.  If you return your bottle you get a percentage off for your next visit. Unfortunately this doesn't apply to me as I most likely won't come back here.  Their milk tea has a strong chocolate taste that doesn't really resemble its namesake.  When I visited before I remember they had a bunch of betta fish in tiny cramped tanks too which was kind of messed up.  It's just not my kind of place.
author: Alexander C.

description: 1st time coming in and they didnt have what i wanted! They didnt even put up a disclosure and tell you that the drink was sold out, not available, or seasonal! My friend wanted tiger tea, they also didnt have that, so sort of a bad experience so to speak, you cant advertise something you dont have, and if its on there, replace it with something you do have or place that item on a seasonal menu or a featured item
author: Alaric S.

description: Customer service is amazing! One of the men was so helpful and kind to my boyfriend and I, offering suggestions and catering to our sweetness needs. Try the nutella milk tea! Just doo itt
author: Stefanie R.

description:
As stated in other reviews be prepared to shell out a few bucks for parking if you're not walking or using public transportation. Dropped in with the girlfriend after eating lunch a few doors down at Murraci's (man that place is good). 

I order the Caramel Iced milk with boba and she ordered the Strawberry Black tea with boba least sweet. I enjoyed my Caramel iced milk and the nice flavor and chewyness of the boba. The drink did not melt super fast and the cool glasses they give you are worth it too. They had about 5 people working at once, which was weird because they were all just standing around and only one guy made our drinks.
author: John M.

description: I don't think their drinks are anything too special, but it's definitely a place to try out if you're around the SF area! I especially like their glass bottles, very eco-friendly
author: Ashley L.

description:
They don't use powders they use real stuff (wow and you thought that was a given huh think about that when you go to Quickly's or some other meh place.) Matcha is by far my favorite. Salted caramel was a little to salty and sweet for my taste. 

Soy milk (and I think almond milk too) option available
author: Connie H.

description:
I came here twice last week while working in the area; once on Friday night around 8:45 and then the following afternoon around 1:30. It wasn't too busy either time; I was in and out in about 5 minutes each visit. 

I really liked both of the drinks I got (both cold). The first night I got the ice milk tea--oolong with tapioca bubbles and grass jelly. I didn't think it was too sweet for me, but the grass jelly probably did a good job of offsetting the sweetness in any case. My 2nd visit, I got the matcha with lychee jelly. I really, really loved the lychee jelly; this was my first time trying it so I can't speak to how it might compare to other places, but I thought it was so yummy and would definitely get it again. The glass bottles were a cool novelty and the caps were secure; I lugged my drink up a few hills both times and didn't have any issues with spilling. 

There is some seating on the 1st floor of the cafe; it looked like there was an upstairs too, but I didn't get the chance to go up there. The drinks were prepared very quickly and were a good size. Both times, the staff I encountered were friendly and efficient.

The drinks were pretty expensive, which knocked it down from 5 to 4 stars for me. I think you're probably paying for the glass bottle, but I think the price might still not be ideal for some. Overall, it was a nice place with good drinks and a cute idea for the bottles and I'm glad I stopped by.
author: Connie L.

description:
Very excited to try this place after looking at all the hipster photos of their glass bottles. 

Location: In the center of Fidi and only a few blocks from where I work/BART. Hole in the wall so it can definitely get packed and the line can be out the door if you're there during the rush. 

Service: I appreciate the ability to pick the sugar level in my drink since I usually do 50%. Even though it was the lunch rush they're pretty quick with your drink with plenty of glass bottles to share. 

I got the caramel ice milk with grass jelly. Even though I got less sugar it was still a bit too sweet for me. TBH, I wasn't too much of a fan for my drink. It seems like fruit tea is the way to go so i'll definitely come back to give that a try to see if my opinion changes.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Such a cute boba place in downtown SF! My friends and I stopped by after stumbling on it while searching for boba spots on Yelp. The store was clean and minimal, and the employees were kind and patient - especially with an indecisive customer (me lol). The girl gave me suggestions and I really appreciated that. Our drinks came in glass jars and they all looked so pretty and tasted good! We ended up sitting upstairs and had a great time.
author: Mona M.

description: Great real fruit tasting smoothies and open late. Only reason why I gave a 4 star review is because today I found a little piece of sharp plastic in my drink and could have easily chocked if I drank quickly. Still giving 4 stars since I am loyal customer.
author: Matthew P.

description: A FREE GLASS JAR?! And also the kindest register person ever; it took me a while to get all my change sorted but he just giggled and was extremely patient, made me feel so welcomed and happy
author: Alina Y.

description: Authentic tea with milk! Remind me of my high school best memory in China Highly recommend house blend black tea!
author: Christina X.

description:
Plentea doesn't charge extra for the glass bottles like most places do, and I like how they get customers to reuse the bottles (eco-friendly!) with incentives. That being said, the price for drinks is kind of pricey for the amount of drink (compared to normal bbt cups). So, I guess prices might already be marked up for those bottles? I tried their black milk tea, and was kind of disappointed. Like another Yelper said, it tasted kind of chocolate-y. Not like black milk tea at all. On a second visit though, I tried their honey lemon black tea.. and that was much better! They actually topped it with three slices of lemon. Definitely think it's a hit or miss depending on the drink you choose, and what your preference is.

NOTE: 15% off of two drinks when you check-in on Yelp, and 10% off if you bring back their bottle to reuse!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Pleantea was okay. I went in there with high hopes because the pictures on Yelp looked great but the boba was honestly pretty mediocre.

I got a coffee milk tea with boba. The boba seemed a little bit old and other than the atmosphere of the shop and the fact that they place your boba in a glass bottle, if wasn't all that great.
author: Nicole K.

description:
I first heard of this place by friends on Instagram who were posting super cute pictures of the cute bottles that the tea came in. I was really excited to get one of these bottles, and decided to stop by on a random night since I was in the area to see if I could still snag a bottle. I was so happy to see that they still had many crates full of bottles when I got there around 8PM (but people say they usually run out earlier in the day). 

There are a few seating areas in the tea shop and the ambience is quite nice. The first time I came, I ordered the Thai milk tea, but it was a little too milky for me with not enough tea and was nothing special. However, my favorite drink here is definitely the Caramel Ice Milk. I highly recommend it. It was super creamy and I always stop by to get it when I am in the area.The glass bottles are also really cute and I now have 5+ of them because I keep coming back for more! If you come here alone, bring back the glass bottle for 10% off. If you come here for someone else, check in on Yelp to get 15% off!
author: Catherine S.

description: Overall great experience. No line which is a plus. I do recommend their Nutella and Matcha. The shop is cute and well modernized but a bit cramped, if only there was more space to walk around
author: Misa G.

description: I give it 3 stars for good presentation and cleanliness of the place, but the bubble tea was disappointing. I got the Thai tea with boba. It looks really nice in the bottle they give you, but the taste was kind of bland and I couldn't finish it.
author: April H.

description: Amazing little place the milk tea was amazing employees were very helpful have finally I got to try different teas all pretty good
author: Veronica C.

description:
I've been dying to come here ever since I saw the cute glass bottles all over Instagram but I must say I was a bit disappointed.

The price wasn't really a problem for me at all - $4.75 for bubble tea and you get to keep the bottle? That's pretty worth it for me!  I got the Caramel Ice Milk and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea - both were pretty good but we wish the sugar level could be adjusted (sadly that wasn't an option).

Service in this location is meh... the cashier didn't seem like she enjoyed her job that much!  I didn't really appreciate the tone she was giving my friend and I when we were ordering our drinks - she seems a bit annoyed but hey we're not even from SF so spare us the attitude!

Overall - very average place.

FYI - $10.00 credit card minimum!
author: Racheal D.

description: Solid place for bubble tea, especially if you want a cute glass bottle to keep afterwards. My favorite is the matcha latte with almond milk and mild sweetness. I've gotten the classic milk tea before, and I find it to be too sweet (and I love sweet drinks!) It's probably just good marketing, but I swear having your boba in a glass bottle makes it taste colder and more refreshing. There's not a ton of seating available, but on off-peak hours, I like to catch up with friends upstairs on their sofas.
author: Denise L.

description:
Such a cute tea place! 
They make the boba tea in a pretty glass jar. If you bring it back they will refund you a certain amount or refill the tea for cheaper. I kept mine and use it as a water bottle. There are lids in case you don't finish it and I think they also serve small sandwiches and dessert. 
Upstairs seating also. 
Note: black milk boba tea doesn't actually include the boba. You have to pay extra for the boba balls which was weird to me. 
I love it though!
author: S K.

description:
It's only 9:30pm on Saturday night and they've already run out of Nutella for their milk tea and no more waffles! It's Saturday night, how do they keep customers without proper inventory? With 4-5 people behind the counter, you'd think drinks would be made faster. Took at least 10 minutes. Almond milk tea was strong: good balance between tea and milk flavor, not too sweet. They asked what kind of tea and I chose black. 

They don't serve plain hot black coffee with milk but they have iced coffee with milk? The only difference is ice. 

Line is out the door, barely any other places are open until 11. Upstairs lounge area's visible from the door. Comfy seating, clean. No public restroom available. 

Most drinks are $4.95, not including toppings. 
5 Stars rewards
15% off two drinks with Yelp check in
$10+ to use credit card
10% off if you bring the glass bottle back next time. 

They offer a couple rice bowls, takoyaki, waffles early in the day?
author: Kristine F.

description: This is one of my favorite boba spots thus far. I love the fact that they put your drinks in a cute, skinny, mason jar-like cup that you can take home with you to keep. My go to and favorites at Plentea are the Mango Green Tea with lychee jelly and aloe and the Matcha Green Tea with boba. The tea flavor is very strong just how I like it which I feel is hard to find at other tea shops. Also the staff is very kind and they have an upstairs part that not many people go to that you can sit and enjoy your boba.
author: Lo H.

description: Decent place to get a good lemonade or boba.  I think the glass bottle is a really cool novelty for this place but I can't see myself returning consistently with my bottle in hand.  Definitely a place to try if you haven't had it before.
author: Maurice O.

description: Plentea is a short walk away from Union Square so if you're looking for a boba place, you definitely should stop by here! Their drinks are a little pricier, ranging between $4-6, compared to the average $3-4 range, but it's because their drinks come in a pretty glass bottle that you get to keep! It's a small little shop so if it's a weekend, you might want to just grab and go. I wanted to get a drink that looked pretty for the pics - so I ended up getting a strawberry milk tea with taro pudding. It was really yummy! I finished it quickly, not sure if it's because I love boba or if it's because it seems like a smaller portion haha! Either way, it was delicious. I would have liked to also try their nutella milk tea or fruit tea w/ real strawberry bits. They also have snacks, a couple entrees, and belgian waffles here too.
author: Ashley C.

description: First time here. An interesting selection. It's more expensive than most boba places. I had the hot Nutella milk tea with aloe & egg pudding (a total deviation from my normal coconut or almond milk basic boba) I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea. It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be. You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.
author: Tasha P.

description:
Easily one of the best bubble teas I've had. Now, obviously this is accomplished by sugar and fatty dairy products (though you can substitute these out) in addition to the quality tea leaves. 

The bottle concept is a great, cute way to still also be environmentally conscious so you aren't throwing away a ton of plastic cups that most bubble tea shops use. There was more seating upstairs along with free wifi to use. Some plugs in one area, so you could keep working.

Loses a star because it was terribly loud. So much so, that we had to leave the cafe because it was too distracting. Another reason to lose one star is that there is no bathroom for customers. After drinking a caffeinated beverage such as coffee or tea, you aren't going to want to stay there to study long. Better to find another cafe instead.
author: Jon L.

description: Got the milk tea with boba, 5/5. Also it comes in a glass bottle so you can keep one as a souvenir.
author: Melissa M.

description:
If you're coming to Plentea, you're certainly here for the nice lil glass bottles. They have them all over the cafe with plants in them amongst other things as decor. You get to take them home with plastic caps as well. The only thing is that they are a bit difficult to grip especially if you are planning to carry it around while walking in SF.

The milk tea is pretty typical. It has a slightly different taste from what I'm used to with some sort of a sugary chocolatey flavor to it. Their boba is nice an chewy and they have a wide variety of drinks to choose from and even some food too.
author: Joshua M.

description: Ok milk tea. Nothing special. Tea is not bold, pretty bland taste. But if you get the tea drink by itself, then it's definitely not too bad.
author: Linh D.

description:
Cool place, and the glass containers are definitely a plus!  Very accommodating service, they're willing to remake any drink if you don't like it. 

- peach tea: a bit too sweet, but you can ask for less sweet. comes with peach chunks!
- mountain green tea: jasmine tea had a very strong flowery taste. i prefer sencha, but this is good if you KNOW that you're getting jasmine upfront
- coffmilk: had to return this, it tasted like dirt or burnt coffee. jasmine tea w/coffee was not a good idea

Cute place, ample seating, fast service
author: Kristie C.

description:
Ah, yes. I totally approve of them giving the glass bottles out (makes for a nice pic ALSO sustainable). However, the drinks were just average to me. 

I totally love the decor and the ambiance of the place. Woodsy, bright and hipster, oh yes this place caters to teens and friends! There's also an area upstairs to chill too if this place gets packed, which I ventured up to. 

-DRINKS- 
Pineapple Green Tea - I saw the girl just pour it from a premade pour-er so I was disappointed that I paid around $5 bucks for it. I liked the pineapple chunks, but the drink was just meh to me. Nothing special. If I were to get it again I would maybe get it less sweet as well. 

Lavender Lemonade - my friend got this and I ended up liking it! It's refreshing and the seeds make for a unique taste. I would ask to go easier on the lavender though! 

I appreciate that they are affordable and the vibes are pretty chill. I really do like their glass bottles but next time I'd try something else than the pineapple green tea.
author: Jenny H.

description: I actually expected more from Plentea. I usually get their Jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly. It tastes okay but I feel like it tastes a bit too creamy. To be honest, I only tried it to because they had the glass bottle which is pretty cool.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
There was plentea of people waiting in line that's for sure. To be honest I really only came for the bottle because I mean who doesn't like cute bottles? 

I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea. Normally when I try a new boba place I always order Milk Tea to determine if I like it or not. Unfortunately it didn't meet my standards. It tasted more like milk and sugar instead. Also it wasn't really worth waiting in line for 20 minutes then waiting another 10 for our drinks. 

I'll probably come by another time when it's less busy and try some other drinks.
author: Yinja L.

description:
Not going to lie I came here for the glass bottle. I ordered a papaya smoothie with soy milk + chia seeds. Yum!

Super nice staff and cute shop!
author: Margery W.

description:
Plentea is a short walk from china town where i parked and run for errands. 
. 
i was craving some boba, so here i never been so why not make a visit and a short walk. 
. 
As soon i got here i was like cool! i had a hard time choosing what to order. Then i spotted salted creama oolong tea! love me some oolong tea, and its salted with cream, you know I'm sold! Of course i had to add boba. 
. 
on first sip I'm like yea hits the spot! The boba was on point, chewy, and flavorful. Next the drink is smooth with a nice smooth salted after taste. definitely smooth, creamy, sweet, and refreshing! nice cool down after that little short walk. 
. 
The pro thing about my drink is, it comes with a glass bottle! you get to keep it too! so of course I'm gonna be using it for my future water bottles, bottomless mimosa glass, coffee cup, water glass, or might even turn it into a terrarium! 
. 
The line was a short wait, as well my drink was quick too. It was a good grab and go, and off to explore! Love the interior and exterior. Mainly a nice and bright warm wood everywhere. minimal, modern, clean, and picture blog perfect for photos! Maybe just parking is a hassle, but who drives in the city when i can get chauffeur! Anyways thanks for reading grab some boba and call it a day!
author: Alex T.

description:
Did you say boba?

Last time I was in the Bay I had to try the famous Boba Guys. This time around my must stop boba visit was Plentea. They have a really cute storefront-- it's pretty narrow but they have an upstairs loft where customers can lounge for a bit with their drinks. The menu includes classic milk teas, fruit milk teas made with real fruit, blended milk tea, and iced teas plus a small assortment of small plates that range from sweet waffles to fried fish balls. They also have a specials board with rotating seasonal teas and offerings.

I immediately went for one of their specials: sea salt cream oolong tea. Sea salt cream is my absolute favorite but not many tea houses carry it, so when I see it I have to order it. My girlfriends ordered the black milk tea and the almond milk tea. We all added boba, of course! The sea salt cream oolong tea was good but not the best I've had. I really liked that the tea wasn't overly sweet and I could really taste that distinct oolong profile, but the sea salt cream wasn't well balanced. It leaned a bit too much on the salty side and the consistency could have been more on the meringue side rather than melty. If you love sea salt cream, you know what I mean. 

I tried my friends' drinks and they were good but nothing to write home about it. Though major points for not being drenched in sugar; I hate it when tea house do that. The cute glass jars can go home with you or can be recycled with the shop which I thought was really cool for those of us that have an abundance of cutesy mason jars from other foodie adventures (guilty!).

The service was friendly. Just a note for debit/credit card users they only accept for purchases $10 or more which I can know can be annoying but I'm used to this with tea houses. We also used the 15% off check-in offer on Yelp with no problem, they just let us know that it would only apply to two drinks which was fine with me.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Plentea is a cute little hipster bubble tea shop located in China Town. 
This place is quite pricey for bubble tea BUT you do get a free/reusable glass bottle!
Obviously this place is always BUSY. Lines start from outside the door depending on what time you visit the place. The lines usually start during the afternoons and will be CROWDED. i don't recommend bringing any large groups of people. 
Plentea DOES have additional seating upstairs but there's only a few tables. 
I really love how Plentea does not use any artificial flavors or powders for their drinks, basically everything is from scratch!
For drinks i ordered a Sea Salt Crema Tea($4.95) with boba and egg pudding($1.00)
*It's a 6-8 minute wait for drinks when it's busy*

The Sea Salt Crema Tea was my absolute FAVORITE. The glass jars were bigger than i expected. The consistency of the Sea Salt Cream was thick and creamy and was the BEST part of the drink. The tea was flavorful, sweet, and refreshing!
Don't forget to grab yourself a bottle cap on the way out!
5/5 stars for a delicious, refreshing bubble tea!
author: Angela M.

description:
Plentea has just the cutest name EVER! I love that you get a little souvenir cup and a discount if you bring it back in next time. Definitely gimmicky, but I love it! As for the teas, I don't think I've found my favorite yet. Out of the ones I've tried the matcha milk tea was my most preferred, but not a favorite. I was not a fan of the strawberry milk tea.

It is just the absolute cutest place to hang out too. Lots of seating, and a cute little upstairs area. However, the few times I've been, it's been rather hot inside (to the point that I was starting to sweat!). They also have sandwiches and food that actually sound good too, which is awesome!
author: Angel K.

description:
They changed the decor on my return today. The blackboard menu on the side wall is gone.  Now with multiple pendant incandescent lights hung from the high ceilings.

The staff was really helpful with the decision on my order today. I ordered a hot honey ginger tea. When I received my tea, they probably thought I would start drinking right away, but it was hot. I sat down, quickly open the lid to allow for cooling and to find The Staff at Plentea shorted at lease 3 oz. of tea from my cup of honey ginger tea. 

I feel like I was back at Starbucks, but with a Venti Latte I was skimp when I received a Grande. I paid a premium price with the tea here and in exchange I was skimp the amount of tea served from my purchase. I feel cheated; disappointed! I used to frequent this place a lot, with glass bottles filling my entire kitchen cabinet, but today, they started to skimp on the amount served. Kind of a huge disappointment they no longer put the same standard with their drinks...
author: Betty L.

description: This tea place is spectacular!! The moment I walked in I was welcomed and the cashier was very friendly he even let me sample a tea flavor. The restaurant is well kept up and is a very nice place to just sit and enjoy a bottle of boba!! Speaking of the Boba it was GREAT I loved it and I love how unique this place is by using GLASS bottles, it's amazing and such a great idea. I will be back!!!
author: Kylia V.

description:
Very strong and aromatic tea. That's a plus.

Drinks come in super cute bottles. That's another plus!

I'm not a fruity milk tea drinker, but the pink strawberry milk tea looks so cute in that glass bottle that I had to order one, and it tastes fantastic! Grass jelly also got its perfect balance of softness and chewiness. I didn't get to try their boba but I have a feeling it's also great.

The reason why it's not a 5 stars is because parking sucks, service was a little slow and this will never be my to-go place due to location and price.
author: Mandy D.

description: This was first time here and I tried the jasmine milk tea and I must  admit, it was really good. I really would recommended it to someone who's never tried it before
author: Camille F.

description:
Unlike other bubble tea places, they give a cute clear glass bottle with your order (to keep, for free). 

Parking: It is in the city, so street or paid parking. 

Ambience: It is a cute, modern space with 2 floors. The second floor is a loft. 

Service: Ordering was fast, but at the time we were there, the store was in the midst of making the boba, so it took 20+ mins to get our drink.

Order: We had the Honey Lemon Black Tea and Oolong Black Milk Tea (both with boba).

Verdict: The space is pretty big for being in the city. The store has two floors -the first floor has some seating and where you order the bubble tea and the second floor is like a loft with seating. I like the fact that the bubble tea is not more expensive than other places, but you get to keep the cute, reusable bottle - very eco-friendly of the store to do that and also marketing (as my friend and I were asked where we got the bubble tea from). 

Note: If you check-in to Yelp, you get 15% of two drinks there.
author: Michelle B.

description: This place is known for its unique boba flavors. I ordered the matcha milk tea flavor because I could adjust the sugar levels and the type of milk used. We also had all our drinks in glass bottles that you can take back after drinking in. Well designed place with throwback music. Clean and sleek interior with a few plants on the walls (going for that succulent vibe). If you're yelp elite you also get 15% off two drinks here so we used that!
author: Diana Y.

description: Came here 2 times in a day when visiting Chinatown. Tried a few drinks, including the sea salt crema oolong and nutella milk tea. I also tried my wife's green tea matcha and almond milk tea w/ red bean. The best one was the sea salt crema hands down. I asked for it half sweet, but the gentleman at the register said it wasn't too sweet to begin with, so I had it as is and he was right, the sweetness was just right. The sea salt crema topping was done perfectly as well. I'm a fan of the glass bottles they put their drinks in. They don't leak or spill when you shake your drink or flip it upside down with the lid on. One negative thing about this place is that they don't have a restroom. You guys sell drinks. That just doesn't make sense to me.
author: MJ E.

description: Delish! And the glass bottles are so cute, I love that they're reusable! I found this gem while traveling, really wish they had a location near me in SoCal.
author: Emma S.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: no wait to order

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: clean and open ambiance

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: The house black milk tea with boba is a must try! The boba here is soft and fresh! This place makes real milk tea with real ingredients, not like those places that pump artificial flavors and sweeteners aka places that ask you do you want 25% 50% or 100% "sweetness". 

_____

Overall Experience

5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Each milk tea comes in a glass bottle.
author: Elliott N.

description:
After a nice dinner nearby, my friend suggested that we get some bubble tea at Plentea.  The large menu screen shows your choices of various types of milk tea, coffee tea, fruit tea, lemonades and fruit/milk drinks.  There are eight add-on choices for your drink at $.50 each, such as bobas, grass jelly, and red beans.

Their drinks are served in a glass bottle, reminiscent of the old milk bottle.  If you bring your bottle back, you get 10% discount on your next purchase.  Or you can use it as a water terrarium, like they have on display.  Interesting idea. 

They have an upstairs seating area with about 4 tables with seating for about 16.  

My Thai milk tea with boba add-on was sweet, but not overly sweet.  If in the area, I will stop by to try another one of the choices.  Doubt I'll have the empty bottle with me.
author: Al L.

description: Got a mango smoothie and pearl milk tea. Loved the smoothie, was really creamy. I didn't like the pearl milk tea and though it was too chocolate-y and not that sweet but my friend loved it. I would recommend the milk tea if you aren't a big fan of sweet drinks.
author: Maya D.

description: I got the Thai tea here, and it was pretty good! Honestly, this place has decent prices and for the free glass bottle you can get it in, I would say it's definitely worth it to go here! Good aesthetics, even though it is a small little shop in the middle of SF.
author: Jen L.

description:
Randomly walked in here not expecting much, but was glad I did. This is one of those boba places going for that natural/healthy angle, so there aren't that many drink choices. I liked that they use actual fresh fruit for flavoring in a way that compliments the drink and doesn't just garnish it. I didn't adjust sweetness and found it just right when most other boba places make their regular orders syrupy sweet by default. I had the peach oolong and liked it, but thought it was a little funny that it's actually nectarines in the drink and not peach. Don't think they need to change the fruit in the drink, because that's what I liked about it, but... Overall, a thumbs up on quality and taste.

On the other hand, not so much a fan of the prices or the practicality of the glass bottling. It's cute and novel at first, but that 10% discount for bringing back the bottle only amounts to quarters. I hope that they actually reuse/wash bottles customers bring back and don't just recycle them, because if it's the latter, then the glass bottle is not environmentally friendly at all (recycling uses markedly more energy than reusing since it involves destroying the bottle and repurposing). As for practicality, what if you're just walking by on the way to somewhere else? The glass bottle (whether full or empty) is heavy and impractical to carry with or without a bag. I kept mine and am reusing it, but for frequent customers I imagine few keep all the ones they've bought.

SERVICE// The girl who took my order was polite and friendly. The guy who made my drink, however, was a bit condescending when I asked for a cap. I didn't realize I had to get the cap myself and at the time there were customers blocking the straw/cap area.

SPACE// I think the space is pretty big, just not that many tables. Nice and bright; loud, open area.
author: Ada L.

description:
Guy at the register wasn't that friendly. Very monotonous, didn't smile, and didn't even tell me what options I could adjust. Only because I've bought from other boba shops did I know to ask for sweetness and ice adjustments. He didn't explain how the bottle system worked. I only knew that they had bottles from seeing the pictures on Yelp. But I didn't know anything other than that. 

I got the classic oolong milk tea with soymilk. The tea flavor isn't strong but it'll do for now, when there aren't any other shops close by that are open. I had the sweetness level at 50% and it's not that sweet. Really wish the tea flavor was more pronounced... The tapioca balls are meh...
author: Audris K.

description:
Not gonna lie. I came here for one reason: I wanted the glass jar.

That being said, I've found that Plentea is a pretty decent place to settle a boba craving. Boba is on point and the tea flavors are strong. Their prices are a little bit higher on average (even by SF standards), but that's expected because of the glass jars. If you don't want to take one home, you can leave your empty bottle in the tub next to the straws; if you want to take it home, grab a cap (also located next to the straws) so that any remaining liquid doesn't spill out while you're in transit.

There's usually a line out the door if you go during peak social hours (i.e., weekends, weekday evenings after work) but it moves fairly quickly. There are some seats on the ground floor, but there's also a cute seating area upstairs that's a little more secluded.

Staff is super friendly. You can get 15% off of two drinks if you check in on Yelp! And if you don't like the way that your drink turns out, they're happy to make another for you. (Just remember to ask nicely!)
author: Yvonne K.

description:
Teas are very fresh and good! 

The most shocking thing is that I dropped my drink (sea salt oolong) and they replaced it with no hesitation. I did not even ask for a replacement and they did it anyway. So thankful for their service! Staffs were friendly and drinks are super fresh!
author: Jessica X.

description: We visited this place early February right when they opened. The baristas were nice and friendly. Very clean and cute place to just chill. On the plus side drinks come in a cute little glass bottle. Will definitely come back when we visit
author: Teresa L.

description: Has been 2-3 years. I'm back :))) luckily my Sea Cream Oolong's still the same :))) I have the oolong tea with my favorite pearls there. Bring your bottles with 10% off
author: Senpai A.

description:
This place is ridiculously poppin! Came on a weekday afternoon and the line was still way out the door, about a 20 minute wait. 

For a tiny boba shop in the heart of SF, Plentea's not bad when it comes to interior ambiance. While the loft seating is commendable, the layout of the bottom is just a bit disappointing. In the name of aesthetics, the already scarce amount of space is further reduced; I was sitting with my friend on a side table waiting for our order, but as more people ordered after us and took a seat as well, we were basically locked in and had to ask each and every person who sat down to move for us to go back to the front register. 

Customer service was a mixed bag. While the guy who took our order had a pleasant attitude, I honestly didn't feel like he gave us truthful opinions about the menu. We asked several questions, only to hear very generic responses that basically meant "everything is good, everything is popular". While arguably a smart answer, it just seemed like a copout to me.

The peach green tea my friend got was pretty refreshing and didn't scream "I'M MADE WITH SYRUP!" thanks in part to the bits of peach on top. My mango milk tea was a bit disappointing though. I already had my doubts with a fruity milk tea, because when I've ordered it at other teahouses in the past the flavoring and creamer starts separating after a while. I had to learn the hard way that this place is no different :( On the bright side, the very aesthetically pleasing glass jars are included in the price!

Overall, not a bad place; just be prepared to wait, not have good seating, and be careful with what you order LOL.
author: Vincent L.

description: Love how modern it looks here! The cashier, Emily, was very nice and reminded me to mix my sea salt oolong milk tea
author: Megan L.

description: This is such a cute place! I love the sustainability aspect as well. Their upstairs area opens the place up and the tea was super tasty!
author: Josée F.

description:
Unique flavors and they open later compared to other boba shops which is a plus. 

I got the iced milk with brown sugar and I liked it. It just tasted like regular milk tea but sweeter. Nothing really special but it was good. 

BF got the sea salt crema and I don't think he really liked it. I for sure didn't like it. It was bitter and not satisfying. He said he couldn't taste the sea salt in it. 

Definitely not the best we had, but not the worst.
author: Vanessa L.

description: As tourists walking around with no particular agenda, we saw the crowd inside Plentea and suddenly we wanted boba. The line moves pretty fast to order and to get your drink. We really enjoyed the brewed teas and quality ingredients that they used. I can taste the tea and the richness of the milk. Like most boba places, you're able to request the sweetness level when you order. Their "thing" was the glass, old fashioned milk bottles that the drinks are served in. You can put a metal lid on it if you're taking it to go. There's a small section upstairs for seating.
author: Char L.

description: I love bubble and I go pretty often getting similar flavours at each location. I went to Plentea and my boyfriend got a roasted milk tea and I got the strawberry black tea. First of all I LOVEEEE their roasted milk tea. I can tell they used fresh milk in the roasted milk tea and in the strawberry black tea their were fresh chunks of strawberries. The glass jars are a added bonus as well (which they do not charge for & you get to keep it). It was well worth the money and I would definitely come back.
author: Kathy N.

description:
Try all of their boba teas. You wont be disappointed. My favorites are their boba milk teas.

Save the glass bottles and reuse them for water bottles. :)
author: Sujeesha V.

description: Plentea's tea and boba quality has decreased over the past year or so. I remember coming here a year back and LOVED it. I came back here three times to rekindle my love for this place but... nope. Boba's not very soft and the teas are watered down / taste very generic. No longer an option to purchase without the bottle (what do I do with 5+ bottles). +1 star for abundant seating, +1 star because the bottles are still nice and sturdy.
author: Sang H.

description:
Tried the sea salt crema coffee but found my crema to be strangely chunky...it was pretty off-putting. It also didn't mix in well with the coffee, floating as clumps. I ended up capping the bottle and giving it a good shake. It made me a bit sad to not have separate layers, but it was nearly impossible to drink as delivered. Additionally, my friend found her sea salt crema tea to be too watery. 

2 drinks with the 15% discount still came out to $10, I was a little surprised by that as well. Pretty expensive if you ask me. 

Delivery in a bottle is pretty neat...I'll give you that.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I don't mind paying for expensive boba milk tea if it's good but it's not. And don't let the glass bottle foul you, it looks like a standard size drink but its way less than standard small. And how many of these bottles can you collect? Drinks are water down, lacking in tea flavor. I use to think it was decent but it got worst. If there are completion around, shouldn't you try to improve? So many options in the city therefore this isn't one.

Services is friendly tho and a lot of tables and seating.
author: Sandy B.

description:
One of the hyped boba tea places in the city! They are known for their signature glassware.

I come here once in awhile since it is just a few minutes away from my office. I think their milk tea and fruit tea are decent, they tend to be over sweet at times. However, my favorite is the Milk Ice Tea with Brown Sugar. It tastes exactly like vanilla ice cream. I also tried their Takoyaki Balls, they are OK, more flour than tako inside. 

Overall, a decent place, but I prefer i-Tea more which is nearby!
author: Natalie L.

description: Pretty good bubble tea for the prices, it can get a little noisy and it's a little small but it's a fun place to get good cheap boba tea with friends
author: Jack B.

description:
Hate to say this but the hype for this place is freaking real. A few years ago, I was super obsessed with collecting the glass bottles, but if you take the glass bottle out of the equation - there is seriously nothing special about this place.

In all honesty, a lot of their teas have unbalanced flavors (i.e. their passion fruit tasting like peace, and just so much more) and their milk gives their tea a  weird flavor sometimes that you don't even want to finish it. The only thing that is good some times are their smoothies especially the avocado! Their toppings are also usually on point and the staff is very accommodating. I would suggest going somewhere else if you want really good tasting boba, but if you want the glass cup and experience of waiting in line -- TREAT YOURSELF!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Neat little tea shop with great loose tea selection. I tried the wild pu-ehr and am hooked. This had a dark aroma of wood and earth while smooth and rich on the tongue. 
The Jasmine pearl was light, fruity and insanely aromatic. 
Come try this place. Lovely staff, very knowledgeable and so helpful!!!!
author: Andy B.

description:
I came across this place while strolling through San Fransisco one weekend and popped in for a try. The place is small (most people don't realize but there is an upstairs level too). There was a moderate line when I got there, but due to the popularity,  it was quickly out the door by the time I got my drinks. The drinks did take a while to get but, again, I think the staff was trying their best to keep up with taking and making orders.  You can get drinks in a regular cup or their cute designed glassware. As for the drinks I tried:

1) Mango milk tea- This was insanely delicious and very similar to a mango lassi. I am sure all the other fruit flavors are equally as good.

2) Matcha green tea latte with almond milk and tapioca- It was good, but a little too sweet for how I like mine

Definitely worth trying if you like boba drinks and are in the area!
author: Doug P.

description:
Very hipster boba spot.

Located on the edge of Chinatown. Terrible street parking. Long lines. 

Yelp checkin gives you a discount.

Drinks come in old school milk bottles. I believe I saw you that you get a discount if you bring it back.

Oolong Milk Tea w/ Boba - $4.50 + $.50 - Good milk tea. Perfectly sweet when I got no sugar. Not worth $5 though.

Green Peach Tea w/ :Lychee Jelly - $4.95 + $.50 - Fresh peachy flavor. Comes with small peach pieces. Lychee Jelly added the right amount of sweetness to no sugar sweetness level.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Finally swung by Plentea after hearing all the hype...and also being insanely jealous of the glass bottles that everyone had.

I had a taro milk tea with boba and my brother had the nutella milk tea with boba, both with reduced sugar (I know, blasphemy!). The taro was delicious! It was made from real taro and not the powder that some places use. The nutella was good as well but had a bit more of a dark chocolate flavor rather than the distinctive hazelnut flavor of nutella.

Either way, the boba in each was perfectly chewy. The glasses are awesome though! Bring them home and use them for tiny aquariums or little decorative pieces or use them for coffee/milk/etc. Also, if you bring them back (at least at the Kearney location), you get 10% off!

All in all, a bit pricier than some places but you get what you pay for!
author: Jason W.

description: This tea place is located not too far from Westfield mall. It's a cute little tea place serves boba into a glass bottle if that's what you're into. I really enjoy places that does that. It's so cute. They have different toppings for your tea like most places. We added chia seeds and boba to ours. The almond milk tea isn't overpowering and I asked for 75% sweet and it was perfect. Minimal design for the interior with light wood makes the place feel open and bright.
author: Sally L.

description:
This is a small place with a cute setting. I wasn't too impressed with the drinks. 
I ordered the Sea salt creme oolong tea since it seemed quite popular, but turns out I didn't like it as much as I wanted to. I can taste the sea salt in the creme, but there was barely any sweetness to the drink and the boba was just decent. My son ordered the strawberry black milk tea, which didn't have any strawberry taste to it at all and the same goes with my husbands and he ordered the mango milk tea...no taste of mango. Kind of disappointing. 

I did enjoy my slice of chocolate mouse cake though...that was the best part.
author: Sandra L.

description: I come here more often than I ought to--I find the glass bottles a bit of a novelty, but some of their tea flavors are really quite good. The space is also very light and open (Instagram perfect,) and it's a very nice place to sit and chat over tea. It's a bit pricey for tea, but I sometimes bring my bottle back for 10% off.
author: Breanna D.

description:
It gets an extra star because you get to keep the glass bottle. Pretty standard bbt, can't complain about it. You're looking at spending roughly $5. If you check in, you get 15% off two drinks. 

I got the peach fruit green tea. It came with bits of peach in it, which I could have done without. 

I'm just highly impressed by the fact that they don't charge you for the glass bottles. Had to try it obviously. Free souvenir and all yknow?

Great staff, drinks are made quickly, good ambience and I like the décor. Would come again just to replenish my collection of glass bottles.
author: Jacqui L.

description: Place had a nice vibe and clean aesthetic look to it. The tea was also very good and the glass jar bottles they come in are pretty dope. The only problem was that we couldn't find the place and the drinks took so long because there were plentea of people there hahah. But yeah, there were a ton of people in this little shop and people waiting in line out the door as well. They do have a second floor but it's also pretty small. I don't blame em for having so many customers, overall it's a chill place to hang out and drink tea or boba with your friends!
author: David K.

description:
Came here when it first opened way back when. Back then you can pay to keep the glass bottle or you can get another cup. Now it's keeping the glass cup regardless. Very small location, upstairs is very small too. If you're coming with a lot of people to chill and hang out- not the best place. I'm not a huge tea fan, but it's okay. I mean..I got green tea... This place has cute decor with fish and plants. I don't crave this place. Just the glass is cool. Other than that..nothing really

You must spend at least $10 if you want to use card.
author: Amy Y.

description:
A boba shop that didn't have boba....I came in Sunday a bit after 7 (they close at 11) and they ran out. Not only boba, but Nutella too? So I guess that's a no go for the Nutella milk tea I wanted to try. Went with the black milk tea instead Without boba of course. Also ordered the honeydew and strawberry milk. 

The place has 2 levels which is awesome since the front of the store to the register is basically 10 feet. 

The black milk tea was kind of strong, but that's just personal preference. The honeydew milk tastes fresh, but a bit light and the strawberry milk was perfect. 

Only downside to the fruit milk drinks are that they blend them up so its pretty frothy. A bit disappointed I couldn't try the boba.
author: Gina K.

description:
I'm surprised I haven't written a review for Plentea yet, as I've been here over 20 times by now. This is the first place I take friends when I'm in the city. I remember when the place first opened and it was such a hit with the glass bottles, over time the location has physically changed, mainly to be more accommodating for bigger groups. The last time I came, the upper area was open, but clearly (and hopefully) still needed some finishing touches. I love how they have five stars and yelp discounts. 
Also, I always get their brown sugar ice milk with boba and egg pudding. This is the one boba place where regular PMT, while good, is not their best drink. 
p.s. bring your glass bottle back for a discount.
author: Savi J.

description:
I love everything about this place! The interior is clean and super cute, with wood paneled walls and plants everywhere. The drinks are reasonably priced (considering you can keep the glass bottles), and taste great too. The only thing that bothers me is that they don't have a restroom.

I came here to study, and it was really nice. Upstairs they have plenty of seating with outlets and free wifi. BUT when I looked around for a bathroom, I saw a "No Public Restrooms" sign instead. I had to walk all the way to Chipotle and use the restroom there LOL. It was just a hassle... if you're gonna come here to hangout/study, it's just something to keep in mind.

It can also get a little loud, but I don't mind that at all. Overall it's a really great place!
author: Kathy K.

description: First time coming here from Seattle. Friendly staff, and always willing to help. I came in with my boyfriend and we ordered a Black Milk Tea and Nutella Milk Tea. Would highly recommend both to anyone trying to this place out for the first time. Love the fact that they put their drinks in a glass bottle!
author: Marina P.

description: This place is nice if you have friends to hangout with! I love how the first level looks like because of the plants and modern day feels. The top floor use to look really nice however they had change it to just tables and no decorations. How they display their drinks with bottles makes it a wonderful place to be at bc it impresses the guests somehow lol not like the typical plastic cups.  No restrooms so make sure you go before heading here.
author: Phuong N.

description:
This is a nice tea shop with ok tasting teas. I was recommended to try the Oolong milk tea by the helpful employee at the register and I liked it, it had an interesting flavor. Keep in mind that you can request to try the favors before committing to a type. My friends got a variety including: iced coffee, strawberry fruit milk tea, and apple honey flavored tea. They enjoyed it, but our complaint is that it can be a little too sweet and the drinks were average. The lines to get these teas is also so long out the door that it may not even be worth the 20 minute wait just to order. I also find these teas to be a little pricier than other places, but that may be due to the glass bottle it comes in that you get to keep! If you visit often be sure to keep the bring the bottle for discounts. 

If the downstairs gets crowded check out the upstairs for extra seating. The couches are comfortable and it is a great space to hang out. But one thing is that I found that it was strange to no have a bathroom in a place that sells drinks...
author: Khoi N.

description: Their jasmine green milk tea is delicious! The boba is also chewy too. If you return the glass bottles you also get 10 percent discount!
author: Nick L.

description:
The drinks came in really nice glass bottles, but other than that, I thought it was just okay. I've definitely had better.

My boyfriend and I were visiting SF for the weekend and happened to walk upon this place because it was conveniently open past 10 pm. Plentea is a clean establishment and has a sort of minimalistic approach to its decor. It reminds me of one of those new age hipster places. Like most shops around the area, it is not very spacious. There are a few bar stools around the order counter and a second story. We didn't bother checking out the upper level seating section, but judging from the dimensions of the overall store, I don't assume it accommodates a large party very well.

I ordered the sea salt creama tea and my boyfriend ordered the sea salt coffee. The tea and coffee were extremely aromatic, however, it severely lacked sweetness. That broke the deal for us because without the sweetness, the drinks just tasted overly creamy and salty.  I know some people prefer less sweet, but these drinks tasted like it had no sugar whatsoever. The coffee was beyond bitter and left a strong aftertaste in your mouth. Yes, it was "strong" tasting but the kind of artificial flavoring you get in the instant coffee mixes. My boyfriend didn't even finish his drink. The creama tea was made from oolong tea. It was definitely strong and smelt good, but without the sweetness, it tasted like regular tea with a whole bunch of salt in it. 

I wish we hadn't left the store to catch our Uber because I would've definitely gone back for a remake. 

Overall, for the price of about $5 per drink, I would say it's average. The bottles are cute but don't expect to get a lot of your drink either because the glass that it comes in is very thick. 

Would I come back? Probably not.
author: Bao Tran N.

description: I love this place! the interior design is simple and warm, the bubble tea is fantastic and it is served in simple glass bottles which make the tea even greater. Staff really nice and they make you very welcomed.
author: Monika B.

description:
oh terrible! This will not satisfy your boba cravings. The service is great and top notch, but the actual milk tea wasn't good. The milk tea was watery and lacked flavor. The bobas were hard and I almost wanted to say that they were not fresh since they were not soft and chewy. 

I would come back just for the service, but I would not recommend the mlik teas here.
author: Linette F.

description:
It's kind of expensive and it's pretty lack luster milk tea. There's only one place in SF that I do go to when I visit and it's Boba Guys. I've been to this place because people had a lot of those glass cups that they got to keep as souvenirs. I think that's pretty cool because they function as really nice coin jars or a vase for temporary flowers. But outside of that, there's not much I'd recommend about Plentea.

It is a good spot of average, no-nonsense, milk tea.
author: Kenny N.

description:
Are you reading this review because you are considering going to Plentea?  Then stop reading and just go or bookmark it for your trip.  Get something cold.  And then come back and finish my review for me.  ;)  Because I promise you will enjoy this place.

Are you reading this because of another reason?  Ok.

We were on the other side of the street, but this place looked cool from the outside.  I crossed the street and took a look inside.  Ooooooh it's like a smoothie place with some super unique offerings.

I got a Fruit Flavored Honey tea and it was spendid if a little too sweet for my tastes.  I didn't check and see if they could reduce the sweet.  Next time I am in the city I will ask when I order my next drink.

My wife got some sort of Asian slushy drink.  Bleh.  She loved it, but I didn't like it at all.  Not my "cup of tea" ;)

My daughter got a Nutella Milk and that was so delicious.

I like that they were open later than most of the other places around.

Can't wait to try another one or two of these when we go back.
author: Robert S.

description: Not a big fan of Plentea. Their drinks are just ok, and their prices are not ok...LoL   I like the glass bottle concept, but it's too pricey.
author: Danny B.

description:
99 bottles of boba on the wall, 99 bottles of... Raise your hand if you came here for the bottles. You too? So it's not just me?

Let's admit it. The major draw for this place is definitely the neat glass bottles you can take away from this place. For tourists, it's a nifty little souvenir. For locals, it's one less glassware I have to buy at Ikea. It does up the price of the average milk tea to around $5 and that's before the toppings/boba is counted. But then again, you're in SF and most of the trendy boba shops are that expensive these days. 

I had the CoffMilk which was a coffee milk tea and I was disappointed that it didn't look like what was pictured on the menu with the swirls of white and dark brown floating down to the bottom. Instead, it was already all mixed in and looked similar to a Starbucks Frappuccino bottle. Taste-wise, it was just as similar to the Mocha Frap you can buy at Safeway although slightly more diluted with the ice. 

Tea-wise, I'm not blown away. I wouldn't fork over my $5 for it on any occasion except for when I'm needing a new bottle or have a friend visiting from out of town. I do think the experience of coming here is unique because you can watch them make the drinks and they use a funnel to pour in the boba into the bottles. It definitely beats watching the boba cup sealer machine (although that has its fun at times). And who can resist the allure of having your own Plentea bottle to keep?

Important Tidbits: Make sure to get a plastic cap for your bottle. They're at the counter. But they aren't 100% seal proof so don't put your full trust in it. There's a Yelp check-in offer for 15% off two drinks so check-in on Yelp. Credit card minimum is $10. No bathroom but there is upstairs seating. And you can bring back your bottle for 10% off your next purchase. But who actually wants to carry their bottle back?
author: Diana C.

description: Adorable products that tasted as good as they looked. We also got excellent service. My friend's glass bottle had some crack/black mark on it. We weren't expecting them to remake the entire drink but they did it anyways! Thank you!
author: Loose Seal A.

description:
I like the aesthetics of Plentea, but the drinks are meh.

We got the jasmine milk tea with tapioca for $5 each and the drink was not good. My boyfriend and I came here to satisfy our boba cravings, but their drink was quite disappointing. The jasmine milk tea was very watered down and to put it quite bluntly, it was bad. I'm a fiend of boba so I can usually finish any drink without a problem, but this was one of the very few boba places where I ended up not finishing it.

You can keep the glass jar for free. If you bring it back the next time, you get a discount. $5 for a jasmine milk tea with tapioca is pricey and I'm pretty sure it costs $5 to cover the price of the glass jars (I would rather pay less to not get a glass jar because I wouldn't keep it).

Giving 2 stars because in comparison to other boba places in the area, their drink is terrible. Not taking off the last star because the aesthetics are nice (I guess). They also have seating available upstairs, which I thought was a nice area to relax and sip.

If you're all about the aesthetics, this place is for you. If you're looking to get great boba, this is NOT the place for you.
author: Jen S.

description:
Wow, this place has the line out the door, so expect for a long wait! I originally wanted to order the peach oolong tea, but they ran out early on in the day. So I resulted to ordering the Mango tea. I was told by the cashier that it's made with fresh mango, and asked for it to be 100% sweet which is what I liked. But she refused to make it sweet, and said if I want more later then they will add it. 

At first taste, it wasn't good, it was tasteless. I asked the worker to make it sweeter and he kindly did. The experience was definitely cool, I love the reusable bottles, but this really isn't my cup of tea (literally). I've had better in the city, but definitely worth a try!
author: Cindy D.

description:
probably the worst matcha latte i have ever had it did not taste anything like matcha latte and on top of the that the boba was so hard ): im super disappointed because i was really excited to come! 
i recommend their lime tea though that was pretty good...
author: Remy W.

description: Boba was stale, and milk tea tasted like sugar water with tea fragrance. Drink was less than mediocre, but I came here for the jar. The jar is pretty cute, but the drink is not worth.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I came here plenty of times and I decided to finally write a review for this place. Located in the financial district. Parking can be hard in the daytime but easy at night. I've tried their milk tea, fruit tea, and smoothies. Honestly, it was alright but not great. Customer service is great here however 6-7$ for a mediocre drink isn't worth it for me. Inside was very aesthetically pleasing and gives a modern feel to it. There is also a second floor where you can chill I believe. Bring your own glass bottle back and you get 10% off. There are better boba places in SF I wouldn't come back here.
author: Tina C.

description:
Always a great day to have boba even when it's super cold and windy in SF haha.  Was desperate for some boba on New Years Eve and this was the only place around the area that was opened.
