LOCATION: Good spot within DTSF, so it's walk-able to the mall and other places. The place is pretty small, but does have some high tables to sit at and I didn't even know that there was an upstairs until reading some of these reviews.  The place was pretty packed on New Years Eve, but service was pretty quick!

DRINKS: I got the strawberry fruit tea with chia seeds. I love how they give you the far for free, instead of charging you for extra.  Since I wasn't going home after, I returned the bottle instead! They give a good amount of fruit bits and there was a pretty strong strawberry tea taste! 

OVERALL: Would definitely come back here when I'm in SF.
author: Jennie Q.

description:
Literally my favorite boba/milk tea shop of all time. Their menu is fairly small but simplicity works wonders for them. Each time, I've ordered something different and they have always been consistent with their drinks since I've liked everything so far. Usually at other boba places, it's a hit or miss and some drinks on the menu are great and some are subpar. 

I've also tried their waffles and takoyaki and both were delicious.

I love how you get the complimentary glass bottles unlike other places where they charge you. Bring back the bottle and save 10% off your order. 

The place is extremely small even with upstairs seating. I wish they had a location in the East Bay but it's relatively close walking distance wise from Union Square if you're in the area.
author: Phuong T.

description:
When you're in SF, there are plenty of boba options...but I kept on hearing about these fancy plentea glass bottles that you could take away with you, so I ventured here on a late afternoon.

They have a lot of options, but I settled on their milk slush with boba and their taro milk tea with boba. I always get 0% sugar, and it was hard for them to give me no sugar. It isn't a problem, since I understand that a lot of boba spots pre-mix or prep their teas (like taro tea is notorious) beforehand. So I wasn't bummed, but told them that I didn't like my tea too sweet. 

There wasn't a long line, but we waited for a while...10-15 minutes for two drinks. Their glassware truly makes the tea seem very special, but once you strip that part away...their bubble tea is very creamy, milky, and on the sweeter side :\ I'm a big fan of Taiwanese style boba, and plentea just didn't do it for me. I could see why millenials love this place (snapchat/insta purposes), but their quality of tea barely had a tea flavor...and I wouldn't go out of my way to (impossibly) park near Chinatown to get plentea. I can go to uber sweet Purple Kow if I want my cup of sweetness.

Oh, and they also use FIVESTARS!
author: Jodi H.

description:
Most of the time, you'll need to wait a little because it's in a such a busy place in SF. It's surrounded with food places so many people come to grab a drink after lunch or dinner! 

I got the honey jujube tea & it was so good. It had the perfect natural sweetness to it from the honey and even had little bits of jujubes in it too! Jujubes are chinese dates btw :) It's a healthy fruit that is naturally sweet. I would definitely get this drink again. 

Two days later, I came and got the blueberry fruit slush and it was alright. When I saw them make it, they used frozen blueberries from ziploc bags. Disappointed it wasn't fresh :( It didn't taste too fresh either. Next time, I would get another fruit slush! 

This is a place worth trying if you need your boba fix or love tea shops. The glass jar is definitely what attracts many people! You can also check in and get 15% of when you buy two drinks.
author: Winnie L.

description:
It's a long wait for milk tea/milk coffee drinks.  Their novelty is that they serve your drink in a milk glass container that you get to keep.

I didn't think it was worth the wait.  The line is long to order, and then after you order you also have to wait awhile to get your drink.  The portion is big, but the taste is just ok.  

I enjoyed my milk container, but my drink wasn't very good and so it was just a lot of liquid that ended up finishing without being super impressed.

This place is pretty popular so maybe they are known for different drinks, but that day I was looking for your basic milk tea with boba and I've definitely had better elsewhere.

It's a trendy place to check out, but I won't crave coming back.
author: Matt K.

description:
Love this tapioca spot! For about 5$ you get your drink and a cute, glass milk jug, which you can bring in next time for a slight discount (10%). It's nice that there's only one size to the drinks as well. 
I usually get the ice milk tea with brown sugar. This is soooo delicious, perfect balance between sweet and tea, and there's something about the brown sugar part that's so good!! The hot almond milk tea also has lots of flavor, must try during a cold night. The matcha tea is kind of gross, Doesn't taste like the matcha from... Like.. Sbux.. That I love...
There's plenteaaa of seats and an upstairs as well, but the loud music and bustling baristas don't make this a good work place- nice spot to drink boba and chill. 
Took away a star bc I hate places that makes you purchase a minimum in order to use your cc! C'mon guys! It's 2016
author: Maria C.

description: Loved the glass jars you can take to go.  But my Thai iced tea was disappointing.  Not much flavor and watery. Not sure what else to say....not worth the wait.
author: Robert C.

description:
I forgot what i ordered, but I was very satisfied with whatever it was. I am from southern California, therefore I had never been to Plentea before. I told the cashier to list tihe most popular drinks, so I made my decision based off of that.  All I remember was that my drink had pineapple in it. 

I had a funny encounter with another customer. I looked at her drink and I was like "what you order?" She was like "I don't know but it has grass jelly in it." I look at that thing and I was like "there's no grass jelly in that." She was like "I don't know it's somewhere in there." Then when I was on my way out, she approached me and was like "You right, I ain't sucking up any of the grass jelly." I work at a boba shop, so I'm pretty sure I know what grass jelly looks like LOL.

I think this is a solid choice for boba, and I will be coming back next time I'm in SF.  The drinks are just right and not overly sweet. Customer service is also friendly, which is always a plus.
author: Christian H.

description: I've been here at least 5 times, and each time it's a pretty good experience! I've tried a few drinks, and I've got to say that their milk tea is actually pretty average. I do like the Honey Lemon tea a lot though. It's not too sweet and super refreshing. Their boba is chewy and nice SOMETIMES. It changes everytime I come here. Boba wise, I prefer Boba Guys's a lot more. Overall, I generally wouldn't come here unless my friends do. The best part about Plentea is just how cute and aesthetics everything is (including the bottle!).
author: Diane Z.

description: I would bump it up but you're essentially paying for the aesthetic bottle when you could walk down like a block and head to iTea but I do really like the Ice Milk w/ Brown Sugar drink and their tapioca is decent but I don't really want to spend $6 for a drink...anyways I would say one pro is the space which is nice and it's a good place to check out at least once!
author: Lena T.

description:
NOTE: $10 MIN ON CREDIT CARDS

Solid boba experience. Not one of my better experience, but not too many complaints. This is the place that gives you the drink in a glass bottle/mason jar. It's a nice little souvenir, haha. If you bring it back, you get a 10% discount. They also have a sweet upstairs area to sit back and chill at.

I got the taro milk with boba pearls. The taro milk had the right consistency (potatoe-y, which some people don't like, but I love!) and good flavor. The boba was not too sweet, until the end when it had soaked up all of the milk. The price is $5+ for most drinks (if you add at least one extra ingredient), but this is expected with the hardware. 

Would definitely return with my nifty mason jar to try some of the other flavors!
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Walked around the streets looking for this place for a few minutes, it's a bit confusing when allowing google maps to guide you, but well worth the walking. The tea was amazing and the glasses they use to serve your drink are just as awesome. If you're in SF I definitely recommend stopping here for a nice cold tea on a hot day.
author: Christian L.

description: I tried a bit of the classic milk tea here and it was good, but like everyone says it was pricey. Also with the glass bottles, you have to stick around and can't really walk around with your bubble tea (plus, it's on the border between downtown and Chinatown so there isn't too much in the very immediate vicinity). The line was also very long on a Saturday afternoon and it took a really long time for about 5 of us to wait and get our tea!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Love this place! I'm not a big boba drinker because I'm so picky ... but this place is one of my top go to boba places.  I try something new every time I come here. Liked every single drink I've gotten so far. My boyfriend gets the Nutella Milk Tea every time he comes here; it's different and tastes amazing and I guess he can't get enough?! Lol. 

I think what sets this place apart from other boba places are their jars. They're unique (cus it has their logo on them), reliable (I squeeze my cups sometimes lol), and you can take them home (cus who doesn't love mason jars?!). Bring your jar back and get a discount on your order! 

Another plus is the aesthetic of the place. Come here with friends or come here alone to do some homework, it's great for either occasions. And lastly, location location location! Basically in the heart of the city. Walk a few more blocks up, you reach Chinatown. Walk a few blocks back, you reach the heart of downtown shopping! Hope this helps. Definitely a place to try!
author: Jamaica B.

description:
Drinks averaging at $5 is pricey for bubble tea, but using the yelp check-in 25% off discount make it a reasonable price. Otherwise, bring your old glass jar for 10% off. 

Whenever I come here it is always crowded. There are about 5 tables upstairs for seating, but most people get the drinks to-go. These are comfortable seats though, and it is a cutely decorated balcony area, definitely a great spot for taking a break.

I was surprised that the drinks are really good quality! I was worried that Plentea is over-hyped due to its location and glass jars, but I enjoy their coffee milk tea and matcha red bean slush. Their drinks are not overly sweet, you can definitely taste the tea flavor. The coffee milk tea is so bold in coffee flavor, yet you can taste the milk tea at the same time, highly recommended! 

Be warned the caps to the bottles are not tightly sealed, and will spill for sure if not placed upright. I will come back to try their fruit tea in the future!
author: Karen C.

description:
The tea at Plentea is good quality. I've only tried matcha and thai tea, but they are both good. 

The problem I have with this place is their glass bottles. Don't get me wrong, I thought it was really cool at first, but then one time, I was rejected for having a dirty bottle. I'm not talking about a horrendously nasty bottle, I'm talking a bit of residue from the previous drink. I definitely washed the crap out of it and wasn't able to get some stains. My glass bottle was rejected and the only thing they could say was that it was dirty. Nobody but me is going to be drinking out of that bottle so I don't understand why it would be a problem that i am drinking out of a stained bottle. I ended up having to buy a new bottle. That defeats the purpose of reusing bottles. 

Also they try and get you with that 10% discount like it really isn't just 10¢ off. Relax.

At least the line isn't too long and they have a good seating area. 

For you SF natives, I just want to tell you can find good bubble tea for $2.50 in NYC.
author: Irene P.

description:
I've been here twice and my experience has been enjoyable both times. The second time I visited, they were renovating part of the downstairs and all of the upstairs, so seating and waiting space was cramped. Their original milk tea and matcha latte are both yummy. It's cool that they let you keep the glass jars. Hot drinks are not served in the jars, only iced drinks.

Tip for Chase Sapphire Preferred and Reserve cardholders: This location uses Square to process payments, which does not process as Dining (confirmed by Chase customer service) so you will not receive your bonus earn here. I found out the hard way :(.
author: Di W.

description:
My husband's co-worker introduced us to this place since she is a boba fanatic and knows almost all the boba joints in town. I thought it was really cool that you get to keep their bottle - if you bring it back you can get a discount on future drinks!

I ended up getting the fresh taro milk - I started getting the "fresh" drinks since they're healthier and it's really good here! My husband had the premium high mountain black tea with taro pudding, which was also very delicious.

If it wasn't so far, I would definitely go back and visit on a regular basis...can you please open up a location in South Bay? =)
author: Cathy W.

description:
I used to love coming to Plentea, and my drink of choice was the Ice Milk with brown sugar and taro pudding. 

However, a few months back, Plentea closed for renovations, and after re-opening, it just hasn't been the same. 

The first time I went back to Plentea after it re-opened, I again got my usual Ice Milk with brown sugar. When I tried to order the taro pudding, I was told they no longer offer that topping. The drink itself was also severely disappointing -- it tasted nothing like it used to and was pretty much flavorless ice. 

I went back again a few weeks ago to give Plentea another try and was again disappointed by my drink. Taro pudding still isn't offered as a topping.

The interior decor and menu have changed quite a bit, leading me to think Plentea might have changed hands.

Lastly, Plentea no longer uses the Five Stars loyalty program (and did not communicate the termination of the program beforehand), so all the points I collected are lost.
author: Jackie Y.

description:
Been wanting to come here for awhile after seeing a photo of the cute glasses they give the boba in and finally got around to trying Plentea.
First time I came I tried the milk tea with boba. The milk tea is not overly sweet but rather has more a tea taste which I really enjoyed. 
I then tried their thai tea since this is one of my FAVORITE drinks ever. They did my favorite drink justice as it was not overly sweet and tasted pretty good. I'm kind of picky when it comes to thai tea so it says a lot when I enjoyed their thai tea.
I love the packaging and how they give their boba in glasses! I washed mine out and kept it since I liked it so much. It is a bit more pricier than other boba places but I think it's worth it. 
Definitely want to come back to try some of their other flavors as well!
author: Julia K.

description:
I was SO excited to try this cute boba tea place out. As I was walking around the area to find the perfect lunch spot, I walked by this place and it screamed to me, "COME HERE FOR DESSERT AFTER YOU'RE DONE WITH LUNCH?" And so I did. I was so excited about finishing my lunch just so I can come here. Unfortunately, I wasn't satisfied at all.

The decor and the glass jars, LOVED IT. If not for that, I'd give this place 1 star. I love boba. I love milk tea. How can something as delicious as these two things together fail so miserably? Well, it happened. Both my fiance's and my drinks weren't good... they were actually pretty tasteless. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing? (I was told the sea salt creama was the most popular drink, but I would never recommend it)! My fiance had the nutella milk tea and it was also pretty gross... and how can you mess up anything with nutella?!? Yikes. 

I really hope this place gets their milk tea in check...

Also, be sure to check if there's actual boba in your drink. My fiance ordered the boba for an extra fee and they forgot to add it in. Too bad we realized that till after we already left the place.
author: Anastasia N.

description:
The venue is very nicely decorated, with little plants scattered around the store, giving it a very fresh and clean vibe. The store has enough seating for about 12 or 13 people at once. Menus (pictured below) are conveniently positioned above the cash register and there are PLENTY of deals/offers! At the time of this review, there is an offer of 15% off two drinks when checking in. 

I ordered the CoffMilk Tea and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea. The thing I love about this place is that for $4.50, you get milk tea in a glass container that you could end up keeping/reusing after finishing your drink. The price is so cheap that I'm ended up questioning how they can possibly make a profit!! As if that wasn't enough, my friend noticed chalk writing on the wall stating that you could save 10% off on future purchases if you bring your own bottle (reuse the bottle) 

The service was very quick and efficient. I ordered and got my drink within 10 minutes. This is especially great during lunch hours because I recall this place being very packed during the day time.
author: Alex L.

description:
Pretty good bubble tea but more expensive than the typical run-of-the-mill shops. It definitely has a hip San Francisco vibe where they use organic this and that. I love that they give you a milk jar for the tea! Super cute :) And yes, you can walk away with them. Though if you bring them back on your next visit, you can get a 10% off discount. You also get a 15% off of 2 drinks if you check in on yelp - nice deal if you came with a friend.

They have a nice variety of toppings you can choose from, much more than what Boba Guys offers. I usually get Tapioca and Lychee jelly. Tapioca is an obvious must, lychee jellies make the milk tea sweeter. So if you like that, make sure to get some!
author: Angel C.

description: Mmm boba is good here! The price is reasonable and they don't charge extra for the cute bottle! You can adjust the sweetness to your drink and I love the option of chia seeds! We got the matcha green tea, the jasmine and the pineapple green tea! All yummy! The line went quick and it wasn't a long wait to get our drinks, the cashier was friendly and don't forget to check in so you can use your 15% off ! I totally forgot about it when I was paying
author: Nikki O.

description:
Argh, I don't get this place!

The milk bottles are a noveltea that I don't need.  They are cute the first time - and maybe good for someone who has never had boba tea before but I actually don't want to come back because I don't know what to do with the bottle ... recycling / throwing it out seems like a waste.  I'm so old school Chinese like that.

Because of these awkward bottles, I feel like I'm getting jipped on the amount of boba balls I get.  The ratio of tea to boba is off which defeats the whole point!
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Pretty cool place even though hella expensive for milk tea. $10 for bubble tea, really? I guess it's worth it since they serve it to you in a glass bottom that you can take home!

Flavor was kinda bland but I typically like my milk tea this sway. The appetizers and dessert was pretty meh so I would advise against getting it. I got the toast and the octopus balls and although they were fresh and well-made they didn't taste that great/filling.
author: Kevin L.

description:
This is my go-to boba tea place when I want something fresh and not overwhelmingly sweet - just the way I like it! I've tried their famous original Milk Tea and Sea Salt Milk Tea - both with boba and they're spot on!

Prices are relatively OK, one of the things that sets them apart from other boba teas is that they serve the tea in a glass bottle with "Plentea" embossed on it and they're serious about reusing it, meaning: if you come back for your future visits bringing the bottle, they'll give you 10% discounts for your purchase!

The store is not that big, but filled with enough seats. Most of the time they have long line, and I wish the store has a public restroom.
author: Annisa J.

description:
I just come to collect the bottles honestly.

Came here around 12:30pm, and I guess I just got really lucky with no line. Everyone was either busy ordering from food establishments or just eating elsewhere, so my friend and I ordered with ease. I've come here a few times before, but I can't remember how those past drinks tasted. The one thing I remember for sure is that the teas here are nothing too special. They look really nice though, I'll give them that!

I got the Lavender Lemonade, and my friend got the Strawberry Fruit Tea.

My drink reminded me of a flowery sierra mist as I did not expect the drink to be carbonated at all. Although I used the word "flowery", I barely tasted anything similar to lavender. In addition to that nonexistent ingredient, the drink did not look like the advertised picture. Looks basically like a bland mojito. Maybe it needs chia seeds? The strawbery fruit tea was tasty as I remember it but with less pieces of strawberries this time.

Someday I'll find that one drink that stands out from the rest, but today was not that day.
author: Kevin S.

description:
I guess people come here for the bottle but I came here because my group preferred Plentea to i-Tea. The price for the drink itself wasn't awful considering you get a bottle, but I ordered an ice milk with caramel and it was greatly lacking in sweetness despite my past experiences with other boba shops. As it turned out, it was because the caramel was sugar free, something that took me like 20 minutes of taste testing to realize. Yeah... it's not for me. Why bother with unsweetened caramel?
My company seemed to enjoy their drinks and you get to keep the bottle afterwards so that's cool I guess. Bring the bottle back for a discounted drink next time!
author: Jenn T.

description: Yelped for boba while visiting SFO and found this cute place. I loved the Seasalt Oolong drink and another fam fave was the Mango smoothie. Parking was a struggle (but then, that is the case for the whole city). The drinks came in the cute bottle too, didnt pay extra like other places.
author: Jen M.

description:
What drew me and my friends' attentions to this place were the glass jars/bottles they filled with your order of tea with and let you bring home. This is an excellent marketing strategy, especially in the milk tea industry, because people who ordered can bring a little souvenir home and use it for themselves again.

Even though the number of regular tea options were greater than the number of milk tea options, I still wasn't disappointed. I ordered the Thai Milk Tea with Boba (the milk tea I usually order when I go to a boba shop to test how the milk tea is) and it came filled up all the way to the top of the glass jar. The taste and quality of the milk tea was just above average. To be honest, I would rank it higher than Boba Guys (which I find overrated and average). The blend of Thai Tea and the milk made it taste just about right; there was really nothing crazy about it. The actual boba itself was also fresh and cooked well, which I enjoyed.

Would I come back? Yes. Do I need to come when I visit SF again? Maybe; personally, I would be fine with going to some other boba shop nearby because it wasn't mind-blowing enough to take my breath away and say "I must come back here again and again!". I'm not saying it sucks, but instead, it was nice and I was satisfied.
author: Eric O.

description:
I wanted to try this place because they serve their tea in old fashion glass milk bottles. 

Came here on a freezing night but their door cannot be closed because they were renovating their upstairs so they needed access for the workers and ventilation as the fresh paint smelled quite strong.

They have interesting bubble tea varieties but I was only interested in trying their lychee tea with herbal jelly. It was fine, comparable with other boba tea places. 

Due to the reno, the place was not suitable for hanging out and more for take out as there was no place to sit.
author: LaiSun K.

description:
This place ALWAYS has a line, no matter what time of day it is. I've always been curious, but never patient enough to wait in line. But the other week, as I was walking down Kearny around 5pm, I walked by and say NO line! I quickly ran into and scanned the extensive menu. I opted for a simple first order, and chose the black milk tea with tapioca. Watching the drink get made was pretty interesting (giant funnel for the tapioca), and as much as talk about the glass bottles being a fad, it actually made a difference (perhaps not in taste, but just in overall experience). 

Pro tip: If you bring back the glass bottle, you get a 10% discount on your next drink. 

I thought the milk tea was one of the best one I've ever tasted. It was just the right amount of sweet, and the tea itself was very flavorful. 

The next time I walked by and there wasn't a line, I went in and ordered the same thing (I wasn't feeling very adventurous), and it was great the second time as well. 

My only criticism would be the lack of professionalism from the staff. Both time that I went, the staff were goofing off, having personal conversations with each other, and doing too many things at once. During my second time there, it felt like my presence was almost a burden, as it seemed the two team members would rather just continue their conversation than take my order. Otherwise, I definitely recommend trying the milk tea - you won't be disappointed!
author: Regina L.

description:
This place is a really cool boba spot in DTSF w their upstairs seating inside. Got the Oolong milk tea w red bean which was pretty much standard for me.  The glass bottles are a cool touch (and a super environmentally friendly add-on for the environmentalists and hipsters in SF). 
I don't think it's worth $5-7 for a standard milk tea drink, but I guess you can include the cost of a glass jar as well.  Went in for the experience and pretty much got what I needed.  Will prob go back, but most likely I wouldn't have my glass jar in my purse to whip out to reuse for 10% off haha
author: Tiffany Z.

description: Great, basic boba in a reusable glass. Eco friendly is a big plus for me. You can get your fancy flavors at i-Tea, but if you want black milk tea boba, Plentea is legit!
author: Matt H.

description:
Got a cold honey black lemon tea w/ pearls. Tea was alright a tad over-steeped and the lemon wasn't fresh, which added a bitterness to it. Pearls were pretty decent.

They have a nice seating area on the top floor. Rather go down a few blocks to get better drinks at i-Tea.
author: James N.

description: I love this place for their yummy drink flavors and also their glass bottles which you can keep! If you bring your bottle back you get a discount next time!
author: Alice S.

description:
It's been about 1-2 years since the last time I've been here (I use to go here more often) and I decided to come back today since I haven't been here in a while.The place changed, it's not like how it use to be anymore. 

I liked it before when they had more options to choose from for milk teas and it seems like they got rid of like half of their milk teas. However, I did try the matcha milk tea with lychee jelly, it was good, it's not the best that I've ever tried but it was still good. I still like the concept of the glass bottles that  they give you and how you get to keep it. Also with their new menu, they got rid of their food.

Plus they upgraded the place, so their upstairs changed. I felt that the vibe use to be more open and comfortable to sit in. Their walls use to have see through bars where you could sit and see everything from downstairs. Now they put a concrete wall where you can't see anything at all when you're sitting down. Plus the plain grey concrete wall makes it more boring and depressing to sit at. Also, they use to have couches and plants to give the area a more welcoming and appealing  look. Now it's just plain wooden tables and chairs.
However, the downstairs interior did look fine. 

I miss the old Plentea, I wouldn't be coming back anymore because of their new upgrade.
author: Jane S.

description: Good drinks, but the environment is also important. The loud music makes the place a bit difficult to hangout, work, or hear yourself think, and there's no bathroom available to the customers. Being that it's a place that offers drinks this seems to be a bit of an oversight.
author: Esti C.

description:
I've been to Plentea twice so far and haven't been impressed by the drinks either time. The second time I stopped by was a couple of days ago and honestly, the drinks from this place would probably be worth only 2 stars but the fact that you get your drink in a cute glass bottle (that you get to keep) deserves an extra star.

I asked about their most popular drinks and was recommended to try their original milk tea. I ended up ordering a black milk tea with lychee jelly at 50 percent sweetness. Unfortunately, the drink tasted watered down and diluted instead of just with the sugar content adjusted. 

However, the lychee jelly was good! Definitely recommend that as a topping to try. I'd probably only stop by again if I wanted to get another jar. It's about $5 for the drink + the jar which is really decently priced. I didn't try it myself but my friend got one of their coffee milk teas and said it was pretty good so try exploring some other options on the menu other than their original milk teas!
author: Nancy T.

description:
Location is in a very high traffic street. No parking close by that I know of. Luckily this place is close to the BART. We came here specifically to use a restroom. We bought our drink (Thai Tea) and asked for the restroom. Turns out there was no restroom. I have never heard of a milk tea spot with no restroom. That is a major red flag for me. Really wanted to give this place a 1 star because I really needed to use the restroom. Employees sent me to a parking garage that apparently had a restroom. Never found the parking garage? Or I think I found the parking garage but it was closed/locked up? Anyways, we had to go to another place and buy something there to use the restroom. 

So I wonder: Do people just grab and bounce for the milk tea here? Or do people actually sit down and socialize here? Because I am more of the person who like to sit down and socialize at the milk tea place that I go to. And if that place does not have a restroom, I am definitely never coming back again. 

upside of Plentea: 
nice clean decor
glass boba bottles

downside of Plentea: 
no restroom?!?!?!?!
expensive (due to the glass bottle) 

Tips for Plentea:
Please offer a restroom for your customers. 
You have lost a customer here. 

OVERALL: Drinks are actually decent but really expensive due to the glass bottle. There's no restroom. Good luck trying to find a toilet around Plentea. I don't recommend this place because the lack of a restroom.
author: Cecilia N.

description: The boba was average but the glass jars are great. I ordered the Peach Green Tea and it was nothing special but not bad. For the drink and the glass bottle, I would say the price is pretty good and would probably only go back to get another bottle.
author: Mallika J.

description:
Tea is good. But I'm really annoyed by the fact that they don't have a bathroom. I mean, it's a tea house where people are consuming lots of liquids. What made them think they can get away with not having a bathroom?

It just feels like a total disregard of customers' needs in favor of the shop's convenience.
author: Joseph L.

description: I've been here twice in the past 4 years and both times were really just okay. Save yourself the $5 (unless you really want that glass jar) - or at least make sure to check in for the discount off two drinks. The milk teas are really watered down and didn't taste good. To be fair, I got a soy milk substitute but the other drink I ordered was the nutella special milk tea which wasn't creamy at all. The vibe of the restaurant is cute and chic but not worth the hype. The drinks came out fast and there was no wait, and there was ample seating both upstairs and downstairs. Since I have two glasses now, I probably won't be back.
author: Erika N.

description:
I like their to-go glass bottles but it all seems too much. I wish they had an option to use a reusable cup for people drinking inside, which is also cheaper. That way, you don't pay the premium price to buy the jug too. 

Other tips:
* The salads are huge! Hope you like greens.
* There are also outlets to charge your phone. Yahoo!
* Lunch lines can get long and can take them even longer to bring you your salad!
* Space is small, so expect to leave after you get your drink if you didn't get a table.
author: Moua L.

description:
TAKOYAKI! In the most unassuming place, with long lines, and drinks served in glass bottles, I found the takoyaki I've been searching for. 

25% off when you check-in using Yelp, a black milk tea, Thai milk tea, and a takoyaki came up to about $12.25. Your order number gets called loudly for drinks but they just put my food order on the counter without calling the number loudly like they did for drinks.

Anywho, the milk tea was great, didn't taste watered down, and it was my first time actually liking something similar to Thai ice tea. The boba were pretty chewy and small. Overall, I guess we lucked out on well made drinks and stocked glass bottles. 

Now the takoyaki. Six amazing balls of goodness. It was actually crispy on the outside and soft and creamy on the inside. But wait there's more! Not one dinky piece of octopus was in it but TWO decently sized pieces of chewy octopus. If only it wasn't $5.25 for 6 pieces but one or two more. 

As usual your mileage may vary, but the bottles are cool and their drinks are creative, so it was worth a try.
author: Nancy H.

description: Super friendly and yummy milk teas. Allows for ice & sweetness adjustments which is always a plus.
author: Linda L.

description:
Really yummy, and no upcharge for almond milk!! I like the glass bottles and the atmosphere but the staff are meh. They prepare the matcha with a bamboo whisk, very yummy results. 

Becareful with the glass bottle, my friend had hers in her bag and dropped it from not so high up and the base totally gave out all over her things. But I still think it's a good thing!
author: Julia N.

description: I do really like this boba joint. Their tea is delicious, especially the Nutella one, and their regular boba tea as well. I tried taro recently, and I do love it. It's not super sweet, and surprise! It's not purple! The texture is good, it's milky and slightly rich and pure perfection. There's no weird little globs if taro pieces floating around, definitely my favorite place to order taro boba. Their little glasses are cute to drink out of (and you can bring it back for 15% off your next drink!). I do find that the actual tapioca pearls are slightly undercooked, too hard, not chewy enough. I'd probably just get tea next time and skip the boba pearls which would definitely diminish the experience of drinking boba from that cute jar.
author: Ke C.

description: This is probably not a fair review, since I've only had the unsweetened jasmine tea. Nothing didn't stand out, but friendly staff and cute presentation.
author: Kosmo Z.

description: Warning: If you frequent Plentea for their fruit teas, come no longer. They changed their recipe for the fruit teas, and now it's a smoothie. I ordered my usual mango green fruit tea, and instead of getting the usual tea with fruit chunks, I was given what is essentially a smoothie. Yes, they're correct in that it's not as thick, but it's a blended drink, and still looks and tastes like a smoothie, NOT tea.
author: Shirley H.

description:
So, the first time I went to Plentea, they didn't have the glass bottles... the only reason why you go and try Plentea for the first time is so that you can Instagram those glass bottles! So I left, and decided to try my luck again later, and they did have the bottles!

I got the Nutella milk tea w/ less milk and more tea because my friend who got it before said it just tasted like chocolate milk. My drink still tasted like chocolate milk, I could barely taste the tea! I wouldn't recommend this drink. My friend got the strawberry black tea, and she liked it, I had a sip and it was good. There were real strawberry bits in it! If I ever came back to Plentea again, which I probably won't, but if I did, I'd try a fruit tea! We both got boba, and maybe the boba was just bad that day, but I wasn't a fan. It tasted pretty bland to me. 

I also think it's pretty expensive for a cup of boba, but I guess you're technically paying for the bottle too. You can save 10%, I believe, if you bring the bottle back and reuse it. 

Worth the try to see if you find something you like and the cute photo, but not worth the price in my opinion.
author: Alesia C.

description:
I came here just to checkout the jar.. The place seemed fairly popular since there was a line and we had to wait about 15 minutes at 8:30 PM on a Sunday evening.
You have to pay CASH if your order is under $10.
I ordered the Sea Salt Creama Tea. The drink was mediocre at best. The tea was pretty blank in my opinion, and the creama was nothing special.
Only plus thing is you get to keep the JAR
author: Tung D.

description:
If you like cute and dainty milk tea jars, this place is it!

Located in Chinatown, the store is quite small but emanates a fresh and clean vibe with a color palette that consists of light woody browns, black chalkboards, and accents of green potted plants. A cozy place to chill if you can snag a seat from their limited seating selection. 

I ordered the roasted oolong milk tea without any toppings (which are an additional .50 cents each) and it came in a very cute milk jar. The caps for the jars are located right by the register, so make sure to grab one if you want to save your drink for later! The drink itself was good, but nothing to write home about. If you prefer a strong tea flavor, the roasted oolong milk tea is probably too mild. 

The service was quick and friendly! It only took about 5 minutes before my drink was ready. Granted, I was only there in the evening so I can't speak much for overall service time! 

If you're visiting the city, this is a great place to stop by for a drink as well as the milk jar souvenir!
author: Robin C.

description:
Delicious bubble tea with lots of options for flavors and toppings, changing up the level of sweetness, AND you get to keep the adorable milk bottle glass? I'm such a fan!

I got a brown sugar milk ice with bubbles and taro pudding, and it was wonderful. I really liked the variety and customization that Plentea offers, plus the fact that the girl at the register was friendly and patient with us. PLUS, check in on Yelp and you get a discount! Win-win-win. 

There are an insane number of bubble tea places in San Francisco, so I know that that decisions can be tough, but Plentea definitely does not disappoint.
author: Gretchen F.

description:
First timer here at Plentea and went with the matcha milk tea (no toppings) because it's one of their top drinks. 

Pros: 
1) Strong tea essence 
2) It smells so great and of .. strong .. tea 

Cons: 
1) Too sweet! I'm not sure if you can adjust the sweetness but I would definitely recommend to do so
2) Definitely on the $$$$$$ side of boba because of their glass bottles 

I had a couple swigs of my sister's peach green tea and I would rather get that if I was in the area again! 

Pros: 
1) Strong tea used
2) No overbearing sweetness 
3) Peach chunks were sweet and added a nice touch 

Cons: 
1) Pretty basic and easy to make at home (is that a con I would consider it more of a pro but you do you) 
   1a) Because it's so basic I probably wouldn't get this now that I think about it, but it is a refreshing and light drink!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Wifey's favorite place for boba milk tea. Boba is a must with her tea. Showed up right when they opened and was informed boba will not be ready for another 30 minutes.As a business, unacceptable.
author: Brian H.

description: If you're into something really sweet, I like the ice milk tea with caramel & egg pudding and boba.
author: Payal R.

description:
Love the way they serve their bubble tea ! 
In a glass container. 
Tastes good and light ~
author: Li S.

description:
Gee, if someone had told me that I'd be sucking a straw in a milk bottle at my advanced age, I would have brushed that remark aside as I was certain that would not happen in my lifetime. At least before I was put out to pasture at Shady Pines. But who knew this boba craze would take off with youthful Asians hanging out at all these bubble tea shops popping up everywhere. Some handle it well like Sharetea in the Metreon where they don't make you feel like an idiot for ordering a Coffee Ice Blended with chunks of coffee jelly that you have to suck up in a wide-mouth straw.

This place, however, appears to enjoy making you feel like an idiot by forcing you to drink their stuff in a milk bottle like it was a retro-hip version of the Juice Shop. Besides which, the selections are on the paltry side here. I had just finished a hearty meal at Hunan Homes and was looking for something to quench my thirst after dinner. I saw only one item with the boba and that was the $4.95 Ice Milk with Tapioca Pearls. Sure enough, it came in a milk bottle just like what you would see in a Doris Day movie where she locked herself out of the house with Rock Hudson nowhere to be found.

So here I was among the hip Asian youth of this city trying to look cool as I sucked hard to get every one of those pearls out of the damn milk bottle (photo: http://bit.ly/1DsWvsK). With heavy doses of brown sugar and caramel in it, it was mostly an oversweetened drink with chewable pellets. I felt like the beginning of an Amy Schumer joke. When I attempted to return the bottle back to the over-giggly cashier, she gave me small-mouth and 'tude about how I was supposed to keep it so I would come back and get it refilled. Refilled? I'll bring my own sippy cup, thank you very much.

BOBA - 2 stars...cold milk sweetened up to excess like I was seven or something
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...contemporary vibe with lots of suckers and presumably suckees
SERVICE - 2 stars...I don't want your bottle...seriously
TOTAL - 2 stars...Sharetea awaits
author: Ed U.

description:
I love how the milk tea comes in a glass bottle (and a secure lid for it, too!)
The taste is average, but the boba is decent.  It's not too hard or too soft. 

I ordered the Fruit Milk tea (honeydew) with boba.
author: Nina M.

description: I was in San Francisco for only 5 hours but my friend said we HAD to stop here. I had the Thai Ice Tea Bubble Tea and it was fantastic! I loved the glass is came in! The boba was cooked to perfection!
author: Ellen H.

description:
My go to is the ice milk with caramel and taro pudding as a topping inside. It really depends who makes it in order to get a really good one and depends if it's busy or not that day. 

The first time I tried it: only a few customers and a lot of caramel was put inside so it made the drink taste better and sweeter. 
I came again just recently: line was out the door, not enough workers to make the drinks, there were only like two people, and even the cashier had to help out with making the drinks. I got my drink, barely any caramel and taro pudding, I felt like I was just drinking whole milk... So disappointed because I was looking forward to drinking it that day as dessert. 

Brought my own bottle, so I did get 10% off of my purchase.
author: Vanessa L.

description: I visited Plentea for the first time Saturday afternoon and was very impressed with the quality of the milk tea.  The Nutella milk tea with boba was excellent and I loved the glass jar approach.  Customer service was friendly and efficient.  Highly recommend Plentea for boba!
author: Christina T.

description: Really great boba place. Whenever I go, it isn't crowded, which is nice! The flavors are really fresh and aren't overly sweet/artificial like some other boba places. I could give this place five stars on the mere fact that they don't charge extra for the glass bottles. I really like how they're into serving quality drinks while helping reduce their plastic waste! The bottle also makes a lovely souvenir for me to put my bamboo in. Super cute!
author: Dom B.

description:
I passed by Plentea last time I was in SF, but since I was trying Boba Guys, I passed on Plentea. However I've been thinking about this place since then, and finally got a chance to go back.

The store is very cute, with the wood decor wall on one side,and the chalkboard on the other side. Their signature bottle motif is continued throughout the store, including a fish in the middle bottle on the wall! There is a decent amount of seating for such a small store because you can go to the upstairs.

We ordered two drinks to take advantage of the 15% off deal on Yelp, but our total still came out to $9+, even without toppings. This is an incredibly steep price, but is justified by the glass bottles you get to keep. However, if you're not into that, I have no idea if there are plastic/cheaper alternatives. I definitely had some friends in our group who would've preferred going somewhere cheaper.

The first drink we tried was the Mango Milk Tea. It didn't taste very mango or really tea. I felt like it was just a very sweet milk tea with the slightest hint of mango at the end.

The other drink we tried was the Lavender Lemonade. This is carbonated in case you were hoping for the more classic drink. It was also very sweet, and I didn't actually taste much of the lemonade flavor. It was refreshing though.

Overall, the main draw of Plentea is definitely the cute bottles. However that translates into higher prices, which fail to be justified by the drinks themselves. These had a tendency to be on the sweeter side, and we're lacking in fruit flavors. 

If you do decide to come back, bring your bottle back and receive 10% off your order (no idea if it can be stacked with the yelp deal).
author: Helen W.

description:
Finally got the chance to try this place out. I was surprised to see that they are open so late! Sharetea, my usual place was closing soon so I decided to drive a little extra to try Plentea out.

Tried the mango slush (3/5) and oolong milk tea with pearls (3/5).

The tea taste is sort of non existent. Perhaps it was late in the night and the batch was bad. 

I liked how the mango slush wasn't too sweet.

I know people love their glass jars but I found them cumbersome. I wouldn't want to walk around with it, it's kind of heavy and awkward to hold. Cute, but probably not that fun to carry around.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Their drink options are plain, but their bottles are great--ecofriendly and satisfying to hold. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Rai K.

description:
Visiting SF, I was recommended Plentea for boba by Jason W. I went here with my girlfriend and I got the sweet taro milk while she got the ginger honey tea.

Drink: Sweet taro milk. 4/5. Not super sweet. As Jason W. mentioned previously, the drink has taro pulp in it so I commend Plentea for using fresh ingredients. The tapioca is decent (read: pretty chewy, solid, though not sweet) but doesn't compare to the bubbles from KungFu Tea, which is a plentiful (haha) chain on the East Coast. 
My girlfriend got the the ginger honey tea (3/5), which was severely lacking in honey. Though again, they threw in fresh ginger so that is noteworthy. 

The vibe and decor is hipster-Asian. Lots of open wall space and bar spots to sit around the venue. They're going heavy on the glass bottle theme here, decorating the place with numerous plants in these containers. Downstairs is more of a sit and chat area while upstairs has a cozy space where you can sit and do work with the free Wi-Fi.

The price is steep so I don't think I would come again to try more drinks but the complimentary glass bottle my drink came in makes it worthwhile as a one-time visit.
author: William M.

description: I really enjoyed my tea an the glass cup is awesome. I will definitely be going back.
author: Lauryn M.

description:
The drink was good but I was not happy at the sight of a cockroach next to me as I was sitting down. Even though the cockroach was not in the kitchen area it could end up there, and that is food contamination. I am in the food business too and I would not want a cockroach anywhere near the vicinity at all. 

This was my first experience too... The setting is nice and the design is very modern and chic but I don't know if I want to come back to find another cockroach...
author: Alison L.

description:
A friend and I decided to come on our lunch break & it was great!

There was no line, drinks were made fast, and it was perfect for a hot day downtown. I decided to try the matcha green tea and my friend got almond & both were delicious. Honestly, we were pumped just to get the cute glass jar it comes in lol - for $5 - I definitely think it's worth it! 

The jars only come with cold drinks & add-on's are 50 cents! I was a little disappointed they didn't have honey boba... but I quickly got over it once I started drinking lol 

Keep in mind they also have a card minimum of $10 - perfect if you go with a friend.

Will be back to try more of their drinks & some of their waffle sandwiches as well!
author: Carrie L.

description: I love this place soOOoo much!! They give you these cute glass bottles to reduce waste, and if you bring them back, you get a 10% discount. I don't know why people complain about slow service, but it's pretty fast. I'd say this place is much better than Boba Guys because you get FREE glass bottles (at Boba Guys, they're $12...), AND their boba is much better.
author: Juan Pablo C.

description: I was craving boba and decided to check this popular place out. It's a cute little place and it was crowded with people. I ordered an iced matcha latte and it came in their signature cute glass bottle. The cashier said that the glass bottle was included and that if I brought it back next time, I would get a 10% discount on my next purchase. That's pretty cool, but that also means I would need to remember to bring it back, which is difficult for those spontaneous trips up here to SF. So I might just use it as a vase. The matcha latte was pretty good, it had a nice flavor to it, but wasn't anything too special. The one thing I didn't like about this place is the $10 minimum to pay with credit card. So if you're planning just to get one drink for yourself, remember to bring cash. The name of pretty cute though.
author: Sylvia K.

description:
Honestly, just came here for the jar heehee. 
Small shop that sells tea in a jar!

Cute bottles, but the drinks are like any typical boba shop. Presentation is really nice and it's decently priced! They also have lids that actually fit snugged which is nice! Service is friendly.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Plentea has a lot of hype around it because of the glass bottles that you can take back for 10% off. However, I feel like their drinks really don't stand up to all of that hype. Honestly, the basic black milk tea is the only drink I like getting here. I've tried other things in the past, but they just don't taste very good. If you just want a generic black milk tea with boba, this is the place to go. If not, I would highly recommend checking out a different boba place in the area.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Excellent service, crazy prices compared to other bubble tea spots and in a very clean & inviting space
author: Kristina P.

description:
I think the best part about this shop are the cute glasses that they're served in. They are so adorable and make for a cute picture! Also, if you bring your glass back your next visit you get a discount. 

The flavors are really a hit or mjss though. My favorite was the green tea latte with boba. Really yummy!

The staff is nice here. A negative would have to be the amount of seating. It's really small but most people like to show off their glasses around the city anyway lol
author: Kristian G.

description:
What draws people into this place are their glass milk jugs...because thats how I got lured in. I'm a sucker for reusable shizz-nizz and you'll get a discount the next time you bring the bottle back. Save a little bit of moolah and save the earth a little by throwing less stuff away. Lightweight Win-Win.

First time I came in they were out of bottles, I was sad, but they gave me 10% off to compensate. I ordered the fresh fruit tea--mango black. $4.95 oh snaps! and that's just for a regular size. I know its SF but dang! Herra pricey. I could almost get 2 drinks at Tpumps for that price! They better be using the highest quality ingredients. If I'm paying $5 for some boba that stuff better be ORGAN-NIC! But anyways, the drink was good, refreshing and boba balls were on point. LOL. Mango bits on the other hand were hard tho...

I tried their hot pastrami waffle sammie with mixed greens on the side. Sandwich was good but needed more melted cheese. Salad needed some dressing tho. I gave it 2.5 out of 4 noms.

Came back on another day and yessuh, bottles were back in stock (best to come the first half of the day to ensure you'll get a bottle). I ordered the fresh fruit tea again--strawberry black. Under $6 with bottle, not bad not bad (I mean you get to keep the bottle). Again, drink was good, refreshing and boba balls were topnotch. 

Overall I give them 2.5 stars. Drinks are good, but not really worth the price...even with the 10% discount. Might as well buy the bottle everytime, it'll only be a dollar (plus change) extra... Drop the prices down a dollar and I'll be here all the time. This place will be a once in awhile boba shop for me.
author: Vicky L.

description: I visit San Fran at least 4 times a year, and every time I have to make a stop at Plentea. Maybe it's their great prices, or delicious boba tea, or most likely their take home bottles! I love their beverages, and the ordering process is very simple and easy. It can get super crowded, to the point where the line is outside the door. Worth the wait? Yes.
author: Serena L.

description:
So I've been wanting to try this place out since I heard about it from my friend who works in the city. Since I was going to be in the city for a brief moment and it was a 5-7 minute walk away from the Montgomery BART Station, I figured, why not come a little early and grab a drink before my 11:45am meeting.

Well they open at 11am which was perfect. They're located north of Muracci's Japanese Curry which getting full as I passed by on Kearny. It's a small little spot though looks are deceiving. There seemed to be a second floor where you could hang out, though the downside is that they don't have a public restroom and downing a large drink...you're going to need a restroom as I needed it after my 1.5 hour meeting...I know TMI. 

The drink menu is over the kitchen/register area and they have a range of drinks from teas, milks, teas with fruit pieces etc. The drinks range but expect to spend about $5-ish dollars esp if you're going to be adding some toppings like honey boba, pudding, lychee jelly, etc which are $0.50 each. There are some hot drinks though I don't think they put those in the glass bottle, which gets me to their "thing." They put your drinks in a glass bottle which you can of course take home and thus the premium though I feel that it's a worthy price considering a lot of boba places charge around the same price and you don't get a bottle to take home with you. Another plus is that you can bring the bottle back and get 10% off your next order. Either way you're getting a snazzy little bottle which I am now using as a water vessel.

They also have food on a chalkboard menu on the wall. It looked like they had waffles as the bread and some fillings. I wasn't really focused on it, I was there for the drink.

So I ordered a Premium Mountain Green Tea (which you can get oolong and black too which I was a bit confused about...) with honey boba and got 20% sweetness. To be honest it wasn't sweet so glad I got at least 25%. The honey boba had a good chew but there was no honey taste. So I've had honey boba at Half & Half in SoCal and that is honey boba. You get the taste of the honey which I actually don't like too much, but it does give it a bit of sweetness. 

Was the tea mindblowing? No. For me, the boba was fine they did okay with it. To me it's like your typical boba place but you get a nice little glass bottle takeaway. Would I come back? I'm curious about the milks and the creamas so I'll be back to try them at least. Also note, there's a credit card charge for any charge under $10.
author: Carolen M.

description:
They use some of the best tea leaves for boba, and of course, they give you fancy glass bottles you can reuse for potting plants, mini aquariums, etc.

Tip: they recently changed their restaurant look and menus. While they don't have food listed on the menu anymore - definitely ask about the takoyaki, it's worth the $5 to accompany the boba.
author: Andy Q.

description: Foodie checking in! We were in the city and the buzz is out there about Plentea so we had to make a pit stop before leaving! Thoroughly enjoyed the drinks. Tea was seeped perfectly and it wasn't too sweet. I can't comment on the boba because I didn't order it but what I can say is that this place is a must visit. They serve the teas in milk bottles that can be reused with 10% discount on your next visit. Loved the tea so much I ordered an extra drink to go! Foodie checking out!
author: Sandara J.

description:
Eh... Only thing bout this place is the super cute decor and look of the place, plus they serve your drink in a jar. That's about it. The drinks have nothing special about it... They also take forrrrreverrrrrrrr making your drinks. Literally waited 20 minutes for my drinks (2). 

Only reason I came to this place was because I was in area and searched up milk tea. Although this place has 3 1/2 stars, I still came because... the jars... hehe.
author: Donna H.

description:
I stopped by here on a recent visit to SF to grab some late dessert. We decided on the strawberry waffle - the good: not as sweet as I expected which can be a bad thing for some people but I thought it was okay. Also it was a decent combo between crunchy and soft. The bad: the waffle tasted pretty flat without the fluffiness of the batter. 

The were also out of matcha AND out of green tea when we went around 9pm. 

It's good that they are opened pretty late though it'd be nice to come back during the afternoon so that I can try their teas before they all start running out!
author: Evie H.

description: Awesome boba tea place!! The glass bottles are an awesome concept! They're open pretty late too so it's great for an after dinner drink :)
author: Camille W.

description: I can't understand how this doesn't have 5 stars... it's a beautiful tea house with exceptional tea & smoothies. It's also really classy that the to-go bottles are glass!
author: JR V.

description:
The bottles and interior are gorgeous! The wait was decent, as it does get a little crowded if everyone just sits and waits there, but they do have a upstairs section, which is really cool. The employees were really nice. The drinks were okay, I've tasted better, but it was a nice first time try here. Parking is really hard to find, since a lot of the meters are tow-away during certain hours. So you can either park at the parking lot, or find parking farther away and walk your distance here. I didn't like the sea salt creama oolong Milk Tea as much, the creama just didn't fit to my taste at all. I got it because it was a specialty drink, and it was pretty unique, since not many boba places have that drink. But other than the drink, everything else was pretty cool.

Recommendation(s):
None yet 

Visit Again: Willing to give it one more try
Recommend to Others: Maybe after my second try at this place
author: Annie Y.

description:
After a full day of walking around the cold, windy city (not Chicago, lol), I still went out of my way to try plentea. I didn't know what to expect from it, nor did I even know about the glass bottles. So we joined the long line extended out the door to see what plentea had to offer!!

I ordered the strawberry green tea w/strawberry bits. Tasted kinda like the Dasani flavored strawberry water, you know.. A watered down, super diluted flavored water.  Not worth $5 imo, not even for the souvenir bottle, and especially not in that long line.

Next time I'm in the area, I'll try other boba places.
author: Michelle N.

description: Nice place! Love the bottle they give you with the drink! The salt caramel ice coffee is great.
author: Wen W.

description:
I had imagined extremely sweet drinks but was pleased that it was not. The $4.85 price tag (tapioca balls, chia seeds, aloe etc are extra) wasn't bad considering you get a glass container whereas in another Boba place that shall remain nameless will tack on $12 if you want their glass mason jar. 

The ice milk with caramel was pretty good (again, not too sweet) and it came slushed.  They had a Nutella one that I was thinking of getting but I initially thought it might be overly sweet so I went with the ice milk. 

Not sure I'll be lugging around the glass container to get the 10% off but good to know they encourage recycling of containers.
author: Esther A.

description:
If you hate actual tea and love chocolate I highly recommend you come here! I ordered a black milk tea with tapioca and when I received my order I literally thought that I accidentally ordered chocolate milk... I mean if you want some overly sweet/chocolatey milk with some fresh tapioca taste then this place is perfect!!! You know, aside from the fact that they also abuse their beta fish... (there was a tank at the counter as well as one on display on the wall and both were extremely dirty.)

While this place is trendy and cute in terms of decor and the glass bottles, I won't be coming back because of the chocolate-y milk tea and fish abuse :(
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
Love this place! I was randomly on a trip San Francisco with friends and stopped by this cute place for a quick treat. 
I was immediately interested in what Plentea had to offer simply by reading the Yelp reviews and seeing the pictures, so obviously I had to make my fantasies a reality and try it. 
I regret nothing! I ordered the specialty brown sugar bubble tea with the creamiest, soft, and pudding. My friends got a different specialty pudding drink as well (can't remember which one) and a chocolate mousse dessert. His pudding drink was refreshing as well and the mousse was a decadently sinful delight. 
If I ever go back to San Francisco I will return to Plentea! I have no complaints. They also happily gave me a free sample of the pudding when I asked to try a bit to make sure I liked it, and the drinks were a unique yet fresh spin on traditional bubble tea.
author: Ariel T.

description:
The main draw of Plentea is that you get the quart-sized glass bottle they serve the drinks in.  For $5, I suppose that's kind of a good deal.  Also, eco friendly.

The tea itself is more on the tea/bitterness side than milk/sweet, so personal preference rules here.  The bubbles are rather small and not as chewy as others I've had.  So ultimately, the drink is alright.

Don't forget to check in on Yelp and get a 15% off coupon!  That was quite the pleasant surprise.
author: Emily Y.

description:
I'm not so into milk tea as sometimes it does a number on my stomach, so I usually go for the fruitier drinks plus tapioca.  I was happy to see Plentea had a honey apple tea option with tapioca.  I went for that, and it was so refreshing.  They give you your drink in these adorable glass bottles.  You can bring it back for a 10% discount next time.  The only thing is, the bottles are a bit heavy so I think its weight actually discourages people from bringing back the bottles. I'm an environmentalist, can you tell?  :)  Customers probably keep coming back without bringing their bottles for re-use and have a pile of heavy bottles at their work desk or at home as a result.  Could Plentea consider re-designing their bottles so that they are durable yet light enough to encourage people to bring them back for multiple uses?  Thank you.

They also serve waffle sandwiches and HUGE salads. I want to try one of their sandwiches next time!
author: Maile N.

description:
I really like the milk teas here, it's a little on the pricey side but it's never a bad option. I think the fruit teas are a bit too watery but my favorite is the lavander lemonade and my favorite milk tea is the coffee milk tea. 
The reuseable cups are kind of nice but I feel like I never bring them back for the 10% discount and they're hard to clean so they're bad as household cups. But aesthetic 10/10
author: Richard X.

description: Aside from the interesting bottles that Plentea drinks come in, their milk tea quality was a bit lacking. On my most recent visit, I ordered their house blend black milk tea, and it had a rather strange strong burnt aftertaste. Not sure what it was, maybe the tea was a bit over roasted or something.
author: Alvin W.

description: I will admit I was most excited about the glass cups, and unfortunately, that's the only thing that's good about this place. I tried the classic milk black tea with boba, and the milk tea tasted terrible. I think there was way too much creamer in it. And I did not care for the quality of the boba. After taking a few sips, I had to pour my drink down the drain. :( At least I have a nice glass out of it. :)
author: Rachel H.

description:
I love trying out different bubble tea spots outside of NYC so of course I had to come here. My little sis brought me there b/c the tea comes in a cute glass bottle. There are also plastic lids for the jar but be careful, it's not very tight. So if you plan to put the jar into your bag, make sure it stays up right. 

I had the mango green tea with lychee jelly. Pretty good but definitely hard to get the jelly out of the bottom. It's a cute novelty spot and I brought the jar with me back to NY to have as a keepsake :) Keep in mind, it's about $5 for a jar of bubble tea so not cheap in any way but I guess the jar is worth the extra $1.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Aight, here's the run down.

Truthfully, I was more excited to keep the glass bottles than anything else. lol In terms of the drinks in itself, I got the avocado drink with boba and it wasn't too shabby. Not the best I've ever had, but still good and refreshing. I like the variety they offer and the decor of the place was pretty nice. No public rest room though - boo, and parking is hella difficult to find. But did I mention that you get to keep the glass bottles?
author: Quang H.

description:
Plentea is a must-go place for milk tea and chilling.

The good: The japanese food there such as unagi and takoyaki are a MUST TRY, especially for avid food adventurees and people who want to explore other cultures. Also, their drinks seem pretty natural and healthy tasting, plus their glass bottles can be taken home and kept (Which is way better for the environment than plastic cups).

The bad: Their milk teas aren't too sweet for people who are used to milk tea places that have sweetness adjusting levels (Ex. Cool Tea Bar or Pekoe).

The ugly: The decor, from when I went into the place, was still under construction and was littered with cardboard boxes. They took up much space and was a distraction of enjoying the decor.

Overall, it was a great stop just to hang and chill after an exhausting day in SF. I recommend the place, thus giving the rating it deserves.
author: Michael L.

description:
+ Drank: Taro Milk Tea with Taro Pudding. Their drinks, alone, are 5 stars.

+ Free WiFi: Check the wall (to your right) when you walk in. Password was written on there somewhere.

+ Space: The seating is very limited. There are a couple tables on the main floor & upstairs, there are 3-4 bigger tables with ottomans. Got lucky & found a table upstairs, where I was able to work on my laptop for an hour. 

+ No bathrooms :/

+ Employees: On the few occasions I've visited here, they've been kind & service was pleasant. There was one time I walked in 15min before closing time on a Friday night- dey waz STILL all smileyz. That is pretty rare.

+ Wait Time: 6-7 minutes.

+ Glass Jar ("bottle"): You get to keep the glass jar your boba tea is served in. They look pretty sweet. Along the left side of the cashwrap counter, they had (not sure if it's still there) a few jars that were made into DIY mini-terrarium/zen garden-looking display decorations. I thought that was pretty creative. Might have to try that with mine sometime. 

+ Location: Located on the left side of Kearny Street (one-way street w/ a few lanes). 

+ Parking: It's a busy area but there usually is a few street parking spots available on Kearny. (the times i've visited are between 8pm-10:45pm)
author: Yayrim K.

description:
Worth it for the glass milk bottle alone.

Oh, tea is great too! ;)
author: Olivia H.

description: Smoothie was way too sweet. Limited fruit options. A lot of ice was used with very little fruit. The glass bottle is a nice touch, but a bit heavy.
author: Sarah L.

description: I came here with a friend and I had a sweet taro milk with boba while my friend had the lavender lemonade. I liked their sweet taro milk better than Sharetea's housemate taro with fresh milk because the taro was well blended with the milk! The service was nice the guy even showed me the big bucket of taro when I asked them to see the taro haha!
author: Grace Z.

description:
I really wanted to like this place because of their hipster glass jars.

I came here twice. The first time was decent. The girl who helped me was sweet. She suggested brown sugar ice milk tea and I remember enjoying it. I wouldn't bother with the food. I had the salmon waffle sandwich and it was whatever. I only got it cause I was hungry, but I could have definitely done without it.

Second time, I got the sea salt creama oolong tea. I'm usually easily satisfied with most boba drinks. I always finish my drinks... but I couldn't even bring myself to finish half of it. It just tasted blech. My boyfriend got an upset stomach from his drink and was not feeling so great for the rest of the night. Not only that, all of my friends and I agreed that we felt extremely parched after drinking their tea. Service was whatever. The guys who work there could maybe smile once in awhile.

Both times, I did not get a glass jar because they ran out. Also, what happened to the discounted price when you don't get a glass jar? $5 for a crappy drink and whatever service?

I don't think I'll be back.
author: Lincy H.

description:
Love this place! Everything is on point from the workers to the tea to the ambiance. 

Who hasn't seen the super cute plentea glass bottles? I had to see if this place lived up to the hype. I ordered the matcha latte with boba and it was pretty good. I prefer boba guys, but it was still a very very good matcha. 

This location is multileveled with an upstairs lounge area. I love the the upstairs, perfect place to relax and enjoy tea. 

Fast service+charming guy working register=
author: Valerie C.

description: Interesting concept with the glass jars for cups! I won't lie I have an army of these cups at my house now! It just reminds me I need my daily boba intake and to grab a glass on my way back! I was told that you get a discount bringing your glass back but I haven't tried yet. I like my drinks a little more on the sweet side. I didn't learn until my 3rd trip that they can put more than regular amounts of sugar and it definitely made the drink better just not my heart rate ! I will definitely me coming back with my glass
author: Gen T.

description:
Just when I thought SF couldn't get any more hipster... even the boba drinks are in glass milk bottles now! You can always opt for a plastic cup instead or return the bottle, but if I'm paying $5 for a drink, I'm keeping the cute bottle! It's actually a really cute place and event has a cool  upstairs loft area considering how small the place is. The first time I went, I just got the jasmine milk tea which was really good. You can totally taste the jasmine which i love. The second time I went, I got the honeydew milk tea. Before taking a sip, I thought it was kind of a weird combination, but it actually works. The honeydew wasn't overpowering and it didn't taste like a fake syrup. The teas tasted very natural, and now powdery. 

Overall, this place has good drinks. Kind of pricey though and I don't know if it's because of the glass bottles...

Protip: bring the bottle back for 10% off your next purchase!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Known for their signature glass bottles and teas, your girl had to stop by especially when it was close in proximity to Sushiritto!

It being my first time, I let the cashier know and asked her recommendations. She offered a milk tea and a flavored tea. I got a regular milk tea with pearls and a White Peach Green Tea. The drinks were aesthetically pleasing in their glass jars that come with a lid if you choose to take it with you to have for later. I didn't find anything particularly special with the milk tea, but loved the White Peach tea; it had finely chopped pieces of peach, well brewed tea and the boba was pretty good here. My drink was refreshing, had natural peach flavor and no bitterness from the tea.

The shop itself is an Instagrammer's dream, v aesthetic, I mean just look at the glass jars ... if that doesn't make boba lovers and hipsters head over heels- I don't know what will.  Prices are also not that bad considering you get to keep the glass bottle. The service was a bit slow, they were currently cooking the boba pearls and there was already a line out the door.

Definitely would come back when in the Chinatown area and definitely try their other flavored teas.
author: Janet N.

description: Cozy and clean. I don't know why but I feel so comfortable. Drink tastes flawless.Cozy and clean. I don't know why but I feel so comfortable. Drink tastes flawless.Cozy and clean. I don't know why but I feel so comfortable. Drink tastes flawless.Cozy and clean. I don't know why but I feel so comfortable. Drink tastes flawless.
author: Changmin L.

description:
STORE: It's cute! There are some good seatings for 2-3 people and made waiting a bit easier. It's more spacious than the other boba places. I would choose here if you would like a bit more time to kill while having boba. 

DRINKS: I tried. I have tried their milk teas, fruit teas, and cremas. Nothing was absolutely amazing to me that I can remember in being my go-to. There's a decent selection.
Really, I think having the glass bottle is just a cool take-away. For me, I always lose it and end up giving it away, which means money lost for me.
author: Casie C.

description: The best milk tea in SF hands down. You can taste the freshness of the ingredients. Real milk with real tea and the perfect level of sweetness. The macha milk tea was even made with real matcha! Incredibly friendly and patient staff and owner that took the time to help me chose a drink. Would definitely be coming back
author: Justin H.

description: It's good, nothing special. I would have liked a little more chocolate sauce. Ordered the Nutella milk tea with boba and egg pudding. Didn't taste like Nutella. Egg pudding had no flavor. Boba was fresh. Staff was friendly, helpful, fast and hard working! Comes in a cute glass jar. :)
author: Shanette F.

description:
I came here around 3pm on Friday with a couple of friends. I waited around 20 minutes until I made it to the front of the line. My drink, Black Tea with Boba, came out very quickly. I did like the quick service and how the interior of Plentea looked. However, my drink was just not good for a basic milk tea. The printer also didn't print my friend's ticket, so she didn't get her drink until she pressed the guys behind the counter about it. 

By all means come here if you want a glass bottle (I'm using it), but it's nothing crazy in terms of milk tea.
author: James H.

description:
In hindsight, I was mesmerized by the glass bottle all of their drinks come coddled in. Wait, not every drink tastes better in a glass container? Doesn't water taste better in a glass mason jar? No? Oh, that must be the earthy minerals we get in our tap water then. Duh.

I came on a late Thursday evening after dining at a nearby restaurant and there was surprisingly no line whatsoever, reinforced by the cashier muttering how fortunate I was. He was lucky there was no line or I'd have to drop my rating another 1/2 star. I ordered the Strawberry Green Tea and also sampled the Peach Black Tea. Neither were memorable and even though I asked for 50% sugar it was too sweet, and watered down for my taste. This is the classic Vietnamese style tea concoction that does not emphasize the tea flavor(as opposed to taiwanese based tea shops).

10% discount when you bring back your glass bottle on your next visit. Oh wait, I might just save the bottle to enhance my tap water at home.
author: Dennis W.

description: Drink options are pretty cool. But nothing out of this world. I personally think this place is overhyped and the drinks are expensive the only cool thing would be the container the drinks come in but the drinks are nothing out of this world. The drinks are good but for the price I wouldn't come back. You could go to another boba shop and find the same thing for a bigger size.
author: Kassandra M.

description: I ordered an Oolong almond milk tea with taro pudding. It was delicious! The oolong and almond made a surprising fruit like flavor that I really enjoyed.  Sister had the Nutella milk tea, which we both agreed tasted like chocolate milk.  We hoped for a more hazelnut flavor.  Line went out the door but the drinks came out pretty quick.
author: Janice G.

description:
SWEET LIQUIDS

Came here over the weekend and the place was dead. That's a good thing because (as I've heard) its ridiculous during the week. There was a good selection to choose from, I was overwhelmed and looked on yelp for assistance (read some tips). The menu looked typical for the most part - then the "pudding" caught my eye. Who doesn't want to try boba with flavored pudding?! 

CARAMEL ICED MILK WITH TARO PUDDING - the drink was served in a glass jar. The caramel iced milk tasted like boba but instead of those fruity flavors it was a milky caramel flavor. There were two options for the pudding, I chose taro because it sounded more interesting to pair with the caramel iced milk. I was not disappointed of my pickings and it definitely satisfied the sweet tooth. It is a bit strange to be sucking purple pudding through a big boba straw. Imagine a big blob of pudding at the bottom of your cup and the straw just sucking away at it.
