The soft silky blobby texture of pudding was different than the tapioca balls and jellies that are usually served - my palette was not bored.

Will I be back? Maybe. If ever I am in the area.

Until the next review.
author: Jane A.

description: It's probably good I don't live/work in SF because they would know my boba addicted self by now.. Lol. Fresh, high quality ingredients. Decor inside is cozy, modern, & the upstairs hang out area is a nice spot to chill in. Hate that they don't have a public restroom though.. Esp if you're loading your bladder with delicious infused tea. Lol. Yes it's a luxury item, but man oh man when you treat yo self-- this place sure does treat ya tastebuds right! I'm loving their salted caramel & fresh blueberry smoothies. My friends & I have even tried their regular milk tea & matcha milk teas. All good. I've had better matcha, but overall this place is great! Of course I'd come back. Haven't had the chance to try their food, but maybe soon. Save your glass bottles & save $ if you come back!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Came here after a lunch at Sushirrito on a Friday at ~1:45 PM.

This place was pretty crowded. As in the line was kind of long, but did not take long at all. Most people also just grabbed their boba and left, meaning there was a good amount of seating, especially up stairs.

I ended up getting the coffee milk tea, my friend got the matcha milk tea. Honestly, it was okay. I am not sure why there are so many people going here.

Not much to really say besides there are better places to get boba in SF. Sorry Plentea, not a fan at all. Not BAD, but not GOOD either.
author: Akash P.

description:
**Boba Princess Approval PENDING**

QUICK TIPS:
+ Card allowed for $10+ orders
+ Cute jars comes with drinks!
+ 10% discount every time you bring your Plentea jar back
+ NO Restrooms for customers! x_x
+ Food/dessert menu available (sandwiches, salad, waffles, cakes)

:( I am typing this as I am sipping my Sea Salt Cream Oolong Tea...NOT! They messed up my order, so I am drinking an Oolong Milk Tea sadly. I asked the nice, female cashier if this was my Oolong drink order and she said it was right. I even held up the receipt that said "Sea Salt Cream Oolong Tea" and she still said it was right. I thought, "Wow they must already shake up the sea salt cream and tea for their customers beforehand." o___o

Now perusing through Yelp, I AM SO MISTAKEN! How can they cheat me out of my drink, such injustice! So DOUBLE TRIPLE check your drinks before you leave. Don't be shy and ask! There is a huge difference between a Sea Salt Cream Oolong and a regular Oolong Milk Tea. Sad Face :(

What's there to say? Come for the cute-tastic jars of course! There is no Rewards System because they give you the glass jars and returning with the jar gives you 10%, pretty sweet deal if you frequent Plentea often. Cash/card accepted. There's also a limited menu of food items (sandwiches and waffles) as well, and although the drinks are slightly pricier, I don't mind the glass jars for my drinkware collection. 

Overall, the teas are authentic and pretty decent. My mistaken Oolong Milk Tea was pretty tasty but it wasn't what I wanted. 50% Sweet was sufficient; 75% Sweetness is probably my max (25% - 100% Sweetness level offered). The boba honey pearls were extremely chewy and saturated in the middle. I probably got the bottom of the bucket of an old batch, blergh. I don't mind giving them a try again but my distasteful experience only merits a generous 3 Stars.
author: Donna T.

description:
Confirmed: the hype is more because of the glass bottles than the actual boba.

I ordered the ice milk with caramel and my boyfriend got the milk tea flavor. Both were chilled to a perfection. The ice milk was sweet but overly frothy. The milk tea was simple - very classic. Their boba was chewy, no complaints there. The drinks weren't astonishingly amazing, but who knows? It felt like I paid $5 for three gulps... Even with the Yelp check-in discount, two drinks brought the bill above $10. 

There's a few tables and seats downstairs but it looks like upstairs is for those hoping to either study or lounge around. The place is very cutesy from the decor to the glass bottles to how "cute" that they think this size isn't a rip-off.
author: Celestine A.

description: I accidentally dropped my glass & spilled the whole glass of milk tea on floor.  The employees quickly cleaned the floor & made me another one for free!  Also, the glass bottle didn't break.  Five star service & drinks.
author: Yilei S.

description:
Ordered the Black Milk tea with boba. Tasted pretty disgusting, did not like at all. I even asked the cashier to recommend what drink was good and/or popular and she listed the Black milk tea as one of the best. 

The only positive was the cool drinking bottle and upstairs seating.
author: Mickey B.

description: My favorite thing about this place is that you get to keep the glass bottles. I already lost my plastic cap, but that just means I have to make a second trip. I went with a classic milk tea just to get a feel for the place, and it was so delicious! I live on the east coast, so unfortunately I won't get a chance any time soon to visit Plentea again, but a girl can still dream.
author: Lisa L.

description: It's a bit on the expensive side but you do get a nice glass jar! I like the aesthetic of the shop and the boba has good flavor and just the right consistency. I really liked the iced milk drink, which was a perfect blend of sweetness and creaminess. The mango green tea was refreshing and had small mango pieces in it! and it had a good balance of fruit and tea flavor. Parking can be hard to find because it's street parking and downtown.
author: Sara C.

description:
Stopped by at 10:50pm right as it was about to close and there were still tons of people in here! My friend told me to stop by cause - glass jars come on. Your first check in you get 15% off your entire order. You can find street parking pretty easily (or at least at 10:50pm). 

We ended up trying the:
+ Thai Milk Tea with boba: Their boba is SO good! It's the perfect size and so chewy. They also put in the perfect amount - it's not like you're overly saturated with boba like some other places.. Totally would recommend this. 
+ Peach Oolong Tea: Not bad! The fruit bits inside were a bit sour for my taste but still tasty nontheless. 

I would definitely come by again if I'm in the area. Not sure if I would ever remember to bring the bottle back for the 10% off. I suppose it's time to start a collection of bottles.
author: Rita Y.

description:
As someone described to me, Plentea is for hipsters.  Definitely a pricey option as compared to many other  Tea shops. But for the price, you do get a great reuseable glass container with a cap so think of it as paying forward from a "green" perspective.
The teas are tasty, visually appealing. The menu is different than most places and in a good way. There are interesting options such as Taro, various fruit flavors, etc..,
I enjoyed the Teas and I think you will as well.
author: David H.

description:
Nice atmosphere. I love Milk Teas, but I must say this place's milk tea is not very good. Tastes watered down and has a funky aftertaste.  I like the bottles they give honestly. I would go somewhere else for better flavored milk tea. But I like the Taro Milk with Taro pudding here cause they use fresh taro. Kind of too sweet, but tasty. Parking is hard, but there's a lot around the block.
I still have to try their regular iced tea drinks.
author: Edgar F.

description:
2 stars for the cute glass bottle/jar design! 0 star for drink quality. 

I admit that I was charmed by the glass bottle, but... that's all there is. The boba quality was poor and the menu is limited. I ordered the Sea Salt Oolong Crema and all I had to say was "meh." I usually love all sea salt related drinks esp the ones from 85 degrees, but this one was just so different - not only it had a weird bitter taste to it but also it was lukewarm. 

The service was really, really slow and disorganized... I waited for a good 30+ mins for two drinks which is ridiculous. 
 
Overall: $6 for a mediocre drink and a glass bottle??? NO THANKS! 

Might as well go to Daiso and got a glass bottle for $1 lol
author: Jing G.

description:
Plentea takes one of my favorite things, boba tea, and puts it in a cute glass jar. Love it! 

The menu was a little bit confusing to me: you can customize the amount of sweetness on some drinks, but not others. 

I ordered the Nutella milk tea and was worried it would be too sweet, but the sweetness wasn't too over the top.  

Approximately $6/drink after you add in a topping, such as boba.
author: Marcia L.

description:
I don't really get why this place is so busy all the time. I stopped by during my lunch hour to grab a tea. Probably waited about 30 mins before I finally got my order.

*Premium mountain tea: black ($4.25), add Tapioca (+$0.50) & Grass jelly (+$0.50)
I asked for 25% sugar as I don't like my tea too sweet. This was perfect! The balls had a nice chew but still managed to stay soft. The grass jelly was nice and silky.

You can bring your bottle back for 10% off. In my attempt to wash the bottle, I broke it, so be careful. I was using hot water to rinse it out and the entire bottom just broke off. So much for 10% off during my next visit.

The tea is good here and I liked the tapioca and grass jelly, but I don't think it's worth a 30 min wait. (Why it takes so long for the line to move is beyond me!) I think I'll wait till the hype dies down before coming back.
author: Elena N.

description:
Tea was just ok for us. Wish the boba was sweetened with honey, softer and chewier. They were so hard.
Cool that my peach green tea came with real peach chunks but the drinks are pretty pricey and the tea flavor was lacking.
author: Liz N.

description: I had roasted oolong milk tea.  Tasted good, not too sweet.  It came in a glass bottle.  Pretty cool, but heavy to walk around with it.  You get 10% off next time you bring the bottle back.
author: Stella S.

description: Their tea is incredible! Highly recommend their fruit teas that have real fruit pieces in it, overall a great tea place for real tea people
author: Katie W.

description:
so after consuming the delicious curry lunch from Muracci's Japanese Curry & Grill a few shops down the street, I noticed that Plentea was right there before me so I could totally quench my milk tea thirst for the day. 

the shop is located on Kearny Street. u can't miss it. the name of the shop is huge above the front door. the exterior has an urban rustic look with slabs of wood on the front n there's a large window which lets in light from the street. the interior is small with 3 small side tables while the second floor (at least there's a second floor.) has more a few more seats. 

one thing which I thought was kinda strange was that the restroom in the shop is only allowed for their employees to use. i mean the main thing u r selling is liquids n being filled up n having no place to relieve yourself doesn't make sense at all. they should at least let paying customers use it right?? 

on to their milk teas. they have a menu with pictures of each flavor of teas n also a small blackboard with the most popular ones written down. that's pretty helpful. I liked how each of their teas come in a cute glass bottle to take home n it's reasonably priced. (looks like an old style milk bottle.) if u come back with the empty bottle for them to refill the next time, it's 10% off. 

I ordered an Almond Milk Tea with 50% sweetened. it was WAY too sweet (he didn't even want another sip of it.) n I really couldn't taste the tea flavor in it either. there should b a balance between the tea n other additional flavors n not just an over abundance of the latter. however, I'm interested in trying their other crema drinks so I'm willing to give Plentea another shot. I just hope I remember to bring my empty "milk bottle" next time I go to SF. (most likely not.)
author: Julie W.

description:
I came here just because I wanted one of their cool glass bottles.

I came here around 4PM/5PM on a Saturday scared that they would run out of the bottles because apparently they only limit to giving out 300 a day now.

The line was out the dooooor...! But the wait surprisingly wasn't too long which impressed me. I ordered the Honeydew black fruit tea with glass jelly. It was almost $6 o__o so crazy...! But I guess you can save a bit if you reuse the bottle since you'll get 10% off your next order, but still - relatively expensive.

As for the drink itself - I wouldn't come all the way out near Chinatown to get this... It's pretty inconvenient to get here unless you live near by. But the taste wasn't too bad - very tea like (which I prefer). I liked how they put chunks of honeydew in my drink so it's legit and not just syrup!

There's not a lot of room in this place so if you're looking for a place to chill, come here early or plan accordingly after getting your boba fix.

04/22/15 - I got the Fresh Fruit Milk Tea Avocado and it's very milky. I like not don't like how the avocado taste isn't strong. But if you're looking for a creamy drink, this might be the one for you!

I also forgot, $10 minimum charge w/ credit cards... So bring cash!
author: Nicole C.

description:
Heard a lot of hype about this place so finally decided to check it out!

They serve specialty boba in these glass milk jars. I got a almond milk boba with no toppings. It was okay, not terrible though I did taste and feel bits of chunks in my drink, not sure if it was just the syrups and powders. 

It's a cool place to check out but I would prefer boba guys over plentea if you're really after some authentic boba. This place puts a creative twist on the popular drink.

Give it a try if you're around!
author: Brian L.

description:
I've always seen loads of pictures of bottles of boba drinks on any form of social media and I wondered whether I'd ever see what Plentea was all about. Finally I had the opportunity to try the place out!

I'm giving it 3.5, but they don't do half stars so I guess 4 will do in this case.

Pros:
- Very simple interior, with two floors available for those who would like to stay in and hang out after getting their drinks.
- The jars that your drinks come in are free for you to take home, with an additional discount whenever you bring it back here.
- Their menu is simple, with milk tea, tea, special drinks, and snacks, like waffle sandwiches.
- They take card and cash.
- They provide caps for your bottles, so you are free to take it to-go.

Cons:
- Location is near a busy area, so looking for parking is like being in a scavenger hunt.
- Pretty pricey for one drink.
- Although it's discounted if you bring back your bottle, it's basically like paying for a drink at other places. 
- There's a minimum fee if you're using card.
- Despite being two floors, the place is pretty small and the line can get pretty long, so prepare to wait outside for a bit. 

Overall a decent boba place with a cute concept in putting drinks in bottles. It's O-K in my book, but it'll be a while before I return to this place.
author: Jerianne G.

description: Their tea actually had pieces of real fruit in it. They came in neat little glass bottles that you could take home with you. I would recommend making a drop by for a quick refreshing drink and a free bottle if you're into that.
author: J K.

description:
service was gr9, drinks were bleh

I came here with 4 friends and we all swapped/tasted drinks (I know-beware of mono) but they still all tasted so blannndd. crie.

we tried matcha latte (cold), sweet taro milk, coffee milk tea (cold), and a strawberry fresh fruit tea (best out of allllladem). matcha latte tasted like straight up milk with green dye. sweet taro milk wasn't toooo shabby, it had [REAL] taro bits that my friends did not like (I enjoyed the bits bc my love for taro has never relinquished), but other than that, sweet taro tasted like sweet milk. coffee was p good I guess, more mediocre tho. iono nothing special, just think of milk coffee. strawberry fresh fruit was aight but it was the best drink voted by all my friends there. the drink was kinda watery, it's very lite on sweetness but maybe bc I have a big sweet tooth. they put in fresh strawberry bits which was a nice touch. overall nothing to get crazy about. the bottles are glass and reusable I believe. you can grab a plastic cap on your way out to save the rest of your drink.

the store is super hip and cute tho. I guess you could come here for the IG pic and what not but I don't recommend plentea for da dranks. sowey
author: Grace N.

description:
Want to know how to win girls over? 

Bring them one of these glass bottles.

I kid you not.

It all started when I started collecting these bottles at my desk since I'm addicted to their "Creme Oolong Tea," and was either too lazy or too forgetful to carry my old bottles back.

I had about 6 bottles lined up, like bowling pins on my desk, when my co-worker looked at it and said, "oh that bottle is so cute, where did you get it?"

"Plentea down the street," I said, lining up my bottles in a V-shape. All I was missing was a miniature bowling ball.

"Oh," she said sighing, "I wish I had one of those bottles!"

Now, I'm usually pretty dense when it comes to girl speak. Usually, a girl will literally have to beat me over the head with her purse to make me see her point. But, since I recently got off the phone with Miss Bad Idea Bear I was in that zone where somehow I was able to understand what my co-worker was saying to me. So, instead of what I normally would have done, which would have been to repeat myself saying, "Well, if you want that bottle, well go to Plentea tea!" 

Yet, instead I said, "Do you want one of my bottles?"

My co-worker looked at me and squealed, "Sure!" And after I handed it to her she literally hugged it, like it was a stuffed animal or something.

"You're so nice," she said smiling as if I handed her a stack of cash or something. Then she said, "I'm going to use it as a vase for flowers!"

I laughed since only a girl would think of something like that.

Had I given my brother that glass he would have just filled it up with water, or started collecting them with no purpose like me.

So, note to my future self. When I have a girlfriend, come here and buy my usual  creme oolong tea, rinse out the bottle, then stick a rose it it.

It'll be a win-win situation!

P.S DON'T wash the Plentea bottle in HOT water because it will crack. I learned that the hard way, twice. The first time, I thought it was my dishwashing skills, the second time, I realized it was just the cheap bottle.
author: Jack R.

description:
Not good boba that is super super super expensive. My boba was $5.50!?!? I got the Jasmine one. While the tea flavor is intense in a good way, the boba was smaller than the standard size and hard. Hard, like maybe they were undercooked...?!

Also, you get it in this thick glass jar, which I'm sure contributes to the cost. However, they only give you a 20% discount on your next order if you bring the jar back! So now I'm holding onto this jar, and I'm not sure I would ever go back!

I almost forgot to mention - there is a special if you check in on Yelp (a discount). But you can't get the discount if you want to check in for your loyalty program points (forget what it is...five stars loyalty? Belly?). It's one or the other. At $5.50 for some boba, I except to double dip!
author: Jaching H.

description:
I've been here a few times and always get an Ice Milk Brown Sugar with boba. Some say that it's really sweet, but I think it's just the right amount of sweetness because the ice waters it down anyway. I mean it's obviously one of their popular drinks for a reason...

I would suggest stopping by before the lunch crowd. Otherwise, the line is out the door. It does move fairly quickly, but can take a few minutes to get your drink. 

The glass bottle is cute and you can bring it back to re-use for a 10% discount. But, sometimes they don't always have the bottles. Sure, $5 for boba seems steep, but I  like the quality of their drinks. However, their texture of honey boba can be hit or miss.
author: Fallon P.

description:
My friend recently moved up to NorCal and she was raving about the vibes here. Came around and tried it and it wasn't too busy for a Sunday afternoon. 

They offer samples if you're very indecisive like we are. I wish I wasn't afraid to try new things but luckily their green milk tea with boba was great. It comes in a cute and pretty big bottle with Plentea engraved into it. 

The prices are fair especially for the drinks coming in glass bottles. I got 15% off two drinks with their Yelp check in. 

Sat up in their little loft and there's plentea of seating (haha). They have cute decor which is extremely instagram worthy. 

They have some pretty good mainstream beats to keep the vibes going. I will definitely come back here when I visit!!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
The drinks are good but Ive had better, theyre also a little on the pricey side but at least you get to bring home the cute bottle and then receive a discount when you bring it back next time! 

The iced milk drinks are good and so is their oolong milk tea!
author: Alyssa C.

description: This was my first time trying Plentea. I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea. It wasn't too bland nor too sweet. It was just right :) the glass bottles it comes with was really cool. One thing that bothered me was that they don't clean the spilled milk outside of the bottle when they put it at the counter for us to pick up. So I would have to wipe it myself when I get it.
author: Jenny N.

description:
I came here with my friend after getting sushirrto, we were playing tourist since it was her first time in the city. 

They have enough seating upstairs for like 20 ppl in case you didn't want to cram into the small waiting area downstairs.  I think that plentea is popular for their glass jars, because their drinks aren't very sweet, milky, or creamy enough for my liking. We had an almond milk tea, it tastes like they just mixed the almond powder with a little bit of tea and barely any milk. It was super super lightly flavored. 

I probably wouldn't come again, there are so many other milk tea places to choose from that this drink was overpriced and hyped up.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
This is specifically for the nutella tea -- it smells like a cavity and tastes like heaven. 

But this is just a trendy boba place that popped up, so it's very hipstery with their glass bottles and unique flavors (see nutella comment above). 

Haven't tried their regular teas though, but based on the flavored options, the tea is pretty overpowered by them.
author: Mandi W.

description: Wow, this boba place is by far the best one in San Fransisco yet. I got their milk black tea with boba and the drink is strong and delicious! Unlike most boba places I had tried like boba guys and bubblecup, plentea milk tea is the best yet. Their stores also have seats inside so it's friendly welcome.
author: Tina L.

description: This place has the best Boba than other places by a wide mile. You can choose any tea or coffee drink and randomly choose the toppings and it all comes out good. The reusable bottles are also very practical and overall it's better than the Boba Guys
author: N A.

description:
THERE IS A WORM IN MY SMOKED SALMON SALAD!!!!

DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING HERE!!!!

Just got two milk teas and a smoked salmon salad as takeout. Popped open the salad and as I was eating it, noticed a WORM in the salad right on top the smoked salmon.

DISGUSTING. HEALTH HAZARD.
author: L W.

description: This is actually my favorite boba place in the city bc I don't like tapioca balls, and they have aloe/grass jelly and fruity tea that go really well with it. Very refreshing; I'm a big fan of the strawberry ones with aloe. At first, I was excited about the bottles but now I have like 6 in my apartment and never remember to bring them around. Like why would I carry these bottles with no real cap? I wish they'd let you be eco-unfriendly .-.
author: Juliana P.

description:
I came here after 4th of July fireworks and had a pretty good experience. There were about 5 people in line in front of my group of friends. 

The prices here are a little more than your average boba place. This is probably because the drink comes in a glass container that you get to keep.

I ordered a black milk tea with boba. When I go to boba places, I like to try the basic flavors because it is often an indication of the quality of tea and ingredients. I liked my drink a lot and the boba was really good. 

The interior of the place is modern and nice. When I visited, it was pretty late and they had already closed the upstairs so I was not able to see what it looked like.

Good tea. Good place. I would return. I'm not sure, but I hear that if you bring your bottle back, you can get a discount. I'll be coming back... With the bottle.
author: Lydia H.

description:
The boba is fine here, not amazing. I got the strawberry tea and it didn't like strawberry or tea. The place is pretty pricey, and it the teas don't come with boba by default. The cashiers also don't tell you this. So I went with someone who didn't request the boba topping and came away with just tea.

Finally, the queue is slow as bananas. There were seven people in line when I got there, so I thought I would get my tea pretty quickly, but I had to wait for 25 minutes just to order.
author: Egon S.

description: Honestly, I'll admit that I came here for the jars. Yes you can keep them if you want, but we didn't want to haul it around with us the rest of the day so we just gave them back. I still don't know how they have so many jars that they can afford to give every customer one...The drink itself was alright..nothing special. I got the Matcha Latte and it just tasted like milk...The boba wasn't the best I've had either. It was a little too chewy and the texture didn't feel very smooth. So...I probably wouldn't recommend coming her, unless you're on a mission to get one of these jars haha. I definitely should have opted for Boba Guys instead.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
My friends were craving some boba in SF and couldn't find a decent place open on a Sunday so we opted for Plentea because we were in the area.

The place had a nice area to sit in and relax or do work. The line was out the door, but didn't take long to get to the front. Maybe 5 minutes and another 5 minutes to get our order.

Sadly, the tea here is average at best. However, they do come in some pretty cool mugs (jars?)! Consolation prize, but at least it's not particularly expensive for a jar of tea. About $4.50-5.00 for a bottle. Not including any toppings at about 50c each.

I opted for the Almond Milk Tea but was right to be cautious. It tasted very creamy and like it was made from powder. I know a lot of places opt for the powder almond, but I still don't know why. It just doesn't taste nearly as good as the syrup form and the texture is just weird in tea form.

On the other hand, the Sea Cream Tea that my friend got tasted pretty good. Not too sweet and didn't have the texture issue that I had with my Almond Milk Tea.

If you're in the mood for milk tea and want something nearby, by all means, stop in. Just don't expect anything amazing from the experience.
author: Alvin M.

description:
I caught the Plentea hype bug and decided I had to try it, given my addiction to boba. If you get out at the Montgomery Street BART station, it's a very quick walk to Plentea.

I got here around one, expecting a line out the door, a half an hour wait, and no glass bottle by the time I got to the counter; instead, there were only two people ahead of me and it was a very fast wait between order and drink completion. 

I will say that the prices are a bit disappointing if you get anything other than milk tea. I ordered the strawberry smoothie and my total was a little over seven bucks. There was nothing particularly special or different about the experience other than the bottle, which is admittedly cool, but there's no justification for the price, sorry. The smoothie was at least delicious, made with real strawberries (leaving chunks of berry in my drink, which was great) and a great combination with boba, and I think it's nice that you get a 10% discount if you bring your bottle back on your next visit.

Plentea gets an extra star for the pretty cool space, which has a loft area above the registers and has a clean, open, airy interior. But unless you manage to get a bottle on your visit, the boba isn't an experience worth as much as they charge. I'd like to come back and try the waffles here, and other snacks. A good drink, so if you're nearby definitely check it out.
author: Angela M.

description: Super cute bottles which you can take home with no added charge. Great boba and legit tea. All good for its price.
author: Rachelle S.

description: Walked by after having lunch in Chinatown. My fo worker told me about the place. We walked in and it was after lunch on a Wednesday so it wasn't crowded. The drink selections are good and I love the milk jug bottles. It was pricy and I felt like I was buying the bottle and not the drink but overall worth it.
author: Stephanie J.

description: This place has a really wide variety of drinks, many I've never seen before. I personally took the basic route and went with a classic black milk tea with boba. There's only one size for all of the drinks because they come in a nice hipster glass jar (but only for cold drinks) that you get to keep. I give the actual bubble tea 3 stars but I added another star because I liked the jar so much. The milk tea was a little sweet in my opinion, and the bubbles were kind of small and not too flavorful. It wasn't bad but I've definitely had better. They also let us sample a couple of different tea flavors in the beginning which was nice. I liked the ambience of the upstairs seating area and the playlist they were playing!
author: Rachel K.

description:
Plentea is another boba place I decided to run to along the Embarcadero. Obviously this was so I could more fairly compare it to Bottle Zup, which is a very similar boba shop. I also wanted to go running, but needed a motivator, so obviously the solution was to make a bubble tea shop the destination and boba my reward.

Unfortunately (for those who may have been pedestrians between my apartment and Plentea), I did not have the opportunity to run over a mile back home carrying a bottle full of boba in one hand and a bubble tea straw and my phone in the other, as I did when I visited Bottle Zup. This is partly because I was feeling lazy and the Montgomery Muni stop is nearby, and partly because Plentea only gives a plastic cap to cover the bottle, and I was afraid it wouldn't hold up under the stress of my running home.

As for the drink itself, the boba had a nice chewy consistency to it and was slightly sweet, but I am not a fan of the matcha latte. It wasn't too sweet, but the blend tastes more like jasmine green milk tea than matcha, but I am not a fan of the super-blended, mild-tasting matcha. I like my matcha strongly-flavored and textured, so this didn't quite hit the right note.

This place is pretty overpriced--I paid nearly $6 for my drink after tax, and had to pay in cash ($10 credit card minimum) which is a pain because it meant that I had to carry cash there while running and carry change back! The glass bottle is sturdy and slightly bigger than the one from Bottle Zup, but even if I bring it back for the 10% discount, I'm not sure it's worth it. I like the novelty of the glass bottle, but you could easily get the same for slightly better tea at Bottle Zup. The one thing Plentea does have going for it is that it stays open so late (until 11pm) which is super convenient in a city where so many places (specifically boba places) close so early.
author: Stephanie H.

description: First time! Wish I had one of these close to us in OC. I have the coffee one but wished I tried the Nutella!!
author: Angela M.

description:
"On a scale from 0 to Plentea, how good is it?"
This is how my SO and I rate milk tea now. 

We came here on a Sunday afternoon after finding out that Boba Guys was closed. Yes, the prices are higher than most milk tea places but you get to keep the glass bottle that comes with it. Besides, lattes cost this much but you don't ever hear anyone complaining!

The Matcha Red Bean Slush is delicious. Add egg pudding to that and you've got a matcha made in heaven (see what I did there?). 

The Thai Milk Tea is yummy too. It's very creamy and light tasting. The Black Milk Tea is just alright to me. The Takoyaki was also nice to snack on ($5.25 for 6).

Make sure you use the check in discount to get 25% off your order. Reusing your bottle gets 10% off as well, not sure if you can combine the discounts though. Oh, and no restrooms which sucks, cause you know what happens when you drink liquids...
author: Jenny Y.

description:
Don't read my review if you're a molecular boba-ologist, because I really can't tell the difference between perfectly cooked boba and slightly under/overcooked boba, like some of you brilliant people. I just LOVE milky tea with little chewy balls in it! And Plentea makes exactly that, in cute reusable glass jars. So yeah, I'm a fan. 

I came here with a group of non-Californias, who had never seen/heard of/tasted boba before. Gasp! Thankfully, Plentea's menu makes it easy for novices to figure things out. There's milk tea, fruit tea, and smoothies, all with the option of boba. I usually opt for the Thai milk tea with boba, perfectly sweet (maybe sometimes too sweet), the perfect afternoon picker-upper. 

For about $4.50, it's not a bad habit. You get some kind of credit if you bring back your glass jar. Very smart for the environment AND for getting customers to come back and back again. 

Plenty of reasons to applaud Plentea!
author: Nique F.

description: Not the best boba I've tried, and the drinks were pricey. However, it comes in a cute glass bottle, so you're basically paying for the bottle. I came on a Friday night, so it was busy (line was almost out the door). We had to wait a little to order, but the staff was really nice. The drinks came out really fast though!
author: Kelsey N.

description:
Cute bottles with boba and pretty quality drinks! The price is slightly more than most tea stands (over $5) but the glass is a nice souvenir that is functional and aesthetically pleasing.

I've tried the taro milk, oolong, and milk green tea and all were pretty solid. The boba was fresh everytime and sometimes warm and usually at a nice chwey consistency. The taro milk was made by blending fresh taro with milk into a nice creamy drink that captures true taro flavor. The oolong has a nice roasted flavor, and the green milk tea was refreshing and not too sweet.

If you have a bottle, you get 10% off for bringing it back! There's not too many places were you can keep the container so Plentea gets extra points for being a more unique boba bottle stop.
author: Steven V.

description:
It's all 'bout that jar, 'bout that jar, no tea.  

^I'm not a fan of that song either, but it quite accurately describes my thoughts on Plentea--it's one of those places that is an obligatory SF bucket list item, but once you've gone there, had your share of photographing the photogenic hipster jars, and now have the photogenic hipster jar in your cupboard, it's not really worth going back unless you are showing friends around SF and know that take-home photogenic hipster jars will make them happy.  

The storefront and ambiance are everything you'd expect, i.e. photogenic and hipster.  It seems a tad bit out of place in the more oldschool neighborhood as a shiny cafe boasting large, clean birch planks and a minimalist logo in an artsy font.  The birch accents extend to the interior, and together with the menu written on the chalkboard, the high stool seating, and half second level layout, it gives off a very clean and modern vibe.  

Perhaps an advantage of the chalkboard menu is that they can raise prices easily, because when I went the prices were slightly higher than what I had seen on Yelp.  Paying almost $5 for milk tea is pricey, but you are buying drinkware as well.  Service was alright; it had a hint of that hipster edginess and they didn't ask me about ice/sugar level preferences when I forgot to ask.  Also, be sure to grab a cap!  It's quite useful for the future use of the jar.

I got the iced milk tea with black tea, which turned out to be good but not all too amazing--it might have been the creamer, but I thought there was a bit of a strange taste to the milk tea overall.  At least the jars are large size so there was Plentea of tea.  I've also heard that they run out of jars sometimes, so I guess it's not Plentea of jars (even though it's all 'bout that jar).
author: Edna C.

description: Their teas are pretty good and I love the bottles! It was really close to our hotel and they're open late so it was convenient to visit for late-night bubble tea. I just wish they had more variety!
author: Win Y.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of this place. I ended up going because I wanted the glass bottle.. but beyond that novelty, there's really no reason in going. 

The first time I went, my friend and I both felt like hot milk teas before we thought about our experience and realized that hot drinks are not served in glass bottles. The hot milk tea was actually not bad. Nothing stand out, but not bad. Still insanely expensive though. Was about $4.50 for one.

The second time I went, I was determined to do it right, so I got a pearl milk tea. First of all... at $5.44 who has the money for milk tea that expensive??? I'd rather go down the street and at least get high quality pmt from Boba Guys or something. I get that part of that money is paying for the bottle, but when the milk tea is really mediocre, $5.44 is ridiculous. Honestly it tasted like $1 pmt you can get in Richmond. Tea itself was very dilute and flavorless and the pearls were clumpy--i.e. you'd bite down and find your teeth stuck. No bounce at all, no flavor. At least I got a bottle out of all of this?

I will say they have some interesting dessert options, so if a friend ever wants to try the place... I might go back and give the dessert a shot.

Also $10 minimum for credit card.

tldr; inflated reviews because they market well; bottle is pretty cool and I'm glad I got one, but definitely not a fan of their tea, especially at that price.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Very cute place. All drinks come in one size, in the glass bottle & the tea itself was pretty yummy too. I got a milk tea but I tried my sisters fruity teas and they were great. I recommend this place
author: Judy H.

description:
This was my first experience trying boba tea, or tea with tapioca balls. I have to be honest, I wasn't a fan of the boba. They were too chewy and not exactly how I imagined them to taste. 

Everyone in my party was trying milk tea, and I again have to be honest and say the thought of milk mixed with tea sounded gross. I'm thinking coffee and creamer/milk and tea... nah, I passed on that and branched out on my own, and ordered the strawberry green tea. Even though I usually don't like my green tea sweetened or flavored, this tea was delicious! 

The glass bottle was a nice touch and will bring it back with me on my next trip to San Francisco, just so that I can get 10% off, and have a reason to go back. Unless, I decide to use it as a flower vase instead. 

This place is one of the places that's missing in my city, so I hope that San Franciscans appreciate the fact that they have Plentea and glass bottles. 

We didn't stay, we just ordered, grabbed our teas to go and walked back to work sipping our teas. What a great memory! Thanks Laura and Nique for showing us this awesome place.
author: Heather P.

description:
First of all, places that serve drinks in a glass bottle (no matter what the drink is, you will be up charged it).  When you return it you can get a discount, but what if you don't plan on making a return visit?  There are many other places that charge you a deposit, and then you can just return it for $ without having to purchase another item.  

I came here with friends and I got the sea salt coffee.  The sea salt foam was really good, slightly salty and slightly sweet.  However the tea was awful.  Was I even drinking tea?  It has literally almost no tea flavor!  Maybe there is too much sugar (even though I got reduced sweetness) to even taste the tea.

To add to this the service is lacking.  I get that you are busy, but if you can't multitask correctly then maybe you should stick to doing one thing at a time.  The dude picked up a phone call in the middle of my order.  So when he asked if I wanted boba in my drink, which I repeated before and after his call, he must have missed it.  My drink was lacking boba, and when my friend told a different guy, he said he can't add it.  Then the original guy said he could, but after he takes my drink says it's 55 cents.  Seriously tapioca balls aren't worth arguing over, but they're also not worth me getting back to the register through a mob of people and redoing the entire transaction.  Let me also add that the girl before me ordered a drink and got the wrong one so they had to redo it.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I loved that they served the drink in little glass bottles (and yet the price doesn't increase that much over other boba places). I carried mine around and brought it home after to reuse! Nice touch! Though I'd be open to the option of a cheaper drink in a normal cup.

The service was fine but they had a weird thing with taking card, which was not very accommodating. I didn't have cash, so at that point the guy said "it's okay, but next time we won't do it," then took my card anyways. Seems kind of odd. 

It's a nice place to grab a drink though because they have seating areas downstairs and upstairs! Downside was that they didn't have a restroom! For a place that's set-up as a lounge area to enjoy fluids, that seems like it would be a necessity. 

I thought the iced milk drink I ordered was okay. My comparison was with Half and Half in SoCal or Meow Meow which have stellar iced milk boba drinks. 

I love boba though, so I'm not going to stop going just because of the one mediocre drink I had. I'll be back when I'm in the area to try more different drinks!
author: Tsyria T.

description: Everybody comes here for the glass bottles. Boba guys charge you for it but they don't here. I got the almond milk tea with egg pudding. You can take that bottle and get ten percent off your future purchase. Not a bad way to get repeat customers. There's plenty of seating upstairs as well
author: Randy L.

description:
The short of it:
- trendy boba drinks
- drinks come in a glass bottle
- very long wait times
- reasonably priced

The long of it:
It took me at least 30-45min to get a boba drink here. The wait is quite ridiculous. The line to order is long and on top of that it takes them a very long time to make your drinks. The gimmick of this place is the glass bottles that your drinks come in. There's really nothing to special about it, just a nice keepsake and if you bring it back you get a discount on your next drink. It seems a bit cumbersome to bring a glass bottle around for fear it might break. I order the sea salt crema tea with grass jelly (because the cashier person said it was better than boba). Was it better than boba? Eh, it was just ok and overall I liked the sea salt cream but other than that there was nothing spectacular about it and I certainly would not come back to wait in a long line. If they could just somehow shorten the wait times then this place would be better.
author: Kristin A.

description:
I've come to Plentea plenty of times (pun intended) with different friends who consider themselves boba connoisseurs (So-Cal friends). While the drinks are standard, this review is really about the ambience of Plentea, which stands out from other places. There is so much novelty at Plentea that it makes for a great destination when walking from Union Square to Chinatown. 

Novelties: 

The Plentea-branded glass milk bottles in which all drinks are served are super novel - they serve as souvenirs in themselves because you can reuse them to make hot tea at home, or take them back to Plentea for 10% off your next drink. They used to have salmon waffle sandwiches and tiramisu, and you, like me, may be a sucker for waffles or tiramisu and want to stop by. 

The upstairs balcony seating area inside Plentea feels super cozy. You can come with a group of friends and bring board games or cards to play, or you can catch up on life while feeling like you're sitting in your backyard or bamboo garden. The environment feels great if you're constrained by your apartment space when hosting dinner parties or board game parties, and I really appreciate the setup here.
author: Shelley C.

description:
So my friends and I actually stumbled upon this place. We knew about it, but didn't know the location of it while walking to Union Square that we would find it. 

I like the jar the drink comes in. The drinks could get pricy though. If I remember for two drinks I paid I think $11? I don't fully remember since I went there a few weeks ago and should have wrote the review the next couple of days after I came back. Sorry, this is going off complete memory.

I like how there's a loft upstairs to hangout and just sit lol. That's where my friends and I went. It was hot up there though. 

The drinks were too sweet according to the people I went with. I thought it needed more green tea since I got the Matcha Green Milk Tea. I got lychee jelly in it too. The drink my boyfriend got was really sweet!! I liked it more than my drink and I LOVE Matcha Green Tea! He got the Brown Sugar Milk Tea with Taro Pudding. The pudding and jelly were extra cost.

I only would go back just cause I give places two chances, and if you bring your jar back they will give you 10% discount.
author: Akemi H.

description: I like the idea, but it was too pricy for what it was. I'm a little disappointed because it doesn't taste as i had hoped.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
The hot gimmick about this place is the cute free milk tea jars that you can bring home with you.  If you bring it back it's 10% off your bill.  

I love love love their sea salt caramel creme tea and honey lemon tea.  The sea salt creme tea was just the perfect balance.  The other boba joints I have tried skimps on the sea salt creme and puts too much tea in theirs.  Same with the honey lemon tea.

However, the milk tea brown sugar tasted really diluted.  All the other drinks were good EXCEPT for the milk tea, which was quite disappointing.

But I like this place def more than T-Pumps!  And I will be coming back :).
author: Joyce L.

description:
Great quality bubble tea. I've tried the Matcha, Sea Salt Crema Oolong, and Thai milk tea. Whenever I'm in the city, I make it a priority to swing by Plentea. They used to serve these cute little glass bottles that you could take home, bring back and reuse for a discount. The last time I went though, they didn't have them. Not sure if they were going to bring them back (I have a suspicion that those bottles were a large part of the hype). 

Matcha: Wonderful. Not too sweet that it overwhelmed the matcha flavor. 

Sea Salt Crema Oolong: Very interesting. It's layered - sweet oolong tea on the bottom and a frothy layer of sea salt crema on top. I wasn't sure if I drank it correctly; I thought the waiter told me not to stir the drink, so I drank the bottom sweet layer first and then the remaining crema. The crema was very salty by itself...so maybe I misheard what he was saying (he had an accent) and was supposed to mix them? Not sure. The oolong tea was lovely, though, and the crema was perfectly textured, just a bit too salty for my tastes. Contrast was nice.

Thai: A bit too sweet for my tastes, but then again, I've never had a Thai bubble tea that wasn't too sweet for me.
author: Katherine Z.

description:
Walked over to a couple of boba places around 3pm and saw it was packed everywhere. Stumbled upon Pleatea and they only had two people waiting in line. Red flag.

In summary, extremely overpriced boba. I paid $6 for a tasteless boba drink in a jar. $6?!!! I understand they are trying to be different with the mason jar bottle but the drink has to match the price. Unfortunately, I got the matcha latte with almond milk/boba with reg sweetness and I could not taste any matcha nor any other taste. Even the boba tasted off, generally boba is sweeter and a little chewy. This was mushy and did not have a good texture.

Noted if you come back you get 10% off if you bring the bottle back. But with the super high price why not go down the street to I-tea instead?

I am a huge fan of boba and you really can't mess up a boba drink. Sadly I will not return due to the poor taste and the extremely high price of meh boba.
author: Sarah I.

description: This is usually my second choice when there's a huge line at iTea. They have really cut down the menu to offer the basics with minimal additions. Prices are reasonable. Recently, I had the jasmine green milk tea. It was rather watered down but drink came out quickly and you get a glass bottle!
author: V C.

description:
Solid boba, decent milk tea.  Boba is sweeter than the bland boba at many boba spots, but nothing to write home about.  They use real milk here (as opposed to half and half or creamer), so you lactose-intolerant folks be wary.

Glass Plentea bottle is included in your inflated San Francisco price ($5+), and as others said, you get a discount on your next drink if you have it refilled.  That being said, who would ever lug around a heavy bottle all day (presumably if you're in downtown for work), all for a mere ~50 cents?  I don't--I just collect bottles. :)

There's usually a relatively long line here at lunch and in the afternoon.  Not something to go out of your way for, but if you're in the area and craving boba, it's one of the better spots, and easily beats out Boba Guys in taste, cuteness, and variety of options.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
Came here for my first time on a Saturday after lunch and the line was not too long. However, it did move at a slow pace.

 I ended up going with the Sea Salt Creama Green Tea instead of the Oolong Tea that the girl at the register said it usually comes with. Not my favorite but it wasn't bad. Definitely not a place I would think about for boba unless I'm around the area.
author: Rachel L.

description:
This place is a dream!!! I fell in love with tea all over again, it's like a fairy-tale came true! It took me a while to go try it, but it was so worth it! it is pricier than your typical boba tea places, but you DO get to keep the glass bottle their teas are served in. Not to mention the joy you'll experience from that first sip...

My friend and I went here after dim sum and it was perfect. I am sure to be back! It's also a perk that it's not far from Westfield. The only down side is that it is tiny. We went on a Sunday so we were able to sit and chill inside for a bit, but I imagine this place is packed otherwise as I have often seen a long line here. Definitely stop by and pick up some teas to go!
author: Fran S.

description: They have cute glass bottles (at no additional cost). Tea is standard, but on the upper end of the boba spectrum. Probably not a place you would sit in and hang out with since it's always packed, but great for a grab and go experience! Service is fast. Would recommend going for higher sugar levels than at other places, I usually get 25%  but it isn't sweet at all at plentea.
author: Cheechee L.

description:
Plenteaaaa! A cute little boba shop served in glass jars to keep! Their selection of drinks is not too big, but I like this as they can specialize and focus on making the drinks tasty. If you want the drink Togo, they have a plastic lid on their counter that you can grab. 

I went with a basic milk tea which had the options of either black, green, or oolong tea. I chose green, and you can also add a flavor which was strawberry, peach, honeydew, and something else, I forgot.
 I chose peach and also added egg pudding. The drinks came out pretty quick. I wasn't too amazed by it since the flavors were okay. My egg pudding was kind of off though? Everytime I took a sip and consumed egg pudding, these white little small crumbs I guess were on the egg pudding? Not sure if this is because it was old or not. I finished the drink tho without any issues.
author: Jayson M.

description: I'll keep this review simple: Great tasting bubble tea in adorable little jars.  Quick service, huge menu, affordable price.  Can't get much better than that!
author: Kirk S.

description:
Came here for their cute glass teas tbh!! First time trying plentea & I love it! You can really tell that their tea tastes fresh & that they don't use a lot of sugar or lots of syrup. 

Recommend: 
Brown sugar milk tea with pearls! If you want something sweeter than get caramel milk tea! 

Peach fresh fruit tea.. Tastes like fresh peach OR strawberry fresh fruit tea.. If you're feeling fruity I definetly recommend all of these three drinks! 

PERKS: U GET TO KEEP THE GLASS JAR 
TIP: bring the jar back next time u come again to get 10% off your entire purchase
author: Vicky P.

description: The tea is fine, but they charge you for a glass bottle each time you come here. Unless you enjoy dragging a bottle back each time to get a small discount. This is inconvenient and not a very environmentally sound approach
author: Tad B.

description: Real cool spot drinks gets made pretty fast. The used to have a little snack section but it's gone now. I was really wanting something to snack on too. My favorite drink is the Carmel ice milk. I always grab 2 cause one is not enough. Real MVP is my boy Han for showing me this place thanks bruh. Over all good place closed at 11pm but not on the dot. #PAYPABOY
author: Donald A.

description: Love their Thai tea with tapioca but the real reason I passed up 3 other places with the same drink was to get one of their glasses! Cute and delicious, my new fave place.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
Finally got to try out this teashop last week and it was pretty good! The prices are great considering you get the take home the bottle too!
I ordered a strawberry milk tea and it was good, but tasted more like graham crackers. The strawberry flavor was very subtle.
The boba was good but maybe a bit too firm for my taste.
Still so happy I tried it!
author: Larissa S.

description:
This is my first time and I have to say I'm very impressed! Im from SoCal and I'm very picky when it comes to trying a new boba place, but this place is so good! I ordered the Ice Milk Drink with pudding and boba and it was bomb.com 

Pros: 
- Honey boba definitely taste like honey
- Good price (for serving them in mason jars)! 
- Nice interior design 
- Nice staffs 

Cons:
- Limited seats because the venue is kind of small 
- Nothing else cos this place is amaaaaazing!
author: Steven C.

description:
Plentea, you deserve plentea of love. Take my money. From now on, I'm only ever gonna drink tea that comes in a glass bottle.

I stick to my two staples: Premium Mountain Tea (green tea) with grass jelly when I'm not feelin' something milky and/or am lying to myself that it's a healthier option. Or, the standard black milk tea with tapioca when I'm feelin' like a basic B.

I admit I've Postmates-ed Plentea one too many times, too. No wonder I'm broke...paying an additional $4 delivery fee on top of the overpricedness of the milk tea. But sometimes you just gotta go with your lazy, fat girl instinct. Gotta get that boba.
author: Ashley S.

description: I love plentea. Great options and friendly staff. I got the sea salted caramel oolong tea. It was INSANE. Everyone needs to try it!! I can't wait to try their other flavors, one time I got taro milk tea which was good if you like the real taste of taro, little chunks of it inside too. Different but great.
author: Charlotte M.

description:
Cute place (: I like their decoration! They also have stairs for you to go on top. That's pretty cool. 

As for their drinks, i thought it was okay. Very watered down so ehhhh. I guess my expectations were a lot higher. I didn't finish half of my drink.
author: Tilia L.

description:
I think it's over hyped and not worth the wait. 

Yes the place is neat, putting boba in a glass bottle is a clever idea, but the boba was just so-so. 

Last time I checked there's still a long queue and I'm in no rush to return.
author: Rachel Z.

description:
I am definitely late on this Plentea life. I've been wanting to come here for the longest time because of their bottles, and I finally made a trip here. First off, there are two stories to Plentea, which allows "plentea" of room for hanging with friends or getting some work done. Personally, I just order and go since parking isn't exactly the greatest during most hours.

I've been into the Honey Lemon Green Tea trend recently, so I obviously got that while I was here in Plentea. I was actually really happy to have ordered it because it's so good! It has the right balance between the honey, tea, and lemon! I think this is sometimes a hard one to make since a little too much lemon will make the whole thing too sour, or a little too much honey would make it too sweet. But Plentea's got it right! I think this is probably be my go-to drink, for now, until I find something even more refreshing.

Overall, definitely worth a visit if you haven't already. I really like the my drink here and I definitely recommend it (Honey Lemon Green Tea with Aloe). Can't wait for my next treat!
author: Wendy Y.

description:
Visiting the Bay area and this Tea shop was recommended to us.  We decided to check it out and YES, we all enjoyed our drinks.  The glass bottles was a pleasant surprise!  Coffee tea and Milk tea.  Decided to go back 2 nights later.  We wanted to try the Thai Ice tea.  I then asked the young lady for suggestions as I wanted something hot to soothe my scratchy throat.  She mentioned the Honey Lime which I purchased.  It worked!  

Great service and friendly staff.  I encourage anyone to visit the store on Kearny St.
author: Neesa S.

description:
Got a milk tea which was basic, but you know when a place makes good drinks when the basic is fantastic. I would rate this place 2.5, but rounded up to 3 stars due to the nice milk jar you get to keep. 

A bonus is if you buy 5 drinks, you get one free. The rewards system is great where you put in your phone number and it tracks your purchases. No need for card stamps.
author: Frank T.

description:
Friday (1/8) visit changed my mind on this location
I ordered the Brown Sugar Carmel Milk Tea - NOT Bad...... I may come back here again when I'm in the area next time.
author: Ryan R.

description: The regular oolong milk tea is a way better option than the almond milk tea (what we got last time). Even the boba tasted better. They're smaller than your average boba balls but they have a slight honey-soaked taste.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Pretty good boba! Loving the jars.

PARKING: We actually walked over from union square but it looks like parking would be difficult since it's located in chinatown near sushiritto and other establishments.

ATMOSPHERE: The outside is wooden and there are 6-7 high tables for 2 people each inside on the lower level and then you can also go upstairs for more seating for larger groups.  We came on a Friday afternoon and found seating even though the line was out the door.

FOOD: Their boba comes in modern looking milk jars, which are really cute and instagram worthy but sometimes they run out.  If you come and get a jar you should save it, bring it back and get 10% off...plus you are guaranteed a jar.  At the end you can empty out your ice and they provide lids near the garbage cans.  

They have flavors such as sea cream, different milk tea, flavored teas and fruit teas.  You can also get milk tea with soy milk for those that are lactose or allergic.

HONEY LEMON GREEN TEA - It doesn't have a prominent tea taste, which is what I was hoping for but one good thing was that it's not overly sweet.  A decent honey lemon flavor with a lime squeezed and put on top.  

BOBA - Their boba is on the smaller side but it was chewy, which moved it up to 4 stars.  They call it honey but it wasn't as sweet nor warm like half and half.  

Overall though, their presentation and flavors make it a legit boba place with good boba.
author: Brittany T.

description:
TL;DR - Literally just, meh.

Honestly, I might return, I might not. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here tho.... especially reading some of the other Yelper's complaints.

Pros:
- Price is fair for what you get
- Clean interior and relatively fast service

Cons:
- Overly sweet drinks 
- The matcha green tea tastes like jasmine green tea so...... missing matcha, a lot. Just order the jasmine milk tea
- Mostly ice in the drinks
- Awkward and rude staff (ie high schoolers with major 'tude problems because they need a little spending money and they have to *gasp* work!)
- Lack of options (If you're going to specialize, make it good. Basically, make each drink something memorable -which the drinks were not-. If you're just riding the hype train, then add more options so everyone can enjoy the disappointment.)
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Plentea is very cute name for a boba place.Coming to San Francisco, I heard boba guys and plentea is a must go to boba place. Since I only stayed in San Francisco for three days I made the best out of it. I went to boba guys the day before and the next day I went to Plentea. 

This place is a bit bigger than the boba guys I've been to and also it has seating. It also had a upstairs seating too which is good for studying. 

I'm more drawn to this place because they give jars. I like collecting jar even back in LA. I got the Sea Salt Crema Sweet Crema Tea for $5. I like how there's a separation with the creme and the tea. It wasn't too sweet and it taste like creme with a bit a sweetness. It had oolong tea in it I believe mixed with the creme on top. My boyfriend got a Mango Fresh Fruit Tea for $5, but then they ran out of Mango bits so they were gonna replace it with Honeydew bits. He ended up getting a Honeydrew Fresh Fruit Tea, but he was fine with it. The taste of the tea was overpowering the honeydrew in the drink. The bits were really random which made some pieces stuck to the straw, but that's cause we used a small straw later on. It wasn't sweet at at all. I didn't get to try any boba, but next time I will. 

I would come back just for some jars. You also get 15% off two drink when you check in. It cost $10 for two drinks. But if you decide you don't want the jar there is a tray next to the straws where you can place it and they'll reuse it I think . Also there are caps on the side if you need a cap for your jar.
author: Winnie H.

description:
After work, I saw a woman walking down the street holding what looked like an old-style glass milk jug, taking sips through a fat straw that I knew must indicate that it was from a bubble tea spot. 

She looked so happy. Like a Hello Kitty cartoon.

I forgot about it until the next day until fellow Yelpers I met up with for dinner told me about Plentea: the home of the glass milk jug. I pledged that I would head there during lunch the very next day.

Easily found in the Financial District, Plentea was already packed full of people, and they had just opened a half-hour before. We waited in a line that seemed to move pretty quick, especially since they also make food. It's pretty small, so I don't know if I'd want to eat there personally. Besides, I was just there for that glass jar...I mean, the bubble tea.

I ordered the favorite, an Oolong cream tea and added egg pudding (you can get boba, tapioca or taro pudding too). 

This drink epitomized what I like about most Asian desserts; it wasn't too sweet. The cream float at the top may have been lightly sweetened too, but that could have just been me thinking about how well the flavors worked together. The egg pudding slurped up my straw like a salmon in a fish cannon. 

When I was paying for it, the price was around $5. I asked her if that was all, and she looked at me quizzically. I told her that if we offered glass jars where I'm from, it'd cost more than that. She said that she thought $5 was too much, but I disagree ;)

Bring back your own glass to get re-filled, and you get a discount on your next drink. Plentea is conveniently located, tasty, cost-friendly, and green. My favorite things.

UPDATE Mar 2015: they didn't offer the glass bottles anymore when I was in. It sounds like they may not offer them anymore, but not sure. Boo. The 10% discount still applies if you bring in your own old glass.
author: Cynthia L.

description: We got the traditional milk tea with green tea which was my favorite! I could really taste the strong fragrant tea flavor in my drink, and the boba was the perfect texture. However, the taro milk tea we ordered was pretty disappointing. I'm not sure if the drink itself sucked or if the red bean I added overpowered the drink and was a bad combo.
author: Jenny C.

description:
The glass bottles are cute and reusable but the drinks were disgusting. I got the lavender lemonade and it tasted bitter and like soap. It had a spicy taste of some sort, neither me nor my friends liked it at all. My friends got the Matcha Latte, they said it was bitter and left a nasty feeling on the tongue. The atmosphere is really nice; crowded, but aesthetically pleasing. 

It is also pretty overpriced. I recommend getting a simple milk tea that you can't go wrong with instead of the Matcha Latte or Lavender Lemonade
author: Katie P.

description:
I tried the Fresh Fruit Tea in peach flavor with green tea and aloe. The name comes from the bits of fruit that is added into your drink. For this drink alone, I will give it two stars. It was mediocre at best. The tea didn't have any wow factor to it because the drink could have just been straight peach syrup and water. I didn't like the peach bits either because it was white peach that has been oxidized after cutting. The little bits were really hard in my drink and I could have dealt without. 
The service was good. There wasn't anything special about it. I received 10% off since I wasn't getting a glass jar. All in all, I wouldn't come back here unless a friend wanted to try. If I were to come back, I think I would probably save my five dollars for something else.
author: Tina Y.

description: The drinks are made from scratch- not from powders like othersl places. They even let you keep the cute milk just it comes in!
author: Lukish D.

description:
I don't understand why this place isn't a 5 star.
People are complaining about parking spots but that's not their fault and it's SF what do you expect.
Price is really fair compared to SF boba pricings like Boba Guys.
I got the ICE MILK drink and it was amazing. If you like balanced sweet and roasty, this is an excellent choice for beginner.
author: Tee K.

description:
Taste: 2 Boba:3 Price: 3 Aesthetic: 4

"It looks better than it tastes." Got the Taro Milk with Boba. Came in an aesthetic milk bottle, which makes it Instagram worthy. Tasted a lil powdery, so I mixed the bottom with my straw. Texture of the Boba was a little too undercooked for my tastes. I'm used to honey Boba, which is softer to chew.
author: Alex Z.

description:
I ordered the matcha milk green tea and it tasted like overly sweetened soy milk - not really  much taste of matcha was present, unfortunately. I came here with a group of 7 and we were all disappointed.. very weak tea taste and very strong sweetened milk taste! 

Maybe the tea (with no milk) drinks are better. (My friend ordered the strawberry oolong tea and said it was just okay but indeed, too sweet!) No complaints for the boba itself, service or wait time. Line goes quick but I rather wait for drinks elsewhere!
author: Kris C.

description:
I recommend the mango green tea, which has bits of mangos. Sweet level is normal pretty sweet which is how I like my drinks but if you don't ask for it less sweet. 

Brown sugar milk tea was only ok, gong chat is still my favorite for it. 

Line is usually out the door but luckily we came here after the lunch rush and barely had a line. 

They use five star, which is an extra +! So just enter your phone # when you're at the register. I prefer this rather than carry an extra card.
author: Sherry Y.

description:
After a day of walking around Union Square, I needed something to replenish my thirst and my cousin suggested Plentea. Surprisingly it's really close walking distance from Union Square which is convenient! 

I ordered the Honeydew Oolong Tea with the Honey Boba and it was so delicious and refreshing! The honey boba was chewy and had a nice sweet flavor to it. As for the Honeydew Oolong Tea, the tea flavor wasn't too strong and had the right amount of honeydew flavoring. I loved every sip of it! Of course the cute glass bottles were a game changer and it's awesome that they offer caps for the bottles so you can save the drink for later. Very nice presentation I must admit!

Regardless of the cute glass jars, I really enjoyed my drink and would love to come back whenever I'm shopping at Union Square. :)
author: MyTien P.

description:
Went here because a lot of people recommend it. The drinks were not good at all. The atmosphere was nice, the theme was very cute. I love the look, the jars, the interior and exterior: it was very contemporary. But the drinks was not good. Did not taste like authentic milk tea. Maybe their smoothie is better.

The green milk tea was alright, a lot of tea, not very sweet but wasn't creamy enough, the boba was good tho. Very nice texture. 3/5
The oolong milk tea was disgusting and tasted like roasted water 0/5. 
sea salt creame tea was too sweet and you can't taste the tea. 2/5

Overall, never again. The service was really good tho. She remade the drink and asked which drink didn't taste good. Probably for reviewing. If you wanna go for the experience, then it's nice. But if you're going for the drink, it's disappointing. So many good tea places out there, this one didn't make it on my list :( it's pretty busy tho. Always a line, maybe we bought the wrong drinks

I got diarrhea after.
author: Nini N.

description:
Excellent milk tea made with fresh ingredients at a great price.  Love the sustainability mission with the glassware. I recycle some, but they are also totally cool with you taking them home if you want to. They make great vases for my flowers!

The only reason I rated 4 star instead of 5 is because I still much prefer the quality of the tapioca balls at Boba Guys to those at Plentea. 

Great service, cool vibes, tasty tea.
author: Alejandro R.

description:
I am some mixed feelings about Plentea. I find this place a little gimmicky but hey, i do love glass bottles. The bottles seem to be sometimes there and sometimes not. When my friends have gone, they have brought me back the bottles but when I went, they said they would be out for two weeks at least. 

MENU AND PRICE: There aren't that many options on the menu compared to other boba places. The price is also much higher than your typical boba place ($4+) and even when they are out of glass bottles they still charge you the same price which feels like a bit of a rip off. 

TEA AND BOBA: The tea is very strong so if you really like strong tea, you would like this place. The black tea felt a bit too tannic for my liking. The boba was good and chewy.

ATMOSPHERE: The place is very small and dimly lit. However it is pretty cute near union square ish. It isn't really a place where I would hang out but it is great for a grab and go situation. 

All in all I would go back to get more glass bottles (LOL I am not even going to lie.) I would also be down to try some of the other teas which might be less tannic.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
Plentea has always been a go to location whenever I was in the area to go to either alone or with friends. Many different teas to try from and the aesthetics of the location are perfect for trying to get that perfect photo of your drink. 

The most desired part of this location though is the custom mason jars they give with their drinks. I have a small collection at home of all the bottles collected there and they're cute enough to be used with crafts and home decoration projects as well. 

Also the location is near many other food establishments, so you can make an amazing meal with a drink from here with food from another of the great locations around.
author: John S.

description:
I always gotta stop by here whenever I'm in the Financial District. And oh yeah, bring your bottle back for a 10% off discount! (But I don't because I'm a glass bottle hoarder, hehehe.) Call ahead of time to ask if they still have glass bottles in stock for the day because sometimes they run out during their rushes. 

I don't know any other place in the Bay Area besides Plentea that gives out boba in a glass bottle that you can actually take home. Drinks taste great, and the glass bottles add a great presentation to it. For about $5 per drink, I'm always satisfied with my boba from Plentea. 

Some faaaaves:
- Strawberry black fresh fruit tea
- Brown sugar ice milk (may be too sweet for some people!)
- Oolong milk tea
author: Robinne D.

description:
Boba very sweet and with a nice firm texture. We got the avocado milk with boba and a milk tea. I think the bobas were the best part. Her milk tea tasted like bitter chocolate milk, a huge let down considering the cost of the teas (13 bucks for the two and a dollar tip) . 

My avocado milk smoothie was bland at first but the bobas are fairly sweet here so they helped round the flavor away from blandness. As always the avocado made the drink deliciously smooth and creamy. 

Overall disappointment for the price. Two stars for the clean atmosphere/store, the boba and the poor fish trapped at the cashier desk. I bet he's sensed so much disappointment in his short life.
author: Mackenzie P.

description:
i'm sure there's a bunch of bubble tea spots in San Francisco, but hey... it's the Original Glass Bottle Milk Tea in SF. For the price of their drinks.. I think being able to take home one of their glass bottles as a souvenir is pretty worth it. And if you come back with your bottle you can get an extra discount on your drink. But don't forget to check Yelp to see if they offer any discounts as well. The last time I went they offered 20% off. 

Anyways. They offer a wide range of Milk Teas and Fresh Fruit Slush drinks. I usually order the Nutella Milk Tea, which is delicious. I've also tried their Thai Tea and Mango Smoothie. All good choices. All drinks range from $4.50 to $6. A bit pricey, but I guess the glass bottle makes up for it. But keep in mind - if you go towards the end of the day they may be sold out of the glass bottles. 

 They've also expanded their food options as well! Last time I went we ordered the Octopus Balls... pretty tasty! i'd say give that one a shot. 

The only downside to this spot is the parking. I always have trouble finding parking around the block. So be prepared to either pay for parking or walk a few blocks.
author: Jadelann J.

description:
Sea salt creama is one of their more popular flavours worth trying. The basic fruit MTs and almond MT are just alright. The prices are shocking.. red bean matcha slush for a whopping $6? (ok fine, $4.50 with the Yelp checkin..) Luckily there are tons of boba places in the area now.

The concept of the free glass is cool, but practically, no one is going to lug their bottle to the store just to get 10% off (unless you live close by). So in the end it is quite pricey since you are mainly paying for the bottle.

As others have mentioned, the service tends to be pretty slow. Their seating arrangement on the ground floor sucks. it is extremely crowded with all the teenagers standing in the middle of the aisle (even worse when there are lineups). Upstairs is a lot more spacious and comfortable, at a good angle to people watch, but don't expect to be able to sit with a large group.
author: Elisa L.

description:
Drinks were okay which is why I didn't go to one star. Definitely overpriced, probably for the boring plain glass bottles. At least the bottles from tea joints in SoCal are decorated & cute. :/ 

Takoyaki was gross. Wouldn't come back... T4 is still my favorite in the Bay Area.
author: Eric N.

description: I'm obsessed with boba so I definitely had to stop by here when I saw it. All of the workers were so nice and friendly. There was a line when I got there but it went by quickly. The drinks were delicious and the glass jars they come in are pretty cool. Not the cheapest boba around but definitely worth a try.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Let's begin with how delicious their drinks are. I tried plentea back in 2014 when I first heard about it and it still tastes just as fresh as it did 2 years ago!its usually always busy when I go so I don't mind the wait because I think it's worth it. Their fruit teas are hecka good especially when you ask for oolong tea!

Their drinks are about a 4.5 but I give this a 3 star rating because I came in today and service was a lot slower than usual. Like extremely slow. I had one person waiting for their drinks in front me and I didn't understand why mine took 23 minutes to make when it was just fruit teas? The girl in front of me and I both were waiting impatiently as the employees were talking amongst themselves and texting. I noticed this girl just standing around in the front texting and talking to the girl making drinks. That girl texting began taking pictures of her hand with a bandaid on it? And then after she started to make drinks and I think that is absolutely disgusting. She used her phone that is full of bacteria and germs on it and then resumed to making drinks without washing her hands. And her bandaid? Why didn't she wear a glove over that hand when making drinks to prevent it from falling off? Oh I know why..... It's because she doesn't even wash her hands before making drinks. Their drinks are good but their employees obviously do not care about their customers health safety. 

Here's are pictures of the girl on her phone and then taking a picture of her hand. Enjoy!
author: Sabrina N.

description: Taste-wise the milk tea is on par with other places but I was expecting more. Most of they hype surrounding Plentea is the glass bottle you get to keep, but the drinks are more expensive than average. The boba pearls I do like, as they are very firm and chewy.
author: Brian G.

description: When ever I go downtown sf, I go here. They serve their drinks in a glass bottles which you can take home. If you can't finish your tea, they provide lids. My personal favorite is the matcha milk tea. They use a whisk to mix the matcha before they pour it in the glass. This process is done in front of you.
author: Katelynn N.

description:
