Only in SF would people pay $4.50-$6.50 to drink boba out of a cute glass bottle. Granted you get a discount (10%, I believe) if you bring back the glass bottle for your next drink, you're really not saving that much! 

If you're looking for something refreshing, go with the honey lemon tea with aloe.

I bet I'll be back, but only when my friends want to check out this place to get the cute bottles! Great marketing with the bottles, Plentea. Round of applause.
author: Christine S.

description: They located in the right location in Financial District area. Tea taste okay, but they have a nice refill bottle.
author: Ilma D.

description:
The fresh fruit tea here is really comparable to Tpumps, but what made me like this place better was the fresh fruit bits and more options of topping add-ins other than tapioca such as aloe, lychee jelly, taro pudding, egg pudding and more.

I came in around a little after they opened at 11:30am so thankfully no line at all. This was my first time here so I kinda wanted to play it safe and ended up getting what I usually order at Tpumps, which is peach green tea except I was able to add aloe and tapioca. It was really light, refreshing and I liked how the peach flavor wasn't noticeably syrupy. I also loved the bursts of freshness I'd get from biting into the aloe and fresh peach chunks. They aren't stingy with tapioca so the the boba to tea ratio is good, I ended up having leftover boba once I finished the tea. The tapioca texture could be a little softer though.

My coworker recommended the brown sugar milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca, but it sounded a little daring to try for my first time. I soon regretted not getting it after trying hers. The milk tea wasn't too sweet at all and the egg pudding was a nice, soft add in. I'll probably be back to get that one.

It is a pretty pricier than normal boba spots, but like most peeps said the extra is paying for the reusable glass bottle which is pretty neat. $13 sounds a lot for 2 drinks here, but I wouldn't mind having it once in awhile since I'd most likely only get it if I was around the area. Making a trip deep into downtown/chinatown  for expensive boba and a long wait is kinda ridic.
author: Georgina G.

description:
Note to public self:  They only give out 300 signature Plentea glass bottles per day so arrive here before 2pm before they sell out!  

If you return to this boba shop with the cute empty glass bottle, you get a 10 percent discount on your order of a drink.  Tax free I would say. 

My first time arriving here and it was after 3pm and they ran out of the glass bottles, of course.  Instead, they serve the drinks up in a standard plastic boba container.  I ordered up one of their house special drinks, which is the Lavendar Lemonade, with boba.  It was too sweet, in my opinion!  Sugary sweet with the honey boba already in it and the lemonade was like a soda drink with lavendar flavor.  Save yourself and skip this drink!  Order another type!  Quite pricey for a boba drink (try about 5-6 dollars), but I guess the idea is to be paying for the glass bottle, ultimately (which they ran out of by the time I came).  

Service was nice and polite.  She mentioned about coming here before 2pm for the glass bottles next time around. 

They serve up Belgium Waffles with toppings if you want that with your drink! I just came for their drink, however.  They also have a nice lounge to dine in, upstairs.  It's pretty cozy.

Other than their adorable milk bottles, I think it is too pricey for a boba drink!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
They're pretty clever with their advertising because a free glass jar with the purchase of my peach green tea got me to check it out! I had added grass jelly and I was also able to try a regular milk tea with grass jelly as well. The grass jelly didn't mix too well with the milk tea and continued to float about the liquids until the tea was nearly half way down the jar. It was surprisingly bitter. 
The peach green tea on the other hand was very sweet and sour from the amount of honey and the chunks of peach I presume. 
Overall, I'm happy with the jar, but I probably wouldn't pay the same price without it.
author: Linda K.

description:
Cute place, okay tea. 

The place is really nice and has lots of cute decorations (especially since it was almost Halloween) They also have a second floor so there's lots of space to sit!

My friends and I all wanted to try this place since we were in city but it was pretty disappointing. I got the Jujube Honey Flavored tea and I watched as they put real honey and fruit inside the glass jar and shake it up. However, it just ended up tasting like a sweet tea with not a lot of flavor - I couldn't even taste the fruit.

My friend got a cold Almond Milk Tea with boba and her drink came out warm. Not hot or cold (which were the two options), but just warm. 

Another friend got lavender lemonade and the lemonade is actually sparkling (since they added sparkling water to it). I'm not a big fan of the lavender but I thought they drink was pretty unique. 

Everyone thought their drinks were interesting but nobody really enjoyed it that much, especially for $5+ a drink.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Tried out Plentea because there was no line outside, but inside was about 5 customers in front of me, it moved pretty fast.

Girl couldn't hear me because it's loud over there.  I wanted Oolong milk tea No bobas $4.5 - with .39tax = $4.89!  It came in the glass container.  I think the glass container is just ok, wish the prices were lower though.  Drink was sweet and nothing special.

Can I get my money back for the glass jar without buying another drink??  I really don't want to go back there and carry that heavy sucker.

Can't even use my credit card because they have a $15 minimum!  Sucky place doing illegal sh*t.

NO Bathrooms even, gotta use the garage bathroom the cashier told someone else.

Some seating in the main area, more upstairs.
author: Ann L.

description:
I'm a huge fan of bubble tea so when I was finally able to visit Plentea I was very excited to try it out! Walking into the location, there is typically at least a bit of a line going out the door, but what good place doesn't especially in San Francisco?

The decor is very cute and cozy especially if you go into the upstairs area! I ordered a matcha milk green tea with boba which was a little over $5 but it was well worth it! I thought it was very refreshing and especially nice with the glass milk jar they give you. Next time I'd like to try the avocado milk tea that turns out to be one of the staffs favorites.

They have a card charge of at least $10 so be mindful of that! Otherwise if I lived in the area I would come all the time, so get yourself some good bubble tea!
author: Samantha M.

description:
Been wanting to come here for awhile and I just wasn't impressed. Maybe I should have opted for a tea instead of the lavender lemonade. But I love lavender! There was no lavender taste at all and this definitely wasn't regular lemonade. It just tasted like sweetener and sparkling water (which I found out it was just flavored sweetener and sparkling water). It wasn't even lemon flavored in my opinion. They put limes in mine and that's all I could taste.

The girl at the register was sweet and she tried to fix it for me putting a lot more of the flavoring (which she said was a combo of lemon and lavender syrup). And i definitely love the bottles they serve them in. But I probably won't be coming back any time soon because what I had just wasn't good.
author: Lillian R.

description: Plentea has good tapioca and the tea is ok. The bottle is glass and very nice. It is expensive but good.
author: Sierra T.

description:
So the only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because of the service. The bubble tea is excellent. The service was lacking. Unfriendly rushed order taking - literally the only people in the store at the time, but acted like there was a line out the door. Forgot to mention my Yelp check-in coupon for 15%off, when I brought it up he stared at me and gave me a look like do you really want me to start over the order? 

I get it, the transaction was done, and he probably wanted to go home and it was a minimal discount, but staring at me and not even offering to honor the discount was super rude. I'd try it again only because the boba was really delicious but the service left a lot to be desired. Not impressed.
author: Morgan J.

description:
I think this is a new place. There was no sign in the front so we walk pass by it not knowing it. The place is small so if you are looking for it, look into the store! :) Glad I yelp what is the best boba place in SF.

The place is an upscale Boba/Tea, the price is a bit more pricy $5+ for 1 drink. It's clean, cute and simple. It taste really good and the boba stays soft after it's been in the cold drink forever, it's sweet and I just love the tea. I though the glass bottle is hecka cute and love it and that's why its pricy. Once in a while, I would come again. But it wouldn't be a everyday thing.

I recommend everyone to try this place out. I want more!
author: Christina H.

description:
Very fresh tea with natural flavoring but really pricey! This is definitely the most expensive boba place I've ever been to. It cost over $5 for my lemon honey tea with aloe. 

I enjoyed my drink a lot since they used real lemon juice inside, and the aloe was very sweet and tasty. Drinks here come in a glass, which also makes it a unique experience. If you're looking for a good boba place, definitely swing by...but watch out cause your wallet might sting a bit! :P
author: Sophia H.

description:
Wanted to go to boba guys but it closes on Sundays.  Plentea was my next boba place to go to.  I heard about plentea through YouTuber - Weylie. 

Line was not long but waited 15-20 min, then another 5 minutes for my drink. I ordered Matcha Green milk tea with herbal jelly. It was not too sweet and I like that. I get to keep the jar so I think it's worth $5.5 -$6! 

I didn't think it was anything special so I didn't give a 5 star.
author: Cindy G.

description:
I've read practically all of the reviews at Plentea, so trust me, I knew I was in for an expensive milk tea before I arrived. I had also been warned about the unfriendly cashier who practically was rolling her eyes at me the entire time while I asked her questions.

* BLACK TEA CREMA WITH PUDDING (~$5.50) - 4 STARS:
Tea crema was rich and thick and reminded me of Purple Kow and Half and Half. Just a few hours earlier I had One Plus Tea House's version which made it clear how Plentea's quality was far above the many copy cats out there. The tapioca was perfectly cooked and the egg pudding was standard but good. The tea is good, not quite as strong and bitter as boba guys. I asked for 50% sweet and it was the perfect sweetness. 

* ICE MILK (BROWN SUGAR) (~$5.50) - 3 STARS:
I expected the ice milk to be akin to PK or HH but really it left me wanting more. It's not as rich and creamy, and way too sweet (make sure to ask for it 25-50% sweet).

* PEACH FRUIT TEA ($4.95) - 3 STARS:
Their fruit teas are merely a black tea with a fruit syrup mixed with fresh cut fruit. The peach tea was way too sweet for my liking.

I enjoyed my black tea crema and the perfectly cooked tapioca balls. Despite the price, I could see myself coming back if I needed an emergency boba mid work day. Perhaps if there was no line, or perhaps if the cashier didn't have her eyes permanently rolling around, this might be a 4-STAR establishment.

Note: no hot drinks. All tea is caffeinated. A few decaf options - fruit drinks and lemonade.
author: Jess C.

description:
Plentea is not worth the hype anymore. I've noticed that some of the milk teas seem to be premade rather than shaken and made to order. Even chain shops like Sharetea or T4 will make it to order. And they definitely use high fructose corn syrup and cheap tea leaves like the chain shops above. 

You're really just paying for a glass jar. Their drinks aren't bad, but they're not good either. My oolong milk tea was average, but my boyfriend got a fresh strawberry green milk tea & it honestly just tasted like a liquified hi-chew. If you're looking for just a drink, skip here. If you're looking for an Instagram or aesthetic snap story, stop by, but be prepared to pay at least $5-6.
author: S R.

description:
Do NOT get the nutella boba. It was a waste of my $5. Zero flavor. Tasted like they just added hershey's chocolate syrup into a regular black tea boba. Bye $5.

Okay what makes me give them 1 star is that they gave me regular milk instead of almond milk like I requested, and I'm sensitive to dairy. Really upset that they were so careless, especially since I have a food sensitivity.
author: Ashlee B.

description:
On the expensive side, but definitely good tea - probably one of the most talked about in SF. The tea is served in a glass bottle, and you receive a discount if you remember to bring the bottle back (what a great branding strategy!). Even with the discount though, two teas with boba cost $11.50. 

Knocked down one star because the tables were in *desperate* need of cleaning (every single one had something spilled on it) - but only one star because the shop is crazy busy. It's understandable that the workers don't have the time to escape the kitchen and squeeze between crowds to mop. If you're looking for seating, the upstairs was emptier.

It's in downtown SF, so an easy enough place to stop by while exploring or running errands. I ordered the mango fresh fruit tea with tapioca pearls. It tasted great, although their shreds of fruit were a variety of sizes (some too big for the straw lol). It seemed like they were trying to emphasize how freshly cut the fruit was. The tapioca probably wasn't the right complement, but the pearls were perfect. I also tasted my friend's coffee milk tea - definitely tastes like it would give you a caffeine boost! I'll be back to try the black milk tea and the peach fresh fruit tea.
author: Varsha S.

description:
When it comes to marketing, Plentea got it down to a T.  Serving boba in a glass bottle is getting people in the door.  Right as 11am hit this morning, the line was already forming and as soon as its door opened, line went out the door.  I know we're in the FiDi and all, but I was quite shock everyone was getting their boba fix so early in the day.  Mind you, they only serve a certain amount of drinks in their glass bottle each day which may be the reason people are flocking here right when they open.  It's a cute bottle to keep but if you bring it back during your next visit, you will get a discount.

Drink menu is quite extensive, they offer a variety of different options aside from just your usual flavored milk teas and green/black fruit teas.  They also have iced milk w/ pudding (brown sugar or caramel) as well as fruit smoothies and fruit milk (strawberry, blueberry, peach, mango, honeydew, avocado, etc.).  They even have a seasonal section for their taro milk, matcha green tea, lavender lemonade, matcha slush, etc,)

Granted they serve these drinks in a glass bottle, but at their price point, you are not getting much drink in return for the cost.  My Brown Sugar Iced Milk w/ Pudding was tasty, but at $4.95 + tax ($5.38 total), one may reconsider.  The drink barely made it back to the office after only a few sips.  It's crazy how even boba made its mark in the FiDi to charge such prices.

I did not see anyone order from the side menu, but they do also offer an array of savory waffle sandwiches and Belgian waffles, along with a few other dessert items.  

Plentea is spacious and there's a good amount of seating both upstairs and down.  However, this is only a good place to stop by if you are in the area or works down in the FiDi.  It definitely works for the working class clientele but I wouldn't suggest making a trek down here just to try it.  Parking is just virtually impossible in the area (sadly).
author: Janetto L.

description:
Let's say the best thing about the place is the bottle.

I should have know when I walked in and there was a "service dog"/poodle wear shoes with his owners waiting for their drinks, "Banana Republicesque" techno blaring in the background. At first glance, the menu seemed simple enough however, I should have run for the hills when I saw the word "premium" tea on one item, as if there used cheap tea in their other drinks and finally "lavender" on another drink...WTH...never seen that at iTea, ShareTea or any other "fiil in the blank here"Tea joint. 

Needless to say I waited to see the proof in the pudding...our group had 4 different drinks, first thing I noticed the scant use of very mediocre toppings, really, where is the bubble in my bubble tea. Never mind the fact I didn't taste any tea in my drink. Nuff said as they say in HK "more saliva/talk than tea". Give me a properly built tea with polypropylene cup and heat sealed lid, keep the damn bottle.
author: vic f.

description:
Plentea has a unique novelty of jars that other boba places don't have. If you order a cold drink, you get it in a cute branded jar that you can take home and then reuse to purchase a drink at a cheaper price the next time you're in.

I don't like matcha, but I like Plentea's matcha green milk tea simply because it didn't really taste like matcha. It was the perfect sweetness, but for people looking for that solid matcha taste, you won't find it in this drink.

I also had the black milk tea with tapioca. It tasted like chocolate and coffee. Nothing about it remind me of milk tea. It kind of reminded me of the chocolate milk cartons you got in grade school. The tapioca was also very very sweet and hard (way too chewy). Also, it seems like the drink was much more caffeinated than other drinks I've had. I had such a hard time sleeping after drinking this at 9 PM. I was wired until 3 AM. Never again.

I would probably only come back for the "matcha" green milk tea. Plus, drinking from a jar is more fun than drinking from a paper cup.
author: Denise L.

description: yesss bih first time here and so much yyaassss. lmao we get to keep the glass so that's lit
author: Nam L.

description:
I really don't care what people say.  I just love it here.  The line was never long when we stop by (what can I say, I'm just lucky).  Their black milk tea is delicious and not too sweet.  Most boba places tense to over sweeten their tea for some reason.  Hey, I'm trying not to have diabetes here.  Love it!  I always add boba with my milk tea but surprisingly I never thought about adding grass jelly in the mixture.

I must try it next time. Their waffle is good, I would say its standard.  Waffle, Nutella, Strawberries, Powder Sugar and Whip Cream to the side. 

Nice small spot to hang out with friends.  The décor is simple and to the point.  I like the free glass vase.  I now have 3 and uses them as my flower vase at work.
author: Lien C.

description:
Come for the Instagram picture. 

It's the bottle that gets people in, but I do wonder if it makes people come back. There was a long line when I was drinking my 25% sugar  oolong milk tea, and saw two people in line who already had bottles. Who knows.

Anyways, the tea is good, but nothing to write home about. It's pricey, and I like how you can change the sweet level, but I wish you could go lower than 25% sweet because it was already very sweet. Not bad service, cute comfy chairs.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Tried the milk tea today, and it was infinitely! better than the lemon black tea. 

Soooooooo. Smoooootthh. Mmmmm

Makes sense I suppose. Milk tea seems to be their specialty!
author: Henry L.

description:
My boyfriend and I came with a mission: Acquire a Plentea glass bottle for the novelty! 

THE WAIT: Long line during the weekday lunch and early afternoon. We placed our name on the Ramen Underground wait list before getting in line. With four parties of two ahead of us for R.U., we managed to get seated before acquiring our drinks. A good deal of the waiting came after the ordering. With Plentea being this poppin', you'd think they'd have come up with a system to speed it up. Waiting ~15 minutes for one drink is slow.

THE DRINKS: First we ordered the Crema Oolong Tea with boba and enjoyed that after our ramen lunch but while waiting in line again for another drink. Crema Oolong Tea, bomb! Boba, soft and sweet. Second drink was a black milk tea with boba. The BMT was good with a strong black tea flavor. Overall, Crema Oolong reigned superior. Came out with TWO glass bottles. It was worth the experience but definitely not worth coming back frequently for $6 per drink. It was good but not THAT good. That's hella pricy for boba. A drink is not worth the price even with the 10% discount when bringing the bottle back for reuse.

THE SERVICE: Bad. As a first timer, I asked the cashier how different the Crema Oolong Tea and Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea taste and which she preferred. Her response: "Well, one has sea salt, you know, so it depends if, you know, you want your drink salty... or not salty." ... ... Okay you know what, forget it. I went with without the sea salt to be safe and the drink was delicious. My friend who comes here vouches for the deliciousness of the oolong with sea salt so I guess that scenario would have been a win-win. This friend and I can agree on this kinda chubby female Chinese/Taiwanese cashier with long black hair, round pale face, and black-rimmed glasses to be of no help when it comes to answering your questions!
author: Liana F.

description:
I'm so glad I discovered this place on Instagram! I don't even know what hashtag I was searching, but I somehow stumbled onto some food blogger's Instagram account and bookmarked this spot immediately because I really wanted the bottle.

I really love the concept of the bottle to take home because it's "green" and it's a pretty novel concept for the bubble tea world. If only they would start one in Seattle too...

Anyway, a group of us ordered a variety of drinks that ranged from regular milk tea, ice milk, fruit tea, and green milk tea. They made for really cute photos.

I tried all of them and they were really tasty, especially the fruit tea with strawberry. The ice milk with pudding was also spectacular. I probably should've asked for more sugar in mine but I opted for 50% sugar, so it wasn't as sweet, but probably healthier.

The honey boba was the BEST part!!! And also the unhealthiest, but whatever, I was on vacation. The food also looked amazing, like the savory and sweet waffles. Seems like a cute spot for breakfast or brunch too. Prices are little big higher than your usual boba joint, but hey, they are sustainable, and I'm willing to pay a bit more to take home the bottle.

The interior was cozy and modern; very chic.

They are still working out their kinks so there might be a line... but then again, aren't there lines everywhere you go in SF?
author: Nina H.

description:
Another bubble tea place in Chinatown. Their USP is their glass bottle containers which is great but makes their prices more expensive (they're on the more expensive side of bubble tea places I've been to)

The glass bottles are fully recyclable and should be reused. The problem is they only come with a plastic cap. You do, however, get a 10% discount if you bring the glass bottle back in but seriously who is going to lug the bottle around the City for this unless you're really next door - the bottles are heavy. 

The tea itself was ok. Wasn't anything special in my view - they're really riding on the glass bottle hype in my view.  We came on a hot day and it was a sauna inside - no air conditioning. 

My biggest gripe though is the fact there is a $10 minimum for using your CC!  No one uses cash anymore and if you buy one bubble tea it's not going to hit the minimum. Quite annoying.
author: Darryl I.

description:
Plentea does not have plenty of bottles. Make note, they're running low. 

Came here with some colleagues on my last official day working in Chinatown. I'd been meaning to come here for a bit, for the aforementioned bottles. Lo and behold...at 4PM, a dude walks outside with a sign that says no more bottles at 4PM. Evidently they're only using 300 bottles (per day until July), then plastics all around. Says the environment "screw you!"

We were hopeful. As we approached, we though MAYBE we'd still get some. Prayed (not really) to the bottle gods for some luck. Bottles were flying out left and right.  I mean, we saw plenty of bottles in the back (no pun intended). But. Alas, they killed the bottles at the group in front of us. This system seemed to confuse even our cashier, Crystal was her name (as evidenced by the receipt). 

Guy (upon Crystal's confusion): Would you be ok with plastic?
Colleague: Do I have a choice?
Guy: No...


Ordered the sea salt crema oolong tea...and holy salty. Or. Should I say SalTEA? No? FINE. I'll take my puns elsewhere. The crema was fine, but perhaps lighten up on the salt content. And...maybe if you don't know how to drink crema, don't order it. 


White girl: How do you drink this?
Guy: Umm..
WG: Do I mix it?
G: NO! Sip from the bottom and pull the straw upward to get the crema at the end.
WG: ohhh!!

There. Now I explained it. Don't be that idiot. 

Oh. BTW. Now that school's out, guess where the kiddies are??? Yeah. Line, x3. Also. Kiddies. DON'T STAND NEXT TO THE COUNTER PEOPLE PICK UP THEIR ORDERS AT!! Tripped over 4 kiddies to get to the salty tea.
author: Lily W.

description:
The drinks arn't so bad but the one hook they have is the adorable glass bottles. It is on the pricey side for just boba but it includes the bottle.

Their ice-milk is similar to half & half in Socal, its pretty decent with brown sugar but a slightly heavier sweetness for my taste. I'm more of a light and fruity drink type of girl. The fresh peach black tea was very light and refreshing. It has fresh fruit pieces in it which is a plus. I've only tried the mango and peach but so far peach is my favorite.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I won't lie, I gave into the hype. If a new place is on my Instagram feed more than 5 times, I definitely have to try the place out for myself.

Just went in (Monday night around 9) and there was only one other person in line before us and a few people sitting around enjoying their drinks. The wait time for the drinks to be prepared was less than 5 minutes. I would definitely go on a weeknight to avoid an hour wait like I read on other reviews. 

We ordered one green milk tea with boba and one without, peach oolong, strawberry oolong and honey lemon tea. 

The green milk tea is okay, kind of too watery for my taste but gets better as you continue to drink it.. I could go without this next time. I think their success is in their flavored teas because I really liked the strawberry and peach. The teas still hold their real tea flavor while complimented by a sweet flavor. They also have real cut up fruit pieces in the tea. The honey lemon was average, something you can easily make at home. 

Also, I'm sure you all know by now that you get to keep the bottle it's served in and you can bring it in on your next visit for 20% off your next drink.

I'll be back to try other things on the menu like the blueberry milk.. Sounds good.
author: Tiff C.

description:
My addiction to tea drinks is really a bad thing.  So bad that it drives me to places that I try to avoid, like the Financial District.  Nothing personal, but I left that career path decades ago.  But then Plentea had to open up and draw me back, reminding me of my years running down the street in my skirt and running shoes with high heels in tow.  Not my proudest fashion moments, but there you go.  

Anywho, something about getting tea drinks in a reusable bottle speaks to my inner sustainable-life self.  I wish all places did this, because we don't need more landfill, seriously.  I love being able to bring back these bottles and get a discount on my sea salt crema oolong tea.  Even my family are into it with their mango tea with lychee and boba or strawberry tea with boba.  May be the best tea drinks we've had in a while.

Are they doing a kickstarter on a different location by chance?  Cause if they are looking to open one in the peninsula, I'm in.

Don't be thirsty - drink your tea.
author: Maria S.

description:
Quite cool that their drinks come in glass bottles; the bottles even have their name on them! They start putting the drinks in plastic cups after they run out of bottles, which seems to be the first 200 or 300. If you opt for the cups rather than the bottles, you'll receive 20% off your drink. Also, bring back your bottle next time for a discount!

Went in and ordered an ice milk green tea with an addition of honey tapioca. Total came out to $5.44, which is pricey, but the tea quality does taste better. If you usually like your drink sweeter, this may not be the one for you.

Second time around, I ordered the peach green tea. They had fruit chunks but the entire drink just tasted bland, watered down, and artificial. Still pricey at $5.38!

I really wish I liked this place more as the decor and desserts seem so cute. The bottle is a nice touch though!
author: Kristi T.

description:
The only way you can look cooler than drinking boba out of a Plentea glass bottle is if you drink boba straight out of a Patron Tequila bottle.

But there's a price to looking cool. In fact, it's almost $5 after tax for most of their drinks +boba (Lemon Tea, Milk Tea, Fruit-Flavored Tea). For their fresh smoothies +boba, it'll run you to almost $8.

If you bring their HEAVY glass bottle back, you get 20% off your next purchase. But I kept mine to use as dumbbells at home, because 20% off later, its still pricey.
(tip: fill them with Gatorade to consolidate your workout space)

While I'm not a big fan of Plentea's prices, I bet I'll be coming here again and again. There's always going to be that one friend who hasn't tried it yet. Maybe I'll try their Belgian Waffles instead of getting their drinks.
author: Ringo M.

description: I got the Nutella Milk Tea HOT and it was pretty gross. Maybe if I had gotten it cold. The service is good but it's hard to understand the employees though they are very nice. Just didn't have a good experience with my order.
author: Laura T.

description:
This boba comes with an aesthetic tax. There's a charm in being served a glass bottle, and good intentions towards the environment. But it's not very nice on your wallet unless you have a good memory--bringing the bottle back gives you a 10% discount.

I don't understand the long line. There are a handful of boba shops in FiDi/Chinatown, most of which taste better than this location. My reception of the tapioca was tepid, at best, and the tea was too sweet, even with a reduced amount of sweetness. 

That being said, this is a good location to do work. There's a second floor, and a good amount of couches and tables. It has that Scandinavian meets kitchy Pinterest-worthy terrarium garden feeling. I plugged my laptop in and worked away for an hour or two before moving onto a less crowded location. Not the best, not the worst.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I've been super excited to come to Plentea just for their jar but the drinks ended up being pretty good also. I walked from Union Square to here and it was a easy walk. Less than 10 minutes if I can remember correctly. My date and I both got the Sea Salt Creama with egg pudding and it tasted very good compare to most spots. The egg pudding was really fresh. Each drink was about $4.75!

Tips:
- If you bring back your old jar next time you come in, they will give you 10% off! I'LL BE BACK!
author: Danny L.

description:
Always my to go place for boba in the city
Service is great and the boba is extremely chewy. The drinks can be a bit sweet but you can adjust that. Parking is a bit annoying but it's right next to Chinatown.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
On my way there, multiple Asians holding glass jars filled to the brim with milk tea caught my eye. As I pull out my phone to yelp the exact location, I spot a giant line coming out of a shiny new bamboo store front. Ah, there it is. 

30 minutes later in the scorching heat, I finally get to second in line and oh guess what, 3 ladies who've been standing in line just as long as me, if not longer DON'T KNOW WHAT THEY EFFING WANT. Seriously people, you've had 30 minutes to decide. FINALLY, I get to the front and viola, ordered in 30 seconds and paid (a spendy) $5.45. 

I get my beverage pretty quickly and am glassy eyed ogling the nifty jar. 

45 seconds later, the novelty has worn off and my hand/arm is getting tired from holding this heavy ass jug. 

It was cool, but I doubt I'll come back, especially with that price tag. Boba guys has jasmine milk tea which happens to be my favorite. Plentea only offers black, green, oolong, and thai. Step up your game!!
author: Angela L.

description:
I wrote tip saying they ran out of bottles awhile ago. It made me pretty upset because the workers told me new shipments of bottles were "coming tomorrow." I actually came the next day but they said tomorrow again and I came a week later and they still said "tomorrow." I'm aware of their 300 bottles a day policy but during this time their inventory was actually empty. 
I wouldn't write a bad yelp review based on low inventory, because it happens, but I think the workers should've gave a realistic estimate of when the new shipments would arrive. It's giving false hope because some faithful customers might actually come back the next day.

Here's a review of their drinks: The drinks come out within a few minutes no matter how long the line is so that's a huge plus. The bottles are so cute and they come with a cap so you can take it to go as well. "Sweet milk tea" is the best description I can give. You can taste the milk, you can taste the tea, and it's very sweet. The toppings are also very sweet but I enjoy the sweetness. If you don't like your milk tea sweet I'm sure you can ask for less sugar. They have very unique flavors and I still have to try a lot of them. Definitely worth it and if you don't like it then at least you get to go home with a cute bottle.
author: Kimmy L.

description:
Literally one of the cutest tea places I have ever come across. No other tea place can compare to the bottles, minimalistic walls, and (small) upstairs section with a nice loft-style view of the downstairs. The most Instagram-worthy cafe there is out there. It is kind of small though so I assume that it can get crowded at times, but everything else about the shop aesthetics is 5/5.

Now, on to the tea. So I have not tried much from the wide variety of their menu, but when I tried the Fresh Fruit tea (peach), the tea was comparable to my all-time favorite tea shop, Fantasia. The flavor was strong enough and not extremely artificial, so 5/5 on the tea. However, I would say that the tapioca is a little more harder than I wanted but still decently chewy. 4/5 for the pearls only because I am biased to Fantasia's incredibly soft, chewy ones.

So overall, I would give it around a 4.75/5. Trust me, the bottle and wide variety of drinks is worth it; there's milk tea, coffee, fruit tea, matcha latte, and my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.
author: Angela T.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Such a great environment and the staff is extremely helpful (if it's your first time) and kind! Almost all drinks costing 4.50 but getting an adorable reusable milk jug with your purchase is worth it! (also 10% off if you bring it back) I love how eco friendly you guys are the only thing I would recommend next are PAPER STRAWS ;) a little XTRA but if you're already giving out glass you might as well go all the way & get rid of the plastic! Either way its a great place Nutella tea is my boyfriends fav. And I go for the Matcha with Almond milk & chia seeds! SO GOOD AND REFRESHING!
author: Hanna W.

description:
I highly recommend their strawberry black tea with aloe, sea salt crema oolong tea and their pastrami waffle sandwich. They are freaking good! 

Their turkey waffle sandwich is good too, but I think the pastrami tasted waaaaaaay better!

I've also tried their pastrami salad and I think it's okay.

DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT get the drinks with pearl/boba! They are hard! 

No restrooms here!
author: Alice X.

description:
It's great that there's finally a decent boba place near where I work!!! I never understood why there weren't good places in downtown.

I've been here twice and had two different drinks - first was a mango green tea, and second time I had papaya milk. 

I would say their milk tea is decent but nothing great. Doesn't deserve the $4.50 or $4.95 they charge you. 

BUT THEIR FRUIT MILKS. I could go on all day about them! And I don't even like milk normally! The papaya milk was extremely tasty and fresh. Not only were there still bits of papaya floating around in the drink, but they also used really yummy ripe papaya for maximum deliciousness!! ^_^

Had some friends who tried the strawberry milk, and while I didn't try any, they swore by it and called it their new favorite drink.

As far as the space itself goes, there are two floors - the first floor and half of a second floor above with some more cozy seating. Both times I was there (once at 3 pm on Wed and once at 11:30 am on a Thu), there weren't too people sitting inside, so it was pretty easy for my friends and I to find a spot to sit and take a nice little break from work.

As much as I love this place's fruity milk drinks (they're the main reason behind the 4 stars), I have to admit there are some cons:
-pricy
-no credit cards accepted under $10
-no rewards system (okay this isn't really that big of a deal, but given how many times I see myself coming here, I really hope they implement something soon!)
author: Dianna H.

description:
Avocado milk is tasty, creamy, and filling. Other flavors to try- sea salt crema oolong tea (most popular, so I hear), matcha milk green tea, and taro milk. 

I like variety and choices, which Plentea has in their drink flavors and toppings (honey boba, egg pudding, taro pudding, aloe, lychee jelly, grass jelly). I don't usually get these drinks, but their unique flavors has me yearning to come back. 

Other notes- Come during off hours. I went on a weekday around 11am, and there was no line. I like their clean, simplistic interior design. And the glass jars are fun.

Downside is $10 minimum credit card charge. Boo. Makes for a poor customer experience, so downgrade to 3 stars.
author: Joanna L.

description:
I was bribed to come try this place for their glass milk jugs despite the expensive prices (which include the milk jug to be fair enough). They claim that they can only serve up to 200 milk jugs in the morning and 200 milk jugs in the evening starting at 6PM (but honestly my own theory is that this is a advertising rouse because I came at 330PM and they still had heaping boxes full of milk jugs)

They're not real milk jugs! I thought they were.. they resemble them but they are more square-ish shape. Real milk jugs back in the day were circular...but it's okay! I'm still going to use them to drink milk! If you want a plastic cap for your milk jug, it's in the basket on the table where you pick up your jugs. Also, if you bring back your milk jug, make sure it's clean b/c they don't wash it for you! And 10% off your drink for saving the environment?? Yes, yes? I'm hoping that's their initial motive for this milk jug! Haha, or if you don't want a milk jug to begin with, just tell them you want it served in a regular plastic cup and they'll subtract 10% off the expensive price for not buying their milk jug hahahaha 

Line seems long because they work slow and the place is short so it goes out the doorway. there are tables on both sides to sit and also an upstairs lounge area (look nice too)!

Taro Milk: THIS IS NOT TARO MILK TEA OKAY? THIS IS NOT TEA. I REPEAT!! This is REAL taro chunks served with MILK only!! No tea in it! Different from the regular use of taro powder with tea. It tastes different but good because it's real taro for once! And it's white... remember... taro is not purple.. it's white... so don't be fooled.. 

Black Milk Tea: very good classic milk tea. cannot go wrong with any of their milk teas! they have black, green, oolong, and one more i forgot.. their honey boba is actually sweet and chewy! i approve :) 

Creama Oolong Tea: Delicious and looks flattering for pictures! do not mix your jug! it will start to mix on it's own.. just leave it be :) You can also order it with sea salt, but i personally heard that sea salt makes it too salty.. i'll try it next time but it's yummy the way it is!! :) 

Pros:
-cute milk jugs with their name engraved in it.. i finally understand.. PLENTEA like plenty.. of tea... i'm slow :D :D 
-also provides plastic lids too! and they seal pretty tight! my BF shook it with the lid on and nothing leaked out! BRAVoO :) 
-delicious teas but small selections

Cons: 
-location is hard.. in the heart of downtown SF where parking is so hard and impossible! I wanna come back here but maybe not on a regular basis just when I want boba.. maybe if I'm already shopping there or it's convenient.. otherwise i think this place is a gem for people that work in downtown SF and want good boba :) 
-expensive But it's cause of the milk jugs haha
author: Cuc N.

description:
Plent(ea) of seating and perfect for a warm day!

I came here yesterday because somehow I still had not tried their drinks after seeing all my friends taste it. It was time!!!

Upon entering, the shop is much larger than I originally expected! There's lots of open space, natural lighting, and plenty of seating on the first floor AND second floor! Okay, really, how many boba shops have an upstairs in San Francisco? Pretty awesome!

I ordered the lavender lemonade! It's a very crisp, refreshing drink! The lemonade is perfect with the sparkling water in that it doesn't get too sweet! Although, I was a little disappointed that I didn't taste much lavender. That's the only thing I would change about the drink.. and it might be nicer to add a topping. Other than that, it's a decent drink for the price ($5) since you get a glass bottle out of it. 

I wouldn't mind coming here again for the other flavors if I'm in the area!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
(4.5) My office orders milk teas often. Plentea has a solid selection of hot and cold drinks, including a popular Nutella milk tea which can be served hot or cold. Good selection of toppings.

All teas come in returnable glass bottles which can make things tricky when on the go.
author: Irina P.

description:
Plentea satisfied my thirst for bubble tea ever since I moved to the bay area. I was spoiled by overflow of bubble tea options in New York City and I haven't had a chance to try them in San Francisco. Plentea was a great introduction to the bubble tea world here. 

They have lots of tea options including some creative ones such as Nutella Milk tea and they also offer various toppings other than just bubble. My personal favorite has always been the grass jelly for summer season and the egg pudding around the year. 

You can ask them to decrease sugar and ice level for your preference although the counter girl English isn't very good. 

The price is slightly higher than other places in Chinatown but you do get a nice glass jar out of it. If you reuse it, you get 10% discount.
author: Athena C.

description:
The people who work here are quite nice and friendly. They would help with recommendations and tasted that you're unsure with. 

I came with a group of friends and as out of towners, we took a bit of time deciding. Good thing the workers were patient with us. 

I had the peach fresh fruit tea with boba. I got to say, as someone who use to work at a boba place, their boba was pretty good. It was perfectly chewy and not too sweet. It was cooked all the way through where there wasn't that uncooked powdery center. Good job on the boba. 

The tea itself was pretty tasty. I asked for low sugar and they did as asked. My other friends had the honeydew tea, milk black tea, mango fruit tea, Thai tea, green milk tea, strawberry smoothie, salted cream tea, and some were duplicated. They were all tasty. (Yes, I did my very best to sample them all for the sake of yelp! ) I did like the honeydew one the best. That one tasted pretty awesome. 

Oh and did I forget to mention, you get to keep the glass bottle that it comes in! It even has their name as part of their bottle. Great way of marketing and it's visually appealing too. Pretty drinks in pretty bottles!!!!! 

Oh and there's no bathroom here. Just be warned about that. Their two story location should have one. Oh well. 

Overall: next time I'm up in the area, I would come back just to try the other flavors....and to get those adorable bottles!!!!
author: Kat C.

description:
Today was my first plentea experience and surprisingly it was pretty decent. My friend and I got there at around 1145 and the wait was about 10 minutes. So it wasn't too bad of a wait. I wanted to try the tea cream but I opted for the iced milk. 

Brown sugar iced milk with boba: 3.5/5. Extremely creamy and milky, which I actually love. It's very reminiscent of purple kow but my only gripe was that it was too sweet for me. I would like it if it was a little less sweet. It's pretty cool in the bottle but I'm not sure how often I'll be back to utilize the bottle. It also is kind of pricy for boba, for over $5 a drink, you are mainly paying for the bottle but the drink is still delicious none the less.

Overall, this boba place is decent, it's out of my way but I would come back next time I am in dtsf. I do want to try their sea salt creamas next time. Also they crank out their drinks 100000x faster than purple kow despite having a long line, it's a definite plus!

Total for 1 drink: $5.63
author: Stella J.

description:
Not bad! I was skeptical about boba in the Financial District, but this is actually a super cute place to grab a quick bite (or snack) and either take it to-go or hang out in the upstairs loft area, which has a decent amount of seating. Plus... free WiFi!

I ordered the Peach Green Tea ($4.95) with Aloe, which was pretty good. I feel like they didn't put $0.50 worth of aloe in my drink. Drinks come in a super cute milk bottle so I guess that's what the higher tea price goes towards. That and it's worth bringing back the bottle for 10% off each subsequent drink. Still pretty pricey though, but it's FiDi so what did you expect?

My friend and I also ordered the Strawberry Belgian Waffle ($6.95) which is topped with fresh strawberries, chocolate syrup, almonds, and powdered sugar, alongside a dollop of whipped cream. They took forever to be made, so by the time it got to us, the waffles were cold. The baristas are very delicate with the toppings, though! What intricate decorative abilities. The waffles were overcooked and crunchy, but I suppose some people like it that way. Anyways, this was a good snack choice, and I'm glad we ordered it.

EDIT: I have also tried the Taro Milk, which I mistook for Taro Milk Tea. It's literally taro and milk, where you can taste the bits of taro in the milk. I'm not a big fan, but perhaps it's just not my cup of milk.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Can't believe my best friend and I drove all the way into Downtown SF just for tea! But it was worth it - I now have a new glass bottle for my stars! Guess I won't be going back with the bottle to get that discount...

The wait wasn't too terrible - tolerable and understandable since we went around 1pm, during everybody's lunchtime. The only reason the line goes out the door is because there's nowhere else to stand - small space. Clever. But there is room to sit upstairs - people usually don't because they're in-and-out of there for their lunch break. Customer service is alright - the ordering process does not allow sufficient time for the cashier to be rude anyway.

I got the Peach Oolong with Lychee Jelly. I wished there were more peach bits - fruit bits would make a lovely topping, I think, in comparison to boba/jelly/pudding. It was refreshing on the sunny day, walking around Chinatown. LOVE the plastic caps.

It's definitely one of those things you should try for the experience and the glass bottle. But I wouldn't go into that area JUST for Plentea. You can pretty much get the same stuff (sans glass bottle) at Sharetea or other trending boba places.
author: Athena C.

description: My friends and I have been hearing about the hype about Plentea for a while, so we decided to check it out. I ordered the CoffMilk Tea with tapioca and my friend ordered the Matcha Latte with tapioca, neither of the drinks look like the picture on the menu. Both drinks were alright; I've tasted better. The only cool part about this place is that their bottles come with the drink you order. The service was friendly, but they were extremely slow with making the drinks.
author: Kiersten S.

description:
Recently, Plentea underwent some kind of renovation, menu-wise & ingredients-wise. In my opinion, for the worse. I work nearby, and frequent this location. During the past year, the staff has become noticeably ruder and slower.

- No more almond milk tea!
- No more fruit syrups
- No more FiveStars program. I believe they said they'll still take whatever rewards you have remaining until 5/31/17
- New caps. Previously, they had rubber caps. Now they have these weird plastic caps. You would think it's a screw-on cap, but it's actually a pop-on. Very hard to take back off as well

Based on the recent updates, and the many competitors nearby, I will most likely not be coming back often (or at all).
author: Michael C.

description:
Plentea is my go-to place for gourmet boba. This place is AWESOME because the drinks come in glass bottles that you can choose to take home. If you bring it back, you get 10% off future orders! They also have a good range of flavors and toppings. My favorites include brown sugar milk tea w/ boba and almond milk tea w/ grass jelly. They don't use powder and their boba pearls have never let me down in terms of chewiness and taste.

The atmosphere is pleasant, but it does get loud at times. It gets crowded during busy hours so there may or may not be seats for you (and others). I personally adore the line of cacti lined up along the wall near where you pick up your drinks. I come here whenever I'm in San Francisco and it's a great pick-me-up.
author: Bunny M.

description: Glasses are always fun, but I never remember to bring them with me when I come back. Quality tea that can be really flavorful, but isn't always consistent and I've gone a number of times. My favorite always include any of the drinks with fruit chunks. Wait isn't too bad even with a long line. Wish they had a bathroom though.
author: Arleah A.

description: Was strolling around Chinatown/Union Square Area and decided to get some milk tea. This was my first time trying out Plentea and the line went out the door. First impression of this place was that it must be pretty good. I decided to get Coffmilk Tea with boba (tapioca) and to me it just tastes like your average ice coffee. It was a bit water down and lacked in flavor. Don't get me wrong, the recycled glass bottle is unique but the milk tea I got was not up to par. I've heard from friends that recommend to get other drinks on their menu that are not milk teas are better and I might consider coming back to give it another try!
author: Devin T.

description: Came in last night as Boba Guys didn't take their last customer.. =(  Surprisingly, this place has delicious tasty full flavored teas with perfect chewy bubbles and of course their awesome bottles! I am glad I found this place and will be coming back for sure!
author: Sabrina F.

description: Their drinks are out of this world and the staff is very sweet! I love the glass bottles and the high quality ingredients!
author: Annalyssa B.

description:
I got the Peach Oolong Milk Tea. It was pretty good! It wasn't amazing though. if I was in the area I will try it again. But I wouldn't go out of my way to go there. I believe people like coming here because of the Jar. I agree. Thats what attracted me. 

I like the pudding here as well. I think this place has probably one of the best puddings. I would have to come back her again to try their other stuff. Its kind of pricey, I guess its because of the jar. If you haven't been... its worth a try I suppose.
author: Christina T.

description:
I only really enjoyed this place because my friend and I got there during some kind of lull period when the line was short (7:45pm on a Wednesday), and we were able to get a spot in the comfy seating area upstairs. After about 15 minutes, though, all the seating was filled and the line was out the door. 

I thought I would love my drink (strawberry green tea with aloe) because it was actually made of real fruit, but it was WAY too sweet... Even when I asked for 50% sugar. If you're like me and usually get half sugar, try asking them for even less. They do have some delicious-looking snacks/desserts, which I might take a chance on if I ever stop by again. 

Yup, the bottles are adorable and definitely upped my Plentea rating from a 2 to a 3. But I probably won't be going out of my way to come back here, unless I'm craving a cute glass bottle. Asha in Berkeley still holds my heart as the best fruit tea place in the Bay!
author: Christine L.

description:
This is one of the better boba places I've been to, and I've been to many. I had the Green Tea Creama with boba. It was pretty good. The creama was thick enough and not watery. The boba had the right firmness, not too chewy and not too soft. Their drinks are pricier than most boba places since they serve them all in glass jars. You can bring these jars back to get a 10% discount.

Overall, I would come back to Plentea again!
author: Maranda C.

description: Too sweet and over priced for me. The bottle is cute if you are into that stuff.
author: Jane H.

description: I got their regular green milk tea with boba. It was watered down, and the boba became progressively harder to chew. Definitely overrated and overpriced. I guess you can taste the tea, but for $5, I'm basically paying for the glass, not the drink. Unfortunately, not impressed with this place!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Wish there was a Plentea closer to San Jose. A really good boba place to grab something to drink and chill with friends. I've tried their sea salt crema and personally I didn't like those very much. However their matcha and oolong milk tea are really good. You can still taste the tea flavor and it's not overly sweet like other places. I always come back here whenever I'm around SF. Definitely give it a try. Plus you get to keep the jar they serve your drink in!
author: Tuyen H.

description:
Pretty expensive but at least the drink comes in a jar. 

I ordered the black milk tea with pearls a few months ago and was extremely disappointed. The tea was watered down and I was pretty pissed considering the price.

I gave it some time and ordered something from their top 3 list, almond milk tea. Huge difference! 

There was crowd, but I wouldn't consider them busy. Slow service.
author: Danae L.

description: After much anticipation, my friends and I came to Plentea expecting some yummy milk tea. However, we were extremely disappointed. We ordered the mango green milk tea with tapioca, mango black milk tea with tapioca, and peach black milk tea with tapioca. All 3 milk teas were bland and somewhat tasteless. The flavor of the drinks was not strong at all; the drinks tasted like water and milk. The tapioca in the drinks tasted like soft plastic balls. We sat upstairs and couldn't find any napkins either. Although the the store is cute and the bottles are nice, the drinks were not worth the high price. (Edit: Since the bottles are glass and fairly nice, I understand why we had to pay around $6 for each drink.)
author: Christina L.

description: Love the fact that they give you a reusable glass bottle and lids. I visited twice on my trip to San Fran, left with 2 souvenirs. I ordered the Salted Creama Oolong tea with egg pudding or taro pudding(love that they have that here!!), came out to a little under $6 each time. It's ok, the creama was definitely yummy! But definitely over priced, even with the glass bottle. For you locals, if you bring the bottle back you can get 10% off your drink which is a nice incentive!
author: Anne Z.

description:
The first time I had Plentea was when they first opened, before the ridiculously long lines occurred daily. Staff was nice, asked me how the drink was and how they could improve. I ordered their black milk tea. If you can't make a decent milk tea, you won't survive the boba industry (haha). The drink was good, tea flavor wasn't strong enough though. First rating: 3

The second time I went I ordered a premium oolong tea with boba. Again, tea flavor wasn't that strong. They forgot my boba so I had to go back to ask for it, but I wish I hadn't. The boba was soft and mushy and tasted old. Second rating: 3 still.

Great concepts, not executed well.

Caution: lines out the door daily around 3-4 pm.
author: Ava F.

description:
My best friend introduced me to this place, and I've been going back ever since! It's really central to Chinatown and Union Square, so definitely check this place out!

The line is hit or miss; sometimes it goes way out the door, while other times I can just walk in and right up to the counter. They do have a limited selection compared to other boba places, but the items I have gotten are actually really good:

- Nutella Milk Tea: This is my go-to drink, and definitely my favorite out of everything I've tried here! You can definitely taste the chocolate, and together with the the boba creates a symphony of sweet flavor. The boba itself, to me, has the perfect consistency. Highly recommend.
- Matcha Milk Green Tea: This is really good as well. The sweetness of the tea balances out the green tea flavor. I recommend getting this drink with the taro pudding, which has a subtle, yet noticeable taro flavor. I also really liked the consistency of the pudding.

I really like the fact that they serve the boba in glass milk jugs that you can keep! They also provide lids for them, if you want to save it or take it to go.

Overall, I really enjoy this place and frequently return to it whenever I'm on this side of San Francisco. Definitely recommend!
author: Jay C.

description: I really crave this place this sometimes and I crave it so badly that I make the hour drive to SF just to get some. I'm not really sure why this place only has 3.5 stars because I've loved all the drinks I've tried here. My favorite is the taro sweet milk - super refreshing and real taro bits in there. I also like the lavender lemonade. The initial punch of lavender will probably shock you, but you'll grow to enjoy how refreshing and healthy it tastes. The place is small inside, but the decor is cute. I like the glass bottles option too!
author: Emma P.

description:
New bottles  and more snacks offered. I always get the same thing . Black peach fruit tea with boba balls and a salmon sandwich. Yummy!!!
They got chips to go and ramen bowls to go.. Add hot water type. The line is long so don't go during lunch. I love this place
author: Cecilia D.

description:
I ordered the brown sugar ice milk with egg pudding ($4.95) and it was amazing! The glass bottle is cute and I can't wait to return with it to get a discount on my drink. 

Drinks range from $4.50 to $6.50 and they have an extensive menu of sandwich and dessert waffles as well as a salad. If you don't want to eat here though, there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance like Ramen Underground and Sushirrito.
author: Karen L.

description: This is a great place for boba.  I love the glass containers they put it in.  The atmosphere and design of the store is great too.
author: Angelique G.

description: Decided to come and try it out one day and was neither wowed or disappointed. It's on a really busy street making it hard to find parking but also has long lines on weekends. They have a big menu with lots of different flavors but I thought it was a bit expensive for boba. My total for two drinks was around $10. I ordered an original black milk tea with boba and the tea flavor was intense. It wasn't my favorite, and the boba seemed under cooked maybe? They were really hard. In the end, the only thing I was excited about was for the cute glass jar it came in. And I would definitely come back and order another drink-- just to get another jar.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Plentea is one of my favorite Boba spots for a number of reasons but one of my favorites is because they are open so late. If you are looking for a nice hang out spot for an after work gathering, then Plentea should be your top choice.

The upstairs area in their building is wonderful; they have couches and tables set up for all of your lounging needs. 

Favorites:
* Oolong Milk tea (because it has the least amount of caffeine), (+) boba, (+) almond milk, (-) sugar, aka no added sugar
* Almond Milk tea

PS - Plentea gives you your drink in glass jars! If you return it, you get a discount on your next drink.
PSS - their check-in offer is great, don't forget to check in :)
author: Alexa H.

description:
I like this place because the drinks I have tried are delicious, the concept of saving the glass bottle for future 20% off discounts is appealing, and the service is great.

I have tried the strawberry green tea, the peach oolong tea, and the iced milk drink with egg pudding. I would recommend them all! The cashiers have been really helpful with suggestions, and both times I came here, I was asked how my drink was and if I had any suggestions to make it better.

The downfalls here are that the drinks are a little on the pricier side, and they claim not to have the glass bottles 100% of the time.
author: Corinna T.

description:
OK... First of all - I'm more of a coffee than a boba person. Butttt, I do crave those li'l pearly balls sometimes. So when I do - I look for boba places that also serve coffee. Best of both worlds. 

Yesterday I was meeting up with a friend for lunch but couldn't decide where to go for the longest time. So I asked her to come and meet me in front of Plentea coz it's an easy place to find. Didn't even plan to get boba or coffee there. My friend got there first and ultimately succumbed to the temptation of iced drinks coz it was a HOT day. It was HOTTT! I saw that they have the sea salt cream coffee and got so excited to try it out. Been in love with sea salt coffee since I tried 85 degrees'. I ordered the drink and pearls with it. YUM! It wasn't sweet and the pearls were chewy and not sweet. I do like mild sweetness in my food and drinks. Can't stand anything that's too sweet. Uugghh!

So Plentea - you exceeded my expectation. Oh, plus those cute old-fashioned milk glass bottles that come with your drinks! Collectibles! Go get em, peeps!
author: Priscillia I.

description:
They're pretty smart. The main reason I went here, and I think others would also agree, is that they serve their drinks in adorable glass milk jugs. Who could resist? It's not for the service, that's for sure. They're not rude or anything, just not friendly either. Usually, I feel the employees would ask if I had questions or made suggestions. This wasn't the case. 

Now onto the drinks. I had the pleasure of trying the sea salt oolong tea, peach green tea, mango yogurt tea, honeydew fruit milk, and brown sugar ice milk. My favorite is the brown sugar ice milk, hands down. It's not overly sweet and I like the consistency (between watery and just a little icy). The peach green tea was a tad on the sweet side. My bf enjoyed the mango yogurt a lot, but was disappointed in how sweet his honeydew milk was. The sea salt for the oolong is much saltier than I've had at other places. Make sure you mix that sucker up good.
author: Christine L.

description:
I'll admit it, I was lured in by the novelty of bubble tea in a glass bottle.

The shop is pretty cramped and the layout is a bit awkward.

I ordered a peach green tea with lychee jelly. The lychee jelly tasted plain at first sip, but it got better over time. The green tea itself tasted pretty good. The drink itself was on the pricier side, but I'm sure you pay a premium for the glass bottle.

Disappointingly, I think the glass bottle actually made it harder to enjoy my drink. There are crevices at the bottom that my jelly got stuck in, and the caps they have available aren't secure enough for you to stick one on and shake up your drink.

I'm glad I gave this place a try, but I'm not sure it's worth a second visit.
author: Queenie T.

description:
Uh.. mm... uh.

Bottles. Their bottles were our goal that night my cousins and I came here. No shame. They have cute bottles. Unfortunately, we didn't realize that they actually started putting a limit to how many bottles they sell per day. I believe it was 300/day. After that they just used regular plastic cups which gave you a 10% discount, I think? 

Bottle... discount. Bottle... discount. Mm. I like both. LOL.

Plentea is located in Chinatown, but it's not DEEP into Chinatown. It's along the street that, when you're driving on it, it goes from Downtown into Chinatown. I know I don't make much sense so you're just going to have to set your GPS and look out for a light brown store front.

The cashier was friendly and their menu is really simple to understand. With only a few drink options in each category it shouldn't take you too long to make a decision. And they also have some snacks here, I believe. I really only saw waffles so... yeah. They have tables downstairs AND upstairs to sit at which is cool.

I got their matcha milk green tea and it was good. Their boba isn't honey boba so it's not really going to taste like anything when you chew them, but at least they weren't hard right? Heh. And their matcha flavor was mild compared to other places that give you a stronger matcha flavor, but it was still pretty good. I ended up drinking it all so no complaints there.

Overall, would come back. Want to try their smoothies and get a bottle, hehe.
author: Venus L.

description:
Only bad thing I've experienced is its only in SF...
Their drinks are nicely balanced, not too sweet. Ice milk extra caramel is my regular and I usually buy a fruit tea as seconds since I live so far away. Their peach black tea is excellent.
author: Rick R.

description:
Came here on Saturday around 5 and it was packed. The line was out the door. 

Got the oolong green tea, but that was a mistake. It tasted like the "teas' tea" brand tea that you get in the plastic bottle only they charge you $5 more. But I tried my friends strawberry flavored tea and it was really good, so maybe I just got the wrong thing. 

Their other drinks looked pretty cool, I definetly will try the creama drinks next time. You get to keep the cool glass bottle too! I reuse it to bring tea with me to school/work and people always ask where I got such a cute bottle.
author: Cindy L.

description:
The atmosphere inside is nice and cute. There was plenty of seating on the weekend. I ordered a green milk tea and it was OK, nothing special but still delicious. (I love milk teas of all shapes and sizes.)

Walking out with my drink was not enjoyable.. The drink was cold and the condensation on the outside of my glass jar made me afraid it would slip out of my finger tips!! I had to hold it with two hands, making holding my earlier Chinatown food purchases less convenient. I would definitely have preferred a regular cup. The Plentea logo is not even that cute in my opinion ........ Therefore I do not like to pay the higher price for the glass jar. I may have liked this idea more if the logo was cuter hehe.
author: Diana W.

description:
Totally a fan of Plentea because:

1) My Thai tea was delicious,
2) My Thai tea came in a glass milk jar,
3) The person taking my order was patient and gave me honest answers when I asked her if she liked such and such a drink, and
4) There was NO line (I will NEVER wait in a line that goes all the way down say, Stockton Street, for a Tapioca. Pearl. Drink. Never!!!!!!!)

: )
author: Teenie K.

description:
Plentea is a trendy little spot in the middle of San Fran's Chinatown.  The place gets pretty tight (although there is an upper level), especially when large groups of people are just standing around waiting for their orders.

I ordered the red bean and avocado fruit smoothie (milk base) with boba.  The red bean smoothie was really good!  I thought it was perfectly sweet.  The avocado smoothie, however, was a little on the bland side, but it was okay (because that's what the bf got hehe).  The order took unusually long (about 15-20 minutes), so it was a little uncomfortable waiting in that tight spot, but what can ya do.  Both drinks came to a total of ~14 dollars, which is a little pricey, but the smoothies come in cute milk bottles that you get to keep (and that I brought back to the East Coast), so that makes up for it.

I think if the bar can work through some of their efficiency issues, this would be a great grab and go spot.
author: Michelle M.

description: This place is about a mile away from China town! I love their drinks but their almond milk tea is a bit too strong, but none the less still yum. The Nutella milk barely had any Nutella inside unlike the picture shown on the menu... It tastes like basic milk tea to me.. But I was extremely happy with my taro milk and Thai milk tea. There are no public restrooms available so you'll have to go some place else if you have bladder problems  they have four tables downstairs and an upstairs portion too.
author: Noelle Y.

description:
Plentea over Boba Guys any day!!!

I ordered the brown sugar ice milk tea with pearls and egg pudding. It's just as amazing as Cafe Lattea down in Cupertino. 

The glass jars intrigued me, as well as how well presented the drinks were displayed on social media. I was not disappointed. It's a bit pricey, but who cares?! It's a good drink! 

The ambiance is very hipster and modern. Small, cozy interior. Fast service. The staff gave really good recommendations. Usually, I've heard there is a line that goes out the door, but luckily, we were in and out right away.

Tip: if you bring the glass bottles that you purchased, you get a discount on your future visits.
author: Steffi G.

description:
service is quick and price is standard
however many other places have a better tea taste
wouldn't come back unless I'm in the area again and everywhere else has very long lines
author: Marcus J.

description: Walked by Plentea on a hot summer day, and boy I'm glad I got my drinks here! There was a line, but it moved quickly. They serve their tea in a glass cup that you could bring home. I tried the strawberry black tea & peach oolong tea. Both drinks were really refreshing and wasn't loaded with artificial sweeteners like most tea places. There was was a perfect balance of tea and fruits in each drink. I need to come back and try other combos when I'm back in the city.
author: Hang H.

description:
Finally visited Plentea and it in fact live up to the hype!!
They had a pretty big variety of teas, but not so big where you have no idea what to get. I decided to stay with the classics and got a green milk tea with boba. It was pretty good and on the sweet side; I had forgotten to tell them to include less sweetener. Pretty decent if you ask me.
My friend got a "sea salt crema tea" cause she thought it sounded good, but it was nasty. Overly salty that you don't taste any tea. Don't get this.
The cool things out this place is you get to keep the glass container that your milk tea comes in!! 
I would definitely come back again but the tea itself is not THAT special.
author: Michael N.

description: Been here more times...it's gotten better but odd furniture changes everytime I go and fish in bottles swimming in their own poop :(
author: Cindy G.

description: I came here the other day and ordered the black milk tea with grass jelly. First of all, this was unbearably sweet. I could only drink about a quarter of it, and I felt sick for the next few hours. The drink itself was pretty strong too. It almost tasted like coffee instead of milk tea. Also, the grass jelly was broken up into all these tiny little pieces, which I didn't really enjoy. I liked the glass bottle that I got, but I pretty much didn't enjoy anything else about my drink here.
author: Cynthia M.

description: This is my favorite place to go when I'm in the city don't mind the wait totally worth it
author: Drea D.

description:
Super hip place. You get your tea served in a nice glass bottle, and if you bring your bottle from a previous visit, you get a small discount. 

I ordered one of their top 5, a salted caramel with frothy milk on the top. It was good but a bit too salty.

The glass bottle and the ambience helped it stick out, but I remember it being sorta pricey.
author: Kelly Y.

description:
This is the nearest "legit" boba places by my office so I do come occasionally. I wouldn't consider myself a boba fanatic but I am occasionally known to live a quasi boba life.

Pros:
+ Decent drinks: My Honey Green Tea was nicely made and not too sweet since it was only sweetened with honey. The drink had a nice balance between the tea and the honey.  
+ REALLY TASTY BOBA: This boba is good.. really good! I'm not sure if it's honey boba or not but whatever it was... it had great texture and very nice flavor. 
+ Trendy decor: The inside is shiny and pretty. There's a nature feel with the wood design. 
+ Convenient location: Located on the busy Kerney St and near the Montgomery Bart station and the California St cable car. Parking is pretty available after 6:30pm.
+ Nice service: The workers have always been nice, friendly and happy to make any suggestions. Can't ask for much more than that. 

Cons:
+ Pricey: Meh, drinks are around $5 which is a little expensive for what it is. I care less about the bottle and more about the price to quality/quantity ratio. 
+ $10 credit card minimum: This is probably my biggest pet peeve and why I'm giving a 3 star rating. Shoot, I walked in and walked back out real quick because I just don't carry cash. When I think of bringing cash, I think of little hole in the wall chinese / mexicna joints and um.. certain adult establishments. Definitely NOT at a trendy boba spot. Luckily, a kind coworker was at Onigilly next door and let me borrow 5 bucks. This minimum doesn't even make sense since drinks aren't even $5 (it was like $4 and some change)!

 I flip flop between this place and Cool Tea Bar on Clay. It's definitely worth a try.. just make sure you bring some cash.
author: Chris W.

description: Yum. Came here around 4 on a Saturday after my failed attempt at casting for the Amazing Race. There was indeed a line. I got the brown sugar iced milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca pearls. I derno but that milk bottle sure adds flavor or makes the whole experience better. My friend got the caramel and that one is way sweeter than brown sugar so latter is the way to go. I really liked the egg pudding and when I got a straw of pudding, pearl, and the slushie tea, oh that hit the spot. I also tried the combo of egg and taro pudding and that was good but I still like the pearl in it. Dang I broke my New Years resolution of no boba because of the friggin milk bottle. Don't forget to pack the cap so you can reuse and drink water. Bring the bottle back for a discount too!
author: Amy H.

description: I'll be honest, I came here for the glass jar. You can taste more of the tea than milk in their milk tea which is a major plus. I don't like places that over-do the sugar and milk. Will return to try other flavors!
author: Briget P.

description:
This place is expensive - get over it.

Over it?

Okay, now taste the milk tea. I'm no pearl milk tea snob, but it's not too shabby. Honestly, this place in my opinion fares better than Ten Ren up in chinatown. It's pretty tasty milk tea, decent boba, and decent grass jelly. Expensive as shit, but if you're working downtown and need that fix, the $5 drink will get you there. Not to mention if you're a hipster you'll probably dig the fancy glass bottle you get to keep. I use it at work now as a water cup and love it. Worth.
author: Joanne Y.

description: I love the Sea Salt Oolong here. Bitter Oolong at first sip then the creamy, salty texture following is quite enjoyable.
author: Yeseul S.

description:
Plentea namesake is OK. I liked the straight jasmine better.

Pretty in pink was OK.

Love to supe up the tea flavor.

Extra star to promote creativity and adding all sorts of crazy into drinks.
author: Tuan P.

description: I ordered strawberry/banana smoothie with chia seeds. I could taste banana and strawberry but it was too watery. I also did not appreciate that they freeze chia ceeds and then add them to your drink. Whats fresh about that?
author: Veronica T.

description:
Milk tea served in milk bottles! This cute idea has crowds lining up all the time, often out the door. However, I was unfortunately disappointed with the quality of the drinks.

I tried their milk tea, green milk tea, and iced milk with caramel and egg pudding. All of the drinks were nothing special and their boba wasn't well cooked as well. For approximately $5, I had hoped for a more delicious drink. I enjoyed the novel glass milk bottles though.

As a note, you can use the bottles afterwards (avoid hot drinks though, two of my friends' bottles broke because they put hot water into it). If you bring them back (or just grab one from the second floor) you can get 10% off your purchase.
author: Michael L.

description: The boba here is a little too hard for my liking but I always come back because I love the glass bottles and the upstairs seating.
author: Kristina N.

description:
I loved this place ever since the very first day. I love matcha so ofcourse I had to get the matcha milk tea. It was really good but I highly recommend you drink it right when you get it. Saving it for the next day or a couple hours is a bad idea. I wanted something sweet so I went with the chocolate mousse. They don't make it themselves as I saw them take a slice from a box but I didn't mind since it was bomb. My boyfriend and I ordered another slice after we finished the first one in seconds. 

I also tried the peach fruit green tea. I think it was ok, I felt like it was a bit too watery even though I always order less ice or no ice here. The fruit bits are nice too. I'll try to try something else next time.

My boyfriend and I have somehow always managed to get here to find no line but last time we came, there was a long line out the front door. Even though the lines here might be long, it goes by pretty fast. The drinks are made pretty quick too, unlike other tea places. Will be coming back!
author: Vivian P.

description: I've heard a lot of hype about this place, but I really don't think they're anything special! The drinks are really expensive (~$5 even without toppings), probably because you are paying for the jar that your drink comes in! You can bring it back for a 10%-off discount the next time you come though.
