I ordered a honeydew slush because I wanted a drink without caffeine, but the drink was mostly just ice blended with only a bit of honeydew. My friend got a drink with boba which was okay, but it still did not impress! With i-Tea and Boba Guys both being so close by (and in my opinion, both better in terms of taste, price, and drink quality), unfortunately I probably won't be back to Plentea any time soon.
author: Kathy C.

description: A pleasant surprise! I took the 8 minute walk from my work today to journey out here and get the brown sugar milk iced tea with tapioca. The girl behind the counter was very nice! They apparently have a policy of no debit card transactions unless it's $10.00 or more, but I didn't have cash on me. She was nice enough to still let me use my debit card and after the walk I was very appreciative of her letting that slide. The drink itself was quite good! It wasn't too sweet and it hit the spot. The tapioca was good, but it's not the greatest I've had. It came In a very stylish glass bottle that if you bring back to future trips saves you .10¢. I had a good experience overall and will definitely come back to try their other flavors and desserts!
author: James R.

description:
Working at milk tea shop myself (I won't mention which one) I have high expectations for tasting the tea in my drinks, so I was really excited to try Plentea for the first time. 

I ordered the Nutella milk tea (4/5) and the Almond Milk tea (2/5). The Almond tea had too much flavoring and I couldn't even taste the tea in it! I was really disappointed in that. 

Also, when I got my drinks I didn't notice there was a crack in my bottle until I was already on my way home to SJ!!! Do the employees even check the bottles?!?! 

I will probably not come back here again and just stick with my milk tea places back in SJ.
author: Zeinab J.

description: I love love love the papaya milk here! I just wish the location wasn't so inconvenient, traffic and parking wise. Prices here are expensive considering there is another boba store on the block but they do give you a glass bottle. I believe they offer you a discount if you bring your glass bottle back to reuse. They also offer a Yelp check-in discount but I didn't discover this until after I've already paid during my last visit. Some of the workers here like to give attitude too. Why should I tip you if you can't even look at me directly when conversing or idk maybe smile? Taking off 1 star for service.
author: Lushi Z.

description:
We always come here when we're in the city. I always get the ice milk with caramel and it's amazing! It's perfect for us people that can't drink tea. I love it when the drink is cold yet the pearls are hot. Yummy! My husband loves their milk teas. The tea is so fresh you'll keep coming back. I just wish they had bigger sizes.

You'll also be suprised how good their takoyaki balls are. Try it and you won't regret it. 

This is definitely a good place to go to after a day/night out in the city.
author: Rachel P.

description: Boba was good. Cute atmosphere. The almond milk tea ( black tea based) was a little strong but still good.
author: Ana B.

description:
Sometimes, I wonder why I come here.

For the jars? For what other reason, really? For the drinks? Are you kidding me?

Plentea is a milk tea place on that hipster street nearby Chinatown, and it's an interesting change of pace from the super Chinese milk tea places.

They subsist almost exclusively on their bottle gimmick. Order a milk tea drink, it comes in a bottle. You finish your bottle, cap it up, and toss it in your backpack and ruin everything. It's fun to do every once in a while, really.

But in all serious, the drinks are rather unremarkable. Everything tastes slightly watered down, but maybe I haven't been ordering the right things. I think the saving grace for this place are the milk drinks, since they're not half bad, but for the price, I'd really rather go elsewhere. I guess you do get the bottle with it.

Come here if you have to show your friends to Bay Area milk tea. They honestly won't know the difference in terms of quality, since it's not THAT much worse compared to other places, but given the price, it really isn't the best deal you can get for your money. However, they will love the jars that come with it, and basics love jars.

TIP: Sometimes they don't have the jar. Check Yelp for the tips to see if anyone has updated, and if they don't have jars, take your business to somewhere like Boba Guys instead.
author: Brian L.

description:
The tea is good and presentation is great -- thrilled to receive the glass bottle.  The tapioca is tender and tea is whole leaf quality (not powder).  The sweetness is not overpowering.

I wanted to reuse the bottle for work -- added warm / hot water (not boiling) and my usual office green tea and the base fell off.  The base is not like a mason jar quality - the plentea bottle base is attached on.  Overall, this is just a general PSA because I don't want anyone else to go through drenched pants, burns, etc.  Keep it for cold drinks.

Still love the tea and the toppings!
author: Edison G.

description:
It is extremely difficult finding good boba places in San Francisco, but Plentea does a great job in comparison to places in Southern California. I love how they differentiate themselves with their glass bottles, which I have to admit is why I wanted to try it in the first place so it's a great marketing technique. 

Anyway, I ordered the Oolong Peach Tea with lychee and tapioca and my friend got the Brown Sugar Iced Milk with grass jelly & tapioca. Both were really good in my opinion. I have to come back and try the Sea Salt Crema Oolong tea next time!
author: Karen C.

description:
I'm pretty sure the big draw here is their glass bottle for keeps...that's pretty much why we went here ;)

I had the sea salt tea which wasn't amazing, but pretty good. 

Some seating inside and some on the second level. No bathroom though. Long line because everyone wants those glass bottles ;)
author: Charisse B.

description:
I've got boba tea on my mind, so I thought it was finally time to write about my experience at Plentea.

Two words: genre redefining

Friends tried and failed to turn me onto boba tea in the past taking me to their favorite spots around the edges of Chinatown. But the tea was too sweet, and the tapioca pearls really did nothing for me. They were gummy, bland, and entirely undesirable.

Fast forward several years to my first excursion to Plentea. I was with a group from work, and figured I would give boba tea one last try. The plan was to try the simple classic (black milk tea with tapioca pearls) and see how it went.

Damn. That's good. 

It's the kind of good that probably now has ruined me for almost all other milk tea I might encounter. But at least I now kind of get it.

Because more than a sugar bomb, this was about tea first and foremost. Tannic, malty black tea was the dominant flavor. And it was good tea. There was just enough milk and sugar to smooth out the edges. The tapioca balls weren't slimy at all. They were firm and snappy. Chewing on them was a pleasure, and the act of chewing helped to extend the joy of my tea and not diminish it.

Speaking of joy... it's hard not to be delighted by the visual appeal of this shop and its product. Count me among the many who have been charmed.

Given the high quality of everything else, I was only dismayed to see they were pouring Kirkland milk from Costco. This is San Francisco. It's Clover country. Get with the program Plentea. 

But with lines out the door, I guess they don't have to change a thing. To get a fifth star from me, they'll need to take that one last step towards awesomeness. So close.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I've only been to Plentea once, so this review is based off of that one experience.

I'm not a Bay Area native, so I'm not blessed with amazing boba places left and right. My palate is probably not as defined as some others. In my honest opinion, though, I love this place.

The location is pretty central, the place is very clean and the interior is great. The downstairs is super packed, but if you're looking for a more peaceful place, I recommend going to the top (stair case towards the back left corner of the room). You have some really comfy chairs, and you can see below. 

The boba is tasty and really chewy, while they have great drink options. It might not be quite as expansive as some others big chain boba places, but for me, they are great at what they do. Otherwise, why would they have such a long line all the time?

Speaking of lines... If you're looking for a quick boba fix, do not expect to get that here. The wait for this place was super long, even in the morning. I arrived around 11:30am, 30 minutes after opening, and the line was out the door already. I think I waited for about 30 minutes minimum to even order a drink. The wait time for my drink was probably about 15 minutes long.

Although the line was massive, the reason I really like this place is it has great seacream drinks. It's not as epic as 85 degrees, but it's good. A lot better than what I can normally get (I'm from Sacramento, so we have disappointing or no sea cream for the most part). What's also great is the pricing. I know that an almost $5-$6 boba drink is expensive, but they give you these adorable glass bottle! They are reusable and if you bring them back in, you get a 10% discount on your drink. I think for the higher pricing, it all works out for the bottle. I would repeat visit this place if I lived closer. Most good boba is in the $4-$5 range, but you don't get a souvenir keep sake. This place gives you that, which is well worth the value. The drinks are good enough to keep me coming back, even though it's a huge wait.

I think if they could somehow get through the line quicker, I would bump them to 4 stars.
author: Li S.

description: Best Tea ever. Just get there early because  they run out of Glass bottles quickly.  I love the customer service here. They always take time to acknowledge you and give you as the customer a full and undivided attention.
author: Destiny R.

description:
I've been seeing people walking in Downtown with bottled boba (which I think is an amazing marketing campaign) which eventually led me to google bottled boba in SF. And what do you know, I ended up here! 

Their tea is a little high priced (almost $5) and even with the 10% discount, that's just another way of saying tax free so the price is still almost $5. 

Overall, I enjoyed the tea (I got Oolong and my gf for Thai) and the boba. The boba wasn't plain tasting like how other places are. I really love the bottle! I keep one at my desk just in case I feel like having boba since this place is just a few blocks away.
author: Robbie P.

description:
They have a decent variety of fruity flavors and kinds of drinks here. But the drinks are sooo expensive????? In my opinion, anything above $4 for a regular-sized drink (without boba!) is pretty expensive and the drinks here are at least $4.50 on average. I see that they serve their drinks in glass milk bottles, but my friends and I went later in the afternoon, so we didn't get them. I think I could justify paying more for the bottle, but otherwise $5 just for a boba-less drink is far too much.

Anyways, I got peach milk with honey boba. It was pretty meh; I have DEFINITELY had better. I mean it was literally just blended up frozen peaches...with milk. The honey boba was nice, soft, and sweet though. I forget what my friends got, but they seemed to enjoy their drinks. They have a small lounge area upstairs, but there seems to be no air conditioning up there so it was a little stuffy. Service was fine and the drinks came out quickly.

HONESTLY, you should just walk over to Union Square where Boba Guys is, in my opinion. Higher quality tea and drinks, more limited menu but also more affordable than Plentea. They also have cute glass jars for their drinks too!
author: Karen T.

description: First time here, the taste of black tea's just ok where u can probably find in china town but i like their tapioca which is chewy and good. Also their tea bottle package  and the decoration here are pretty cool.
author: Hong L.

description: My favorite boba place in all of the Bay Area. Outstanding, you have to come see for yourself.
author: Maelani L.

description:
Sorry to say, but the hype is not real for Plentea. 
They've got cute decor, and it's cool that they give their drinks in a bottle (cold drinks only), but compared to the many options around it, their tea just isn't as great. The only plus, I would say, is they don't charge too much extra for the glass bottle.
Why wait in long lines for something average-at-best when better is around the corner.
author: Crystal J.

description: Cute but never coming back. What brought me here was of course the glass bottles...but oh god the sea salt creama tea was AWFUL. I really can't imagine people like it. It was so salty. I understand it's a salty drink but it tasted like ocean water with no hint of caramel. Boba seemed old. The friend I was with hated it too. Disgussstttiiinnggg. Not worth it. If you are coming to take pictures of the bottles it's really not worth the money
author: Arianna R.

description:
This is one of the boba places in SF I've wanted to go for a while because I kept seeing instagrams of their cute glass jars. I now have the jar since they let you keep it, and I really like it.

I ordered the oolong milk tea with boba and egg pudding. The boba was pretty good, chewy and cooked just right. I enjoyed the egg pudding more though, because it's probably the best I've had at a boba place. The egg flavor is really strong, and the pudding is not overly sweet and doesn't fall apart easily.

I especially like visiting this place because they have a charming upstairs lounging area, with couches and tables. One of the walls is decorated with lovely flowers and the shop's name. The only drawback is that they don't have a bathroom, which can be a challenge after drinking lots of tea! Their service is great also, with staff routinely cleaning the area upstairs.
author: Kailin H.

description: My friends and I are obsessed with this spot it's so good and the cute glass bottles are great and there's a discount when you reuse them.  The milk ice is beyond delicious what a treat!!! I prefer the brown sugar one. If I'm trying to be a bit healthier and go on the lighter side their fruit teas are divine. After sampling many boba spots in SF this by far takes the cake!!
author: Priya S.

description:
Expensive-- even for the fidi

I ordered the avocado milk with grass jelly. It was almost 5 bucks!  I've had better for less. There's definitely more options in the area.  For now, I'll pass.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Day of Visit: 24 Nov 2016.
This is my second visit, first one was about 2 years ago(?) i don't remember what I got at that time so I'll just talk about my purchase today.
Main reason why I was here today is: they're the only boba shop open on Thanksgiving (at least around downtown).

I love the bottle! I threw my first bottle away because it was bothersome to pack some 'unnecessary' stuff when I was moving out of my old place. The cap doesn't look very reliable, but enough for to cover the bottle so I could just rest it next to my leg while sitting during a commute. 

I had Thai Milk Tea with tapioca. It's good, just like the common thai milk tea you get almost everywhere. It's not too sweet for me fortunately. I also like the taste of the boba, but don't you think the size of the boba is a bit smaller than the boba you get at other places?

It's not a place I'll visit often, but I'll definitely visit once in a while.
author: Bianca N.

description: Honestly, the tea is so-so, it's not impressive. The gimmick here is that they let you take their glass bottle to-go! We tried the taro ice milk which is tasted good. My friend tried the nutella milk tea, pretty interesting. Worth a try, but probably won't return.
author: Gary C.

description: For $5+ for a drink, it's nice that you get to keep the glass bottle as a souvenir. Tried the Lavender Lemonade w/ lychee jelly and it was ok. It was more of a lemon spritzer than a lemonade. Very bubbly w/ specks of lavender at the bottom. The jelly itself wasn't overly sweet but did add texture.
author: Julie L.

description: Today was the first time I tried plentea. I walked 2 miles only to wait 30 minutes to order. Despite the wait time, the milk tea was incredible! It actually tasted like tea rather than sugar water like what most places have to offer. The boba has a decent taste as well. I will definitely stop by here again. I recommend the black milk tea w/ pearls!
author: Tina T.

description:
Personally working at a boba shop, this place is great and has great boba to pair with your drinks. 

I've had boba since i was 5 so I like my milk tea plain and that's exactly what I get here. 

Staff is very accommodating especially when it comes to getting hot drinks (it's cold in SF so why not a hot milk tea?) they let you know in advance that you won't be getting a glass bottle but i disliked the fact that you don't get a 10% discount since you got a cup instead of a glass bottle. 

Usually you can bring in your old glass bottle and get a percentage off your drinks or if they run out of glass bottles you also get a percentage off but why is it that when you order an ordinary hot drink you are
charged with the same price? I believe it's a little unfair. 

Overall staff and drinks are great but pricing should be consistent.
author: Faith C.

description:
Sadly I have to give them a lower rating. 

Walked in towards the end of the evening after dinner, ask for a coffee/tea with aloe. After I walked out, realized it's lychee, and not aloe! Walked back in and asked if they could fix it, they were ok doing it, walked out again with my drink, and.....guess what, it's still lychee :( I wonder if they mis-labeled their toppings. 

The mistake aside, the coffee/tea mix was lower quality. Glass bottle is cool, but made it hard to carry. I wish this place would focus more on the quality of their drinks.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Above average pricing but good flavor!
Came on a Sunday night and got a thai tea with tapioca and strawberry green tea wit tapioca. Both flavor wise was hella good but the tapioca was below average texture wise. It was a bit hard and not as gummy as I like. A drink will costs you around 5.5-$6 with a topping. 
Recommend if you are craving a good boba tea in the area!
author: Sarn S.

description:
One of our go-to boba spots in the city, mostly since it has consistently delivered good drinks (haven't tried one I don't like yet) and is open pretty late (10pm week night boba runs anyone?).

The menu has all your basics with traditional Asian flavored like red bean and matcha. It's not as trendy as Boba Guys, and less extensive than iTea down the street, but offers some solid choices. My personal fav is the Red Bean Matcha Slush.

My only knock is that it is pricey for boba, especially given nearby options. Bring your bottles back for a 10% discount on your next drink (which helps because these drinks are pricier than your average boba run). Also check in on Yelp for additional discounts.
author: Vi N.

description:
This was one of the bubble tea places I had on my to-try places during my time in SF. Plentea doesn't charge you extra for the glass bottles they put the drinks in. Drinks range from $5-7 dollars - which I think is fair since you get to keep the glass bottle. 

I got a lychee bubble tea and it was alright. Nothing special about it since I felt that there are other bubble tea places in SF that did a better job.
author: Shirley S.

description:
My go-to boba/tea place in FiDi! I love all their drinks and the glass bottles you get to take home with you are such a nice perk. My favorites have been their avocado milk smoothie (loveee these), strawberry green tea fruit tea (real fruit chunks in it!), and ice milk with caramel and brown sugar (which is technically a rip off cause you're literally getting iced milk with some caramel but it's so delicious!). I'm actually not a big boba fan so can't offer any input on that but I always get lychee jelly in my drinks and this place is up to par. The glass bottles come with a plastic cap so you can seal your drink when you're done with it. They're also very big head-turners. I always get people asking me where I got my drink if I'm walking around FiDi with it. 

They do have some cons though. They have a minimum $10 credit card charge so sometimes I have to buy 2 drinks so I can use my card when I don't have cash (which I guess isn't entirely a bad thing cause I get an excuse to overindulge). Their drinks are also kinda pricey compared to other boba places (albeit you are partially paying for the glass bottle). The glass bottles are cute but you have to carry around the bottle with you the rest of the day. 

Overall a very yummy boba/tea place in FiDi and I'd highly recommend if only for the cute basic glass bottles. 

Tip: 10% off if you remember to bring the glass bottle back next time! (But who has that kind of foresight)
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Note: if you don't need their bottle, the price for the tea is cheaper. Please expect a long line anytime of the day, but certainly this is worth to wait for your drink. 

P.s: no restroom here
author: Chin Man L.

description:
My kids love this place when we're in the city. The boba is fresh, has the right texture, and works well with their drinks. Which, by the way, come on these cool glass containers that you get to take home!

They do have a limited offering of flavors compared to Tpumps, etc. However, you can customize them a bit.

The only knock I had was that the bathroom was dos employees only.
author: Gene D.

description: A+: great tea, cool bottle, nice clean store with lots of seating, staff very friendly and accommodating, great menu variety
author: A G.

description:
I really went here to get one of their useful glass bottles. I love milk tea and boba, so that was just an added bonus. Or so I thought....Their milk tea was a little underwhelming. Something about the taste that just made me want to waste half of it. The boba was ok, but definitely nothing special. There are other spots in the area that don't cost $5 and are better. 

I supposed if you're walking by and you don't want to walk much further, you can stop by and pick up some here, but I'm definitely not going out of my way to get this. At least I came away with a couple neat glass bottles to use for other things!
author: Aaron Y.

description: One of my go-to places for bubble tea. I love the cute glass bottles and the flavours never disappoint. My favourite is the lemon green tea with aloe jelly.
author: Michelle C.

description: Good late night drank but they didnt have my go to (Taro) but I tried the strawberry one; typical boba drink, nothing too special but at least I got to keep a cool glass!
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Plentea usually has a ridiculously long line for a reason -- it serves pretty darn good tea and desserts. Not to mention the glass bottles that come with the drinks are a really good draw for all the hipsters out there. 

By the way, you have to get the glass bottle whether you're going to come back with the bottle for a 20% discount or not. They don't give refunds if you decide to return the glass bottle to them. I personally think they should have the latter option too, just in case people are from out of the area and don't need a glass bottle. Reuse, recycle, right?

Anyway, the tea and milk tea are both very good quality. They use real fruit in their fruit teas, which is always a plus. 

I wouldn't recommend the fruit milk though -- they were quite artificial tasting. I tried the blueberry milk once, and I think they used dried blueberries and blueberry jam, at least that's what it tasted like.

The belgian waffle is pretty legit, and the restaurant owner takes a lot of pride in this dessert. The toasted marshmallow was perfection -- browned just the right amount, and served nice and warm. I was also very impressed at the quality considering it was a mad house in the kitchen, and there were lots of other drink orders going through.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Pretty pricy for tea, got the premium mountain tea. Taste decent, really like the fact you can adjust your sweetness.

Cold drinks are served in glass bottles you can take home which is a nice touch. The interior and music playing fits the environment. Pretty decent if you're looking to kick it with your friends
author: Jason L.

description:
Another SF-hype boba place that is just A-OK. 

They do get points for their super hip, fun glass jars that you can take home.

Their drinks are just alright, nothing special. I found them, actually, to be one the sweeter side (even though I asked for 25% sugar!). I would recommend getting a drink that is NON-MILK versus with milk. 

Overall, hip and cute - but just okay. The line is no joke either. 
There's better boba and tea out there!
author: Olivia C.

description:
FIRST time of PLENTEA ("plenty") times to come! 

Point to note: I am not a crazy boba fan and really don't drink boba all that often (except for half and half in socal which I lovee or sharetea which is pretty good too).

However, this place definitely has my stamp of approval for your boba fix. There are so many flavors--original milk tea, matcha latte, sweet taro, coffee milk, almond milk, and even nutella milk (??!). They also have fruit teas for the non-milk tea lovers. Drinks are ~$5 and you basically choose your flavored drink cold/hot, sugar level (50% is usually perfect for me for other places but plentea makes it less sweet compared to other places which is perfect for me), and finally add-ins (my fav!). For add-ins you get to choose from: taro/egg pudding (my must-have!), tapioca (boba), chia seed (for the health nuts), lychee jelly (fruity peeps), grass jelly (yum), red bean (for the sweeties), and aloe (light jelly/texture). My favorite part is the glass bottle your drink comes in. They're super adorable and you can even keep them! (or bring them back for your next drink for 10% off...correct me if I'm wrong). 

I got the almond milk tea with taro pudding (my two fav things together omg), cold, 50% sugar. Loved it! It had a nice almond flavor that tasted really pure (NOT artificial almond flavor that gets stuck at the back of your throat), subtle black tea mixed in the background that was not overpowering or bitter, and perfect level of creaminess that just had me wanting more! Definitely wished they gave more taro pudding because it was that good--again, no artificial or overly sweet taro taste, and the pudding tasted soft and fluffy. I'm already ready to come back and try some more! Matcha is definitely my thing so...until next time!
author: Alvina L.

description: Me and my friend went here on a Thursday night around 8:30 and ordered 2 drinks, both with whole milk. My friend even doubled checked with the barista (female Asian with big eyes and heavy eyeliner) that his boba milk tea is made with whole milk and she confirmed yes. When the barista was making the drinks I saw her adding whole milk followed by some half and half. She then exchanged a look with the other barista (male) and smirked. The guy then looked at me and my friend, as if he wanted to make sure that we didn't see what they were doing. There weren't any other customers, but I wasn't sure if she was making our drinks so I didn't say anything. After me and my friend tasted our boba we were certain that there is definitely half and half in our drinks. I should've went back and ask her about it but I didn't feel like it. It was very bizarre. I couldn't figure out why she would do that. Did they run out of milk? Was she taking some kind of pleasure in adding half and half into people's drinks? Was she simply trying to make it taste better? Idk. One thing I'm sure tho, is that I am not going back again. It's such a shame, because me and friend really liked this place.
author: Tinaa T.

description: Love this place! So cute and you get to keep the glass bottles they serve your drinks in ^_^ I got Thai iced tea with egg pudding. The cashier was really nice and let me sample the egg pudding because I've never tried it before. Price was ok-- little pricey probably to accommodate for the glass bottles. I liked my drink but it didn't have as much of a strong Thai iced ices flavor as I was expecting (Seemed a little diluted and milky). Still pretty delicious and would probably go again (if anything to get another glass bottle!)
author: Jackie P.

description:
After waiting in a 7 persons line at 3 PM on a weekday, I paid almost $6 for a toned down Mamma Chia drank and the experience of lugging 2 glass bottles in my bag down Chinatown and to the Bart station. So! F@$*ing! Heavy! 

Would I come back? Yas.
author: Sandra J.

description:
I love the glass bottle and even comes with a cap.
I tried the honey lemon tea with taro pudding and that wasn't the beat combo but the tea itself  refreshing. Their milk tea (oolong) was good, I prefer it over Sharetea.

Worth checking out because of the glass bottle :-)
author: Linda T.

description:
If I'm craving fruit tea, Plentea is my go-to spot! I'm a pretty picky person when it comes to my beverages. A large reason why I like Plentea so much is because the drinks are really easy to customize.

Tip: I always like my drinks with a slight hint of sweetness, so I actually ask for no sugar at Plentea. If you order a fruit tea, they always add a pump of fruit flavor which already has sugar in it.
author: Estelle C.
Dan B.

description: Honestly the tea isn't even that good. It's the bottle that really got my attention. Waaay too much ice in these which waters it down a lot. Boba was soft and chewy but didn't have much flavor. Not worth the money and wait.
author: Chris M.

description:
My cousins first introduced me to this place when I was visiting them.  I was already intrigued with the bottles the drinks came in.  I only had a couple of sips of theirs and had to come back for my own bottle.  

The lady at the counter was super friendly.  I was super stoked to see taro pudding!  I've never had it before and I think it was pretty obvious how excited I was.  She went and immediately gave me a sample of it.  What awesome service.

I ended up ordering black milk tea with taro pudding.  Delicious.  The milk tea wasn't super sweet and went really well with the pudding.  There's just something about the glass bottle that makes it taste that much better.  It's kinda like how coke is in a real bottle.  Haha.  

If you return the bottle, I believe you get 10% off your next purchase.  What a brilliant marketing concept.  Parking is difficult.  It's best to take the bus out here or walk.  

I'd give it 5 stars anyhoo.
author: Jen W.

description:
Ordered: Honey Milk Tea with Boba

Why 3 Stars:

Honestly the tea was very average here and the boba was quite good. Nothing about the drink stood out as wow or you need to come here. Kind of tastes like most other boba places and so I wouldn't really say that you need to come here and check it out.

Something that they do, do is that they serve their drinks in glass bottles and that is very cool and unique. Also they have plastic caps on the top so that you can take the drink to go if you would like. 

Once again the reason I came here is because I am from Seattle and I heard that the Bay Area boba is so much better and that is why I made my way down here.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I got the Thai Milk Tea with Tapioca. I love Thai tea and this one was alright. I didn't think it was exceptionally good. I love the concept of having boba in a glass jar and this was exciting. 

I want to go back to try the teas next week.
author: Millie W.

description:
Dropped by after dinner and grabbed a Hot Matcha Latte with Grass Jelly.

Hot drinks don't come in the glass bottle, so don't order a hot drink if you're coming for the bottle aesthetic. 

The drink was okay - not too sweet but the matcha flavor wasn't too strong either. The grass jelly was slightly sweet and yummy, but the portion wasn't very generous.

I've been here before for boba, and I would say this is overall a decent tea shop but doesn't compare to anything from LA.
author: Anna M.

description: Terrific boba! I prefer Plentea over Boba Guys or other higher end boba chains in the Bay Area. I love the glass bottles which make grabbing and go a breeze, and is more eco friendly. Plus staff has an awesome attitude. To me this is the top spot for boba in its area.
author: Sam S.

description:
One of the best tea place in the city.  This place pours tea in glass bottle instead of plastic cup like other places.  Advantage for glass bottle is able to keep and bring it for next visit.

I been there for few times and only drink either no sugar black tea or oolong.  Toppings usually either tapioca, grass jelly, or red bean.  I am probably different than other customers who I seen so far drink either milk tea or slush (like smoothie but not as watery).
author: Charles S.

description:
When you first walk in and look at the menu it looks so simple and plain but once you you mind opens up to all the possibilities come into mind. 

My husband and I have had 

Nutella milk tea 

Nutella milk tea with extra nutella 

Iced coffee milktea with nutella 

Lavender lemonade with aloe (wish it didn't have seeds pain in the ass to drink)

Fresh fruit Oolong mango tea with grass jelly

Sweet taro milk with taro pudding and grass jelly 

Iced carmel milk with tapioca 


and we have yet to cover the menu. 

I really enjoy the glass bottles that come with the every drink and the discount that is offered if you bring it back. 

Currently craving iced coffee milk tea with nutella.. yum.. :)
author: Lindsay S.

description:
I like the Milk Bottle gimmick.

It's pricey. With the Kash app the first order is free.. not sure if there is a limit. But it is a bit of a hassle to sign up for the Kash app.

Tea does not hold up to time in the refrigerator. I thought it was good when I got it, but later the tea just tasted bland.
author: Michael W.

description:
The hype surrounds the bottle. It's trendy, hipster, and Eco-friendly. Plus, if you decide to keep it and bring it back, you get 10% off your drink.

But, unless you work in FiDi and remember to grab your bottle on the way out, it's highly unlikely you'll be scoring that 10% discount on a regular basis. Unless carrying heavy glass bottles in bags is your makeshift workout. Which seems intriguingly dangerous.

Nevertheless, the prices of the drinks here definitely absorb the cost of the branded glass bottles, running you around $4-$5 for your drink and an additional $0.50 per topping.

That is steep.

I usually get their fresh fruit teas, $4.95, with tapioca for an extra $0.50. They use a fruit purée instead of syrup, which I enjoy, and you can customize the sweetness and ice as with any other chain milk tea store. The pearls are chewy, the tea is smooth, and they use crushed ice--aside from the price, they're doing it right.

Plentea is among plenty of milk tea options in the city. But, if you're hankering for tea in FiDi, or if you really want a souvenir glass bottle to add to your glass bottle blowing band, a visit to Plentea is as good as any.
author: Adele F.

description: love their bottles! The drink is not bad and the service is pretty good.
author: Clare L.

description: I love this place! Cute interior, reusable glass bottles, but the best of all- their tea is high quality! I ordered a sea salt caramel specialty milk tea and my friend ordered a roasted oolong. Not too sweet, but still flavorful enough. I usually frequent Wonderful Food on Irving and Purple Kow in Richmond, but Plentea is a strong contender! I'll be back! =)
author: Y D L.

description:
We were craving boba and saw some people walking on the street with boba milk tea in glass bottles. We decided to try it out. The boba shop is cute, modern and clean. 
The boba the texture was off and uneven. The drinks are overpriced at $6-7. I got the matcha green milk tea and it didn't taste like the real matcha at all. It's a unique concept and cute but the quality of the boba drinks is way off. 

Pros: you get to keep your glass bottle. They give a 10% discount if you bring it back for future drinks.
author: Essie K.

description:
Try Plentea just to say you've been here. And for those cool looking bottles. Other than that, the drinks are really nothing special. Except for the taro milk tea cause that is fresh off the boat. Not the boat, maybe wherever taro grows from. The drink has taro bits in it, and it doesn't taste like they used powder. 

If you reuse the bottle, they give you a discount. Don't be too amazed because the discount is probably just the price of the bottle. Nothing surprising there. 

Kind of annoying to drive with the drink once you put your straw in and started drinking because it leaves you wondering where to store the cap. I don't know about you but I wanted to keep the cap so I had some hard time keeping it in a safe place so that it doesn't get lost. All for a cap. Yup. 

The boba shop is kind of small, but it's two story! So if there are no more open tables on the first floor, try your luck on the second. The second floor is more like a loft because you can look down to the first floor from it. There is also a cool hipster decorative area that will gain you all them likes on instagram. You're welcome.
author: Alison K.

description:
Got the Iced Milk with Caramel and Egg Pudding and 50% sugar. My initial reaction was that it tasted like Purple Kow, so it wasn't that special. I'm glad I got 50% sugar because caramel added sugar already. The egg pudding wasn't that sweet either, so I was able to drink my drink without feeling too guilty. I liked it, but again, nothing too special. Maybe it's their teas that sets them apart from other boba places.

It's cool that you get to keep the bottle and they have lids for you to take home. My friends told me that if you bring it back for a refill, you get a discount, not sure how much though. When my friends and I were lounging on their second level, a ton of people had left their bottles and it was tempting to take them, but there wasn't a place to wash them out.

Also, they don't have a bathroom, so figure out a different place to alleviate your bladder after drinking all that fluid.
author: Stanley C.

description:
Honestly, I went to Plentea because of two reasons:

1. It was a Sunday and Boba Guys was closed
2. The cute little bottles pictures on Yelp

It was around 3pm on a Sunday afternoon. There were quite a few customers, and interior design was pretty nice. Supposedly besides milk tea, this place also sells juices, shakes etc.

Iced Oolong Milk Tea (half sweet) with boba: C.
I was very disappointed. I almost felt like drinking water. Usually with half sugar, the tea taste should stand out or at least you can feel some milk silkiness - not at all. There was also no taste for the boba. Drink quality aside - the cups they use are the simplest plastic transparent cups with no decoration whatsoever, so there is no marketing/art point that I could have added.

Meh, next time I am in downtown craving for boba on a Sunday, I would rather walk up a bit more to Chinatown to get some higher quality drinks.
author: Simon C.

description: Ordered the regular milk tea with black tea and the Nutella milk tea. Both very good. We ordered takoyaki as well and that was delish.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
The place is really good! Lacks light outside but inside, good wifi, very nice and welcoming personal. 
Great variety of drinks, my favorite one is the oolong tea or the nutella one!
I always add tapioca or aloe!
But if you really want something to eat the takoyaki is really good for being in San Francisco.
author: Tatiana P.

description:
Drink: Black milk tea with boba, 0% sugar. 

Milk teas with boba are pretty much my baseline when trying out boba places. I usually order milk teas with no sugar and hope that their tapioca balls are well soaked in brown sugar/honey/sweetener.

Honestly, I wasn't super impressed. The tapioca balls were just okay in texture, not that sweet at all. I was truly disappointed with the milk tea however. It was watery, not at all creamy, and I could just barely taste any tea. I might as well have been drinking dehydrating water? I had to make sure I had some boba with each sip to get some flavor. 

I definitely like the glass bottles that come with the drinks and their incentive to reuse. I think it's a fun idea. 

As for the store, the store was pretty clean, and the employees were very kind. Since they don't have a public restroom, they even gave recommendations on some restaurants nearby that had restrooms I could use LOL. 

WiFi is great with readily available password, plenty of seats and outlets on the second floor. Fair warning though, the speakers are located on the second floor, so it's LOUD.
author: Nicole B.

description: Great little boba shop on my first visit to SF. Many options that all seemed delicious. I personally went with the Nutella Milk Tea which had a nice little chocalately addition to each sip of milk tea. I didn't ask for any bubbles so I can't comment on that. However do note that you only get to keep the glass bottle if you order a cold drink. Warm drinks will not come in the glass bottle.
author: Jackson S.

description:
This is a good place to bring a date or to hand out with friends. 

ENVIRONMENT
The downstairs space is limited but there is an upstairs as well. Don't expect it to be quiet..think Starbucks.

SERVICE
It's a little slow. You can wait in line for up to 30 minutes; especially on Saturdays. It's good, but they really need to start taking orders from people standing in line starting at the front door. They use an iPad for payment so it would really be easy.

COST
It's a bit pricey, but you get to keep the beaker. They do offer a 10% discount if you bring your own beaker back, but who carries a glass container around with them. 

QUALITY
I will that it's good and they take the time to get it right. I've have the Ice Milk with caramel and the brown sugar, but the caramel is better. The iced coffee is just ok, but the standark milk tea with boba is good. 

FOOD
I haven't eaten there since they do not offer anything Gluten free.
author: Eric E.

description:
The bottle is probably one of these smartest marketing ideas that this place has. Everyone comes here because they want the bottle or they want to use their bottle they got for a 10% discount. Also, it sounds like they often run out of the bottles because when I went, they didn't have bottles to sell nor did they have any when a friend of mine went a week ago. Again, the bottle is such a smart marketing idea.

I got the regular milk tea with the lychee jelly. It's alright. Nothing special. I've also had the crema before, which wasn't as great but I do have to say it was being saved for me for quite a number of hours in a fridge, so I don't think it's fair for me to review it besides saying that it's not good after being in the fridge for a while. 

The interior is really nice. It's clean and it's two levels. When I went, it was a bit stuffy and warm, but it was okay for me because I was a bit sick and cold. However, my friend said it was too much. I enjoy sitting in the upper part of the place, it's a nice place to grab a drink and catch up with a friend.
author: Julie L.

description:
You must stop in if you're spending the day in SF. Thirst quencher for walking all around the city. I ordered the oolong strawberry fruit tea with lychee and my boyfriend ordered peach black tea with aloe- both really good! 

I'm giving them 4 stars because they were out of the glass bottles again however, they did still offer us 10% off. The line was out the door but it went by pretty quickly and was worth the wait.
author: Kim T.

description: So I might have ordered poorly, because I thought the drink was only okay. I got the mango fresh fruit green tea, with boba and lychee jelly. It was overpriced but you pay for their glass bottle too. I should have really asked for them to make it less sweet, but it just slipped my mind, so overall the drink was too sweet for me. Otherwise I'm sure I would have loved it. The staff was friendly and helpful.
author: Shelley C.

description:
4.5 dollars for plain milk tea is slightly expensive in Chinatown. But considering that I got a glass bottle it wasn't bad for the price.

There was a lot of ways to customize the drinks here. I was able to get it unsweetened, which I wasn't able to do in a lot of other bubble tea stores. The store was nicely decorated, and much cleaner than the streets outside. I got the plain iced oolong unsweetened milk tea. It was a just plain milk tea, unsurprising. But it was a good break in a long day of walking. I wouldn't suggest fully unsweetened with Oolong, since it turned out quite bitter.
author: Yu S.

description:
I use to rant and rave about Plentea to all my friends and coworkers, but after a recent visit, I have to say their quality has really gone downhill. While never a big fan of any of their food and desserts (tried a few sandwiches and their cheesecake), I was quite die-hard in my devoting to their amazing drinks. 

I typically order a honeydew boba with either lychee or tapioca. And since I never remember to bring back my glass bottle, I always wind up buying a new one. Something I am quite fine with, as the bottles are well made and I reuse them for various other purposes. The other day, I went back with some coworkers and I ordered my usual w/ tapioca, and it was literally the worst boba drink I ever had in my life! a Huge glob of honey that was just sitting on top of the tapioca made the drink rather bitter, as I could not stir it enough to actually mix the drink sufficiently with just my straw. The tapioca balls were hard as rocks, instead of chewy like they were suppose to be. And the drink itself tasted like it was made out of the powdered crap that Quickly uses. For a $7+ drink after tax, it was definitely not worth the premium price. 

Pros:
-Clean Store
-Friendly staff
-Plenty of indoor seating, including an upstairs balcony
-Durable, aesthetically pleasing, reusable glass bottles

Cons: 
-Difficult parking. There is a parking garage one street down. But add that parking cost to your drink, and it becomes very expensive.
-Long lines
-VERY pricey drinks
-Poor quality drinks/food

I truly hope that my experience was a one-off, but I get the feeling that there has either been a change in ownership or a major shift in their business model to have concocted such an awful tasting drink. Either way, I definitely won't be recommending Plentea to any of my friends/family anymore nor do I think I will be returning for some time.
author: Alex C.

description:
One of the worst feelings is finding out there's no tapioca pearls after craving it for the past few hours.  Thus, I'm really not impressed when boba places run out of their honey boba WAY before they close, like 3 hours before, which was the case when I went here.  If you're a boba tea joint, that's one key product you just don't run out of. 

Anyhow.  I got the sea salt crema oolong to go.  The tea and crema are alright, nothing amazing that sets it apart, and it's overpriced.  You can get something similar with a bigger portion, AND that's cheaper, back in Berkeley.  Granted, it is SF, and I also didn't get the cool looking glass bottle, which I think is trendy and a smart way to get people to come back.  

Maybe I'm just bitter because I didn't get my boba.
author: Emmeline C.

description:
This place is SO cute. Definitely instagram worthy, isn't that how we judge eateries now? 

The menu is really streamlined and easy to choose from, unlike a lot of other milk tea shops which have menus covering the walls. 

The staff was really quick and nice! 

The flavor in my tea was delicious. I loved that they have a yelp coupon also!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Came here last year for their drinks while on vacation in San Fran.. Not bad at all...

The prices are a little high, but that's because they give you the container too (glass cup jar thing).

Minus two stars for the attitude that one of the girls gave us when we asked if there was a bathroom. They also wanted to close earlier and wanted to shoo everyone out. Not very friendly.
author: Summer S.

description:
Recently revisited a lot of boba spots to share some tips, here's my first stop:

I like when some restaurants and bars offer a commemorative pint glass, but things change a lot when they are like "BTW, you're gonna pay for these artisanal glasses every time you want a drink." 

I suppose it works if you save Plentea as a "my friends are in town" spot, so I am sticking with three stars. 

Boba: Average, you're getting a lot of placebo from that bottle if that's your thing
Crowd: FiDi lunchers, Marina stragglers, food couriers becoming artisanal milkmen
Try: Asking them to make it less sweet, dang!

Maybe they could do growler fills? (If this becomes a thing then you better pay me)
author: Taylor S.

description: Cute place, drinks come in these cute bottle with caps. I got the matcha latte with almond milk, egg pudding and less sweet. I like you can customize the sugar level. They also have food and snacks like salad and waffles. But I think some of their dishes are premade. There's an upstairs area for you to sit and chat. I didn't see any bathrooms, so that kinda sucked.
author: Minerva L.

description:
The only thing good about this place is the bottle...which you're paying for with their high prices.

-TEA SUCKS
-OVERPRICED
-OVERRATED


DON'T COME HERE.
author: Jenn L.

description: I love going here for the ice milk with caramel! The Matcha wasn't that great but it was okay. The fruit slushes are pretty delicious! It's a bit of a walk from downtown market (Powell St.) but it's worth it. Be sure to bring your jar back to get a discount on your drinks! The seating upstairs isn't spectacular or spacious, but it's better than crowding up the bottom seats by the door.
author: Sabrina H.

description: The only reason why I came here was for the glass bottle and that's the only reason why you should come too. The prices are high (like boba guys high) because of the bottle and not because of the ingredients.  The boba was just alright and could have been of a better consistency. I ordered the oolong milk tea and it wasn't too sweet (which was good), but it felt just a little watered down. If I am ever in Chinatown and really have to have boba, I may come back and get it without the glass bottle (if that's an option). It is a good place to hang out because there is seating upstairs. There are seats downstairs, but those tend to be taken over by people who are waiting for their orders. Otherwise, I will just go to my usual boba spots. If you are in the union square/westfield mall area, there is a boba guys on stockton and a sharetea on mission st.
author: Breniel L.

description: Good peach oolong tea. Event unsweetened is somewhat sweet and it comes with small apple fruit chunks.
author: Alison D.

description:
I was worried that this place was all hype but there's something alluring about a long line of people. I mean, it must mean it's good since people are willing to spend 30-40 minutes waiting. 

Turns out, it was pretty good! :D. The milk tea I got was one of the best ones I had. Minus one star because they cater to those with the stupid glass bottles. I didn't want a glass bottle because I didn't want to take it home on the plane so I ordered it in a normal cup but it was poorly packaged and dripped all over me.
author: Roger R.

description:
I think the bottle they serve it in is what brings the tourists in. I had the honey dew slush and my cousin got the brown sugar milk tea. We both liked our choices. The boba was a 8/10. 

Don't forget to use your 15% coupon thru yelp!
author: Max M.

description: Not good and expensive. Kind of irritated that my coworkers made me wait in a super long line and hyping up about how good it was. It took us about half an hour to get a drink. Cute jars, but the tea was really weak and not good quality at all. I asked for half sugar and it ended up tasting super watery.  I'd rather go to Ten Ren's in Chinatown.
author: Linda H.

description: I think Plentea is just okay. A bit pricier than your normal boba, but it's because you get to keep the glass bottle (or return it for a partial refund). A heads up - the taro milk tea isn't that sweet since it uses the natural sweetness of taro!
author: Janet H.

description:
The drinks are really refreshing and they come in cute glass bottles/jars! A little pricey, but I guess the glass bottles/jars compensate for that and double for a souvenir. 

The ambience is really pleasing. It has urban feel to it or something along those lines. 

Overall, I would recommend if you've never been here and it's something everyone should at least stop by and check out once.
author: Emily T.

description:
I have been going to this place ever since my friend took me my sophomore year of college. 

I love their use of the glass bottles and they are super cute to reuse as a water bottle or even a vase/pot.

My only suggestion is do not let the staff talk you out of getting almond milk. I don't drink milk and the server convinced me not to get almond milk because the standard milk they put in the drink is "lactose free". I was feeling awful afterwards and regretted following her suggestion.
author: Raquel T.

description: Drinks are served in a glass bottle that you get to keep and it's reasonably priced for around $5! I really only come here for the glass bottles otherwise I wouldn't go out of my way to visit. The drinks themselves are decent, but they're nothing special. This place also has a really trendy ambiance and there's an upstairs loft for people to sit and hang out. I normally order the original black milk tea w/ boba and I avoid the fruit teas because they tend to be overly sweet and taste like juice. Overall, decent boba shop and would return!
author: Christian V.

description:
**REVIEW FOR DRINKS AND SERVICE ONLY. 

Ice milk with Caramel and boba - quite bland .. Nothing special 

Peach green tea with lychee - fresh fruits bits are in the drink which is awesome. Aside from that it's really basic , normal , nothing special. 

Glass bottles are cool !! 

It was about $10 for both drinks including the Yelp! 15% off for checking in. The service is kind of slow. They seem to be low on supply and had to refill a few things while I was there and there was a line sooooo heads up its gonna take a while.
author: Trinity N.

description:
Plentea is a small shop along Kearny--you'll walk right past it if you aren't looking. I came for the glass bottles and was kind of disappointed to find that they were only serving them in disposable cups, but the tea was good--if not a bit expensive. 

One nice aspect is that if you ask for less ice THEY ACTUALLY GIVE YOU LESS ICE. This means more product and less melting. I bought the sea salt crema despite multiple warnings by my friends that it was the only bad flavor. I liked it but I'm used to drinks like this. 

Decent tea. A bit pricey. No more glass bottles.
author: Joseph Y.

description:
Went for the first time and enjoyed the ambiuance of the small yet, well put together Boba shop. I'm not really into Boba, but a friend and I went and we enjoyed it. I ordered the Nutella Milk Tea w/out Boba and I loved it. I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option. 

Great place! Plus I like the bottles the drinks come in.
author: Tony D.

description:
Delicious oolong milk tea! 

Packaging is adorable and service is friendly :) Love it here and will be back
author: Emily C.

description: Super very nice and good atmosphere. Tea and more fresh and good test. Downtown San Fra, looks you are in other place, quiet and relax
author: Raffaele L.

description: It's true. The glass bottles really do make it taste better. Be prepared to wait in line. I tried the oolong milk tea with tapioca and the peach green fruit milk tea, also with tapioca. Both were super dank. Be sure to check out the upstairs seating, it's way chill.
author: Andy B.

description:
To be fair....Plentea is no big deal. What really attracted me to the place, that being it is in CHINATOWN, is only their glass bottles. I ordered a regular milk tea and very disappointingly...I received no glass bottle :( no cool pictures to show off...
It says on the door that because of some distribution issues that the place they order their glass bottles from are currently not available. 
As a business, I would assume that they can find alternatives. It is very disappointing that they can simply say "out of stock" and expect to have returning customers. 
In addition, they charge you the same as if they did give you the glass bottles...not cool... either way I've had better and I probably would not go out of my way again to come visit Plentea again.
author: Katie P.

description:
Friday; 10:30 pm; with the bf

Not so crowded, maybe 4 orders ahead of me. First time here so we were obnoxious with our questions.

Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea: not the best I've had. The crema part tasted gross, and there was too much sea salt. Make sure not to shake or else it messes up the taste.

Strawberry and Mango Smoothies: these were separate orders one with boba other with pudding. I prefer pudding and I prefer strawberry. Mango may taste better with pudding.

The pearls/bobas hardened quickly; means maybe they weren't boiled for long enough? All in all the drink wouldn't last in the cold.

ALSO: just because the bottle is "glass" doesn't mean hot drinks go in there, I tried to have some hot tea in mine the next day and a circle of glass fell from the bottom of the bottle. But they are cute!

Would probably go again to try all the other drinks. Would not order any of the same drinks.
author: Rose L.

description:
Came in at around 10:30pm after having dinner at Alexander's, there were 3-4 guys behind the corner, nobody greeted us as we walked in. The guy just stood there as I was looking over the menu. When I got ready to order he barely talked, everything he said was a low mumble. I ordered the honey lemon oolong tea with boba and a mango fresh fruit tea with aloe. 

Their little point system thing, five star?, was malfunctioning, he didn't bother to tell me. I kept entering my phone number and he just stood there telling me the total. I asked him did it go through? because i would like to receive my points. he then looks at the machine, and says oh the system is down right now, idk. uh... ok.
 
What I ordered:
Mango Fresh Fruit Tea, add aloe:
Came maybe 8 dinky pieces of fruit inside. The aloe was huge chunks, which I like, but the tea in itself was very bland. Almost had no flavor at all. It tasted like water with a little bit of flavoring from the aloe.


"Lemon" Honey Oolong Tea with boba:
Came lime wedges floating inside the bottle (I hate it when restaurant just toss citrus in my drinks, I have a thing with not trusting restaurants to scrub their citrus thoroughly.) The drink in itself was too sweet. Either they used way too much honey or its made with syrup. Either way I could not finish the drink, I really wanted the boba too. 

I would go back if I'm ever in the area, but would probably stick with the milk teas instead.
author: MsJen C.

description: This is the only milk tea place I've went to that has a bottle for the milk teas and their milk teas and shakes are pretty good. I love their avocado milk because it's blended with real avocado unlike others which is blended with flavored powder. I ordered a mango milk before and it taste like power. Now the avocado milk has more milk taste than the actual fruit taste. I prefer to taste more of the fruit than the milk.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Originally I wasn't sure about this place but after trying their Iced Milk drink with brown sugar I was surprised to find it very sweet.  Luckily I love sweet milky drinks so I really enjoyed it along with their cute glass jar provided with caps (for drinks on-the-go). I just wish I knew about the check-in on yelp first so that I could get the 25% discount! Their Iced Milk drink was very similar to BB Tea Stations milky drink but I think I enjoyed Plentea much more. One of the reasons is that Plentea has an ambiance where there is an upstairs where customers are able to relax and enjoy their drinks and snacks. But it just proves that I will definitely be returning to the financial district for some Plentea.
author: Kaitlyn K.

description:
Been meaning to try Plentea for awhile now, but I tend to forget that it's there. So i finally decided to give it a try on Thursday with my boyfriend and I've been back 3 days straight now! I really like the bottle but at the same time I don't because it jack the price of the drink up so much.

I've had the Thai Tea with boba and it was good, but not my favorite. My boyfriend got the Matcha Milk Tea with boba and that was really good. You could still taste the matcha and it wasn't overly creamy or sweet either. I don't know if it's the days that i went that the boba was hard? So the next time that I went, i got the the Caramel Ice Milk with grass jelly. It kinda reminded me of Half&Half ice milk drink. It wasn't crazy sweet like the ice milk in Tea Society nor was it bland. It was sweet enough for me to finish the whole bottle and not feel sick after. 

Definitely will be back and this time i want to try the Nutella Milk Tea and their flavor milk (strawberry, mango, etc). I havent had any problem with waiting long, maybe it's cause I go in the evening. There's basically no parking unless you go after 6PM or park in those expensive parking garages.
author: Amy V.

description:
The attractive architectural design of the place was enough to grab my attention. Plentea is one of the up and coming hipster boba places that serves their drinks in glass bottles, which you get to take home with you! 

I came with a group of friends on a Saturday night around 10 pm and then place was packed! The line went out the door but that was good because I always take awhile to choose my drink of choice. Eventually, I settled on getting the Oolong Milk Tea with Boba and it was a satisfying decision. The portion was big, considering the size of the bottle and the price of the drink, and the oolong tea was flavorful, which was what was most important to me. 

Two other drinks that stood out to me were the Fresh Fruit Mango Tea drink and the Matcha Milk Green Tea with tapioca and grass jelly. 

I am in love with this hipster spot and am excited to come back and try more! I also really love their atmosphere. It was a welcoming environment that encouraged me and my friends to stand and talk there until closing time. Another plus is their free wifi!
author: Regina L.

description:
I came here last weekend with some friends that visited from LA and coincidentally it was my first time here too! But I've been wanting to come here for the longest time. Yes, ever since I saw the cute glass bottles. THEY GOT ME. 

Cash only with transactions under $10, you'll easily be over that buying 2 drinks. 

I got the green match milk tea with egg pudding 75% sweet
I really liked it! I think it was smart to get it with less sugar because egg pudding is usually pretty sweet. 

My friend got blueberry smoothie with pearls. Also pretty good but he loves blueberries.

You can also get a lid which seals on pretty tight which is good for on the go. 

I'll be back for sure and bringing my glass bottle back too! :)  recycling ftw.
author: Rachel C.

description:
I was in the area and decided to give this place a try since they give glass bottles instead of the regular plastic ones, which is very environmentally friendly. I ordered the lemon green tea and my friend ordered the Jasmine green milk tea with boba. I love the lemon green tea. It was pretty good. The Jasmine green milk tea however, was not very good. It had the same taste was Quickly's tea. I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas. 
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.
author: Kelly O.

description: Love the cute little milk hugs they come in. Thai milk tea with honey tapioca is amazing. Love the atmosphere with the little seating area upstairs. My boyfriend had the strawberry banana waffle and said it was amazing. It had slivered almonds and a chocolate drizzle on it. The only downfall, it's pricy, like the Starbucks of bubble tea. You get to keep the jug though!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I came here today with a bunch of friends excited to further explore the what else the world of milk tea had to offer. The place was fairly small, but because it had an upstairs getting a table wasn't really an issue. Ordering was really fast; their menu isn't super extensive. 

Overall the milk tea is just okay; very comparable to other milk tea places except I feel like this place uses a lot more tea, which some people may not like. The best part about this place is you get to keep the bottle! The next time you come in, be sure to bring your bottle for 10% off your purchase :)
author: Thuy T.

description: We stumble upon this due to all of the hype surrounds it. When first enter,  the decor was nice and spot on clean . Sure, we waited in line to order. I was disappointed  that there's no soymilk replacement. The cashier didn't even said there's any other alternatives.  No thanks. I order nothing, not even the teas. I was with someone that ordered and kept the glass bottle,  so that was not bad.
author: Anonymous U.

description: Good milktea in cute glass bottle：) I tried green tea milktea with aloe, yummy!
author: Meri Z.

description:
This place can be pretty pricey if you just want your boba fix... You're basically paying for the glass bottle... But you can bring your bottle back for 10% off your next purchase!

I don't have a favorite drink here, but I really enjoy their takoyaki!
author: Angela L.

description: I was super excited to see a bubble tea place that had non-dairy milk options. But when I arrived it turns out about half the milk tea selections are already mixed in with milk and cant be replaced with almond or soy. This would be my go to spot if it weren't for that. Plus one star for the glass bottles though!
author: Monica M.

description:
You really shouldn't have the cashier be drinking while I'm trying to talk to her. It seems almost unprofessional. Also I didn't get the correct change...i gave 20.95 and the drink was 5.93 and I only got 15 back. It was only two cents off so I decided not to push it.

Boba is okay. Came here for the glass bottles but not sure if it was worth the trip anymore.
author: George W.

description: I had started off with the regular black milk tea with boba, and the tea actually had a chocolate taste, which I didn't like very much. They have a sign up in the store saying that they'll fix something about the tea for you if you don't like it, so I went up to them and they actually switched it to oolong for me! The oolong milk tea was fantastic. Good tea and great staff.
author: J. Z.

description: Every time I go to SF, I have to stop by Plentea. Normally my SF trips are solely for clothes shopping in union square, but every time I go I have to stop at Plentea. The place is cute, definitely something you can post to instagram or snapchat. It had a cute area up top where you can lounge. The line goes pretty fast, however there's always a line when I get there. There's plenty of items to choose from. I definitely recommend the fruit teas because they come with real fruit!
author: Erica A.

description:
Solidly mediocre. I feel like this is very much a bubble-tea-for-kids kind of place--most drinks are excessively sweet, the tea flavor barely asserts itself, and I think many drinks rely on adorable toppings (the fruits sliced into the fresh or milk teas, the red beans at the bottom of the red bean matcha slush) instead of a solid base flavor. On that note, a small technical complaint--I got a peach green tea with aloe and the aloe chunks were cut too large to be easily slurped with a straw.

The glass bottles are cute and an excellent bit of branding (and also convenient if you want to grab a drink and walk around the city, consuming it slowly). The interior is also lovely and there's a decent amount of room in the upstairs loft area, so if you want to get bubble tea and lounge around on an expanse of seating with friends, this isn't a bad option.

It's very unlikely I'd come again (especially since Boba Guys is a short walk away and generally better), especially since the line was particularly long and the tea particularly meh for the price.
author: Celine N.

description: Delicious bubble teas. Hadn't tried bubble teas until we came to San Francisco and I'm so glad I chose to come here because they were so damn good! They have glass jars so you can reuse them and that's something I love about this place. There's also an upstairs section where you can go and enjoy your tea and there are a few tables on the bottom floor. The girl working was so helpful she she gave us samples so we knew what we were getting. Great atmosphere! We brought our jars back home to Idaho and didn't want to throw them out so we use them for decor and we love them. I got the brown sugar milk I belive it was with bubbles and my husband got a tea with bubbles. They have a ton of toppings and different drinks to choose from as well. If you don't like your drink they will happily make a new one for you. Thank you so much for the amazing experience we hope to come again soon!
author: Brenda C.

description: I dont exactly want to give a 4 star review because I think Pleantea deserves better but... well its expensive thats why lol. Cute bottle! I got a mango shake drink and it was fresh mango! I should try the tea though since thats what it is... a boba shop lol. But i like pleantea its just that spending $7 on a fresh mango shake isnt something I would want to pull my wallet put for heh
author: Jasmina D.

description: This is probably one of my favorite milk tea/boba places to go to in the city. The aesthetic of the store is amazing. Setup makes you feel like you have walked into a modern museum. There are plants everywhere, bamboo walls, making it feel more homely than ever. Nonetheless, the glass bottle that the drink comes with is reusable and reliable for any other occasion after you are done enjoying your drink. It is too notch and if I could come here everyday, I would.
author: Jack L.

description: I'm really glad that we stumbled upon this lovely place while walking around SF. I got the fresh fruit (strawberry) milk tea. There is an option to choose what kind of tea you want: green, black and oolong. The boba tasted like it was made fresh and had the right amount of chewiness. All cold drinks come in these cute hipster jars that you can bring next time you visit for $0.25 off your drink. Note that hot drinks come in regular paper cups.. that's why despite the freezing cold weather, I opted for a cold drink :)
author: Jeri A.

description:
Simple boba place, good quality milk tea (especially the oolong). Only qualm is the price which is higher than what I am used to, coming from SoCal. The service is really quick though, which can be good or bad. We ordered a sea salt crema oolong tea w boba and an ice green milk tea w boba ($11.22 total) and the order was made within 1 minute with no one in front of us. 

There's a good amount of seating with an upstairs balcony available! 

One big plus is that I ordered "less ice" and they actually gave me a noticeably less amount of ice! 

Also, card minimum of $10, which is basically two drinks.
author: Alison C.

description: I really like the glass bottles and unique variety here. Great location and a very popular spot. The only negative I have is that they hardly put any fruit in the fruit teas.
author: Amanda B.

description:
They take their time to make their drinks. I noticed the maker tastes it before pouring into their special bottles. I enjoyed my fresh fruit smoothie. 

I would visit again.
author: Ange G.

description: I drink the occasional boba or whatever. I came here for the bottles! Lol and of course to try the drinks. The bf and I ordered the fresh fruit peach green tea with boba and it was good! It was at the right sweetness and fresh pieces of peach..I enjoy that. Though I was not a big fan of the prices, kind of expensive! What if people don't want to pay more for the glass bottle and they just want some regular cups!? Anyways, was a good experience with friendly workers! I usually don't give too many stars for a drink place, but I enjoy my experience here and this place is worth a visit if you're ever around the area.
author: Vonnie T.

description: I ordered sweet taro milk with lychee jelly and taro pudding, soooooooo good! They used real taro to make the drink so it has natural sweetness and the lychee jelly is so refreshing. Love it! You can take the jar with you too.
author: Xin G.

description:
This place is not worth the hype. The only good thing about coming here is their cute jars which is about ~$5 for a drink. A bit pricey but that's the cost of getting something cute? If you keep it and bring it back, you get a 10% discount for reusing it..which isn't exactly much in my opinion. 

The place itself is pretty tiny and has 2 floors. It feels like a loft. Not many tables, but if you see one, you should snag one! It can probably seat 2-4 people? 

If I can recall correctly, I ordered a Strawberry Black Tea with honey boba. My boyfriend ordered peach green tea with honey boba, and both of us complained about the amount of sweetness in the drinks. Seemed to have a lot of sugar, and while drinking it, the jar seemed to be quite sticky. Not something you would like to carry around all day.  My drink also didn't taste any different and wasn't as amazing as compared to other boba places in the SF area. 

From a fellow yelper, she says they have about 300 jar-cups per day. If you don't arrive early enough for them, you'll get a plastic cup! Lines are also normally out the door, so try to avoid peak hours which is probably during lunch and mid-evening (around 4:30 pm).
author: Mandy G.

description:
Giving it 3 stars bc there's no wifi or bathroom, but if it was based on beverage quality, id say 5 stars. 

I needed a last minute location for a quick meeting on a Sunday night near downtown and I came across Plentea. 

There's a few high too tables to study/chat at downstairs and an upstairs with better seating. However this isn't a place for long term study sessions that involve internet. 

I ordered from the fresh fruit tea menu- green tea and honey dew with tapioca. My friend ordered the same but with aloe instead of tapioca. I preferred the one with aloe. They came in a cute little milk glass which you can take home and receive a discount with if you reuse it. 

Overall, great place to grab a snack, tea or stop by for a chat with a friend. 

Pros- 
Cute quick place to meet w a friend 
Deliciously fresh
10% off when you reuse glass bottle. 

Con: 
no wifi
No bathrooms
author: Alexandra B.

description:
Love this spot..I live super far in ssf but ide drive out just to get Boba here!
My fave is the original milk tea ..black..w tapioca
OR new fave sea Salt oolong crema w tapioca!
author: Gina I. B.

description:
We saw this place driving by to get dim sum, decided after dim sum to come try this bobba place. It was a line out the door, they were very fast and great service which i like . The bottles are glass and their name on it. The drinks around $5 not bad and comes with a glass bottle is nice but if you have kids not good for them to have. 

I had the lemon black tea which was very good and refreshing. This is the only location they have it busy but they say their in process trying to open a location in berekely. If im in the area  i might come back and try different drinks.
author: Hoa T.

description:
This place is alright, and it's probably the most convenient pearl milk tea place in the Financial District area.

Some good things: 
- The glass jars are cute. Sure, they're probably the reason why the prices are so ridiculous, but at least they're sort of unique. Some of my friends collect the jars, others can't wait to get rid of them, so I guess it's a mixed bag. Some kind of sink where you can wash the jar before you leave would be nice. (There's no bathroom, more on that later.)
- An impressive amount of seating considering how small the space is.
- Located really close to downtown and open late so you can go during lunch, as an afternoon break, or after work.

Some not-so-great things:
- There's no bathroom for customers, which means you might end up running back to your office to relieve yourself, especially since pearl milk tea is kind of a diuretic.
- The prices are pretty high, even for SF. I blame the glass bottles.
- There's not a lot of options for people who like hot drinks and people who don't like sugar in their drinks. Unfortunately, I fall into both categories.
- The tea quality isn't particularly impressive.

I've been twice and will probably be back, because it's the only pearl milk tea place that comes to mind in downtown, but it's definitely not worth trekking across town for.

== EDIT ==

Just popping in to say that I was mistaken and there is totally another pearl milk tea place in downtown. Boba Guys is literally two blocks over.
author: Brittany C.

description: We are lucky to live in a part of the country where there are plenTEA of milk tea places (Haha, get it?!). Ok seriously - the flip side of that is that many of those places are just OK. This is where Plentea stands out. As someone who spent a couple years in the LA/OC area, there just seems to be more good places down south (sorry norcal!). Cue Plentea - a solid spot with a great lineup of handcrafted drinks. I came here a few times, and my favorite is the iced milk drink with boba + pudding. I always choose caramel whenever they ask, and it is awesome. Very few places do the milk drink right up here. Oh and did I mention you get to keep the mason drink jar with your purchase? SCORE!
author: Darren L.

description:
This is likely the only and last time I let a transplant hipster tell me where to find a great boba milk tea in the city. The red flag should have gone off when he boasted of how his best boba tea experience was in Austin, TX, not Taipei, not Hong Kong, nope, not even LA...I should have known. 

Anyway, letting this guy talk me into trying Plentea is a rookie mistake I should not be committing. Plentea makes you buy these ridiculously impractical and heavy glass jars to house their mediocre boba tea. You can't even just turn them in for a refund, only discount for your next purchase. I'm sure there's a way for one to purchase the tea without the glass jar but this option sure isn't readily offered by the dude at the register.
