I mean, if I want a cool milk jar, I'd buy myself a jar of milk, not tea. I'd go to the grocery store and grab me my usual jar of Straus Creamery milk or half&half. Paying $5 to carry around a heavy jar of mediocre boba tea really makes me question whether to kick my own ass or to just recycle the glass jar and call it a day.

I would have tried to do both but I'm not as flexible as I'd like to be so in the meantime, I'm tossing the jar into the recycle bin and will work on my flexibility so I can kick my own ass the next time I let another hipster talk me into drinking boba tea from an establishment where impractical vessel for tea is more important than crafting the taste of the tea itself.
author: Taffany H.

description:
Man talk about overhyped. Oh cool I get a hipster little glass bottle to keep. That I'm probably never going to use. Oh and look they've got another one of those cute and punny names. Sure are plentea of those around. That totally makes this place better than the rest. /sarcasm

Simply put, this place is Quickly's in a glass bottle. The tea itself is pretty normal. The boba is where it gets ehhhh. Completely tasteless. Their menu says 'honey flavored boba'. Yeah that's not right. 

Being 100% honest here, the bottles aren't even really free. Their drinks are about $1 more than other spots. Do the math. You're paying for that bottle. 

Sure, the glass bottles make for a fun little Instagram post, but if the tea itself is meh then it's not worth the likes. Chalk up a pass for me.
author: Sean H.

description: Awesome bubbles! As someone from Taiwan and have had a ton of different bubble teas, Plentea is a great option in SF. I've only had the iced milk green tea so far, but I was really happy with it. Got it with bubbles and less sugar. If you're someone who enjoys a more fragrant tea taste in your drinks then definitely get green tea over black tea. The glasses they use are also super cute and it isn't plastic, so if you bring it back to reuse, you get 10% off. Only complaint I have is its quite pricy for bubble tea. It's probably because of the glasses they use.
author: Rohenne L.

description:
I actually am a big fan of Plentea! Aside from the fun glass jars, I think their drinks are very unique and tasty. The past couple times I've been here, I've gotten the Mango Fresh Fruit Milk with Pearls and it's delicious! Creamy and fruity, it makes for a sweet treat that's different from anything I've gotten from any other milk tea place. I can't really speak to any of the other drinks, but all of them sound interesting!

The decor in Plentea also adds to the experience here. Plants are lined up against the side of the counter and in a corner high up on the wall, and the wood furniture and chalkboard menus make it feel cozy and home-y. Staff is also very friendly!

The drinks here are pretty pricey, but that also includes the glass jar that you get to keep, which you can bring back for 10% off your drink. But what I wish they did was give that same discount for anyone who doesn't want a keepsake jar and would rather just have their drink in a standard plastic cup. I'd rather have that option than to keep collecting jars, just because visits can be spontaneous, as I don't always plan out my SF outings to include a trip to Plentea. Just a thought, but I do love the reusable jar concept!
author: Sabrina C.

description: my beloved milk tea + boba. no sugar, almond milk, everything's organic! the real fruit smoothie are wonderful too! keep the glass bottle (make sure it's clean) and get 10% off (for cold drink) next order! w/ sitting area & a snack menu.
author: Freya-Loki O.

description: Plentea is definitely one of my favorite tea places in the city! This place is close to union Square so I love to just grab a glass of tea and roam around the city to shop etc. They put the tea in the cutest glasses which you get to keep if you pay for it and the tea itself is just fantastic. There's so many flavors and toppings to choose from and the tea is fresh flavorful and I always come back here. I have so many of the glasses at my house and you can totally reuse them for anything. Awesome place!!
author: Anne F.

description:
Been here 3 times now, and the coolest thing about this place is that they give you a glass bottle. Other than the glass bottle I've found that you can get better tea for the price at boba-guys a couple of streets over. Or you can get a better bang for your buck (aka more boba for your $) over at cool tea bar, which also happens to just be a few blocks down. 

While this place doesn't have the 'best' (imho) boba around, I'm all for going to this place if there's enough people in a group that wanna go, I just wouldn't go here on my own volition. 

They've got a good selection of drinks, and their tapioca has some honey flavouring to it, which is a nice touch. But i've always found their tapiocas to be on the harder side, and not all that chewy. At the end of the day there's not much to complain, nor praise about this place.
author: David C.

description: Aside from the glass bottles there is nothing special about the tea itself. The tapioca had a good chewy consistency as expected from good boba tea.
author: James S.

description: One of my favorite places to go to for Boba! Whenever I come here I always get the brown sugar milk w/ egg pudding and boba! Bomb dot com! This place serves their drinks in a glass jar that you can keep, which is pretty cool & everytime you bring back the jar you get 10% off! The only thing about this place is that it can get a bit crowded because it's small but it's worth the wait! And the parking sucks cause it's street parking unless you don't mind paying a couple dollars for garage parking.
author: Johnny L.

description: I love their bottles. I love their presentation of boba tea. Super fancy. I ordered the sea salt crema oolong tea for my husband. The wait time wasn't too bad and when I recieved it, it was layered and was instructed to not mix it. I took a sip of the drink and the sea salt was throwing me off, which translated into, "I don't know if I like this one." The sea salt was strong enough to make me give it to my hubbs and be like, "Alright, here's your drink." Haha. Would I come back? Yes I would but I would order something else. Plus, I need a matching bottle for the one I have now.
author: Sharon B.

description: The service was great and informative on their selection. Price was good and they have cool glass bottles. Only downside was getting to the place.
author: Richard H.

description:
Wow! I came here at the recommendation of a friend and co-worker. It's a cute little shop near the Montgomery bart station--very convenient. 

I ordered the Taro tea with Taro pudding and it was amazing; it had the right amount of pudding to tea ratio and it was sweet enough and made with REAL taro! 

The kicker? It comes in a reusable bottle and you save 10% on your next drink if you bring the bottle back for your next purchase.

Service was awesome and quick. I'll def be back to get the SAME EXACT drink!
author: Sylvia O.

description: As a SoCal native, I feel like our standards for boba/pearl/bubble/etc. teas are pretty high. But I think I've found a good alternative for my boba cravings! The super big plus for me here is that the drinks actually come with nice glass bottles and you still get a lot of drink for what you pay for (considering they're giving you a glass bottle to reuse). Drinks are around $5 total with toppings and I got the Strawberry Green Tea w/ Boba. Pretty refreshing and not overwhelmingly sweet.
author: Tiffany E.

description:
Boba right? It's all the same isn't it? Some artificial flavoring added to great or black tea, a little milk, and of course tapioca. Sounds simple but there are lots of places that get this wrong. There are any places that just don't care. 

Isn't one boba/bubble tea shop the same as the other? This one is easy. The answer is no. Many places screw this up royally. Here they have taken their time to separate themselves and create their own niche in the boba world. They operate like a cafe, a chic modern cafe. They serve their drinks on 50's milk bottles and craft their specialty drinks utilizing the glass bottles for their transparency. 

They do milk teas, fruit teas, smoothies and specialty drinks. They also offer some great meals and awesome desserts. It's not a big place but it does have a 2nd level where you can lounge and enjoy your order. Of course there is an up charge. They are of course selling glass bottles. But if you come back with a bottle you get a 10% discount. Drinks start from $4.50 and can run up to $6.95 for smoothies. 

It may not be your every day boba shop but then again boba shouldn't be everyday. Go try it...you won't be disappointed.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Wanted to snag me a cool milk jug and so I hopped into the seemingly never ending line to order. This place is very snug with a stacked upper floor, but that's okay because I just wanted to stop in for a break.

I had the matcha milk green tea with boba and my counterpart had a strawberry tea slush. Our drinks were made fairly quickly and off we went upstairs. My drink was just okay, it was very similar to Starbucks' green tea latte (it's a common theme of mine to make poor food/drink choices.) The beau's plentea was quite memorable-sweet, tart, and so very refreshing after walking 8 miles that afternoon. 

The jar can be a nice vase for flowers. 
I've attached my hipster photo of our drinks to this review for your viewing pleasure.
author: Renee L.

description: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!
author: Doug V.

description: One of the better quality spots around town. Worth the trip, as long as you have a coupon, I wouldn't pay without it. Quality ingredients and the glass bottles are a nice add! Love their flavors and they're not that sweet! Made to order of course so very fresh.
author: Vivianna A.

description: After spending hours wandering around Chinatown, I exited the dragon gate and turned left twice and found myself inside Plentea! I wanted something to soothe my dry throat and was refreshing. Thus I ended up with Honey Lemon Tea with Egg Pudding. So delicious !! I wish I lived closer so that I can get it again. As if it couldn't get any better they also put it in a cute/simple glass bottle with their shop name on it and you can keep it. Now I use the bottle for my smoothies at home ^.^! Will visit it again for sure.
author: Tera S.

description:
Their boba is cooked a little on the soft side, and very sweet, just the way I like it. I could just eat their boba with a spoon by itself. 

I thought their prices would be steep because of the glass bottle, or you'd have to pay a $2 deposit for the bottle like a lot of pressed juice shops. Nope the prices were very reasonable and about the same as if you were to buy tea in a plastic cup.
author: Angella A.

description: First timers...and worth the wait! Friendly staff, fave varieties of drinks, and a cool hangout. Parking can be tricky since it is in a busy city street. Nonetheless, find parking and take a nice stroll to this place in this great city.
author: Patricia C.

description: It was super packed when we arrived at Plentea and street parking is never great. I got the matcha + read bean that's on the menu instead of making my own. The matcha has a very soft taste, it could be stronger. I thought it was a little bland. The melted slush in the bottom or the red bean had all the sweetness to it. I don't think I'd come here if it was that packed for some just average boba.
author: Alyanna A.

description:
Its cute how the drinks come in those old time milk bottles. If you bring the bottle back, you get a 10% off of your next drink! I ordered avocado shake for my mother, I ordered the avocado milk drink with lichi jelly and my sister tried the salted caramel. 
My mother really liked the avocado shake because it didnt taste too sweet and it was very creamy. Not like the other places she had tries before, where it was OD on sugar and watery. 
I thought that avocado milk drink was yummy. However, it tasted wateres down but that was my fault since I didnt drink it until later when all the ice had already melted. But i would definately prefer the avocado shake or the salted caramel drink.
author: Stacy W.

description:
What is up with the crazy line for Plentea? 

During a late lunch, I saw my opportunity to try Plentea (no line!) 

I ordered a green milk tea with tapioca. 

Opinion: Yummy, sweet, good stuff. 

Con: Is a tapioca tea really worth around $5?
author: Irina R.

description:
Came here for another visit and hated it so much I had to give it an updated review.
Yes, the same old problems are still there. Bland, over-priced drinks and no Wi-Fi.

But I've never had someone told me that what I ordered was wrong, or that I ordered something that I didn't.

I stopped by and asked if they had "HONEY GREEN TEA". Really not that complicated of an order I don't think. Especially for a boba/tea joint.

After waiting 5-10 minutes for my drink, I was given a HONEY LEMON TEA. And after taking a look and sniffing it, I didn't even have to take a sip to know it was the wrong drink/not what I wanted.

When I approached the cashier and let him know, He told me, "No, that's not what you ordered, this is how the drink always comes". Uh, what? How would he know how the drink I want always comes? What does that even mean? Anyways, after a prolonged awkward silence. I finally caved and just asked him to replace my drink..
And guess what.. he did have a honey green tea.. even after insisting that they couldn't make it... So confused...and unhappy. Never again, no matter how many times my out of town visitors beg me to come here...
author: Andrew T.

description:
Don't get me wrong I really love the green milk tea here, however I realized the discount for bringing your bottle back is not really worth it. 10% isn't really that much off the order, might as well just keep getting more bottles and pay regular price.

When I first came here I thought, "Oh yeah the price is reasonable for boba since we are pretty much paying for the bottle..." Why is it still so costly when we bring the bottle back? They're just refilling it... Probably because it is in the financial district, and in San Francisco so OF COURSE it's a little more pricier. They need to make it like a 25% discount or something or even 30%! 10% is nothing.

I also don't like the fact that I can't customize the taro and brown sugar. I wanted a taro milk tea and a brown sugar milk tea, all they offer is just the milk... Obviously a lot is pre-made since there are many jugs of milk tea already sitting out but can they add a little more options with their teas please? 

I usually recommend this place for the glass bottles so its a one time thing kind of place.
author: Zsa Zsa G.

description:
You can't go wrong with boba...

 I ordered a honey dew and an avocado drink. My honeydew drink was okay but the avocado drink seemed like it was missing something....

Oh well..

I will be using my glass bottle for a crafty picture collage.
author: Jay B.

description: I'm lactose intolerant, so I ordered soymilk. Either I was given dairy or I got food poisoning: I got sick from their boba.
author: C. H.

description: I get the Caramel Ice Milk EVERY SINGLE TIME. IT IS AMAZING. Personally I love drinks that have great smooth texture and temperature along with the right amount of sweetness, and this always hits the spot.
author: Vincent Y.

description: I love the glass bottles. Bring your bottle back for 10% off. The creme milk tea is good. The boba was a bit too dense for my liking. Maybe it just wasn't fresh? Still the tea was good and I would return to try other flavors.
author: Lauren N.

description: Gave it a second try. Still bad. Forced you to use glass bottle. Coffee milk is bland. There is no body in the drink. Feels like bland milk, coffee and sugar. Long line too. Not worth $6 or $7 per drink.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Matcha milk tea with egg jelly = da bomb!! I'm a fan so far. 

-1 star cause they don't have a bathroom. Sometime I just need to go after having some milk tea. :(
author: Joon Y.

description: How amazing is this place to provide reusable glass bottles and when you bring it back you get 10% off!! Their flavors were great. I had the nutella milk tea which kinda tasted like chocolate milk. Not something I would get again to be honest. the second time I went I got the strawberry fruit tea and that was yummy. I shared the waffle with my friend and it was ok. I just enjoy the concept of using reusable glass bottles and they have a good amount of flavors to choose from. Their real fruit slush was good too from trying from my friend.
author: Heather S.

description: Plentea is a cool little lounge place that serves hot and cold bubble tea and a limited menu of foods. On our visit we came specifically for the Nutella bubble tea since that's not a flavor offering at most bubble tea places. When you enter you will notice they have a small shop, but make do with the size. It is very open on the inside and there is a seating area downstairs that is a bit cramped, but upstairs is a bit cozier with some sofas and the ability to overlook the downstairs portion of Plentea. I ordered the cold taro tea flavor with boba and my girlfriend got the cold Nutella bubble tea without boba. Both of the drinks were pretty good. Definitely would order the Nutella again. I have no idea if this is intentional, but all the bubble tea on the west coast that I have had ends up with a gritty consistency. I truly think it's the flavor powder that hasn't been dissolved and mixed properly. Either way, Plentea is a cool little shop with some nice sugary drinks. We will be back!
author: Vats A.

description:
Yelp, it's been a while. Quite a while since I wrote a review, but I can't just churn out reviews like a mindless machine, I like to craft my reviews and make sure it's an enjoyable read.

Wait what? I'm getting ahead of myself.

I saw my friend post pictures on Instagram about Plentea with the milk like jug bottles and I was like, "oh myy I have to stop by." Little did I know I stopped by the same night after dinner in Japan Town.

It is on Kearny, a little bit past the financial district and next to Chinatown. Google maps actually got the directions wrong (wanted me to go on the behind street) and I eerily missed it because where Plentea is located, there are no streetlights there and it looks dark as hell. Add to the fact Plentea didn't really looked opened so two clueless idiots drove right by then looked back and said "ooooh I think that's the place"

We ended up parking around the corner and walked there and I was surprised there was no line on a Saturday night. I mean there was clueless idiots standing around debating what to order but it didn't go out the door. Approaching the counter, we ordered the Thai tea with egg pudding, Green Milk tea with Boba and Oolong milk tea. 

After reading some of the reviews I was concerned I couldn't get the glass bottle especially since it was at night also, and when they called our number, I took a glance and I was so overjoyed. They had the glass bottles available even after a full day of orders on a Saturday. You'd expect them to be out. 

Hmm maybe that's why they looked closed so they don't have sell to more customers. Just kidding. We took the bottle caps for our three drinks and some straws and headed back to the car. The green milk tea was a delivery for another friend and she said it was good. My friend that ordered the Oolong was very happy with his choice. He claimed it was, "the best milk tea evarrrrr" to which he continues with its better than a lot of places he has been too. 

Curious I tried mine, as I went for the Thai Tea with egg pudding. First thought was it wasn't overly too sweet and that is a quality I like. You can taste/smell the Thai tea aroma, and it was silky smooth tasting oh so fresh. The egg pudding? Quite wonderful.

As much as this place makes it to one of my top spots in milk tea spots, I really hope it wasn't just a fluke when I went in that evening and it tasted good. 

It looks like they take all major credit cards but have an outrageous 15 dollar minimum. If you have the glass bottle save it after you're done! You get a 10% discount if you bring back your bottle.

I must try the other flavor drinks and the food. They all sound so delicious.

Cheers!
author: Harry P.

description: Never been to a plentea before. Since it was MLK day it was PACKED. I'm talking a 5 day vacation sharing a suitcase with a family member PACKED. Saw a very cute cashier so decided to wait. Waited for a very long time but the cute cashier kept me strong . Finally got to the front and talked to her (her name is emily, very nice name). She recommended the iced milk which I got. It was actually REALLY GOOD, but her beautiful warm smile made the cold drink into room temperature. Would definitely come again 10/10.
author: Walter L.

description: I honestly love the tea hear and the fact they give out glass bottles for you to bring back for refills, but the only down side is I asked of there was nuts on their waffles and they said there wasn't, but after I ate them I ended up in the ER a hour later.
author: Jullianna O.

description:
THE GOOD- As a taro lover, I know a quality taro milk boba when I see/taste one. I rise to the challenge of finding the best  taro everything (FYI Best taro bun goes to yummy bakery). I won't have to look any further for the BEST taro milk boba. Plentea uses real taro root chunks, not the purple powder crap. Why not use the real ingredient? You can get it for .83 ¢/lb a few blocks down the street at the chinatown market, capisce? Personally, I think the glass bottles are unnecessary, but hey you can recycle, help the planet, and get a .55 ¢ deposit if you return your bottle. Not much of a deposit but I'm down for helping the planet and rid the world of plastic cups.

THE BAD- Last time I returned my bottle, the cashier placed the ticket order on my bottle and put it on the assembly line. Hold up. They don't wash them first, or sanitize them before refilling your bottle?? Nope. They don't. 

THE UGLY- I confronted the cashier-girl about not washing the bottle.
Me- Wait, are you going to wash my bottle first?
Girl- No you need to wash it before you return it.
Me- Um, can't you just take my old bottle, and give me a new bottle?
Girl- No...We would have to charge you for a new bottle.
Me- Why would I be charged for a new bottle? If i'm bringing back my old bottle I should get a deposit for it and get a new bottle in return.
Girl- No we can't do that.
Me- Okayyy can you just wash my bottle before filling it again?
Girl-......ok.

You think thats ugly? I watched my bottle like a hawk, especially since the cashier went along taking another order and didn't communicate to anyone about washing my bottle. I gave her a glare and she quickly turned around and told some guy to rinse out the bottle. He looked puzzled but took it to the sink for a wash before refilling it. This is a mere glimpse into a world where we cut funding for education.
author: Mishi S.

description:
Probably one of the top 10 boba spots in the bay that I like is this place! Their souvenir signature glass cups that they give with the drinks were a cool idea.

Setting wise the place barley has no parking outside so your gonna have to probably walk from somewhere nearby so expect to walk! The place is two floors, but still kinda small so the line goes outside. There are only like 8 tables on the bottom floor (2 seaters) so when your drinking your drinks or eating food your gonna be looking at the people next to you that are in line.

Food and drinks! Food wise the food was okay I ordered the salmon rice plate before and it wasnt hella bad, but I did recognize the costco fish on it loool! But the food didn't taste processed ya know? Other foods like the sashimi salad was okay the sashimi was decent not frozen tasting or something and salad was fresh. Drink wise I've had the Nutella milk tea all the way to the taro one, and they're all really good so this is a definite place to try! :D
author: Jordan C.

description: This place is really neat. The atmosphere is super laid back and they have a lot of plants which was a nice touch. I love how you can take the bottles home and reuse them. Its a super eco friendly milk tea spot that I would definitely come back to. Their brown sugar, and hazelnut milk teas are the best.
author: Marissa M.

description:
Summary:  Trendy tapioca tea place in SF that is more about quantity than quality

Tea:  I got the oolong ice milk tea.  It comes in a glass bottle with the logo on it - very cool "green" way to serve up a beverage.  Unfortunately the tapioca was a little overdone, making the very outside of the boba too soft and the inside overly chewy.  The tea itself was ok but was exceptionally sweet.  Since the sign near the register said to tell them about any drink that isn't perfect, thankfully my friend took the bottle out of my hand and told them it was too sweet (I was thankful that she was so bold).  It came back with more tea in it and much better.

Shop: Cool shop with places to sit.  Clean and trendy, steps above the old boba tea shops from a decade ago.  Nothing incredibly special about it though.

Overall:  With just 3 visits to Plentea and Boba Guys, I have to say Boba Guys has this place beat.  The boba wasn't cooked well and the tea itself was just ok.  Go Boba Guys for quality.  Go Plentea for quantity and to support their green efforts.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Overpriced boba drinks... Cause you're paying for the glass jar as well. I wish they'd sell their drinks with the option of purchasing the jar or not though. 

Overall cute concept and interior.

And parking.. LOL it's SF, who am I kidding.
author: Diana T.

description: Drinks are overpriced, and it's more sugar than tea. The glass jars are a gimmick -- there's not much in there and gives them an excuse to charge a ton for very little content. The service is awful -- the guy picked up the phone in the middle of our order, so of course, he forgets to add boba in our drink as we asked right before he took the call. Then, when our drink came with no boba in it, they argued with us saying that we never ordered it, and then said "Fine, give us 55 cents and we'll put it in". Rude.
author: Kazu O.

description:
After working in the city for over a year, I finally was able to try this place. 

At any milk tea places, my signature drink to get is always taro milk tea, but due do my latest addiction to matcha, I had a decision to make. 

Since my friend was getting the taro, I got the matcha.

First of all, the glass bottle! I love the concept and if you bring it back, they give you 10% off or if you opt out you get 20%. Otherwise it's about 5 dollars drink isn't bad! Considering they give you a jar with their name on it!

The matcha was sweet, be sure to mix it! Decent.

The taro milk tea was phenomenal !! It was a thicker drink but I can taste the taro pieces! It was so good that I've decided I have to go back and get one myself!
author: Josie H.

description:
I love the tea here. It is served in glass milk bottles with the name of the company sculpted into the glass. The staff is friendly, there is always a line but it is always worth it. There is seating downstairs and there's an area upstairs as well. They also have a nice menu with sandwiches and snacks. 

The to go tops for the bottles don't hold terribly well. So if you put a full bottle in your bag, it might end up pouring out. I mean...I've heard this is possible... uh, yeah. Never happened to me. Nooooooo
author: Dave S.

description: It was alright, not the best. I've had the almond milk tea other places and this one was just ok. Prices are little more expensive for the glass bottle but its a cute little bottle. Now, I just need to figure out what to do with it. Great option for the Fi-Di but a little far for me.
author: Alicia A.

description:
DRINKS IN CUTE JARS! 

Great way to attract people, right? It's totally INSTAGRAMABLE worthy! :) I love the look of the jar and the toppings that float around inside! I would even save the jars! 

I ordered the green milk tea with honey jelly. There is nothing too special about the milk tea, so next time I'll give an update on the fruit drinks! My drink was $4.50 which is pretty pricy for milk tea but I'm sure I paid for the jar more than the tea. 

They don't accept credit card transactions less than $15 so bring money! However, the worker was nice enough to let me use card even though I ordered one drink... He knew I was a first timer! The place is pretty clean and looks new... A cool spot to hangout with a friend during lunch. 
Although if says Chinatown, it's in the financial district so goodluck finding parking or not getting into thick traffic around 5 during the weekday. 
I would recommend coming here for the experience of getting a cool ass glass jar and that IG pic that I'm sure will get over 100 likes ;) let me know your IG so I can like it! Haha
author: Sabrina L.

description: I like this place. I've been in several times, and I really love the iced honey lemon green tea. It's delicious, and it comes in an awesome glass bottle. The 25% off your order (when you check in) is an awesome deal, and makes this place affordable and even more appealing. Unfortunately, this place gets really busy, as is expected at places located in the financial district. The other day, the staff really struggled with the crowd. It took 15-20 minutes to pour my iced tea. Brutal. The young gentleman with glasses really held the team together, while the girl with pink hair really struggled with efficiency and awareness. I hope she was training that day! Either way, I'll most likely be back!
author: Alex E.

description:
Finally got to try this place out. For $5.54, I got an oolong milk tea with boba. I asked if I could get one without the jar. Nope. They were really fast getting my drink out. A lot of chewy boba and a lot of tea. Just right with the sweetness. I don't get the point of the jars even though they are really cute. From what I hear from other reviews - the caps don't hold well so you can't use the bottles unless you are at home. It is a bit pricey. =/ 

No bathrooms but the space is open and there is an upstairs seating area.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I've had overwhelmingly good experiences here at Plentea. The boba has almost always been good, and the milk tea is good. I'm not a huge fan of the fruit ones, but they're an interesting break away from regular milk tea. 

What's unique about Plentea is that they have their own mason jar glasses that they serve their drinks in -- and you get to keep!! There are plastic lids on the counter if you want to take your drink to go. 

This place is a little small, so the seating is limited. There's an upstairs area that is pretty sweet to sit at. 

Overall, a solid milk tea boba stop.
author: Mitty C.

description:
This was on my to-do list while visiting SF and honestly I wasn't that impressed.

We came about 2-3 hours before closing and they ran out of tapioca! What kind of boba place runs out of tapioca way before closing time? They can't measure when they're close to running out and making a new batch sooner? I came to try the sea cream oolong tea and it was alright. For the price and small portion you get, not worth it in my opinion. Our cashier said they're known for their milk tea so we got that as well and I liked my seacream oolong tea better and that wasn't even that good.

Two stars because our cashier was friendly and we got our tea fix. But not our 'boba tea' fix.
author: Sophia V.

description:
To be completely honest, the only reason why I wanted to try this place was because I know you get to keep the jars they serve their drinks in. I think that's how they attract customers, which is a bit unsettling knowing that people come here more often to get the jar than the drinks.

So many of my friends were posting pictures and talking about this place, my boyfriend and I finally decided to try it out. The drinks were definitely not up to par as I was expecting.
I got the Real Taro Milk tea with boba. It was so much more expensive than a regular milk tea, but that's mostly due to the jar. The drink, without boba, is $5 already! The drink itself was decent, not the BEST I've ever had, but not the worst either.
We also got the mango slush. It was also average, but I personally like their milk teas more.

Now that I have the jar, I don't know if I'll come back. Maybe if I'm in the area, yeah. But I wouldn't go out of my way to get it.
author: Jenny C.

description: It was my first time coming to SF and youtuber Weylie would come here sometimes to get boba, so I decided to stop by. I got the sweet taro drink and I loved it! It didn't taste like the typical taro drinks you get from Quickly, Coco, etc (even though those are good too). There was actually a bit of actual taro, which made it quite refreshing. For the price of the drink and getting to keep the glass bottle, it's cheap! Would def. come back again.
author: Jen Z.

description:
Honestly, I came here because I was so intrigued by the glass bottles. It's definitely a HEAVY bottle to carry around while strolling down SF. 

I ordered a Peach Black Tea with Boba and a Oolong Crema, and I was very much impressed, and here's the break down:
-there is ACTUAL FRUIT. not the CANNED-HIGH-CORN-FRUCTOSE-SYRUP-DRENCHED FRUITS
-the idea that ice is almost NOT an option because of the bottle neck size (score! so the drink doesn't get diluted!)
- It's definitely more on the tea side for both drinks, however, the crema was REALLY sweet in my opinion
-you used a souvenir! 

You're basically paying ~$5 for the bottle. As for the wait, yeah, it's out the door.. and if you're lucky enough, there are a few tables with chairs for the wait. But be prepare to wait!

OVERALL:
4 stars for the drink
3 stars for the hype
author: Lisa C.

description:
This shop isn't located in Chinatown like I had thought since on Yelp's address it did say it was in Chinatown. It's way closer to the FiDi but still within walking distance of Chinatown (~8-10min). There's only street parking and parking's hit and miss (depends on when you go). There are a few stools and tables down stairs, but they have a cute little loft upstairs as well with a couple cushioned seats and more tables. No public bathroom.

I have been wanting to come here for ages because I love the jars that they serve the drinks in! I came here with a group of friends right after dinner in North Beach, so we walked over around 9PM on a Sat. I was surprised it wasn't packed or that there wasn't a line. I definitely wasn't going to complain!

Drink Menu:
Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Premium Mount Tea: ($4.25) Black / Green / Oolong
Honey Lemon: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong
Fresh Fruit Smoothies: ($6.50) Strawberry / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Milk Smoothies: ($4.95) Strawberry / Papaya / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Tea: ($4.95) Tea (Black / Green / Oolong) with fruit (Strawberry / Orange / Mango / Peach / Honeydew)
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95) Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95) Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50) Honey Tapioca, Egg Pudding, Taro Pudding, Coffee Pudding, Aloe, Grass Jelly)

Waffle Sandwiches Menu: ($8.95) Add 2 Slices of Applewood Smoked Bacon +$1
Morning Waffle: Only served before 10AM. Bacon, Egg, Spring Mix, Swiss Cheese
Turkey Club: Roasted Turkey, Swiss Cheese, Avocado, Tomato, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Hot Pastrami: Pastrami, Swiss cheese, Avocado, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Smoked Salmon: Blue Cold Smoked Salmon, Herb Cream Cheese, Cucumber & Chives

Salad Menu: ($8.95) served with Spring Mix, Avocado, Tomato, Pecan
Meat: Turkey / Pastrami / Smoked Salmon
Dressing: Ginger / Mustard Soy Sauce / Yuzu Citrus

*All vegetables are organic

Dessert Menu:
Strawberry Belgian Waffle: Whip Cream, Fresh Strawberries, Jam, Almond Slices & Chocolate Syrup
Banana Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream, Banana, Nutella, Almond Slices, & Chocolate Syrup
Marshmallow Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream Topped w/ Toasted Marshmallow & Chocolate Syrup
New York-style Cheesecake
Tiramisu
Add Vanilla or Green Tea Ice Cream: +$1

Our Order:
Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding 
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca

I was debating between the two cremas and asked the cashier's opinion and she told me the most popular was the Sea Salt Creama Oolong. So I had the Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding and I LOVED my drink. The crema was really smooth and creamy and didn't have too much salt. The egg pudding had a good consistency as well. One of my friends also liked my drink more than hers. The bad thing is that they are not consistent in their drinks. One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet. The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers. The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus. Fairly pricey but so yummy!

Note: If you don't want your drink in the glass bottles, you get a 10% discount off the drink prices and get your drinks in a plastic cup instead. You also get the same discount if you bring the bottle back
author: Kitty K.

description:
Very smart marketing with the glass bottles to create hype in the FiDi. Before, unless you can get there before lunch time, you won't be able to get your hands on the milk bottle and it drove me crazy. I wanted my tea and boba in a milk bottle! But now, the milk bottle is available all day errday. Finally got one today and I was satisfied. 

Aside from the milk bottle craze, the quality of their drinks is good. The 2 times I've been here, I got the black honey lemon tea with aloe and tapioca. It's not sweet, the perfect hint of lemon without it being too sour, the aloe jelly gave it the perfect balance of sweetness, and the tapioca was fresh and chewy. I like it.

Today, Kash was having a special promotion in front of Plentea. Free drink on them if you download their app. Who am I to turn down a free drink?  Otherwise, this drink would've cost me $5.00 ($4.50 for the tea, $.50 for each additional toppings. Thanks Kash!) A bit pricey imo, but hey, now you are part of the trend drinking your milk tea in a glass bottle. Welcome to SF!
author: Cindy W.

description: Came here a few minutes after they opened and lemme just say, the guy that was ringing up our order was really nice. I didn't catch his name but he was super friendly. He also pointed out that he was wearing the same sweater as my boyfriend lol. Anyways, since we came when it opened, we were able to get the glass bottles. The drink prices range from 3.50 to 5.95 I believe. We ordered the milk tea and Nutella milk tea both with boba. I really enjoyed the milk tea because it wasn't too milky and I was able to taste the tea. My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea. I didn't get to try it but I assume it's chocolatey. We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like. It was super adorable upstairs. They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters. Overall, I would come back here to try other things.
author: Shannon C.

description:
Yummmyy!!! 

Everybody loves their glass bottles and shiet, but while I do think they're cute, I don't live in SF and wouldn't benefit from the 10% off thing........................ so whatever. Got me a regular cup.

Anyway, I ordered the sea salt crema oolong tea while my friend got an iced mango tea. The mango one was tasty! Fruity and not too sweet. Very refreshing. 

The sea salt (omg such a long name from now on it's SSCOT)...... the SSCOT was different than any salted tea drinks I've had! Well to be fair, I've only had like sea salt green tea (from multiple places), so this oolong tea was a new twist to me. But it had really good depth and flavor! I love sea salt-y drinks, and to be honest, if they have this down in SoCal I'd probably go a lot more often than I should. Like, I would purchase the shiet out of that glass bottle and reuse that bitch. sorry. Just excited. LOL

Good job Plentea. I haven't heard good stories about NorCal boba (I mean no offense I just HEARDDDD) compared to SoCal (esp 626 aka asia land) and this place definitely rocks.

Oh but yea price was fair for regular cups... I think.

* I can't give this a 5 yet because I didn't try their boba. If the boba is shitty then that's a game changer
author: Fran B.

description:
Two things I was a big fan of at Plentea:

1) The selection (they had NUTELLA milk tea!!!)
2) The use of reusable glass bottles (ranks high in 'grammability)

Obviously I had to get the Nutella MT as it was such a unique menu item. The Nutella flavour was strong and the drink itself was very good. Boba was prepared well. 

The glass bottle is narrow but very tall and comes with quite a lot of tea. Great value for the price.

There are usually lineups at Plentea, but the service is quick and you'll receive your drink in a reasonable time.

Definitely worth a visit!
author: Kris P.

description:
Their lavender lemonade (w/ aloe jelly) is simply splendid! It's really refreshing as it balances sweetness with a little pang of sourness - think a flavor like that of Sprite. 

The cleanliness and decorations of the store lead to a very chill and laid-back atmosphere, perfect for relaxing after a long day. Plus, getting to keep the glass bottles is a nice bonus. The only drawback is that these bottles can't be washed in warm/hot water - they crack :/.
author: Michael C.

description: Finally! After having this place bookmarked for so long, I was able to make a trip out to the city with enough time to find this place. Luckily when we got there, there was only about 2 other people in front of us. The menu is pretty simple, prices are a little high but hey, you get to keep the cool glass bottle and this is SF...obviously everything will be a little higher. I ordered the Honey Lemon with Black Tea and of course boba! Mmm just enough sweetness and the boba to tea proportions were perfect. By the time we left, there was a line out the door! I would recommend getting this to-go though, as the place is a little on the small side. They do have more seating upstairs though if you plan to hang out longer.
author: Marissa C.

description:
First timer here! Love the glass bottles. Bring the bottle back for 10% off your next drink!

Credit card minimum charge of $15. Lame!

Drinks... good! strong tea flavor

No bathroom. Not a big deal but I feel like most drink shops should have bathrooms for the full bladder.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Came here at 3 pm on a Saturday afternoon and they had run out of the glass bottles for the day which is what most of the hype is all about. The sea salt crema oolong tea was just alright. On the other hand, their honey boba is pretty good as well as the taro pudding.

Ample seating available (there's also an upstairs), but there isn't a bathroom.

Download the Kash app. There's a promotion for $20 credit when you first sign up.
author: Mimi S.

description:
They don't know what's in their tea. That's pretty disturbing.
I tried to order an almond milk tea but they said there was probably gluten in it. Maybe they have gluten elves that come at night and sprinkle it in there. Ah well
author: Xue H.

description:
After witnessing countless people strolling along FiDi's streets with Plentea's glass bottle, I finally decided to check it out today.

-Service-
Very friendly cashier & barista. We were in & out within 5 minutes during lunch hour, drinks in hand.

-Drinks-
I couldn't really taste the tea in either of our drinks. It was more of a fruit juice with little chunks of fresh fruit. Still yummy, and decent honey boba.

-Value-
Until July, they're only giving out bottles until 2pm. It's a 20% discount if you get a plastic cup. Theoretically the bring your bottle back discount is a good idea but it's just not realistic to lug that bottle around. I'm not interested in paying 5 bucks for a drink unless the thirst is REAL.

Still, try it once just for the novelty :)
author: Jenny Q.

description:
I'm a boba addict and always on the hunt for the latest and greatest. I've seen the infamous milk bottle on IG and of course decided to hit up Plentea on a lunchtime adventure. 

I got the sea salt crema oolong tea with tapioca, and a strawberry black tea with lychee jelly. I also got the turkey club waffle sandwich. 

Sea salt crema oolong - initial reaction? Different. I definitely tasted the sea salt. Not so much the oolong. I quite honestly didn't know what to think of this one. I probably wouldn't order it again, though at least I can say I tried it. Expanding those horizons right?

Strawberry Black Tea - I got this for my afternoon "coffee break", though I tried it immediately because there was ice in it and I didn't want to wait til it was slightly watered down (some other review said there isn't room for ice because of the milk bottle opening. Yeah well that's not true). That one is definitely a winner! Great tea flavor, not too sweet, and real strawberry bits contained within. 

The turkey club waffle sandwich was bland. No taste to the waffle, I tasted more avocado than pesto, and correct me if I'm wrong but I thought clubs had bacon? And for a waffle sandwich, this thing tasted healthy. I'm all for healthy but it just did not feel right and deflated my boba happy bubble. 

So, Plentea is definitely a must try. Skip the sandwiches. Pricey for boba but whatever, you're paying for a cute glass bottle. I'll be back.
author: Riza A.

description:
This place deserves a 3.5 star rating. Drink tastes just so so. But compared to the similar milk tea shop at financial district, I consider this as the best quality and cleanness. 
Price is high. A single drink on average is usually over 5 bucks. (Black tea is 5, add pearl or pudding is additional amount, some other smoothies are $7)
If u prefer cheaper milk tea, u can walk additional 4-5 blocks to get it from chinatown, but these places are dirty.
author: Nina H.

description:
Love the almond milk tea and lychee jelly here. I want to say best I've had, just the right amount of sweet for me. 
Nutella milk tea is a must try as well.
author: Vivian T.

description:
Good place to get boba! Drinks are ok! 
Weird staff, weird rule!
If you check in on Yelp, u get 25% off on your order, but they will not allow u get point for five star reward! 
Staffs are short in temper!
author: Shanti W.

description:
Check your glass bottles everyone! 

I can let go a lot of things about this place. For example, the location-no parking lot, the wait time-lines is out the door to the curb, the dirty waiting area-crumbs and spills on the table but 1 very important criteria that they should watch out for is to make sure they are not serving their drinks using a cracked bottle! As I looked closely, the bottle is cracked around and chipped with missing pieces. 

I'm disappointed knowing that they don't pay attention to quality and I could have possibly swallowed a few broken glass pieces.
author: Mari A.

description:
Came here for the bottles left with a plastic cup =[ .

The cool thing about this place are the hours and glass bottles! One of few boba places that are open later. Honestly I have too much of their glass bottles but it always slip my mind to bring them back for the discount. Overall the drinks are good nothing spectacular would taste better in a glass bottle tho! 

Ordered: ice milk w/ egg pudding (there's taro pudding also)
author: Julian T.

description:
Had a matcha slush with red beans,  
Red beam tasted fresh, sizing was large, I gave the rest to my friend, they even had half price on new food items 
Losing a star due to the friendly but slow service
author: Georgie D.

description:
Great quality taste. Love the idea of the glass bottles but it's a bit pricey. 

Especially in a competitive San Francisco market where there are boba tea shops in every corner.
author: Sol P.

description:
Dear very rude cashier, 
I'm sorry, I didn't think that a tea house would have JUST PLAIN MILK on half of their menu. You looked at me like I was an idiot for not understanding the complexity of your highly regarded bubble tea establishment. God forbid I have to ask you a question about your retarded menu.
Don't come here if you don't want to feel chastised while ordering a highly mediocre bubble tea. :)
author: Maeve F.

description: Didn't really enjoy the drinks, but loved how they put their drinks in glass jars! Kinda disappointed with what I got, which was #1 on the menu! Tasted just like sugar and milk, wouldn't go again for the taste, but only for the jars.
author: Rachel E.

description:
So nice to have a boba place near union square! Love the fresh fruit milk drinks here, I see them cutting up the fruit just for my drink! It IS very pricey, my honeydew fruit milk cost almost $6 and, let's be honest..No milk tea should cost that much. Extra cost for a glass bottle, which I didn't opt for. 

You CAN adjust the level of sweetness here :-) Thumbs up for that!

Nice clean interior, wish it was cheaper. But it's yummy and satisfies my sweet tooth twice over. But could really be cheaper. :'(
author: Kathy Z.

description: This time I tried the iced milk with brown sugar and the lavender lemonade. The iced milk was okay. If I try it again, I'll get it with caramel. The lavender lemonade, however, was AMAZING. I was really hesitant about it, but my friend ordered it and I am so glad she did!
author: Susan G.

description:
Loved that we got to bring home the jars that we drank out of although it may not be the most convenient for people on the go. The bubble tea was decent and the staff was knowledgable. 

FYI - the line is fairly long at times so if you're running somewhere else, plan an extra 10-15 minutes for waiting.
author: Leah T.

description: Pretty decent milk tea, but the boba wasn't soft. It was really hard and chewy :(
author: Cathleen S.

description:
tl;dr

Really legit boba and tea comes in cute glass bottles. If it weren't so expensive it would be 5 stars!

-----

We first came upon Plentea when we were down the street at Sushirrito and spotted all these people with glass bottles of tea in their hands. Curious, we went to investigate and soon spotted a long line of people going out the door waiting for their tea (a very common occurrence as it appears in boba-crazed SF). Since we've been to our share of disappointing boba places in SF (T-pumps, I'm looking at you), we had really high expectations going into Plentea. However, after two visits, I think it has passed my litmus test!

THE TEA: Plentea's tea is actually really tasty. I've tasted all three of their main selections so far (black, green, oolong), and each possesses the delightful fragrant aftertaste lacking in many mainstream boba places. This definitely gets a pass from me.

THE BOBA: This is waaay harder to get right than the tea, and several great boba places have been undermined by their poor quality boba (Tenren is a great example of good tea but bad boba). Plentea's boba is perfectly chewy and really tasty (probably because it is drenched in honey, haha). Combined with the tea = killer combo.

PRICE/PRESENTATION: This is my major gripe about Plentea and the reason why it's really only 4/5 stars. They are simply too expensive. Case in point - I got a honey lemon green tea with boba and ended up paying $5.44 - at Teaway, this would be in the neighborhood of $2.20. Yes, I understand you're giving away a glass bottle with purchase, but that doesn't mean you can jack up the prices to almost 100% extra! Also, the glass bottles are smaller than the normal plastic cups, so they're reaping even more profit. If it weren't for the fact that the tea+boba is so good, this would essentially be a naked money grab. However, kudos for Plentea for being so creative and thinking of this gimmick that is so successful with customers.

Bottom line, great tea+boba that comes in a glass bottle. Genius move on marketing, and combined with the quality product I can see them continuing to be a very successful business.

(Here's what I've tried so far -- all have been excellent:

Peach black tea
Oolong tea crema
Honey lemon green tea)

ps. They have NO WIFI but plenty of outlets in the store.
author: Chris S.

description: This place has good tea and average boba. They DO have a Nutella drink that's pretty bomb. The bottles that they provide with their drinks are awesome, and totally reusable. The drinks we ordered were: red bean, Nutella, oolong milk tea, mango slush, iced coffee, & milk tea with taro pudding . Everyone was very satisfied with their drinks and saved their bottles.
author: Bel W.

description: So yummy I loved the blended milk and ice drink with boba. The glasses are so cute and there pretty quick to get your order out. The waffles looked so good but we didn't have room!
author: Korina K.

description:
The bottle is a great gimmick! It is the reason why I came to try this place. But that is probably the only reason why I came here. The drinks offered here are by no means bad though! All the drinks I've tried here were delicious. (If I remember correctly, I've tried the peach black tea, lavendar lemonade, and the sea salt crema). The drinks were also very photogenic? Each bottle deserves a picture!

But it's not worth the 4$+ that I had paid for it, maybe it was the first time just for experience sake. Bringing the bottle back for that discount doesn't really make it any more worth it. You can save maybe 50 cents? Because this is on the pricier side, and I personally think there are good alternatives at a cheaper price elsewhere in the city, waiting in line for this place is not worth it after two or three visits. One time I came and there was absolutely no line, but right after I went in, a line suddenly formed and it was out the door! Maybe you just have to get the timing right. I've also gotten the bottle for all 3 times I was here, again it's all about the timing. It is a good place to take friends who are in the city for the first time though because it is a pretty cool place, they can even get a bottle as a souvenir.

The atmosphere upstairs wasn't bad though! It wasn't paticularly crowded one time I was there. Upstairs was a nice place to sit down and chat with friends (and also maybe a place to look down on how ridiculous the line can get).

The waffle sandwiches here look phenomenal though! I've never tried it so I can't vouch for the taste but it is a sight for the eyes!
author: Julianne Z.

description:
Was DYINNNNNNNNNNG to try this place ever since it opened and Dominic T. started blowing up my instagram feed with pictures..

FINALLY made it over here today during my 2 mile walk from Trader Joe's in Nob Hill and there was hardly anyone in line. They were completely out of glass bottles and offering at 20% discount for giving it to you in a plastic cup. Heck yeah! I'd prefer the plastic cup over the glass bottle any day!

Since it was my first time here, I ordered the black milk tea with tapioca so I could appropriately benchmark the place.

The milk tea is pretty strong..I'm feeling pretty wired after drinking it, and I'm a 3-4 shots of espresso type of gal! But I like how you can actually get the tea flavor without just a bunch of creamer and sugar. The tapioca is a great consistency and perfect the chewiness. I'm actually quite impressed!

I'm definitely level setting because this is a boba shop IN FiDI and in NorCal..BUT, its worth the four stars because it is in a convenient location, has awesome hours because they're open late-ish, AND it had yummy tapioca.

Not bad, Plentea! I'll definitely be back to try more teas and some of the desserts!!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
One word. Jars.

One of the coolest things here is that you get to keep the jar bottle after you purchase your boba. Also there's something about sipping from a jar that makes you feel awesome. Milk tea is awesome here and it's definitely worth the try. Highly recommended.
author: Nathan L.

description:
My first time at plentea was pleasant. There were so many options to choose from, from milk tea to fruit tea to smoothies. 
To be honest, I mainly came here for the milk bottles (great marketing haha!) but the tea is excellent. They use real taro, strawberry, ingredients in your tea and the boba is very chewy. 
Prices range from 4.50-6 I believe. 
Since I had a hard time finding the place, it's 4.5 stars(for reference, it's across from ramen underground). Plentea doesn't disappoint, so I'd say give it a try!
author: Michelle Z.

description: My friend loves this place for their bubble teas, so I decided to give it a try during my visit last weekend. When I asked the cashier how the taro pudding was and if it would be good in a Thai milk tea, he replied "that's extra." "But is it good?" "Yeah, yeah" was his reply as if he was just hurrying me along so he could get to the rest of the line. It was a simple question, but whatever, I ordered it anyway and the combination wasn't all that good. The taro pudding was more like jello with an artificial taro taste. After a couple sips, I didn't really want it anymore. The glass jars are kind of cool, but they're heavy and not a convenient thing to walk around with.
author: Monica V.

description:
I think the glass bottles (with plastic to-go lids!) are what's going to bring me back to Plentea. Not that their drinks are bad.. it's just that the location is pretty out-of-the-way for me and a boba drink isn't much of a priority in my life right now. I had the Iced Milk with Brown Sugar and Taro Pudding. It was a teeny bit too sweet for my taste but it was still enjoyable. It's something different from the other boba place I go to, so it's a nice treat when I want something different. 

Staff are nice here and the wait wasn't too bad. So if you're in the area and/or in need of a reusable water jug at home, I'd definitely suggest coming here and getting some boba milk tea as well!
author: Athena L.

description: A little bit on the pricey end for boba, but very well flavored with strong hints of tea. It comes presented in a glass bottle which you can keep.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I'm not really impressed. It's a nice place. It was clean and bright! The lady at the counter was incredibly nice and thoughtful!

I like the bottle that they came in.
But my smoothie was over $7. And it was not amazing or incredible. 

It was kind of cool to experience but the avocado didn't make me jump for joy! I'd much rather go to any other boba tea place.
author: Natalie C.

description:
First of all let me just call out you "yelp snobs" for having super high expectations from a place that has only been open for less than a freakin' week!!! Really?! 
 
*No bathroom... (not all places in the financial district or downtown area have one, get over it! Go to Starbucks!) 

*Limited options or adjustments to the menu...( they've only been open 5 days!!! The people who work there are only getting acquainted with the amount of items they have on the menu. It takes a few times to get it down. How do I know? Because I'm a chef! Repetition is the key, not to mention the owner is still trying to get feedback about his products. I spoke to him tonight, i told him the smoked salmon waffle was good but the salmon was a little too salty since the slices are big.) 

*Steep pricing... $6.50 for a pint (2 cups exactly, yeah I weighed the shit out with a measuring cup) of milk tea is not bad when you're smack dab in the middle of downtown. The bottle costs $4 retail by itself, which means the cost of your tea is about $2.50 including tax besides that it's all about the location. You want something cheap go to China town or the Sunset. 

I usually don't like reading comments nor ratings because a lot of you guys are so subjective. It's annoying as hell! But anyhow I'm giving this place 5 stars. Great location and good hours (finally good boba around downtown and open till 12am), flavors are spot on and well balanced (I've had 4), lovely interior and straight forward menu (better because it doesn't confuse the consumer plus too many options gets overwhelming e.g t pumps/teaway), Waffle options are fun and the waffle itself was perfect in texture and sweetness (Had smoke salmon, it was nice the owner wanted to give you more  but it gets to salty because of thickness. He took note of it and graciously thank me for telling him what my thoughts were). STAFF was very warm and friendly. Hope I gave the owner some justice. It's a cool concept no doubt! My pastry team's guilty pleasure.... 

Flavors I've had:
Brown Sugar- taste like maple... Perfect amount of sweetness for using brown sugar. For that person who was complaining about how it taste like sugar milk, guess what it is! That's why it's called FLAVORED ICE MILK!!!
Oolong Tea with Strawberries/Green Tea with Peaches- not too bitter and too light. You can taste the tea on top of that they use fresh fruits always a plus! 
Strawberry Milk- reminds me of Momo Milk bar beverage. Milk steeped with bright fruit flavor.
author: Hedilyn G.

description: I really want to like this place, but from my past experience, it' just wasn't my cup of tea. The tea was pretty bland and the cream didn't mix well. The whole body of the tea just fell flat. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing because other times I thought the tea was alright. Overall, this place is a pass.
author: Amanda T.

description:
AHHHH, the bottles are soooooo cute! It was what drew me in to coming here at first, and I definitely don't regret it! 

Pros: 
- comes in a bottle form (bring it back next time for 10% off)
- lids to cap on when finished with drink
- milk tea is RICH and BOLD - I've never had anything THIS close to tasting like REAL, AUTHENTIC milk tea flavor
- thai tea is JUST the right amount of sweetness and tasted soft/milky
- grass jelly has a nice texture

Cons:
- pretty pricey $4.50 for milk teas + $0.50 for toppings
- long wait out the door (~15 minutes)
- limited seating inside
- portions are a bit small

Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend trying this place! I was hesitant to order their cremas and iced teas since it's rather expensive but will for sure try it next time!
author: Vivian L.

description:
SOOO GOOD!! Got here an hour before they closed. No line and really good service! I got the milk green tea and it was amazinggggg. Love when milk teas aren't overly sweet. The tapioca was nice and chewy too! 

My friends got a taro milk tea and loved it as well. Can be a bit pricey, but at least you get to keep the jar! If you bring it back on your next visit, you get 10% off!
author: Weylie H.

description:
Not the best, but it'll do. The bottles are nice, though that means the drinks are pricy. And there's a $10 credit card minimum, so come with cash if you don't plan on ordering more than one!

Environment: 4/5
Seating downstairs is limited, but there's more space with tables upstairs. The store doesn't have much space, and because it's so popular, it gets crowded really easily. On two of my three visits, the line would go out the door, which wasn't the most fun experience when it gets cold.

Also, no bathrooms!

Drinks: 4/5
The salted crema oolong is good... in a very interesting way. I don't believe the oolong was strong enough, but the salt and foam at the top made it enjoyable, as it was a taste that I'd never experienced before.

The milk tea's are average. I really enjoyed their mango oolong tea, but mainly for the mango. There was something about their oolong tea when I ordered it with mango that didn't taste like tea, but like a cleaning solution of some sort.

Service: 4/5
Friendly, but not overly friendly. Not too fast either, but watching them make drinks, they definitely do more work than mixing powders and syrups with a spoon!
author: Joseph T.

description:
Boba in a Bottle in the Financial/Chinatown district. Probably inspired by Boba Guys and SoCal boba joints. The location is smack right dab between Sushirito & the second location of Cool Tea Bar. 

Inside of Plentea is pretty chic and clean. There are only a few tables inside. Dislike how there isn't a restroom. 

The price for 2 drinks is usually around $12. The green milk tea with boba tastes exactly like teaway's green milk tea. The boba was still hard and haven't been cooked fully. Disappointment :( The honeydew smoothie was pretty decent, just not great. It tasted like it was made fresh with real honeydew so that was a plus. 

Am I only the one has a problem with trying to take off lid on the bottle? I think it is baby proof or maybe girl proof in this case for me. The concept of lid and on the bottle looks nice, however I have trouble taking the lid off. 

Bring back the bottle for 10% discount. However, if I'm in the area, I don't think I will be coming here for boba. Pricey & so hard to find parking.
author: Kathleen U.

description:
There always seems to be a line whenever I drive by it so I decided to try going close to opening time.

There was only one person in line in front of me but like 10 people waiting for drinks.  It took about 12 mins to get my drink.

The glass bottle is cute. They only give 300 bottles out a day.  If you want to just get a plastic cup, they give you a discount.

I ordered the ice milk with green tea and egg pudding for close to $6.
The taste was ordinary and the egg pudding had no flavor.

Parking is tough.
author: Heejin L.

description:
I wanted to see what all of the hype for this place was about so figuring that I was only a few blocks away, I decided to go check it out. My friends told me not to get it because they had a bad experience but I wanted to experience it for myself.

I had expected the line to be longer but it wasn't too bad/too busy considering the fact that it was during lunchtime! 

I had ordered:
- 1 Thai Tea with boba
- 1 Mango Milk
- 1 Matcha Milk Green Tea with boba

The Cashier lady was extremely rude and I am not sure if it was because I am younger than their usual crowd (Which seemed to be the mid-20s? at the time) or if it was because they were busy. I wasn't done with my order yet, and she told me the price without asking me if I was done! I kindly told her that I was not done and that I had more drinks and her attitude towards me made me a little irritated after. She told me the price came up to nearly 20.00 and I was shocked because I only ordered 3 drinks! I asked her about it and she said yeah that's what I ordered and so I checked my receipt to confirm that she had gotten what I ordered correctly. The receipt did not list the drinks I ordered and so I figured it was just that expensive. 

When they called for my drink, I saw that they gave me 4 drinks and that they did not put boba in my MMGT! I quickly got my drinks and left because I did not want to be in that place anymore.

The drinks weren't even that good and not worth the hype. Yes, the bottle is cute but that was probably the only reason why I even gave them one star. I tried my mom's thai tea and the boba was good which is why I gave them another. Otherwise, the portion of the drink and the quality of it isn't all that and the service is definitely not all that!

I will not be coming back here and I do not recommend this place. I could easily get better tea a few blocks away for a better price.
author: Carolyn M.

description: I came here this afternoon with my boyfriend. This place is kind of hidden but I was pretty glad I found this place! But it's pretty crowded in there in the afternoon. The wait was around 10-15 minutes as it was kind of long. I felt like the drinks were meh. I came here and I got a Nutella Milk Ice Tea while my boyfriend got a CoffMilk Ice Tea. The drinks here were unique, as they came in glass bottles. I think that's the main reason why a lot of people come here. But I didn't like it as much because it was too loud in there, the wait was kind of long and the drinks wasn't that special if you ask me (besides the cute glass bottles). The price rages from 5-7 dollars which was okay for me! I would probably come here again, but not on the weekends.
author: Ashley Z.

description:
Wow. Came here for the second time and they "ran out of the glass cups" so they gave 20% off, which imo isn't worth it. The plastic cups they give it to you is tinier than a normal drink. So it was like the tax money was discounted...... stupid.

As I walked upstairs I saw the glass cups LOL. What? I thought you guys ran out. Okay, cool.

So I came here to chill, grab some tapioca with my friends and I wanted to use the bathroom. LOL, no bathroom. I honestly was in such despair that I asked if there were any surrounding places that had a bathroom, and apparently there weren't. So how did the employees use the restrooms? IDK whatever. I guess this isn't a store's responsibility to provide bathrooms. But for a place that has a chilling area and sells drinks & food, I would expect there to be one.

Bad customer service. Plus without the cup, the total for a drink still came out to be 4.20$. And honestly, the one thing that makes this place appealing is the cup, it just annoys me that they said they ran out and I saw them. (I already had the cup, I don't need it. I just think its rude to lie to your customers.) Oh and they use syrup with their tea...topped off with fresh fruits. So cut up fruits at the top. Okay. Thanks, but no thanks.
author: Mel T.

description:
Even though you get a discount for brining back the glass bottles, 10% isn't going to motivate customers to bring our bottles back in. This is very unsustainable because people would rather just pay that 50 cents for a new glass bottle..... I really don't like this concept. I figured that the only people that would bring the bottles back are people that work in the offices but that's about it.. I would recommend them giving customers a better discount for bringing in their glass bottles or making the option to have the drinks in glass containers and plastic containers. This would be a lot more Eco-friendly...

As for the drinks, they were just okay.... I got the oolong milk tea with tapioca and the tapioca was a very soggy texture and tasteless :/ the oolong milk tea was too sweet and left that nasty feeling in my mouth. I also got the fresh honeydew milk and I liked this one because of the fresh honeydew. However, it was a bit frothy on top. Total came out to be 11$ for the two drinks.
author: Leilani Y.

description:
For a boba store in SF, Plentea sucks.

San Francisco has many other boba shops that taste great with better prices. Being so close to Chinatown, there are stores such as Sweetheart or Cool Tea Bar with much better boba drinks. The only thing really keeping this store going is the fact that it comes in a Plentea glass milk bottle. Taking away the bottle, the actual drink is most definitely not worth the $5 + dollars that they charge here.

Like any modern day boba connoisseur, I like to judge a store based on the classic black milk tea with boba. I ordered a black milk tea with boba and a fresh milk with pudding drink. And both were equally disappointing. The milk tea was bland with little black tea flavor. It was very diluted. However, the actual boba was okay, but not anything special. The fresh milk with pudding sounded amazing and unique. However, the drink was overwhelmingly sweet with an underwhelming flavor. So much so, my friend and I made it a third of the way through before tossing it. The pudding made the drink look tasty, but that's just it, it was only contributed to the aesthetics. 

On top of the overly hyped drinks, I found a tiny shard of glass as I was beginning to reach the bottom of the milk tea. I was chewing on my boba when I heard a crunch, at this point I spit it out and found a shard of glass. Needless to say, I threw out the glass bottles and most definitely will not be coming back.
author: Eva C.

description: Nice, friendly staff. My friends and I got the Thai tea this time (I got the mixed fruit drink with boba and was a bit bland and messy), but the Thai tea with egg pudding was really good! And you get to keep the bottle if you want :)
author: Johanna V.

description:
I came here last week as I found out this place is right by my work and bought two drinks- sea salt creama with honey boba and peach green tea with lychee jelly. Prices ranged from $4.50-$6 and you get to keep the glass bottle. You could bring it with you the next time and you get 10% your next order. 

It is SUPER DELICIOUS and they have SUPER FRIENDLY STAFF! I have to say those ice cream waffle desserts sure looked appetizing. I'll have to try that next time, along with their milk tea, pudding and other tasty items they have.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
3.5 overall because of that price tag. Like holy smokes, I can buy a burger from In n Out w/ that! It could be a cool hangout spot though since there's WiFi and they plan on staying open until midnight.

[+] branded glass bottle for you to keep
[+] 10% off if you reuse the bottle
[-] dude, that's just tax
[-] still $4+ for the cheapest drink
[+/-] so do I pay full price for another bottle or reuse and save on tax? hmm...
[-] add-ons are additional 50 cents

PEACH GREEN TEA w/ LYCHEE JELLY
[+] was refreshing!
[+] can taste the green tea and the peach flavoring
[+] came with fruit bits
[+/-] fruit was fresh, but tart
[-] pain in the freaaakin butt to get the fruit bits and lychee jelly out of the narrow-neck bottle

At the very least, get the novelty glass bottle, be hip and put flowers in it ...or plant some succulents if you fear for your masculinity (:

If the bottle reuse gets a better discount, I'll be back much more often. But until then, I'll just bring a few friends to check it out once and be done with it for a while.
author: Sandy T.

description:
The Plentea logo'd glass bottles they used as a marketing strategy is genius--that's probably what inclines most of their customers, myself included, to wait in an out-the-door line for some boba milk tea. The funny thing is, the price of their milk tea is about $1 more than most other spots in the area, which pays for the glass bottles. I'd recommend opting for a regular plastic cup and receiving a discount, as the glass bottle is not worth keeping and hard to clean anyway.

I tried their oolong milk tea with boba. Their tea was good and the boba decent as well, but not the best milk tea in the Chinatown area. The lunch options, however, are pretty darn good. I've had the pastrami waffle sandwich and the smoked salmon waffle sandwich, both worth ordering again. The saltiness of the pastrami/salmon complement the slight sweetness of the waffle bread. I will definitely have to come back for the dessert waffles.
author: Celia K.

description:
I tried mango oolong tea with tapioca. It was super refreshing, and had a really strong tea flavor, which I really appreciate. I could've gone without the boba, it was nothing too special, and the tea was more refreahing by itself. It was quite expensive though, my drink came out to be about $6 (with the glass jar). 

My friends' drinks were pretty good too. The ice milk was too sweet for my taste, but pretty good. The mango fruit milk was surprisingly really refreshing as well, and the mango green tea was just as good as my drink. 

Not sure if I would come back because of the price, but I guess if you're in the area and in the mood for boba...
author: Joanna Q.

description:
Cute glass bottles with boba? Yes please. 

I tried this place in July and it is not October, so I'm not sure if my opinion/information would be a bit outdated.

 But anyways, it's about $5-$6 for a drink with the bottle, which is a ridiculous price for boba but I guess it's okay because you can reuse the bottle. It's a cute bottle so why not. 

The drink itself, not something I would go for again. Its very powdery after a while, but still drinkable. 

Wouldn't come back just for the drink but maybe if I was in the area.
author: Vernice T.

description:
Their signature drink is the honey lemon tea.  And it tasted horrible. Not to recommend anyone the drink at all. But their interior and exterior design is nice since the place is pretty obvious of where it is located. They have like 6 people working and it took along time for it to be my turn.

Only positive thing is the bottle we get. But $5.44 a drink isn't worth it at all.

Edited: gotten better since last been there would recommend some drinks but others not really.
author: Kenny L.

description:
The tea is not great here. I love the bottles and it looks fancy, but I prefer Quickly.

I came here after a work day to treat myself to boba since I've been slightly addicted to boba these past few months. I usually go to Quickly and have also tried Boba Guys. I'm not picky and love both of these locations, so I decided to try Plentea.

I am disappointed. The milk black tea gave me a headache, one drink is expensive ($5.35), and the bottle doesn't even fit into the drink holder in your car.

Maybe the other flavors are better? If you want to have a fancy bottle, this is the place. But you might want to go to one of the many other boba places if you want boba.
author: Ena Y.

description:
I love pleantea of boba in my bottle. What intrigue me about this place is the glass bottles they give when you order your drink. I like how you can keep the bottle too! They provide a cap for you if you want to take your drink or bottle home. The place seems cool too. I like the layout, they have a second floor where you can just chill and chat with your friends. In addition, Plentea have plenty selection of foods you can order. 

One thing was odd to me that there wasn't a public restroom, not even for customers. 

Overall, i'd come back again if i was in the area and craving boba. I'd recommend this place when people are in the city looking for a boba fix.
author: Alliver V.

description:
Surprisingly, Plentea has one of the best Ice milk drinkI've ever had. I ordered it w/ brown sugar and egg pudding. LOVE it!!! The sweetness of the milk drink is complimenting the no-so-sweet egg pudding which I think is the great combination.

They don't have that many variety of drinks but they also serve sandwich and waffles. The place is not too big but they have seating upstairs and some downstairs. It can be really crowded during lunch break so prepare your trip accordingly. 

I have tried their milk tea w/ black tea and tapioca, I don't think it's their specialty so it's just okay! it tasted the same as regular instant milk tea that you can get from asian grocery store, not too special from what i've experienced. Not to mention that the tapioca is kinda hard to chew and a little bit tasteless compared to purple kow boba.

Definitely will come baackk! especially because they serve it it glass bottle so we can always reuse it and they give 10% whenever you come back. good marketing!
author: Miss G.

description:
A-OK, there are better options in the city though

Pros:
- reusable jars = saving the environment
- cool hangout spot with upstairs seating
