- yummy sea salt crema oolong tea! good combo of sweet and salty
- refreshing peach oolong tea
- chewy sweet boba

Cons:
- impractical to bring back the jars especially (you'd have to plan a trip here)
- they have messed up 3 of 7 drinks (wrong additive, missing additives) even though the cashier entered it correctly in the computer
- poor inattentive cashier service, she cut me off and was dealing with the back end staff 5 times during my order
- super fake taro pudding, it's that purple reconstituted powder taste
- smoothies and fruity milk are terrible, even for my sugar craving cousins
- most bottles come back with a sticky exterior due to spilling

Final tip: get the sea salt crema oolong with boba, or the fruit flavored oolong teas, all other fruit milks, milk teas, smoothies are not worth your time.  and check your order when it comes out to make sure it's right
author: Tina A.

description:
The hype is over the drink jug, not the drink.

We decided to stop by this place before going to the airport since it was walking distance thinking we had time to get a drink here...BOY WERE WE WRONG.

It took a total of almost a hour for us to order and wait for our drink! Being from SoCal, and my boyfriend's house being walking distance from a Half n Half; I will admit I am "boba spoiled" as I would call it. 

Their menu doesn't have much variety, it really is mostly teas (PlenTEA, yes I know). I opted for their "fruit tea" and got their iced strawberry green tea, while my boyfriend got their boba black milk tea. The total came out to around $10, which isn't so bad because Half n Half cost about $9 for two people. 

The wait is L-O-N-G. I don't know if it is always like that or it was just because it was Lunar New Year and they were busy and understaffed, but it took a long time. The facility is on the small side, and while they do have an upstairs, it started to get stuffy inside so we ended up waiting outside.

Their boba black milk tea was pretty good, but my strawberry green tea was just okay. I have had better, but taking home a cute glass bottle that I can reuse for other things KINDA made up for that.
author: Angelica E.

description: It's super cute that they serve everything in a glass jar! Personally thought their tea was average but 5 stars for the glass jar!
author: Anna H.

description: Thanks to the new picturesque menu! You know what to expect as they have put pictures of the the boba now. Overpriced boba for sure but I don't mind it once a while.
author: Deepthi M.

description:
Bubble tea in the FiDi? Ermagherd, it's a dream come true! 

The prices are a bit "steep" (tea pun intended) and range from $4.50 for the milk teas to $6.50 for the fresh fruit smoothies. You're paying for a.) convenience since this place is right on Kearny and b.) the Plentea branded glass bottle. But to put it into perspective, the gourmet coffees and fresh-pressed juices dotted all around the neighborhood go for higher. 

I got the oolong crema tea which was presented quite prettily with the crema foamy and swirling on top of the tea. It tasted fresh-brewed with just the perfect amount of sweetness and cream. Two thumbs way up. Like a weirdo, I also took a picture of someone else's fresh fruit orders which also looked super refreshing. 

Grab a plastic bottle cap and bring your bottle back for 10% off your next order. Not too shabby!
author: Faith Y.

description:
OK, OK; I'm totally hopping on this bandwagon. Except for the line part-- I could do without that. 

Their seemingly-simple menu is a delicious trap. Thankfully the cashier graciously walked me through the menu options to help narrow down the choices-- this is probably part of why the line moves so slowly, but I appreciated it nonetheless. I'm sure as more customers get acquainted this will improve, or they'll figure out a better way to educate folks while they're waiting in line. 

Unfortunately, the way the space is configured means it's awkward/crowded to wait for your drink. You want to be near the open space next to the cashiers so you can hear your number get called, but this is also directly in the way of people exiting the business. The upstairs section is a nice use of space but the stairs aren't terribly inviting, in that they look like an employee-only staircase. 

The glass bottle gimmick is cute, and I like that they offer both a cheaper disposable option or a discount for returning the bottles on your next purchase. Looks like they'll have unlimited supplies starting in July, but for now they have 300 per day.

I was also pleasantly surprised to note they have food, so I'll have to give that a try next time I visit!
author: Krista L.

description:
Newly opened boba place that serves boba in a glass jug that you can bring home. If you return with the glass jug, you will get 10% off your order. 

I ordered the sea salt creama oolong tea with egg pudding and loved it! There are seats upstairs and on the ground floor and it seems like a great place to chill and work or chat with friends.

Will definitely return again!
author: Christina N.

description:
Just ordered an avocado fresh fruit milk drink ($4.95) with soy milk and 50% sugar. I'm glad I asked about customization because not everything can be modified. Sadly, my beloved grass jelly was no available yet and I didn't feel like getting aloe for $.50. Cash and credit accepted. 

I'm so thankful there was no line when I went this afternoon and the wait was very quick! I do wish there could be a customer loyalty program whether with Belly, fivestars card, or simply an old-fashion stamp card. I don't think a 10% discount for reusing the Plentea jar is enough incentive for customers to return again and again. No restroom, by the way! Upstairs seating available. Check out my pictures for the drink and updated food menu.
author: Dominic T.

description:
Bad experiences:

For a place in the FiDi, they need to make drinks a lot faster than they do right now. I have only had it twice but before I even got it the first time, I tried waiting twice before I gave up because my lunchtime was over. The first and second time, I waited in line for approx ten minutes with only one person in front of me and two to three people waiting for their drinks and both times, they didn't even take my order within ten minutes so I had to leave. Finally the third time there was no line and I went in to grab a drink only for them to say there was no bottles... I ordered a strawberry tea and it was so sweet that I would rather have gotten a strawberry soda... Cheaper and I would know what I was expecting from it.

Update: since I obviously wasn't thinking straight, I gave them one last chance and I was unsurprisingly unhappy with my order. I got the coffeemilk tea and it was nasty. The coffee flavor left a bitter taste in my mouth while it was loaded with sugar which made it overly sweet. I drank three sips before I decided a better place to put it... The trash.
author: Wilson T.

description:
I hope management sees this message. 

I'm a pretty loyal fan of Plentea. I'm so loyal I've collected 11 glass bottles. There's a deal that if you collect 10 bottles and bring them in, they will exchange it for 1 free drink. I live in south Oakland and hulled my 10 bottles to the store yesterday, looking forward to the free drink I'd be picking up. As usual, parking in SF was atrocious. I brought in the 10 bottles, and the girl at the counter told me one bottle was cracked, and thus I only had 9 to turn in. She couldn't honor the one broken one and told me I'd have to come back with 10 BOTTLES UNBROKEN. YOU'RE KIDDING RIGHT?? Bring all 10 back across the bridge and deal with parking? Serious bonkers and serious customer service issues. 10 glass bottles is heavy!!

Once I get rid of these 10 bottles, in some way or form, I WILL NOT be coming back here. Boba shops are popping up left and right, and thus there are many other options. And options that don't involve carrying glass around.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I came here because a friend told me about how they had the glass bottles. To be honest, I did go mainly for the reusable bottle, not so much the drink itself. I was expecting a long wait so I went on a Monday at 11:30 AM. I was surprised to find no line so I quickly ordered my drinks: a mango black tea for myself and two black milk teas for my friend and for my mom. 

Although the wait to order was fairly quick, the wait for the actually drinks took about 10 minutes, even when it wasn't crowded. 

They called out my order and gave me my drinks. The lids for the bottles are in front so you can cap your own drinks.

So, as I expected, my mango black tea did remind me of a tpumps or honeyberry drink, but it included real mango pieces on top, which seems more worth it.

I tried some of the milk tea and it tastes like any other milk tea to me. My friend said it was a little too sweet so I'd probably get the 50% sweet next time.

Overall, I think this place is pretty good considering it comes with nice bottles, but if you're going primarily for the drink, you could go anywhere else unless this is the closest boba place nearby.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
At first you think it's cool because of the "free" jar they give you... but the tea is just average. Would recommend the green milk tea and oolong milk tea with egg pudding. Giving 3 stars as it's good enough to satisfy my craving for milk tea, but have definitely had better elsewhere. Also $4.50 + tax for tea with bubbles is pretty expensive, even if they do give you the jar (which is pretty annoying to carry around and makes your hands cold when it's chilly out).

Also we tried pouring hot water into one of the jars and the bottom fell out, so don't try at home! They hold up to warm/hot water but not water that's just been boiled.
author: Michelle R.

description: I had been waiting to come here for a long time and it definitely didn't disappoint! I got the sea salt oolong tea and my friend got oolong millk tea. Both were flavorful and you could taste the tea. I also didn't have to ask for less ice or sugar and it was the perfect balance. The boba was a little hard for my taste but overall a great experience and they have comfortable seating upstairs and downstairs. Would definitely recommend the oolong millk tea to whoever comes through.
author: Sophia W.

description:
The three of us were on route to Chinatown on foot when we passed by Plentea.  I had read about the glass bottle novelty and the long lines to order a boba drink.

We walked in Saturday around 12:45pm as our curiosity was peaked about the glass jar. And no lines.

Once again I made a boo boo.  I'm not boba expert so when the order taker asked me what I wanted to order to drink, I went with the ice green tea milk.  She asked any toppings?   I said no.   I guess boba is a topping.

I ended up with a glass bottle of ice green milk tea only.  Needless to say I paid $4.00 + tax.  Seemed pricey. If you bring your empty glass jar back you'll get a 10% discount off your next drink.  I don't know how many folks plan to do that unless you work in the FiDi area.

On the other hand I am going to be in Chinatown Sunday.  Maybe I'll bring my clean glass.  And get a boba topping.
author: Shirley N.

description: I totally came here bc of the glass jar! Fell for their scheme!!! You get to keep the jar and get a discount if you bring it back to be reused. The drinks are about $5, which prob factors in the jar. I got the iced green milk tea with pudding. It was just ok. There were quite a few other items on the menu that looked good, but i tried my friends dranks too and it's just ok too. I will likely not return after getting my first jar.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
I've tried the strawberry smoothie. I barely tasted the strawberry flavor, it tasted more like water and milk and a hint of strawberry.

I also tried the Strawberry Belgian Waffle. It was good; worth trying.

The place is pretty small, but cute decor. 

The pricing is not bad, for $4 you get to keep the glass bottle. Also, they provide a lid just in case you'd like to take it to go.

I'll definitely come back to try other drinks like the Thai Iced Tea. I'll bring my bottle with me to get the 10% discount for bringing my own cup.
author: Ceryll D.

description:
Prices are high but I suppose it's to cover the cute glass bottles you get. My friend wanted to leave hers but I  think they'd make great flower vases! 

I wish more boba was in the drinks (50 cents) but I did like the flavor of their black milk tea. Boba was nicely chewy. But I'm just happy with the glass bottle that will be filled with fresh flowers every week.
author: Winnie T.

description:
I stumbled upon this place after swinging by sushirrito and the line was way out the door but luckily the workers inside worked quickly and I only had to wait ten minutes. What attracted me was the people walking out with their drinks in glass jars! The catch is (at least when I went) they only offered glass jars to the first two hundred customers of the day, however, they do offer a 20% discount for drinks in plastic cups so it's not too bad if you don't get your nifty glass jar.

Now normally when I go to a place that serves bubble tea I like to get just a standard milk tea with boba or the egg pudding, I tend to stay away from the fruity teas because I feel like they are too sweet and the fruit masks the tea flavor. So I ordered the milk tea with grass jelly and it was perfect, there was a good amount of grass jelly and the tea wasn't too sweet and you could taste the tea itself. And drinking it out of a glass jar just made it seem so much cooler!

From what I've heard their other teas are awesome so I plan on coming back to give those a try as well.
author: Zach C.

description: This place was awesome and I was surprised I got to leave with a souvenir glass bottle! I was visiting SF for a weekend get away I wish they had one of these in San Diego
author: Jamie L.

description:
Boba in a Bottle? Say it ain't so! In fact, I think Plentea might have been inspired by Boba Guys' Boba in a mason jar idea and low and behold, the Boba in the Bottle was invented! 

I was in the Chinatown area on Wednesday, 04/30 and desperately wanted to try Plentea so I begged my boyfriend to go with me. It was almost 90 degrees, my boyfriend was grumpy, hot and Yelp directions were leading us everywhere, so I knew that the only thing that could alleviate this situation was a nice cold glass on boba. When we finally got to Plentea, we were told by some guy on their second floor balcony that they were closed and that their grand opening is tomorrow, which I found odd because the store was open, pretty much looked ready to go, and there were 5 Yelp reviews raving about their boba. Disappointed, we took our business to Ten Ren a couple blocks up from Plentea.

A day after their grand opening, my sister and I went to try their boba. If you plan on driving, then I wish you the best of luck because it is almost impossible to get parking near Plentea. Luckily, there is a parking garage nearby and public transportation is always available! This time, the shop was open and they were actually ready for our business! We ordered the Crema Tea with boba and the Iced Milk Oolong Tea with boba.

Iced Milk Oolong Tea with boba - Absolutely delicious! I say this a lot, but this could quite possibly the the best boba in SF. I like my milk tea creamy and smooth + strong tea is my favorite and Plentea does exactly that! The boba is chewy, yet very soft and actually reminds me of Fantasia's boba. It's not Asha's milk tea, but it's very close!

Crema Milk Tea with boba - I honestly couldn't taste the difference except the Crema was a bit creamier than the Iced Milk Tea. Overall, it was a nice drink to have if you want a creamier consistency milk tea.

The total was around $11 and yes, it was pricy, but worth it! Although they do encourage you to reuse your bottle for an extra 10% off, I do not see myself coming here often due to the horrible parking situation and location. The milk tea is 5 stars, but I need to knock down a star for the expensive prices!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Stopped by Plentea twice yesterday:

2:45 PM - First time I've seen a line out the door!  It took my friend and I about 20 minutes to get to the front to place our order.  While in line, a representative from Kash, a new app designed to skip over transaction processing fees for retailers (while rewarding points to customers who use it), told us that we could get $10 off our order if we paid with it.  Heads up, y'all!  There must have been a huge catering order right before us, because I saw one of the Plentea employees wheeling out crates of drinks.  Next thing I know, the cashier calls out our order number and tells me that... they've run out of boba.  You what?!  The cashier was really apologetic, asked us if we wanted to just substitute something else or get our order refunded altogether.  Though my friend and I wanted boba, we opted for new add-ins.  I went for taro pudding for my taro milk tea, and my friend went with aloe for her honeydew black tea.  Oh, the sadness, though!

I am really grateful that they use real taro and real honeydew for their drinks, but I will probably never order the taro milk tea again.  Yes, the cashier warned me that it was milk tea with taro mixed into it, but I didn't realize that the taro would be so gritty.  That, plus the stickiness of the milk... not a very refreshing drink.  Oh well.  Live and learn.  My friend liked her honeydew black tea, but said that it was too sweet.  If you actually like to taste the richness of the tea, adjust your sweetness level.  

7:30 PM - After grabbing dinner at Bun Mee, two of my girl friends and I headed over to Plentea.  I was a little wary after my experience earlier in the day, but when we got there, there were only a few other people in line ahead of us, and they had boba again!  Praise the Lord!  I went with their peach black tea with boba, and my friends got the sea salt crema with boba, and the peach oolong tea with lychee jelly.

The way their fresh fruit tea drinks work is that they're basically whatever tea you choose (black, green, or oolong), with minced pieces of your choice of fruit (mango, peach, honeydew, etc.).  The fruit flavor really isn't fully infused into the drink in the way that you might get from a syrup or powder, but then again, you get the benefit of knowing you've got fresh fruit in there.  The peaches were not ripe, though, so the bits and pieces were crunchy and super tart.  You win some, you lose some, I guess.  Between my black tea base, and one of my friends' oolong tea base, I'd probably try and go with the oolong, or maybe even green, next time.  The black tea almost overpowered the peach flavor, while the oolong nicely complimented it.  As for the sea salt crema... blech.  I've never been on that bandwagon, though, so take my comment with a grain of, er, salt...

Still love the glasses here!  I'm starting to build quite the collection...

*NOTE - NO PUBLIC RESTROOMS!*
author: Iona C.

description:
It is a small place sandwiched between few of the best restaurants of that block.
On a weekday lunch time the queue is usually a block long but then the drinks they serve more than makes up for it. I would suggest visiting after 5pm or on weekends. They have discount if you are a returning customer if their glass bottles. The bottles are cool.
author: Prateek G.

description:
TIP: Checkin first to get 25% off entire order!!!

This place has some nice decor with some nice plants and is pretty clean.

I got the lavender lemonade - it pretty much takes like Sprite but a bit more limey. You really can't taste the lavender at all. Must admit that the glass jar that you can take home is really neat. I also tried the iced green tea which was okay.

There is 7 small circular tables with stools that fits 2-3 people each on the first floor and on the second floor there are some leather seats and a bit more lounge space.

Heads up you need to spend atleast $10 if you want to use card.

This place is maybe a 3.5 star on my book but I might update it if I come back again.
author: Derrick C.

description: Fav boba place in the city! I appreciate their use of glass bottles to save the environment. You get a small discount for returning the bottles on your next purchase.
author: Erica C.

description:
Do it for the bottle and the Instagram...

The drink quality merits 4.5 stars, but at $6 per drink, the prices are way too high to earn a frequent visits from me. The Crema Oolong Tea was the most memorable for its amazing creamy texture and refreshing taste. I also recommend the Brown Sugar Milk Drink with pudding for subtle sweetness and something new. Since the teas taste authentic, I can see the other drinks being just as yummy. Their menu included unique options I have never seen before as well. Not to mention, the peals were chewy and honey-tinged-- just how I like it! 

Take note: they have a limited amount of bottles per day. They have a new stock everyday at opening, and once more at 6. So don't come at 5 and hope for a bottle!
author: Yaoyao P.

description:
Incredibly gimmicky. The idea of using milk bottle jars is cool but you're essentially paying upfront for that bottle. Great business idea imo. However the execution of the drinks is very poor. Too milky, creamy, and I stood and watched them pour pre-made mixers (like you would for a well drink at a bar/club) to make some orders. Ordered two drinks, and in one they forgot an ingredient they charged me for. Had to come back down to get it done right (they just added it in). Taste of a cheaply made drink is noticeable and makes me feel like I paid $6 for some milk with flavored powder. Upstairs lounge wasn't bad - nice to chat and people watch while having your drink.

Parking around here is tough too so I'd advise making a long drive to get here unless you just happen to be in the area.

You get 10% off your drink if you bring the bottle back, but really who's going to keep a glass bottle in their bag or car at all times (it'll get dirty just sitting there). Pft.
author: Amir A.

description: Milk teas are very good and fresh but their prices are quite high compared to other places which you can get the same quality for a lesser price. This is a place I only come to once in a great while to treat myself rather than a daily fix.
author: Bobby C.

description: Plentea is my go-to spot for that 2:30pm slump, lol. I will say that I initially came for the glass bottle that you can bring back for a 10% discount although their drinks are good as well. I've had the Thai tea, strawberry milk, and the honey ginger lemon tea. I definitely did not get that powdery taste that you usually get from other boba spots, which is a plus. They accept credit cards, but they do prefer cash. Minimal seating is available on the lower and upper levels. Overall, a solid boba spot in SF.
author: Christine G.

description: This is my fav milk tea place in SF! The glass bottles is a nice touch; they even give you a 10% off on your drink if you bring back the glass bottle on your next visit. My favorite is the regular milk tea with egg pudding :)
author: Stephy H.

description:
New boba shop located in the extremely busy FiDi - I admire their courage! Yes, drinks served in a glass milk bottle makes them that much more appealing, especially to the after school/lunchtime crowds. 

While I had the usual black milk tea, my friend tried the oolong crema. I loved my drink; the tea flavor was strong and prominent and tapioca chewy - just the way I like it. My friend wasn't as enthusiastic with his choice. 

I'll give this place the benefit of the doubt. There is always room for improvement for a new shop, and I'm sure soon they will find their groove.
author: Hannah P.

description:
I've come a few times over the years and always thought it tasted good. But then I noticed that the milk that's added is actually "powder" and not fresh. For an artisanal boba shop, that was shocking, especially at their prices. I don't think the tea is of any particularly good quality. The gimmick really are the glass jars. For teas or boba, I'd recommend Asha down the street or Boba Guys.

FYI -their website says they use organic fresh milk. But that was not the case with my drink. I ordered the basic milk tea and saw the staff pour tea into the blender and add a scoop of powder to blend. After that, she poured it into the glass jar. Their website feels deceptive.
author: M H.

description:
Whenever I passed by this place, the line was literally a store or two down. I finally came on a day where there was one person in front of me. I was so excited to order. I usually order taro everywhere I go cause that's my favorite. 

So I ordered the taro milk, (has no tea) and is blended. I added the taro pudding and bobo as well. I got it in the glass jar and it was so cute looking and tasted so good. Perfect amount of sweetness. I will def try something new next time I'm in the city.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Convenient location, and "free" jars.

Ok, well I guess they already factored the glass jar into the base drink price, but the people waiting in line don't seem to care or notice. This seems to be a good boba place to show off to your SF-noob friends after a long day shopping at Westfield/Union Square. I think a lot of the traffic in Plentea is primarily due to the jars, and wannabe-hipsters love jars.

The price is a little above average for boba places, and they do have a credit card minimum ($10 I think? Normally ordering 2 drinks will take care of it). Location-wise, it's a relatively quick walk from the Montgomery bart station, although they don't have a bathroom in the store-- which I guess is great since it keeps the crowd moving so people can't perch there too long. 

Drinks wise, the milk tea is REALLY creamy, which I don't like. BUT if you're into that, then this place is great for you! Somehow the tea flavor still comes through despite all the cream, which I admit is impressive. The fruit teas are ok -- nothing special.

Tip: If you really need to use the restroom, go to Super Duper across the street!
author: Emily T.

description:
Beware: The line is RIDICULOUSLY long! But don't let that turn you away, the tea is really good! 

We had to wait about 30 minutes, so I definitely need to figure out what time they're slow because I definitely don't want to wait that long again. The place is new, so I think they're still trying to figure things out.  The employees seemed a bit flustered.

I had the fresh strawberry black tea, it was REALLY good! It was about $5 and I loved the fact that they give it to you in a glass container that you get to keep. They have a large variety of teas to choose from. I want to try one of their milk teas next time. 

Great addition to the FiDi!
author: Suki B.

description: Giving out jars instead of cups is what differentiate them from other milk tea places. I really like their jars because it makes their business unique. Bring it back to order your drinks will save you 10% off, I haven't done that but I should. I usually order oolong seasalt and I recently order jasmine milk green tea, which I like. Sometimes simple is good! Bobas are just right to chew. 4 stars because I feel like their menu is less compared to other places, not much choices.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Come for the glass bottles and save 10% off your next purchase! Come before 12 to avoid the line that goes out the door.

The tea itself is pretty good but both times I struggled to get all the jelly or boba out with a straw. I'm a fan of the fruit teas and the matcha green tea! Lychee jelly is cut too long though so you have to pour the drink into your mouth at the end because it's impossible to suck it all up with a straw. Oh and the indoor decorations are super cute as well! I'm only giving this place 4 stars because it's pretty standard flavor wise and it's pretty expensive at around $5 per tea
author: Jenann P.

description:
I might have just changed the game.

I've been studying their menu since they opened. There's fruit milk and then there's fruit tea. But there is no fruit milk tea. None of the milk teas they offer are flavored and none of the flavored milks have tea in them! The first time I asked if they had fruit milk tea, they said no and that was the end of the conversation. So I ordered a blueberry milk with honey tapioca. I could pass on the tapioca, the blueberry milk was what you think blueberry milk should taste like. It is actually whole milk with blueberries.

The second time around I asked if they could add milk to their fruit tea. It took a while to get a definitive response, because that would involve going against the menu and being a little creative *gasp* I was told that they don't do fruit milk teas because they don't want to mix too many things together and flavors might not mix well, etc. However, they graciously decided to experiment for me and made what I requested: Strawberry Oolong Milk Tea w/ Egg Pudding (they ran out of grass jelly). The outcome was perfect. If they keep doing this special creation for me, I will keep returning!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Line went out the door but the boba was worth the wait. Not overly sweet and your drink comes in a glass bottle. Some of the best bubble tea I've had. 10/10 would recommend.

Drinks are $5 generally + 50cents per add in eg grass jelly boba lychee jelly etc
author: Alex Y.

description:
My new favorite boba spot in SF.  Menu is a good mix between simple and having variety.  You can get things other than boba (e.g. grass jelly) in the tea as well.  The drinks come in glass bottles, which you can keep, and bring back for a discount on your next drink (ok, a little gimmicky, maybe, but I eat that sort of thing up).  Plenty of seating, including an upstairs area.

Downsides (aka things that keep Plentea from 5 stars): the line to order can get unmanageably long (so definitely show up at low-traffic times of day), tea is a little pricey (~$5), and they have no restroom.
author: Brian T.

description: Yum! I love their taro milk with tapioca balls. Love that there's pulp in it. I have yet to try the other flavors.
author: Reese E.

description: When I'm in sf I always stop by plentea to get the jasmine milk tea and the Thai tea, both drinks are in glass bottle which is pretty cool!
author: Jenifer D.

description:
Oh the hype that I've heard about this place. Came by after work one day around 6-7pm. The line wasn't that long so it was pretty relieving. I did hear that after a certain time during the day they run out of the glass bottles. Okay, giving into the hype I wanted a glass bottle. (you would want one too!)

They still had some when we came by and so we ordered a fresh mango green tea with boba and a salted crema oolong tea with boba. Okay you're definitely paying for the glass bottles because two drinks came out to 11 bucks. Next time I'm coming by I'm getting my drink in a plastic cup (they have that option and its cheaper). The drinks were actually really tasty and refreshing. And the boba was perfect.
author: Dara S.

description:
Been here only once and decided that we would come back in the future! 

First off, I just want to say that their glass bottles are a pretty catchy trick to get people to come in. My girlfriend and I were eating at Sushirrito and saw some people walking around with a glass bottle with tea and boba in it and we were like "whoa we need to get some of that wherever it is!" 

The lines gets pretty long but I mean if you're with somebody just chit chatting away, then the wait to order and the wait for the actual drink won't even matter. They've got a few chairs and tables inside to hangout while waiting or drinking. 

We ordered the thia iced milk tea with the pudding and the boba and I have to say that the pudding and boba mixed together was actually good! The Thai milk tea was creamy and delicious as well. All the other drinks that people were getting looked really yummy too. There are lots of combinations for drinks you can order.  Unfortunately I can't talk about the food because we didn't order any. 

Don't forget to bring the glass bottle back to receive a 10% discount y'all!
author: Adam M.

description:
Parking may be hard to find sometimes, but there is street parking where you have to pay or there is a garage across the street that charges a few dollars per half an hour or so.

Love the tea here! I am a fan of their caramel milk tea with boba and pudding. It's a bit sweet due to to the caramel but you can ask for less sweet. I have a sweet tooth so I like mine at normal sweetness. The cool thing here is that the drinks come in cute milk jugs that you get to keep! And if you bring the bottle back next time then you get 10% off on your order! 

I also like their strawberry yogurt when I'm in a fruity mood. It's refreshing.
author: Stephy L.

description:
Pricey but quality teas. I got an unsweetened mango oolong tea. DELICIOUS. It came with small fresh mango chunks, which added just the right amount of sweetness (I'm not a fan of sweet drinks).

My coworker wanted a fruit milk tea, which apparently they DON'T DO because they "can't guarantee the taste".... Whatever that means. I'm not quite sure how they can offer regular milk teas but say that they can't make a strawberry green milk tea. Weird. She ended up getting the Strawberry Milk, which is just whole milk blended with strawberries. I wouldn't recommend getting the Fruit Milks.

All drinks come in a cute branded glass jar that you can take home. If you bring it back to reuse on your next trip, you get 10% off your order. :)

Free wifi... but I wouldn't stick around to hang out here. They don't have a restroom!
author: Ava S.

description:
For the price you pay, the drinks here are really not worth it. The cheapest drink is $4.25, and that's before you add boba or other toppings for .50! That's probably the most expensive boba I've ever had, especially considering how small the cup is. 

In terms of taste, it's not too bad. I had a sea salt crema oolong tea, which wasn't too sweet, and the saltiness complimented it nicely, but there wasn't a whole lot of tea flavor. My friends got the ice milk drink, one with brown sugar and the other with caramel. The brown sugar was really sweet but tasted pretty good, while the caramel tasted as though they had melted down caramel candies into the drink. Probably not a drink I would order again. 

They also ran out of their famous glass bottles (it was around 230pm when I went) so if you want a bottle you have to go in the morning or in the evening when they restock. I'd come back if I was downtown and craving boba but you're better off going to the Richmond or sunset.
author: KC W.

description:
The five stars is purely because their lavender lemonade is utterly divine. xD 

I also tried their thai iced tea and nutella iced tea. Both were alright. It didn't taste like they used condensed milk so that might be why it was just ok. 

I like that we get to keep the glass bottles they come in. It would have been nice if someone at the counter told me about their yelp discount though lol.
author: G C.

description:
5 stars for their green milk tea. 

All I really want these days from a boba joint is good green tea with good milk. This place delivers both in spades, with a classy glass bottle to boot. 

The tea is strong, which I can appreciate. The milk to tea ratio also seems appropriate. 

Not looking for perfection here, but my drink was sweet, smooth, strong and tasty. Not much more I can ask for.
author: John Y.

description:
Incredible new place to get bubble tea. A bunch of different options to choose from, mix and match.

They also serve smoothies and a number of other things, and they have ample seating to hang out for a bit (upstairs).

Highly recommended.
author: Ben P.

description:
I used to be the queen of boba.. til I realized how unhealthy and how many calories are in each tapioca ball :( 

So we came here the other night because we were around for the CNY parade. I figured I should try and order something "healthier". I got the Honey Lemon Oolong Tea w/ Chia Seed which was great! It was sweeter and chia seeds def fill you up! The BF got the Honey Ginger Tea w/ Aloe. The ginger pieces and aloe toppings in his drink is what made his drink better than mine! BUT! I think we liked each other's drinks more than the one we actually ordered up for ourselves lol. 

Ughhh and I suppose it's my fault for forgetting to check in! You get 25% off your order if you do check in on yelp. So I'd like to come back, try their other drinks/flavors/toppings, and check in!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I fell in love with this place after my 1st visit today lol. The drinks were spot on, the place was nice, and the owner is such a lovely person. She was going around asking people how their food and drinks were and i thought that was so nice of her. 

My 50% sweet avocado fresh fruit milk, with soy milk, egg pudding, and aloe was perfect. I also tried my friends mango milk tea, thai milk tea and mango milk and thought all tasted really nice. The waffle had a nice texture and they did not skim on the nutella and banana 

The place was so crowded and the line was sooooo long. But once we make our order, it came out pretty quickly. Overall a nice experience and i loved how they let us kept the bottle haha.
author: Jenny N.

description:
I like to go when there are no lines so I can get my drink and food the fastest way possible. not only is it cool that you get a glass bottle compared to other shops, but it's also eco friendly.

The drinks are a bit more pricey compared to other boba places, but you do get a 10% discount when you bring your glass bottle back in. You get 20% off if you get a plastic cup. The teas are strong and flavorful but the boba is a bit lacking in flavor and chewiness. 

I've also tried out the pastrami sandwich. It took a little longer to make but it was really good w/a few layers if meat wrapped in a waffle bun.

The average wait is about 20 mins during peak hours.  When there's no line, service is really fast. The cashiers and staff seem pretty friendly overall.
author: Eric T.

description:
What can you say right? the bottles are adorable and a unique idea. Total seller there, these bottles are what sparked my interest and brought me to pleantea.... Nice marketing strategy there. 

Being that its in the city of course there was no parking, upon my arrival I was bummed to see a ridiculous line. But anything for boba! So I waited with my patient friend for roughly 30 minutes. Once we ordered waiting was rough considering the tight space and taken tables. After getting a table we probably waited 8 minutes or so for our 3 drinks. But my goodness this chick was eager for our table and was up against where we were seating I was ready to ask her she wanted to have tea with us already.... Nah just joking. 

Talking boba business now I'd give it 3 stars. I ordered a classic milk tea boba and despite not caring for the tea itself the boba was good. Not to mushy and not to hard haha. But the bottle gives it another star so I'll settle with 4 stars for pleantea.
author: Mahina M.

description:
Come by if you're around FIDI!  They have really good drinks here, but the wait time can be really long.... i was here the other day with my coworker and we waited after we ordered another 20 minutes.. i dont think it's that difficult or takes that much time to prepare some milk teas.. but i'll be back because i'm so close to it! :)

Pros: they accept cards!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't crowded at that time. I ordered a custom drink: Strawberry oolong milk tea w/ grass jelly. (Originally I wanted blueberry but they ran out of that..) They don't have fruit flavored milk teas on the menu, but they could make it for you if the line isn't busy & if they know how. I was very satisfied with my drink. It tasted really good! Better than Tpumps in my opinion. 

Love the idea of getting to keep the glass bottle. I think that's one of the main things that attracted people to try this place.. Well at least for me it did :P 
Plus it's environmentally friendly that way!
You can bring back the bottle next time for 20% off your drink. 
(Which I think is kind of a hassle to bring back and forth.. But it shouldn't be so bad if you have a bag with you :P)

The price is however.. overpriced.. At first I was willing to pay $6 for a drink because I get to keep the bottle, I would love to come back again to try all the flavors but I don't know if I want to pay like $5 for drink since it's just milk/tea.. Even if it's 20% off, it's still pricy. I don't think this should be more/as expensive than Jamba Juice or Starbucks.. :/

The workers there were very nice, and it's a pretty nice place to chill at. There are two floors to this place. 
But overall, my experience was great. My only problem is the price.

----- Update -----

The second time I went, I ordered Mango Oolong Milk Tea. They didn't really know how to make it but try tried anyway. It didn't taste good this time... There was way to much powder and my drink was warm.. I think from now on, I'm going to avoid asking for fruit milk teas. I wish I got the name of the guy who made my first drink because that one was perfect.
author: Tina S.

description: Favorite place to get boba tea! Also love the fact you get to keep the bottles the tea comes in. Super cute!
author: Katelynn F.

description:
Pretty good bubble tea.  Their glass bottles are a nice novelty... I've got 3 sitting on my desk at work.  It's hard to manage bringing the glass bottles back, as getting boba tends to be a more spontaneous decision for me.  And a small pet peeve is having to hold the small plastic cap to the glass bottle while the straw is in....

All in all, good boba, nice novelty if I'm in the mood.
author: Scott F.

description:
-Really busy on weekdays after school (majority are hs kids and some are business ppl hence the financial district)

-Concept of the glass jar/bottle filled with boba & fluid is a good idea--there's a 10% discount on your next purchase when you reuse the plentea bottle.

Basically, the majority of the ppl who come here buy the boba for the bottle or they actually wanna try the drinks & food. Seating can get packed really fast.
author: Erica K.

description:
I love the glass bottles they give! I don't see these type of bottles very often and they even had lids on them.

The black milk bubble tea itself was not bad. The tea was not too sweet and the bubbles are chewy. The straw of course sticks out of the bottle so it doesn't fit if you want the cap on it.

They have a minimum $10 credit card charge.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Ehh.. this boba isn't that great. 
My work place had a ton of these bottles from co-workers going here a lot over the past few months and I found this place on the bottom of my bubble tea list. I think it was the worst tea I ever had. I ordered the thai tea and the jasmine milk tea and both were just bleh. I would never pay the price for the boba period so I am very glad I got a free tea with all the bottles I had because it's not even worth it. There are better places in chinatown!
author: Star S.

description: Delishhhh. Got the red bean matcha slush and was pretty happy with it. It's a bit expensive (~$5 per drink) for what it is, but they let you keep the glass bottle that the drink comes in. So you get a nice drink and a fun keepsake, plus a pretty cool Instagram if you're into that :)
author: Iris S.

description:
Let's see. For one, good God, turn the music DOWN. I can't even hear people who are 3 ft from me. It does not make for an enjoyable time. The shop needs to be cleaned. The maneki neko in the upstairs loft was covered in dust, and there was food on the floor. Per my husband's ranting, if you're going to open a store, either say cash only or eat the cost of doing business. What am I talking about? The $10 credit card minimum. If you're coming here by yourself, good luck, I hope you have cash. It's like dangling a carrot in front of someone; We accept credit cards... just kidding, only if you spend x amount. Just. No. 

Why does it take so long? 20 minutes to get two (simple) drinks is ridiculous. Are you guys growing the tea leaves back there? This stuff ain't cheap either. Although, it's much better than powdered milk tea (+1), but geez, five dollars a pop? My wallet hurts. I feel like I'm paying for this gimmicky glass bottle that I don't even want (and isn't convenient for me to carry around the city). Why not just focus on good customer service and tea rather than relying on this whole glass bottle nonsense? 

I'll be sticking to my tried and true, less than 5 dolla' boba. You know, that happy place where you don't have to deal with chicks next to you taking 20 selfies and your eardrums bleeding.
author: Miffy Y.

description:
Glass bottles!!!!! 
For a small extra cost you get a glass bottle and you can use it for flowers, water, etc. 
You also get a discount the next time you come back with the bottle. Yaaaaaassss!!!

Their green milk tea with boba is good - just ask to use less sugar and you'll be set. Boba is just sweet and chewy enough. Yums. 

I've never actually set foot in here - all of my boba from here has been delivered to me but I can say this - it's worth the trip if you're already in the area! lol
author: Susan Y.

description:
I was recommended to try this place because of how cute the drinks came in a glass bottles. I'm not the one who would drink boba all the time unless I have a craving and since my boyfriend and I were in the Chinatown area, we decided to try Plentea. 

It was early afternoon and there was a line out the door. The interior is rather small with a few tables, and from what it looks like, it seems like there's also a sitting area upstairs. The price of drinks were a little on the pricey side, but it didn't surprise me since you're basically paying for the glass bottles. I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea with Tapioca and my boyfriend had the Mango Oolong Tea with Grassjelly and Tapioca. We were the many who didn't get our drinks in the glass bottles (limited to 300/day until July) so we got a 20% discount for purchasing in a plastic cup. The cashier told us you can receive a discount for every time you bring your glass bottle in.

It didn't take long before our drinks arrived and when we tasted it, it was just..alright.  My boyfriend said he wasn't too impressed with his drink and had better elsewhere. It wasn't bland but it came out a lot sweeter than we thought it would be..too much syrup perhaps? We both didn't think it was THAT spectacular-tasting to be waiting in line for 30mins.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Love the drinks. Doesn't feel as heavy as your typical tea places and it provides a good balance. 
Different in taste too! Definitely recommend when you come to sf and try this place out. Will be back!
author: Raymond T.

description: The atmosphere is very modern and clean looking. I had the Thai iced tea with boba and the tea was amazing, not to sweet. As for the boba is chewy and sweet at first, but overtime the ice makes the boba less chewy. My friend ordered the lavender lemonade and she said it had a strong lavender taste. One of the best parts is that your drink comes in a glass bottle that you can take home. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Sidney F.

description:
I had to wait half a hour for my drink. I understand that your store was busy, but how can you forget to make my drink?

Three people after me received their order before me. I only ordered an avocado shake.  The person before me received two avocado shakes but you just forgot to make mine. When I received it I swear to god that i could make it at home. Like there was literally only avocado in there, there was no flavor, no sugar, just avocado. Major disappointment for thirty minutes wait.  The server didn't even acknowledge that they forgot my drink until I asked about it's whereabouts. I hope they went to the avocado farms to harvest the avocados that were in my drink.
author: Tim M.

description:
Really wanted to like the tea, but I honestly think it's the jar that makes this place as popular as it is. Novelty, I guess? My regular black milk tea was much too sweet for my taste and I gave up half way so I'll probably ask for less sugar next time. The pearls were good so that's definitely a plus. 

Line is out the door which can be a bummer...be prepared to wait.
author: Jennie C.

description:
I love the glass bottle!!!
It makes the drink looks perfect 
However, a little bit too sweet!(mocha milk)
Maybe better for another flavor
author: Tung H.

description:
Okay I'll be honest. I really just wanted to try this place out because of the cool looking bottles. That's what really caught my attention & I like to call it "hipster boba".

I was in the area one day since I was shopping with friends and we decided to go get some milk tea after. We walked in, the place was small, and the set up was just ok. They have an upstairs with tables and chairs, but it was still a little crowded. The lady who took our orders was super friendly and she gave us her recommendations on the menu which was super nice of her.

Since I'm a fan of sea salt cream tea, I decided to get the sea salt oolong tea. When my drink came out, the lady advised me not to shake the drink which I thought was weird since I always shake my sea salt drinks before drinking it. She had told me that it actually tastes better when it's not mixed together. I took her advice, and I'm not sure if I actually really liked the taste of it. I felt like the drink was just ok: I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it. The sea salt tea just didn't compare to the one I usually get at 85 bakery. I'm not sure if it was because I didn't shake the drink this time or if it really was just ok. I'm giving this place 3 stars for now, but I would actually go back to retry the drink again and try out some of the other drinks. And plus, if you bring the bottle back next time, you get 10% off!
author: Wendy L.

description: First timer here! The oolong milk tea tasted more like milk than tea. Why though!!! My friends were raving about this place in San Jose but better luck next time. It wasn't that great for me. Few stars for the glass bottle!!
author: Kelly P.

description:
Got their brown sugar ice milk drink with tapioca - thought it was pretty good! Love the cute glasses they come in and come back with it for 10% off, but I would personally just keep it. On average about $5 for the drink with boba and the glass - which isn't a bad deal. Worth it in my opinion.

Only cons are it's all the way near Chinatown but if you're there at least you can get lunch nearby, but of course not great parking anywhere so would have to take public transportation there.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This place blew my mind!

I love the caramel ice milk with egg pudding. It's like salted caramel ice cream without the salt and it's not as heavy!

The jasmine milk tea is great if you ask for it less sweet. 

The fruit teas are a bit too perfumey for me.
author: Grace H.

description:
Decided to give this place a shot with a friend. Line was out the door, just like you'd probably see at T-Pumps. I would have turned right around but my friend & I had nothing better to do. All the drinks are roughly $4+ (expensive for milk tea) and are served in a glass jar... which probably accounts for the high prices as the glass jar is pressed into that price. You need a $15 minimum for card which I also found ridiculous! I'm not trying to buy 3 drinks just to use my card. I ordered the fresh fruit tea and got strawberry black tea. I wasn't impressed with the drink for the time I had waited in line (seriously 20 minutes) and the price I'd paid.

Save your money and go to T-Pumps instead. Kudos for trying to endorse the reduce of trash/reuse of bottles by offering a discount for bringing it back for your next drink, but who's really going to conveniently carry that glass bottle around?
author: Cris-ann L.

description: The three stars are mainly just for the cute bottles. My boyfriend and I got the Matcha Latte with Egg Pudding and the Sea Salt Crema Tea with boba. I thought the matcha was quite watered down and mediocre at best. My boyfriend's sea salt crema was also meh. The prices are extremely high (but I guess this is because you can keep the bottles). Keep in mind that the drink size is smaller than the norm as well since the bottles are quite narrow. My boyfriend also got very little boba in his drink compared to other places. All in all, the only thing I am happy about is now I have some cute bottles for memories.
author: Trinh D.

description:
Pros:
-u get to keep the bottle

Cons:
-long line (waited about 30min)
-drinks are okay. Some taste watered down
-pricey
-plastic cheap bottle cap, that isn't tight so the bottle leaks

I ordered a green tea slush with egg pudding ($6)
-slush tasted pretty good but definitely not as good once it melted. Try to drink it before u leave
-egg pudding is decent

Overall, wouldn't go back. The bottle and drink were too overpriced.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Unsure why this place has 3 1/2 stars! 

I thought it was cool! I got their Mountain Premium Oolong Tea, and it was a splash of freshness in my mouth! Yes, the prices are high, but you get that cute, hyped up glass bottle for only a dollar extra! I think it's cool how they promote recycling and being green yo! When you come back with the glass, you get a discount! Woohoo! 

Service was aight doh, and they play your typical top ten mainstream music. Upstairs hangout lounge area is nice though! Nice to people watch from. Kekeke. I dig it! I dig it!

Tried my friends' milkier drinks though and wasn't as big a fan.
author: Kim N.

description:
Recently ordered: $4.95 Jasmine/Green milk tea w/ "boba"

Yep, I gave into the hype and successfully bought a drink ONCE, yep just once. The other times I came by ... the lines were so long and ridiculous during the 2pm post-lunch time where the line was out the door and atleast 10 deep on the sidewalk. That is at least a 30 minute wait since it took a little more than 30 minutes last time I was successful when the line got to the door. 

Anyways. 2? yeah 2 ... that disappointed.
-1 = price is a downer here. Yes, they give you a re-usable bottle and they give you 20% off when you bring it back. Great marketing technique to bring customers back ... but it should be an option to buy a glass bottle for those who want one and offer regular plastic / compostable cups if you wanna go "green"

- 2 = the wait / line. There HAS to be a better way to regulate the wait and/or the line. You gotta have a better system in terms of when the customer walks in, orders, get the drinks made, then get them out. I hate comparing but,  check out Sharetea. They get your order, make it, then in 5 minute, I get my drink. 

Last the taste - the boba is actually GOOD and sweet. so if you want your milk tea not too sweet, order it LESS LESS sweet because the boba will actually sweeten your milk tea already. I had no idea my first time, and it was too sweet for me. 

I'd love to come back and give you another try Plentea (and to use my bottle) but every time I come no matter what time it is, the wait and the line is too long and AIN'T NOBODY GOT TIME FOR THAT.
author: Kenny L.

description:
I love this place! The salted one is great but goes down so fast. I have plenty of Plentea jars now but they are great to use at home too. Make sure you grab a lid. 

I only took away one star because of the price. It's a little too expensive for a beverage.
author: Shay S.

description:
I had the Ice Green Milk Tea with Tapioca ($4.50+0.50). It was alright. Nothing mind blowing, and the tapioca was a nice semi-soft chewy texture. I can't remember if it was honey boba. Overall, I just wanted the jar. 

My friend had the Ice Lemon Black Tea ($4.50). It was tasty, but at the end of the day, it tasted almost exactly like the boxed ones you can find in Chinatown. I would be laughing if that is what it really is...

The line started at the door frame. I was in and out within 20 minutes. 

Parking - a pain, typical for this location. 

Note to Plentea - change your cash register. I have NEVER seen so much cash lined up on their side. The cashier carefully "picked" out my change. It was mind blown. I couldn't stop staring. I wish I could've snapped a picture.
author: Jess W.

description: I like their boba milk tea. The store is clean and boba milk teas are delicious. Upstairs has few small tables for people to chat, read books, or just  relax. I also like their tea bottles.
author: Lifang Y.

description: If it weren't for the glass bottles that I can reuse daily, I would give this place 2 stars. The boba milk tea was super washed out. It tasted like watered-down milk with some brown color.
author: Kevin Y.

description: Cool hangout spot with standard fare boba drinks in glass bottles.  They also sell food.  I had eel with rice, and it was simply delicious!
author: Amy S.

description: I absolutely loved the bubble tea from this place. It comes with v fancy glass bottles too. Ordered the creama tea which was not too sweet and very refreshing. The tea was smooth on the tastebuds too. My friend got the avocado shake which was super good too!
author: Qianqi L.

description:
I'd witnessed the rave about this place on Instagram LONGG before coming to Berkeley, so I was really excited to finally get a chance to visit! I also read many reviews on this place, so I wasn't expecting too much, but I also wasn't expecting the worst. I mean, THE JARS. How can anybody say no?

Drinks: Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea + Crema Oolong Tea; 3.5 stars because they were just okay.

I would say that this is a place you would go to for a one-time-experience/Instagram kind of thing. The drinks are pricier in general for the taste/quality you get. They aren't ridiculously expensive, but I've tried so many boba/tea houses in SoCal (not to mention Taiwan, this summer....I CAN'T eat any boba that's not from Taiwan anymore. Sorry, I'm a harsh boba critic) that I feel like this place was alright. It's not bad, but it wasn't outstanding.

Loved the ambience and cute jars. I don't have the time to make another trip to SF, so I re-use these jars as my smoothie bottle, sometimes flower vases.
author: Eileen W.

description: My 30% sweet taro tea was still WAY TOO SWEET. Cloyingly so. I can't imagine what 100% would be like. I liked the chunks of "fresh" taro. At that rate, wish they had 3% sweet.
author: Andrew K.

description:
JAR JAR JAR!!! That's all anyone comes for right?

Came to Plentea on a Saturday afternoon for a honeydew milk tea with pearls and a caramel milk tea with caramel pudding. Unfortunately, they ran out of jars but we got 20% off!

The drinks were not bad at all and honestly for the $5 you're essentially paying for the jar, not the drink.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Best way to get here is from Montgomery station if you're taking the Bart. It's right across the street from Sushiritto so if you want to be a typical asian, go ahead and get that prior.
The drink is overpriced but it's pretty tasty; I got the caramel milk tea with tapioca. The reason for the price is because you're paying for the bottle. However the price you can get 10% if you bring the bottle back the next time.
Don't be surprised when you come and you see a long line full of Asians, it's pretty popular among them.
author: Andre B.

description:
Trash! I paid $7 for the matcha green tea with red bean and boba! $7!

Pro is that when it's not too crowded, it's got a cozy little loft to hang out in and wifi, but not worth the trip and money otherwise.
author: Cailin H.

description: I love this place! It is kind of expensive and I do love the glass jar that I can take home! The downside of this place is that it's small, cramped up, long lines, and kind of takes a while to get your drinks. I don't live in the city, but I do enjoy coming here when I visit.
author: Racheal A.

description: Milk tea with boba comes with cute bottle ！Delicious balance of flavors... Best part is you get to take the glass bottle home!
author: Samantha P.

description: I was lured to Plentea by the glass bottles posted on various social media. I ordered a Thai tea with boba, and honestly it wasn't anything special. The boba was chewy (I've had way better boba) and the tea was too sweet for my liking. I literally only like the presentation of the drink (the glass bottle), other than that, I would never pay $5+ for a Thai tea. And for the price, the portion is pretty small.
author: Zara A.

description: If you're an SF tourist on the hunt for Boba downtown...this is your spot. The drinks are good and you get a souvenir bottle. Drink on ! If you check in you get a discount
author: Dee R.

description: I've walked past Plentea many times and there is always a line out the door.  Today, I stopped by early and the line hadn't formed yet, so I had an almond milk tea with bubbles, which was excellent.  Tea can be served hot or cold.  The only reason I didn't give five stars was the price was a bit high.  Quality has its price, however and I highly recommend Plentea.
author: Chris K.

description:
I love the fact that they give you your drink in a glass. Plastic is so gross. :O

The prices are a little bit more because of that, but the teas are yummy. There are a few options for toppings and they also serve food. If you bring your clean glass back, you get a discount!

Also note that there is a $10 minimum to use a credit/debit card, so make sure you have cash if you aren't going to spend more than that. :)
author: Melissa S.

description: I find the tea pretty tasty. However, the novelty jar that drives business to Plentea is low quality and potentially dangerous. The day after I polished off the beverage, my husband washed the jar, contemplating whether to reuse or recycle the container. The bottom just fell out, hitting my kitchen floor. Recycle it is. Fortunately, the glasses were mostly big pieces and easy to clean up. I never thought the jar would be made of Swarovski cystal and it's not like my husband is the Hulk either, but I didn't think they'd be hazardous (except when people outright drop them as they prance around in the FiDi).
author: Lily T.

description:
I've tried the Fresh Fruit Mango Milk with boba. I went after work and luckily purchased the last bottle of the day! Woohoo. It was very refreshing and the boba was good. The glass bottle definitely adds to the appeal of the drink. If it were in a plastic cup, it'd be a regular drink to me.

Only thing that I thought was weird: they have fresh fruit milk and fresh fruit tea. I asked the employee if they were able to make fresh fruit milk tea but unfortunately they could not. :( I still enjoyed it though.

Definitely worth the try for anyone who loves boba.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I went there for the second time on Thursday and bought three drink cause I got overexcited and because of the $15 minimum for card. I didn't really know what to get so I looked at the pictures on their yelp and picked from there. My first drink, sea-salt crema w/ boba was pretty good! toward the end it tasted really really salty so i didn't finish it but overall good! My second drink I got taro w/ boba and it was not so good, it was really grainy which and I Didn't like it that much but the taste was fine. My third drink was oolong tea w/ lychee and this was by far the best. Next time I go I'll definitely get this again :)

The atmosphere is really chill too! and the staff were really friendly too!
author: Paola M.

description:
Best milk tea in the city. Perfect balance of sweetness and tea-flavor that comes in a reusable glass jar. 

Lines can be long on the weekends, but the wait usually isn't too bad (~20 min)
author: Adam Y.

description: Free wifi, upstairs and downstairs seating, tasty drinks and good music. I can't complain. The sea salt oolong drink was crazy tasting... and tasted great!
author: Christine L.

description: Meh. Came here with a couple of friends to try the place out. The service and everything was good and they have a cool concept (very instagram-worthy drinks). I got the thai milk tea with boba. I like that they use fresh ingredients, but the boba drinks were just subpar. 5/5 for service but 2/5 for the drinks.
author: Vivian S.

description:
One of the better boba place near Union square. The glass bottles are cute and I like that you can re-use it to get a 10% discount. Husband ordered the fruit tea with boba and I ordered the green milk tea with boba. The tea is good but the boba was not. It was too chewy, to the point of almost hard. I believe making the perfect boba is a must for every milk tea place. They need to expand their toppings variety. 

Overall the place is quaint and there is enough space to sit and enjoy the tea in the shop instead of a grab and go place. I may come back if I happen to be around the area.
author: Tami T.

description: It was cool and overcast today and I was fighting a cold. I was thinking that a cup of hot tea would be soothing. I ordered a cup of Oolong. They served it too me iced. I let them know that I wanted hot tea. The person preparing the tea told me that I hadn't ordered it that way and scowled and gave me a dirty look. I let her know that I hadn't ordered it iced and no one asked my preference. She then begrudgingly poured tea from a pitcher into a to go cup and microwaved it. Microwave tea at 5 dollars a pop served with a surly attitude. No thank you. I won't be going back.
author: Samuel H.

description:
Finally got to come here after hearing everyone hype about it. 

The drinks come in a glass jar you can keep which is why they're a little on the pricier side. Their interior design was definitely aesthetically pleasing, so bonus points for that. 

My rating is mainly for the drinks themselves. I got their oolong milk tea with tapioca balls: the tea was good, but it didn't "wow" me. The tapioca balls were a little hard for my taste, and I felt like as I kept drinking, the tapioca got slightly harder to chew. Not sure if I just got a bad batch or if it's always like that. 

I would come again with friends who've never been before, since the interior is really cute, but I wouldn't consider it a go-to place.
author: Clevian H.

description: Meh. I had to come try this place because the bottles make for such a cute photo and I came all the way from the East Coast and I was passing it- so why not? The prices were pretty decent too for such a monstrous bottle. I got the strawberry fruit tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea (something like that). We waited about 10 minutes for our drink and then when it finally came.. my boyfriend was the first to take a sip and he made a face of disgust. So here I am thinking "Oh lawd, probably one of his drama queen moments" as I went to go take a sip of mine. I was about to make the same face again so I took yet another sip and gave that face up. The strawberry milk tea was so.. bland. It tasted super watered down and it just wasn't pleasant at all. It was also pretty warm in temperature so that probably made it even worse. I tried my boyfriend's and his again had the same problem. I still can't decide what's worse- watered down coffee or watered down fruit milk tea. Either way, I had a terrible experience but at least the glass bottles made it safely back to NY?
author: Kimberly K.

description:
I love my tea but $6 is very inhibitive.  I had a peach oolong with lychee jelly and sister and the sea salt crema with taro pudding. 

The peach oolong was super oolong-y and peachy!  there were bits of fresh peach in my drink.  The sea salt crema was filling but also very good.

The glass bottles are a nice touch but not at the markup
author: claudia y.

description:
This place was not a let down. I went around 1130 and the place wasn't so busy so I was able to get my hands on their glass bottle. I ordered the black milk tea with egg pudding and I was not disappointed. The black milk tea was good and the tea taste was very prominent unlike other places I have tried before. I'm coming back to try the other choices that they have on their menu. 

Come early enough so you can grab their glass bottles, if you don't they end up running out and you'll just get it in a regular cup. If you get the glass bottles, bring it back when you get another drink because there's an extra discount!
author: Loree T.

description: If you're in the city, and you're craving for a dessert, this is the place I usually recommend to people. Not really dessert, but drink wise. Everything I've had here so far is good! Also, I love how you get to keep the cute glass bottles.
author: Hayle C.

description: Their fruit teas are better than their milk teas. I tried the Mango Green Tea and IT WAS SO GOOD  so refreshing and you even get to keep the jars!!!
author: Kelly P.

description:
I got the strawberry slush and it was delicious. I came here late on a Thursday night (around 10 and stayed until 11), and the employees were still nice and friendly. The guy at the register gave great recommendations and didn't seem irritated by all my questions! 

My fruit slush was great and I also tried my friends' with lychee jelly, which I would recommend. If you don't like boba, I'd definitely recommend adding lychee jelly. It's sweet and isn't as chewy as boba.

This place opens late! Also, they give you a glass bottle with your order that you can keep and bring back. I really like the concept of this place. They'll give 10% off your order if you bring the bottle back and reuse it!
author: Julie L.

description:
Milk tea: Definitely creamy, but too sweet. Needs a little more tea flavor.

Fruit tea: Too sweet yet watery at the same time. Needs stronger fruit & tea flavors.

The search continues...
author: Jen P.

description: Yup, one of those people that came here to take home an official "Plentea" bottle. Its honestly overpriced @ 5+ dollars per drink, but hey its a cute instagram picture. I like that the bottles are reusable, and you can get a discount if you bring it back! Ambiance of the place is pretty cute, they also have upstairs seating so you can chill. i ordered the Sweet cream oolong tea crema. Could be sweeter, and the pearls were already hard. Maybe it because it was the end of the day, but i sure do love sweet soft chewy boba, and this place didn't please.
author: Mariell N.

description:
Another place nearby where I can indulge my milk tea addiction!

Sure, their matcha milk green tea tasted pretty decent ($5.98, if you get it in the glass), with a decent amount of the familiar green tea flavor infused. But the one thing that attracted me to this place was the glass bottles! It's such an original idea (at least, I haven't seen anyone else do it yet), and they offer a discount if you bring it back. Personally, I plan to just keep it as a memento. 

I also hear their sandwiches are pretty good as well, give it a try! 
But I'm huge on matcha milk green tea, and so I'll be coming back here for it when I can!
author: Viet N.

description: Before coming here I consistently went to Destiny on Kearny for boba, but I came here once and never looked back. Mango green tea is where it's at. The pieces of mango in your drink along with the boba is pure genius. Not to mention the adorable glasses you get with each drink. Yes it's a little pricey, but let's be real. The glasses are totally worth it. I may or may not have a dozen of them in the drawer of my desk at work. But really though, you want me to lug ten of them all the way back to Kearny for a free drink? No thank you. Other than that, great drinks and service and I'll definitely be coming back :)
author: Sam L.

description:
The seating inside of Plentea is so adorable! I love the glass bottles and I can't wait to come again for a 10% discount next time haha. The fresh fruit tea that I got (strawberry green tea flavored) was pretty good; it's better than what I usually have. 
The cashier was talking on the phone in the beginning so it was a little awkward just standing in front of her...
But the tea itself was actually pretty tasty so it evens out!
author: Alice H.

description:
Plentea of good things to say about this place, including the warm customer service and of course, the glass jars they come with.

Upstairs seating for groups, side tables for parties of two.
author: Ryan K.

description: I used to go to this place regularly with my husband until the last two times. I usually order oolong milk tea and it used to be so great but lately it's not at all. Once I asked for a new oolong milk tea and it was so much better. But last time I asked to replace it with coffee milk tea and it was even worse!! I would recommend to ask for sample if you go before ordering one and taste it before you leave. Now I like i-tea much better which is on the same street. And there you can have a bigger cup with the same price.
author: Fatima E.

description:
Customer service - 1 star
Drinks - 3 or 4 stars

I've been there a couple times now. Between the few times I've been there, I interacted with two females cashiers. Both cashiers were rude and dislike answering questions from customers. They would give one word responses and never smiled. 

I like their fresh fruit teas but their iced milk was way too sweet. After letting all of the ice melt, the iced milk was still beyond sweet. 

I want to give this place 2 stars but since I would come back, 3 is more appropriate. There are just no good boba places close by.
author: Jing W.

description: I am not entirely convinced. My real issue is their oolong didn't have that rich earthy flavor it is known for. It tasted more like a light, floral green tea. The sea salt crema is so good though, if the tea is right it could be incredible. I am willing to give them another try.  Heads up line was insane and expect to pay $5-6 total.
author: A S.

description: The tea tasted slightly above average, but I'm annoyed that they don't have restrooms, even for customers. They recommended to use either the super duper restroom across the street (closed at the time) or the parking garage next block over. We walked over to the garage and found the restrooms closed there too. We had already ordered hot drinks with boba, but they don't even have any spoons to get the boba with, so we had to drink hot milk tea with boba out of a straw.
author: Cody H.

description:
This place is the classic -"Over Hyped Place with Lines". For some reason it is engraved in humans that if there is a place with a long line we MUST at all cost stand in it!!!! That was my case thankfully the line actually goes kinda fast. So granted I didnt go crazy and try something different I did get an Iced tea oolong with leeches. It was meh nothing to write home about. 

I would like to come back to give something different a try, but its not something that I would go out of my way to try. And lastly like many other people said its pricey for boba but maybe if they allowed people to get the option of plastic instead of glass it would be cheaper.
author: Nina M.

description:
The cashier was very polite and helpful.

I got the Taro milk and it was..... different. It is just milk with crushed taro, so unless you want to chew pieces of taro, don't get this.
author: Diane Z.

description:
I gave it 4 stars because Plentea is located in an area for people who are already in the financial district, downtown/union square, and/or Chinatown; plus, to make the trip across town, just to grab tapis, is not worth it.  Since I didn't have to work, I decided to ride MUNI to check out the hype.  Considering the area/district, and that this is hand made milk tea in a reusable glass bottle (which is the only tapioca place, so far, that does this), I'd say prices are somewhat reasonable.  Perfect location as it is in the middle of a block of restaurants, and people can grab drinks back to their workplaces.

Came here just in time, right at the beginning of the lunch rush, so I waited about 5 - 8 minutes for my order.  Got the Thai ice milk tea w/aloe; even after about 30 mins., when the ice melted, the flavor didn't dilute and still had that Thai tea flavor (like a Thai tea should taste); I also like how my drink stayed cold after making a pit stop to grab a quick lunch before I headed back to MUNI.  Will be back, but it won't be a constant thing.
author: Jessica S.

description:
As other reviews have clearly stated-it's ALL ABOUT THAT GLASS!  I just wanted, just ONCE, to try expensive, over-priced boba in a little glass that I could keep.  Alas, for whatever reason, I was given a plastic cup...(maybe they ran out of glass already that day??)

So much disappointment.  The milk tea, however, was pretty good.  Just not worth the steep price without the glass :(  But with the $1 teaways gone and Quickly's being terrible, and Purple Kow far from my house and with long lines...searching for another place has begun.
author: Aly A.

description:
SO good. If I lived in San Francisco I would come here frequently. I had the milk tea and the thai tea and my boyfriend had the taro milk and something else I can't remember...

Very good and fresh. Also LOVE the bottles. They make a great souvenir from SF. A bit pricey compared to other bubble tea drinks, but worth it.
author: Shayla S.

description:
So, I gave 3 stars cause I'm unsure as to why my blueberry milk wasn't even filled to the top or at least higher than where it is when I got it. All the other drinks from the picture are filled to the top. The drink was tasty I have to admit and I love the glass bottle. I'll have to come back again and see if they fill it the same way next time and inquire as to why it's less than others. I feel like I'm being skimped out on my drink. Oh, and people, in the milk drink...there is NO TEA. So people don't get confused. If you look at the menu it just says milk. When I asked for green tea she said that there isn't any. The girl at the register today though, she needs to be a little more outspoken, cheerful and nice. She was none of those. Soft spoken and can barely here her. You're the cashier and face of the place.


Time: 11:14pm. Just tried the mango oolong tea with lychee jelly. SUPER DUPER SWEET! I don't know how anyone can drink something with that much sugar?! I don't think I'll be coming back. Only thing good were probably the waffle sandwiches. I'll stick to tPumps and will knock out a star down to two. Sorry Plentea, just not good enough.
author: Sheena C.

description:
I LOVED the Oolong Crema with 30% sugar and herbal jelly!! The creme itself tasted divine!!! I wished they are closer but I guess you can't have everything =)
The regular oolong milk tea was so great! So was the peach oolong with aloe vera yum!!
author: Wendy T.

description: Of course I mainly came for the glass bottle. :) But they're also a good solid boba tea spot. Firm, chewy boba. Good, strong tea taste. Solid milk tea. The fresh fruit teas (with actual bits of fruit in it) are refreshing on hot days, which we've had quite a few of recently in the city.
author: Andrea L.

description: I literally came here just for the bottle. The boba was whatever, nothing special. Not worth the wait if the line is out the door like it normally is.
author: Leslie C.

description:
