Knocking it out of the park.

I don't like sweet boba (although when I do it's at tea-era in Palo Alto). So this shop is the spot for me. Like the boba guys they focus on the basic, astringent tea flavors to show off their brew.

But what really is impressive is their fruit smoothie. I'd call it a fruit milk shake, since the avocado gives it a creamy consistency.

If I recall correctly, an employee said they opened up ten days ago, so their operations still have a ways to go -- but they make up for it in hustle.
author: Christophe C.

description:
Things to know:
There is always a long line. 
It's small and cramped and noisey. Squished and uncomfortable waiting for your drink. 
They up-charge you for tapioca and any other toppings. 
You can opt for a non-glass cup and save 50cents. 
Tapioca texture is actually okay, chewing slightly too soft not bad. 
The reg black milk tea was okay, didn't hit the spot. 
"Went wild" and tried the salt crema oolong --ooNO. 
Gave it to shots and I'm done.
author: Melody T.

description:
The worst customer service ever. They said "no public restroom" SERIOUSLY!!!!!!!!!!
You sell drinks but no restrooms? 

Drinks was ok. I think boba guy and cool tea bar way much better in quality and price! 

I would not recommend and will not come back . Plentea I dislike you so much for making me go down to the parking lot . Ewww
author: Vicki N.

description: tried their sea salt crema tea and it was pretty good. the minimum for card is $10 but the cashier was nice enough to process our transaction even though we were slightly under.  I understand that the glass bottles are part of their branding but I wish there was a way to deny it if you don't need one and reduce the cost of your drink. right now the only scheme they have is, if you go back and return it you get a 10% discount. But for tourists, they might not go back and I found it to be a hassle to carry it around while exploring Union Square.
author: Prashray D.

description:
I was super frightened by the prices, but they have the cutest idea of using the glass milk jugs--environmentally friendly and awesome. If you reuse it, there's 20% off. I ordered the sea salt crema, and it was very good!

We came at around 3pm, so there was actually no line. (I passed by at around 12ish another time and the line was crazy!) Come here for afternoon tea instead.
author: Katherine H.

description:
The drinks are pricey but they're all so good. I like that they have tea, milk teas, as well as milk drinks and smoothies.

The glass container concept is cute and unique - you can bring it back to re-use it for a small 10% off discount. You can also opt out of the glass container and use their plastic container for the 10% off discount.

I think it's worth it for the price - it's delicious, filling, sweet, and conveniently located in Fidi/downtown!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 3

Came here to grab some cold oolong milk tea. Milk tea was okay, although there was too much ice, and it was quite pricey.
author: David L.

description:
Parking is a pain just a heads up if you're trying to find good parking in this area. My hubby literally waited in the car- with the kids while I stood in line looking at the menu deciding what I wanted as my first official drink at Plentea. 

I was aiming for "Fresh Fruit Teas." I asked the cashier since it was my first time if I could try a sample and unfortunately they don't allow that at Plentea but when I asked her opinions on what's popular, I took her word for it. 

I ended up ordering the Mango Fresh Fruit tea with boba. I LOVE anything mango so I had high hopes this drink would be good! 

*If paying with a Debit/Credit card* it's a $15 minimum! Crap, all I had was my debit at hand but Thankfully, she let that slide, and took my debit. She did tell me next time they won't accept it unless I have cash. I appreciated the kind Customer Service. 

In literally 5 seconds flat my drink was ready. HOLY Crap---that was FAST! =P I was not disappointed at all, mango tea is super fresh with little mangos inside and it was actually toooooooooooo sweet for my husband when I made him try some, but it was just perfect for me. 

Their bottles are super cute. I'm a huge fan of glass and mason jars so I love the fact that they serve their boba in cute glass bottles. Talk about fancy! Love it!
author: Jade D.

description: I've heard about this place for a while and I thought I'd be disappointed because of how hyped up it was, but Plentea turned out to be good. The line was pretty much to the door when I got there but the service was fast and we got our drinks only a couple minutes after we ordered! I got the peach black tea with lychee jelly and tapioca, while my sister got the brown sugar iced milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca. The peach tea was alright, a little more bitter than how normal places make it, but it wasn't bad. The tapioca here is good! My sister's drink, the brown sugar iced milk, was super good and I definitely recommend it! It's one of their most popular drinks and I understand why! That's probably what I'll be getting next time. Also, their iced drinks come in really cute glass jars that can be capped and you get to keep! :)
author: Yvonne L.

description: This place is always packed. They have bright boards so it's easy to see what you want. I think the best part is the bottle! They also have lids for them which is perfect for that brisk walk through the city. There Re a few tables below but they have some nice comfy couches on the top. If you plan on staying and chatting make your way up there instead of being squeezed in the front. I recommend the red bean slushie drink. I didn't get it but my friend's sister did and it was AMAZING! I don't live in the city so when I do go it's the first thing I get.
author: Monica H.

description:
Got almond milk tea and Nutella tea and both were very good. Love the glass bottles and definitely worth the little extra price. Nice decor and will come back. Friendly service and very clean. Will return. 

Ps. Best music ever. Think Britney+nsync.
author: Henry H.

description: Awesome bubble tea that come in cool glass bottles!!!!! (You get 10% off on ur order if u bring in ur old bottle... Although i didnt see anyone do this and i probably would do the same and forego the 10% so as to add another glass bottle to my collection!). Green tea is pretty solid as is the thai iced tea. Great place to come and chill with yo peeps.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I love the bottles that the drinks come in. Plus, if you bring in your bottle on your next visit, you can get a discount on your new order. 

The drinks themselves are pretty good, I tried just the black milk tea without boba and it was decent. It wasn't too sweet or too bitter, and it gave me a really good caffeine kick. The only problem was that the drink was a little too warm for my taste.
author: Revati V.

description:
Waited 15 mins in line and I couldn't wait any longer so I had to leave. 
Would not recommend to other people unless you have 20+ mins of spare time to get an overpriced milk tea drink.

Highly disappointed and not coming back.
author: Mel P.

description:
I went once and wasn't really a fan because they put fruit mango chunks in my drink. I went back a second time to try it again and they didn't add chunks to my drink and j loved it. It was such a tasty drink and so refreshing. They are also very generous with their boba! Such a good place. Mango green tea with honey boba is my drink of choice. I'll definitely come back! 
Don't forget to bring back your glass bottle though for the 10% off!
author: Elena V.

description:
Have to admit, I was enamored by those cool milk bottle-esque glasses that the drinks come in. But in the end, that's where the obsession stops. The milk tea itself is decent, the boba soft, and the bottle super cool. The menu is pretty limited, but that's not always a bad thing if it's executed well. We ordered the Coffmilk Tea and the Green Milk Tea. The coffmilk is just a coffee milk tea, with good coffee flavor. The green milk tea was decently strong in tea flavor. I just wasn't wowed by the flavor profile with either drink. I probably should have been more adventurous and gone for the sea salt crema tea or coffee, but I don't get to drink SF grade boba very often anymore, so I have to get my fill when I can. There's a yelp discount which was helpful, but I honestly hate places that charge for toppings. It just feels very stingy and the original prices really aren't cheap. Guess you're paying a premium for the bottle! 

And oh, that bottle that I was so excited to add to my collection? Cracked after one use.
author: Karen C.

description:
When my mom and I walked up the line was out the door and for the next hour or so we were in there, there was a steady stream of people coming in and going out. The menu was pretty impressive, with a large selection of milk teas, fruity teas, flavored milk, and plenty of toppings to go with it all. Tucked away at the bottom right corner of the menu was a good selection of snacks, including Takoyaki.

I ordered the strawberry black tea with boba which also included strawberry bits and my mom ordered the coffee milk tea with boba. Unfortunately they had just ran out of boba, and it took at least 20 minutes for them to make more! If I didn't have good company with me, I wouldn't have wanted to stick around and wait, especially being that the place is so small. 

Drinks were okay, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us. Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return. At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?
author: Simone M.

description: Busy place but got tea! Very cute place. There was a long line but it moved quite fast. They give you glass bottles to keep and you get a discount if you reuse them. There were some seats downstairs but there were more upstairs.
author: Alice Z.

description: Really really nice juice! The mango green tea with lychee jelly will be my first love in SF!
author: Xx L.

description: Second time here and it's so cute !! I love the glass bottle they give and when you bring it back you get a discount ! I had the black milk tea when I came the first time and this time I got the strawberry green tea with chia seeds and it has fruit bits in it which makes it really delicious . It's kinda pricey but it's really cute :3 haha worth it every time I'm in sf
author: Shirley B.

description:
I was honestly really excited to come here for my first time and the hype behind the famous glass bottled milk teas.... But all it is, is a hype. 

I bought 3 drinks (Taro, Milk Tea, & Coffee Milk Tea) which came out to about almost $18, so it is kind of pricey. You're basically paying for the glass bottle. 

The taro was like fresh taro, wasn't all that good to me. My boyfriend ended up throwing the rest away. The milk tea is OK. It's not like Tapioca Express or Quickly milk tea, it's more of the tea, tea type milk tea (similar to a Tea Stations). And the Coffee Milk Tea was just gross. It was so watered down I ended up giving it away to my friend we met up with. Didn't even care about the glass bottle at that point.

Overall, probably not coming back again. The milk tea spots around there are probably better tasting. So unless you want that glass bottle, I don't recommend coming if you're craving a bomb ass milk tea.
author: Asia C.

description:
My fiancé and I walked past this place after eating at Ramen Underground. Its bright, sheen interior caught our eyes and we decided to get something sweet to drink. Turns out, they just opened the place on Thursday. Despite being new, we were welcomed and offered help immediate. The service is very quick and friendly. 

The coolest/cutest thing about this place is that the drinks are served in bottles! And the neat part is that you can take the bottle home and return it for a discount on your next purchase! I hope I can visit this place again soon :)
author: Jun N.

description:
So this isn't your typical boba place with plastic cups - they serve it in a cute glass bottle that you get to keep.

If you want something fruity, I recommend the mango fresh fruit tea.

TIP - check in on Yelp for 25% your whole order! 

FYI - min $10 if you're using a card
author: Ephraim B.

description:
Heard about this place and wanted to try it for the first time.  Came here after a dental appointment.  
Ordered one milk n one tea with two toppings in each.  The cashier asked me what tea would I like with the milk.  I repeated I only want milk but she said I have to choose a tea???  So I ordered black feeling confused??? And when I got the order, it was not milky white.  I asked another girl whether this was the right order and of course it wasn't.  Milk is milk, no need to choose a tea.  The cashier apologized for giving me the wrong info.  Anyway this other girl said I had to pay another 50 cents on top of the $11.95.  So I have two boba drinks with pudding for $12.50.  That's way too expensive, think I was overcharged.  
Just wish this cashier knew the menu and stop confusing the customers by giving the wrong info and overcharging me too.  So for anyone going there make sure they don't overcharge you.  The milk boba was not all that compare with Purple Kow ( the best).  The only thing drawing the crowds are the bottles, with lids that are not even airtight.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I went to Ramen Underground for lunch then stopped by Plentea on the way back. Only waited a few min in line, but the line was still growing around 1:45pm! I totally think the wait is worth it though, this place is by far the best boba drink I've had in the financial district!! 

Fresh boba, not frozen and good selection of tea choices. $4.50 + $0.50 for a "tapioca" topping is pretty pricey compared to drink shops like Quickly or in the Richmond but that's to be expected from downtown. 

I wish they gave some sort of refund for the glass bottles though... 10% off your next drink only works out to like 50 cents and it'd be nice if they refunded $2 like the juice places. 

Also, the $15 credit card minimum is pretty high - that's like the price of 3 drinks so make sure your friends have Venmo so you can order together or bring cash.
author: Jing L.

description: First time trying this place. I really love it. I like that glass bottle that it came in as well. Good customer service
author: Cecily S.

description: Walking distance from our timeshare which makes this place convenient. Great boba thai milk tea and cute glass bottles.  $10 minimum credit card purchase, so bring cash.
author: Aileen d.

description:
We came here at 10:15pm on a Saturday night and it was still crowded with tons of hipsters. I figured people wanted to come just to get the novelty glass jars. This place is banging with customers mainly because of their competitive selling point - fancy glass jars with their business name exclusively imprinted on the jars. I felt skeptical, but I too fell victim to the novelty item. Haha! I begged my boyfriend to bring me here. I attempted to order the Iced Milk Tea with Tapioca because that is usually how I guage the quality of a boba place, by the quality of the most standard drink. They ran out of boba! WTF! A boba place with no boba?! That's like KFC running out of chicken (which did happen to me one time)! I settled for the pudding instead. There were 3 people working and they get slowed down when people order the blended drinks. 

The Iced Milk Tea flavor was very watered down and wasn't very strong. I didn't get that "oomph" tea taste. The pudding tasted grainy and not smooth. I didn't think the quality was very good, maybe because the end of the day and it's towards closing time. But still, quality shouldn't be compromised at any time. 

My boyfriend ordered the Honeydew Fresh Milk and it was way too sweet. I feel like I need to come back again during the day and get the tapioca so I can give it a less biased review! They also have waffles which sounded really good from the description on the menu.
author: Janny S.

description: Best bubble tea in San Francisco! Plenty of boba and the most awesome glass bottles. Loved it and will return the next time I visit.
author: Luz B.

description:
Came here one time when I happened to be in Chinatown. The only reason I was able to try it is because now they are open on weekends.

Only way to get here would be the bus. I can't imagine driving here and having to find parking in FiDi. Nope nope nope. The shop itself is pretty small and very hipster-feeling. I'm talking about chalkboards, wood paneling. Luckily when I came here it was not very crowded, but there was still a line. I could see it being quite hectic on a weekday.

Service was like any other boba place, and it was fairly prompt despite the crowd.

The drinks themselves were..okay I guess. I thought mine was weird tasting. I got a mango yogurt black tea. The mango totally overwhelmed any tea flavor that was in there. And the mango didn't really taste or feel fresh (there were mango chunks in the tea). It kind of reminded me of the preserved dried mangoes. My bf got the strawberry black tea I believe...again very average. 

I'm glad I came here because I got the much-talked-about glass bottles. However, the price is quite expensive for just a boba. It's just as expensive as getting Starbucks (most boba does not cost as much as a frappucino).

I can't really see myself coming back much. I'm usually not in the area (Chinatown/FiDi), and when I am I have better places to get better boba for cheaper.
author: Denise C.

description:
LOVVVVEEEEE!!!!!  Love when theres bottles, hate it when theres not. My fav drinks have to be caramel milk with boba and pudding, papaya milk, mango green or black tea... basically everything is BOMB!! 

p.s I have like 25 bottles at home. Bring your plentea bottles for 10 percent off. Oh and PLENTEA IS BOMB!!!!
author: Amanda V.

description:
Was super excited to have a boba shop open up in the FiDi. ABOUT TIME. They are all about organic eco-friendliness so they serve up the drinks in glass milk bottles and if you get it to go, there are little tops for them, which I find pretty nifty. 

Got the Oolong tea crema...no, they do not make one with green tea. I asked. Boo. That being said, it was pretty tasty, but I think because of the milk bottle deal, it's not the usual crema that I'm used to with the cream top...it was basically mixed into the drink already. 

The boba was pretty mushy...I want to hope that it was just that batch, but I kind of doubt it. Skip. My egg pudding on the other hand, was pretty delish. 

They're pretty new and the drinks take a little longer than I'm used to for a boba shop. They also serve up desserts, which looked really good, but we didn't have time during our quick stop. 

If you bring the milk bottle back, you get 10% off your next order. Overall, a good pick me up for the work day, but not necessarily my cup of tea. HA.
author: Annie S.

description: The boba tasted ordinary as in any other boba spot. The staff was very friendly though. The bottles were cute and if you bring them in next time you get 10% off
author: Frances V.

description: I wanted to try this place for a while. They ran outof the brown sugar milk and tapioca. I was looking forward to trying the brown sugar milk too. How can a boba place run out of tapioca ? Instead I just got the red milk tea with pudding and aloe jelly. 1/4 of my glass was filled with ice and the rest was the drink. You don't get too much to drink, but hey you get to keep this cute plentea souvenir cup! :)
author: Cindy D.

description: It's just awesome :) although they do give option on sugar levels, but the drinks are perfect. It's not too sweet :) the tapioca is chewy :) remember to bring the glass bottle back next time to get 10%
author: Jenny Y.

description: I wish I knew how to quit you, Plentea. Your drinks are expensive, not that big, your boba is hard and you have that ridiculously high "minimum charge" for credit cards that we know cannot be legally enforced.  Yet I keep coming back for you.
author: Bonnie S.

description: Plentea for me is just like the other 'boba' shops. I ordered green tea with grass jelly and it was the same as what the other shops would offer. The only difference is the reusable glass jar which I had to carry along while shopping in the city.  Staff were nice. Lines were long so I had to abort my effort my earlier and came back late in the afternoon. Street parking or garage parking.
author: Kitty D.

description:
The 4 stars are primarily for the glass bottle that they give you the drink in.

In my opinion,  the prices are a bit high for milk tea but then again it is FiDi...so it's expected.  I ordered the thai iced tea and it was a little sweeter than I'm used to but still enjoyed it.

This place is pretty great because they are open until 11pm and play top 40 music and the staff was friendly. 

They also keep a bucket of plastic tops on the counter if you want to take your drink to go and so you can reuse your bottle for other beverage purposes. With the increase in boba milk tea enthusiasm in SF, I think all the other new milk tea cafes should catch on to the glass bottle service. Embrace your inner SF environmentalist!

I have to go back for another cap since my dog chewed mine up...so this time I may grab 2.
author: Elisha Y.

description:
Bring bottle back, 10% off.
Get a plastic cup, 20% off.
They only have 300 glass bottles a day. I was lucky enough to get one at around noonish. I like their design. They use plastic caps and surprisingly, no spills!!!

I got the Thai tea here the other day and it was lovely! It's just the right amount of sweetness and it didn't leave any color on my tongue. Drink was smooth and refreshing. Only problem I have is how pricey it is. Almost $5 for a drink?! No thankss!!!
author: Benita M.

description:
Pretty good milk tea and nice glass jugs. I've been here twice and got the matcha green milk tea the first time, then the normal milk tea with grass jelly. Really like the grass jelly, which is a bit sweet. Kind of expensive for boba though.

$10 limit on credit cards, which is a shame, but if you're with someone else 2 drinks comes out to just over $10 with tax.
author: Charles G.

description:
I decided to come here while I was visiting San Francisco since I'm a bubble tea lover and I'm not going to lie, I was intrigued by the bottle itself more than the tea. It was decently convenient to get to, and I loved the idea of bringing the bottle back if you're a regular and actually live there. (Otherwise if you're like me and just touring the place you can bring it back to wherever you came from to reuse it) 

The decor here is nice and trendy and I love that they have an upstairs as well. It's regularly priced as other bubble tea places, and they have some unique flavors. I stuck to my usuals since I like to see how different places compare with their most basic teas and Plentea was among the typical ones.
author: Angel T.

description: I work in the city and took the wrong bus.  So while walking back to the Caltrain station I decided to stop by Plentea because it was on my way.  When I went, there were no glass bottles left.  I'm not going lie I was disappointed and the 10% didn't really make up for it, it was still $5.  Either I got the ice black milk tea with 50% sweetness.  It was still sweet, but I usually like my drinks less sweet, so if I do go again I'll get like 25% sweetness.  The drink itself was still good though!  The pearls were really good.  I'm pretty picky on my pearls and like them on the chewier side.  These pearls were chewy and sweet.
author: Lydia K.

description:
The cashier was straight up the worst with her terrible attitude. STRAIGHT UP. We were so excited to come here after a long day in Japan Town for the bottles and the drinks. I recommended this place to the others because my first experience here was good. When we arrived we asked whether they ran out of bottles and the cashier rudely told us that they're getting a new shipment and they won't have anymore for two weeks. It's an understandable situation, but did she have to explain it so surly? Geez. I just asked a simple question. She was rude to the rest of our party and then had somebody else man the cashier because maybe she couldn't handle being one anymore??? 

Anyway, the prices for the drinks are pretty expensive, but I don't mind since the bottle comes with it. And when they run out of bottles don't worry--you get a whole 10% off!!!1 That amounts to a whole $1.64 off a 3-drink $16+ purchase. The toppings cost 50 cents extra as they do in most places, but I should've been paying 5 cents for the 10 pieces of lychee jelly that they oh so generously gave me. The drink wasn't bad, but the cashier kind of ruined our experience with her whole "charm." 

TL;DR: The cashier had a bitter attitude and the drinks weren't worth the price.
author: Megan C.

description: Love the bottles!!! The boba was a bit small, but it was tasty! I got the matcha latte with boba and egg pudding and it was sweet and pretty good! It was $6.95 in the end and I think because of the huge bottle you get it's worth it!
author: Renita T.

description: Very tasty milk tea. The most attractive part is their bottles, which can be used for air plants. We tried Thai, Fruit, Mocha and they all tasty.
author: Daming L.

description: Very popular spot! Cute atmosphere with nice  and quick customer service. So I ordered the lavender lemonade, which is a specialty of theirs, and it wasn't bad. It's the only carbonated drink and tastes like a lemonade soda with a hint of lavender. It was a little sweet for my taste so I would encourage those who don't like things too sweet to ask for it less sweet. The glass bottle is cute and great to reuse at home. If it weren't for the glass bottles, it would be extremely overpriced. Overall good experience and would come back again if I was in the area!
author: Gina B.

description: My girlfriend and I are always here. Great place. Space. Ambience. Except the mainstream radio music they play.
author: Joey K.

description:
Good taste and variety, workers friendly, shop is clean and has hang out space.  
The glass bottle discount is nice because the only thing holding them back compared to the plenty of other shops is the high price.
author: Fanshu B.

description: Cute little boba place located at the edge of Chinatown. Their drinks come with a glass bottle that's included in the price (most places charge if you want it in a glass bottle)! And since we were traveling it was actually quite useful that the bottle had a lid so we could slip the drink into our backpacks while walking. They didn't have much variety in the drinks but they had the basics and that was good enough. The only thing that was lame was that they didn't have a restroom (probably to deter people from hanging around too long) so we just got our drinks and left quickly in search for one lol
author: Jennifer W.

description: First time ever, just cuz I was in the neighborhood. I got the milk with brown sugar, Boba and pudding, so yummy! Finally, a drink that is comparable to my D3 at Purple Kow. I wanna say this one at plentea taste fresher and not as thick. So happy I found this place!
author: Ravenous T.

description: My FAVORITE tea place in the city and that's saying a lot! I'm a boba addict and this is my go to spot. My favorite drinks are the black tea with sea salt and the red bean and matcha slushi. The red bean milk drink is also really good for late nights when you don't want caffeine. I wouldn't recommend the lavendar lemonade, it was kind of like a weird soda drink.
author: Margaret L.

description:
It is lovely to see a genius marketing strategy that is also good for the environment. 
Serious tea. The whole package is there. 
Expensive yes. Expected being so since where they are yes.
author: Bruno S.

description:
Calling all Instagram photogs and Bay Area hype seekers - you've found your spot! 

Plentea has been long known for their cute glass bottles that you can take home with you, and they definitely make for a good photo, but the tea is just alright. Nothing too special for the $3-4+ you're paying! Everything tastes relatively fresh but is definitely on the sweeter side, and if you're willing to brave the huge lines that sometimes form, I would definitely recommend you get something with less sugar, because it'll be sweet regardless. 

Cute place to visit to check off your list, but there's definitely better places out there!
author: Sophie H.

description: LOVE this boba place! I can't wait for the new location to open up in Berkeley!
author: Christine C.

description:
Plentea is quite uniquely known for giving their drinks in a glass bottle. Not gonna lie, that was probably the reason why I was attracted to this place after seeing pictures and reviews on yelp while visiting the bay area.  Located in the busy downtown of union square, you'd think that people wouldn't want to carry around a heavy glass of boba, but boy was I wrong! Even at 3pm, the lines were long, and I had to wait around 15 minutes before ordering.

They seem to sell not only bobas, but just regular tea (Plentea...hehe.) and some other yummy bites like waffles. I just went for the greentea milk tea with tapioca. 

-Greentea Milktea: I expected some kind of green colored drink in a bottle, but what I got was a coffee colored drink. Confused as heck, I took a sip to find out it truly was a green tea milk tea. I guess I was so used to the powder matcha flavored that I didn't expect the tea to taste actually, like greentea (which I appreciated)

For that I would give it a 4 star. Truthfully if it tasted like the regular artificial matcha greentea, I probably would have given it 3 star. But for sticking true to the flavors of the tea, I can appreciate it. :) Only downside is that it's quite pricey. $5+ for boba? 

You can bring back your bottle and get 10% off next time. Again, didn't think people would actually bring back used bottles since it's located in such busy financial district area, but I saw a lot of business employees in line during their break to grab some delicious boba. Good for you plentea!

TL;DR: Boba in glass bottle, kinda cool concept, expect lines, actual tea flavors, pricey 5+, cool if you're a tourist.
author: Tina Y.

description:
You'll pay "Plentea" of money here for a poor quality drink.

The line was out the door on a Sunday afternoon, but the wait wasn't long. Since all the milk teas were pre-made, drinks were ready by the time you finished paying at the register. You could even see the storage containers holding all the pre-made milk teas behind the counter and the staff simply pouring them into the glass bottles.

The black iced milk tea tasted exactly what you'd expect from pre-made milk tea. The tea flavor was barely noticeable, and the drink tasted overall watered-down. I'll give Plentea credit for not serving diabetes in a bottle though like other shops.

The glass bottles are branded with the store name, and they're an interesting novelty in the plastic cup-domnated bubble drink scene. They're far from making up for the hefty price tag of drinks here though. The 10% discount for bringing your bottle back is hardly worth it either, as you'll still pay at least $5.00 for your drink. I'll be using my bottle to hold all my drawing pencils.

I'm happy to have finally tried a boba shop everyone's been talking about, but I won't be going back. You're better off going to Quickly's getting the same pre-made milk tea for half the price.
author: Tanya A.

description: This is my favorite place to get boba in SF. The boba is great and the inside is very clean and cute. Would recommend!
author: Kelly P.

description:
I will never come back.  

They stopped using bottles.

First, if you bring back bottles, you get absolutely no discount or reimbursement. No matter how many bottles you bring back. 

The worst part: If you bring back bottles, they'll try to put your NEW tea right into that OLD bottle! Without even asking you, they'll put your new tea in the bottle. Not only is that gross, it's completely unsanitary.
author: Christine B.

description:
Wanted to see what all the hype was about so I went here on a Sunday afternoon and there wasn't a line! I tried the Thai tea with boba and my sister had the oolong one with the honey boba. It was about $5 each and the fruity drinks were even more expensive. 

There is seating upstairs and downstairs. We quickly got our drinks. The thai tea wasn't too bad and the oolong tasted good too.It's kind of pricey for boba but I liked the concept of bringing back the bottle and getting 20% off the next purchase. Definitely a different approach to selling boba. Will come back some other time to try something else!
author: Jeanette Q.

description: My partner ordered their black milk tea with boba and I had the lavender lemonade. The tea was fine, nothing too memorable but good, but the boba was a great level of softness and sweetness.  The lavender lemonade was delicious. I wish they had more seating, but the store itself is cute. The service can be a bit off if there's a line, and the prices are expensive but the bottles are cute to keep!
author: Nana S.

description:
Cool place. Nice bottles, and very awesome drinks. 

Aside from the bottles, this place has some legit drinks made with real fruits. They grind it up before they serve it up. 

I really like boba milk tea and this place is definitely a top pick for me when I'm in the city.

Though you do kind of pay a higher price than other places though, maybe it is the bottle? But for the fresh fruits I think it is very worth it. 

The staff is friendly and the place is pretty clean. 

Make sure to try the sea salt and caramel. I know it sounds weird, but it is pretty freaking good.
author: Mark L.

description:
I've heard about this place through friends so when I stumbled upon it, I had to try it out! 

I got Taro Milk Tea w/ taro pudding, & i absolutely enjoyed it! The quality was great and tasted like actual milk tea, not the cheap-watered down kind. I could even taste the taro bits, which surprised me b/c you usually don't get the actual taro in those drinks. The taro pudding was a delicious add-on as well. In regards to the price, it didn't really bother me b/c I don't get boba often

Overall, great first experience w/ their taro milk tea & would def come back if I'm around that area/craving boba
author: Trina N.

description:
Honestly, I went for the glass bottle. Including the bottle and milk tea, the total came out to be around ~$6. I got my usual, jasmine milk tea with pearls but I thought it was pretty mediocre. The milk tea was super watered down and the pearls seemed slightly uncooked. My friend's drink had pudding in it and that tasted pretty good. All in all, don't get the pearls and get the pudding!! 

The location is also pretty "meh." It was impossible to find parking nearby so we had to drive down a few blocks down and walk. 

Still, this place is good for pictures, if you're into that. I believe they offer discounts if you bring back the bottles.
author: Katie L.

description:
I like the tea here, better than Share. It just tastes great every time I get it. Maybe it's in the glass bottles =)

The girl at the front (Filipino?) had great customer service skills, instructing her co-workers to shout out the numbers louder (cmon chica, you can't be whispering those numbers out, it's loud in there) and letting me have a bag for my food when I literally didn't have a dime on me to pay for it. I love her. She's way better than the kids at ALLLL those other places. Yeah I'l make the trip out here from outer richmond for that. =) 

Sea salt crema Oolong tea, strawberry black tea, mango green tea = all winners. 
I didn't try, but the waffle pastrami sandwich and banana nutella dessert I ordered to-go for my friend looked amazing.
author: Christine Y.

description: I have a weird obsession with specialty bottles and jars so like the fact that all their cold drinks come in cute milk jars is enough for me. The tea is good...pretty much the same as most boba shops but less sweet and artificial tasting which I like. I used to own a boba shop so I'm picky and I was relieved they didn't have those fake fruit blends that everyone loves. $5 is pricey but you get to keep the bottles so the extra $1.50 is worth it for me. I loved the sea salt crema oolong.
author: Rosie I.

description:
I feel like a milk tea place automatically gets 3 stars if I can customize the sugar level & if there's an option for soymilk or other alternatives to dairy. Plentea gets an extra star on top of that just for the glass jar. Although it's technically not "free" it's just a good addition to their branding/marketing strategies. 

I got oolong tea with soymilk and the taste of soymilk was too strong that I couldn't really taste the tea but I can't blame anyone for that I guess. Their boba was decently chewy and sweet too!
author: Becky M.

description: Small joint. I dig it. Simple selection. Simple service. I would give an extra star if it had a bigger selection, if they blended there tea just a little more, I still tasted the ice bits in my drink. I would come back, I would recommend this to my friends and they give your milk tea in a glad milk jug, how cute!
author: Jonathan L.

description: It was super crowded and the line was out the door, but that's because it's worth the wait! I love the glass bottle idea. Flavor was great and the boba was perfect!
author: Emily A.

description:
I came here with my SO earlier during the year, and we were surprised by how cute the shop looked.

The upstairs was closed, however, due to renovations; but that's alright, as we were only there for the boba.

All their drinks come in glass bottles (or if they're out, they'll give you a plastic cup), which are really cute and reusable!
If you come back with your bottle, you can get 10% off your order. Also, if you're coming in for the first time, you can check in for a 25% discount!

I'd have to take a star off, as it's pretty pricey (~$10 for two drinks). 
My SO got the Oolong Milk Tea and I got the Thai Iced Tea. Both were very good, but his was less sweet, which was something I preferred.
Be prepared for long wait times during lunch time!
author: Kimberly P.

description:
I've visited Plentea twice.  Their space feels clean and they have seating both downstairs and upstairs.  Their main attraction is the cute glass bottles that they serve their boba in.  Aside from tea, they serve a couple of sandwiches and desserts.  

I've tried their Oolong Milk Tea with Boba as well as their dessert waffles.  The boba is pretty standard.  It's Ok.  Their dessert waffles are pretty good, but what dessert isn't when there's whipped cream and nutella involved?  

There can be a long line and if there is be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes.  They have a minimum of $10 to use card and will give you 10% off if you remember to lug your old glass bottle back the store for more boba.
author: Christine D.

description:
-1 for a little bit pricey 
-1 for having limited bottles 

well came here the 2nd time now and a little bit early cos if you come here late youll run out of bottles.the first time we came here we were just 5people/5bottles short then when it was our turn to order they suddely ran out haha just our luck.
but as for the tea..i order the crema oolong tea with boba,it tastes good but the crema is nothing as sharedtea.just sayin'
my sisters ordered thai tea and black strawberry tea which was yummy.
well 3bobas in a bottle is 18bux well i guess were paying extra for the bottle.oh wells.
& for having limited bottles..well if youll start something so trendy and the place is well known for this ... then it will suddenly ran out by the end of the day or something..it kind a upsets a customer but it got me come back again for the bottle haha good trick for customers to comeback haha
place was pretty cozy esp upstairs ;) nice hangout place.
author: Enah N.

description:
Decided to try this place out after hearing lots of good things. I tried the the sea salt cream oolong tea and my girlfriend tried the mango green tea. The drinks tasted pretty good overall. My drink was a little too salty/creamy and not enough sweet/tea. The mango green tea was good and came with little mango chunks which was a pleasant surprise. Unfortunately, I do not believe these drinks lived up to the almost $6.00 that we had to pay for each! 2 drinks with pearls came out over $11! I guess the high costs are due to the glass bottles that they come in that you can take home (which is pretty cool I must admit). 

The real reason I am rating this so low is actually about the bottles. After finishing our drinks, I decided to rinse the bottles in a bathroom sink. While rinsing, the bottle slipped out of my hand, falling about 1/2 a foot into the bottom of the sink. This very small drop completely shattered the bottle into 15 pieces, cutting up my hands. If you are going to use glass bottles like these that you suggest to re-use, make sure the glass isn't such crappy quality! Warning to everyone planning on re-using these bottles, be very careful with them!
author: Thomas B.

description:
Drinks were ok. Not bad. On 2 different occasions, I had Mango tea and the Salted-Caramel Oolong tea. I enjoyed my Waffle Pastrami sandwich more, but for $8.95 for the sandwich- not a value.
-On my first trip there, during lunch rush in the middle of the week, the cashier was a nice, straightforward guy doing his job well.
-On my second trip, WITH my wife and daughter on 2/28/2015 Saturday 2pm, the cashier was a bit ditzy, hard-to-understand, and she was wearing a black bucket hat that had the middle-finger on it. Why wear that?  This is not a pool-hall or a tattoo parlor.

What is the image that the owner/management trying to portray? There are tons of other places to eat on that street. It's because of that cashier on the second trip, that I will not visit this place.
author: Al O.

description: Went for the glass bottle to be honest. Other than that it's clean enough but the tea and smoothies didn't blow me away.
author: Nadine C.

description: I love the fresh fruit teas, especially the black peach tea, it's a little pricier than your average boba tea shop, but they are also giving you a glass bottle for your drink so I can kinda see it averaging out. You get 10% off for returning your glass which doesn't really seem worth it to me, but I like using the bottles to take with me on my way to work (fits in my cup holder) so it's a nice added bonus.
author: Alison T.

description:
My first visit was on a Wednesday night around 9:30PM and the the wait in line wasn't so bad since there were only 3 or 4 people ahead of me. Not only did they run put of boba, but it took 20 minutes to actually get my drink!! I ordered the Lavender Lemonade with aloe which was very delicious but it wasn't worth a 20 minutes wait. 

On my second visit was on Thursday at around 5:30PM and my wait in line was about 5 minutes which isn't bad. This time it only took about 10 minutes to get my drink. I ordered the Lavender Lemonade again but this time with aloe and boba. They forgot to put boba in my drink so I had to ask them to fix my drink. They were more than accommodating and apologized for messing up my order. 

The boba is delicious and it's pretty cool that they give you the drinks in a glass bottle which you get to keep. If you bring back the bottle, you get 10% off on your next drink. Certainly not the best place to get your boba fix, but not the worst either.
author: Lisa H.

description:
The jars are so adorable! 

I tried the brown sugar milk tea with taro pudding and it was delicious! It might be a little sweet for a lot of people so get it 50% or 75% sweet! I just loove when it's super sweet so that's why I didn't decrease it. Man that brown sugar taste though. And the taro pudding YUM. It was just perfect. 

Bring the jar back and get 10% off next time! I think the drinks are pretty pricey here though so I probably wouldn't frequent this place....yes even with the 10% off it is still pricey.

The place is pretty cute with the little upstairs area and it just seems kinda hipster. I like it!

Note: Cash only unless your order is above $10!
author: Kelly T.

description: Got to try their Taro for free using a deal on Postmates. I loved the flavor; the texture and taste of their tapioca pearls was perfect. The glass bottles are great! Will def stop by when in the area.
author: K R.

description:
I really like the bottles-- I might buy them just for the bottles, they're cute and nice to have at home.  If I remember, I'll bring it back for a discount :)

Their milk teas are way too sweet-- they didn't offer any sweetness options, so i didn't ask.  Maybe if I did, they might be able to control the sugar levels?  It was completely caramel saturated, so it was kind of difficult to enjoy.

I'll still try it again though-- I think the milk tea itself was pretty tasty, if it wasn't for the sugar problem.
author: Alice S.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile. We were in the area and decided to stop by and see what it was all about. After hearing there's sometimes a long line I was a bit worried. Luckily there were only 4 people ahead of us. That changed quickly, there was a line out the door.

We ordered a honey lemon oolong w/honey tapioca ($5.00) and a iced milk w/pudding ($4.95). The honey lemon was nice and freshing. It was a little to sweet for my taste and could use a little more lemon. The tapioca was decent in taste and chewiness. The iced milk w/pudding was EXTREMELY sweet. If there was the option to control the sweetness it would probably be better.

***There was a notice that said there are only 300 bottles available daily until July. If you get your drink in a cup you will get 20% off.

The store front has the organic/green feel to it. The interior has a modern touch. The staff is friendly and helpful when ordering their popular drinks. 

Overall my experience was good and I like the glass bottle touch. My only tip is of our two drinks they were both on the sweet side. Cheers to boba drinking!
author: Kristina S.

description:
I like the glass bottles, but wish they had a non-glass bottle option that was cheaper haha. The tea itself is pretty good, and I like that you can adjust the sugar levels down to 25% sweetness. I've tried the regular milk tea, oolong milk tea, and the coffmilktea, and my favorite is probably the coffmilktea - tastes like a hybrid between Starbucks' bottled coffee frap drinks and milk tea. 

The area upstairs is nice to chill in!
author: Abby S.

description:
I was surprised this place has bad reviews because I love their oolong sea cremas. Sooo tasty and one of the better tasting teas I've had besides Gong Cha. I think the fresh milk is really good too. My def go-to place in the city. 

However, it's definitely pricier than average because they come with these cute milk jars that I like to use as vases for my flowers. The past few times I went, they ran out of the jars and the plastic cups they substitute is so tiny and I finish it in less than 10 mins ;( The line can get really long and the place is small and there's no bathroom which sucks.
author: Shana N.

description:
First time here.  Not so friendly service especially the asian guy that works here.
I just simply asked for a ladies room and he snapped at me and told me "No".
Not necesarry to be rude to paying
Customers!
Drinks are good!
author: Coco C.

description: I have always liked boba tea, but the varieties at Plentea are ridiculously delicious.  Really like the glass bottles they come in.  If I didn't know better, I would have thought they were milk bottles you find from a shepherd boy milking goats in the fields of Norway or something.
author: Max G.

description: The atmosphere is adorable. The smoothies taste fresh and their tapioca is perfect (the glass jar is a plus). A man (I believe who was the manager) was so sweet and funny. The music had my friends and I excited and happy to be there. Overall great experience!!
author: Katrina F.

description: I love their avocado milk and the FU(feeling) it's full of young generation people with fresh minds and fresh drink. The only thing I didn't give it a 5 stars was because their bottle was run out!!!!!!!! I came for the drink as well as the bottle as I'm visiting so I want to keep it as a memory. However, we got a reasonable 10% discount.
author: Kar Chuan T.

description:
Located in downtown San Francisco, Plentea is probably one of the more hyped up boba places in the city. With their unique flavors like sea salted caramel oolong crema and cute glass bottles it's kind of hard to resist checking this place out. Since I'm such a huge boba addict, I knew I had to stop by before all the metered parking became tow away spots at 4pm. 

The space is clean, hip, but small. Be warned that lines can go out the door because of all the popularity! There are a couple tables and chairs on their main floor and a couple more upstairs, so if you're lucky enough you might be able to snag a table. Service was good, especially considering how slammed they are most of the time.

The drink itself was honestly just alright. Nothing special, the tea was mediocre and the boba was just a tad bit undercooked so it wasn't chewy and had more of a bite to it. So considering the quality and the price, I'm going to say most of my money spent went towards the glass bottle.

I honestly believe that this place is only popular because of its central location and the fact that the glass bottles you can get are so instagramable. All in all, I might stop by again if all the heavens aligned and I found parking and the line wasn't ridiculous. But probably not. 

Tip(s): Parking is difficult. It's mostly metered but make sure you read the signs about parking times because they WILL tow your car if you're not careful. But there is a parking garage right around the corner if you're into that kind of stuff. The line can get long, so if you have some where to be make sure that you plan out enough time. Also if you bring the glass bottle the next time you come around you can get a 10% discount!
author: Elaine T.

description:
While on the pricey side, the drinks I have bought are definitely fresh and really yummy. I love the fresh fruit milk drinks (I've had mango and honeydew)- you taste the fresh flavor and it's really delicious.
As others have said, the line after 2:30 during the week is always long - so make sure you have some time!
Enjoy :)
author: Magda M.

description:
I don't get it. Is it the glass bottle that keeps people coming back? I mean the bottle is great and all and I can keep it as a drinking glass or flower vase. BUT, I think the milk tea itself is pretty mediocre (Yes, like the T.I. song). I was so excited when I went for the first time and I thought it was going to be all rainbows and butterflies. It was just normal milk tea with normal boba balls and normal tastes.

Oh yeah, be careful of the pricing. I bought two for $11 something and I was like O.O what?! how is it that expensive. Definitely on the pricier side. 

I would recommend trying it once for sh*ts and giggles and some cool glass bottles to keep. That is what the hype is about right. I wouldn't go a second time unless there was no more milk tea left in the world. Or if there was only Quicky's.
author: Sally H.

description: Eh no thanks. Black tea tasted like powdered hot chocolate. 3 stars for fast service.
author: mackenzie e.

description:
This place has a cool concept, buy boba in their glass jars, bring it back to reuse and you get a discount. I likey! Too bad they were out of glass jars but they're supposed to have a full stock of them in July. 

Got two creama oolong teas with boba and one iced milk tea. I liked the layers of cream on top, tea in the middle and boba in the bottom. It was pretty sweet so if you have a sweet tooth, this one is for ya. The milk tea was ok, nothing too special, but their honey boba was warm and chewy, which was a plus. 

There's seating upstairs, which was neat. Luckily, we came during their down time so there wasn't a line out the door. 

Prices were average, $5-7? Not bad for this area. Enjoy!
author: Sharon K.

description:
These guys have truly nailed their target demographic.

Because while boba is admittedly delicious in most circumstances, once you add in a chalkboard menu, a beautiful interior, some cohesive branding, and above all, a glass milk jar that guests can bring back again and again (or take home and use as a vase), you'll immediately convert first time customers into loyal customers for life. Or at least for as long as the bubble tea boom lasts. 

My 50% sweet taro tea was delicious. Admittedly, it was even more delicious out of an adorable glass jar.
author: Laura N.

description:
If you're coming for a cute drink in a cute cafe, totally worth it. The bottles are adorable and reusable (I use one as a vase sometimes).

If you're coming just for some boba, it's pretty good but not worth the over $5 pricetag. Yes, you do get a discount if you return the bottle, but it's still pretty expensive for just a drink. 

True, FiDi doesn't have a lot of options, so I still will come in every once and a while and I do really like their Matcha Latte, but the lines are usually too long for me to get one on my lunch break anyway.

Essentially, a little better quality than other boba shops in Chinatown but pretty expensive for what you get unless you admit you're only doing it for the cute jar.
author: Christina R.

description:
Boba is a way of life.  Plenty of places to get boba and Plentea is certainly one of them.  Most of the boba establishments are often similar but when I first saw that glass bottle, I told myself "I MUST HAVE!"  Thus I gave Plentea a shot.

Food:
How I like my milk tea is definitely more on the tea flavor side and so I got their Black Milk Tea with no boba.  The milk tea definitely got the tea part of the mix and it was not too sweet as other places.  The taste can be comparable to places such as Tea Station and Sharetea and Plentea got my approval.

Service:
The service is pretty straightforward.  Order drink, pick size, and add any toppings.  I am completely indifferent with service as the drinks should speak for themselves.

Experience:
My experience at Plentea is pretty similar to other grab-and-go style boba places, but you cannot beat the fact that you get to KEEP a glass bottle that comes with your drink.

Judgment:
Plentea is definitely a place to drop in and grab yourself a drink if it is on the way.  It is on the pricier side for their drinks but you do get a discount for bringing that bottle back for your future drinks!
author: Patrick L.

description:
The drinks are okay. They're higher quality drinks, but not anything special. Please, Plentea.. I'm begging you.. no more jars.. please no more!! My house is overfilled with them!! Does anyone actually bring them back for the discount? Or are they such a novelty that people keep buying more jars and keep flooding the house with them? No more....

At first I was very excited to bring home my very first jar. It's a cute jar, I gotta admit. I wasn't a big fan of the logo on it, but hey. It's clear. It's unobtrusive. I've only been here once. Got two jars. One of the jars cracked, oh well. Now I have a bunch of jars in my house cuz my roommates seem to LOVE your shop and LOVE your jars. Omg.. noo more. I have no room for them in my life anymore.

Sorry Plentea, it was cute at first. Now I'm forever scarred by how many jars are in my house that I'm not coming back there.

In fact, I changed my rating from 2 stars to 1 star because of how many freakin jars are in my house. 

The drinks are okay btw. But please people.. PSA: Bring back your jars!!!!!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
When a place needs to ask you how sweet you want your milk tea, it's usually a sign that it's super duper sweet. That was my experience coming here and ordering a basic milk tea at 100% sweetness. The milk tea tasted super concentrated instead of super sugary sweet and I ended up with a headache for the rest of the afternoon. Next time, I think I'll go with 50%. At least it tasted like it was made from real tea leaves and not that Quicky-esque made from powder stuff. 

I've had a fruity concoction before which was probably ordered at 100% sweetness and its flavor intensity was definitely derived from sugar and not concentrated tea. 

$10 minimum card charge, 10% off your drink if you bring back a bottle (1 bottle per drink ordered). There will always be a moderate to long wait no matter what time you go.
author: Virginia T.

description:
eh i feel like every since people found out about them and they have gotten super busy, their service hasn't been the best. also the lines are still extremely long sometimes so they haven't sped things up. Also as I called out, the bottles did not last long. it's only like 300 bottles a day now but you do get a 20% off discount if you get a plastic cup 

I think my main reason in the drop is because I like to get the matcha slush with taro pudding and really do not want that much sugar. The only reason I do is because they said its bitter without it so I always ask for less than 25%. I was there the otehr day and they don't pay attention to the tickets.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Cute ambiance and fast service
Slightly overpriced but I love the glass bottle and presentation
The loft upstairs has comfy chairs and outlets if you want to charge your phone/laptop.
author: Tamlyn L.

description:
+Ordered an oolong milk tea w/ taro pudding. The oolong isn't sugary sweet, it tasted mainly tea. 
+Taro pudding wasn't too sweet either so it didn't throw off the taste of my milk rea. 
+Service was really quick. At first I didn't believe my drink was sitting on the table the whole time. 
+Has an upstair sitting area great for group hangouts. Not too tiny but enough to get around. Just watch your step because the stairs are small. 
+The price range for the tea quality and packaging (glass bottle) is reasonable. It's usually around $2-4 if there's a lot of syrup or a lack of tea involved. Plentea had quality and fresh-made oolong tea that you can actually tasted the smooth smokey fragrant of an oolong instead of the sugar sweetness alone. It's usually a bargain to have more tea contents than milk/water/syrups at $2-4. So $5-6 is a reasonable price range according to what I had from my oolong milk tea. 

-The tea tasted great, bad thing is the caffeine made me feel anxious and shakey after drinking it halfway. That's weird because I though oolong usually have lower caffeine contents than black tea. Maybe the staffs added it in a bit too much.

Next time I'll ask them to take it easy on the tea for me! Overall I'm looking forward to visit Plentea more often. 

*ahem, cute guy staffs are here too but they're not effected by my Yelp critism. Just saying for you ladies out there, haha*
author: Jackie T.

description: Like others have said, the good thing about this place is you get a glass bottle. The other things vary. I got the matcha latte which was ok, just ok. It tasted more like milk then matcha so maybe they put too much milk? It would have been much better if I tasted the matcha. The boba was not good at all because it was not chewy but very hard. I would come back to give them another try because there stuff might be better if it was not that busy.
author: Mike G.

description: Great innovative Boba shop in SF. Excited for them to open one up in Berkeley!
author: Noah B.

description: If you're looking for some decent ass boba around the fidi this is your place.  Get the oolong crema if you know whats good for you.  DON'T do weird fruit tea mixes and add taro jello like I did because that was gross.  Overall, its pricey, even if you do bring your jar back, but its also kinda the only option and their location is great so you cant avoid it.
author: Vince L.

description: The shop is very popular. Lots of people are waiting there. The offer all kinds of milk tea with glass bottles, which is really special. (P.S. The bottle can not hold hot water, or it will explode.) I ordered milk tea(oolong) with grass jelly inside. OMG! It tastes so good. It is just the same taste as Taiwan. Really deserves a try.
author: Nancy S.

description: There's a lot of options that can cater to anyone. You can keep the one of a kind bottle. Definitely my favorite boba place!
author: Jordan Rey C.

description:
Really clean spot for a Chinese bubble tea place, decent milk teas and good boba, but too much ice and tastes watered down.

On the pricey side for bubble tea. Yelp says it has free wifi but I called and they said they don't :/
author: Liana K.

description: I like their lavender lemonade, but I don't think they stand out among other boba/tea places, and I wouldn't go out of my way to get boba from them. They are also kind of pricey, even when you factor in the premium they put on their glass bottles.
author: Tina X.

description: This place is delicious! I walked here on my lunch, at about 12:30 and it wasn't packed at all. Ordered an oolong milk tea and by the time I was handed my receipt, my drink was ready! Highly recommend.
author: Amanda B.

description:
As a person who enjoys collecting cups and mugs, I can say that these Plentea jars are wasting my precious cup space. Drinks are mediocre, and what brought me to this place were the cups to begin with. $4.95 for tapioca? Noooo thanks. Even with 10% off, that just sounds absurd. Also -- the trouble of having to carry these heavy glass jars with you is such a hassle considering the fact that I have to lug these with me on public transportation to get all the way there.

I made a trip there recently and upon ordering and giving the cashier my jars, she then tells me that the jars I have are a older version and the tops will not fit my jars. She still gave me a discount and gave me two new glass jars... and now I'm left with 4 useless jars. Not to mention my two drinks came out to be over $10 even after 10%...

Cool concept, but comeon. It's 2015. Stop wasting glass and just stick with plastic. (Maybe come up with a option of bring back your bottle for $1 back?)
I'd honestly rather have a $4 drink in a plastic bottle.
author: Jenny Y.

description: Best if they update the correct pricing on the menu, service charge. Not consistent waffle sandwich, it's soggy...
author: John C.

description: Meh!! Cute concept but pricey. Love the glass bottles the drinks come in. Very sturdy glass that I'm actually keeping as a vase. The drink was nothing special. The price was a bit high.
author: Wanlan X.

description:
Like our lunar guardian, everything that we love to do, eat, collect, and wear comes and goes in phases. Tie-dye shirts, stamps, roller-blading and aviator shades gave way to beanie babies, Old Navy anoraks, yoyos, and Game Boys. Some of these once-popular trends are gone for good, but others are raring to make a comeback at any moment. Right now though, our focus is on skinny jeans, succulents, and sipping from glass containers - and Plentea is thriving on that thirst.
 
The attractively branded glass bottles that are yours to keep is an incentive that breaks stalemates between Plentea and any comparable milk tea merchant. Nevermind the inadequately flavored drinks or the tapioca balls that have as much flavor as gum that has been chewed for three hours. Forget the fact that the above average pricing means you are essentially paying for the bottle and offering free advertisement for Plentea. Turn a blind eye to the obnoxious $10 minimum for credit card use that no lone boba buyer would reach.

Plentea offers a 10% discount towards a purchase upon a bottle's return, but who in their right mind would give up a sea salt holder, candle container, or makeshift vase? 

Anyways, despite Plentea's various shortcomings, GLASS BOTTLES!!
author: Andrew M.

description: This place is so cool, it's borderline hipster. Love the tea though. A lot of outdated furniture.
author: Von T.

description: The glass bottle is the nice point. The milk tea is ok.
author: Qianren Z.

description:
First off, the value here isn't that great; a fruit milk tea was 6.25. Even if you bring back the jars they give you, it's still well over $5 for a pretty small tea. Even something like making the drinks larger would help if drinks can't be made cheaper.

The sea salt crema in oolong has too much crema for me. It's too rich and I can't taste the tea at all. It's more like a milk shake than a milk tea. It's not bad if you like your drinks like that though.

I also tried the strawberry fruit milk. I would like it better if they incorporated more real fruit into it like Tea Era in Mountain View for instance, the gold standard for strawberry milk tea.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Finally made it to Plentea and I think Yelp got it right, a four-star venue!  I'm a fan, and I'll go again with my reusable glass bottle...gotta get that discount!

Saturday afternoon and the line was out the door...a couple doors down once a brilliant person in line decided to snake the line against the buildings (as opposed to blocking the sidewalk). After a lil over 30 minute wait, I was happy to finally order. 

And because it was my first visit, I opted to get a black iced milk tea with boba and pudding. I always say you meed to order the original boba first to get a sense of the baseline. I enjoyed it. The boba texture was good - chewy but not too chewy and sweet but not as flavorful as others. The milk tea was better - sweet, strong and ice cold. I added the (mango) pudding for good measure, it had a nice consistency and was sweet enough, but didn't add to the drink.

Nice my friend and I nabbed a two top upstairs. The venue itself isn't much to speak of but a tad nicer than the smaller boba shops. Our drinks were served quickly and by nice, smiley staff. I can't wait to go back to try fruit teas and with jellies, oh, and the cremas!
author: Marie B.

description:
I happened upon this place while I was looking for something small and wanted to try out their milk tea... oh gosh, Best. Decision. Ever!

The bottles are definitely cute, but their teas are awesome. I ended up getting two that day: black milk tea with boba and a crema with pudding. Both were just brilliant!

I highly recommend checking them out if you're a fan of bubble/milk tea.
author: Nicolette B.

description: fuck these jars ! the thai tea brought back my diabetes and diarrhea. peace out my dudes. loves y'all and forever, Xoxo
author: Xavier L.

description: Best bubble tea. Get the Sea Salt Crema Oolong because it is the most popular one! I love that you can recycle the bottles for % off your next teas
author: Lauren-Michelle R.

description:
My friend Marie and I came here on a spontaneous boba craving, and it seemed like this was the only boba place that was open late at night. So we took a big ass trip from the Mission to Downtown.

It was worth it! Marie got mango green tea with boba. She appreciated the bits of mango in the drink.

I got the thai milk tea with boba. I thought it was okay, I wish I got the more popular ones like the regular milk tea with the special whatevs. But it wasn't horrible though! 

I mean, we were in the mood for boba, and this satisfied it.

The total was around ~$10. Not too shabby for a late night boba expedition.

Anyways, if you're getting a boba craving at night; Plentea is a pretty good choice.
author: Liping H.

description: I was so scared coming even on a winter weekday praying that there won't be a wait going at a later time close to closing due to the reviews saying they waited 20 minutes in line! and we got lucky! it is so cute right when I walked in because there was upper level seating and all the tables were stool tables. all the drinks being in bottles got my friend and I so excited because it's a free souvenir we paid for, unlike a plastic cup we toss daily. drinks were about 6 bucks each after topping added.  I think it's quit a deal. the menu is very simple and I like that. there is the selection of oolong, green or black tea. for the non milk tea lovers there is regular tea with fruit of choice to be added in to it to make it the fruit tea. the milk tea selection. consists of matcha milk tea, creme milk tea or the sea salt creme milk tea and choice of tea. each drink may have the amount of sweetness adjusted. to accompany the drinks, there is a simple menu of a few sandwiches and desserts on the black chalk board against the wall. I loved this place!  uniquely done well. only con, no restroom! !!!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Quite a standard milk tea location. The cute thing is their jars - you get to take them home afterwards. 

Nostalgia points: Makes me feel like I'm back in high school.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Cool over priced jar , save your money and get the darn jar at the dollar store.!
The milk tea itself was less than impressive it just was not there for me , I am more into authentic Taiwanese milk teas and this was definitely not it.! My bf tried the Nutella and its straight up just chocolate milk ..duh should of known there was nothing special about it. On to the next milk tea place!
author: T. C.

description: You know, the bottle is cute but that's about it. Are the drinks any better than anywhere else? Nope. Will you bring the bottle back next time for your discount? Probably not. After all, who carries a bottle around all day in hopes of getting Plentea? I think I'm going to use my bottle to store sugar in my cupboard instead. When you remove the bottle gimmick, Pleantea is just another average overpriced tea shop.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Well, it tastes alright, but the portions are small. I only came here for the glass bottle. 

It tastes smooth and too healthy for a boba drink. There's not enough ingredients in there. I don't understand how this place is always so crowded, I recommend going up 1-2 blocks for One Plus Teahouse. It's less crowded and they have so many indgredients for an inexpensive price.
author: Hina W.

description: Been wanting to check out this place for the longest time and since my little cousin came to visit, she also wanted to try it! As expected, the line was quite long but it went by pretty quickly. I order strawberry milk tea with lychee. I like that they crushed the ice and and the drink was delicious. Not too sweet for my liking. What's enjoyed the most was probably the cute plentea bottle! You get to keep it and if you come back with the bottle, you get a 10% discount. What a way to get the customer to come back!  I will definitely revisit... With my cute plentea bottle!
author: Ellen Z.

description: This place is super trendy and refreshing after a walk around Chinatown! It was a little pricey for me but that's San Francisco for you! I really enjoyed the idea of this place and if you bring your bottle back you get 10% off your next purchase
author: Denise M.

description:
Food review:
I was ok with standing in a line to order and I was okay with paying $8.95 for a waffle sandwich, but I was not okay with waiting 25 minutes for it to come out. I've had their teas a few times and like them so I decided to try the food menu out...I should just stick to drinks from now on, especially since there are so many food options nearby. Not sure if I will even come back for drinks since Boba Guys is closer to my work anyways. 

1 star for being open late 
1 star for the food, which was okay but nothing that I would go out of my way for.
author: Katies F.

description: menu changed when i came today... extremely disappointed. This used to be my favorite boba tea spot in Bay Area, I love their fruit milk tea, super high quality drinks!!! Now they're not available no more....
author: Elaine L.

description:
This place is kinda expensive considering the amount of tea you get. I didn't really taste any difference between this tea place and the next, though I do like their jars the drinks come in..

Save 10% when you bring your jar back? So what.. save like 50 cents next time?

I rather just order a drink and get another jar.
author: Christine N.

description:
This place wasnt my favorite. They ran out of the glass jars, which I didnt even care for in the first place. Only good thing, they gave us a discount because they didnt have thr jars. 

I just had a regular black milk tea with boba. It was just ok. Had better elsewhere. Im just not impressed at all.
author: Vanessa W.

description: I wish there was a plentea closer to San jose! I went on a Saturday night around 7pm and the place was empty aside from the one girl in front of us. It's clean, has a cool environment, and has an upstairs area to hangout which is really great. The hype for these glass bottle (which you get to keep) drinks is real. Sort of. Well I guess it depends on what you get. The smoothie drinks are good and my friends like the brown sugar ice milk. Personally my favorite would be the sea salt crema drinks. If you're a fan of gong cha, you will like it here. The cream on top is super thick unlike other places! The strawberry fruit tea with strawberry bits was not good, despite what many reviews have said...we didn't bother drinking anymore after we tried it. And my friend is usually obsessed with anything and everything strawberry! We also got the honeydew oolong tea with grass jelly. It was so sweet that it tasted syrupy. The honey lemon black tea with boba was so strong. It was good but I think next time I would ask for it with green tea instead so it can have a lighter taste, but I would probably give it another try. I'm looking forward to coming back for my sea salt crema!
author: Maleah M.

description:
Okay, I'll admit, I'm a sucker for a cute bottle-- and don't even get me started on boba. So when I was strolling down the streets of the FiDi, I did a double take when I saw a group of strangers pass by sipping bubble tea in those adorable glass containers. Luckily they were kind enough to point me to Plentea, otherwise I would never have found my go-to FiDi spot for my (constant) boba cravings. 

The taste is pretty consistent-- not too sweet nor watery, and they use fresh fruit instead of the artificial-tasting powder that most other boba joints use. My favorites are the mango black milk tea, the mango ice milk, the mango smoothie... okay, pretty much anything and everything with mangoes. 

There's always a long line out the door, but don't worry as the service is pretty quick. Sadly, it's pretty pricey for boba (around $5)  and there's a $10 minimum card charge, hence the 4 star rating. Still, you get a 10% discount if you bring back your bottle which is kinda nice.

Long story short, I'd recommend stopping by if you're in the area. As for me, I see plen(tea) of Plentea in my future. :)
author: Arianna N.

description:
I wanted to love this place but I don't. The stuff they serve you is pretty basic... in a glass bottle. I went twice and got the plastic cup the second time... which spilled the top portion of my drink when I poked in the straw.

It took 15-20 minutes for our drinks to come out both times.  There's a wait/line because they work super slow and the store is not huge. 

The drinks are really mediocre. I got a peach yogurt drink the first time and an ice milk drink the second time. The brown sugar ice milk drink was better than the yogurt, but even then, it was just okay. Their boba is okay, not too sweet and a little bland. I just left underwhelmed. I think it's because I waited too long both to order and for my drink.
author: Ariana V.

description: Came here for a quick drink after dinner in Chinatown.  I ordered the honeydew green tea without any bobba.  It ended up being about $5.00 bucks.  I enjoyed it and the atmosphere was inviting, but it was nothing special either.  My friend didn't finish hers.  They gimmick is that you get to keep the jar and you get a discount on your next drink if you return the glass.  I'm from out of town and neither of us were coming back so we just returned our glasses when we were done.
author: Ben S.

description: Great tea!! Love ice milk boba with brown sugar!! Felt like I'm back to my home town.
author: 心怡

description: As an avid boba enthusiast I've been coming here on and off for years. I love the glass bottles, it really creates a unique experience. My favorite is the fresh fruit tea. I typically get strawberry, boba, and green tea. Yum! I do agree with others, you're paying for the 'experience'. Is it the best boba in town...not quite, but it sure is refreshing as hell. It's especially great for those who don't really 'get the boba obsession'. Most bubble teas are very dairy heavy, so it's nice that they have some non-dairy refreshing options.
author: Janine J.

description: The store is super cute and small.The boba is pretty good and we get to keep the glass bottles! There are a couple downsides: the shop is small so there's limited seating and the menu is limited. It is worth trying though!
author: Eliza D.

description:
Let's start with the fact that the cashiers are always unbelievably rude. Simple questions are answered with attitude, and they rush you all the time. I know customer service can be extremely difficult at times but you shouldn't take it out on customers, especially if they didn't do anything to you. If you don't like being asked questions, they you shouldn't be working there and you should find a new job.  

Since all my coworkers raved about it, and it being so close I thought I'd give it a try. The milk tea wasn't anything special, I've had better. The peach smoothie was way better. The boba is pretty good, chewy and soft. It's also a little sweeter than other boba places but I like it. The glass bottles are pretty cool, kind of the only reason a lot of people come here. Even with the glass bottle discount, it's still a little pricey.
author: Rose B.

description:
Definitely the best fruit teas I've ever had!

So far, I have been here 3 times. I've tried the sea salt crema, strawberry oolong tea and the mango oolong tea. The fruity teas are definitely better than their milk teas. The milk teas are pretty average and you find other (cheaper) milk teas of the same quality other places. But the fruity teas are amazing. And I love the glass bottles that they give you (last time I went, they ran out and gave me a plastic cup...*tear*).
author: Regina M.

description: Great service and good tea overall. I love the included glass bottle and the tea tastes authentic and delicious :)
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
I'm not sure I understand the hype of this place just yet. This review is just for the drinks. 

Things I don't like: 
- No one knows how to order
- Lines are out the door "literally"
- Slow

Things I do like
- The bottle is eco-friendly and reusable (vs just using the "quickly style" tapioca cups
- They have tapioca, pudding and other "add-ons"
- They serve other things besides drinks (waffle sandwiches)

I got the brown sugar milk tea with tapioca and egg pudding. The tapioca was fresh but pieces were quite hard. The pudding was stuck at the bottom and I could barely get anyway until the end.
