The prices are kinda hefty (Mine was $5+) so it's definitely not cheap. Perhaps i'll like it the next time I visit but I'd rather go to a quickly-chain or just another Asian tapioca/boba place.
author: Phillip D.

description:
I pretty much live off of boba. 

Even when traveling I still make it a point to get my boba.

Im sure most people come here because of the cute glass jars that the boba is served in; well that is why i went here. 

I got the milk tea and it was okay.. drinks are okay here. They have a pretty good drink selection though and got a good strategy on their part;  to put their drinks n those jars..it lures people like me in
author: Phuong K.

description: Such good milk tea!! They give you super cute glass bottle. It's was super busy so give yourself some extra time. If you love bubble tea you have to try this!
author: Maddie K.

description: Decided to drive around the city and stumbled upon this place. Super cute decor. The staff was pretty rude. We were the only ones inline and by the time someone decided to take our order the line grew to the door. It seemed like the girl taking our Oder just didn't want to be there. My fiancé ordered a Lavender Lemonade, my sister ordered the sweet taro drink and I ordered the Thai milk tea with extra tapioca. When my fiancé tasted his, you can tell by the look on his face the drink was not good. I decided to taste it and honestly it tasted NOTHING like lemonade. It was gross. He did want to make a big deal out of it so we left. My sisters drink was ok. The Thai tea was pretty good. Overall I would not go out my way to come here again. I think staff should be more friendly and attentive.
author: Angelica G.

description: A little cramped to eat upstairs on a Friday evening. The bottles are a nice touch but the drinks overall can be a bit pricey for the quality.
author: Hungry D.

description: Place is aesthetically pleasing and so are the bottles that come with the bubble tea. As far as quality of the drinks, its mediocre. There are definitely better tasting bubble tea places i have been to. If i were to go again I would get their fruit tea or their slush's. Also you get to keep the glass as a souvenir.
author: Kevin E.

description: They move quickly! The cashier was really pleasant. And of course the bubble tea was good. I also had the sweet cream coffee which was smooth and refreshing. Not sure if the glasses are yours to keep but I was only visiting on a layover, if so that's even cooler.
author: Tiera B.

description: Fun modern little boba joint. I like that they use glass jars for their drinks. It is in the financial district so the line builds up quickly. The shop itself is pretty modern and feels like a great place to meet up with a friend or two and chill.
author: Ryan N.

description:
The only thing good about this place is the bottle. The lid isn't right for the bottle. If you tilt it, even a little, the tea will spill. So if you are getting it to go, bring a bag. 

The oolong milk tea is the most disappointing thing there. No oolong Taste. The peach tea is a little too sweet. 

It's good to hve if you're in the area I guess.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
I often spot people walking around the Chinatown/financial district area with these stylish milk-jar glass bottles filled with milk tea and boba. They are definitely eye-catchers and good marketing tools because it made me curious about where everyone was getting this fancy-looking boba drink. Now every time I carry around a glass, I get asked all the time about where it's from. They're pretty, which I give credit for, because, you know, we eat with our eyes too. The drink itself is good-- just good and above average. Their standard is not too sweet, so it's not one of those places where you have to ask for less sugar every time. I can taste the freshness in their tea, but it sometimes has a slight bitterness to it, like over-steeped tea. Their boba is consistently tasty and delectably chewy. 

Wouldn't make it my regular boba spot though. Way too pricey for adequate bubble tea :(.
author: Hannah P.

description:
After seeing such cool pictures of plentea on Instagram and other social media I decided to come down to SF to give it a try.

It was around 7:30pm on a Monday & I was really excited once I entered the shop, because guess what?! NO LINEEEEE YAYAY.  

To be honest I was more excited about the glass than the drink itself after I got my order. 

I ordered a black milk tea drink with pudding but they forgot to add my pudding inside the drink and they still charged me the extra $0.50. But I still enjoyed the place because their glass cups are so cool and cute ^.^ 

overall I would come back to this place, but I think I'd rather try another drink next time.

3/5 stars because the drink I ordered was really watered down and I couldn't really get any flavor out of it. But the service was great & I loved how cute the shop was & I loved the glass cups!
author: Pariya N.

description: They have a cool place to hang out upstairs boba are okay. I like the bottles and l think l have 10 of it at home l always forget to bring it everytime l go here.
author: James D.

description:
Pros:
- ADORABLE glass jars
- you save 10% if you bring back your jar
- save $ if you ask for a regular cup

Cons:
- milk tea was ok (I prefer my tea a little stronger and my milk a little creamier)
- boba was a bit too soft (but appropriately chewy)
- DON'T LET YOUR GLASS BOTTLE TOUCH HOT LIQUID (the bottom is weak and will fall out in the dishwasher)

Bottom line: I would totally come back to get a cute glass and to try a waffle. But I'll set my expectations lower for the tea.
author: Jiann M.

description:
Like everyone else, I was on a quest to obtain one of these glass bottles. After 3 tries, I finally got one! :) 

So far, I've only tried the Sea Salt Oolong Crema and the Lavender Lemonade.
I'm usually not a big fan of creamas, but theres something about Plentea's sea salt creama that gives it a distinct taste. Like most creamas, there are 2 ways to drink it; drink without stirring and stirring first and then drinking. I've tried both ways and for Plentea, you definitely need to stir it before you drink it. The Sea Salt Oolong Creama is very milky and creamy and it leave a slight sea salt aftertaste. As for the Lavender Lemonade, it is a hit or miss. Sometimes the lemonade makes the drink too sour, and sometimes it is a perfect balance of lavender and lemonade. 

Overall, you pretty much pay for a cute looking bottle to showoff on Instagram :P
author: Emily L.

description: Ok first of all, the drinks all come with a free glass bottle with "Plentea" on them. Pretty good since most places charge extra for that (looking at you Boba Guys with your $12 mason jars). I had the strawberry green tea and I loved it. It wasn't too sweet and I could actually taste the tea unlike other places where you can just taste strawberry syrup. The seating at the place is also pretty cool. There are big tables and couches upstairs for a more lounge atmosphere and barstools and high tables downstairs. Unfortunately, there is no public restroom, but if thats not a problem, then this place is almost perfect. Oh, also, their food was 50% off as a special promotion.
author: Bowen L.

description: Cool place. Very cute that they use glass bottle. The price is a bit expensive than other places. The taste is just so so. Not so strong. I feel like so much water in it. But worth to come try once. Also, this place always has long line, I don't think it is worth to wait.
author: Emma C.

description: My husband and I stumbled into this place randomly and their brown sugar milk with boba ended up being one of the best things we ate the whole trip. The glass jars they come in are so fancy.
author: Kayleigh S.

description: I like their drinks especially the Brown Sugar Milk drinks with egg pudding. I didn't really like the salted Creama drinks. I was disappointed that they raised their price for their drinks. I guess it make sense because they are charging for the bottles. No wonder they still have the glass bottles at 9pm. I will have to think twice for a $5.50  drink. Boba Delight  gives you the option of getting a plastic bottle or glass bottle or just the cup. Plastic bottles was a lot lighter to carry with.
author: Miri L.

description: This place is adorable and you get to keep the glass! Totally Instagram worthy!
author: Cece F.

description: Pleeeeeeeease come to New York! I'm addicted now and want Plentea every day!
author: Elle A.

description:
The glass is cute and they obviously invested a lot in the decoration and experience.  There was a short line on a Sunday afternoon but the service was quick and we didn't have to wait too long.  I really liked the atmosphere.

I got the classic milk tea with boba and my friend got the strawberry green tea.  Both were quite bland and watered down.  The boba was mushy and not chewy enough.  I thought it was a bit expensive since two drinks added up to $12.
author: Gwingie L.

description:
Loved the milk tea and boba! Cool little place with lots of flavors to choose from and sweet desserts. I tried to brown sugar milk tea with boba - SO yummy! Got a souvenir glass too. 

Another convenience is they serve dairy free milk tea, which is awesome for my lactose intolerant hubby.
author: Genna D.

description: My friends and I visited SF and stopped by here to grab some late night boba. One of them ordered the Sea Salt Oolong Milk Tea but actually tasted like the ocean. The nutella milk tea made my friend throw up, while the other drinks were mediocre at best. Only good thing about this place is the cute jars I guess. 0/10 do not recommend!!
author: Vincent L.

description:
Only been here twice but both times I was pretty satisfied. I got a fruit tea and the matcha milk tea. Both were good and rich in flavor. The boba is also pretty good. 

The place itself is cute and quaint, small with a upper deck and some seating. Would come back again if it wasn't so far from where I live. This is also by far the most expensive boba place I've been to in SF.
author: Leanna W.

description: Best boba I've ever had. Love the fruit milk teas, nutella milk tea, and sweet taro milk tea.
author: Julian S.

description: Sorry don't understand the hype it was like thick milk with honey. The bottle was cool if that's your thing.
author: Frank C.

description: Decent tea, I had better but the jar was cute and a good idea makes a good cup. I prefer other tea places for more intense tea taste tho.
author: Lulu W.

description:
2.5 stars I guess. 

I went in for the milk jar pretty much like everyone else. The glass jar is cute and nice quality but their teas...are not the best I've had. Being Taiwanese & from SoCal, I KNOW my boba and tea!

I will just say...if You weren't there for the milk jar, then I would skip this store because the drinks are pricey for the amount and quality that you get. $6.50 for a drink?? Umm no, thanks. 

Oh, one more thing. Customer service pretty much don't exist at this place, so be prepared to suck it up if you just want your jar. This girl messed up my order (adding boba when I didn't want any) & was rude about it. She didn't even apologize......and had the look on her face like it was my fault. Oh well, now that I've got my jars...I would probably skip it.
author: Bunni L.

description: I love this boba place. Yes, it's pricey but the drink and the glass bottle is well worth it. The first time I came here, I got the hot black milk tea with boba in it. Don't get hot drinks here... Mine came in a coffee container, which wasn't exactly the experience I was looking for. Nonetheless, the drink was still good. The second time I came here, I got the cold peach oolong tea with boba in it. The peach tea was AMAZING. It was perfectly sweet, had little bits of peach in it, and the texture of the boba just amplified the drink. It also came in the glass bottle and I'm definitely going to bring it back to get a discount on my next drink. Also, be sure to have cash on you because they don't take debit or credit if it's less than $10!
author: Hana K.

description: I am naturally picky about bubble tea as an Asian girl. I will consider this good milk tea. They made milk tea with real tea not powder. Beside tapioca, the egg pudding and taro pudding are good toppings to get.
author: Danning X.

description: Here is the rundown:  Plentea offers great tea at a not so great price.  The glass bottles don't make up for the cost difference.
author: David C.

description:
happened to drive past plentea post-brunch on a saturday around noon and HAD to request the bf for a boba pitstop.  no line, no wait.  

verdict?  just because boba is served in a fancy glass bottle doesn't make it any better.  the drink was decent, but it wasn't anything to rave about.  it wasn't terrible either...  i guess i'm a bit apathetic about plentea.

i got the peach black tea + boba and it was almost $6 because of the bottle.  i wasn't sure what to do with the glass bottle and thought it would've made a cute flower vase but i am now re-purposing it as my smoothie container.  you can also bring the glass bottle back to get a discount on your next drink order.  or pay an arm and a leg again for your boba to be served in a glass bottle again.    

they have a 200 bottle limit in the morning until sold out and another 200 limit at 6 pm.  random rationing program, but i was able to get one at noon on a saturday.
author: Alice C.

description: Stopped by here while we were waiting for our table at Ramen Underground. I got the iced black tea and it was good. It wasn't overly sweet and had a strong tea flavor. I am more of a coffee drinker so I do wish they had at least one coffee type beverage. Serving the cold drinks in the glass bottles is a really cute touch. You can have it in a plastic cup if you don't want to hold on to the bottle- just be sure to ask when you place your order.
author: Prianka K.

description:
Pretty good stuff here, but the bottles are kinda gimmicky and the boba is a bit overpriced compared to others of similar or superior quality. There are soymilk options which are nice, and this place is open pretty late- until 11 PM most nights, so it's a great fallback place when all the others are closed.

I come back here every now and then, and would recommend it if you're in the area and want some good boba approved by a boba lover.
author: Nancy W.

description: A few friends and I decided to try this place out since we were already in the city (we're from San Jose). The drinks were alright, the only thing I can give them credit for is the cute bottles. Otherwise, it isn't worth the drive if the bottle is the only thing that caught your attention.. You're well off going on Etsy and calling it a day.
author: Rae M.

description: BEST TEA IN THE WORLD!!! Such a fun place and a great place for tourists to go that locals actually go to too. Fave drink is the almond milk tea, but really you can't go wrong!
author: Cecily D.

description: The drinks are OK but the bottles that they come in make them unique. Drinks average at about $5. If you bring the bottles back, you get 10% off your next drink which isn't worth the hassle in my opinion. Also, it is in a very inconvenient place in town that lacks parking. I'll be back but only if I happen to be in the area.
author: Diane M.

description: Wonderful place! Ordered oolong milk tea with pudding. Delicious milk tea and free wifi. Will definitely come again.
author: Olivia G.

description:
Milk Tea was okay, it was really sweet...
Highly suggested to order drinks as less sweet.

Bottles are cute and reusable *\(^o^)/*
author: Emiko N.

description: Just stopped by here on a Monday night after my friend's bday dinner. Luckily there was no wait. We all ordered the sea salt crema oolong tea! The drinks came out pretty quickly and it was super cute that they came in glass jars, which we got to take home with us! It even includes a lid! Awesomes! We all agreed that the sea salt crema was really good! It was not too sweet and had a good amount of saltiness to it. My friend's bf also ordered a banana waffle dessert, which was pretty yummy also! It's too bad that this place is located kind of far from my work place and parking can be very difficult to find, otherwise I would come here more often!
author: Mary C.

description:
PROS: You get a nifty little bottle that has a wide enough mouth you can clean and use again. 

CONS: I ordered 4 drinks: Salted caramel crema, peach green tea, thai tea, and green tea and ALL for were HORRIBLE. Considering there was a line before the doors opened, I would expect somewhat of a good drink. But one drink was watered down and the others were too strong and came off bitter. I'd like to LOVE this place, so maybe I will find myself trying it out again.
author: RoseMichelle M.

description: The tea wasn't absolutely amazing, but it was good. I mean, when you're craving boba, the tea here will do :) The line is kind of long, which sucks. The strawberry tea I got was super sweet and had pieces of actual strawberry in it, which I really liked. I know some people might think it was too sweet though. I like the glass bottle they give you. It's cute and now I use it normally as any other cup to hold my tea.
author: Alice H.

description: I think it's the jars that makes people coming back because the drink is pretty normal. It's just regular milk tea with boba, nothing special. It's a good picture I'll tell you that but I'm not sure it's worth $5-6 for a drink. Next time I come here, I'll probably try something different and bring my bottle as well. Overall, the milk tea isn't bad.
author: Vicky L.

description: I honestly hate that Plentea is the only place in FiDi that offers boba. Their service is slow, the seating area upstairs is always gross (tables are never bussed, there's always empty drink cups everywhere), their drinks are not cheap, and the worst part is that everybody there tolerates it! Even the McDonalds around Market and 3rd, known to locals as one of the worst McDonalds establishments in the Bay Area, has better service than Plentea. I've gotten the creama here and while it was acceptable, Sharetea or Gongcha's creama is magnitudes better. If you want boba, walk to Chinatown or venture out to Richmond or Sunset, but do not come to Plentea. This place honestly has only become popular because they offer their boba in a glass and that's the hipster thing to get.
author: Austin W.

description: There's something about drinking out of these milk bottles that just make the experience all the more delicious! The place is cute, offers friendly and helpful service and the taste is great. A couple of flaws are parking isn't the greatest with this busy area and unless you plan on frequenting Plentea you're left with the bottles (which to some may not be a bad thing). They offer the basic milk teas and smoothies but they also offer extras that really stood out to me, like putting sea salt, puddings that aren't the usual flavors and grass jelly. They also have food but I didn't try any of those. I highly recommend getting any of the puddings, they're all good. A must try if you're in the area.
author: Guisela L.

description: One of the better milk tea/boba places I've tried. The ordering process is a little slow because your barista (bobista?) takes your order and makes your drink. The result is that the line tends to get a little long at busy times. The wait is worth it, however, because the teas, milks, and slushed are pretty great. They serve the teas in an old school glass milk bottle that you can return for a 10% discount or you can request it to go in a standard plastic cup. We tried the avocado with egg pudding and the Carmel ice milk with tapioca - both were good but the Carmel was dealt great.
author: Calon L.

description:
MT that comes in a glass-bottle.  Fancy!  

The drink prices are on the costly side.  As expected, since it is based in downtown.  The Oolong MT is really tasty and somewhat tasted like the tea used in traditional MT made in HK.  

Payment methods are ambigious.  I've seen people swiping their AMEX, but they refused to take my AMEX.  What gives???
author: Chi T.

description:
Okay so their roasted oolong is a good classic safe bet, but recently I realized how much of a sweet tooth I had. I ordered their iced milk honey boba w/ pudding and caramel and it was quite the diebetus drink - comparable to Purple Kow's iced milk drink w/ boba and honey boba. 

I don't think fruit teas are my thing- I've tried their mango tea w/ small chunks of mango floating around and I wasn't too impressed. Just felt super watered down. 

Anyways, it's nice to know I don't have to travel very far to get boba in the financial district anymore. 

The location is located super close to Onigilly, Sushiritto, and Murrachi's too so you can pair boba with some afternoon munchies. Sounds like the perfect combo to me. 

Will swing by again if I'm ever in the financial district!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
My main reason for going to try plentea was for the cute jars without even thoughts about the actual tea. However after the hype of the jar wore off, I was actually disappointed by the milk tea. It didn't taste enough like tea and was pretty plain. Quality was mediocre. It wasn't sweet enough or had enough tea flavor. I also tried the brown sugar iced milk which was def better in quality than the milk tea so would recommend that over the milk tea. It was thicker but had much more flavor. 

Wouldn't recommended this place for the milk tea but would recommend if you want a pretty jar.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Yes, you get to keep the bottle. 
It's their bait for getting you in the door but what actually keeps you coming back is the quality of ingredients and comfortable atmosphere. 
Located on Kearny, Plentea is a great lunch time option if you're craving boba or cafe delights on a work week.
Weekends are a lot quieter as the entire financial district shuts down. 

I recommend the Tea Creama with Boba. 
Be careful not to break the foam into the tea while drinking.
author: Charlie L.

description: Cute interior, easy to read menu, slightly gimmicky but I do like the bottles and I have plans to use them. I got the peach green tea with boba and boy was it loaded with peach pieces. I'm not used to that and I'm allergic so I swapped with a friend who didn't like her Lavender lemonade as it tasted more like a mojito (I love mojitos). I love that they offer chia seeds and if I'm ever near a Plentea (Come to NYC?) I would return to try the puddings.
author: Lily L.

description:
The Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea is absolutely perfect. I was so happy that it was far from watered down milk tea. I definitely would advise getting this if you're unsure on what to get! The only odd thing about it was that there was a LOT of boba leftover at the end. But the boba in general is good! 
I've been here on several other occasions and their milk tea and flavored fruit milks are solid.
author: Leonna T.

description: 2nd time having Plentea. The first time was disastrous, the drink was basically diluted milk with no tea flavor whatsoever. So why second time? We wanted to get boba guys and they were closed on a Tuesday. We got 4 drinks from Plentea this time, mine was brown sugar milk tea with boba, which was so-so and too sweet even with just 50% sugar. My coworker really loved her taro milk tea though - apparently it's made with real taro, I had a sip and it's pretty good, and I don't even like taro!
author: Essie L.

description:
Very rude cashier. She rolled her eyes at me for asking a simple question about their "reuse glass bottle" program. Excuse you, please learn some decent customer service.

Only good thing is that they are open 7 days a week and pretty late for their location.
author: Jessica S.

description: I really want to give this store a 4 stars. The drinks are good overall but the customer service is super duper bad. The cashier look like she hate her job and her life, she just lay on the counter when we were taking order and it's show us a very very lazy attitude.
author: Andree V.

description: Overall it is a great place with a great concept. Love the glass bottles and you can bring them back to get them filled up.
author: Nikita D.

description:
Let's face it: the only reason I came to try this place was so that I can get their cute glass bottle! I ordered a regular black milk tea and it came out to almost $5, which is fair considering you get to keep the bottle. The drink was okay, very reminiscent of Fantasia's milk tea but slightly watered down and not as strong. I still liked it!

Why the 2 stars? The young lady taking my order was rude. No hello, no greeting, no smile. I came in 4 minutes before they distributed the next batch of bottles and asked if I could order now and wait for it. She rolled her eyes and said "I guess." The rest of her customer service was lacking and she continued to take my order with a snotty attitude. Didn't seem like she wanted to be there. 

If you don't care about how you're being treated, this place will be just fine and their tea is not bad. But my overall experience leaves me hesitant to make another return.

Also, how does a place that serves tea have no restroom?! D:
author: Lena L.

description:
Oh plentea. Why do you have to be so expensive?

I came here twice on the same day with the same friends. First, we went for lunch and I ordered the taro milk with boba in the cute milk bottle. I now use the bottle for juices and milk now. 

Later that night, we went again, and then we ordered the peach tea, I think. Either way, it was delicious. 

Either way, I enjoyed the tea and boba there - it wasn't the best I've had, but it wasn't bad either. But expensive for the price. Then again, you can just get a plastic cup or bring back the bottle and get 10% off.
author: Nina Y.

description: Saw some people drinking these Boba style drinks in at the table next to us in a restaurant...a diner from another table asked where they bought their colorful drinks and I overheard the name of the store. This is in one of the busiest areas of the financial district which means...no street parking during normal weekday business hours..so far...all their drinks are good...from their fresh fruit milk drinks which are always made with fresh fruits to the most basic Oolong tea and Thai tea drinks which we have tried in the 4-5 times we've been here...feeling a little hungry? They have food as well...consisting of a number of Waffle sandwiches or perhaps a desert. You might say..why not just go to Quickly? I like Quickly myself and frequent them as well..but, I have to give Plentea credit for higher quality of ingredients.
author: Orlando J.

description: Finally! Me and my friend been talking about this place for a while now and I get to finally try it! Their glass bottles is definitely a new take on boba drinks, I've never seen any other places that got this yet. If you save the bottle and bring it back you get a 10% discount! For its uniqueness, I say it's worth to make the drive out here.
author: Kristie L.

description:
Went to plentea with my gf because my friends told me to try it out. 

Got there around 5pm and there was a little line.We waited for about 10mins to get our orders in. I got the sea salt creme oolong tea with honey tapioca. The drink itself I thought tasted a bit weird, but got use to it and the tapioca was horrible, it wasn't sweet at all and it was hard. My gf got their avocado fresh fruit milk drink with honey tapioca, the drink was OK and again the tapioca sucks! 

The only pro thing about it is their glass bottle and you get to keep it. If you bring it in you get a discount on their drinks.
author: Tom L.

description:
Bottled boba is a unique concept, even for someone who grew in up in the 626.  Beyond the bottle is a respectable boba joint, using fresh ingredients at an above average price point (roughly over $5).

Black boba milk tea:  I would say the milk tea tastes about average. Still, it's refreshing to find a boba place that shows restraint in sweetening their milk tea. 

Honeydew milk: Delicious, with real chunks of fruit.
author: Andrew K.

description:
A cool little drink shop that I passed by without even seeing it until my girlfriend pointed it out to me. They serve your drinks in these glass jars that remind me of the obsolete glass milk bottles that you only see in 30's era movies. The drink was pretty good, and they still filled ours up all the way even when we asked for less ice! So thank YOU Plentea for not completely ripping us off!

If you want to return your glass bottle you get a discount, but it's also a cool novelty thing that I could actually use at home, so we took ours to go (which is normal, I'm not a klepto).
author: Kevin S.

description:
It's the best feeling every when you run into a place that you didn't plan on going to and it's like, the best place ever.

Me, my bf, and his friend were walking down the street when we came across Plentea!!! I've seen it on IG before, but never thought about coming, since we don't live in SF. Line wasn't that long when we went around 2-3pm ish.

I got the Strawberry Fresh Fruit Milk Tea ... I think that was the name. With lychee jelly. It was so good!!! A lot of people here are complaining about the price ... but like... why? You all pay 3-4 bucks for boba someplace else where they give you the cheap plastic-y cups with the cheap plastic top wrapper. Here, you get to KEEP the glass bottles plus get the lids! And here, the milk tea isn't syrup-y and super sweet. It's just perfect. You can even adjust the sweetness level if you tell them.

I'm definitely coming back!!!
author: Alice H.

description:
I can understand what the hype is about. It's not because their boba taste amazing but because of the reusable glass bottles the drink comes in. Honestly I went only for the bottle too. I ordered the Thai tea with tapioca and honestly it was no different from what I could've ordered somewhere else. The wait to pay and receive my order wasn't that long. When we went upstairs to sit, it wasn't crowded but there was trash on the tables and floor from previous customers ( I suggest they put a trash can upstairs as well). 
Overall, try it if you're in the area but if you're traveling across the city, look for a boba place closer to you. $5.44 (with tax) for boba is pretty pricey but considering you're in the financial district and it does come with a glass bottle, it's decent.
author: Tracy G.

description:
Came here at 1:20pm, never fails to surprise me how long it takes from line (only 4 ppl in front) to cashier to drink despite having 5 ppl behind the counter (+1 more dishwasher). I think it's time to purchase another cash register, how bout it? (I hate it even more when it's during school downtimes such as summer, holidays and what not because the lines would get even crazier). When I left the place, the line went out, turned and completely blocked baladie cafe.

They even added credit card minimum of $15 which I thought wasn't a very good idea considering their location in the FiDi district barely touching Chinatown. Their customer base are a bunch of office workers, and many can tell you they don't walk around with cash on hand; everyone in the area just swipes a credit card so adding this minimum was a huge disappointment.

Yes they are special that they have their own glass bottles but then... they only limit 200 bottles a day when they first opened until July, then they made it unlimited BUT then changed the bottles to have a bigger opening and only provided the bigger caps which no longer fit with the original bottles (and then they switched back to 200 bottles a day yet again). Initially glass bottles were great for customer retention but then it's like a slap in the face when they changed the bottles and the caps. So...what about the old customers? Are they no longer important? Now they have to dish out more money (as pricey as it already is) on another glass bottle. For those who like to collect these bottles as it's a trend, great for you but some of us don't really want another bottle.

I've been there several times and always get their flavored tea's, mango, strawberry, and peach and they've all been great and all but all of that comes after the experience at the business and sadly in my opinion (and I say my opinion), I don't think it's enough to make up for the bad experiences leading up to the drink itself. I think I rather just walk a couple more blocks and grab drinks at some less overrated boba businesses... sorry guys.
author: Judy C.

description: The taro milk tea is hands down the best I've had! What differentiates Plentea from every boba shop on the street is that they use REAL taro. Wait times can be a bit long, but service and product makes up for it. Christine was awesome and really went out of her way to help me figure out what drink I'd like, she even offered me samples. The interior is also designed really nicely and the glass bottles are a unique touch. Will definitely be back when I'm in the city!
author: Sylvain U.

description: This was my first time at a tea shop in the united states. I had no idea which one to get. Christine was very helpful and reccomended the green milk tea with the pearls. That shit bomb and cute i like it 5 stars would visit again if im in the area
author: Darren M.

description:
$5 for a watery milktea? Why!?

I got a green tea milk tea with aloe. It's not worth the addition, you barely get any. The milktea is flavorless, it basically just tasted like water with a dash of milk/cream.
author: Stacy C.

description: Came here on a Thursday evening and it was lively but not too busy. I was getting dinner soon so I didn't want a full on milk tea, so I decided on the hot premium mountain tea -- oolong. Service was pretty fast and I got my tea in no time. I really enjoyed the taste! However, I thought the price was a bit on the high side: $4.25 plus tax for a small (not even close to being completely filled) cup of tea. I mean, the tea was good, but it wasn't THAT good. Hipster vibe and solid tea and service but likely won't be coming back.
author: Beverly Y.

description: The line is long but the wait time isn't too bad. They get your drinks out to you very quickly even though there's a lot of people. In terms of drink quality, this place would get 3 stars but because of the utility of the glass bottle they give you, I give it an extra star. The drinks aren't anything special and the variety is a bit lacking. I like how they have nutella milk tea, something a lot of places don't have. I didn't get to try the food but since the appeal of this place seems to be the bottle, I probably didn't miss much. The boba itself is pretty nice and chewy.
author: Allan Y.

description:
So I very rarely take the time to write reviews, but this place is definitely worth it.  I have been searching for a place with great milk teas ever since moving to San Francisco 3 years ago.  I never enjoyed the super sweetened teas from Quickly and the like.  However, this place has amazing milk tea, not overly sweet or fake tasting.  Some of the comments call the tea bitter, which I understand if you are comparing it to Quickly's super sweetened teas.  So it's probably based on each person's preference.  

The boba is also super fresh.  I am not a fan of boba that basically breaks in two once you bite into it.  I prefer soft, chewy boba.  And this place lived up to my expectations.

Only downside is the cost- $5.44 for a milk tea with boba.  But you do get to keep the glass, and get a discount upon returning with the bottle.  Seeing how I usually pay around $4 for milk teas at quickly, the extra $1.44 is not the worst thing in the world.
author: Allison H.

description:
Had the salmon salad with blue cheese sauce (as they were out of every other sauce).
The ingredients are fresh (and organic) the size is ok but there was no bread to go with and it was $10. 
I prefer San Francisco Soup Company for the same price or less you have delicious and original salads + bread.
author: Sophie G.

description:
I'm not going to lie...I came here for the cute bottle, even though I told myself I wouldn't.

Another gimmick? Perhaps. But it works.

Plentea is located in Chinatown and is a small cute little establishment. They even have an upstairs with more seating! Yay!!!

The workers here and extremely friendly and they will answer any questions if you have them.

The drinks are a bit overpriced but it is understandable because you get to keep the bottle! The bottle even has their name on it!! But the best part is that they give you a discount if you bring back their bottle.

I got the standard Black Milk Tea with Boba. The tea itself was very good and tasted authentic. The boba was sweet, soft and chewy! Excellent texture. My girlfriend got the same except instead of boba she got pudding. The pudding was good as well! It wasn't too sweet, like other places. This can be a problem if the pudding overwhelms the drink itself. 

All in all, the drinks we had were very good. If the standard drinks were this good, I can imagine the other drinks being delicious as well. They also offer Tea Cremas, Fruit Teas, Waffles and Sandwiches. I will be sure to be back to try it all!

My only problem with this place is that there may be a long line and it could take awhile. I definitely had to wait 15-20 minutes to place an order and get my drink. Also, there seems to be a lack of seating but that is due to popularity.
author: Christopher Y.

description:
Damn ... wait it for 30min.. just for this waterdown..  tea suck. Services suck..
$5.     For a bottle.   Omg.
author: sean c.

description:
This place is close to work and just opened a few months ago. They will also serve bubble tea in a glass jar if you come early enough (they give out a set number each day). The boba is pricey, and is decent for the area but not THE best I've had. 

Be aware that there is a minimum spend if you choose to use your credit card so be sure to bring cash or buy 3 bottles of boba.
author: Lillian C.

description: I really like plentea!! I didn't expect it to be that great but it was way better than I thought. I just got a regular jasmine milk tea and my bf got the peach green tea and both tasted good. Did I mention they serve their drinks in cute glass cases? Haha
author: Esther L.

description: The reason I am giving it a 5 star is because it tastes a good as bubble tea gets and it is environmental friendly! When I visited the shop, it was under construction but I think it is pretty spacious cafe in the city if you want to meet up with a friend. I love that you can keep the bottle... so cute! :)
author: Saemyi J.

description: This is my third time at Plentea and yet I am still not sure how I feel about this place. I like that they give you the option of substituting with soy milk as well as sweetness levels. I ordered the Matcha Green Tea with soy milk unsweeten with tapioca pearls. It was good. The tea tasted fresh but the pearls could have been a little bit softer, other than that no complaints. I am not a huge fan of milk tea so maybe it didn't appeal to me.
author: Rosanna T.

description: The BEST and most amazing tea creations anywhere. Oh, how I LOVE this place. I've tried nearly every other boba tea place in The City, Berkeley and Oakland, and none of them even comes close to the variety Plentea offers.
author: Lisa L.

description:
This review is generated from 2 visits and both of them were awful
Came here mainly for the glass bottle  honestly. Verde in south bay has much better milk tea. Line was long and the wait was about 30 min around 2pm on Sat. 

The owner/cashier recommended the sea salt oolong crama. The name was pretty accurate as the tea was sweet and salty. However, they put syrup on the side on the bottle so that you couldnt really stir the syrup with tea. 

My friend got a regular milk tea with tapioca. And they forgot to put tapioca in it. 

The second time when I came, they already set up the rule that they only gave out 300 glass bottles per day. Of cuz i didnt see the sign as before you could opt in to get the glass or plastic bottle. Who knows that they changed rule in a week.

Got the matcha milk tea. I couldn't taste anything matcha out of it honestly. Grass jelly was bland but the egg pudding was good.

I will never come here unless I am peer-pressured/forced to.
author: Ruxin H.

description:
The notion of taking great social media pictures of these glass bottles from all angles supersedes reality of Plentea. Around 5 pm on a Monday, there's hardly a line, but they were already completely out of glass bottles (limited to 300 per day). However, they do offer a 20% discount on all drinks purchased in a plastic cup. Regardless, drinks are around 4 to 5 dollars each- pretty pricey.

My friends swear by their oolong milk tea and honey green tea. So naturally, I ordered the sea salt oolong crema. Which turned out to a major mistake on my end, over half the cup- plastic cup, I was one of the many unluckies* who didn't make it onto the VIP 300 list- was filled with cream "dashed" with an overly generous amount of sea salt, all sitting on top of heavily watered down oolong tea. 

I probably would've walked away a happier camper had I at least gotten that glass bottle so infamously plastered all over Facebook and Instagram. 

*unluckies- yes, it is a word I made up and regularly use to describe the unfortunate.
author: Ada C.

description: Good quality, but a little pricier than I'm used to. Its nice that they have the alternative packaging ( glass containers) but they're also a little bit on the heavy side.
author: Lily R.

description: Ordered an oolong tea but tasted like jasmine green -_- Maybe they messed up my order but I tried my friend's black tea & it still had that floral taste. Both teas were on the watery side, I like a more creamy taste. Not sure what happened but was very unhappy with the tea. The boba was fine, the seating upstairs was great & the glass bottle is cool but it's not worth it since the tea sucked.
author: A. G.

description:
This place is incredible. First I will start with their specialty, the sea salt crema with oolong tea. The salt and cream is so tasteful and delightful understated that it gives you a hint of the flavor without slapping you in the face with it. The sweet oolong tea mixes perfectly with the salty top. 

Next, the Thai tea. I have had a lot of Thai tea- none compared to this one. Honestly some of the tastiest drinks I've had. 

One down side is the tapioca: I would say slightly above average but not up to the par of the drink itself. They were slightly hard and could have been cooked a little more. I've not tasted their jellies but they look pretty good. The other down side is the price. I feel that 5:50 for a boba is a little over the top. That being said, if I were to spend that much, id want it taste like this.

The glass is a nice touch.
author: F G.

description: Taro milk tea with real taro bits. Yum. Sweetness level just right. The glass jar is quite an experience that sets it apart from other boba places.
author: Raphael H.

description:
I go to this place every now and then since its close to my school.
The real upside to this place is the bottles you get tbh lol
The milk tea here isnt all that, but I like the presentation =]

You get your drinks in these cool glass (almost milk jug) like bottles, and you can keep em afterwards.

They have downstairs and upstairs seating too which is nice.

Just make sure to come at the right time to get bottles, cause they run out and then you'll just get it in a regular cup.
author: Timothy N.

description:
5 stars for taste and concept, -1 star for pricing! 

My go-to is usually an avocado smoothie, especially at pho restaurants. But this place charges $6.50! I know, I know.. SF/FiDi pricing, yadda yadda.. But still. C'mon. LOL 

Now that I've finished my short rant, this place is great. I didn't order the 'cado smoothie because I refuse to pay that much (after giving them so much yelp grief! hahaha), so I decided to try their caramel milk tea w/ custard pudding. OMFG!!!! Super friggin' delicious. 

It was so good in fact, that I clotheslined everyone in the long line to get up front and order another one. WWF style. Off the top rope. High Risk Maneuver!* 

They ran out of glass bottles, but are currently offering 20% off when served in a plastic cup. Great model, I approve. 

Overall, I like this place. I'll definitely come back and try other drinks. But I for sure suggest the caramel milk tea w/ custard pudding. You won't be disappointed! 


*I didn't really clothesline anyone, I swear. I'm actually a really nice guy. :P
author: Eduardo R.

description:
The glass bottles are so cute and the drinks are delicious. You get to keep the bottles!!
I had...
 a fresh fruit tea -- delicious and made with FRESH fruit!
 a milk tea -- so creamy yet light!
Will definitely come back and will try to remember to bring my bottle for a discount!

They also seemed to have a special with an app dL where you could essentially get $15 worth of drinks for $free.99
author: Jane L.

description:
I have a confession to make....We only came here because most nearby places were closed. We thought the bottles looked cool, but that it must be a gimmick to make up for average drinks. But hey, why not?

I'm so glad we decided to try it! I can't vouch for all if the drinks, as I have only tried 3 of them. But the ones I have tried were delicious! My personal favorites is the Creme Oolong Tea. I love that it is not overly sweet like so many other places. The "creme" is more like a whipped creme, or sweetened creme fraiche that sits on top of the tea. They advise you to not stir it in until you try each of the components separately. The tea is lightly sweetened and good on its own. But the sweet creme is truly amazing.  The Sea Salt Creme Oolong is good too. It really is a bit on the salty side, even for sea salt drinks, but you can ask for less sea salt creme. I also enjoyed their regular milk tea. 

If you bring back the bottles, you get 10% off. But I admit....I'm currently using mine as a vase! :)
If your order is under $15, they prefer cash.
author: NikO D.

description:
The drink was too sweet but in general okay.  They don't offer anything hot, so be prepared and come here on warmer days. The girl who served us was very impolite and inpatient. I know they are popular and people wait in line to get the drink. But this doesn't mean they can afford to be impolite. No restroom for customers on premise either.
The bottles are cute, to be fair.
author: Loraine L.

description:
The bottles are back full time and we can continue saving the planet one glass bottle at a time. Rest assured, you'll get your average milk tea in a nice glass bottle in the afternoon if you choose to. If you're like the new customer I saw at the counter today who was shocked that you needed to pay more than $5 for a bottle of tea, then you can opt for the discounted drinks in the plastic cup. But let's face it, why are you waiting in such a long line if you're not getting the glass bottle?

I tried the sea salt crema everyone raves about. Personally didn't think it was mind boggling. The tea flavor was lacking, covered by the cream. I prefer the classic black milk tea and less sweet. They have 25%, 50%, 75% sweet options so the mild sweet tooth can be satisfied. 

I stay true to my original review. I give them 2 stars for the average milk teas and nice chewy bobas with a nice bottle. Originally I was going to give this 3 star with the glass bottles there all the time but after trying the other drinks, it's truly a 2-star "meh. I've experienced better" rating. 

If you are in a hurry, don't even bother coming. The line is almost always out the door. Sure it might be a short looking line but the wait is unexpectedly longer than you'd anticipate. If you're coming out of town just to try this, lower your expectations, have plans to stand in line with a friend who is fun and can keep you entertained, be prepared to pay about $5+ for a milk tea, and you'll be fine. I, for one, cannot justify standing in line for an overpriced milk tea during my lunch hour. On the rare occasions when I get off work early, I'll stop by again.

By the way, I think it was my first time seeing a cashier drink boba milk tea in the middle of taking an order. She had to hurriedly chew through the boba, covered her mouth before she could reply to the customer's questions. I'm all for drinking water on the job, that's fine and totally normal, but the quick chewing and attempting to speak that was quite a bit to watch.
author: Shirlene K.

description: The pearls were too hard and my drink tasted reminiscent of dish soap and fruit juice and it was not worth the near $6 it cost, even if it came in a fancy bottle. The place itself was fairly cramped and honestly the selection isn't that large. The interior design was kind of nice but it didn't do much to deter me from the god awful drinks they decided to serve. Also, they kept fish in the design and that was definitely not okay. At least there was free wifi.
author: Felix Y.

description: I haven't gone back for a few months since our office moved, but love their tea. Only reason they didn't get a five-star because they wait was almost super long, and they were obviously short-staffed (hope this has been fixed). FiDi/SoMA needs more great boba tea place and this definitely fills in that hole. Bring back your glass bottle and you get a discount!
author: Sharon L.

description:
This place is so silly - I am not paying $5-6 for boba when I can get it for roughly $3 elsewhere!

The interior looks really cute and there's upstairs seating overlooking downstairs and the street, so I can see why people want to come and be a part of the ambience. The other factor that appeals to and lures you in is their cute glass jars. Well I am not buying, sir!

Apparently they only distribute 200 glass jars a day, and once they're out you get your drink in a plain ugly plastic boba cup. Luckily when we went, they were out of glass jars. I think I really would have let myself pay $6 for plain boba milk tea.

You have been warned! For us it was just a walk around the block but if you're investing time to drive into SF and come here, you'd better come early - before the  glass bottles run out. Without them there's no novelty and it's just plain ol' boring boba.
author: Macy H.

description:
Ordered the Oolong milk tea with boba. $5 tea should not be remotely watery. Sent my first glass back. Got no ice in the 2nd glass and it still was slightly watery but better. The killer was when they only filled the 2nd glass up 3/4 because i "drank abt that much of the first glass". poorly made drinks. customer service about the same.

what was the profit margin on 1/4 glass?
author: Brandon N.

description: Ordered the coffe milk tea and oolong milk tea, both with tapioca pearls.  The coffee was a bit strong for my taste, but the oolong was on point. Liked the bottles but would have probably enjoyed the hot drink better in a different cup! oh well
author: Leslie H.

description:
i've been here a handful of times now and like this place.. 

some things i've ordered:
-ice milk brown sugar w taro pudding: taste like filipino drink sago
-ice milk green/black tea w grass jelly
-sea salt crema milk tea

the glass bottles are cool but we never keep them.

they also have food but i have yet to try them

this place is a-ok by me
author: Raquel T.

description:
This place is ridiculous. I don't care how good the tea is. The wait is way too long. I have been waiting for an hr and I m still waiting. The speed they make tea and take order just can't keep up. I also saw one of the employees go buy milk when I am standing in line. Very poorly planned place. 

Edit: when it was my turn to order. They ran out of half of the fresh fruit flavors.
author: Ben W.

description: I was attracted to the jar more than the drinks. By my 3rd drink, I've came to the conclusion that the jar gives the illusion that there is more quantity than it is. The jar is heavy and hard to hold if you're taking it to go. The jar is made of cheap glass - it will break if you put hot water in it.  So for $5-7/drink....I'm over this place.
author: Gloria T.

description: Tasty salty oolong smooth and creamy with a milk jar, very convenient and clean area to sit in an area with a bunch of restaurants
author: Richard K.

description: Fast service! good drink and the place's so cute. I love to be back every week with Avocado Milk drink!
author: Sloan L.

description:
Rushed here during my one hour break between my classes and it was worth it. Parking was hard and I ended up having to pay for garage parking. But the tea here is worth it! I ordered the oolong sea crema with boba. It came in a cute little glass jar which we could take to go. This made me really happy because most milk tea places don't let you take their glass/mason jars with you if it's a to go order. The glasses even had covers so you don't spill and if you come back with your jar I think you get 10% off. (:

The drink itself was amazing. I've been to a lot of milk tea places and I am rarely satisfied. The oolong sea crema was very creamy and had just the right amount of sweetness to it. You could also taste the tea in the drink. A lot of milk tea places now make drinks that taste like they've been sitting in a refrigerator in the back all day or is made from a powdered mix. My drink reminded me of gong cha in milpitas or half and half down in SoCal, which is something I've been looking for in the sf area for awhile now. Overall, a great milk tea place that I can't wait to go back to!
author: Gayle G.

description: Good drinks, nice concept, instead of plastic togo cup like any other boba places, they have us glass jar to go, and 10% off once u bring the jar back for recycling. Will be back
author: Bonnie H.

description:
CUTE JARS. that's like def the best thing about this place. Their milk tea is just alright, but the cute glass jar that the milk tea comes in makes up for it. What kind of bums me out, is that I have to carry this glass jar everywhere afterwards and I feel bad throwing it out later. I understand that you can bring it back next time and get 10% off, but if you're shopping in downtown sf, there is no way to carry a sticky glass bottle around all day.

Not bad to get your boba fix, but definitely have had better :)
author: Carmen C.

description: Always need to try a new place to see if I agree with all the hype.  I tried their traditional milk tea, half sweet.  It was just ok.  Seemed very watered down but I guess it's cool I got to keep a nice glass bottle?  Their boba is very good tho but very sweet, so I'm glad my tea was half sweet otherwise it would be way too sweet for my Chinese pallet!
author: Judy S.

description: Best for a warm day in the City by the Bay. Matcha green tea latte with almond milk is very good. The honey infused citrus tea with lychee jelly is refreshing, both are lightly sweetened which I preferred.  They do not have rewards punch card which is not a plus.. The milk bottle is a first for me I would keep them as a souvenir for my weekend in the City. Definitely coming back and try other flavors.
author: Carolina H.

description: I want to start out by saying that it's is only getting a 3 star rating only for the fact that you can keep the glass bottle your tea comes in! We stopped by here earlier today and enjoyed the loft area for sitting upstairs. It wasn't the best boba tea we got in town, but it was okay (I got the mango green tea with tapioca). The flavors in mine were a bit bland and all the tapioca was stuck together and hard to get through the straw. My boyfriend has his with milk tea and it was way too thick for my liking. It was also on the pricier side of different places I've been in San Francisco, but like I said you can keep the bottle!
author: Danielle B.

description:
I was extremely excited to see that there is a new boba tea shop open in the Fidi. Nestled next to Onigilly, Plentea is conveniently located on the bustling street of Kearny. 
  
Plentea has a natural wood decor with artificial pots of mini greens lining the wall and a chalkboard menu.  
 
There were a assortment of milk teas where you can choose whether if you want black, green, oolong, and thai tea. Others that I noted were fruit smoothies, fruit milk, and fruit tea. 
 
I ordered the honey lemon green tea. It had the perfect amount of sugar, not overly sweet like most boba tea shops. The green tea was strong with more of a bitter aftertaste. The tea is served in a glass milk jar. I thought this is extremely cute and sold more as a novelty.  
 
After speaking with one of the employer or employee, she suggested that I try the Honey Lemon Oolong Tea where the tea is not as bitter. It was yummy and refreshing. Definitely ordering that next time!
  
There were plenty of seating downstairs as well as upstairs for those that have larger groups. On the weekend, the place was of course filled with teenagers.   
 
Drinks were roughly 5.50 if you choose to include boba, jelly, or aloe.
author: Becky Q.

description: Tried the lavender lemonade with aloe and it was perfection! It included sparkling water so the drink was a little fizzy and the lavender was a great touch. It wasn't super sweet so I would not suggest it if you're hoping for a very sweet lemonade but it was extremely refreshing.
author: Sarah K.

description: I was so excited to try this place out and get me one of those glass bottles! I had high hopes for this place. I had a green milk tea and I was so disappointed. My drink was watery and the green tea was very bitter. Green tea is easy to steep too long and mess up and I was sad that Plentea didn't make the cut. My boyfriend, though, got one of those ice milks and he was it was okay. It lacked flavor, to me, when I tried it and the boba was really soft and too well done. Way to expensive for not so great tea.
author: Katherine L.

description:
This is an update as of 6/5/14...

I had to drop the rating to two stars because apparently, now you only get the glass bottle if you are the first 300 of the day.  I honestly do not care about the bottle, BUT as stated in my first review, that is the whole novelty of this spot.  Therefore, without it's main attraction (the bottle), it no longer is a novelty spot, yet an overpriced boba spot.  I can get the same quality drink for 1 dollar less elsewhere and large sized.  

Having said that, so many people complain about not getting the bottle.  Seriously?  You want a bottle, go buy a glass bottle of milk.  You get a bottle AND it's bigger!  Reuse that!
author: Bernie C.

description:
I went here yesterday (Wednesday) night and got, I believe, the fresh fruit tea (peach) with oolong tea. My friend got the strawberry one with oolong and the fresh fruit (mango) one.

Peach - it tasted watered down and there were little Apple bits in the tea. I didn't taste any peachiness and it tasted really watered down! Cost 4.95 with Boba, which is extra 50 cents.

Mango - this is the most expensive at 6.50. We got one and it tasted like ice cream and couldn't even taste the mango. There was another fresh fruit drink with milk and that is.exactly how ours tasted like! With milk. So We asked them to make a new one. And while they were finally making it (after they made EVERYONE'S ORDER - they waited till there were NO MORE CUSTOMERS to start making it), we noticed they added MILK to our FRUIT ONLY drink! What the Heck!? When confronted, they said they always add milk to the drink.. I don't get it. I paid 6.50 for a 4,95 drink. We did not argue with them and just took it. At least it had more mangoness this time....

Strawberry - this one tasted much better! I only had 2 sips, but tasted pretty good and sweet. Had bits of strawberry too. Why didn't mine have buts of peach instead of apple!? 

Lastly... the "honey" boba was not sweet at all! I've had better making them. It was kind of hard and not as chewy.. must've been sitting there for a while because after the remake mango, that Bob's was softer and warm..

Spent $13.54 for 2 drinks which tasted bad. I originally asked for taro and was told they don't have that anymore. Quicklys tasted better! Honestly, the only thing going was the glass cup, which is a pretty neat idea. Would not go here again. Maybe it was because the staffs are new or this crew wasn't as good. Did not enjoy it at all :(
author: Yan L.

description:
Drink of Choice: 4/5 Taro Ice Milk Tea w/ Boba, 50 % sweet 
Variety: 4/5 
Ambience: 3.5/5 (cute and a few tables up and downstairs, but busy busy busy!) 

One of those places that you see on your instagram/fb feed and have to try just once.. at least for the picture. We got the Brown Sugar Ice Milk and the Taro Ice Milk. While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it. I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area and it's worth a try. 
 
P.S. i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!
author: Christiana C.

description: ! The milk tea is subpar, but the experience was wonderful. I got the mango fruit milk-- the drink came in a glass bottle (which you can keep!) and drinking the beverage was a wonderful. The mango fruit milk had the same viscosity of milk, with chunks of real mango in it. I will forever keep my Plentea glass bottle :P This place was expensive though.... I guess you pay for what you get.
author: Stacey W.

description: Packaging can make a big difference ! Their unique packaging sets them apart from other ice tea places. The flavors and options were amazing as well. I would surely go back and try more options of flavors/lemonade and milk teas.
author: Shubhi T.

description:
You see, I am just like you, 
just an average de rigueur azn, chasin' the next hype, 
tryna find the next tea joint, sippin' till the day I die, 
tryna find true love, afloat on that bubble high, 
first heard Plentea, from my girls, 
of course, girls know best 'bout them pearls and jewels, 
decently packed, arrived interior woodgrain chalk board on sight, 
limited 200 bottles, day and night, 
ordered milk tea, black with them puddings right, 
puddin' swimmin' in them jars, doin' swirls pretty tight, 
the tea was alright, better enjoyment by instagrammin' the delight,
aftermath second floor deck chillin', wallet felt light and in a plight, 
but hangin' out with homegirls, can't complain such is the life
author: Roy C.

description:
I love how they sell their teas in a glass bottle! When you bring your bottle back you get 10% off your drink (like how when you bring your own reusable coffee cup to Starbucks) 

The staff is really nice, helpful and friendly! This week they sold out of their jars and had to use the usual plastic cups but they let me know that I got 10% off because they had no more jars (which was really nice!)

My coworkers and I go their all the time and we have collected a pretty good amount of jars haha they're really cute and since I like collecting mason jars this was a nice addition lol but be very careful because they break easily. They may appear strong but when I was trying to rinse out my jar using the hot water (the boiling hot one you use to put in your cup of noodle at work) it shattered!

Anyways, the flavors are super delicious! The usual flavors and you can add any toppings to your drink. They could add more flavors but the basics are good enough for me! My favorite is the Thai and Black milk tea with tapioca.

I still have yet to try the other flavors but I've heard the honeydew melon is good!

I love this place! Definitely going to come back, since it is a couple blocks away from where I work :)
author: Mariah T.

description: Parking around it was a pain but the line wasn't too long, and the drinks were worth it all  Plus of the jars and store itself is pretty aesthetic.
author: Denise W.

description:
It's cool, but it's pricey for what it is. Wanted taro milk tea but they didn't have taro. Tried the sea salt crema oolong tea, it was good but the crema part doesn't really mix with the tea so you get curdles towards the bottom of the drink. Brown sugar milk with pudding tasted like sugar milk, we wanted caramel but they didn't have any caramel - just opened and there's no caramel or taro?? Okay. Mango oolong tea was good but they forgot to give us boba even though it was requested. Ice milk tea was not good, something funky about the flavor but I couldn't put my finger on it. 

Come here for the novelty of a cool glass that can second as a vase or something. Not worth the $5-6 for a drink, even for this area. Bring the glass back for 10% off your drink, that's equals a free topping - if they happen to remember to put it in.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Got my apartment excited to try this interesting new place with its limited glass jars! Initially wary because of the 3.5 stars, but Plentea looked unique enough to warrant a visit. 

Brief line at 2 PM on a Sunday afternoon, and it moves quickly.

Got the iced black milk tea! It's usually my drink test for each new tea place (besides T Pumps): if they can make it well, they've got a new fan. Plentea's tasted fine, but it was incredibly average, and the boba was slightly hard/not chewy enough. Ehhhhhhh. Unimpressed face. Roomies thought green milk tea and thai tea were alright, too.

The glass bottle is super nifty; I've used it to hold smoothies/other beverages at home, and it looks cool to carry to class! The lid is a semi-flimsy plastic cap, the kind you just push onto the top (no twist), and it has leaked a little, so avoid putting it in purses in case it tips over.

The $5+ seems worth it because of the bottle, but the watery, lackluster milk tea reminds you that you are overpaying for this novelty. Especially since Bobo Drinks just opened in Berkeley and they have cool embossed mason jars you can just buy for $1. May have to come back to try a couple other flavors - and bring my bottle back for the 10% discount! Though who wants/remembers to lug that heavy thing around?
author: Tina Y.

description:
The major appeal of this place is the glass jar. By the time I came around here (around 3 pm on Saturday) though, they ran out of glass jars and every thing was served in plastic cups. *sad face*  

I had almond bubble tea. Nothing really particular about it. The bobas were cooked appropriately and the almond milk tasted like it should. I'd say it's comparable in quality to another chain, Tea Era, but definitely does not reach the honey boba goodness of Half & Half in LA.
author: Wonhee P.

description: So excited to have a boba place open up in fidi! Plentea does not disappoint. I got the Oolong fresh fruit tea with strawberry - a refreshing caffeinated drink that's perfect for spring! They also let you keep the glass and will give you a 10% discount if you bring it back for your next drink.
author: Natasha N.

description:
Very small and easy to miss the spot. If you are walking around, stop by. The girl was very friend and service was fast. Good selection of foods. 
I went with the fresh fruit green tea with boba. 

Cons:
No bathrooms
Parking is tough (likely a garage near by)
Can be busy.
Price is slightly higher than I like to pay for.
author: Roger A.

description:
3.5 STARS

Yes, I am one of many that was quite intrigued by their glass bottle concept as I was browsing through their Yelp page.

I was not so intrigued to arrive and find out that they ran out of bottles for the day. Boo. Their prices were quite absurd--but quickly realized that they factor in the cost of the bottle, however, do offer an incentive to bring them back and/or 20% off discount for regular cups.

I ordered the 'Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea' with boba. They ran out of boba! Seriously? Every time I hear those words, it pierces through my heart. In conclusion, the drink itself was pretty darn good, but it could've been better with boba, just saying. The tea taste was subtle and the sea salt crema was perfection.

I came back a few days later and again, no bottles. At least they had boba this time.
author: Dung N.

description:
My favorites the Oolong Milk Tea and Honey Lemon Oolong Tea. Just the right amount of sugar and tea flavor.
Prepare to wait thought. I waited for a good while (probably 30mins?) but definitely worth the wait. At least in my opinion.

Gotta love the people complaining about the line though. No one made you wait in line. You saw how long the line is, you choose to wait. The end.
So if you wait for 30mins, 1 hour, or more for a drink and end up regretting that you did so. No one to blame but yourself.
Go back when there is no line or just to go somewhere else. Plenty of bubble tea places a few blocks away in Chinatown. I don't know if it'll taste as good but at least you won't have to wait so long in line.

Pretty simple. Wait or don't wait. Again, no one forced you to.

Things get pretty hectic during rush hours and I'm not surprised if it takes longer to prepare drinks.
Parking is extremely troublesome but it's downtown. I expected it but obviously many others failed to understand this.
There are several parking garages (Portsmouth Square Garage) nearby. If you can't afford measly $3-4 an hour to park your car, take the bus.

They definitely need to work on some ways to make drinks faster and the numbers for the drinks are very unorganized like someone mentioned. I assume due to the fact that some drinks are faster to make than others. If so, it's understandable to me at least. Others probably failed to understand this too.
But they have been opened for a little over a week so maybe it'll get better as time passes.

I do love the glass bottles though. The lid on the other hand is a pain to take off sometimes.
author: Jae C.

description:
Came here to get the glass bottle that came with a large drink during their promo period. I think they only have one size for all drinks? Anyway, what kind asian doesn't line up for free stuff. One time I was the last person to get a glass bottle before they ran out. Whoop whoop, small victory. Line is always out the door after 1145 or so. one time I waited 25 mins to get to the cashier. 

 All their drinks are on the pricier side, $4-6 per drink. So without the glass bottle, the drinks here are actually not worth it. they give you a 10% discount if you get plastic. I came here and tried the jasmine green tea, thai tea, and regular milk tea. I would say that their teas are good but not worth my $5. Thai tea is probably the best that i tried. They also have some snack and lunch foods.

Will not come again when there are better and cheaper places. I fell for the glass bottle gimmick and that's it.
author: Cecile S.

description: Plentea is a new business on Kearny and pine! Ordered honey lemon green tea was really good. I like the flavor of the fresh brewed tea with just a little honey kick to it- just enough to taste the sweetness. I have 25% sweet level so if you prefer sweet tea, you have your choice.
author: Richard X.

description:
I too, came here for the bottle. If it weren't for the fact that I had the day off and came to visit the boyfriend during his lunch, I would never be in the financial district. I also wanted to try Sushirrito close by so why not kill two overhyped birds with one stone? 
Had the Honey Lemon (Black) tea and I thought the tea was good. Was it $5 good? Not to make it a regular in the boba rotation. The boba itself was mediocre-- clear signs of being overcooked because it was too soft and chewy.

I might come back if I ever was in the neighborhood (not anytime soon) but I wouldn't make a special trip out here.
author: Jenna H.

description: Loved the glass bottle! It is definitely a great idea to get people to come to the store. I had the black milk tea with honey boba, and it was good. My best friend had the strawberry milk with boba. I wouldn't say that either were anything super special. I would definitely come back, but the price is a little steep to come too often ($5.44 with tax).
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Brown Sugar Iced Milk with Egg Pudding. You're welcome.

Even though they have great specialty drinks, I still have mixed feelings.  The first time I came here was well before closing.  Yet they were closed.  "We ran out of drinks." ......UM, WHAT?! That was irritating since this is downtown with limited parking.

The layout is really weird. The cash wrap and ordering station are in the middle, and the line tends to go out the door. But the pathway is tapered off by a rail from the door to about 4 feet from the cash wrap, so it gets really crammed and awkward when you order and then get out of the way for the next person to order, but the pick up station is on the other side of the counter, so you have to nudge and mumble apologies to make your way to your drink then cross back over to get a seat so you can sit and enjoy your drink. Then when you're ready to go, disrupt more people to get around the rail and out the door. 

The drinks are tasty, but they take for-eh-vurrrrr (sandlot impersonation). I get they're new, probably had to hire more people because of how popular they got, so that means more training... But geez. 

Points for trend. Points for glass bottles. Points for applying a discount when bringing back said bottle.
author: Tina G.

description: Love the atmosphere and the service is friendly too.  Like the other reviews mentioned, your boba is served in a glass bottle.  This is partly why the pricing is a bit higher here, but to be fair, I've paid for boba that costed nearly the same, but without the bottle.  It's a nice keepsake, but being someone who doesn't live near their store, I doubt I would ever bring the bottle back for the 10% discount.  I really liked the tea I had here, I need to come back to try their milk tea.  They do a lot of different styles here too including the sea salt tea.  The boba was also pretty good too.  I think the bottles are really cool though, and I don't particularly mind spending a little extra for them.
author: Bryson L.

description: Meh, overpriced but typical for SF. Also, it was way too sweet for me and they couldn't make it less sweet for a Thai tea. Seemed like you can't use the yelp check in offer with other discounts. If you get the drink in a plastic cup instead of glass bottle, then you get 10% off.
author: Olivia P.

description:
A bit expensive to be honest, but you kinda expect that price for the location.  You could walk a few blocks to Chinatown find better priced pearl tea.

The drinks aren't bad, but it's hard for me to justify the price.  I get that the glass bottle costs more, but they should either give a bigger discount for bringing back the glass or  lower the prices a bit.
author: Steven H.

description: The Taro Milk is actually real Taro and none of that fake powder stuff, so so good! The Nutella Milk Tea tasted like chocolate milk. The brown sugar milk tea was a little too sweet but pretty good, nonetheless. Pretty reasonable boba price considering you get to bring home a glass bottle.
author: Shela D.

description:
GET THAT JAR
I DON'T CARE WHAT TIME YOU WAKE UP, you better set that alarm, wake up early get there by 11 and get that jar. okay now thats outta the way

So I came here for their jar hahaha and the drinks here are not bad but pretty pricy ( Range (from 4.00~ and up) 

TIPS: Cash under 10 bucks so buy two drinks or they charge fidddyyyyyy cent on your credit card

I got the honey ice tea with citrus and aloe, really good and refreshing but they had some citrus strips on the bottom of the jar so i had to swallow that... not that good.

You can never go wrong with the Matcha Milk Tea, or Green Milk Tea, or check out the smoothness

Come back and bring your jar! 10% off and hey we all like to save money #asians
author: Jason Ping T.

description:
I stopped by Plentea with my friend on a Friday afternoon. There were "Plentea" of high school students lined up for milk tea. The line was out the door which equated to a 45 minute wait. The place exudes a nice hip vibe. There is an upstairs for lounging and they serve waffles in addition to milk tea.

When we finally reached the line, I ordered a Oolong Tea Crema and my friend got a Black Milk Tea. It took a while to get our drinks after we ordered. We received our teas in nice tall glass containers that we get to take home. If you bring it back you can receive a discount on your next visit. After trying my tea, something was off. I wasn't able to immediately put my finger on it. I tried my friend's tea and it was 10x better. I took another sip at mine. By the time I got half way through I realized that my drink was not cold enough. It was about the temperature of tap water. I figured that they don't put ice in the Oolong Tea Crema, but after looking around and at yelp photos, all the drinks have ice. Well, except mine. The tea was a little weak and it wasn't too sweet either. The boba here was really soggy and didn't have a good bite to it.

I like the concept of the place, but no ice, no flavor and over cooked boba is not impressive. To be fair though, my friend's black milk tea was decent. I would still not pay $5 dollars for it. Their small kitchen looks way to cramped for the amount of people back there. I think once they figure out how to be efficient with their space and staff the wait time should improve and their drinks will be more consistent. I will wait till then, but for now, I will pass.
author: David C.

description:
Finally a boba place near work!!! The line is ridiculously long though. Average 20 mins. But still, a boba place near work!

A little pricey for boba, around $5-6, because they give you glass bottles, but you get 20% off anytime you bring back the bottle. You also get 20% off if you choose the plastic cups.

I've tried:
- The salted caramel crema drink - sounded delicious, but a little too milky for me and just the slightest hint of salted caramel
- Peach fruit tea - it has fresh peach bits floating on top, but the peach flavor wasn't strong enough, close to tasting like water
- Lemon honey tea - good, the usual

Overall, the drinks taste pretty fresh. The boba itself isn't too bad either, occasionally a little overly chewy, but still good.
author: Jeanie F.

description: Its not easy finding parking. You should park a little farther and walk your way there. There's also usually a line but it goes by pretty fast. If you like fruit tea I would get the peach oolong tea with lychee and honey boba. It can come across as too sweet for some people but I think it's a nice fruity taste especially when chilled.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Open late in the sort of FIDI. 
Sea Salt Oolong Crema is fine - tea, not so strong and the cream is pretty heavy.
Regular tea cream isn't what I thought it would be.
Grass jelly comes from a can.
If you change your order, be sure they don't just dump the ingredients out of your cup and refill it with other things.
And only the first X people get their tea in a bottle.
