For the concept, this place is pretty neat though and gee golly they're smart to have opened it here, next to a ramen shop.  May be if I'm in desperate need for a tea after work, I'll be back to check out their fruity teas and the upstairs lounge area as well!

So, meh for now, but see you again maybe~
author: Jennifer Y.

description: I'm always up for trying new milk tea places. It's the asian girl in me :) I came here on a Saturday afternoon. Line went out the door but it moved quickly and gave me a chance to decide on what to get. They have food on their menu too if you're looking for a quick bite, but from the look of it, you're better off eating elsewhere. Get your drinks here though and be prepared to pay at least $5/drink. I got the peach oolong tea with aloe. Very refreshing and perfect amount of sweetness. I like that I can keep the glass jar that they serve it in so that's why I'm not complaining about the $5.50 drink. I'm taking off stars for the taste. Ive tried the blueberry milk tea with honey boba as well and wasn't impressed by the boba. They added too much milk and made it taste like nestle milk. I've had better. Besides that, their staff was nice and efficient.
author: Lynn V.

description: It's way to expensive for what it is. You can get the same tea a block away for half the price.
author: Nicolas C.

description:
Lines are long. Lines are filled with young men and women who all want a snap of that hipster glass bottle for their instagrams. I don't blame them, the drinks are highly presentable (and that's kind of all that matters, right?) 

Jokes aside-- I ordered the Honey Lemon tea and it was honestly some of the best tea I've had. It was cool and extremely refreshing for someone who'd walked around SF all day. The drink had sweet undertones of honey but was not overwhelming in the slightest. So. Delicious. 10/10 would recommend.

The only reason why I'm not hitting this up to a 5 is because the service was a bit slow. I stood in line, unmoving, for a solid 15 minutes.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Overall Impression: Small milk tea shop that always runs out of boba in it's closing hours, yet the glass jar that comes free with every purchase makes buying anything worthwhile.

Cost: Around 5 for most drinks. Decent variety, and add-ons are extra. Boba supply seems to run short in the few times that I've been there.

Taste: My friend got a blueberry smoothie once that he said was one of the best drinks he's ever tried. I usually stick with the milk teas and have not been let down so far. 

Customer Service: It's average. Nothing special, but they do make your drinks quickly.

Ambience/Atmosphere: A place to hang out for a bit and then leave. There is limited seating, and when you find seats there is not much to look at.
author: Kevin T.

description: Not statisfying at all!!  btw if you are lactose intolerant everything on the menu is made with milk.  You have to pay extra for soy and almond milk substitute, extra for the glass bottle, and extra for boba.  What's a boba drink without boba, it should be included. Also if you want to use the wifi it is free with a code so if you want to hang out and browse on the internet, you can.... but just know there is NO bathroom when your tea starts making you wanna tinkle. The bathroom they have is for staff only.   And not to mention, the headache creating techno blasting music they have which is worse upstairs coz that's where the speakers are and you don't even want to hang out coz you're getting a headache......sigh....I really don't get the hype
author: Eesayah O.

description:
Milk tea (50% sweet)! 


Skip the coffmilk tea/fruity drinks.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
I'm not sure why this place has such a "hype"... It's quite pricy and below average in taste. On top of it, the cashier was pretty rude and didn't really understand/speak English well, it made ordering more difficult than it should be.

I really wouldn't recommend Plentea - there are far better alternative in town!
author: Noe L.

description: I had the milk thai tea with bubbles. The flavor was ok nothing spectacular while my friend tries the Nutella one which was also little weak on flavor. Overall decent I was expecting more flavor.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Boba -- there are definitely days when their boba is off

Flavors -- the ones worth trying: sea salt oolong crema and peach black tea, mango black tea is strange at first but tastes better after a few sips -- not too strong of a mango taste though, strawberry green tea is alright but it has a slightly bitter after-taste

Waiting -- don't go during lunch hour(s) unless you're willing to wait (usually a long time) 

Service -- some cashiers are rude and don't make eye contact while others are friendlier

Overall -- honestly, I just wanted the bottle :-) (but they run out really quick)
author: Adrianne T.

description:
I've gotta say, take home bottles is such a good idea. You can even get a lid for take out purposes! Plus you get 10% off your drink if you bring them back? Sold.

A friend of mine had always been telling me about this place, and I'm glad I did! I ordered the mango green tea with aloe, and I really enjoyed it! It was pretty sweet, so I may adjust the sweetness next time I come in. Which reminds me, plus points for being able to adjust sweetness! I don't think they mention it on their menu, but my friend mentioned they could do it for some drinks. If you're not sure, just ask!

I wasn't able to taste the waffles, but they looked so good! I definitely need to come back again.
author: Mia T.

description:
Cool, original concept. Hasn't quite hit LA yet in the way that it has for the Bay Area which is why I think I liked it so much (I live in Los Angeles if that wasn't an obvious). 

I was literally the only non Asian person in the entire store. The place was full. Uncomfortable you ask? Nay, I'm used to awkwardly being glared at. 

Anyways I ordered a strawberry fresh fruit milk tea with tapioca which was delicious and came in a nifty glass bottle that I totally intend to use for non milk tea purposes. 

A little expensive but worth the price for what you're getting. The employees work really hard and very fast in a teeny space so credz to them.
author: Sherry M.

description: Great little spot for some milk tea. I had the sea salt crema oolong tea, based on my friend's recommendation, and it was very good. A little salty and also a little sweet. The girl behind the counter told me not to mix it up, but I actually think it tastes better when it's mixed (call me crazy). They also give you cute glass jars with your drink, and if you bring it back, you get 10% off your next drink. I didn't want to bring the glass jar with me back to Seattle so I handed it back to them when I was leaving and they were surprised I didn't want to keep it, haha. But apparently you can opt for just a plastic cup, which is probably what I'll do next time. And I definitely want to come back!
author: Karen L.

description:
I got the Iced Milk Drink with Brown Sugar and Tapioca ($4.95) no sugar - the drink was pretty tasty, not too sweet. But I think it is pretty expensive for boba. 

The drinks come in these glass bottles that remind me of milk bottles. I don't like them. I think the opening is too small, the workers had to put the boba in by using a funnel and then banging it on the counter. I believe this process slows down the service to a snail's pace. 

I wish they had the option of choosing a plastic cup for a cheaper price. I don't need the bottle. At least you can bring back the bottle and get 20% off your next visit. Though I've never been back because the service is way too slow causing the line to snake out the door. Too ridiculous. It's not delicious enough for the wait.
author: Ella C.

description:
It really isn't worth waiting in that huge line if all you're hoping to get out of this is the glass bottle. You could literally get that at target or something. I came here with my boyfriend during the winter, excited to see what the hype was all about, but they had ran out of tapioca balls. I normally wouldn't buy milk tea without my boba so I chose a mango smoothie. First of, what kind of tea shop runs out of boba, especially during the early afternoon?? And hugeee regret when I took my first sip of my smoothie cause it tasted like any ordinary smoothie plus more pricey. 

Anyway, came back today cause I've been wanting to find out how the milk tea was here and sighhhh what a huge disappointment. I got the black milk tea with boba and everything about it was just mediocre. The milk tea tasted bland and lacked the normal sweetness that normal milk tea have. Upon reading other reviews, I guess you could customize your sweetness, but they never asked us and there was no sign saying we could. Even then, wouldn't a normal non-customized milk tea be sweet regardless in the first place?? Sigh again, huge letdown.  Also the boba was not satisfying at all. Not chewy enough and bland as well. Everything was just bland. 

I guess they could excel in other types of drinks but I've always been one to only always order the milk tea. I wouldn't be coming back again just cause it doesn't suit my taste. I guess it's only hyped for the bottle and the IG pic.
author: Amy X.

description: Been wanting to try this place and finally got to!! It was worth the trip! I got papaya milk and it definitely lived up to my cravings. The sea salt cream oolong was also pretty good! And I love that you get to keep the jar!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I walked by this place and really wanted to try it because of the cute bottles.  Coming from SoCal, I've had my fair share of different boba places in my lifetime.

I got to the front of the line only to be told that it would be a 20-minute wait for any drinks because they were 'backed up'.  I'm not sure what that means since there were only 4 people in front of me waiting for drinks...

I still want to give the place a try even though $5 for boba is a bit steep...but maybe I'll wait until the staff has gotten the hang of things.
author: Suzi F.

description: Kept it simple, milk tea, no boba, and its decent. You know you're going for the bottle, once you accept that part, its A-OK.
author: Chetan S.

description:
Con: Place is a rip off. Nothing really special but the bottle. Do not even bother going there if they do not have bottle. Drinks are about $5 WITHOUT toppings. You can get that elsewhere in chinatown for $3 to $3.50 with an even bigger size. 

Pro: Tapioca is always on point and I like the chopped up fruits in the fruity tea drinks.
author: Helen J.

description: So I ordered a regular milk green tea and mango green tea both with boba.  I barely ever get regular milk tea just because I feel that it's very plain but I just wanted to try it here.  However, they actually gave me Jasmine milk green tea instead and I am actually glad that they messed up.  I actually did not even know it was Jasmine until i noticed the difference in color with my friend's regular milk tea.  The Jasmine milk tea had a really nice floral note to it and the mango one was pretty good, tasted like any other mango green tea I've had.  The glass bottles are of course a nice souvenir to keep at the end.  Overall, a pretty good first try!
author: Sam L.

description: I came for the bottles. Yeah, I said it. The teas ($4.95/ea, bottle included) were good, not great. The cashier is rude and not helpful. The location is impossible to get to; too many one-way streets and parking sucks. I still think Purple Kow makes the best drinks in the city.
author: Andy W.

description:
The drinks here are good, but I really hate their glass bottle policy. They force you to take your drink in a heavy glass bottle that you're required to carry back for a discounted drink. You can't just give back the bottle for some change. The bottle is a pain to carry around the city. I don't usually plan out my trips to get boba drinks. I just pop in when close by, so I'm rarely carrying the bottle on me.

The place is over priced (because of the bottle) and makes itself inconvenient to it's customers. Boba Guys isn't that far and is way more user friendly.
author: beverly l.

description: Everyone hypes about Plentea, but really, the boba tastes the same for me as any other boba place. I think people are just jumping on the bandwagon and exaggerating about how good Plentea is because of the free bottles. I had a black milk tea bottle, and it tasted okay. I like the ambience of the bona place though, and the music.
author: Grace P.

description: yummy crema and nice glass bottles you can keep
author: Long C.

description: I like the tea, very tasty... the prices are a little high. We liked the glass bottles. No air conditioning, maybe that is standard for SF. It had a fairly long line.
author: Ali S.

description:
The bottle it came in was very cute, but very awkward to hold. The tea itself was just okay. 

Now that I've tried it, I wouldn't wait in line again.
author: SCSR L.

description:
The cool glass bottles are what draw me to this milk tea spot. It's cool to drink out of (though part of me is afraid that I'm going to drop it and glass is going to shatter everywhere, but that's besides the point) and nice to keep to reuse at home. You are paying a bit more than other drink places (I think because of the bottle and the location), but you do get a discount if you bring the bottle back during your next visit. 

The drinks aren't bad and they have a pretty good menu selection to choose from. I really like the Matcha Green Milk Tea with tapioca (sorry, I'm anti saying boba). The regular black milk tea, almond milk tea, and taro ice milk are also great choices in my book. You definitely taste the tea in their drinks and the tapioca is perfectly sweet and chewy. 

The only downside is that its location is out of the way for me with it being in the financial district. But it is a nice addition to the hustle and bustle work area and is great to grab on your lunch break. Just be aware, lines are almost always out the door in the afternoon.
author: Sharon L.

description:
Second visit was much better!  This time I got the sea salt oolong tea crema, which was very good!  Bringing the bottle back got me a discount, and I am much more satisfied about this visit.  I would still avoid their fruit teas though (last time they tasted very watered down).  Overall, a good boba place with delicious honey boba!

PRICING:  D
Very, very expensive for boba.  However, the bottle does make it a little more worth it.  Even with the 20% off (no bottle) discount, the prices here are steep.

SERVICE:  A-
Lines and drink making takes a long time, but that's because they make your drinks fresh.  Very nice staff - taught me how to make the most out of my crema.

DRINKS:  B
Some drinks are good, some are bad.  I would avoid fruit teas and go for the cremas.

BOBA:  A+
Perfect chewiness, delicious honey boba.
author: Tim L.

description: So happy to find they have a non-dairy, caffeine free option with the lavender lemonade drink and that they have lychee jelly! Love the atmosphere and decor and especially their bottles!
author: M.A. L.

description:
Came here on a warm day, and the line was out the door. I like that they serve their drinks in glass bottles. But I'm not a fan that after you finish you have to carry your glass bottle all day with you, especially if you park really far. However, I am a fan that that glass bottle are reusable for 10% off your next drink. 

My base line tea drink is jasmine milk tea. If a place can pass the jasmine milk tea test with pearls, then they are a winner in my book. They have secret seating upstairs, where is it more quiet and intimate. 

The staff is really nice, but I had a hard time hearing my number being called for my drink until another customer pointed it out. Other than that, it is worth the wait to try.
author: Rosary N.

description: You don't have to buy the glass bottle!  It makes the drink that much more prettier and that much more expensive, but it won't taste any better.  I got the avocado smoothie.  It's made with real avocado.  I added aloe and grass jelly.  they're real too.  The drink is real good actually, not too sweet at all.  On the outside, the place looks Euro and done up really well.  It's done up really well on the inside too.  The surprising thing is to see this place filled with Asian/Chinese people because the place does not look like any of the other boba tea joints.  This place can outright be a place for drinking cocktails if the lights go down and music goes up.
author: Byron L.

description:
Tea taste like tpumps to me. Its the bottle that ppl are really going after. 

Got here at 5:15pm. The wait on Memorial day about 15mins. 

Ordered two different teas and 1 Belgian Waffle. The teas came out less than 2 mins and we thought, "wow this place is pretty quick."

Its now 6pm and we are still waiting on the waffle. We asked them after 15mins and they said they are making it. Clearly you can tell no one was making it because u can see behind the counter the waffle irons, no one is there. But we thought, hey its a bit busy lets wait a few more minutes since we did remind them. 15 minutes pass and we ask again then they said, "WE RAN OUT". 

Are you serious?! 

Whyd you take my order if you dont have anymore?
Lack of communication, this should have been expressed to the cashier as soon as they realized they ran out.

Also i dont know why the lady said they were making it when theres really nothing goin in back there?! 

Freaking wasted my time.

*The manager said he will refund my money.
author: Ledam O.

description:
With a constant line out the door I thought this place would be good,........not.
Cashiers were snobby and the drink (tapioca) strawberry milk, tasted like a yahoo , with small chewy balls in it.
 What is everyone waiting for? I don't get it, is it the fancy glass you get when you buy a drink?
 Two stars were generous. Overpriced 6.75 for a drink, and that was on the low side of the menu.
author: Hannah K.

description: Expensive tea!  I'm used to the $3 mark but this is more like $5.  If you opt for plastic cups, it is only 10% off.  The sea salt oolong crema was ok but not sure if it was worth $5.  There are plenty of places to sit and they are open later than their neighbors.
author: Chris L.

description: I like the place, and the staff are great, but I ordered the nutella milk tea and there was zero nutella in it! Just milk tea and chocolate syrup :(
author: Anna K.

description: Went there for the soft opening.. loved the decorations & Tried sea salt cream oolong tea & papaya milk.
author: Boa J.

description:
New hype in boba milk tea madness..

i got the earl grey milk tea. i love the taste of their milk tea, it doesnt have any weird after taste like you get from Quickly's or any other cheap boba milk tea place.

Just the right consistency, a blend of well brewed tea, milk and sweetner. none of that other stuff.. 

it can get quite busy here aropund 1-2pm...  The milk tea is a bit pricey, maybe because of the glass bottle, but the taste of their drinks are delicious. 

i will definitely go here again.

also you can keep the glass bottle!!! or give it back and receive 10% your next order.
author: Steve S.

description:
This boba place is just okay. It is overhyped and overpriced for its "glass jars" I have been here a few times and got around to try both their milk teas/teas (fruit tea, yogurt fruit tea, sea salt crema) and I must say they are pretty inconsistent and tastes pretty watered down half of the time. I do like their concept of 1. choose your fruit flavor (they even give you fruit bits!) 2. choose your type of tea 3. choose any toppings you desire. Their tea drinks are better than their milk teas though!! You can actually taste the tea flavor but it is not really that strong. My favorites are probably their newly additional yogurt fruit teas especially the passionfruit or peach. Their other newly additional milk drinks tastes more just like sugared milk so I would definitely not recommend it and their sea salt crema tastes extremely sweet (even after adjusting the sweetness level). Oh, you can definitely adjust your sweetness level here and you should!! Well, unless you have a super big sweet tooth. I always get my teas/milk teas at 50% sweetness. 

 It is a great hang out spot since they have an upstairs with a couple of tables and a couple of tables downstairs as well. Plentea is pretty crazy during lunch time with all the FiDi people so you should definitely get there before 12p-1p or maybe come after 2p. You do get 10% off if you bring your bottle back but since drinks alone are already around $5 ($6 with toppings) so you don't really save much.
author: Shanna C.

description:
Ok, so I admit that I fell for the gimmick - I really, really wanted to try this place when I visited San Francisco because I wanted that glass bottle. But what I didn't account for were two things - 1) the possibility that they would run out of glass bottles at a certain time and 2) that the tea might not be that good. Now, I'm from SGV so...I'm pretty used to decent milk tea and boba. I roll in at maybe 8/9pm and I note that there aren't any more glass bottles. Well, whatever, might as well try the hype. So I ordered the matcha milk tea because I figure matcha milk might be pretty good. But nope - the matcha flavor is pretty much nonexistent and the milk tea is more milk than tea. Oh, and as other yelpers have noted, the price is the same no matter if you get the bottle or not (to which I call bs).

So yeah, I would say Plentea is...not the business. Or at least, not the place to take your boba business to if y'all craving good boba.
author: Doris K.

description: The drinks here are pretty average. I came here at 10:45PM and they close at 11PM. They said they were closed early because there were no customers so they could only make basic milk tea. If you say you close at 11PM, close exactly at 11PM. I work also and would never do what these people do. Otherwise, just keep one register open. The total was $5.38 for a milk tea with tapioca. It was good, but for the price it was way too basic and out of the way for me to walk.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Yeah yeah you get a glass bottle as a souvenir. Other than that, the drinks are expensive for what it is, but then again, welcome to the Financial District. You make your money here and you also lose all of it here. My green milk tea + boba + tax came out to be $5.44. Very average milk tea, not enough of the tea flavor. Boba is standard boba (standard chewy, no honey flavor). 

At least I get a glass bottle to put my flowers in. Woohoo!!
author: Cheri S.

description:
Okay okay, lets be honest here...I come here because I want the bottle. But hey!! I get a nice bottle, and my milk tea fix all in one! Those bottle is nice advertisement too! You see people walking around with them, and you just got to ask, where you get them from?

The tea...it was okay. I tried a black milk tea and the green one, and both were too milky for me. I would like a bit more tea taste. Also it was hard to go back consider they are pretty expensive. There were also one time when I went and they ran out of the bottle. They would give you like 10% discount using plastic cup, but seriously?...that is like only 30 cents less the full price. Totally not worth it, I would think I would at least get a dollar off or something. 

I wouldn't mind going back if I'm around, but I don't think I would purposely go there.
author: Mandy C.

description: Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea. Get it it's AMAZING. I can't even begin to explain how delicious and unique each sip tasted. It made me happy and giggly with each sip and sad once it was gone. The girls working at the front were very sweet and helpful and it was very quick to get our drinks. I guess the drinks are usually served in glass bottles which is even cooler but even without that aspect it was incredible. Good thing Plentea is on my way to work because I'll be stopping here often! Great place guys!
author: Jazeena B.

description: I think one of my favorite things about this place is the glass bottles and how it caps off with a plastic lid. The drink is a little pricey because of its glass bottle. My friend and I paid a little over 12 dollars for two drinks but I love the concept of bringing the bottle back for 10% off next drink. and if not bring it back, then reuse it for flowers, utensils holder or cup for your pencils, pens scissors or other desktop knick knacks. The bottle gets heavy in your bag but the lid is pretty sturdy so the drink doesn't spill. I get my drink delivered in the city for drink + 4.99 delivery fee by using Post Mates delivery service. Worth.
author: Gigi J.

description:
Here's what I think about Plentea...

Pros:
-Cool looking bottle
-Chill atmosphere to hangout in
-Pretty good fruit drinks
-Discount if you reuse the bottle

Cons:
-Almost $5 for a drink
-Long lines
-Give out only 300 bottles a day, so go early!
-Milk tea drinks are very satisfactory
author: Dora C.

description:
Expensive! Almost $5 for a drink even with the 10% off because they ran out of glass bottles. I have two glass bottles at home already that I can never manage to bring back so I didn't need more because it would have been too heavy to carry around. 

Line was out the door during lunchtime, if I had to wait too long I would just give up and leave. Girl in front of me gave up but at least getting the drink was almost instantaneous compared to waiting to order.

Drink is OK, I can taste the tea flavor past the strawberry. Not sure what kind of strawberry flavor was used but it's not too sweet or taste too artificial either. Little bits of strawberry fruit in it.
author: Anita T.

description:
I think I've totally given up trying to come here for the glass bottle, I never make it for the cut. And the boba haven't wow'd me enough to lure me back in.

First time, I got their mango oolong fresh fruit drink which was pretty good, but nothing "OMG I MUST HAVE IT AGAIN SOON" type of feeling.

And the second time I came here, I got the caramel fresh milk drink which was a disappointment, and totally not even worth the $4. 

Adios, Plentea. I'm off to try other things.
author: Harriet W.

description: This was my first time at plentea. first of all, the drinks are very overpriced. A smoothie was around 7 dollars. The tea itself tasted pretty good but the tapioca pearls were a bit undercooked. I liked how the give the drink in glass jars. I probably will come back again in the future to get a 10% discount.
author: Joyce J.

description:
Came here since it's the only real place you can get tapioca/boba in the FiDi area so perfect for all you working people in the area with that boba craving!

I came on a Friday with a bunch of coworkers at 3pm and the wait was around 20 minutes. A few in the group actually thought it was too long and went back to the office.

When we went they also ran out of the glass bottles. Isn't that one of the few reasons everyone is coming here anyway?! Just kidding. Or am I? Granted, there was a 20% discount, but it's still a little pricey for those who are used to $3 drinks in the Sunset or Richmond. 

I got the green milk tea with egg pudding. Wasn't great, wasn't bad.
author: Peter D.

description:
Someone recommended this place to me as they knew of my newfound obsession w/ Milk Tea

I got the caramel milk tea w/ tapioca in the cute milk bottle. What an utter disappointment! It wasn't horrible by any means, but I don't understand the hype or long lines. Honestly, it tasted like something I could have bought as a pre-made mix and made myself at home. Absolutely nothing that should have, in my mind, made it a $5 drink that I've heard people wait in long lines for. Thankfully, when I got there no one was in line.

Although, this place is out of my everyday route I figured it COULD be a spot I would hit up in the future if ever I'm in the Union Square area. Ummmm, nope Like I said it's not horrible, but also it's nothing I would go out of my way to get. Honestly, if I was by it in the future I'd probs go elsewhere. It wasn't gross...just not worth it, to me
author: Eboniña E.

description: The bottles are glass and absolutely adorable. I recommend a slush with boba (extra $0.50). I had a milk smoothie the first time and I didn't really like it so I tried a peach slush and it was way better. It's not too sweet and great to drink. The lines get a little long but it moves quickly.
author: Emily X.

description: It was really good!  Good teas and milk tea.  Always a plus for nice decor and pretty glass jars. There pearls (boba) was nice and chewy.
author: Julie C.

description: Decided to check this place out. I ordered a coffee milk tea and it was ehh alright. The boba qual let me down. It can be better. The coffee milk tea tasted normal. There was no line.
author: Jonathan T.

description: Love the cute glasses! The tea was just the right amount of sweetness. The barista was super friendly and helpful. I got the hot jujube honey flavored hot drink. Tasted great!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Only tried this place for the bottle honestly. I heard the drinks weren't that great, but the milky drink my friend ordered wasn't bad. The passionfruit tea drink I ordered was bland and not my cup-of-tea. I was sad to arrive home realizing I didn't get a cap :( But I will return to try other things and hope to update this review with better ratings. Also, bringing back your bottle gives you a discount on your order, which is environmentally friendly and smart!
author: Amanda C.

description: Really long wait and the service is slow with only 2 staff people working. Don't come here if you need something in under 40 mins. I was first in line and was waiting 10 mins while they tried to catch up on orders. I walked out because the never even said a word to me.
author: Darius K.

description:
I've been trying to come back again and again to get one of those glass bottles and I finally did. Usually they open at 11am, but on Sundays they open at noon so I got here 15 minutes early and was first in line. Didn't actually line up, more like sat outside in my car waiting for them to open. Apparently they have a limited amount of glass bottles and limit it to 300 a day. 

I tried the fresh blueberry milk and the drink is literally what it sounds. Blended blueberries with milk. I have no clue why I ordered this because I'm lactose intolerant and it gave me a stomachache later. I guess I didn't expect the whole drink to be a glass full of milk. 

I also tried one of the special drinks - the taro one and the drink was full of chunks of taro. Guess I wasn't too fond of that either. 

I came here especially for the bottle and I got what I wanted. My little souvenir. My only complaint is the cheap plastic caps they have. I think the hype for the bottle was too much, it has been sitting on the kitchen table unused like all my other reusable bottles. Just not a big fan of washing dishes I guess.
author: Maybo L.

description:
Finally took the bf and this time we tried the fruit peach tea and the fruit mango milk. Even more awesome! 
The peach tea was super refreshing and it has bites of fresh crunchy peach. The mango milk tastes just like a mango pudding from Chinese dim sum or dessert places. Need more now! Thank god I only work a few blocks away but now I'm in more trouble then ever!!!!!
author: jasmin t.

description:
Didn't get my glass bottle but you know what? I don't really care. 

I ordered a matcha green tea latte w/salted cream, which isn't really on the menu. They seemed slightly confused by it since they guy I was ordering it from hadn't heard of that idea or combo before, but I was pushy. I was like, "Yo trust me! I drink a LOT of boba and am obsessed with salty cream over my matcha latte so just can you make it happen?" And sure enough he did...and it was great...until...

I realized a few sips in that not only was it not salty enough, it just wasn't salty at all! I tasted my friend's who got the oolong w/salted cream (MY GOD THAT DRINK IS A DREAM) and realized mine was not done right! I went back and the woman was totally ready and offered to make me a new drink, which I didn't really feel like I needed, but if she could just add some salted cream to the mix, I would be soooo happy! So that she did and back I was to being a happy camper.

Two thumbs up to this spot - I've officially arrived in the world of expensive boba. Let the wallet thinning over beverages begin!
author: Christina C.

description: Tea was good, boba was average, prices were high. I feel like this place is mostly a novelty because they give you cute little glass jars that you get to keep. By doing this, they are able to cover up the fact that their boba isn't very good.
author: Carson P.

description:
I've been about about Plentea for the past few weeks and decided to try it. Boba in glass bottles aren't exactly new since I've seen places in SoCal that have done this a year or two ago. Plentea is probably one of the first ones in the Bay Area to try this where you get to keep the bottle.

I got there at 1 pm and the line was out side the door. I waited for about 10 minutes before I got to order. Definitely not as long as Purplekow or T-pumps. I only waited for about 2 minutes for my drink. I got the sea salt cream oolong tea after reading the reviews on their fruit milk tea and I did not want to pay over $7 for a smoothie. The drink had the tea on the bottom with a layer of cream on the top. They told me not to shake it so I just stirred it with my straw. Not too salty or sweet. No complaints.

I did see that they only sell a limited amount of glass bottle drinks so I would get here early I want one. However it is 20% cheaper if you get their drinks in a plastic cup. Make sure that you keep your bottle because you want reuse it to get another drink for a discount. You'd have to plan to bring it but if you're a poor college student like me it's worth it.

I did see that they messed up one order but they fixed it immediately with no attitude. This place is relatively new so there is some things they need to fix. I feel like the drinks are overpriced since you're just paying for the glass bottle but come here often enough I would think you'd get your money's worth if you'd reuse them.
author: Isabel C.

description: The drinks are a bit plain, but it's still not bad. The music they play is pretty modern and do need to lower the volume a bit for a good conversing time. They offer a second floor for people to sit in, but it's a very small space, so it may get crowded quickly.
author: Angel N.

description: Their tea wasn't that great, it tasted watered down. But I love their setting and environment, it's very hipster. What got my attention was the bottles that you get to keep, and if you were to bring it back it would be 10% off on your next purchase.
author: Sandy C.

description:
Tapioca drink in a glass bottle....that right there is enough for me to get more drinks

Went in today with a good buddy of mine. I got Mango Oolong tea w/ grass jelly, while he got the strawberry green tea w/ grass jelly. The people working there are nice and genuine. 

Will be back soon
author: Mike Z.

description: This place isn't over-hyped. Their teas are the best I've had (even compared to SoCal ones like Half&Half). Reason being, their flavors really come through without the tooth-aching sugar of most other bubble tea places (even if you told them to not make it too sweet). They use on average way higher quality ingredients than 95% of all other bubble tea places. Yes, the glass jar is cute/annoying (depending on how you look at it), but that's not the point. The point is the teas do taste really good! I LOVE their sea salt crema... it's absolutely amazing and I can drink that every day if I lived next door. LOL. Their avocado tea is also amazing (if you love avocados). All of the fruit blends are fresh. I wish they would start franchising this in SoCal, I would drive very far for this. :)
author: Alice W.

description:
Stumbled upon this place by accident. I had just finished early dinner with a group of friends next door at Ramen Underground when my BF noticed people drinking milk teas and fruity tea drinks. (He knows I how much I love fruity iced teas - its got its own little compartment in my tummy just like dessert.) We walked a few door downs and BAM - Plentea!

One fresh fruit mango green tea for me and one for the boyfriend. We both enjoyed our flavored green teas - not to sweet and just enough tea taste. Nothing mind blowing but it was nice and refreshing after having a heavy bowl of ramen. The prices is a bit steep though - $5 for a drink. Wtf?! But I believe if you bring your old Plentea bottle or order a plastic cup you get a discount. I got 20% off because they ran out of the Plentea bottles during my visit and I got my drink in a plastic cup instead.

I didn't know about the existence of the famous cute Plentea glass bottles until I checked out the Yelp photos after I got into the car that I saw the cute little glass bottles. (Oh darn.)

Will I be back? Sure if I'm in the area. There's a lot of drinks on the menu I have yet to try but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit...
author: Serena K.

description:
I love the fruit drink here! The milk tea tastes like real milk tea! Their tapioca could use some flavor or sweetness though. I don't like getting boba if i know there's no taste. 

But my first time here I bought 2 drinks for myself! I don't go to the city often so I wanted to try 2 different drinks. I got the fresh strawberry fruit tea --- amazingly good--- I loved the strawberry pieces! I also wanted to try their black milk tea, really strong tea but I liked it. (Next time ill try it with green tea). 

The prices are a bit expensive, which is why I would only go here once in a while. And I'm big on tea drinks, I probably get a boba drink once a week or every other week (b/c I'm also big on coffee places too). Yeah, the prices are the only negative id give. I like how they offer discounts on reusing their bottles but it basically just covers for the tax. Bump it up to a bigger discount and maybe people would reuse 'em.
I love the drinks but not so much the prices. I'd say this wouldn't be my weekly boba place, its more of an occasional boba spot. 

PRO: Really good drinks

CONs: Expensive & tasteless tapioca
author: Melanie M.

description: We went in when it was busy, and I asked them if they could get my the bottle with the logo on it. And they did! So nice! My go to boba place in SF!
author: Jelaine C.

description: I like the idea where you get a glass milk bottle with every drink order. You can take it home and come back to re-use it and get a 10 or 20% discount, I'm not sure. So pretty much it's super over priced because you gotta get the glass bottle. I got the oolong milk tea and it was okay tasting but you could tell they forgot to put any sweetener. I like my tea flavor don't' get me wrong but there is suppose to be a tad bit of sweetness in it which I didn't get. Pretty much I would come to try it and get a cool bottle but not really worth coming back multiple times. The tea is alright but there are better spots. Cool, unique idea for boba. Since it is in the financial district it will get business but if you are thinking about going out of your way multiple times to come here, it's not worth it. If you are in the area, it's worth a try.
author: Jeromy G.

description: I came here not expecting much but just another hipster boba place with cool bottles. I guess I came here just to say I tried it but I was impressed. Cool bottles, fresh fruit bits, and good tasting tea. I ordered a strawberry green tea with boba and my sister got peach green tea. We loved the fresh fruits. Only complaint is the boba was a little on the al dente, I wished it was slightly softer but overall its worth checking out!
author: Julie C.

description:
Oh, Plentea. You and your fun business model.

Glass bottle (if they don't run out)+your choice of tea+boba+fresh fruit= hell yes, don't mind if I do.

That being said, they aren't terribly quick at moving people through. Slow to order--some of this is customers' faults, they get up and then wax philosophical on what they want--and slow to get the tea out. Only go if you have 20-30 minute to spend waiting.

The good: delicious tea. Cute glass bottle.
The bad: loooong wait time.

Protip: bring your bottle back for a discount next time. Or just keep it on your desk and drink from it. It's highly satisfying. Try it. Tell me how it goes.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Let's be honest, we all went there for the milk jar. However, their milk teas/drinks are not bad at all! My friends and I bought plenty of Plentea today... and soon we were left with none-tea and wanting more.
You get to keep the milk jar and re-use it! 10% off when you bring it back. Also, if they ran out of jars, your drink is automatically discounted :)

I got Oolong milk tea with boba (no sugar). Tasted kind of watered down, tea flavor is there but not enough (tea might need to steep longer). Boba is nice and chewy and not too sweet either! A plus is that they did not put too much ice in the jar so theres plenty of milk tea to enjoy!
I also had a taste of what my friends ordered (they all got regular sweetness) so I will review those too.
Black milk tea with boba - tea flavor is strong (I like!) and the drink is not overly sweet. 
Salted Caramel - So this drink came out in three layers... boba at the bottom, what seems like black tea in the middle, and white foam looking substance (I don't know what this is) on top. The barista handed it to us and told us not to mix it.... are we suppose to drink the tea and foam separately? Anyways, my friend mixed it anyways and wow. It was delicious. Salty caramel flavor ON POINT. Also, as someone who doesn't really like sweet stuff, this drink was not as sweet as i thought! (basically by this point i have come to a conclusion that Plentea drinks are not overly sweet compared to other boba places)
Iced milk with taro & taro pudding - whattt?! they have taro pudding?! I wish I knew! Anyways, is basically milk with taro bits (real taro chunks! gotta chew a bit before swallowing) and chunks of taro pudding.... and I loved it. I have been avoiding taro drinks from places even though I love taro just because a lot of places use taro powder, which makes the drink thick and too rich to drink. However, plentea actually use real taro! 

Service is good. Drinks come out really fast (probably within 2 minutes of ordering). However, the guy who took our order today was not understanding what we wanted... but after repeating ourselves multiple times, he got our orders right.

Parking is always a struggle in the financial district, so plan ahead! Also, the shop is surrounded by other food/snack places so it does get crowded.
author: Jessica L.

description:
boba is $5 minimum here! sure it comes in a nice mason jar but if you order a hot drink, you just get a drink in a regular paper cup! I know it's for safety reasons and I knwo rents are high in the FiDi but there was nothing particular outstanding with my honey lemon tea or my friend's regular milk boba. I'll come back and try some of their fruit tea drinks since that looked popular.

The wait is ridiculously long. There were about 5 people in front of me, but I waited half an hour to get my drink. Part of it was because they messed up, but it still took another ten minutes to make.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Cute hipster set-up in Chinatown. Good location since there's a lot of options around. It's unique that they have the glass jars but really they should consider giving people an option (kind of like how they ask paper or plastic at the grocery store). 

Anyway, the boba is not too mushy nor is it hard as a rock. The teas have a nice flavor although they don't blow me out of my mind. I got the Oolong crema sea-salt which was yummy (and the owner tells you how to drink it right haha), and my friend got a papaya milk tea, which was kind of a flop because it wasn't as flavorful as it should be (felt like they skimped a little on the papaya?). 

Service is better than that of your standard Asian owned place. Since they're new it seems like they're having some rationing issues. For example, my friend and I dropped by about 1-2 hours before closing and there was a sign on the door stating that they ran out of boba. Excuse me but how do you run out of boba...?

Overall, it's a new store with a lot of potential. However, they have many things to work on if they want to survive as the next big boba store in SF.
author: Jolene L.

description: This place is a typical boba shop. Fair in price and pretty tasty but it does not have plenty of variety. Still a good boba shop since it is pretty hard to find one in the area.
author: Sean P.

description:
So much better than Quickly's! I got the Green Milk Tea with Tapioca, no ice. It was quite expensive... Nearly $6. The milk tea is not as sweet--you can actually taste the tea. The boba is either hit or miss- sometimes it's a bit chewy while it can be soft too. I prefer Boba Guys.

The only thing that sets this part is the glass bottle. It's quite heavy which is meh.
author: Emma H.

description:
You can really taste the tea leaves in the oolong milk tea, the boba is delightfully chewy, and the fresh fruit teas are super refreshing on a hot day. It's rare to find any milk tea place in FiDi, so I was pleased to find that the drink quality here is pretty good.

It is rather pricey, but I guess everything downtown is. There is an extremely long line, but I guess everything downtown has one. I am knocking a star for two recently implemented policies:

1) Minimum credit card purchase of $15. This is just unreasonable for a place in the heart of the Financial District whose menu consists mostly of items around $5. How many people are going to wait in that long line only to get to the front and realize they can't pay for the drinks they just ordered? At least give the option of using credit card if we pay a transaction fee.

2) Only 400 bottles given out per day (200 in the morning, 200 starting at 6PM). Considering that the bottles are one of their main marketing schemes, it's highly disappointing to arrive after they've reached their daily maximum.

Tip: Order your drink with less ice. Otherwise it gets pretty watered down.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Came here when there was too long a line at Boba Guys on Stockton... I wonder how many of Plentea's customers have said that.  Plentea offered much more of a selection than Boba Guys, for example, but I thought their boba was so-so.  I had the milk tea with lychee.  My boyfriend had unsweetened coffee with boba.  He said his was not flavorful.  My biggest complaint, being someone who doesn't intend to return given that I am hardly ever in the area of a Plentea, was that we were served our drinks in glass bottles with the Plentea logo.  This is a cute concept and great for returning customers, but for me, it was kind of a burden.  I'm sure the aim is environmental, but I would rather be charged less and get a plastic compostable cup (assuming the glass bottles cost more than those cups).  I am aware I have a slight hoarding problem for things like this.  I asked myself, "Would I ever have the need for a glass bottle?  It wouldn't fit snugly in my car cup holder, and I don't know how tightly the free bottle covers are that Plentea provides, so would I ever want to use it?  It's also not very comfortable to hold, with no handle and direct contact with the cold drink..."  Needless to say, I carried that bottle all the way to the Ferry Building with me, when I came to the realization (as did the rest of my group, one of whom had a Plentea bottle at his condo), that I would never, ever use this thing and it wasn't worth carrying around all day.  I tossed it, annoyed that I had carried it around while I walked, only to decide to throw it away.  And all for an okay serving of milk tea.
author: Christina G.

description:
Decided to check out this place after hearing people rave about it, as well as my best friends. 

I ordered a peach oolong tea and a strawberry oolong tea. $5 for tea and the jar, and 20% off if you reuse the jar. It's pricey and I think having the jar sometimes would be a hassle. 

What I really liked about the tea was that I tasted the sweetness/flavor/syrup of the tea, but I can also TASTE the tea itself. It wasn't strong, the tea wasn't too sweet. It was light and refreshing. This is probably the best tea I've tasted in awhile. Can't wait to come back to SF and buy more!
author: Christine C.

description: I'll give them some slack since today is their first official day of opening. The girl on the register look hella lost and confused and that's probably why they totally forgot to make my drink. Most drinks cost average $5 after tax and that's pretty reasonable since we do get to keep the glass bottle. 10% off the next drink if you bring it back the next time you purchase  something. They have $9 sandwiches and salads if ya wanna eat lunch there. My black milk tea is average...nothing to rave about. I do like the sweet and chewy tapioca. You also can ask them to make the drinks more or less sweet. Also the glass doesn't fit in the car cup holders so don't even bother. Overall a good addition to the financial district.
author: Lisa Z.

description: super love these and eco friendly with the re-usable glass bottles. cant get enough
author: Ashlie S.

description: Finally, a tea house that doesn't serve pebbles for tapioca/boba. This place has a simple menu. Pricier than the rest--probably due to the cool glass bottles--but tasty and worth it.
author: Yumi N.

description:
Hit or miss. Not all drinks are good or bad. If it's your first time here try the fresh fruit milk blue berry or the stick with their house milk tea with boba.

Free glass jar to keep though. Still hunting for the best.
author: Victoria S.

description: Average boba but you get to keep the glass bottle! That in itself pretty much boosted my review up 2 stars. I had the strawberry milk with boba and my best friend had the black milk tea with honey boba. Neither were fantastic but again...that glass jar. We literally talked about how excited we were to keep the jar for like 10 minutes (it's that fun). If you bring the bottle back you get 10% off each purchase. Both of ours were around $5.30. Come for the bottle, leave with some boba.
author: Salma R.

description:
Went there at about 10:15pm and there was a very short wait. Ordered an iced milk tea with tapioca and brown sugar. This particular drink was a bit too sweet for me but despite that the tea has a really fresh taste. My husband had the strawberry fruit milk and it was incredible. We also tasted the strawberry Belgian waffles and they were the best EVER. 

We didn't get a glass bottle since they are only handing 300 a day until July. That part was a bit disappointing. Oh well.
author: Lisette C.

description:
First of all, I love bubble tea, and probably hit up a tea place too many times in a week, but when we walked by and I saw the glasses, I wanted to try it. 

The line was rather long and actually went out the door! The last time I remember having to line up for so long was during the peak of T Pumps in San Mateo. The store is located in a small building, with a second floor balcony overlooking half the store. It looks as if it had a little renovation done to it, giving it a more modern appearance with it's newly done flooring and bright digital menus. There were many choices of teas and toppings including Tapioca, which they said is honey flavored but I couldn't tell. If you were feeling like a snack the menu also had food and desserts to compliment your drink.

The drinks were served almost to the brim in the the milk bottles and definitely got 5 stars in terms of presentation. But, as bubble tea lovers know, it's the drink that really matters and unfortunately, this is where it goes downhill. We had ordered two fresh fruit drinks, and to their credit, they did have pieces of fruit floating in the bottle. They were not filled with too much ice, it felt just enough to keep the drink cold all the way to the end, a very big plus for me as I usually get less ice. The drinks were very sweet, and I think in all the excitement to try a new place, we had forgot to ask to change the sugar level -although it would've been nice to be asked while we were ordering. The tea barely stood out through the onslaught of sugar, and the supposed honey boba tasted like ordinary tapioca; nothing special at all. The egg pudding was pretty good and on point, but didn't stand out in any way. 

Overall, I was kind of disappointed with the drink. I felt like something in an awesome bottle should have been more memorable but the whole time it was just mediocre. I think at $5 a drink, not including toppings, it has some room to improve.
author: Yang L.

description: I am a huge boba fanatic and I've had boba all over and at many places in SF. I think Sharetea is the best, but this place is good. I find the milk jars to be a novelty so I choose to get the plastic cups. Their boba is always a good consistency and perfectly sweet. They use real taro, which is a plus and their teas are really great. My favorite is the sea salt crema oolong. I also love their green tea matcha slush and the milk fruit ones. Papaya being the best. I have to stop myself from going every day!
author: Billy S.

description: I was going to go to Boba Guys, but didn't feel like walking 10 minutes. I got the black honeydew milk tea. It was pretty good. I find the glass jar kinda unnecessary and think a disposable plastic cup and a few dollars off would be better. Regardless, the tea was above average and I would recommend it to others.
author: Sam A.

description: I was so excited to try a new boba place . The glass bottle they have definitely makes your drink look nicer. However, they always run out of tapioca ( may mean theyre selling a lot ). Make sure you call if you want tapioca on your drinks ! Also, One of the guys that work there doesnt seem to know how to do simple math. He was supposed to give us 10% discount for each drink since we brought in our own bottles. He gaves us .25 back instead of a $1.15. And thats besides the fact that he charged us .50 each drink for tapioca when they didnt even have any. Luckily their sea salt caramel oolong and Iced Milk tea with caramel makes up for all the petty mistakes.
author: Reginne B.

description:
Paid a lot more for a lot less.

Plentea is such a hip boba joint. The name initially threw me off, but as soon as my friends and I stepped inside, a smile crept upon my face.

The first thing you'll notice is that the drinks are served in a fancy schmancy glass bottle. It's tall and awesome, and there are lids in the front where you order so you can cap it if you're unable to finish your drink (which is very unlikely).

Their drink selection isn't huge, but it's sure to please everyone who steps in through the door. I opted for the normal milk tea (black). The wait wasn't short, but my friends and I went upstairs to the 2nd floor to chill. Other people were situated up there and it had such a nice, buzzing atmosphere. Everyone seemed friendly and happy, some were also studying.

The drinks tasted great - not too sweet. Like I said, I paid a lot more for worse boba.

The cool glass containers, open hours and quaint atmosphere makes me regret that this visit was not going to be routine. I was visiting some friends up at UC Berkeley and they suggested we try this place for desert.

Hopefully SF will be a place I can call home in the future and I'll be sure to make Plentea among the shops to visit often.
author: Spencer L.

description: Great tea! I loved it, only downside to this place, there is no public restroom. I drank my tea inside, During half way of drinking my tea I needed to pee. But other than that the tea was amazing, I went a little basic and got a regular Thai tea and grass jelly. So only 4 stars since no restroom.
author: Daron P.

description:
Stopped by around 4pm on a Thursday afternoon to grab some milk tea. As expected there was a line of tweens out the door for the new boba spot but luckily the long moved at an even pace. I just went for the green milk tea with less boba though the fresh fruit drinks were enticing. The green milk tea was satisfying and actually tasted tea-like. I ordered less boba (I don't like the usual amount people add) and was happy to see the amount I was hoping for. My friend ordered the sea salt oolong tea which I wasn't a fan of, but some may like the flavor. The combination of sea salt with the oolong and milk wasn't right for my palate. 

Drinks also come in a Plentea branded glass bottle that's yours to keep. You can bring it back in for 20% off your next drink, but I'd prefer that they simply have a deposit that they refund upon return of the bottle like Juice Shop and etc. 

Overall I'd say Plentea is worth a try but not in the afternoon with the after school crowd. Next time I'll try stopping by earlier to avoid the lines.
author: Kellyn W.

description: Love the concept of BYOB for frequent customers. I'm a fan of the green tea, but I wish there was a way to drink it hot in a mug or something instead of a disposable coffee cup.
author: Simon C.

description: Kudos for being so friendly! They are super new (I was there on their day 2 of opening), and the folks are really trying to make sure they cater to their customers. Friends and I got sea salt crema oolong tea and strawberry waffles with green tea ice cream on the side. I personally liked the tea more than dessert - which is good since this is a tea place :) The tea was quite tasty and not too sweet (thank you!).
author: Lindsey O.

description:
Unique upper level seating and a cool atmosphere only to be let down by an unwelcoming barista who served below-average milk tea recipes!

Now you can taste the quality in the ingredients they ordered, but something obviously went wrong from the moment the ingredients were shipped and the drink was handed to me because it did not taste that great at all.. very inconsistent in flavor, with cheap, boring bobas (yes, some places do bobas very good), and very unsavory. 

You can keep their jars, which is cool.
author: J J.

description: We visited Plen Tea when we were in San Fran in October and it was absolutely amazing! The shop was very modern and service was good. Very reasonable price, great tea/coffee and it comes with a souvenir bottle as well. We had sea-salt crema coffee and the premium green tea. Highly recommended!
author: Susan T.

description: Great price which includes the bottle, and also very good quality on the slushes. It's hard to find a good boba place with decent slush/smoothie options, especially that uses real fruit.
author: Eugene H.

description:
Came here on a weekend after my workout and there wasn't much of a line. It was halfway through the day so I did not get the glass bottle. There was a sign saying that glass bottles will be available all day starting July.

I was a little bit skeptical about how good plentea could be..and to my surprise my drink exceeded my expectations! I had the caramel iced milk 50% sweet with egg pudding. I loved the blended ice and freezing cold sweetened milk. If you're a fan of egg pudding you will like it here. The texture is good and so is the flavor!

I will have to come back for more drinks to verify the rating. Their drink variety is pretty interesting (not your typical boba shop). Will be back soon, crossing my fingers for consistency!
author: Stine H.

description: I like to add aloe in my milk tea. However, the milk is too cold( it doesn't have the hot choice). I don't think I will go there in winter.
author: Su Y.

description:
3.5

Maybe I've been spoiled by the plethora of yummy & cheap boba shops in New York that I didn't see the appeal of this place. The black milk tea was okay but not the best I've had. The price point is higher than what I'm used to, but hey, it's San Francisco.
author: Mai N.

description:
Use to be a must-go, not anymore. Service has steadily gone down since September. The drinks are tasty, but the service has left me bitter. So, 2 stars for Service and 3 stars for taste. Advice: don't expect to be served in sequential order and be patient.

No more glass bottles! My roommates introduced me to this place a few months back and I've been hooked ever since. Plus, it doesn't help that I'm only a few blocks away. However, I'm not buying from here anymore after today's experience. 

The guys working the blender were very slow & RUDE. I placed an order for 5 & asked for a status 10-15 minutes after placing my order (I noticed that 6-7 ppl who ordered after me were served first). I asked in a calm manner & their excuse was that they only had one blender. Yet, the 6-7 orders after mine were blended as well (another 2-4 were not blended). The orders were finally ready & when I asked for a container to hold all the drinks, one of the guys says "no we don't have any" while giving me the stank eye...ok, really? A gal making the milk teas was nice enough and gave me a container.
author: Aldenn C.

description: Went here with some friends and a line out the door I knew it would be goooooood! Was not let down. Had the thai tea with milk and boba in a glass bottle that you get to keep or return for a discount off your next one. I'm keeping the bottle. Also, met the owner who was working the register, love him, love this place! I will be making a special effort to visit here more often as I want to try everything on the menu because what I had was so good, I know everything else will be too. Treat yourself, go here!
author: Evening Star B.

description: very nice place to take a rest.   I  ordered a  mocha latte, which tastes very good!  i do not like too sweet,  this drink really meets my need.  Really recommend this place !
author: Jie W.

description:
Most expensive boba I've ever purchased, even with the 20% off because they had no glass bottles! For this more or less $5 drink, I was not impressed...think it was the matcha oolong milk tea? Something like that. But yea, no wow-factor. Quickly's would've satisfied for an even cheaper price.

They're all hype! Only really worth it for the glass bottle, if you're able to even catch them when they have it.
author: Glecie C.

description:
PLENTEA of BAD SERVICE.

Long line, unfriendly service, mediocre green matcha milk tea, no bathroom for customers.

Never coming back.
author: Jiwon M.

description:
Tried this place for the first time today with some friends and I found a piece of glass in one of the tapioca balls. They use those glass milk jugs as cups for the drinks in that place and that is pretty cool. But these glasses break. No my current milk jug that the drink came in was not chipped. 

Maybe they should go back to plastics or paper cups!!! 

WTF.
author: Mary K.

description:
Plentea! I finally got to go here and I didn't realize it was so close to my meeting spot after work. I finish up at 6pm, so I always get here right when they get their deliveries for their fancy glass bottles. I have never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes, though for my first two visits, using card was fine - note that there is now a $15 minimum to charge, so be aware of this before stopping by.

The tea itself is all right. Over the last couple of weeks I had a plain milk tea with boba, a matcha slush, a lavender lemonade, and the brown sugar ice milk with taro pudding. Everything was generally okay except for the matcha slush as it didn't really taste like anything but ice, and it was really difficult to drink out of a glass bottle. Nothing really stood out to me in terms of taste - it is pretty much your run-of-the-mill tea, but dressed cuter. This would be the ultimate gift to give to someone when you're running late or want to leave a good impression on someone's mind - few things are more special than giving someone boba in a capped glass bottle and a smile.

The service itself isn't all that spectacular, I admit. Much of the time they seem flustered or aren't particularly pleased about giving customers more information about a drink or how to order. I imagine that on a bad day, this is not what you want to deal with - if you want a better drink with the same lackluster service, skip the fancy bottle and head over to pretty much anywhere else in the Inner Richmond, Sunset, etc. This may be the outskirts of Chinatown, but it's basically like you're in FiDi, which I think really makes for a better picture of this place.

Overall, it's not bad. You get a discount for bringing the bottle back (which you will probably want, because even if you get two cups of tea/etc. beverage, it's probably not enough for that $15 minimum charge...considering that it's $5-6 a drink). I went there enough times to say that I wouldn't go back unless I am reeeeally craving some overpriced lemonade or something.
author: Robbin A.

description: Best ever!! Good service good boba! The most amazing is that they have reaaaaaly good quality of babo
author: Ching C.

description:
Came in here a few months ago with my boyfriend on a weekday around 3PM.

The line was longish, took about 20 minutes till we got help, and even had to add more time to my parking meter, since I wasn't expecting a wait that long. They also ran out of glass bottles the time I came in, which is so disappointing because that was honestly the only reason why we went in. 

We paid $11 ish for two solo-cup-sized drinks aka two small cups (for boba at least).

I don't know if I want to attempt to come back here just because parking is a hassle, and the bottle (which we didn't even get) makes the drink expensive. The drinks we got were mediocre: thai tea and matcha green tea.
author: Eden G.

description: Decent drinks (milk tea tasted a little diluted), good customer service. cute glass jar, PERFECT boba!
author: Audrey H.

description:
Thoroughly disappointed and I'll explain why. 

Came here around 12:30pm with my friend so we were expecting a bit of a wait but no, holy crap the line was out the door and nearly outside onto the end of the sidewalk. So we wait bc we have some time and finally when we're the next people to be served we see this small AF sign at the cash register that says "Minimum credit card charge $15". Obviously, being in SF who really carries around cash anymore when there are SO MANY other forms of payment. So we left. Time wasted: 15 minutes. They really should have signage announcing that on the outside of boba place so people aren't wasting their time. -1 star. 

Gave this place another shot later that same afternoon at 3:30pm. We were expecting no line but nope! Line out the door again. We finally made it inside and the poor couple in front of us experienced the same "credit card minimum charge" heartache we felt so they left. I'm going to assume this is a common occurrence with Plentea. 

When we finally ordered, they had run out of glass bottles which was a bummer bc most people go for the glass bottles. The gentleman at the cash register offered us 10% off which is honestly not that much bc my milk tea still cost me $4.50. -1 star. 

And what bums me out even more to this day, is that the milk tea was so low quality. It wasn't even strong in the tea flavor, watered down, and lukewarm. I honestly don't think this place is worth the price and time you spend invested in it. 

However, I will say the boba was decent but for $4.50, I would not come here again. Come here if you want to take an IG pic of mediocre milk tea in a glass bottle that they don't even have 90% of the time. Not worth it, bruh.
author: Jo L.

description: Every San Fransico student should go here at least once to put the bottle on Instagram. There. That's the hype. Outside of the cool glass bottle, the tea isn't great. I got the red bean matcha slush and I expected the red beans to be ground in the slush but there were just beans at the bottom of my glass. Outside of that, the matcha slush was lackluster and nothing special. Another detail is that they have a 10$ minimum to use a credit card. This place is mostly hype for the bottle but even if you leave disappointed you only lost 5 dollars and gained a glass cup.
author: Erica M.

description: Tea is a little bit on the pricey side even when you include the glass cost. What's with the new name trends like plentea or tastea (socal). The oolong milk tea was pretty good. Might be more on the milkier side. Boba is soft and chewy. If you bring the glass back its a 20% discount. They run out pretty fast. Also I think everything tastes a lot better in a fancy jar !
author: Vincent L.

description: Such a cute place! This location is small but it comes with two levels. Drinks come in a glass jar that you can take home with a plastic lid. I ordered the oolong milk tea with egg pudding and it was good!  May not be the best milk that I've ever had, but I will drink it anyway. They do provide food at this location, but no finger foods though.  Make sure you check into their location on yelp to utilize their current 25% discount.  The most disappointing part about this location is the bathroom.  They have one but it's only for employees!  Surrounding establishments will not have public restrooms so keep that in mind as you're finishing your drinks here.
author: Sue T.

description:
This place is so boooomb! Every time a friend visits I bring them to this place. I think the concept of serving their drink in glass milk bottles is totally awesome--as long as it doesn't detract from the actual quality of the drink,  which it doesn't!! It's great--the drinks are delicious and my friends are always ecstatic about their little souvenir! 

Anyways aside from the novelty of the glass containers, their drinks are actually really great. I usually like to judge a boba show based on how they make their taro drinks,  and they do it right! It's creamy and smooth but they actually put little taro chunks in there too! 

LOVE IT :)
author: Nancy W.

description: Walked in wanting to try out the hype and was very disappointed. Ended up costing $14 for only two drinks!! AND I ordered a strawberry slush which ended up being watery and tart. Not even close to sweet. Their boba is eh. It's small and not sweet or the right texture. I would NOT RECOMMEND going here if you don't have to! Overpriced for a horrible drink and boba!
author: Jessica W.

description: Came to try out this new place since it seems pretty interesting. I ordered peach green teas; they put real peach in it. This drink really disappointed me.. It tasted really weird especially the peach. Maybe it's not the season yet?!? I wouldn't order this drink if I ever come back this place.
author: Susanna H.

description: Finally, I came here for the so called milk tea and its bottle.i have to say, they over charge the milk tea and the container.Their milktea taste like...I don't even know how to describe it...too heavy and a taste of plastic...it does not worth all the waiting. Maybe their flavored tea taste wayyy better than the milktea, but I don't wanna give a try anymore.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Okay okay, so yes the bottle is what made me come here during my once in a full moon drive to Chinatown during a day off. 

So I got the peach green tea with boba and mine tasted incredible. Not incredibly sweet and you can definitely taste the freshness of the fruit and the blend. The bottle is a clever idea and definitely innovated to make me want to collect more (even though the purpose to come back and reuse the bottle to get a discount on your next drink... Nope. It's added to my bottles to put my juices to go)

The three star is for service and well getting our other drink wrong. My bf ordered their mango smoothie, with promises of using fresh ingredients. It took a loooooong time to get our drinks. And on top of that, if we weren't staring at the counter for our drinks, then seriously we would have not known our drinks was ready bc they never called our number or name or our drinks. Crunched on time, we grabbed and left bc we had places to go. Got in the car and then we realized, as wonderful as my drink was, my bf ended up with honeydew instead of mango and you would think... Wouldn't you notice the color? Yeah well when you're in a rush you don't notice a lot. Hopefully a wrong will be righted the next time we visit... But we're in no hurry to return.
author: Hepsie C.

description: Match  red bean slush is the BEST that I ever had . Will be back for more . The service is great, friendly and they know what they are doing .keep up the the good work.
author: Judy M.

description:
This place is alright, it has a decent seating capacity. Honestly, I only go here for the cool looking glass bottles that I can re-use. My first time here was a pretty good experience, but my second time here I found a really sharp small piece of plastic in my drink. There was no way I could have gotten it inside my drink either because it was sealed and I had nothing plastic near me whatsoever. It's a good thing that I caught it before I swallowed it because it was pretty damn sharp lol. I brought it up to the cashier and he didn't really do much other than apologize, didn't offer to replace it or anything. 

It's an alright place to go to if you're looking for a joint to sit at while you eat Sushiritto and if you want cool looking glass bottles. But other than that... it's nothing too great. I don't think I'll be coming back here after this incident.
author: Cindy N.

description: Love the drinks and bottles. I thought it wouldn't taste good since the bottles are their selling point but I really enjoyed my matcha with red bean. My boyfriend enjoyed his avocado milk too.
author: Amy G.

description:
Do yourself a favor and get the sea salt crema oolong tea with honey boba. You're welcome!

I'm from LA and this is one of the few boba places in SF that actually can compete with them. Their honey boba is delicious and their flavors are pretty awesome. The glass bottle that it comes in is also a great perk. All in all, I definitely think this place is worth a visit. I just hope it doesn't go the way of T-pumps with their ridiculous lines.
author: Ty L.

description: Great drinks cool little place to chill, Awesome service and quick very original and you can take the cool bottles or leave them but when if you bring it back next time you get a discount. Tasty drinks I am deff coming back and the prices are very reasonable and if you don't know what or how to order the cool guy will help you in what you should try for the first time. BOMB it's like a cool taro but better toppings and diff flavored.
author: Alex E.

description: A bit expensive but it is in the SF so I guess it okay. I love going here for the bottles and love how unique it is. With the price it's like I'm basically buying the bottle though. I've had better tea before and the desert was kind of too sweet for me. I've gone there few times and I'm not saying I regret it but because it's so over priced I'm scared to try new things.
author: Sul L.

description: The drinks are good and the decor is nice. I really like how they put the teas in glass bottles and we are welcome to take them home. Overall enjoyed the black milk tea:) will be back again.
author: A. P.

description:
Like everyone else, came here because of the glass bottles that's given with the drink. They only give out 300 glass bottle a day so definitely stopping by after work was already too late for it. But the good thing is that they give you 20% off the drinks if its not in a glass bottle. I ordered the sea salt creama tea and it was alright. I feel like no one but Sharetea can make creama drinks correctly. The only thing I enjoyed about my drink was the boba.

Either way, not bad for a boba place in the FiDi. I wouldn't mind stopping by here again.
author: Nikki W.

description:
I'm a big tapioca milk tea drinker and if I have to compare this to other boba places, this place has a lot of opportunity to make it big while it's still new. I guess what lures people here is the glass bottles their drinks come in AND you get to keep it! You can bring these bottles back for 10% off your next drink. The price of the drinks range from $4.25-$4.95. If you want toppings, it's another 50 cents. 

I ordered the Iced Oolong Milk Tea with honey tapioca. The tapioca was bland... just chewing on soft, chewy dough. However, I liked the milk tea.

I also ordered the Strawberry Fresh Fruit Milk. I expected this drink to be sweet but it's very subtle. Some might call it bland but for the ones who likes it less sweet... you might like this. Besides strawberry flavor, there's many other flavors to choose from including avocado, honeydew, and papaya! Flavors you don't see everywhere.

Per drink rounds to be $5. It is overpriced, and I can do without the glass bottle even if I get 10% off my next drink. I doubt I would plan when to bring the glass bottle from home to go get me a drink. I'm spontaneous about drinks!!! I get it when I want it!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Came here a few times in the past 2 months and got something different every time. The price is definitely on the higher side for boba (around $5 per drink), but hey...it comes with a adorable glass bottle. The drinks are alright, nothing too spectacular, but I do like the lavender lemonade. 

Bring the bottle back for a discount on your drink! And $10 minimum purchase before they will let you slide your card.
author: Wendy C.

description:
This is definitely one of those milk tea shops where you've heard about it so much that you just HAVE to go try it. If not for the drinks themselves then for the ability to talk about said drinks afterwards.

The single defining characteristic of Plentea is the cute milk bottle they hand out with every drink. (I think I've accumulated four by now....) It's quite eco-friendly, and you have the added benefit of bringing back your bottle for a discount. (10 whole freakin' percent.) Although the general problem I've noticed is, I don't decide ahead of time whether or not I want Plentea, and by the time I pass it and decide that I do want something to drink... well, there's another bottle for me.

The drinks themselves are definitely solid, but not mind-blowing. I've had their regular black milk tea, jasmine green milk tea, and sea salt crema with oolong tea. I always leave satisfied with the taste of my tea, but as I mentioned earlier, the tea tastes the same as any other decently upstanding milk tea shop. At $4.50 a bottle for milk tea and $4.95 for crema, I would also be perfectly happy going to Sharetea, for example, and getting an equally good milk tea for $3.50 and creama for $4.25. 

Giving Plentea 3 stars for decent yet overpriced milk tea.
author: Dale W.

description:
There is NO wi-fi. Now that that is out of the way...it's my first time here and I order the Sea Salt Crema Oolong tea. If you like the Sea Salt green tea drink from 85 Degrees bakery, you'll like this one. Salty-sweet creaminess all mixed with the delicious taste of Oolong tea. Fantastic. I also love that they serve waffles, both savory and sweet!
