The reusable glass bottle is a great idea, especially if you've ever seen a garbage can outside of a T-Pumps filled with all of cups and straws. Bring the bottle back and they give you a discount on your drink. 

A fantastic first impression. I'll be back to try more of the teas and food. And hopefully they make their way down to the Peninsula.
author: Brian L.

description: Went on a Saturday and the line was ridiculously long. They changed the boba containers so they're not as cute as they were before, and the price and quality are average for the city.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
3.5
The gig here is that you get to keep their glass jug after your purchase otherwise the teas are relatively average with the exception of the oolong tea sea salt creama. Just as good as the 85 degree bakery one. Boba is above average with nice chewy texture and slightly sweetened. If I were in the chinatown, downtown area, I would probably go here.
author: Robert Y.

description: No jars when we came in afternoon. A gem in the financial district. Taro milk tea was great. This is my new favorite boba place in bay area. The store looks clean as well. We chilled upstairs after buying our drinks. Will definitely come back for tea and the milk bottle
author: Winnie W.

description: 3.5 glass bottles, push up the price but can be useful.  tiny bobas if you like that style.  had a mango slushee with real mango but a bit more watery.
author: Rob C.

description: I had one of their fruit teas and it was alright. The store is easy to miss, so keep an eye out for it. The bottles are really cute though and I love the upstairs floor they have!
author: Emily N.

description: So delicious!!!! I have tried several of their teas, but today I tried fresh fruit slush (avocado) and fruit tea (strawberry). Sooooooooo yummy and refreshing. Ordered through Postmates :)
author: Celia V.

description: I've been to quite a few tapioca places around the bay area and this is one of the better upscale ones. What sets them apart are the flavors (macha, nutella, etc.) and the quality glass bottles you get to keep with each order. Thing to note is that the inside is small, has limited seating and out of the way from Union Square (if that's where you're coming from). But if you can make the walk there and don't mind standing, you won't regret trying Plentea.
author: Marc Y.

description: I got the honey jujube tea and my hubby got the blueberry fruit slush.  Both were yummie yumm yummzzz. The boba attracts my older daughter too.You can also check in and get 15% of when you buy two drinks, and we like that because value is what keeps us coming back. Most we spend is about $5 to $7 per drink and that's great for a treat for the family. We will recommend and return.
author: Doris G.

description:
freaking garbage.  charge 5$+ for drink.  send me on a wild goose chase to find a god damn bathroom

edit:  i was mad cause i was about to pee my pants.  and i very clearly remember coming here before and using the restroom.  maybe it was a different business.  that being said. its not fair to review business on that alone. i asked the girl at counter where she used the bathroom and she said the parking garage down the block.  i know its out of her hands but i didnt appreciate the obviously false statement. 

ive upgraded a few stars.  the glass jar the drink came in was nice but too big for the drink holders. or too square.  the drink was ok but i felt had too many floaty bits.   

i think if i come by this way again. ill try it again.  the drinks are quality. i just chose wrong.   the food looks worth a try. next time.
author: Irvin S.

description:
So my husband has been raving about Plentea's boba milk tea for some time now because they cater to his office frequently. We have been searching for great boba in walnut creek/concord area for months and I finally had an opportunity to visit this past sat. We managed to get street meter parking right out front and the place has a cool vibe, top hits music playing and a neat lounge upstairs. 
The menu is well versed, your typical selection of milk teas, the even have fruit milk, fruit smoothies and their food selections looked good. I was so happy to see matcha green milk tea!!! My husband got the caramel milk tea which was a bit sweet for my tastes. 
4 stars because they do not have restrooms available (not good if you have kids in tow), and the girls behind the counter were very friendly to your face but I could hear inappropriate conversation going on...
They have a card minimum of $15 which seems a bit crazy for a boba place and their prices for their drinks range from $5-6. Now you do get a cool glass container which you can bring back for discounted drinks in the future. Too bad I don't live in the city, but I will definitely be back after I try the Japanese curry place a few doors down.
author: Justina L.

description:
Had to try this place because I wanted to be hip and cool and fit in with all the popular kids with a cool Instagram picture of my tea in a bottle. .
Came tonight (Wednesday around 10PM to avoid to crazy lines I've been hearing about) and there was no line, but they were out of tapioca/boba/pearls/whatever you hip kids call those black ballz. SAD FACE. I don't usually get balls but I was gonna bringing one back for man friend and he loves balls in his mouth. Too bad for him. No balls tonight. 
I got the peach green tea w/ aloe for me (not bad, but nothing special I'd travel across the city for again) and the honeydew milk for him (fresh honeydew, but meh) 
My drink buddies got the strawberry oolong (Maybe it's an acquired taste but the boys did NOT like it. Gag reflex and all @ first sip.)  and peach black tea w/ lychee  jelly (so ugly, but tasted the best of the 4 drinks we ordered).
We sat upstairs to enjoy our meh drinks, and it's nice and cozy. Only about 5 small tables-- some hip rustic wooden ones w/ matching chairs and whatnot. Yep. 
Anyway, the bottles are the only thing they really have going for them. (Bring it back to refill for 10% off your drink).
See my cool hip picture? 
That's about all I'll ever want from this place. I'll revisit if I'm in the neighborhood, but never across the city for this again. Got my bottle and picture, PEACE! ^_^v

P.S. I went to Wonderful Foods right after and got man friend his favorite milk tea and poured it in my empty Plentea glass HAAHA. WF is already 5 stars, but 5.5 when drinking it out of a glass jar. Heheh #win
author: Melissa Y.

description: I loved the matcha latte and the boba was perfect! It wasn't mushy and wasn't too hard. The matcha latte wasn't overly sweet and milky. I would definitely recommend this to all of my friends!
author: Sofia S.

description: If you like Boba Tea, this is a great place to get it. I go here every Monday with friends and sometimes after work. I am always very satisfied with the quality of the tea. I also love that you get to keep the Glass Bottle! However be careful, the glass bottles are not super durable and will break if you try to put hot water in them.
author: Josiah W.

description: Consistently excellent milk teas! The regular black milk tea is great, but my favorite is the almond milk tea. I also love the glass bottles that the drink comes in and have a growing collection sitting in my kitchen cabinet.
author: Mina K.

description: I gave it a 4 because I like the fact that I can keep the glass bottle as a souvenir. I've only been there once and I tried the regular milk tea with pearls (around $5.5). The milk tea isn't the best. Strong tea flavor and not sweet enough for me. 2.9 out of 5 for black milk tea.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Drinks are good, the boba is chewy, bottle is cool, but they should give an option of getting drinks in a normal disposable cup so you don't have to shell out $5 for a boba drink. 

Too expensive for boba. Went once for the novelty bottle, but I'll probably stick to TenRen or Boba Guys if I'm in that area.
author: C. Z.

description: This place is so much fun! It's nice that checking in on Yelp gives a 25% discount, and a big part of the allure of this place are the cute glass bottles that your drinks come in! The tea is quite tasty and for some of the drinks, it's even fun watching the servers prepare and taste your drink to make sure it's well made! The boba bubbles themselves aren't my favorite kind, they're a bit on the harder side, with a sort of tangy flavor inside, but some people prefer that type.
author: Lucy G.

description: My go-to tea place! I like their salted creame oolong very much but not the milk tea. One extra star for the glass bottle.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
I got the salted crema oolong milk tea with egg custard which I really liked. The selection of different teas and toppings was good too...there were milk teas, fresh fruit teas, yogurt fruit teas. The glass bottles are a nice look and also practical. It's nice to get the discount when I reuse it, which pretty much gives you a free topping.

I'd rate this place only 3.5 stars mainly because of the price.  Though I do realize they're in a prime location in FiDi, $5+ is ridiculous for boba and their service is slower than what I'm use to at other boba places. There's always a long line. I will gladly walk to further places for more reasonably priced boba but sometimes I'll indulge here since they do have flavor and topping options I can't find nearby.
author: Lisa V.

description:
Where the milk tea hype is at.

It's pretty cool how you get a glass bottle, very unique indeed.
I can go back with this bottle next time and get a discount.. woo hoo

I ordered the Thai milk tea with tapioca, it was okay, and the tapioca was pretty good.

PROS:
-cool bottle

CONS:
-long lines
author: Joy L.

description: Knew this place must be good when I saw a line out the door. Let's open one of these in Marin. We need you.
author: Beryl N.

description: I visited Plentea today with my friends to see what the new hype was all about. I ordered the crema oolong milk tea with boba, but only had 3/4 of the bottle filled with milk tea and the rest with cream foam. Maybe I am biased because I just came back from Taipei, where the boba is incredible and inexpensive, but Plentea is overpriced and average. You are basically paying more for the glass bottle and the environment.
author: Emily F.

description:
After seeing all the co-workers walking around the office with  Plentea glass bottles, I had to go see what the hype was all about.

We arrived a little after the lunch rush, so I was a bit surprised that there were still glass bottles left, but glad to have gotten one!  And there wasn't a line either, another plus! A friend went with the regular Milk Tea with tapioca, and I went with the Honey Lemon Tea with tapioca.  Took about 5 minutes or so, we capped our drinks and were on our way - super portable! You can also choose to sit in the store as well, as they have a few seats around, but a majority of the patrons take their orders to go.

The price itself, was pretty on point with everything else in this area, hovering around $4 a drink.  If you do bring back your glass bottle, I believe you receive 10% off your drink order.

I appreciated the ability to adjust the sweetness level of the drinks, because milk tea can get pretty sweet. All in all Plentea is a pretty solid place head to in the FiDi for a standard tapioca drink, and so far the only one.  My friend and I really enjoyed our drink, and will definitely be back soon when our milk tea cravings cave in, which will be soon, unfortunately for me...
author: Cindy L.

description: I was eating at Ramen Underground on a Saturday when I saw people walking around with cool boba in a bottle. They were open for a day or two when I walked in so there were a lot of things to be worked out. I got the sea salt creme oolong with boba. The gimmick is the bottle, there was nothing outstanding about their tea in my opinion. The pearl was a little hard in the middle and overly chewy on the outside. I think I paid over $5 for my drink and I didn't think it was anything that I'd drive out to the FiDi for. The girl behind the counter kept chatting away saying they were open late. If I want boba, I have plenty to choose from in the Sunset.
author: Adelina W.

description:
Since moving out of the Sunset, I've been looking for a place to fulfill my boba cravings and I think I've found the place :D

I always order the classic black milk tea whenever I go to new boba shops. Because if they can't do black milk tea right then what's the point, right? I asked for my black milk tea to have only half the amount of sugar and it was the best decision I made that day. The milk tea still had lingering tastes of "tea". The drink wasn't drowned with milk. It was a beautiful blend of two flavors, a perfect base to the perfectly prepared tapioca. To top it off the experience, my drink was served in a reusable glass bottle! There was even a cap so I had the option to toss it in my bag or save it for later!
author: Michelle W.

description: Very innivative desert drinks. My Asian Fusion drinks love affair continues with this place. I love the Sea Salt crema oolong tea top.with custard. Flavors so complimentary.  It seems like you are drinking a custard drink that is creamy yet so light and refreshing. The lavander limeade with lychee jello..a well balanced.drink that is a symphony to taste bud. I loved how it served on a mill glass bottle.  Put this one on your list to try when in SF.
author: Ron D.

description: Went for the first time Sunday afternoon. Hooked after the first visit. They have cute, reusable, glass bottles that get you an automatic discount every time you bring it back. Uh...how awesome is that? The drinks were amazing. I really love the Sea Salt Oolong Tea because anything with Seasalt is yummy. They're new, but definitely worth the visit!
author: Mariana C.

description:
This place is like any other boba place, but just a bit better & I like it! It had just opened & my friend told me about it so we decided to go try it out. 
I came here on Labor Day. I ordered a Caramel Milk Tea w/ Taro Pudding & she ordered just a regular Milk Tea because she didn't know what to get. Line was long, waited about 5-10 minutes maybe. Got out drinks, posted on Instagram & everyone was just like omg tfti, lol. My friend liked my drink so much, she wanted to trade with me haha. We bought them in the glass bottle so next time if we come again, we'd get a discount. We did come again the 2nd time with our bottles & I noticed they don't give back your original bottle. It was actually a different one, either a new bottle or bottle someone else brought it. Maybe they meant to do that, or maybe they mixed it up. I would still come here once in a while. I just don't like how it's kind of pricey overall for a drink. 
They have chalkboards as menus. There is an upstairs & downstairs for you to sit. Not only they have boba, they have some desserts too. But I never tried it yet. Really bright inside with their glass windows. I like it.
author: Ivy Q.

description: I came here of course because of the hype that you get a glass bottle with your drink. I ordered the fruit smoothie milk drink with tapioca, it was tasty but not sure if it was actually worth the $6.95 on top of that I also ordered the waffles with strawberries and nutllea, i believe that was lacking flavor, they just drizzled nutella over the waffles and I was expecting it to be a lot sweeter. i wasn't totally impressed but I would try other drinks here. Beware that the line is literally out the door and you'll wait at least 15 min if not more.
author: Irma R.

description:
So I was very excited to see a tea shop in the area. Upon excitedly walking in, the person behind the cash register who had about 0 friendliness about her informed me that this place does NOT serve hot drinks. How very lame and disappointing. I have no intention of sipping iced drinks in 40 degree cold.

Furthermore, upon deciding to give this place a second chance, I tried their belgian waffle dish. It was beautifully served but the flavor was underwhelming. Not a fan.
author: Diana B.

description: The boba tea here is delicious and probably my favorite in SF. I also love that it is served in glasses that can be taken home. The prices are high but standard for SF.
author: H K.

description: I have never spent $6 on boba let alone on taro. I know that some tea places can be quite expensive, however, if you're spending a lot of money, especially for a drink...then you are definitely looking for high-quality boba. I went here with my friends after an evening walking around the city and we all come from socal (where boba lives, thrives and is of genuine nature) so when we came upon this place on yelp we were expecting HQ. Unfortunately it did not live up to its hype and I was just left disappointed, with my taro milk tea..3 Stars for the amazing customer service though!
author: Isabel B.

description:
Plentea is a joyous hang out, talk with your friends, eat, and do the things you like probably instagram and Facebook or whatever it is people like. I think that their jars of boba drinks are amazing!! Once you drink their drinks you won't be disappointed! 
The Jars are my weakness!!!
author: Shan M.

description: Wanted to try a new place and thought the glass bottles were a neat idea. Not bad but not worth the price of a glass bottle. There are other tea places that are just as good or better for cheaper.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I came by around 6 something with some friends after a tired day of running around the city. It was a pretty quick line and the cashier was nice. She was super easygoing, polite. The drink was fast too. I ordered 3 drinks and within 5 min, it was ready. 

Great customer service, drinks and a nice upstairs eating(/drinking) area. 
+for the glass bottle, my mom reuses it for homemade tea on the go!
author: Jae L.

description:
Guess the novelty of this place has worn away because I came in and there was no line. It was well past noon and yet I was still able to score a glass bottle. No line, no wait. 

The prices for the drinks are expected from this area... It's part Fidi/Chinatown. They have rent to pay people. 

I got the Creama Oolong Tea and it was quite delicious. I added some honey tapoica.  I'm not a fan but I always try out new places and these were soft and chewy. Goes well with the drink. 

I'll be back with my bottle for my 10%. I like this place better than the other boba offerings in the fidi. It doesn't say too much because the offerings are bleak but this is definitely a good place to go.
author: Jeannie L.

description: Really good customer service! I really didn't enjoy my drink at first sip. I let them know and they changed it for me. You earn my review Plentea! Worth the trip to the city!
author: Christine J.

description: This place gets pretty busy, considering that, the wait wasn't too long for our drinks. The glass bottle that they put their drinks in are cute and an awesome idea for reusable purposes. Not too sweet, overall a great place to get your tea/boba fix.
author: Sammie A.

description: Meh. Kinda pricey for average drinks. The glass bottles are cute, I guess, but I felt stupid walking around the city drinking from a glass jar. I think Boba Guys and Sharetea are better.
author: Paulina L.

description:
To be honest, I was only really excited to try this place because of the cool glass bottles. I went for my regular, Green Milk Tea with pearls, and my boyfriend got the Honeydew Fresh Milk. The cost of drinks are a bit pricier, but it's just like any other milk tea spot since you're paying for the cost of the bottle in the price. 

My drink was not sweet enough for me. Maybe it's because of the green tea but the pearls didn't help either (though they were the right amount of chewy). My boyfriend's honeydew drink was interesting though. There were pieces of honeydew in them! It was a bit too sweet for my liking; I almost wished we could have mixed our two drinks together, then it would have been perfect (I think...). 

Next time I'll definitely try something else, and stick around to have them adjust sweetness levels if I don't like it.
author: Kim N.

description: I have tried the peach fruit milk and strawberry oolong tea. Both were really good. Its a nice idea to give them in glass bottles. Eco friendly and stylish.
author: Namrata J.

description:
The drink itself is thirst quenching but I don't crave specifically for Plentea's tea. Haha but the glass bottles are cute! Which is probably why there's so much hype about it and the line can get really long. ._____. 

I get it frequently because it's the most decent one from work but I recommend holding off on the boba/pearls -- they're tasteless and too firm.
author: Johnny F.

description:
Their reusable bottles are so cute I wish I were a local so I could come back regularly with it and get the 10% discount. I had the black milk tea with pudding and ice milk and two separate occasions. Both were delicious. The second time I came it was just past closing and they served me anyway. I was very grateful.

It is kind of pricey and there will be a long line during peak hours but I like the drinks so I think its worth it.
author: Christine D.

description: My friend Nick got the fresh fruit smoothie (strawberry) and I got the peach fresh fruit tea. Both of us got tapioca. Next time I want to try the sea salt crema oolong tea with either tapioca or pudding.
author: Jeff B.

description: Pretty tasty boba place. The concept is cute and teas are fresh. You get to keep the cool glass jars that they come with. The drinks are more pricey than other boba places. They range from 5-7$ depending on what you get. When I went there was a line out the door. Pretty popular place and they are pretty close to Chinatown. The sea salt creama is a must try. Nice and creamy.
author: T L.

description:
Was home in the Bay Area for July 4th weekend, and I saw all these AWESOME bottles on Instagram, so I was like I NEED THIS. Rounded up 4 other friends, so that we could carpool to SF just to try this new place, as well as get the bottle.  I read one of the earlier reviews, saying they arrived just before they opened since there is a limited supply of bottle to get one, and originally that was the goal, but two of my friends had a slight time conflict, and we ended up showing up around 12:45.  The whole way there I was actually semi-stressed because it's about a 40 minute drive from where I live, so I was like WHAT IF WE DROVE ALL THIS WAY AND WE GET NO BOTTLES. But, praise the lord, they still had bottle when we arrived haha.  I'm guessing because it was a Sunday that parking was extremely easy to find.  I parked pretty much outside the shop, and then walked in.  The decor was fairly modern looking, and there is an upstairs. However, I immediately notice a few drawbacks about the decor.  Somewhat tight, but it's SF, so what can you do, but this led to all the tables on the first floor seating only 2 individuals, so for a group of 5, we took up 3 tables.  Also, I had no freaking clue that to the right of the register was a huge chalkboard that had FOOD ITEMS.  I was so busy looking forward at the drink menu, that I never noticed this.  Such a shame because some of the items sounded really exciting.  I also believe none of my friends noticed the food menu either.  Since I commuted so far, I went what the hell, I might as well get several bottles... LOL. So I decided to try three different drinks.  I got the iced milk with brown sugar and pudding,  the green milk tea with pearls, and a strawberry smoothie with pearls.  All came out pretty quickly, and I was actually extremely satisfied with all 3 drinks.  The level of sweetness is pretty good. It's just sweet enough that you can still taste the drink flavor and flavor from the pearls, but not overly sweet.  Although I really do enjoy the drinks, the price was a little bit steeper than I expected.  Granted I knew I'd be paying for the bottle, but if I were to just get it in a plastic cup, it's 20% off, but most of these drinks were 5$ or more, so that's only about a dollar off, and I think the plastic cup size is 12oz, so yup quite steep.  But at least it's good quality pearls and drinks, so I guess if I were ever in the area again, I would be down to stop by and grab a drink.  Location-wise, I think it's quite good, as it's nestled close to Union Square and Chinatown, but I can see how during peak hours it'd be difficult to find parking.  I would recommend this place to my friends only for the bottle, or if they were in the area.


P.S.  I noticed I keep talking about the bottle, and I'm sure if you see the bottle in the photos on here, you'd know what I'm talking about, but they have a disclaimer that they only give out 300 bottle a day, which is why I was in a rush originally! I'm not sure how long this promotion is going on for though.

:D
author: Brendan D.

description: The best tasting tea fruit fusion I've had do far.  Cool store in a cleaner part of Chinatown. And they let you keep the glass bottle!
author: Daryl D.

description: Already addicted to the milk tea here!  My friends and I like to come by and hangout upstairs.  The drinks are excellent.  I've had the milk tea and ice milk with brown sugar, both are good along with all the other drinks shared with my friends.  You get to keep the glass bottle and cap - which is nice.  Don't forget to check in for a 25% discount!
author: Kevin N.

description:
Yummy tea, awesome glass bottle, 10% discount when you bring it back, right next to Ramen Underground. 

TEN OUTTA TEN.
author: Allie W.

description:
Yum. I really enjoyed the first time I visited Plentea. To be safe, I tried the green milk tea which I thought was really good. It did get a little watery so I'll remember to tell them to put less ice next time but overall, the flavor was delicious. They had some really interesting flavors so I'll definitely be back to try them. 

On top of that, it's a very SF thing to do, but the cute glass bottles they serve with the drink make the experience even better. I do admit that it does get a little pricey for one glass of boba, but it's definitely something to try!
author: Malika R.

description:
Longgggggg lines and no AC. Bad combo for this heat wave. Aside from that the drinks aren't half bad. We got the honey lemon black tea (tastes just like Lipton's brisk tea) and the green fruit tea in honeydew. Both were definitely refreshing and came in cute glass bottles which justifies the hefty price tag of about $5 each... Sorta. Don't expect Tpumps prices here people!

Their business model reminds me of juice shop's but Asian style! If you don't want to keep your glass bottle you can return it for 20% off your next drink (about a dollar off?). I think it's a better value to keep your bottle and turn it into a vase of some sort, but that's just me :)
author: Kristen C.

description:
Plentea has good but slow service. There is only one cashier so the wait is longer than other tea places. But, the making of the tea is moderately fast. 
They serve the tea in cute multi use glass jars which makes the drink more expensive than other places but if you bring the cup back, the drink is 20% off!
The aroma in the store is really good and makes your mouth water. In addition to teas and other drinks, they serve waffle sandwiches and deserts too. Although I didn't get any food, I'm definitely coming back to get it. 
The food is a little expensive but it will be something fun to try. It's a great place to have a date or just to hang out with friends. Definitely a place to try!
author: Sharon G.

description:
I don't really live in SF, but when I do I know just where to go for some fantastic milk tea bobas. 


This place is very cute in the inside. It's quite packed, but people seem to be friendly anyway which doesn't bother me one bit that it is packed. As long as the environment is welcoming then it's good enough for me! 

I've tried other boba places whenever I do come to SF, but the quality isn't so great. I guess it's just because Im used to SoCal Boba drinks. Who knows. 

BUT this is one place I will never forget. ONE PLACE  I will always come back too. 

What makes it even better is that they have their own custom made milk jugs which you get to keep. :)
author: Sandy T.

description: Went on a Saturday around 1pm and I was surprised there was no line! The boba u can get at any boba place, the appeal is obvi the glass bottles. I got the brown sugar milk w/ tapioca and it was good! Not $6 good but good nonetheless. I basically paid for $6 milk in a glass bottle. I'd say try it out just for the experience. I'd go back if I were to visit China town but wouldn't go outta my way to come again.            Ps- parkings a bit*h
author: J J.

description: Pretty expensive boba and the price is only worth it if you get their cool milk bottle glasses. I wish they would have more tea flavor options. I've tried the avocado milk but it was given lukewarm so that was a weird experience. I did like the papaya milk as that is a flavor you can't get everywhere. I go here because its closest to my work but I'd rather go elsewhere. Also last time they didn't have the bottle and instead of telling me this before I pay just says 'I gave you a 10% discount'. Lame!
author: Erin T.

description: It's OK.  The boba was a bit tough.  I wouldn't go again unless I had no other options.
author: Jacob A.

description:
I came here twice. I initially did not enjoy Plentea and I did not plan on any future visits. But when my coworker convinced me that I ordered the wrong drink, I decided to give it another shot. Last time I ordered the oolong milk tea with boba.

I came here again on the weekend with DD and the line was long bit manageable. This time we ordered the milk tea with boba again but with black tea as per my coworkers suggestion. I can say that it's one of the better tasting boba shops in town! The milk to tea ratio has been consistent for both visits but if you're like me and appreciate a strong tea presence, the black tea finishes it off well! 

The place is quite big for the FiDi area with an upstairs seating area. Modern natural decor. And they serve your drinks in glass bottles where you can receive 10% back on your next drink if you return with it (limited supply). 

Will I return? Yes I would.

Recommendation: Milk tea and boba with black tea.
author: Henry P.

description:
Ever wanted to use the words "boujie" and "boba" in the same sentence? Well this is your chance!

Plentea is new to these Chinatown/Financial District parts, but it's fancy enough for it most definitely. 

I had to knock a star off for the price - this is EXPENSIVE. 

Knocked another star off for the service. I know they're just trying to get their bearings since they're new. In a month they'll be smooth sailing. But for now, just not convenient enough. 

Don't forget to bring the glass bottle back for 10% off. Or you know, use it as a vase.
author: Genevieve L.

description: I primarily wanted to go here for the fact that they serve bubble tea in glass bottles (something that you do not see on the East Coast). I ordered their special iced nutella milk tea ($4.95) and it tasted like chocolate milk. Toppings are extra at $0.50 a pop. In general, their drinks are a little more expensive than I'm use to. However, I would go back to give them another shot but just order something else.
author: Maxine C.

description: Pretty decent. 10/10 would eat at again. I ordered a red bean tea and that gave me a red bean tea so I was pretty happy
author: Androo D.

description: I am not a fan of this place's tea, but their bottle are cute and the service was good. It was clean inside! Their little snack section is nice and a discount for bringing your bottle back is a good perk! I didn't try the food but it looked good as well. However, after trying three times, neither my friend nor myself could find anything that really tasted good. The almond milk tea is not good at all, with an almost spicy, astringent flavor, and the peach milk tasted like yoplait yogurt blended with milk :( For the price, it was not worth it.
author: Kaitlynn S.

description: Cute bottles and pretty good boba (though I only like the simple green tea, myself). Bring back the bottles for 10% discount the next time, but this only works if you don't break it at home (oops!). I'm coming back this week for more. Small venue, but it's great when it isn't packed.
author: Ameryl L.

description:
Pretty decent! One of the better tasting tapioca I've had, really chewy which is what I like! They use real tea so thats cool. I like the honey tapioca flavor, instead of just plain, non flavored. Pricey but I can forgive that since you get to keep their cute glass jar cups, I'm gonna put it to good use! 

We got the iced milk tea w/ egg pudding and honey tapioca, and a sea salt crema oolong tea w/ grass jelly. I could skip on the egg pudding and the grass jelly, it wasn't soft and didn't taste like it was made fresh daily like some other places I'm used to. What can I say, I'm spoiled with my taste buds lol. I liked the sea salt crema oolong. Just perfect. I'd get it again. The iced milk tea was ok but just a tad bit on the sweet side.

We also got the banana Belgian waffle. Good size to share for 2 ppl. Waffle was toasty. Wish the banana was cold, it was warm, a little weird for me. Drizzled with Nutella and chocolate syrup...hmm good but I wouldn't spend $6.75 on it again.

It is a small joint, expect there to be lines. They have an upstairs lounge area, has wifi, still cramped though. No restroom. Would I be back? Only if I was in the area.
author: Molly M.

description: Been here twice and there was no line. Love how you can keep the bottle & bring it back for a discount. Their drinks are delicious and they have awesome service!
author: Carmina T.

description: Changing my 3 stars to a 4. They've been able to overcome their bottle demands. Can't tell the difference but today I went by during lunch and didnt have to wait in line. Milk tea anywhere with no lines is a win win nowadays. Minus getting then a Quickly cause they never have lines
author: JJ S.

description: Came to visit SF and was told to come here. I'm glad I did! I got peach green tea and it was pretty good. The best part is that it comes in a glass bottle!! I will definitely be coming here again whenever I visit. :)
author: Jenny H.

description: Went here after the SF pride parade and we were really excited to see what all of this artsy PMT mason jar stuff was. The boba was definitely too sweet, but the grass jelly and the milk tea part itself was pretty on point. I'd have to say that it definitely isn't the best in the bay (Ocha and Tea Era and Verde are better). Still cool to keep the mason jars though!
author: Amanda C.

description: My friend and I decided to stop here on a Wednesday evening. Parking is slim to none so I would suggest walking? (We walked from our hostel which was a little less than a mile away). I would have to say this is one of the better tea places in this area. I got the creme oolong tea ($4.95) which was amazing. It was oolong tea with a thick layer of cream on top. The two in one bottle was amazing. I enjoyed the fact that they serve all their drinks in a glass bottle! If you keep it and bring it the next time you to, you get a 10% discount. I also got the Mango Green Fruit Tea the next day I went and there were mango bits in them! Personally, I enjoy how much their teas tasted like the real deal and not artificial, but this tea wasn't doing it for me. I prefer the creme oolong tea. All in all, whenever I'm in the city I will be coming here again.
author: Lillian W.

description:
I've tried to come here a couple times, but the line ups made it really difficult during the work day which is the only time I'm in this part of the city.

However, one night, all the stars aligned and I happened to be in this area around 9pm on a weeknight. There was still a line up of about 6 people ahead of us, but the wait wasn't too bad. Maybe 10 min. from getting in line to taking the first sip of my drink. 

Like many first time patrons, I got the glass bottle. I got the classic black milk tea with bubbles and pudding. There wasn't much bubbles and pudding for having charged $0.50 for each. If I remember correctly, my drink was $4.95, plus $1.00 for add-ons, making the drink over $6.00 after tax. The drink was good though.

Pros: High quality tea, real fruit, high quality add-ons, recylable/reusable bottles.
Cons: Long line-up, limited seating if you want to hang out, pricey, no restroom.

Tip: Bring your bottle for a 10% discount.
author: Camille B.

description: The drinks are delicious but for what you get, it's a bit on the expensive side. At least it came with glass bottle. I might come back on another hot day in the city.
author: Hong K.

description:
After waiting in line for 15 minutes, I ordered a lavender lemonade with aloe. The drink was absolutely delicious and refreshing. The lemonade was strong and infused with a wonderful taste of lavender. The aloe added a great crunch. The drink was topped off with a lemon spritzer that gave it some bubbles, I would recommend mixing it a little before drinking. Otherwise you will be hit with a blast of sugar syrup at the bottom using your straw.

Evern at 4pm, we waited 25 minutes from waiting in line to getting our drinks. this place is super busy and they give you glass bottles to take with you. they were out by the time we got there but hopefully I can get one next time.

The place is more pricey than other boba places, at almost $5 a drink with a 20% discount.
author: Vay V.

description: I first came here because I couldn't resist the cute bottles they had. I got the sea salt krema and it was tasty but I wish it had more tea flavor to it. The saltiness of the crema was really good and unique. It's kind of pricy but I would come here again if I wanted to. You get a discount if you bring back the bottle they give you!
author: Janet T.

description:
Cashier is not really frendly.
The drink is good, but who want to come to a new place with a cashier having a not - welcomed face?
author: Janice N.

description: The shop is very hipster which is good. But in terms of the boba, I feel like eating tire. It smells like rubber.. But kudos for the glass bottle design.
author: Reeza R.

description:
I loved the glass bottles so much, I was made an instant fan.  But in recent weeks, when I've visited, they have pumped up the sweetener making it almost undrinkable.  They claim to adjust the sweetness for you, but if they used to make them just fine, do you now say "like you used to make them" or what?

Turn down the diabetes guys!
author: H A.

description: High grade tea and the glass is a great piece to draw you in.
author: Billy S.

description: We ordered a taro milk & sea salt caramel crema tea. The drinks were made from scratch, no gross powdered mixes, flavor and sugar levels were on point, and the service was fast and friendly.
author: Becca Z.

description: My go to drink for trying and evaluating a new boba place is jasmine green milk tea. I have to say that this place's jasmine green milk tea was made well! Definitely had the perfect balance between sugar, tea, and milk. A few of my friends tried it, but only felt so-so towards it. I guess it's a place thats not consistent with their milk tea making, which is bad for boba cravers. But, the glass jars were too cute to pass by for me!
author: Mo W.

description: In love with the hipster glass bottles that you get to keep. My favorite is the milk mango with boba or pudding... it's delicious and extremely smooth and creamy!
author: Jessica X.

description: The atmosphere is pretty cool and the fact that you get to take home a little glass milk jug is pretty nifty. I love boba and was a little disappointed in the actual tapioca balls. They were a little tuff and not as sweet as I've had before. BUT they have some fun flavored drinks and I would for sure go again.
author: Dana O.

description: Average tasting milk tea and come early if you want the glass bottle! If not it's 20% off.
author: Amanda W.

description: Great service! Asked for a recommendation between two drinks and the cashier gave me samples to try instead. Able to customize drink/alter to your liking and the glass bottles were definitely a nice touch. Drink itself wasn't anything special; standard milk tea drink
author: Taryn Q.

description:
They sell 300 glass bottles a day then serve their drinks in plastic cups with a 20% discount.

I got the fresh fruit milk with avocado & boba. The boba was pretty good, but the milk was sooo bland. It was straight up milk, half an avocado, & ice. I don't know what I was expecting when I ordered it, but it didn't live up to par.
author: Catheria S.

description:
Good place as any other boba place if you want some tea. The bottles that everybody comes for and posts about on instagram and facebook are of no extra charge! And you also get an extra discount if you bring it back. Nothing too special about the drinks itself, but good change of pace from the regular quickly's and TapEx boba. 

The line always start to get longer after 11:30am so it is advised to come early. The only downside to this place I would say is that it is a bit out of the way if you don't plan on going to Chinatown area and are only going to SF for Union Square shopping. Otherwise $5 for a drink plus the bottle isn't too bad.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
They say a boba drink is composed with 1) tea, 2) cream/milk 3) boba/tapioca. 

I say I'll give 4 stars to the tea, 5 stars to the cream (extra star for the salted crema!) and 3 stars for the boba (tapioca). If you care more about tea, go to Asha in Berkeley; for better tapioca, go to Boba Guys in the Mission (they're opening a new spot in Union Square)

But overall the crema drinks here are just amazing!
author: Nina T.

description: Plentea has the great and cutest idea of using the glass milk jugs. I've tried the Regular Milk Tea, Oolong Milk Tea, Sea Salted Caramel Milk Tea, and Brown Sugar Milk. However, Brown Sugar Milk (half sweet) with egg pudding and tapioca is my FAVORITE! Highly Recommend!
author: Euodia A.

description:
I tried the black milk tea with honey boba and had the sweetness adjusted to 25% sugar. The tea had a strong flavor which was good and the honey boba was also pretty good. The texture of the tapioca was soft, chewy, and ideal. Overall, I think the drinks, store environment, and staff deserve a solid 4 stars. The store had nice, modern decor, seating area was very clean, and the staff was helpful and very friendly.

-1 star for drinks being a little too pricey. It would be nice if they didn't force you to purchase your drink with the glass bottle (that's probably why the drinks are marked up so high) With one topping, my drink was $5-6. I would definitely go back if they provided cheaper options (plastic cups, or option to drink the boba in-store)

If you bring back the glass bottle, you get 10% off your next purchase.
author: Monica T.

description:
I really wanted to like the hype! I left with thinking the drink was OK.

Well for starters, I only waited maybe 10-15 minutes so that wasn't too bad. I ordered the green milk tea w/ boba. I thought the drink was decent, but it was not amazing. Also, it was much pricer than other boba places I've been and I guess you're really paying for the throwback glass milk-bottle-eque feeling which was kinda cool. 

I'll probably only go back if I'm in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
author: Leah F.

description: Long ass line. Nothing to complain. We were there for bottle. Just a bottle, seemed crazy?? Who cares.
author: Ben C.

description:
Plentea's a milk tea place that also sells waffle sandwiches. It's a weird concept but there's people eating the food so I guess it works. The place is pretty tiny, but there's a small area upstairs to sit down in.

== Drinks ==

Milk Green Tea and the Thai Milk Tea are very meh. Both of them don't have a good tea taste... for some reason it tastes pretty watered down. Maybe too much milk compared to tea.

Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea is pretty good. It's not amazing, but it's the best one I have tried so far.

== Service ==

Pretty quick. 5-10 minute wait usually. The line goes to the door sometimes, but it doesn't go out the door.

== Overall ==

The glass bottles make it pretty awesome right now to grab some.
author: Steven B.

description: This is a cute little shop located in china town. The staff seemed fairly nice. The store itself was a little bit if a mess. Spilled drinks on the tables and trash/wrappers everywhere. I like that the drinks are stored in glass bottles and you can even take them to-go. I tried two drinks: peach black tea and honey oolong tea. The honey oolong was decent, but I think I would opt for black tea next time. The peach black tea was a little below average. I would come back to try a few more drinks but I wouldn't call this a solid boba shop.
author: Shelly C.

description:
I gotta admit, I'm not a Plentea fan.  It' s not that is is bad but it is overpriced for boba.

Can't justify spending almost $6 for a boba in a glass jar.  I think Plentea commands the crowds since the boba/pearl drink offerings are very limited in the area.

If I am going for boba, it's all about Gong Cha or 85 degrees for me.  Much cheaper and both places offer the sea salt and fresh brewed tea that is a hot trend now.  

Plentea does not compete with Gong Cha's mustache series drinks :-).  Now that is the real deal!
author: Van Anh N.

description: Black milk tea with boba (my usual order to determine if the store was good) was good. The bottles are so cute! There was no waiting line to order.
author: Pauline Y.

description: I like how they're open late. I can really just go here when I'm h*** and decide to go on a random night adventure with my friends.
author: Jordan J.

description: Complete review to come soon. 3.5 stars. Their tea was good, not bad, but just a bit pricy.
author: Edwin Q.

description: The staff apparently had no idea how the taro concentrate was made. She said that there is no added sugar and taro is naturally sweet!! But I swear there is plenty of sugar added as I have not had any taros in my life that's this sweet. With that being said, my taro drink is overly sweet. So Disappointing!!
author: Anna L.

description:
A large part of their draw is the milk bottles they provide. I always ask for my drink in a regular cup now to get the discount (same discount as bringing the bottle back).

Tea: Milky. Medium tea flavour, but not super strong. Their Oolong isn't Taiwanese oolong; probably a Wuyi/Anxi. Places don't usually say on the menu and employees don't always know

Boba: Decent. Chewy. Havne't had issues with mushiness here.

Add-ons: Their grass jelly is standard. I'd lower the sweetness of a drink when adding Aloe jelly. Extra sweetness gets into the drink.

They don't cook their boba with honey so my vegan friend and I can come here together.
author: Fern W.

description:
There's free wifi. Only one size for boba. It's about $5 each.  You can pay about $1 extra to have a cute glass bottles with "Plentea" on it so when you come back next time with it, you get a 20% discount instead of using plastic cups.  But the glass bottles are really popular so they "sell out" by 1pm everyday. 

They also have BELGIAN WAFFLES dessert style or sandwich style for around $7 and they look really delicious. 

I got the Crema Oolong Tea with boba with 25% sugar. It's basically heavy whipped cream over oolong tea. The tea tasted good, and I liked that the boba was cooked just right, but it was still a little pricey for me to be a repeat customer.  

For me, Cool Tea Bar still takes the win for boba. The portion is bigger, it's cheaper, and still tasty hole in the wall place.
author: Jenn L.

description:
A lot of people think that this place is only popular because if it's cute packaging, but they're wrong. The glass bottle is actually just a bonus! Plus, bringing it back in for a discount is always a good thing. Plentea actually has really good boba compared to most places.

My advice is to just stick with their fruit teas. They come with little slices of fruit which is so refreshing and a nice change of pace from the regular jelly toppings.
author: Audrey G.

description:
Pros: Adorable bottle! I took mine home and use it everyday for juice (: Great marketing ploy too- I saw someone walking around with their bottle and had to ask them where they got it. 

Cons: Drink offerings are that of your typical boba/tea establishment. Nothing too 'omg!' about the drink offerings.
author: Christine M.

description: Love this place. They have cute bottles and lovely drinks. Its about 5 bucks a drink. A little bit pricey for milk tea. But worth the try.
author: Yining Z.

description: How can you say no to their cute glass bottle? Just make sure you grab a lid before running out the door!
author: Lexy C.

description:
This is a really neat place to get tasty drinks as well as a nice glass bottle! Great customer service, great selection of drinks and meals. 

My bottle was initially broken, which I didn't notice until I drank all of my brown sugar iced milk drink, but they offered to give me a new one! Definitely a place to come back to!
author: Allan L.

description: Love their refreshing fruit flavored teas with their honey boba! I can also reuse the cute glass for teas I make at home!
author: Minna C.

description: This place looks delicious! I think it's a little bit pricey compared to other boba places in the area, BUT they do have really really cute glass cups! I guess if you want to walk around carrying around a glass cup for 20% discount when you buy a drink, this place is for you!
author: Andersen Y.

description:
Too Sweet for me, awesome concept.

Good Luck!
author: Emily L.

description:
This was my second time visiting this spot. The first time was so-so. I remember being slightly disgusted at how overpriced their drinks were. I have my share of favorite Boba spots, and this wouldn't be one of them. This last time I was highly-motivated to write a review, mostly because the chick behind the counter was ridiculously rude. If I'm paying $5 for a mostly-ice drink, atleast be courteous. I also ordered a mango milk with boba to-go to bring home to my kid who's obsessed with boba drinks. 
Let me start with rating my drink. I ordered a salted crema oolong milk tea with tapioca and taro pudding. The pudding was decent, the boba chewier than I prefer. They put too much ice considering how small the container is. And the drink itself was pretty gross. The combination of the saltiness and sweet was not a good balance and unusually love that combination!
As for the gal taking my order: I was obviously not familiar with the menu, and she was clearly very impatient and annoyed that she had to correct me. I also tried to discreetly let her know that it's unethical
To require a minimum debit card purchase amount. A minimum for credit card is legal, but requiring a minimum amount for debit is downright dirty. I was merely trying to do them a favor as I usually like to help asian-ran businesses to do well. After how rude she was, I am making an exception by writing this review. Instead of recognizing that my tone and demeanor was simply one of saying "please be careful", she mistook it as me blowing a whistle at her. Her reaction was borderline ghetto. 
Try them out, maybe you'll have a better experience. As for me, never again.
author: Crispy P.

description:
Asked the cashier which was is best seller which was the Salted Creme and honestly, way too much salt. Drink is lovely but TOO much salt ): Their Thai ice tea is amazing ! So I think from now on that is what I will always get. 

On the other hand, when I was asking questions, they weren't really informative. It felt like they were just tryina get rid of me, no 5/10 for customer service /:
author: Adriane Chrisha P.

description: The drinks here were okay. I like the milk jar the drinks come in! Something you don't see elsewhere. However, they don't give out receipts, only your number order. So you have a bad memory like I do...that's it for you (I almost forgot mine)! Also, they totally forgot about my friend's drink! Seven numbers later, my friend decided to ask about his drink. Well at first he was hesitant because he didn't have proof of his order (receipt) but they were nice enough and ended up making his on the spot!
author: Rose S.

description: Pretty good! They have a variety of flavors. I also think their jars is cute!
author: Kendall N.

description:
After passing by this place so often I decided to splurge and order the matcha green tea with honey tapioca here.
I regretted my order as soon as I saw someone else's drink coming out, I could tell the tapioca had turn to mush on the bottom of the cup, but I was still optimistic until the first sip.

...Don't advertise it as honey tapioca if the boba isn't even sweetened AT ALL.

The matcha green tea itself was decent, but I was too distracted trying to slurp up the tapioca that got stuck through the straw to enjoy it.

Perhaps it was an off day for the boba, but for the price I was expecting the drinks to be better than the average boba shops in SF.

At least I could bring home a bottle.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Good tea.  Good boba.  And good pudding as an option.  (The pudding is actually caramelized, which is how a good boba place does it - as opposed to that cheap gel-o crap.)

Love the fact that you can actually taste the tea leaves in the tea here.  And they use real milk - not the cheap powdered stuff.  Solid ingredients all around.

The line is longer than you would expect at lunch, and you got to be careful with their glass bottles!  My colleague totally dropped it due to the condensation, and since they use steel counters, it cracked right open and cut her hand!
author: Mark M.

description: Great drink selections. I have tried ice milk, sea salt coffee, fruit tea. The tapioca is made perfectly.  Only thing is the long wait, I'll get the drinks everyday if no wait required.
author: Tiffany O.

description: My coworkers and I come here to get out of the office and enjoy some boba. I love the glass jar the beverages come in and the staff has always been friendly.
author: Michelle E.

description: I finally get to try this place after hearing about this from friends and being known top boba places from Facebook (I believe). I was surprised of how pricey it is -- I'm assuming because it is in a glass container, though on the bright side, you can bring it back for 10% off (similar to Starbucks reusable cup policy). I ordered my usual (Peach Black Iced Tea) -- LOVE the taste (I am very picky when it comes to my peach because I swear, it seems like a lot of places cannot put the right amount of peach flavor in my drink), but my boba was kinda hard (maybe it was a bad batch because when my sister ordered it before, she didn't have that kind of problem). Hopefully I will come back soon -- I am definitely curious with their milk tea!
author: Carmen W.

description: It's a bit pricy for just a fancy jar. The milk tea is too sweet and they don't do any customization. A good location will give them enough business tho.
author: Minqi L.

description: No bathroom, even for paying customers. Most drinks are average. Sea Salt Carmel w/ egg pudding is the best combo, but not worth the $6 price tag.
author: Kim T.

description: It's okay. Ordered the coffee milk tea and it was watery beyond belief. On top of that they force your hand into buying a glass bottle that you don't really need which of course makes the prices of it ridiculously high.
author: Evelyn Q.

description: Line out the door today. Waiting in the upstairs seating area for it to shorten before I order a taro milk tea or fruit tea with boba.
author: Debra M.

description: They milk tea is alright, nothing really special. The only thing that attracts everyone is the glass bottle you get to take home. Its pricey b/c you pay for the bottle as well. Definetly a good location since its in the financial district and pretty close to Chinatown. Long wait just like tpumps.
author: Suki L.

description: Two star is for the marketing. I came here for the cute jar. But I got paper cup when I ordered it hot. NO ONE TOLD ME WHEN I ORDER! All the pictures on the menu are showing drink with a jar. if the selling point is the jar, please make it clear. We ordered two drinks and when we came back asking can we at least get one jar( we paid same price for drink with a jar) they said no. Probably it's out of their control but I wish business ppl know better than that. It's bad marketing.  Not really worth paying over $5 for a milk tea Without the jar near Chinatown area.
author: Sophia H.

description: I don't understand why so many people are in love with this place. Is it because of the jars? I guess if I add the jar concept, this place gets 3 stars. The taste, is just off for me here. I am not the hugest boba enthusiast, but my girlfriend makes me go to all these different places around the city, so I have definitely had my fair share. I had the matcha green tea with boba. Where is the flavor? I like tasting actual matcha here, but I felt like I was drinking 80% milk. Additionally, the pearl flavor did not have that signature tapioca flavoring. It usually has that rich, sweet flavor, but I found that missing here. I probably will not be coming back here for a while. I got my jar, so this place has lost its appeal to me. If you really want a special jar, Cost Plus World Market and Target sell them for cheap.
author: Alex L.

description: I love my boba so I've been wanting to try it. There was a line out the door when I went but it's not the same wait as tpumps. I like that the boba comes in a bottle you can keep. The price isn't too bad. I got the fresh strawberry black tea and mango green tea. It was delicious. The taste was simple, tasty, but not too sweet. I'll come back for sure, hopefully I remember to bring my bottle to get 10% off. Lol
author: R M.

description: I love that they have soy milk and almond milk as alternatives. This is one of the only tapioca drink places I know that does.
author: Jessica W.

description: Really cool place, simple, refreshing boba tea served in glass bottles you get to keep! I got the almond milk tea with boba, it tasted great wouldn't change a thing about it.
author: Jesse K.

description: I was in town and my friend took me here to try it out. This place is advertised for their glass bottles but when we came there, they were out of the bottles. And the drinks... It was just okay. I got the fresh peach green tea and it tasted like it was from concentrate and they decided to add some peach slices in it. Ehhh, I rather save the $5 I spent and go elsewhere.
author: Amy L.

description:
Sadly, it's just another hype. It's not worth the price or wait. 

The cool thing is the bottle that comes with the drink but the drink itself is alright. Got the Oolong milk tea and honeydew milk but there was no distinct tea flavor for the milk tea and the honeydew didn't taste...right? Nothing stood out.
Aside the bottle, the boba is actually soft and really chewy which is a plus! 

Btw..the bottles do run out and when they do, they give you 20% off - but if they don't give you the bottle, it's honestly not worth getting.
author: Windy L.

description:
A great place in the Financial District!  I have had fresh fruit milks and the milk tea with tapioca.  Everything I have had here has been delicious!  The lines are long and it's interesting watching someone chop fresh fruit with a little plastic knife.  

The bottles are cute, although there is a production problem right now, so they only have 300 bottles available a day.  If you take the bottle back, you get a 20% discount, but if you get a plastic cup instead, you also get a 20% discount.  

I have met tourists in line, people who drove from the East Bay, Peninsula, etc., so that they can give this place a try.  

This is one of my favorite places for bubble teas, but it is very tempting to go here often since it is just a block away from the office.
author: Suzie Y.

description: I heard so many good things about this place so I figured to try it out.  I have been meaning to come here but every time I come up to the city I never have time to stop by.  Now that I work in the city, I can finally be able to come here whenever I want.  When I first arrived, I noticed that there was a line. Before I could order, I had to wait about 20 minutes.  I ordered a strawberry milk tea and the unagi donburi.  After ordering, of course I had to wait a while for my food and my drink.  There was only 2 people working at the time.  1 girl who was taking orders and making drinks, and another girl in the back prepping the food.  I would've given this place 4 stars but I decided to give it 3 stars because the wait time was really long. I really liked the milk tea.  It was very flavorful and you can really taste the tea compared to most of the other boba places. The unagi bowl was pretty good.  It had just enough teriyaki sauce on it. The pricing of their drinks is a little on the steep side but then again you are paying for the glass container. Most definitely I will come back again.
author: Marc U.

description: The oolong milk tea is life! My absolute favorite tea place compared to share tea and boba guys. Bring back your glass bottle for a 10% discount too.
author: Deandra S.

description: I've been here a few times (luckily I've never waited more than 5 min) and I'm a huge fan of all their different types (and it helps that they have different levels of sweetness). Sure their whole glass bottle makes it pricey but I use those bottles at home everyday so I'm a big fan. That being said, I would never wait more than 10 min at this place so if you see a line, just come back later when it dies down.
author: Diana Y.

description: Got green milk tea w/ boba, nothing special. I have to say, kobe bento's $2 milk teas @Chinatown taste better than this. Doesn't worth $5.44 at all, guess I'm just paying for the cup.. And the boba has a plastic after taste.. Soooo NASTY....
author: Sharie H.

description:
GO ON A WEEKDAY! Your chances of taking home a souvenir bottle is so much higher than if you go on a weeknight! That aside, the layout of this place is so unique with the 2nd floor seating, it gave this place a very chill and chic vibe. The drinks itself are so worth it for its price. It's not too sweet or to bland. The texture of the tapioca was very soft and chewy. The only think I wish they had was a bigger drink menu. I would most def come check this place out if you are in town because it is quickly heading for the title of "the Best Boba in SF."

I filmed a vlog that featured this place, so you can check it out if you want! 
(& sub for more reviews)

http://youtu.be/T-COV8EYFQI?list=UU4jxQg-EYioFkQrcNwtQD2g
author: Katrina T.

description:
Milk tea not bad. This time I got the black milk tea with grass jelly. I like the jar and how you can bring it home.

I came here long ago and got a sandwich then but couldn't remember which so I asked the worker for his recommendation it which was popular. Got a hot pastrami sandwich and that was what brought my rating down. It had an off taste to it but didn't know what it was. Waffle was also pretty soft. If I come back, probably only getting the drinks.

Atmosphere wise, I like how there is an upstairs for u to sit, but once more ppl started coming in then it got pretty noisy. However, thumbs up for the worker kicking out this really loud homeless person that walked in
author: serene h.

description: This is one of my favorite boba places in the city. It can get pretty full with limited seating at peak hours, but service is usually quick. The glass bottles are really cute (10% off if you bring yours back to reuse!). I usually get ice milk with brown sugar and egg pudding, which comes to around $5 - a little pricy, but tastes pretty good. They also have wi-fi, which is nice.
author: Jenny Z.

description: My friend and I had the Thai milk tea and peach fresh fruit tea and they were pretty good! The Thai tea was standard and I loved the fruit bits in the peach tea. Nothing special but definitely better than many boba chains + the bottles are great! Definitely kept mine for whenever I come back. Also the store and it's deco is very minimalist and appealing! One star off because we had to clean up one of the tables upstairs on our own and I noticed there were other tables that also haven't been cleaned.
author: Sandy N.

description: I've been here twice now, and I didn't enjoy my drink that I got the first time. It was too bitter and watery AND they ran out of the glass bottles (which I won't deny I came here for in the first place). So, as I passed it again a second time a few months later, I decided to give it another chance. The black milk tea was one of the best I've had before. It was perfectly sweet and the boba was perfectly chewy to me AND they didn't run out of the glass bottles this time! Haha
author: Jamie J.

description: What kind of lunch spot in the fi-di (this is not in Chinatown) doesn't accept credit cards for a $9 purchase?  This one apparently.  I can't speak to their teas or food (although my coworkers like it and there are certainly plenty of people drinking boba out of glass bottles in the area) because of this, but really it's the 21st century and we're in a major US city, not accepting credit cards for every purchase is ridiculous.
author: William C.

description: Tasty tea in glass bottles. The tea to milk ratio was good.  I didn't get boba so I can't comment on that.  Decent number of flavors to choose from.  Great customer service.
author: B. Y.

description: Coworker got me tea w/boba it was the best I've head. The taste was natural and on top ode that, it was served in a glass bottle! Only reason I'd say I didn't give it a five is because I didn't experience the service and my tea was kinda warm.
author: Xavier R.

description: Plentea, I love you! I love the Oolong Milk Tea with honey boba. The tea is strong and very good. Also the tea is not very sweet.The honey boba has a very good consistency and they are very soft. I would definitely come to Plentea if you have never been.
author: Taya S.

description: This place has cute glass bottles and the tapioca is excellent. The first time I went I got the sea salt with crema. I like sweet, so I thought it was delicious. If you don't like sweet, don't get it. This last time I went I got the avocado smoothie. The guy at checkout said they were the best smoothies he's had, so I went for it. Built my expectations up too much and was slightly disappointed. Very creamy and smooth but I wanted a little more sweetness to it. Tasted like a liquified avocado. Don't get me wrong though. It was good. Just not great. The tapioca again was great though. Both times had lines almost out the door bit moved quickly. In and out in 10-15 min. On a side note, my friend got the macha green tea and said it didn't have a strong enough flavor for her. Higher prices in comparison to competition, but worth a try.
author: Lindsey G.

description: 2 stars because of the cool glass bottles it comes in & how nice the place looked. it was like a hipster boba place. i don't live in sf so i was yelping up places i thought i can try in the city. what caught my attention from previous yelp reviews was the fresh fruit teas (which was certain fruit flavors with your choice of tea & fruit bits) it was hotter than a rave that day so i thought it would be refreshing to get a peach green tea with peach bits in it. but APPARENTLY they have updated their menu so the drink i wanted basically DOESNT EXIST ANYMORE!! they had a peach oolong tea but i absolutely hate oolong and I requested to get it with green tea instead & she told me i couldn't do that idk why and on top that they ran out of peach anyways so it was just consecutive L's from there on out. I ended up getting a Thai tea with pearls because I didn't wanna hold up the line and basically I paid for trash in a glass bottle because their Thai tea tasted like toilet water. I would've been more than satisfied with water instead inside that glass bottle tbh. what I'm trying to say is this place is all hype. it's just nice because of the bottle other than that not worth it. lol especially if you don't live in sf don't try this place out.
author: Jocelyn F.

description:
My husband took me here, and we order caramel milk tea and black sugar milk tea both with boba. It was a little bit sweet, and cannot be adjusted. 
The boba was nicely cooked, chewy and flavoured. 

But it is still very yummy drink, and I love their glass jugs!!! They are so cute!
Must come by if you have a chance!
author: Abby L.

description: Their fruit teas are decent. The milk tea and coffee milk tea were terrible. No flavor. The boba were not cooked thoroughly enough. It's definitely a cool place with great packaging. Nice to try once.
author: david l.

description: I got the green milk tea here, it was pretty good but it wasn't sweet enough. So I asked the workers to add more sweetness, it was so much better after. The crema milk tea isn't so good but that's just me, I recommend to be adventures with the flavors !
author: Shayla N.

description: I tried this place for the first time and got the strawberry oolong tea and it was not bad and not too sweet but with strong oolong flavor which I like. The only bad part about this place is that it's pretty expensive compared to other tea places (around $5+ for a drink)
author: Tina W.

description: I love their milk tea. I ordered a black milk tea with tapioca and their milk tea was not too sweet and their topioca was chewy just how I like it. Love their glass jar that the drink comes in with. Definitely going to reuse the jar! Will recommend!
author: Nancy L.

description: One of those new fashionable places with new stuff to try that belong to a city! Lots of customisable teas and a few tasty munchies. A little overpriced. Friendly staff.
author: Marc N.

description:
It was so hot yesterday, and it was even warmer inside! First thought stepping in was... VENTILATE or TURN UP THE AIR CONDITIONER, now it probably didn't help that there were also a lot of people in line and also with the door was open, but still... lol.

This wasn't our first time around but I was craving it and I love getting the glass bottle! Wife and I picked up the CARAMEL ICED MILK w/normal sweetness and it was good. I questioned it after first sip, but then realized how refreshing it was especially on a hot day. We killed the drink quickly! We weren't asked how sweet we would like our drink but that's ok, maybe they're used to people already saying how they like their drink customized.

Ordered mango juice drink for daughter that wife tasted... said it was bland, not sweet.

I was surprised because even the Glass Bottle wasn't the same. It was colored now with the logo... definitely loved the original where it was ALL GLASS and ALL CLEAR! BRING THAT BOTTLE BACK!

Would we come back? Yea... sure... for the CARAMEL ICED MILK drink! Maybe I'll try something else but it's like the D3 at Purple Kow... it's so good, you don't know if you're willing to try something else.
author: BA C.

description:
When there is a different bubble tea shop on every street block, Plentea certainly has come up with a creative marketing strategy with its own branded glass bottles.

Can't say there's much more to it.  I came here twice and got two fruity teas and were quite disappointed both times.  They looked nice but didn't taste good at all... speaking of being able to get more for less at the more established places like Cool Tea Bar!  And two of my friends had all their bubbles stuck together in a way that just looked nasty.  They didn't like the taste of their drinks, either.

Then I gave it one more try with the plain milk tea (no bubbles!) and finally had a pleasant experience.  It tasted similar to the Kirin brand (Japanese) bottled milk tea, which is sort of a premium drink that you can buy from Asian supermarkets.  At the end of the day, I'm not sure if there was a quality control issue, or only a few products were good.
author: Peter H.

description: There are lots of options for boba tea in the neighborhood, but this one always has a line out the door. I've been here a few times a really like it. It is a little more expensive, but the quality and taste is really there.
author: Stu U.

description:
I m here for vacation from hawaii, n tried lots of bubble tea in San Francisco as well. Hands down the drinks here are super good

I love their iced milk w/ brown sugar and taro pudding , it's like drinking pop corn with caramel. Love it so much!

Also I tried my friends' drinks - honey lemon oolong tea, milk green tea and also the sea salt creama oolong , they all taste so good! 

Not to mention their very famous glass bottle, it's reusable , environmentally friendly and u also get to hv 20% off for next purchase when u bring it back to the store!! Genius idea! 

I recommend everyone to visit them if u r in town n craving for some boba drinks!
author: Joanne W.

description: I enjoyed the glass bottles. The green tea with boba was pretty good and strong (though I preferred the boba to be a little bit softer).
author: Jboogie L.

description:
The good: 
1. The drinks are good and are sweetened with honey. Cow milk can be substituted with soy milk. 
2. Location is great for financial district workers such as I am. 
3. Decent lunch/snacks options with their savory waffle sandwiches and desert waffle snacks. 
4. Drinks are served in glass bottles, when they have them available. 

The bad:
1. The shop seems to be run by very young kids who are still trying to figure out how the business should work and run. They do not run a tight ship and it can get annoying. 

2. They advertise waffles, but I have dropped by at least twice around 11-11:30 AM and their waffles are never ready around that time. They open at 11. When I walk into a shop and I see items advertised, I expect the shop to have these items available for me to purchase. If they are not going to be ready until a certain time, they should note this on their menu and not have customers waiting for 15-20 minutes with various excused: "We just opened and are still getting the waffles ready, we just burned the waffles, we are short staffed, ...". If you do not have something, don't have it up on the menu. If it is only available after a given time, note this clearly on the menu and other signage, so customers do not waste their time waiting. 

3. The cashier is clueless. There's no confidence in her answers. She seems very unsure and has to check with someone for the simplest questions. They should train their cashiers better and anticipate customer questions related to products and pricing that may not always be "on the menu". 

4. They will make your drink in the empty glass bottle you bring back to the store. However, if you just bring back your bottles to recycle, they do not give you anything for it. Places that are truly conscious about recycling (e.g. The Juice Shop, St Benoit Yogurt) incentivize customers by giving back the "deposit" (extra $ you pay for getting your treat in a glass/ceramic bottle) when you return glass/ceramic bottles to them. I hope they further research their business model.
author: Rindah L.

description: I feel like Plentea is another boba gimmick - a punny name containing the word "tea" and "free" glass containers (I'm looking at you - mason jar boba joints!!). I got the oolong milk tea and it was really nothing special. For almost $5, you get a cool glass bottle but the actual milk tea isn't spectacular. It lacked body and the tea to milk ratio was off. I'd probably go back if I was in the area and wanted milk tea but it's nothing to rave about.
author: Maggi K.

description: Its about $6 for the milktea + the glass bottle. Taro milk here is one of the best i've tried. But I've also had the mango milk which tasted just like powder.
author: Diana P.

description: Bubble Tea! I've heard of it, but never experienced it until now! Ok, so it's tapioca balls added to the tea. The tea is a milk based tea. The tapioca balls are flavored. Plentea is a popular place. The place was packed. Though it seemed like a common occurrence because they prepared all orders quickly. I ordered the Brown Sugar Ice Milk With Boba. Nice and sweet. The tapioca balls were purple though. I'm spoiled because this place gives you these glass bottles, which you keep. Now if I get bubble tea anywhere else I'll be expecting one. The space had an upstairs and downstairs. The downstairs area was crowded, but the upstairs appeared to have more space. The tea was under $5. However, I was wondering if a discount was applied if you brought your glass bottle back. Seems like an earth friendly option. Not sure if it's offered, so ask if you live in the area. I'd visit again if I'm in San Francisco, but for now I'll be seeking Bubble Tea spots in my area. The stuff is good!
author: Natasha C.

description: My peach green tea with honey boba was actually pretty good! Strong peach flavor & boba was chewy and sweet. However, the milk bottle is definitely just a gimmick. Plus...it was really pricey - $6 for a drink. Granted, it was in the FiDi.
author: Tina C.

description: Lame. We came all the way from the Pacific Northwest just for the glass bottles, only to find that they don't have their glass bottles until April 10th. WTF.
author: H C.

description: Real boba places don't charge extra for boba amirite?!  Also I'm judging you if you pay for this regularly; who cares about the 10% discount if you return w/ your glass when all the 10% takes care of is the cost of overly sweetened boba.  If you want to enjoy boba get out of San Francisco - the articles on the Interwebz that recommend this place have terrible taste.
author: Angelica P.

description: I have never felt the need to write a yelp review but this is definitely necessary. If I could give 0 stars I would. We decided to stop by due to the relatively decent ratings and reviews, let me say they were definitely mistaken. The bottles are nice but that's the only thing "nice" about the place. My friends and I decided to stop by and have never tasted boba so powdery, watered down, and just really bad. Furthermore, their customer service was tremendously rude and lacking in manners. After letting them know about my disappointment, they pointedly ignored my comments and told me that's what the drink was supposed to taste like... So yes, my tea is supposed to be clumpy, watered down, un-mixed, and starchy. Thank you for providing me with the worst boba I've ever tasted. Would never ever recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jada C.

description: I dont get the hype of this place but it is a Super cute place! I love how they give our drinks in glass jars, super creative and usable ;) the drink I got which was mango ice milk tea was ok, It could be better. The pearls isn't soft enough, but I'm coming back to try other drinks And hopefully it is better.
author: Leslie N.

description:
super bad service . they didn't even acknowledge that you are there for service . they look at you and continue to do other things. it's like you are invincible.
