at least say we will be with you shortly.
author: Timothy W.

description:
The most adorable thing about this place is that you get your boba in milk bottles. Milk bottles! Real life milk bottles that you can take home and fill with...whatever you want, I suppose. The decor itself is pretty standard, perhaps a step up from most boba places, and there's upstairs seating, which isn't cleaned very often, so you might have to use some napkins to wipe down tables before sitting down. 

The pearls...not quite the right consistency. The lychee jelly was too stiff. The drinks (matcha green milk tea, jasmine milk tea) were overall too sweet, and nothing particularly remarkable, especially for the price (expensive!) . I haven't tried any of the teas without milk, so I can't say anything about the quality of their teas alone, but better boba places exist.
author: Courtney N.

description:
Well first of all I went with my friends because of their fancy glass bottles. It's cool how we get to keep them. 
I love their oolong milk tea but Thai milk tea is gross.. Doesn't have that special taste in it and it's too sweet. 
A little too pricey for a milk tea and the price for a smoothie is wayyyyy too much 

Also need faster services!
author: Anna L.

description: Using the glass cups is a cute idea but if you really focus on the the actual tea and boba its a mediocre place and experience. They don't have public wifi or restroom so it's not exactly a welcoming place for you to stay. Tea itself is nothing special and the boba is overly soft yet bland. The cost is a bit more than other boba places yet I suspect they don't give as much because of the containers. Came here twice and won't be coming again.
author: Ruby C.

description: This place is cute, but I'd just go here for the bottles to be honest. The drinks were okay, but I wouldn't drive from San Jose to San Francisco for this. The setting of this place is cute, hands down. The lights and plants made the place calming and enjoying. Besides that, parking was tough, and drinks were okay.
author: Ivadine M.

description: Coolest bubble tea place you'll visit. They've got wifi, plenty of seating, cool snacks, creative and fresh drink options and you get a cool souvenir with every drink order.
author: Wouldn't You L.

description: This place is cool and the bubble tea is great. They also have an upstairs area to sit and enjoy your food and beverage or to just hangout. The service is great and friendly.
author: Crystal G.

description:
Best boba I've ever had, hands down. Good variety and great flavors, you get the impression they are using high quality ingredients.

What sets them apart is the texture and taste of the actual tapioca bubbles, and they are fantastic. I haven't tried the food options there as I'm only ever there for Boba.
author: John S.

description: All the workers were really friendly, the oolong milk tea succeeded my expectations, and the glass bottles were definitely a plus
author: Kiki M.

description:
2nd time here and they didn't have the glass bottle I wanted!
I suggest matcha milk iced green tea with boba!
author: Jaycel B.

description: I got a fresh mango milk tea with boba for $6.25. They grind ice with their milk tea and frankly it was not worth having to walk up 2 blocks :(. The boba was way too hard and I ended up just putting my straw at the top of my drink to not get any boba. The mango milk tea was pretty good, it was sweet but I was expecting more actual milk tea not it to be blended in with ice. Also I had a lot of ice chunks which annoyed me. Only good thing was the glass jar that I got. But even that was sticky! Sigh I probably won't be back for this drink but may try their other drinks if my friends convince me to come back.
author: Sarah K.

description: The oolong milk tea is very good. I also tried my friend's caramel ice milk and it was fantastic. I will be visiting again soon.
author: Xavier S.

description: This is the best bubble tea I've ever had and the cute glass jars are an added bonus. I always get the taro milk tea and it has a smoothie texture to it with what seem like little pieces of taro! Also the tapioca tastes more "natural" too somehow.
author: A S.

description: As a Bay Area teenager, I've been to my fair share of amazing milk tea joints. Plentea is definitely on the top of my list. I had the mango green tea that came with mango chunks and it had the perfect amount of sweetness. Its fairly hard to get the perfect proportion of when it comes to tea but Plentea was pretty successful. Its also a bonus that we get to keep their beautiful glass bottles.
author: Larissa Q.

description: All the ingredients they used are fresh, I like the taro milk tea the most, it's very creamy and tasty, if you have a chance to pass by this tea shop, you might want a healthy and also tasty tea!
author: Penny L.

description: We went there on a Saturday night with a friend who highly recommended it.  After we arrived I saw the unique bottle they used for their drink.  I have actually seen it around but didn't know it was from here.  There were probably 5-6 people ahead of us but the service speed was quite reasonable.  About 15 min and we got our drinks.  I ordered taro milk. It was really good. Made from real taro with artificial colorant. It was a bit too sweet for me (yes, even for me!), so we went back and added more milk.  It was then perfect. They said they did not add any sugar or sweetener. It was just the sweetness from the taro.  Definitely a place I would come back when I am in the neighborhood.
author: Mason H.

description: I like the teas here although they are pricier than other places. Convenient for those who work in FiDi. If you bring back the glass bottle or opt for the plastic cup, you get 10% off.
author: Natalie S.

description: Meh. Wasn't able to get the bottles on my most recent visit and maybe that was a good thing. Without the glass bottle, I was forced to think about what makes the drink taste different vs. walking to chinatown to get a drink for 2.50... For reference, I ordered a blueberry smoothie. Can you combine any other fruits with that smoothie? NO. That was disappointing for $6.50! For $6.50 I better be able to have organic fruit in there! But, no. I was given some frozen blueberries with a touch of milk, blended. Done. There was no flavor, no sweetness, none of that. I hate these types of establishments that try to mask a ridiculously low cost, already existing high margin, type of business, with high prices. Walk to Quickly 3 blocks down and get some fried squid with yo shit. You'll be happier with your life.
author: Brian C.

description: Mainly you're just going there for the glass bottles to put on Instagram. Boba was just okay and that's me being nice and it was also overpriced. Definitely won't be coming back here again.
author: Ang P.

description: it is nice drink but overly priced.   I would love to steal their recipes.  I think what makes them stand out is that they have better tea.   Compared to Boba Guys, this is insanely good.   we had oolong milktea, lemon tea, and fruit slush. the last one is the most mediocre one.
author: Shuting Z.

description:
Let me just restate what has already been said by other reviewers, the mini milk jugs, while a bit gimmicky, is a nice way for these guys to separate themselves from the countless other boba places around the area. They seem to be of decent quality, and I'm sure if just milk were put in them, would most likely do an adequate job holding the milk.

I went with the premium green tea.  While I can't comment on a comparison between that and the regular tea, I did quite enjoy it. It's not overly sugary like some other boba place, and walks the fine line between a nice treat and dietetic nightmare.

So why only three stars you ask? Well there's no public urinal at this place. Although there may be a reason why they let you keep the glass jug your drink comes in, there are certain societal expectations when one goes to a particular type of eatery. If I were going to an Indian restaurant, I would expect there to be plenty of toilet stalls and double ply toilet paper. The same standards must be applied here at PlenTea, so I'm afraid I have to dock a star because of this oversight.
author: Sunny L.

description:
It literally took me at least 2 hours to finish my drink. I was drinking it for dear life, not wanting to waste a good $5 for a SMALL, low-quality drink.

Listen to the reviews on here. That was my mistake. The Black Milk Tea is crazy bad! I just could not drink it. It was bitter, tasted like coffee, and left such a bad taste in my mouth. It's kind of like vodka. You can't drink a lot of it at once or your mouth and throat will hate you.

The boba was tasteless. They were extremely tiny, which I hate, and tasted like plastic. Low quality drink + low quality boba equals an unhappy customer. Plus, the price was extremely high, all for nothing.

It's all hype. Plain and simple.

Additionally, my friend and I (whom of which had the same exact drink) both felt extremely jittery because of the strength of the drink. I experienced a bit of anxiety and a fast heartbeat because of it. Definitely not fun! 

I would choose Quickly over this place any day!

P.S. There is a 10% discount for getting plastic cups. The funny part about it is that it's not really a full 10%, because my check was for $16 and instead of $1.60 off, I got $1 off. CHEAP! Lastly, they require a minimum purchase of $15 to use credit cards. I've never heard of such a high requirement for spending. All these tactics used to make dough for this shop. Uncool! The whole "bring your jar in for 10% off" means nothing because prices are sky high to begin with!
author: John H.

description: Mmmmm brown sugar iced milk + taro pudding. Price is definitely something to note (~$5.70), but it's a nice treat every once in awhile :) Bring in the reusable glass bottle to get 10% off!
author: Will Z.

description: The milk tea is very refreshing and delicious. It can be a bit slow at times and there's always a line. The bottle is so cute and you can get extra caps by the door. There's extra seating upstairs so you can enjoy a nice meal there.
author: Ziyao Y.

description:
I love coming here whenever I'm in the area. Their glass bottles are absolutely adorable, and you get a discount on your drink when you bring in your bottle again! I usually just get their regular milk tea (Green tea or Thai tea) with boba or pudding, which have been consistently great each time I go. During my last visit I tried their Matcha Milk Green Tea, which was a little too sweet for me (I ended up not finishing it because it was too sweet!).

In terms of price, it can be a little overpriced ($4.50 for regular milk tea w/o toppings). But overall I love coming to Plentea and definitely recommend trying it out!
author: Stephanie H.

description: I ordered Iced Taro Milk Tea with Honey Boba. Tasted ok, certainly not the best, but definitely not the worst. They have quite an extensive selection of drinks and a more limited selection for snacks. The lines were pretty long, waited around a good 20ish minutes? Quite honestly I just came here for the glass bottle, I think I liked the glass bottle itself more than my drink. If you bring your bottle back next time, you get a 10% discount.
author: Xin W.

description: Automatic 2 star deduction for not having a public restroom for a beverage place, other than the glass bottles you get to keep , this place isn't that special , those drinks were in between good and average. The menu is a little confusing because of the way they separate everything . All in all it's pretty average boba for a more expensive price. The bottles are the one and only highlight of this place.
author: Slavic D.

description: Stopped by during lunch for Thai Milk Tea. Tastes good, comes in reusable glass bottle with plastic top.
author: Cecilia J.

description: two boba drinks for $12. honestly feel like legit boba is that delicious artificially flavored stuff you enjoy with your friends on a hot summer afternoon.  this was a different take on it, but i'm old school.
author: C. L.

description: Delicious mango slush, but spendy! The glass bottle you pay for and keep is nice, but unnecessary. I enjoyed the fresh fruit, though.
author: J P.

description: Typical tea with a milk bottle. You pay more for bottle that they put the tea in. Seems like they give you a discount if you bring it back which is eco friendly, but I don't think I'll ever do since I don't live anywhere nearby. Tea itself is all right, but I think I'll just take my bottle and go to other places in the future.
author: Ephie T.

description: I love plentea they have those little jar that's so cute and I love their milk tea especially the taro milk tea. And they have good customer service and they give me good deals too! I love plentea
author: Jessi L.

description: Superfast turn around.  Black milk teas is good.  The Boba is the best I had in a long time.   They are chewy but not too soft.  Worth the drive in sf.
author: Danny C.

description: This place was good but not amazing. I got the peach tea and there was a lot of fresh peach in it, which was good. The tea was delicious, but honestly the boba was kinda chewy (and not in that good chewy way if you know what I mean). I honestly was drawn in by the cute bottle and probably wouldn't have stopped by if it weren't for that. I'd go back if I was in the area, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to get it.
author: Emma W.

description:
This place is seriously the source of my happiness. 
The Nutella Milk Tea is so bomb I can't even begin to describe my obsession-but don't forget to grab a lid to shake! 
The fresh fruit teas: all are seriously incredible. I have never been to a place that puts real fruit in the teas and it's just an added touch of love to the things. My favorite is a toss up between the mango and strawberry. 
The honey lemon tea. That's all. 10/10. Cute little limes floating in there really just help the citrus-y flavors come alive and is just a really awesome tea. 
For the slushes, I've heard that you have to try the avocado, but I've only had the blueberry. SO GOOD. 
Toppings: I love the aloe and the boba, but it's a real bummer that it costs extra:/ kinda disappointing since the drinks average $5 a piece. 
The employees- AWESOME. I've never had a bad experience there and they are always so accommodating and nice! I've never had any sort of negative interaction with any of the people that work there. It's very inviting and makes it easy to come back(embarrassingly frequently). 
This place is all around really cute, it's small but for a takeout tea place in the city you'd be crazy not to expect that. Parking can also be crazy, if you don't find yourself walking there nearby it's not good to go noon-1 on weekdays because it's the financial district and everyone insists on taking their lunch. But just about halfway down on the next block, there's a parking garage that's not too expensive and the employees there are very nice as well! 
Overall, a very awesome place:)
author: Nina P.

description:
SF has a surprising lack of boba shops, but luckily one of them is Plentea! It gets a star off for being on the pricey side of boba and for my first order, which was a mango smoothie that wasn't mixed well and didn't taste like mango. That being said, it gets 4 stars for my 2nd (and 3rd, 4th, and 5th) orders, which was a peach black tea with aloe and boba. It's absolutely perfect and comes with bits of real peaches; the boba is nice and chewy and the aloe is in delicious cubes almost as large as the boba! Heaven in a cup - I should probably try other flavors eventually but I can't resist getting this combination every time I go...

There's only one person taking orders so the wait is pretty long, but once your order is actually placed the drink arrives quickly. The glass bottles are also a nice touch and are useful around the house if you don't bring them back for a 10% discount. If you're like me and go get boba on a whim, or just don't want to carry the bottle back, you can also choose to get your drink in a plastic cup and get a 10% discount on the spot. =)
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I stumble upon Plentea when I was visiting Pier 39. Today, I decided to give it a try since I was touring my friends around the area. 

The line was decent since the place is actually small. I love how cute the bottle is compared to other boba shops. 

However, the drink was a different story. I ordered sea salt creama oolong with boba while my other friend ordered passion fruit oolong with lychee jelly. The drinks aren't as great as other tea places. 

Also, they gave me so much boba that I had little to drink with. They do offer adjustment to drinks but like most other places, it's mainly made from syrup. 

The pricing for this place is expensive - only because you are paying for bottle. They have little sittings inside, but unlike other boba joints, they don't give you the password to their wifi. 

I would recommend going to ShareTea, TPumps or even Purple Kow if you are looking for a better tasting boba drink compared to the bottle that makes the drink look nice.
author: Wanda V.

description: Heard good things about this place. Drove all the way from San Jose area to try & wanted it in the glass for the experience as advertised but they said they were out of glasses. Drink was good but I was unsatisfied with there being no glasses. Contemplating on whether or not to come back again.
author: Jorge M.

description: Got here around 9:30. Only like 5 people in line so the wait wasn't long. Took 20 min to get the drink though. I got the Sea Salt Oolong with grass jelly since they ran outta tapioca. Wasn't bad, but wasn't the greatest either. The glass bottles are cool, but it's pretty expensive for the amount of tea you actually get. Might try it again to test their tapioca, but definitely wouldn't go outta my way to come here over other tapioca places.
author: Puka N.

description: It's good if you are around that area. The glass is a great souvenir. The drinks are overpriced.
author: Michelle S.

description: Looking forward to coming here because of the glass bottles but they were out of them. Really no other reasons to come here. The boba itself was mediocre at best (it definitely didn't taste fresh). The actual tea (I ordered the peach green tea) is pretty good but very sweet. Ultimately disappointed in this place especially because of how many other boba places are in the area and because of how expensive the drinks were.
author: Sharon B.

description: Yes, the bottles are cute. Yes, they have egg pudding topping. Yes, they have great fresh fruit teas - mango is the best. Yes, they have brown sugar ice milk, which they blend up together - yummy! Yes, I try and stop by whenever I'm in the area. And yes, I leave empty bottles in my trunk so I can reuse them and get 10% off my order - after all, how many of those bottles do I really need. And yes, drinks cost about $5 but no, that doesn't stop me!
author: Rachelle T.

description:
My first time here and I had to check out what the hype was all about. That's what it is mainly... A hype. It's not the worse milk tea place I've had (that place is also in SF ), buts also not the best. I got one of their popular Ice Milk with Caramel and Boba. Sadly it just tasted like sugary milk with over chewy boba. 
I got an Oolong milk tea for my brother and that tasted better, but again, I've had better and I've had worse. 

It's worth another try. Plus the have desserts!
author: Andrew B.

description: I think the hype is finally dying down. My first time here, I got the sea salt crema. It's not bad, but it's not good... it's alright and I wouldn't order it again. I gave Plentea a second chance and this time ordered a fresh fruit tea which was pretty good. The tea comes in glass bottles which is cute, but over priced. They offer 20% off if you recycle your bottles or use a plastic cup, but they don't even rinse out the glass bottles.... GROSS! Needless to say, I don't recycle glass bottles after seeing that. Overall, I'm not too impressed but there aren't many boba options in the fidi so I do come here from time to time.
author: Kristen F.

description:
I like the tea a lot. Best Boba I've had in the city, but it's not consistently good and the people that work there are miserable. They need to hire cashiers that know how to smile that are friendly.

Asides from that, pretty good.
author: Maggie D.

description: Love this bubble tea.  AND you get a cool bottle, which we still have.  one time they had run out of the bottles, but they gave us a little discount instead, which was nice.  The bubble tea is great too!
author: Robert S.

description: Loved the reusable bottles, the fresh fruit, and the flavor of the tea. The honey boba was the right sweetness and texture that made the matcha green tea even better.
author: Amy T.

description: This place is so cute! Its a great place to hangout with friends upstairs,  quick drink and its in the cute mason jar! I only give it a four because the drink is a bit too sweet, but overall I love this place.
author: Shelly C.

description: Easily the most overrated and overpriced boba place in the city.
author: Josh U.

description: Tried this place out since my co-workers kept raving about their drinks.  Due to dietary restrictions, I opted for a non-tea based drink....so I tried their "mango" smoothie without boba.  For an early morning weekday, they did not have their classic bottles, but I get a minor discount.  I realized after getting my "mango" drink, it was not made anything fresh....no fresh fruit blended at all. Tasted more like powder....Not coming back here again.
author: Lisa W.

description: No. Hella basic. Got the sea salt crema with pudding. Basic. Ppl waiting in line for a glass bottle. You know what else comes in glass bottles? Beer. That's what I wish I spent my $6 on
author: Deanna L.

description: My friend took me here because he had a great experience. He told me the drinks were good and they came in a glass bottle. Well today I guess we came at a made time, because they didn't have any tapioca and they ran out of glass bottles. It was around 12pm and no one was in there, so it was odd. Anyways based off my experience it wasn't the greatest, I'll give it another try.
author: Cassandra G.

description: Not too thrilled with this new place...tea quality is average but is way overpriced. I suspect much of the price is to offset the cost of their glass bottles. Seems like the only thing plenty at Plentea is the price. I also suspect the great reviews so far are from discounted sales or freebies. I bought the novelty but probably won't in the future.
author: Ashly M.

description: It's OK. The drinks are definitely over-priced. Thai iced tea with boba for $5? And sometimes the boba isn't done well and is gross to eat. Yuck. I've also had some other drinks with pudding and they're WAY too sweet. To me, Plentea is OK but not worth going out of your way.
author: Julie W.

description:
Be careful, be careful, be careful.  If you are one of those folks that likes to save 10% and bring your bottle back, be sure you wash and sanitize it before doing so.  In the past, Plentea would take your bottle, put it on a rack to be washed and make your drink in a new, clean, bottle.  Or so I thought.  I happened to be standing in view of them making my drinks today and watched the girl in the back take my dirty bottles, casually rinsed them and then reused them for my drinks (I had three of them).  When I asked about it and told them that the bottles were not clean, then just stood there staring at me with that expression like "so, what do you want me to do about it?".  And when I asked the cashier for a bag for my drinks, she said that would be 10 cents.  I then asked her if I could have my bag back that I originally brought the bottles back in, she said that she already threw it away.  i asked for a new bag and she still wanted to charge me 10 cents. I gave her a dollar and she asks if I wanted my change back.  Really???  I finally get my change and a bag and left, not noticing until later that she only gave me back 80 cents.

i'm from the South Bay and whenever I get up to San Francisco, Plentea was the go-to place.  Not any more.  i just hope my family doesn't get sick on these drinks i brought back.
author: Daniel L.

description: I had the papaya flavoured fresh fruit milk with honey tapioca. The drink was great, although a bit sweet for me. The glass cup is a really nice touch as well and I'll definitely be bringing it back for a discount next time!
author: Andrew Y.

description:
I want to give this shop higher rating, but sorry!! my experience here was bad! i'm talking about the service! the girl who took my order gave me a nasty look.. idk why.. she was smiling with 2 customers in front of me though. She took my order without smiling or eye contact... =.= didnt even say if it's my order or not when it's out because i wasnt sure if it was my drink.. she was busy texting on phone.. i dont think it's right to use phone.
Drinks: first time try strawberry milk and it was okay.. not sweet in my opinion..

if i ever come next time n have better experience then i'll fix my rating then. not today
author: Janice N.

description: Tried the iced milk with pudding. Eh...glad I didn't have to wait in line for it. It definitely wouldn't have been worth it.
author: Christina W.

description: 4 people ahead of me take 15 min to order... People were so annoyed they walked out. They were out of glass jars and the plastic cups were super flimpsy that my milk tea spilled out. Average drink and the tapioca balls were too hard.
author: Kimmy P.

description: It's hit or miss with this place. Sometimes the boba is very chewy and sweet while other times it's hard and tasteless. Most of the time it's harder and less sweet, but when it is soft and sweet, it's incredible.
author: LoveFood W.

description: Oh god. Have you ever had $6 boba that requires you to spend $15 in order to use CC. Plentea is the epitome of hipster with their fancy glass bottle and logo. I guess since you have a little souvenir to decorate your cubicle in the farm you work. But seriously? I don't think I'll pay this much or milk tea. Drinks a bit sweet so I'll always have to ask for them to make it half sweeten. I'll stick to my 2.75 Milk with boba at Wonderful Foods.
author: Phuong V.

description: I honestly didn't understand why there's always a long line at this place until I walked in 20:45 tonight. There were 3 ppl in front of me and it took the cashier 15mins to take the 3 orders. By the time I finally finished ordering the line is out of the door. Several people left while the rest of us were waiting and the Plentea ppl said nothing. I brought up the wait issue when I ordered but the girl didn't seem to care. To her customers are supposed to just wait longer when they are training a new staff and that unapologetic attitude bothers me. Honestly quality wise this is just an okay milk tea place closer to my office and Asha has way better drinks and customer service. People rave about their glass bottle but to me this is just ridiculous. It doesn't improve the taste of the drink and instead makes it harder to hold. Probably my last try here. Next time when you go just keep in mind you'd probably have to wait twice as much as you think you will.
author: Christina H.

description: Plentea is such a cute place and you gotta go super early or straight a 6pm to get the bottles, that's primarily why I go there cause it's kind of expensive for milk teas and tbh i'm just tryna get the cheapest thai tea in the city bruh
author: Sophie Z.

description: The place looks modern and nice but their payment methods are medieval. The Thai iced tea is good, but this place asks for $15 min for credit/debit card or the "kash" app. It's a lot more than Boba Guys ($3.5 vs $4.5) , where I think the tea is better, but I am a huge fan of the glass bottles. I would give this place a better rating if they did a better job of advertising their payment methods (or lack thereof)/used a standard mobile payments solution.
author: Polina S.

description: I've been trying out every boba place in the financial district in search of the perfect boba.  Plentea's boba is very good and I've never had to wait in a long line. The glass bottle gimmick is fun and I appreciate the 10% discount, but I wish they had a lower-priced boba option without the glass bottle. Also, I could never in good conscience give a place with a $15 credit card minimum a 5-star review. Seriously? That's insane.
author: Jennifer B.

description: DELICIOUS milk tea. You can tell that its brewed very well and not made of any sort of powder. The glass bottles are so cute and unique! I love their milk teas, ice milks, and fruit teas. The price is a little costly but still very worth it. Decor is super cute and hipster! I enjoy sitting on the upper level to sip my drink. Wish they had bigger sizes though!
author: Jasmine Q.

description: Wow what a waste of time!  Drinks are ok, but they got 6 ppl in the back still manage to take 15 min to make my drink, which I only got bc the cashier girl recommended it.   They don't even have almond flavor!  So when I had to go and thought a refund would be quicker than getting my drink, that's when they decided to make my drink in less than a min. Come on peeps, u work in fidi, u can't expect to wait that long for one milk tea.  Their priorities: obviously to make money off of stupid jars and with little effort on quality.  I ain't about that life :/
author: Sandra W.

description: I really like this place. The lines are pretty long though. I usually get the black milk tea with tapioca and lychee jelly. I love the jars that use for the tea and if you bring them back you can get a 10% discount.
author: William F.

description: Its over hyped. Could get better boba in other parts of chinatown. Nevertheless, you get a discount for reusing the bottle!
author: Austin C.

description: Yes, they use seemingly fresh tea and they add pieces of fruit to your fruit tea.  Yes, your purchase of a drink gets a glass bottle that can be reused with a 20% discount on all drinks.  However, they usually run out of glass bottles by 6pm and if you're there before that, you will likely be waiting in line for 20-30 minutes.  And that's not counting another 15-20 minutes of waiting to get your drink after paying.  I can see why many people are so attracted to this place, other than the novelty of it all.  It is the only boba-worthy joint in FiDi without having to walk up the mountain to Chinatown.  But I don't know if it's so good that I'll forsake my billables and wait in line amongst high school kids while the employees try to figure out what they're doing.  2.5 stars upgraded for the cool bottle.
author: Linh V.

description: I like their jars and if you bring it back, you'll get 10 percent off your next order. They only give out 300 bottles each day, so if you want it, better go early. Parking is such a beezie. I would highly suggest taking public transportation. I ordered the milktea, peach green tea, and the oolong seasalt tea. The milktea and the peach green tea was pretty good! I would come back and bring my bottles back.
author: Amy C.

description: Food is too overpriced not that good. Boba drink is not that great only reason I went is for the glass cup
author: Abram M.

description: This place was ok. I got there when the line was not really that long. i usually drive by and wanted to try it, but it always has a long line. I got the milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca. Tapioca was way too bland for me. It had no flavor, like little flour balls. The tea and egg pudding was tasty. Shouldn't have added the tapioca. They ran out of the jars, so we ended up with plastic to go cups. Cashier gave us 10% discount. The place was way too loud. I couldn't really hear the cashier, nor could I understand her. The previous customer gave up and left. He was practically yelling his  order.
author: Andy L.

description: This is my favorite place to go in San Fran for dessert and drinks. They serve them in cool jars you get to keep. The staff are so cool and refreshing when you ask questions. You just can't be happier with the service and the bubble tea.
author: Arielle B.

description: The milk tea is pretty good. The place also looks nice inside and is pretty clean. The Thai tea is solid. It's not mind blowing but it gets the job done if you need a milk tea fix (it's probably the best in the area). I gave one star off because it's pretty expensive for boba! Just make sure you bring back your glass to get 20% off!
author: Gregg H.

description: Delicious, great price and a lot for what you pay compared to other boba places in the area. Chewy boba and there's a lot to choose from ( types if tea, tapioca, pudding, etc). Def will come back!!
author: Maureen M.

description: Just came here for the glass bottle to be honest. The tea itself didn't blow my mind or anything. Worth getting if you're nearby or in the city, but definitely not worth the parking or the line you would have to beat to just buy a glass bottle. If you're tryin real hard to get that Instagram pic of your new Plentea bottle then go ahead and test your luck! But be prepared to be disappointed with the likelihood that they'll sell out of bottles. Check the window for the sign!
author: Aaron L.

description:
We got - Jasmine Milk Te and Sea Salt Cream Oolong Tea

Quick moving line 
Clean
Milk tea in a glass bottle 
Taste really good... not too sweet, chewy tapoica.

Absolutely gonna come back here :)
author: Hien P.

description: Went to sf specifically to try their sea salt crema, and get hold of one of their glass bottles.  The bottle for sure is a little gimmicky.  I had to be schooled on how best to capture the flavor of my drink. The drink was OK, but not my cup of tea. I think their other selections are fine though. Meh... Give it a shot?
author: Chrissy C.

description: Came here on a short trip to SF. Line was a little long, I loved the upstairs seating and of course the bottle. I actually took it home (don't judge). Got the green tea milk tea, and it was way better than I expected! Super fresh and it actually tasted like the tea. $5 for good boba and a bottle? Worth it! Thank you Plentea.
author: Susan H.

description: This is just an O-K place.  2-Star rating logic goes: 3-star for the product deduct 1-star for slow ordering and cash only.  Cash only??  What year is this, 1816?  I bet very few people will beg to differ that if you're doing business today, in a tech driven economy and city, and possibly rolling in the dough (as I can see that business is good and lines are out the door usually), that you'd suck it up and take electronic payments.  Cumon, stop being cheap. Credit card fees are cost of doing business and plus helps speed turnover, faster lines, and might even increase sales.  There's some Econ 101 advice for you and I advise you take it.  Cash only...pffft, really irks me.  As far as the product goes, the drinks are decent and come in these reusable glass containers.  While that's a nice to have but not necessary.  I can understand it if it were a limited time promo. However, after a few visits I would amass a collection of a bazillion bottles and an enourmous guilt of tossing them out.  I don't see how it enhances the product.  If you wanted to be green, tell your customers that the glass is not for keeps and take it back, wash, reuse.  Passing out glass bottles must really hurt the bottomline too.  I really don't see the point.
author: A t.

description: Very good drinks,especially the fresh fruit milk tea. They put real fruit in it. I love the bottle as well. Go green! The only down side is there is no restroom in the store. Really?!
author: Abby L.

description: Yummy! So good, never thought I would be so excited about milk and tea. But this place is great!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ lychee jelly. So f'ing delicious. Extra points for the pretty bottle.
author: Melissa P.

description: So I just had to try what everyone has been ranting and raving about on my instagram and facebook feed. For me this was a 'treat yo self' day but usually I try not to spend over $5 for boba but to try out this place, I caved in. I love the cutesy bottles- as everyone has mentioned before, you get 10% off if you bring it back- which I think is genius. I got the ice milk with pudding , caramel and grass jelly. One of my cons is that when I got to the front of the line they notified me that I would have to pay 50 cents extra because they ran out of milk and would charge me for the soy milk ( but isn't that your bad?) My other con was the grass jelly- and I have had it at multiple locations- tasted strange but I was too in a hurry to take it back. I think all in all , it was a fun place to try but I don't see myself going there for my next boba fix.
author: Desiree C.

description: Overrated for the line, price and quality of the drink.  Share Tea, T4 and cooltea is absolutely better.
author: David T.

description: ummm, I had some high expectation upon trying this place.  I was relieved that there was no wait on a friday night (at least the time I went because when I left the line was out the door).  I had the regular oolong tea with creama.  It was too sweet for my taste.  But the price is decent considering you are getting a glass bottle! Would come again to try other flavors but would most likely tell them to make it less sweet
author: Ann L.

description: From hearing about all the hype and rave about this place I decided to give this place a try. Got to this place at around 9pm and there was a small line. I ordered the taro milk without any addings and my boyfriend got the peach oolong tea. Unfortunately, they ran out of glass bottles and gave us the 20% discount instead. The drinks took about 20 minutes to make. As I take my first sip of my taro milk it was disappointment immediately! The drink was bland and grainy with a small hint of sweetness (not in a good way). The drink seemed to be composed of milk + syrup + blended taro + ice , something I can make at home for less than $5. As for the peach oolong tea it has a strong artificial peach taste to it. Disappointment all around .  I wouldn't be back again even if they cost less than $5 a drink.
author: Lucy C.

description: Clean decor. Small space packed with peeps til late afternoon.  Double the price of any other boba/dessert spot but their shtick is a reusable glass bottle.  Better for the environment but a lot smaller than a typical milk tea.  Ordered the black milk tea w/ tapioca but someone right before me got a mango smoothie that looked awesome.  Boba is well done and obviously sweetened like it should be...Brown sugary goodness! !
author: Jessica M.

description: First of all, the chalkboard menu they have is misleading. I ordered a FRESH FRUIT smoothie (honeydew). I was watching them make my drink and they used SYRUP. Not fruits, syrup. I'm basically paying $7 for a bottle and syrup drink when the menu stated it was fresh fruits. I'm not coming here again.
author: Priscilla D.

description:
Gave this place two tries and overall, disappointed and I won't be returning.

Ordered the iced Oolong milk tea both times and the quality was poor.  

1st time (owner not present): not much tea taste, was watered down
2nd time (owner present):  better than the first time,  too sweet and not enough ice.   I tossed the drink after a few sips.

Having tried all the milk tea establishments in the Bay Area, I would rank this place as below average.  Fantasia is still #1 for me.  Overall, the quality of the tea at Plentea just isn't there and the execution is unfortunately very inconsistent.  My friend has been here 4-5X and on days the owner is present, it is good and when he's not, quality is sacrificed.  I'm more than willing to pay the premium for a quality product.  But aside from the fancy glass bottle, there isn't anything special with the tea.

Perhaps other drinks are better but if they can't get a simple iced oolong milk right, i'm hesitant to try others.

It's too bad given the place had good potential.  It goes with the trend to differentiate via the glass bottle but at the end of the day, if the quality of the end product isn't there, it'll be challenging for repeat business once the novelty of the place wears off.
author: Michelle C.

description: I loved this place. What a pleasant experience. The staff was ultra friendly and attentive and the service was prompt. I found the prices to be extremely fair. They have "plentea" of seating. The atmosphere was welcoming and hip. I had the sea salt crema oolong tea with egg pudding it was to die for!!! Highly recommened that. My friend had a peach fruit tea which was tasty as well. I cant wait to go back and try the lavander lemonade. Definitely give this place a try, you won't regret it.
author: Jose F.

description:
Tried the iced oolong milk tea without boba and friend ordered the same with boba, but neither of us were impressed with the flavor and quality of the drinks. Mine was pretty sweet and tasted very watered down, with barely a hint of the actual oolong tea.

The glass bottles are a nice touch, but I agree with another Yelp review that the offer to bring the bottle back should be greater than its current 10% discount on the next drink. I'll probably just end up using it as another mug in my office.

Actual store is nice, very clean, with an upstairs seating area.

Overall, may try to come back and try one of the other drinks, but for $4.50+ per drink, I'll have to be pretty selective of which one to order.
author: Linda J.

description: My friend introduced Plentea to me when i came to San Francisco last year. The line is usually long. I had to wait about 10 minutes to order a drink. There is a variety of menu on the board, i did not know which one i should get so i decided to try ice milk with caramel, which was the most popular drink there. I added tapioca and egg pudding into my drink and i was impressed by the cute glass jar when i received my drink. The tasted was really good and i really love the tapioca here. That's the best tapioca in San Francisco. Also, you can take the glass jar home, grab a cap ( next to the straws). You can get 10% discount if you bring your bottle at the next tome you visit. The price is not too high, almost $4 or $5 and add mote topping just 50 cents. The service is also good and fast. The only disadvantage at Plentea is that they don't have any restroom for customer. By the way, Plentea is one of my favorite place i want to come after my class.
author: Tran D.

description: Well I mean, I know that tea isn't hard to brew. I worked in a shop that sold boba and teas (not mentioning where especially since it was awful milk tea) but my drink was done before I even got my receipt to sign. That's...odd, I thought. It was the EXACT SAME TEA we served at my old job. Probably came from the same bag mix. Still overly sweet. Cost $1.50 more than the other trash. Soooooo overhyped and at least I got a nice milk bottle out of the deal.
author: Raven P.

description: Love the milk teas, they are not too sweet, just right... The banana Belgian waffle with Nutella is soooo good!
author: Coco Q.

description: The concept of serving milk tea in glass bottles already attracts many customers to come and try their boba. Unfortunately I was not wowed by their flavors and limited selection of drinks. I got the brown sugar ice milk because they said it was one of their more popular drinks. I wanted to adjust my sweetness to 50% but the cashier recommended getting it at regular because "it will defeat the purpose of getting the drink in the first place" and he said it's "not even that sweet anyway." First taste? pretty darn sweet to me! There wasn't anything unique about the drink that would want me to order it again. Prices are slightly more expensive especially since the drink doesn't come with tapioca. We ended up using the 25% off offer on Yelp which helped with the costs but probably would not place Plentea as one of my go to spots for milk tea. The reusable glass bottle though is an incentive where I can see many customers returning for, especially since you get 10% off each time you bring your bottle back.
author: Wendy Z.

description:
Came all the way here to try their waffles last week at noon and was told they ran out of supplies to make them. NOON. really? an hour after you open?

Then came back today to find people standing by the door waiting for them to open at 11:30. No sign on the door about them opening late or not being open today. Finally a guy comes out to tell us that they are closed for the weekend. 

This place needs to get their shit together.
author: Angela K.

description: The waiting line is ridiculously crazy.  I got the taro milk with taro pudding.  That wasn't good at all. My sister got the sea salt. That was nasty.  Want was really good its the mango green tea with lychee jelly.
author: Lonni L.

description:
I heard about this place from my friends' Facebook postings. This is a new bubble tea place and it's pretty solid. However, they seem a bit inflexible with the menu and the milk teas are already pre-mixed meaning they cannot customize for an unsweetened milk tea drink which most places will do for premium versions including Boba Guys in the Mission. Here are my +s and -s about this place. By the way, NO BATHROOM to use! This is important enough that I am going to mention it again under minus.

+ Plus Points
+Comes in a unique glass bottle. Bring the bottle back and get a 10% discount off your next purchase. Comes with cute lids too. Not spill proof, but close to it. Pretty stable placed in my bag although I was watching for spills.
+Great location along 8X MUNI bus line. Very walkable between Fi-Di and Chinatown.  Great lunch choices around the place and also some waffles and organic salad choices here.
+Unique drinks like fresh fruit with milk.
+Trendy ambiance.
+Takes credit card INCLUDING Discover!
+Pretty quick turnover for drinks even when they were busy. I've been twice.
+Steep pricing. Yes, even steeper than Boba Guys in the Mission. Drinks start at $4.50+ tax for regular tea drinks without toppings and go up to $6.95+ tax for the fruit milk drinks. 
+Offers organic salads and waffles. Grand opening deal right now whereby customers get 25% off their lemon honey drink if they order a waffle. Waffles were about $7 bucks.

Minus:
-Ordered a mount premium tea drink which can be unsweetened. However, tell them twice because one of mine came out sweet and I did not know until I got home. They forgot what I told them!
-Gals at the counter were not too creative and flexible with the menu. They really stuck with the menu and at that price, you gotta let customers customize!
-More topping choices beyond boba and pudding would be nice.
-No reward program for frequent drinkers.
-NO Bathroom. Seriously?
author: Tina C.

description: I finally did it!!! Got there when there was no crazy line outside. Got taro with honey boba, was aaaamaaaazing!!!! not too sweet, and BOBAS ARE SWEET SOFT WARM and DELICIOUS! even more! got 20% off for taking drink in plastic glass instead of bottle. I also tried their delicious waffle sandwich!!! sooooo good!!! waffles are just amazing and every single ingredient of the sandwich was toooo good!!! will go there again...and again... and again... :D
author: Asiyat T.

description: I'm not sure why I come here. Either the line is out the door and I go elsewhere or I make it in and they screw up my order. 1 star for the location and 1 star for the tea.
author: A E.

description: Amazing fresh bubble teas (and other specialities) made quickly and with obvious passion.  Served in glass milk cartons, the whole vibe is super hip.  If you like bubble tea, check this place out!
author: Alex G.

description: I love this place. The drinks are delish. The boba is fresh. I love that they use glass bottles. And you can bring them back for 10% off your next order.
author: Jenna K.

description: First day visiting SF and I decided to try this place out! The bottle is super cute. I'll be sure to clean my bottle and treasure it back at nyc. I tired the sea salt creame oolong tea, and oh boy was it salty. Definitely a nice place to try for tourists :-).
author: Wilson C.

description: Yummy drinks. I go right as it opens at 11am and there are no lines. The drinks are delicious! There is an option to get a drink with the glass reusable bottle or to just use a plastic cup. You just have to let them known when ordering. I actually think $4.95 for a drink in a glass bottle is a GREAT deal. Reusable glass bottles by itself are generally $10 or more at stores. At most coffee shops, ceramic mugs are usually $7-$10. So I am seriously coming back.
author: AstroPheems 1.

description:
Don't expect good service. They're awful. 

And the discount thing is basically a scam. You get 50 cents back if you bring back the bottle you got at your last visit and allow them to refill that exact bottle. Today I brought in NINE bottles to give back to them, but asked if I could get my tea in a new one since those had been sitting on my desk and therefore probably weren't the cleanest...and they said they wouldn't be able to give me my 50 cent discount.

The staff is just...not smart. I have a feeling the owner would be happy to take 50 cents off in exchange for nine of their bottles, which would (in a small way) reduce their costs. 

This is just one example of their impotence.

But this place is fine if you don't care about service and you just want a bottle of sugar water with gummy things in it (there's no way it's actual tea).
author: Nikolette H.

description: The owner refused to let me use the restroom, after I spent $25 on tea and a sandwich.  I will not return.
author: Jordan P.

description: Don't go here. Seriously. There are plentea(LOL) of better boba places nearby, such as CoolTea Bar. This place is overhyped and their drinks are watered down. YUCK!
author: Gordon P.

description: The Jar is definitely a nice touch. The boba is above average in both texture and taste. There is a lack of variety in flavor options and the variation in quality of flavors is quite obvious. I would recommend the fruity iced teas here with honey boba. The fruity chunks in the tea compliment the flavor very well.
author: Andy T.

description: I'll be honest, I was one of those people, the ones who go to plentea after being drawn in with the promise of a beautiful, overpriced glass bottle to take home afterwards. I got a honeydew green tea (25% sweet) with boba, and while it was pricey, the tea was pretty damn good and the pearls were decent. I was so happy they let you adjust sweetness which is always a good sign in a pmt joint. All in all, it was a worth a venture into the city and I enjoyed it immensely as I waited for a sushirrito (which, by the way, was not worth the wait) and people appreciated how my drink looked.
author: Pat L.

description: The jars are really cute! I drank here for the first time and I ordered the ice green milk tea and the sea salt crema oolong tea, both with pearls. The sea salt crema oolong tea was good, and had an interesting taste to me because I've never tried a sea salt kind of milk tea before. The ice green milk tea, however, tasted watered down. There was a lot of people when I went so maybe they were rushing? Overall, this place is aight and I'd be glad to come again.
author: Huyen L.

description: I've had boba before, but not in a glass milk bottle. My friend wanted to come here just for that. But I have to say, the glass milk bottle is definitely why the price for a boba is $4.50, but the tea is quite good. This isn't your normal - powdered, overly sweet boba milk tea. I ordered the original black milk tea with pearls and it was lightly sweetened with the flavor of black tea nicely coming through. Plus, the bottles are to keep and if you bring it back you get 10% off your next drink. I say come through, get some really good, no fuss milk tea and a bottle to-go!
author: Krutika D.

description: I tried the Ice Milk w Pudding and it was alright...kinda too sweet for me. Nothing wowed me, except the glass bottles.
author: Quyen L.

description:
Arrived right at 11 a.m. when they opened and there was no line. Ordered caramel ice milk with egg custard and lychee jelly.  Beautiful presentation and delicious liquid dessert for me. My friend declared her black milk tea the best she's ever had!

I noticed fresh papaya and honeydew being cut behind the counter for a fruit drink. Hooray--they use the real stuff!

Definitely paying a premium for these drinks in a glass bottle, but the presentation is outstanding!
author: Mrs P.

description:
Horrible customer service and predatory business practices.  After waiting for almost 20 minutes in line with only 4 people ahead of me,  I place my order and the cashier points to a small sign near the register "Minimum charge is $15".  There wasn't a sign posted on the door for me to see while I was waiting.  I explained I didn't have any cash on hand and she stared at me blankly.  I gave in and bought two more of my same drink.   Once I realized I could not carry three drinks without a bag, I asked for one.  She said "Did you pay the 10 cents?"  I said no, but you can charge it to my card.  She said sorry, "Minimum charge is $15".  

Ok, Plentea, if you're going to require a minimum charge of $15 for credit card purchases, at least post the sign at the door so I don't have to wait 20 minutes before I am told I have to buy three drinks when I only want one.
author: Lokelani F.

description: medium to long waits normally, was closed over memorial day weekend. =( pretty good tea.
author: Teresa H.

description:
Plentea is a place that is new and is developing. 
So a week or two ago, my boy friend and me went for our daily tea run. We decided to give Plentea another try because there was no line.
I ordered a Milk Green tea and my baby cakes ordered a Fresh fruit Blueberry Milk. My boy friend loved the blueberry one but my green tea tasted very run down. It did not have that amazing bitter taste that I was hoping to experience (I took a few sips from my friend's the first time we went as a group). I was not going to complain but then one of the workers approached me and asked us for our honest opinion, suggestions, or concerns. 
I told her what was up and she thanked me for my input. She even asked if I would like to try Oolong or Black milk tea and that she would be happy to make a switch. I ended up with a whole new bottle of tea. I really liked how the workers valued their customer's input and do not complain/make ugly faces if the customer had one.

Plentea of tea for us that day, lol.
author: Cleo C.

description:
Got the green tea matcha slush and it was good. Waiting for the waffles to come out. Great service.

Only thing was the long line...
author: A A.

description:
This is the closest to LA's Half-and-Half SF has to offer: they use real milk.

Downside is the wait. The line can be 5-10min, and the wait thereafter can be another 5-10min.

The mango fruit milk tea with an egg pudding topping is refreshing yet not excessively sugary. The iced milk tea with egg pudding (or tapioca) and caramel sugar will remind you of Half-and-Half - it's noticeably heavy.

Friendly owner/manager.
author: Jack W.

description: 3.5 stars. On a warm day, be prepared to wait over 30 minutes for a drink. They need a better system to speed things along. You get your drink in a glass bottle and it's only one size. Expensive for just once size...$5 to $8 each depending what you get. I tried the mango smoothie. No extras. Wasn't bad, but nothing wow. Their milk flavor drinks with pudding is something more unique. Just make sure you add the right amount of sugar or it won't taste right. If you bring your bottle back, you get a discount, but not sure how much. I haven't been back yet.
author: Karen H.

description: It's better to go towards the beginning of there business hours. No line and will have the bottle for the drinks for sure. They now being green because you get 10% off for bringing the bottle back for your next purchase. Not sure if the 10% off is worthy, especially on the days when you need to wait in line. I like the salted crema oolong tea, but it's tricky not to mix the cream with the tea. Therefore, better take your time yo drink it so the crema cam slowly melt in to the tea in a way?! It's good tough. Other than that, nothing special about the rest of the drinks. Service is decent here.
author: Lianna D.

description: The tea is nothing special. The only cool thing is that it comes in a cute glass bottle.
author: Jeymmie P.

description: Boba's great! The bottles are cute, but definitely over hyped. It's a great place to grab and go!
author: Candace K.

description: Water down overpriced drinks. Plus a piece of tape in my drink that I almost choked on.
author: Kevin W.

description: My girlfriend and I usually don't make it very far from a boba shop before we run out of drink and consider turning around. This happens more frequently after leaving Plentea, where the blocky yet unique glass bottles don't give much room for anything but maybe water for a small plant. What a collectible. Actually, we DID find ourselves thinking we could use them for casual drinking glasses, something my grandma has a tendency to do after she uses a plastic container. I remember taking home leftovers from holiday meals in cool whip or potato salad containers. The label like a fading color in the bones of a family heirloom. I preferred them over the traditional Rubbermaid because I knew they were a time capsule from her. When I was five or so I'd also use pre-used cool whip containers to make mud pies behind the community pool fence at my grandma's apartment complex. I usually left them out to dry all night, and one day they disappeared: that first feeling that someone enjoyed something I had created so much they took it home, maybe kept it in the fridge, served it to ten-minute guests. Anyway, I told my girlfriend we should boil off the label to the Plentea bottles; she thought otherwise. There's a glass under my car seat even now. Emergencies. I'm sure that, when we get around to it, we'll drink something from the converted Plentea glass without the anxiety that we'll run out faster than we can enjoy it. But, alternately, I imagine myself forgetting about it and finding it years later when I'm deep into a thorough cleaning, which definitely won't happen soon because I'm too intimidated by California's drought propaganda to hose off the months of dirt and 65-miles-per-hour wind on my car. What can you do? There's no turning around now.
author: Logan E.

description: Plentea has a good variety of drinks to choose from. It was my first time and I got the taro milk tea which is made with real taro - no artificial powders! With honey boba.  I will try other drinks in the future. Because you are paying for the glass bottle the drinks are pricey. The taro milk tea was 4.95 and boba is additional 50 cents. Much cheaper in the avenues but a good option if you are downtown and have a milk tea craving.
author: Bebe W.

description: I came here just wanted to try their tea and also wanted to get one of their cool glass bottles. I ordered strawberry green tea and peach oolong tea, delicious but not the tapioca balls they were too chewy.
author: Irma Allan D.

description: I came here for the cute jars honestly. The drinks were mediocre... nothing amazing that would make me want to come back. I went for the honey lemon tea with aloe instead of milk tea. It was refreshing but didn't stand out from other places I frequent.
author: Emily M.

description: The only cool about this place is the glass bottle. I got a "fresh fruit" mango black tea with grass jelly. It was too sweet and tasted process. I also got the lavender lemonade. It was lemon lime soda steam with one slice of lemon and lavender pieces in it. It is really unpleasant to drink and have little  pieces of it coming up. I was expecting a lemonade not soda. I love the bottles but the drinks were nasty. They don't have bathrooms.
author: Duy T.

description: My oolong milk tea had A TON of bits..... Too bad I didn't take my first sip until I was already down in the subway. Every sip felt like I had some sand in my drink. I'm really disappointed; I'm really surprised so many people in FIDI come here....
author: Theresa M.

description: I like stealing, let me get this out there.  But the fact that I can get a spiffy glass bottle that i didn't have to swipe with my boba is awesome! The drinks are average, I always get black milk tea and boba which is soo yummy. Plus the guy at the counter is super nice!
author: Cristelle J.

description: This place seems to be doing so well in the financial district, probably because this is the closest place next to being in Chinatown for good boba in the area and the trendy concept with it. I came here yesterday and there was a line outside the door around 1:30pm. The wait wasn't too bad, as I got to decide what I wanted to order. Their menu isn't that extensive; they have all the basics milk teas, flavored milks, iced milk drink, and flavored teas you have seen at other boba shops if you're an avid boba connoisseur. They also have snacks here like waffles, sandwiches, tiramisu, and salads (something I wasn't expecting). I opted for the peach oolong tea with pearls. It wasn't bad and I liked the peach bits in my drink, but for almost $6 I could probably get the same thing elsewhere for $2 cheaper. I do like the novelty plentea glass bottle that comes with every drink, but if you're the kind of person who doesn't care for it, then don't bother coming here. There's also nothing here that I would go out of my way for, but if I'm shopping downtown and craving boba, I wouldn't mind stopping by.
author: Kathleen S.

description: The line is always out the door when I come here. Two floors for eating in but chances are there won't be anywhere to sit as it's a fairly small place. I had their honeydew milk tea which was pretty good the first time I went, although the second time I got it was just meh. My friend had their avocado smoothie which was pretty good! Their bottles are what make them popular more than anything else though, and their drinks average $5+ so it's more expensive than most boba places. The cashiers have been great whenever I come and they're willing to answer questions/give recommendations.
author: Anthony W.

description: The best boba place in San Francisco hands down.  Such a welcoming environment made by the owner, manager, and staff. I come here almost everyday since I've moved to the city and I'm a boba addict because of this place. The bottles they put their drinks in are wayyy too cute :) their boba is always made to perfection. If you ever have a boba craving or just want a place to hang out with your friends, this is definitely the place to go to!
author: Mandy W.

description: I came here twice, once at night near closing & once during the afternoon with a really long line. The first time, they already ran out of the glass bottles so got the 20% with plastic cup with Peach Oolong Tea. It was ok, I didn't really like it and there are more places with better Peach Oolong for cheaper. I really just came for the glass bottle. The second time, came on a Monday during lunch time. The line was quite long because of the time, decided to get the Lavender Lemonade. At first I was really excited because I love lavender flavored things and lemonade. I was kind of disappointed because it was really just lavender pieces with some lemonade and sparkling water. It wasn't really worth the line and the price but I did get the glass bottle. Judging from both drinks, I don't think the bottle would give me an incentive to come back.
author: Polly L.

description:
I came for lunch and ordered the turkey pesto waffle and a black boba tea. I feel somewhat sick now because everything is so sweet. The tea is to be expected but the waffle? I tried to peel off the waffle but the avocado was smashed into it. I think this place is okay but has the potential to be a lot better. It's nice to have boba tea in the neighborhood!

To the owners: I'd suggest switching the waffles with regular old bread. It's an interesting idea but doesn't really sit well when you feel like you've just had a sugar overload (and can smell the sweetness from the fresh waffle.)
author: Whitney A.

description: What a unique place. I was visiting San Francisco and while I was downtown I saw several people walking by with glass bottles with boba inside of them. As I love boba I asked someone where they bought their drink from and she told me about this place. They have so many different options and the glass bottles are super unique. Definitely a place to stop by at for a refreshing drink.
author: Niraj P.

description:
Got the Ice Milk with boba (brown sugar). Tasted like brown sugar. I like my iced milk thicker, so this place wasn't as good to me. The boba balls were super chewy, but not enough sweetness in the boba balls. 

I would go to Purple Kow for my Iced Milk.

Total: $5.38
for Ice Milk with Tapioca (Brown Sugar)
author: Leila T.

description: it was good the first time i get the milk tea. few times later feel like it taste not that good anymore. the tea is not good., and too sweet too.
author: Chia-Pei W.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco for bubble tea. Crema oolong is my to-go drink. Minus 1 star for being a drink establishment with no bathroom.
author: Momo M.

description: The drink didn't taste good. They serve their tapioca drink in glass bottles. I also tried their cheese cake is delicious
author: JP C.

description: I got the black milk tea with tapioca pearls. I liked it despite the  expensive prices. I guess you mostly pay for the glass bottle that you get to keep. At least they give you 10% if you bring it in the next time.
author: Cathy N.

description: Average tea where you could find from anywhere. Cool glass bottle that costs $2 extra. Nothing impressive about the drinks but I will definitely stop by again for their cute bottles.
author: Sara S.

description: Came here the other day and was extremely happy! I came with 3 other people and I got a Thai tea with their honey boba. Super good and the sweetness was perfect for me but I like sweet things so. There was no line when we walked in but there quickly became one within minutes. My order came out within 3 minutes which is extremly fast considering there was like 3 people with orders ahead of me. I paid about $5 for my drink. In my opinion it was reasonally priced considering we can keep the glass. I pay about $4.75 for my thai tea with boba in my area so it wasn't expensive or pricey at all in my opinion. I definately recommend the iced milk caramel thing, my friend got it and I fell in love. Overall, I will be coming here more often with my glass jar for 10% off! (:
author: Grace H.

description: they trick you into liking the place by giving you a cute little bottle that you can show your friends or instagram or whatever, but hey, it works.  the boba itself is actually pretty good.  I recommend getting the oolong milk tea.. the black tea tastes a bit funky.  i've never actually brought back the bottle for a discount because I've never gone to the city just for the sake of getting a boba refill and so I'm suckered into paying an extra few bucks for a new one every time - genius.
author: Mason T.

description: As overall Yelp rating reflects this place accurately. Bubble tea with milk,taste generic at best. please don't even try this place if you are driving and trying find parking in busy hours.
author: R P.

description:
boba is perfectly sweetened, chewy and soft.

teas taste fresh and are absolutely refreshing.

when feel fruity i go for, strawberry fruit tea

when i'm craving for something creamy but refreshing, i go for: sea salt crema oolong tea

when it's hot and i just want a good easy drink, i go for: mountain oolong tea.

you can't go wrong at this place.  PLUS: you get some really good flower vases out of the jars they serve the drinks in.
author: TM O.

description: Best milk tea I've had in SF so far.  Kind of pricey cuhs you're paying for the glass jar.  There's a small selection of drinks and they ran out of like all the food there except the desserts.  Parking sucks also.
author: Rana D.

description: The Black Milk Tea was very watered down and bland but the Ice Milk with Pudding was really good and saved this place. I like that we got to keep the cool glass jars :)
author: Andrew D.

description: The best milk tea we've tried in years! A little bit line but that's how you know you are in a good store. Their fruit juice are made out of fresh fruit bought daily,love them!
author: John W.

description: 2 weeks ago i bought 2 thai milk tea and 1 red bean green tea. It was pretty tasty and i love the glass jar. A girl behind the register and I didnt pay for extra topping since the milk tea already has pearl in it. On the next thursday after my 1st visit, i revisit the place and reorder thai milk tea but the guy in register said i hv to pay for extra topping bcoz all beverage doesnt have anything in it (pearl, jelly, etc) unless u add it.. I got confused of how they can charged me differently? Any of you experience this or just me?
author: Windi P.

description: General speaking !its not necessary waste almost 30mins to wait for ordering the tea because of the glass .beside this ,nothing interested me ,the tea is tasteless .may be they forget to put more sugar in it .
author: Difan X.

description: I tried the strawberry smoothie boba which was mediocre. It was mildly sweet and seemed like something I could have made at home. The sea salt caramel turned out more salty than sweet which i found a little off. The place had a nice design. Overall, I didn't have an amazing experience. Maybe the desserts or milk teas are better.
author: Colin F.

description: Had the iced milk brown sugar - SO YUMMY! It's amazing!!! Cashier was very patient, nice, and helpful! Great customer service!
author: Jen S.

description:
I went here during my lunch which was from 1:30-2:30. I will never come here during peak hours (which I have no clue what the peak hours are...). I waited for 30 mins just to order. The lines are ridiculous!! 

I was the last one to get those jugs which was pretty lucky/cool. Honestly, the tea was just ok. I got the normal milk tea and it kinda reminded me of Quickly's or Tap X. Maybe one day I'll try something else, but lets hope it's amazing because the basic, was just...ok......

On the plus side, if you bring the jugs back, you get a discount.
author: Denise L.

description: 6 dollars for one drink,  that's higher than most places.  Could I just get a drink in a normal plastic cup?
author: Eatdrink L.

description: Cute bottles but that's about it.  They run out so the the bottles are offered only in the morning and the evening.  I wasn't impressed with the tea and my bottle cracked after the 2nd use.  I was wondering why it was leaking....
author: Rosalind S.

description:
For the price of the boba, I expected good quality tea/boba. My daughter and I are avid fans of boba tea houses and we would always search tea houses wherever we may be. On our trip to San Francisco last weekend, we happened to be in the neighborhood and decided to stop by. We (my family and daughter's BF) initially ordered 4 drinks. It was no differently from Honey Boba and I wanted to try the Sea Salt Crema so I ordered a 5th one to go. I left it at the hotel frig and drank it on our way back to LA. We stopped at Gilroy and at that point started drinking the boba. IMAGINE my disgust while chewing the boba, crunched into something and I started spitting it out and while standing in front of the line at The Body Shop, the cashier handed me a trash can so that I can vomit what seemed to be broken glasses. I immediately called the Manager of Plentea and all I got was an apology. REALLY? I took pictures of the broken glass and inspected the bottle. It was intact and had no crack or chip, which only meant that the broken glass came from somewhere else. I will definitely consult with my lawyer and ask him what my rights are!!! Stay tuned readers!

So a month after my review I decided that the owner's apology was enough and I will not file a suit against the owner. I was just so traumatized and decided stick with Honey Boba.
author: M J.

description:
uh-mazing! I got the simple bubble milk tea and it was delicious! you can easily tell the difference with fresh brewed tea.. my only complaint with tea houses in general is that they use coffeemate instead of milk.. coffeemate has hydrogenated oil which as we all know is not good for us.. 
my husband got the matcha green tea milk with grass jelly and it was perfect. Not too sweet, real milk, it was yumm!
author: Aditi A.

description: They get two stars because they sell a genuinely good product, but other  they need to do something about their line. The last time I was there took me 45 minutes to get a milk tea. I didn't know that they were picking tea leaves in the back and making tea from scratch.
author: Joe C.

description:
There was a pretty long line just after 2pm on a Friday when seven of my co-workers and I showed up to initiate our first bubble tea run. But we got through it and received our orders in just over 30 minutes after arriving.
* Location: 5-min walk from work
* Order: The matcha milk green tea with egg pudding ($4.90 after 10% reusable bottle discount) was pretty tasty. There is no option to change the sweetness level.
* Egg pudding: I'm a fan of egg pudding and get it all the time when I'm visiting Taiwan or Japan. This one was was nice and soft.
* Tea: Nom. I love matcha!
* Downside: Still expensive.
* Other perks: Bring back your glass bottle for 10% off! It looks like they changed things up since the first time I came here: you don't have the option to get a plastic cup, but you also don't pay an extra $1 for a glass bottle. Also, the new glass bottles come with a cap, so you can take your drink to go without spilling it. (Sadly, they didn't let me trade in my old bottle for a new one with a cap.)
author: Tiff T.

description: So so. They only do cold drinks, major boo since my go to is hot.  To entice you to come back they serve their drinks in a glass milk bottle,  Apparently you get $1 or something off on the next visit.
author: Meredith K.

description: Walking on this particular street, I've noticed every now and then passerbys drinking out of what looks like a glass jar, which caught my attention.  I couldn't help but finally give it a try one day since the lines usually turn me away.  Surprisingly, for my first time the wait wasn't that bad and I actually got my drink pretty quickly.  I ordered the oolong milk tea.  It was pretty good but I seemed to have finished it pretty quick even though the bottle looks quite big.  A bit pricey but not bad.  I'll try a different one next time I'm in the area.
author: Raymond C.

description: Not worth the money unless you want the cute jar. Boba was hard and had no real taste to it. Cheaper to go to quickly down the street.
author: Karen A.

description:
Honestly, I've had my eye on this place since it opened and the biggest draw was definitely the glass jug the drinks come in. I'm sure the initial draw for everyone is the novelty of the glass jug, but I'm glad the drinks didn't disappoint.
   We ordered the salted crema w oolong without hesitation, but wanted to get creative with the second drink but settled with the Thai milk tea w boba. The salted crema was different than other salted cremas and foams, as this one was like whipped cream floating on top, but it was so good. We did wish they had given us more of it, though, because it's just a small dollop of it and it wasn't the most easy thing to get at with the smaller opening of the milk bottle. 
   We also found out that the fruit milks use whole milks, while the milk teas use coffee mate or creamers, and you can sub for Soy Milk, except for the Thai milk tea. They also offer sugar level modifications, which is great. The Salted Crema Oolong was awesome with just 25% sweetness.
   I was also surprised that this place opened late on a Sunday night, considering the surrounding location is pretty dead after normal business hours and days. They offer 10% off if you bring back your glass bottle to reuse, also a discount if you use plastic cups. The glass jugs are quite a waste of resources, but it is such a draw. It's highly unlikely that the everyday customer will have their glass with them on hand, unless they actually work in the FiDi or Soma area. Luckily, I do, and will be back to try the Taro milk teas and fruit milks.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Mediocre black milk tea. There was a lot of tea settlement at the bottom of my milk jug.

The grass jelly texture was off. It was more like agar jelly then soft grass jelly.

3 Stars because the bottle idea is pretty awesome!
author: Jtina K.

description: perhaps I'm a sucker for the glass bottle, but honestly, the boba was good, the tea was great, and I'll be back. It will put you back about $4.50-$5.00 for a drink, but still worth it. They give you a lot of boba compared to TPumps & it's better quality than a Quickly and you don't have to hike out to the outer sunset/richmond to get it! #win
author: linda t.

description: I love the mango milk here. It's so, so good, especially for late nights if you're looking for something that's not caffeinated. Make sure to bring back your glass bottle for the discount :)
author: Linda Y.

description: Cute place with delicious milk teas. Get the brown sugar milk with taro pudding. You won't regret it!! The glass bottles are adorable too!! Definitely on the list of must eats when in SF.
author: Nina S.

description:
It seems like boba places have been popping up left and right. Even if there's already two or three places that have already set up shop in very close proximity. For me, I'm a sucker for those cute glass jars. I also found the name to be really cute and clever as well.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while now, but it's just out of the way for me. But i finally went with a friend who came over from the East Bay to grab lunch. We were in line for about 15 minutes, I guess that's not too bad if you're not in a hurry.

We got a regular milk tea and an oolong creme. I thought the milk tea wasn't too bad, but the other one was just a tad bit sweet for my taste. The bottle was pretty nice, but not sure if it's still worth the price. I don't think it's a place that I will frequent.
author: Amimee D.

description: 1 star love the drinks, but the girls wear inappropriate clothes(too short i could see her butt cheek) and another girl is awkward and idk what her role exactly is, and i didn't even hear her say thank you, this place needs MANAGEMENT.also they had no lids so the girls boyfriend? had to tell the girl i was waiting for something and when she brought it she kept moving it as i was trying to PICK ONE, let me pick one and then leave it wherever u want lady!
author: Emily J.
