description: Went here for the first time a couple days ago, and i loved it! Cute little boba place in the city. Im a huge boba fan and the menu was very short and to the point. Some boba places are overwhelming with long lists of flavors, but it was easy to choose from a fewer amount of flavors and teas. The best part is that you get to keep the cute glass bottle your drink comes in! And i beliebe you get a discount if you come back with it. Definitely going to come back!
author: Briana N.

description: The milk tea here is kind of watered down a lot now. It used to be good when it first opened. Also, there milk tea seems to carry more caffeine than other boba places. What made/makes this place notable was that it came in glass bottles but now the owners can't seem to keep up with demand so either they don't carry them anymore in that or they charge you extra. I forget which. Trash now, ownership really sinks this place down. 2 stars because their milk tea USED to be really really good.
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Cool spot to get some refreshments and maybe a snack. Unique twist on boba tea. They have their usual milk tea but you can add yogurt, salted caramel creme and other different add ons to your drink. We tried the fresh fruit tea that you can pick different types of tea Oolong, green and black were some of the choices not to mention you can add boba, jelly, aloe, etc. Cool twist on the norm and it even comes in a glass jar although it didn't fit in our cup holder. It's a little pricier than most places and the line can be a bit long but cool to experience.
author: T L.

description: This place is delicious. This is real boba tea and I love how they put the fruit in the drinks! I got the brown sugar milk and it was very good. Also, the boba is very fresh! The only thing I don't like is how expensive the drinks are, but other that that this place is AMAZING!
author: Lucie C.

description:
Finally decided to come here to see what all the hype is about...I arrived about 10 minutes before they opened and there was already six people ahead of me..the line moved along pretty fast...when I got to the front I asked the girl what she recommended...She wasn't really pleasant and just seemed to brush me off...not really good customer service...to not be the jerk holding up the line I ordered the Peach milk tea with bobba...
I really love the glass bottle touch, I can always re-use it for my morning smoothies so it didn't bug me that they charged $5.93..The tea itself was really sweet for my taste and not cold enough...It tasted like a super sweet peach milk drink...nothing special...I prefer the bobba drinks at Quickly in China town they never disappoint. 
So all in all I think its more the hype than anything...Although I will come back to try their green tea and waffle sandwich..they may be better.
author: Lia B.

description: The black tea with honeydew (real honeydew bits!) and honey tapioca is pretty good, tastes unprocessed (coughQuicklycough), but a smidge expensive. Not sure what the glass bottle gimmick is all about, seems wasteful to me.
author: Maximillian M.

description: $4-$5 per drink. Smoothies are ~$6. I keep my glass jar at my office and take it with me whenever I'm craving Plentea for 20% off. LOVEEE all the fresh fruit teas. But the sea salt crema oolong tea was way too rich/sweet and made me feel sick. Oops.. won't get that again.
author: Crystal L.

description: just OK boba. literally just average boba for about $6 (drink + boba). ordered the Coffmilk Tea and was pretty disappointed.
author: Ben L.

description: Don't order the almond milk tea or the coffmilk tea. The almond milk tea tasted like they dumped a couple teaspoons of almond extract in milk tea. They did offer us a new drink for free. We got the regular green milk tea, which was significantly better.
author: Liz D.

description: Not a fan of the lunch-time long lines, but the drinks make up for it! Love their brown sugar milk tea! My fave :)
author: G. G.

description: I can honestly say that most people are just there for the bottles. The bottles are great and reusable. If you bring it back, they will also give you a discount for reusing of the bottle. The boba tea is great but you can go somewhere else and get the same for lesser price. Then again it's more about the bottle and that's what the big hype is all about.
author: M M.

description: Got the milk tea with boba, very average.  Cool glass bottle for your boba at a premium though.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Tried this place yesterday with my boyfriend because it was close to sushiritto. The line here was ridiculous. They really need a second cashier. My boyfriend ordered the basic black milk tea and I ordered the matcha milk tea with boba. The drinks are served in cute glass bottles. Unfortunately, despite the cute packaging, the drinks were just average. Next time, I'm in SF, I want to try a different place.
author: joanne c.

description:
After working at a place making milk tea from powders and sugar solution I've become very picky about my milk teas. Namely that they shouldn't taste like sugar and powder. This place definitely meets my expectations, real tea!

Reusable glass bottles is a great idea. I'll be brining mine back tomorrow for more and a lovely discount for bringing it back!

I asked if I could have it less sweet and apparently you can choose any percentage of sweetness! So I got the green tea ice milk tea with 75% sweetness. Very delicious!

I also got to try the Oolong sea salt crema tea, which was good too.

I'll definitely be back many times to try all the flavors... maybe add the honey tapioca next
author: Sekhmet S.

description: Decent tea. Kinda pricey but nothing FiDi clientele can't afford. Cute bottles. Discount if you bring the bottle back.
author: W A.

description: Great location and good concept but bad service. I went there with my coworkers, and this was first time ( and last time). We asked the girl some questions, she just gave us a "black" face. Oh well, what a Nice customer service. Otherwise, the bottle is cute, drink just ok, price is high. Few blocks away, there is a Quickly, similar drink, same service but I pay much lessssss. Once is enough.
author: MC K.

description: Went to Plentea again today. Knock off one star because no glass bottles. Knock off another star because BOBA and GRASS JELLY was NOT on point today =( boba was hard and grass jelly was lumpy =(. But the fruit tea that I ordered with aloe was yummy. Luckily I ordered 2 drinks for myself, at least one of them tasted good.
author: A L.

description:
This is a review of the quality of the drink because, no, I did not go for the souvenir glass. ( To be real, I am not going to carry it around all day or ever bring it back ) 

Went in Thursday afternoon at 5PM with a very short line. Ended up getting a black milk tea with lychee jelly and fresh peach black tea with boba for $11.00 I drink boba literally everyday from a variety of places and this one was by far not worth the walk nor the price. Very forgettable. 

Its all a big ( genius ) marketing ploy like a bunch of other asian places...
author: Adrienne C.

description: Good bubble tea, but a bit too sweer. I had the taro milk bubble tea. It was ~$6 for a small drink. Came in a glass bottle. Would have been better if it were paper or plastic so it'd be less susceptible to breaking, yet equally recyclable. Overall it was good but nothing to rave about.
author: John P.

description: This is one of the best thai milk teas I've had! It's perfectly sweetened- most I find are sickeningly sweet. I also LOVE the glass bottles. Such a modern, eco-friendly way to serve their drinks... I definitely plan to bring mine back for the 10% discount... But it'd also make a cute vase or perfect bottle for juicing!
author: Ashley S.

description: First I would like to say.. Thank goodness for Yelp! I decided to see what the buzz was all about on this small place; in the financial district close to chinatown. When I arrived; yes it was a line. The wait was actually less than 10 Mins. I came here close to 1 pm today. When I walked in; there were a few tables and a upper level for people to drink their teas and relax. I walked up to the cashier and told them it is my first time here; The cashier recommend me the popular fruit teas were strawberry and peach. So I ordered a Strawberry Black Tea; you can add toppings like lychee, tapioca, aloe and other varieties.  I received my order less than 6 minutes;  which I think that's fast. The Strawberry Black Tea had strawberry bits and it tasted like Strawberry. Plus it comes in this awesome bottle; you can keep but you can bring it back to get a discount on your drink!!!. Overall my experience with Plentea was awesome; I plan to go again soon. ;)
author: Jaiesha C.

description: Their boba is good but the location is meh.. It's hard finding parking, but their glass bottles are cute.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: ICE MILK WITH BROWN SUGAR IS THE BOMB ! lines are long though, but you can get there on weekdays when there's no line.
author: Florencia I.

description: Just impressed the way of their serving in glass bottles. awesome.
author: Newaj H.

description: Unique flavors; but the salted cream oolong tea is a little too salty and creamy. Sweet and soft boba though!
author: Maria D.

description: Tried this place for the first time! Line wasn't as long as what I thought it would be and the cashier rang up the customers in a timely manner.  I got the brown sugar milk tea with boba in the milk bottle.  I honestly got it for the milk bottle but I noticed their "300 a day until July" sign so I have to go back and get more!  The boba is very soft and chewy but their milk tea was kind of sweet, even if it was brown sugar.  I think i would definitely go back to this place once this place mellows down.  :)
author: Jessica Mae T.

description: We had the tea here in plastic to go cups because they ran out of the glass ones. The peach oolong tea was very fragrant. Overall taste is good but I want to try their milk tea next time.
author: Jennie W.

description:
The milk green tea, crema oolong, and avocado smoothie were all tasty. The boba was too sweet however. 

The plastic caps on the glass bottles don't seal well and leaked in my bag.

Prices are on the expensive side. $4.50 for milk tea plus 50 cents each topping. Essentially you are paying for the glass bottle with your drink. Lines are shorter in the evening than afternoon.
author: Ann H.

description: The iced Oolong milk tea with grass jelly and egg pudding was decllous! The drink is pricey, at $5.98 with sales tax, but I can see why as it comes with a reusble glass container.
author: Anne T.

description: Bobba is good and you get a glass bottle with it!  The lines can become very long though...
author: Kailee Q.

description:
Even tho the place seems to be crowded. Generally the place is overrated and overhyped. Even though our drinks had a heavy tea tasting, there weren't literally the milk side in it. It's feeling like drinking milk water with tea. Overall, Our drinks were below mediocre with that high of a price.

Won't come back if in the area again. There are other more authentic and better 'real boba place' in the area such as the cool tea bar.
author: Wai C.

description: We were walking around town on a nice sunny day in San Francisco and came across this place on Kearny. There was a long line so we got curious and stand in line. We learned it was a boba tea shop. Their hot unique selling point that drives people there is their drinks come with a cute glass jar and you can take it back for discount. Unfortunately the day I was their they have a shortage on those jug but they willing to give 20% discount off of the drinks. My husband waited in line at least 15 mins before we are up to order and waited another 6-7 mins for our drinks.  We ordered a fresh mango smoothie with boba and their famous ice salted caramel crema oolong tea. The drinks are good. I like the mango smoothie better then the salted caramel crema oolong tea.  The mango tasted very fresh and good tapioca boba. Nice rubbery texture and nice to chew on.  The salted caramel was little too salty for me. I don't think the Creme mixed too good with the salt since it wasn't too sweet or the texture is rich enough to hold up the saltiness.  I would go back once in awhile but not purposely just to make a trip there. Especially they don't have that jug. The people works there did mentioned the jug supply will be back to normal in July.  Until then.. Just need to go early to hope u get a jug after standing in line for 15-20 mins.....in don't think the place is at four star yet but maybe a 3.5 star.
author: Becky K.

description: The tea and food options are great, but I wish the wait wasn't too long. It took awhile for the cashier to take my order, maybe because she's new. I'm not sure...but it also looks like they only have one person making the drinks. Maybe if they had more people helping out, it'll be faster. But definitely a pretty decent place to get your boba fix in the financial district!
author: Amy T.

description: boba is out, pudding is in!   i tried the drinks with pudding in it, and i'm on board with this new trend.  i like both the taro and egg puddings.  i tried my friend's iced milk with egg pudding with caramel and it was a delicious drinkable dessert.   i had the iced green tea with taro pudding which was good too but not so much after drinking my friend's.
author: Wakako U.

description: Arrived around 2pm and there was at least 30 people a head of me. I waited in line for about 45 mins and then it took a good 15-20 mins to get my drinks. The fruit smoothies are really good! But the people trying to pour it into the bottle were having issues and I was standinf there staring for about 10 mins.... that was kind of annoying if you ask me.
author: Monica N.

description: I came here on a Tuesday afternoon,  so it wasn't too busy and the line wasn't that long. I ordered an iced milk and a jasmine milk tea. Their iced milk with egg pudding is delicious. It's not watered down and it's the perfect amount of sweetness. The jasmine milk tea was alright, and their tapioca was kind of a little too soft, but overall not that bad. It's kind if pricey, but the glass bottles makes it worth it. Would definitely come again and reuse my bottle for a discount.
author: Ivy P.

description: Unique boba tea joint. We tried the Thai Ice Tea with Tapioca. It was very good, not too sweet, and the boba was perfect. I like that we got a tall glass mug to keep.
author: M K.

description: First off, 5 stars cuz the drinks are AMAZING. (And that's a lot for me to say seeing as I'm suuuuppper particular about my boba) and plus one for the reusable glass bottles, BUT! -2 stars for their extremely slow service, with no sense of urgency at all. Im coming back, but they better get their efficiency together cuz I can't wait another 15 minutes on ONE drink.
author: Cynthia N.

description:
Great customer service! 

First time here, so I thought I got the most popular drink, sea salt crema oolong tea... I guess it's an acquired taste because it's was too salty for me, so I asked if I could get a different drink and they we're happy to make a new drink, strawberry oolong tea, which I loved.
author: Angela R.

description:
They serve milk tea in glass bottles.  That you can keep.  That had me sold pretty quickly, so I went just to try it out.  It is a little pricey ($5 for a milk tea with pearls), but it's 20% off the next time you come back if you bring the bottle.

As a warning, I'm a huge pearl milk tea snob.

The milk tea was too sweet for me, cause I prefer a heavy tea flavor in my milk teas with just the right amount of milk to take off any bitter edge it has.  It was good though, just nothing special.

The tapioca was better than most places actually!  They were chewy instead of the hard pearls I've had many times in other places, and the pearls actually had flavor from tapioca syrup.

There's food here too that I didn't get the chance to try, but overall it seemed like a pretty good spot to sit and chat with some friends (in the upstairs seating).  There seems to be a line most of the day, but it's not too bad.  They only have a limited number of glass bottles per day....and I probably wouldn't come here if it wasn't for the glass bottles.

So yeah, I'd come back.  For more glass bottles.  And maybe some milk tea as well.
author: Tommy H.

description:
I been there 2 times already, tea is not that great but most people come because of the glass bottle.    $5-6 dollars it a bit expensive, not so worth for the pre-mix powder drink.
May be lack of boba milk tea store in downtown financial area.
author: Natalie L.

description: A bit pricey with their cute little glass bottles but you can get return them for a discounted drink or get 20% off if you opt to get the plastic cup instead. Mango black tea with lychee jelly is the best!
author: Angie S.

description: Plentea is amazing! The glass bottles are super awesome and extremely portable. I tried the mango fruit tea and caramel iced milk. Both were delicious but a little on the sweet side!
author: Kerry N.

description: This place is awesome. The baristas were so nice to us because they genuinely cared about our Boba needs. Got a green milk tea. It was really good, the best in the city.  Also got the brown sugar ice milk tea with egg pudding. I was looking for Brown sugar milk tea ever since I tried in in LA and this place was the first Boba place that taste similar. Love this place :D
author: Anna L.

description: This place charges tax for take away drinks. And I specifically said to go, and yet on my receipt it says dine in.
author: Angelina Y.

description: Like the comments below, people only come here for the jar. Other than that, eh...nothing special. :/ Sharetea is still my favorite!
author: Jenny L.

description: I like the glassware, really nice ! But seriously, only a 10% discount for reusing!! So depending on tour toppings an avg of .40-.60 cents off! My biggest complaint however is the Nutella flavor drink. There was no presence of Nutella in my drink, it tasted more like Hershey's choc syrup! Very disappointing!! I know Nutella, been enjoying it since before it made it to the US, so don't advertise a drink having Nutella and not use it. Tell me tour out before substituting something else. There was no hazlnut flavor whatsoever!!
author: Daphne P.

description: First time trying this place--a friend brought me here and told me about the cool glass bottles they sell. Unfortunately, today when I went, they were all sold out! I ended up getting a Mango Fresh Fruit Milk with Honey Tapioca. It was pretty tasty, but I didn't expect there to be actual chunks of mango in there. Wasn't bad, but I think it would've tasted better without the chunks. The tapioca pearls were nice and chewy like I like them. It's a little pricier than some other boba spots you'll find, but overall worth a try.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Milk tea seems to taste better in glass for me. There's almost always a line at this place. The drinks are ranges from really good to ok depending on the day; not very consistent. Still, if I have time, I like to make a pit stop here and chill before going to wherever I was going.
author: Lea M.

description:
CUSTOMERS BEWARE - BROKEN GLASS PIECES FOUND WITHIN TAPIOCA.


This is the third time my family and I came here. The first two times we've been satisfied with the black milk tea with tapioca and the sea salt caramel oolong milk tea with tapioca.

BUT...

This third time (which is earlier today, 9/18/14, around noon) my mom got three orders to go. Mind you, it's so DIFFICULT to find metered parking around that place. So while I drove, my mom started to drink her boba and a couple of sips into her drink she found herself chewing on something crunchy in the tapioca. She spat out the tapioca and LO AND BEHOLD there were two small pieces of BROKEN GLASS INSIDE THE TAPIOCA that she was chewing on. 

We didn't touch the other two in fear of chewing on broken glass. I tried calling Plentea to let them know so we don't have to trudge all the way back to downtown but they didn't answer. SO we're going to go back and return the drinks and hopefully get to talk to the manager or supervisor and show them the tapioca with the broken glass pieces and get a refund. 

I saw another review of a customer that was served with broken glass as well. 

This will be the last time we're giving them our business. They're products are hazardous. 

I hope people get to read this review so that they can take precaution when planning to order from this place.
author: Dianne G.

description: Top stars. I hate drinks that are overly sweet-I got the strawberry fresh fruit tea with black tea and the peach milk tea (forgot what these drinks are actually called)-and they were amazing, refreshing, and the perfect amount of sweetness. The glass bottles make it more environmentally friendly-which I love. The only downside of this store is that there is usually a long line-because this place is awesome! Best boba/tea place, in my opinion. Always coming back here again :)
author: Karen I.

description: I went to Plentea in the afternoon, and as expected, there was a long line. When I got to the front of the line, I realized that they had a long line because the workers took a while to make each drink. The workers there were really polite, and I could tell that they wanted to make sure their customers were satisfied. I ordered a regular milk tea, and to be honest, I didn't think it was all that good. To me it tasted just like teaway milk tea (which can be found all over sf, honestly), and the drink just wasn't all that great for it's price. But I guess the main attraction was the glass bottle, which was indeed cute. Overall all I think the bottle was worth going for, but not the drinks themselves.
author: Annie H.

description: This review is based on three separate visits. The first time I visited, I wasn't sure what to get but saw that another yelper had gotten a "salted caramel" milk tea. I thought it looked delicious and decided I would order that. When I placed my order I was told that there was no such thing. The sweet cashier started listing off options to me and with some confusion I ordered, not really sure of what I would receive. What I got was the most delicious drink ever. A milky caramel drink with boba on the bottom topped off with a thick delicious cream on the top. Of course it was so good that I had to go back and order another a few days later. When I went to do so, I tried to explain to the cashier what I got the last time. She looked confused and what I ended up with was disgusting and nothing like what I got the first time. Unfortunately I was in a hurry so I just took it and left. That leads me to today. I was determined to get the drink of my dreams again and returned to attempt to order correctly. After standing in line, I tried to explain to the cashier exactly what I wanted. She again looked very confused, but was very sweet and tried to point me in the right direction. I ordered and when I received my drink I could tell just by looking at it that it wasn't the right thing. I wasn't worried though, because they have a large sign that says "we will fix your drink if you don't think it's perfect." So without even touching the drink I told the cashier it wasn't right and asked her for milk tea on the bottom, not plain tea as I had been given. She sweetly listened and went to the back only to come back to tell me that her manager said if I wanted another tea I would have to pay for it. I asked to speak to her manager and was rudely confronted by her. She kept saying "well what am I supposed to do with this drink?? I can't give it to another customer!!! I don't see what the problem is. What's your problem??" Finally I was forced to read her sign to her, which she just happened to be standing next to. She finally conceded, and as she walked to the back THREW my drink into the sink in anger. (Remember, glass bottles.) I was made another drink that was closer to what I wanted but still without the creamy top that I asked for, but I was sick of arguing so I left. I'm sad. I really wanted that delicious drink again, but I guess I'll never have it, as even if I did decide to give that rude woman more of my money for her overpriced drinks, she still probably couldn't get it right. I just felt bad for the cashier who was very sweet and apologetic.
author: Lauren C.

description: The drinks are delicious but they are extremely inefficient and mind-blowingly slow. It took me OVER AN HOUR to get a single drink. I will not be returning here in the future.
author: Alyson G.

description: I was lucky that this opened near my hotel in SF because I ended up being able to get a good daily bubble tea while on business! The lineup is long but worth it, tried their desserts although they run out of ingredients and options often. I got the bottle and used it for a week but will have to get it again when I return.
author: Sheila K.

description: DEFINITELY WAY TOO EXPENSIVE. Around the 5-6 dollar range for a 24oz (I think) glass bottle.10% off your next purchase if you bring it back (but still a lot). I like the fresh fruit and the boba is not bad. I would only come here again if I was hanging with friends and they wanted to come.
author: Kevin L.

description: was very disappointed for the service that was given, in fact my order was made wrong and my bottle broke that same day when I rinsed it. Idk why ppl buy such expensive drinks for an extremely cheap bottle that breaks! Never come on lunch break or after the work rush hour...expect to wait 45 mins in line!
author: Grace V.

description: Love this cute little spot. Walked In around 2 today and was surprised there was no line especially since it's a Saturday. I ordered the ice milk with caramel, egg pudding, and boba. It was soooo yummy! I like how their tapioca is soft and squishy, I know some places who freeze their tapioca and it comes one rock hard yuck! I like the fact you get a discount here if they run out of glass bottles and if you bring in your old glass bottle. I'll be back next time I'm in town!
author: Michelle Q.

description: Too expensive. I tried the fresh fruit oolong mango tea with honey tapioca. It was OK. Nothing stood out. Of course, they are out of the famous glass so I got a 20% off (I really don't care). I still paid almost $5. The place is too small. The service is too slow. This place needs to have a better system to keep the line moving and drinks done a lot faster.
author: Jingle A.

description: To be honest this place is overhyped. The bottles are really nice but the tea is not very good at all. There are definitely better places for a cheaper price. The milk tea is premade so the tea looses its taste. Very disappointing
author: Stephanie O.

description: I came here twice with friends and the first time was during lunch hour so the wait was really long. The second time wasn't that bad. The drinks are pretty good and I ordered the green milk tea with boba. It's a bit bitter and sweet for my liking but good for a place that opened recently. The glass bottle is nice since you're initally paying for the bottle. But overall I do like the drink and it is worth it.
author: Monica D.

description: I've had my eye on this place for a while and finally had a chance to check it out. For all you boba lovers out there, this place is def worth it. For the same price of a drink at Tapioca Express, you get a bigger bottle (which you can take him, how awesome is that?) and get to enjoy amazing tasting tea! When I went here yesterday, the line was till outside the shop so I would say others agree with me. However, it might have taken about 15 minutes to get the drink. The same amount of time it takes me at other boba places. The boba was super chewy and soft, which is imperative because we've all witnessed hard boba and can officially say it sucks. The only downside is that the tea itself was okay. But, if you bring your bottle back, you get a discount so points for that. I'll for sure be returning to try the waffles, which btw looked BOMB.com, and maybe even spoil myself to the Nutella drink.
author: Hina A.

description: Fabulous! A must visit! Always heaving with San Franciscans so it can't be bad and it isn't! A wide variety of flavoured iced or hot teas/coffees to suit most palettes!
author: Sandeep M.

description: the bottle you get is awesome but when I poured hot water in it the bottom fell off /: but still cool!
author: Shelby S.

description: Bad service ever! That blonde chinese bitch is fcking lazy! All of them! I was with my nieces, we ordered 9 drinks and they told us that they only serve regular milk tea. They lazy as fck. I swear, we wanted different flavors. Its our first time and this is what we get? Never ever. They're lazy! Stupid bitches! Very dissapointed!
author: Clariz M.

description: The drinks are a little pricey, but its reasonable, because the bottles that they gave us are so cute and reusable!  I just wish the caps were a screw in type, not a push on. But overall, their Ice Milk Drink with Egg Pudding and brown sugar is... DELICIOUS! I love how the brown adds so much flavor because I tried the Ice Milk Drink with caramel and there just wasn't as much flavor as the one with Brown Sugar. I'd probably go back to go try one of their Fruit Teas because It looks so refreshening and delicious!
author: Angela L.

description:
Would give zero stars if I could. I completely apologize in advance for such a long review but it's an entire incident that happened.
I was visiting SF with friends and when we first arrived there were only a few people but after we ordered people started flooding in. Thirty minutes after ordering, my friend and I still hadn't received our order. When we walked up to tell them they told my friend that they never made his drink because they got too busy and basically said that it was his fault for not reminding them to make his drink sooner. When I asked them about my drink the "barista" filled up a black tea for me real quick when I ordered a green tea and then handed it to me. I didn't touch it and told him "Actually, I ordered a green tea" and showed him my receipt. He set it down and continued with the other orders. I stood there waiting to talk to the cashier again and when I finally got his attention I let him know I got the wrong order. The barista came back to talk to the cashier and told him I was wrong... My boyfriend then came over to see what was taking so long and the barista looked at my boyfriend and told him this was my drink pointing at the black tea. My boyfriend picked it up handing it to me and I told him to set it down. Then the barista told me that because he touched it its now mine. The barista didn't stop there, he then held up another tea and said "Look at this tea. This is what black tea looks like, does this look like yours?!" I told him that I saw him fill up my bottle with the canister that said "BLACK TEA". The manager then came out and I asked for my money back but he wouldn't let me get my money back. Instead he continued to insist I try another drink. I then asked for a Thai tea to-go. The manager then said "It is to-go, all the drinks are to-go, why do you think the caps are here!?" At that point I was just shocked at the customer service. They cared more about being right than treating the customer with respect. He handed me the Thai and said "Try it and make sure you like it this time" ...Uh, the problem wasn't that I didn't like the drink, it was that they never got the order right in the first place. I finally got my drink after 45 minutes and a lot of yelling on their part but was the drink good, sure. Was this whole ordeal worth it? Do you even have to ask? You couldn't pay me to go back there.
author: Annette K.

description:
overall pretty good i think, though there was definitely some miscommunication at the counter. i ordered the sea salt crema oolong tea with tapioca, which comes layered. sea salt cream, tea, then tapioca. the woman at the counter said "don't mix it. drink it straight like it is." these sounded like terrible instructions but hey, who am i to question the person who's sole purpose throughout the day is to deliver milk tea drinks to people? so i stuck my straw in and drank from the first layer only to choke from the excess amounts of sodium coating every part of my throat and tongue. surely she was mistaken and meant "don't drink it straight like it is. mix it." damn, girl!! get your shit straight please, because i almost hated Plentea after that. but then i decided to ignore her backwards instructions, mixed it up, and happily drank it down properly. the tapioca had great consistency and chew and the tea was pretty good. i'll likely be back if i happen to be in the area. 

someone tell me how they possibly keep up with all of the glass bottles they hand out. i can't imagine that's a cheap thing to maintain. their bottle game is strong so they must be making a ton of money off of sugar and tea.
author: Regina C.

description:
what got me excited to come here was the boba in a glass bottle. browsing through fb is great advertisement. my friend had came here before the grand opening day - soft opening? and everything was 50% off at that time. so im like whoa! i gotta go... but the two days before their grand opening.... they were closed... so came here on their grand opening day and waited about 30 mins? for two drinks (decided to go safe and got jasmine green milk tea and thai iced tea both with boba) - total came out to about $11-$12? pretty steep for some boba.... but i figured its because of the glass bottles....and the location - nothing labled "financial district" is really cheap. the milk tea was alright... nothing fancy i believed the boba were honey flavored.. at least to me it tasted like honey - similar to T-Pumps so that was good. i would come back.... because im a sucker for glass jars. i also want to try their fresh fruit tea.... 

if you bring your glass bottle back you get 10% off... which isn't much... i think your better off paying that 10% for a new glass bottle...
author: Kristina L.

description: I've had plentea multiple times with different drinks - black milk tea, fruit tea, and honey lemon tea - each time, it's beyond amazing. Service is prompt. I also had a waffle once, and it was pretty good, definitely great for dessert. Plus you get a glass jar which is pretty classy and reusable either at the store or at home. Highly recommend.
author: Leslie T.

description: Pretty good but they hardly ever have the bottles anymore! It's a bit disappointing..
author: PB S.

description: it is nice place ... price is reasonable，the cup is unique & fashionable！and u can have the cup with u！！the price is cheaper compare with other tea place in this area！really good customer service！definitely will come back...
author: Jamie L.

description: I came to this place because everyone was raving about this hype and for the cute bottle! When I got there, there was a line, but that's okay because tpumps was just like that when it had it's grand opening here in sf irving. Since it's gonna be pretty busy for awhile, they should make the drinks with a faster solution. The place is a bit crowded, especially the first floor. When it was my turn to order, the cashier was very nice and suggested me whats good. I got the fresh fruit mango milk drink with tapioca and ice milk with tapioca & taro pudding. The bottle caps, straws, etc were all placed neatly on the counter! I think my drinks came in no later than 5 minutes. The food there in my opinion is not worth it. Something they should improve on, is putting more ice in it. My fruit drink was cold yes but not cold enough. it was too foamy and needed more ice. The taro pudding is good!!! I am willing to come back to try more of the drinks. I would give this place a 3.5.
author: Josie D.

description: Overpriced. The milk tea isn't even good. With that quality, I'd probably just charge $2.50 instead of $5.00. I've had better... A LOT better... milk teas for a much cheaper price.
author: Kristine Z.

description: Wow, the decision to not give the glass bottle ruined your place. Good luck.
author: Jason K.

description: It was too overpriced for how much you got. I was also expecting glass bottles and they were out. They also had a limited selection of flavors.
author: Jessie S.

description: The drinks are good, but not worth a 45 minute wait. No joke, 45 minutes. We were there at 11:01 and got out at 11:46. I know it's a new business, but they need to fine-tune their processes ASAP because right now, they are as inefficient as they come. Until then, I won't be coming back.
author: Jill Amy R.

description: I'm just gonna put this out there: I don't get the hype.  My coworkers told me about this place and I've been here twice.  Maybe I'm order the wrong thing.  I usually go with just a plain milk tea with boba and it just doesn't hit the spot like other places.  I came in pretty late one night and only one girl was working.  She dispensed my milk tea from a large square cube and there was something so unappealing about that.  Decent service.  While I'm not totally against this place, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back since the quality just isn't there and it's pricier than other locations.
author: k h.

description: The tea was very good, but they need to work on their efficiency. I went on an evening so there weren't many people, but my tiramisu I ordered took 25 mins. I could see the staff kitchen and the staff was just very slow...it was frustrating.
author: Yan K.

description: Bumping up a star after multiple visits over the past few months. Drinks are still very good and the quality of ingredients is excellent. I've enjoyed trying just about everything on their menu. They're a little faster than they used to be, and the kitchen looks much cleaner. Why I'm not bumping it to 4 or 5 stars: Still too slow! Last week there was a guy operating the register who slowed down the whole process by messing up just about every order, forgetting ingredients, etc. Another employee tried to take over but he said, "no, I'm having fun!" Would prefer he have fun when the line isn't out the door. Also, I find it annoying that they have a $15 credit card minimum! This is ridiculously high and is often what keeps me from going here. If they could speed up the order process (they're super quick with making the drinks, it's the register that's slowing them down), and lower that credit card minimum to $5, I'd be a regular customer.
author: Alison S.

description: The selections are on the short side, but their oolong tea with crema surprised me, the tea is very refreshing though boba are just ok. I wish the cream is less and more tea. And the bottle should be worth 1 dollars if you return them like every other coffee shops, 10 percent off of a 4 dollars drink is really not a lot...
author: Diana C.

description: Ugh. I think my initial review was just a bunch of BS. Listen, if you want to spend $6.47 for a Hazelnut Milk Tea (with two toppings) that will actually turn into Chocolate Milk Tea when your recieve your order, then by all means come here. That's what happened to me today and I dont like it. In fact, I'm tired of all these inconsistencies and drinks not being what i expect them to be half the time. And for the price of two bobas somewhere else?! Yeah i think I'll stop coming here. $6.47 psssh. To be honest, i didnt even realize i was spending that much because i kept throwing down a ten dollar bill and just never really processed it. This week all I had were ones so i was paying more attention to the cost. Last week my drink was $6.69 WITH a 10% discount for bringing back a jar for that coffee milk tea. hahahah oh god. Don't be fooled by the jars. They're basically sirens singing to your eyeballs. Passssss. BYE FUHLEESHUH.
author: Mila B.

description: this is the cutest place! they give you a reusable glass bottle which you can bring back for a discount on your next purchase. i got the ice black milk tea with honey boba. the tea has a strong tea flavor that you can tell freshly steeped. just the perfect amount of milk to tea. the honey boba does not taste like honey which i don't mind cause i believe that some boba changes the flavor of the tea. i will definitely be back!
author: Nicole M.

description: This place is definitely a great breakfast spot to go to.  The waffles are amazing! The honey green tea that i got was also amazing. Make sure to bring back the jar they serve your drink in next time you come back for a discount! Not sure how much -i think 10% or 20%.
author: Cynthia I.

description: solid bubble tea in downtown SF served in adorable glass jars! definitely coming back. free wifi also available (check the blackboard!)
author: Food E.

description: solid bubble tea in the fidi. a little too pricey in my opinion but the boba is on point and its the only good place that you can get to quickly at lunch
author: Annie R.

description: I stopped here while waiting for a seat at the ramen house a few stores down. I've heard about this place before from a best friend of mine so I decided to walk in since I was so close. I love how they serve their drinks in such hip glass bottles. That's probably their selling point as I don't know any other boba place to do so. Drinks were mediocre; I ordered the iced Thai milk tea with tapioca and my brother got the oolong tea without boba. My Thai tea seemed to be heavy on the milk part but nonetheless good. Tapioca was chewy and not hard like other places. The one thing I didn't really like to much about Plentea, is the price of their drinks. A usual milk tea shouldn't be $4 almost $5, but I guess you are actually paying for a glass bottle too. Overall, everything was good, customer service needs some work but other than that, they are a good boba place with a novelty jar to take home!
author: May S.

description: Good tea and they use good ingredients which makes up for the price.  I don't get the obsession for the glass bottles...  it's just a re-usable bottle that actually doesn't have a very secure lid.  Just bring in your own Klean Kanteen and see if you can get the same discount.
author: Trinh N.

description: A very good boba milk tea place in the FD.
author: William N.

description: Beware of the long lines.  The boba is not extraordinary, this place is popular because of the boba jug which is gimmicky.  I also found two strands of hair in my drink.
author: James W.

description: It is the real tea, not like other places which use powder. About $5 a drink is ok in the FiDi. Also Like the waffle sandwich and dessert. Love the jar!
author: Hyman W.

description: Overpriced.. Gave very little boba.. They only why the prices are so hiked up is because their location. I rather commute to the outer Richmond for purple kow!
author: Dennis T.

description: Boba tea at its best!! So glad this opened near my office. There's usually a long line, but it moves fast.
author: Leah M.

description: Got the Ice Milk Drink with Pudding at 50% sweet.  Pretty tasty and not too sweet.  Glass was cool since I can bring it back for a 10% discount.  Otherwise if you have no plan too bring it back I don't think it's worth the added cost.  Prices are pretty high and they ask if its "to go" or "for here".  I said "to go" and was still charged sales tax.  It is up to the establishment to charge tax if the food is "to go" so I think it would help them out a lot with the pricing if they do not charge tax on "to go" orders.  Also, I know its the first day and it still took some time to prepare my drink even though I was the only one.  So be prepared to wait until they get up to speed.  I'll be back with my glass to try some other drinks.
author: Jason C.

description: Finally a milk tea place in the FiDi. Definitely on the pricier side but I appreciate the glass bottles as they're more professional in front of clients/coworkers compared to the usual plastic boba bottle with cartoons on it. Would be five stars but the line moves ridiculously slow because the service is on the slow side.
author: Drew L.

description:
okay new boba joint. 

Boba was too hard to chew & it stated that it was honey Boba but it is NOT. it's really just regular boba 
overpriced...  basically paying for the glass bottle
eh. decent
author: Cindy W.

description: good drinks, but extremely overpriced. it's also extremely crowded due to the hype, which I don't think it lives up to.
author: Yuri R.
